label: Research method
text: A framework is developed that supports the theoretical design of an organizational memory information system ( OMIS ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The framework provides guidance for managing the processing capabilities of an organization by matching knowledge location , flexibility , and processing requirements with data architecture .

label: Research method
text: This framework is tested using three different sets of data attributes and data architectures from 147 business professionals that have experience in IS development .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that tradeoffs exist between the amount of knowledge embedded in the data architecture and the flexibility of data architectures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This trade-off is contingent on the characteristics of the set of tasks that the data architecture is being designed to support .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further , the match is important to consider in the design of OMIS database architecture .

label: Research questions
text: Here we hypothesize that impact-factor boosting ( unethical behavior documented previously in several underperforming journals ) should not be considered as exceptional , but that it affects even the top-tier journals .

label: Research method
text: We performed a citation analysis of documents recently published in 11 prominent general science and biomedical journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In these journals , only 12 to 79 % of what they publish was considered original research , whereas editorial materials alone constituted 11 to 44 % of the total document types published .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Citations to commissioned opinion articles comprised 3 to 15 % of the total citations to the journals within 3 postpublication years , with even a higher share occurring during the first postpublication year .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An additional 4 to 15 % of the citations were received by the journals from commissioned opinion articles published in other journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Combined , the parallel world of uncitable documents was responsible for up to 30 % of the total citations to the top-tier journals , with the highest values found for medical science journals ( New England Journal of Medicine , JAMA , and the Lancet ) and lower values found for the Science , Nature , and Cell series journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Self-citations to some of the top-tier journals reach values higher than the total citation counts accumulated by papers in most of the Web of Science-indexed journals .

label: Research method
text: Most of the self-citations were generated by commissioned opinion articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The parallel world of supposedly uncitable documents flourishes and severely distorts the commonly used scientometric indicators .

label: Research questions
text: The main argument in such literature is that citizen science has many advantages , not only for scientists and the science that is produced , but also for the participating citizens .

label: Research questions
text: As a result of this line of reasoning , the main issue becomes : How we can facilitate citizen science , and help it expand to more projects , and involve more ( types of ) participants ?

label: Research questions
text: My aim in this opinion paper is to make 2 points : First , that most recent work on citizen science fails to elaborate on the new types of relationships , practices , and interactions that are facilitated by information and communication technologies , when compared to traditional volunteer science .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The second point is that there are pronounced disciplinary differences among citizen science projects , something that , again , is generally being missed in much recent work .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Missing these points can lead us to imagine that it 's only a matter of time ( and of course funding ) before all sciences catch up with citizen science .

label: Research questions
text: Such a line of thought can result in investing resources ( money , time , effort ) in projects and infrastructures that are doomed to fail , because of their topic or field of research .

label: Research questions
text: I conclude by offering some thoughts on a research agenda .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The effect of hybrid open access on citation counts and author behavior in the field of chemistry is something that has not been widely studied .

label: Research method
text: We compared 814 open access articles and 27,621 subscription access articles published from 2006 through 2011 in American Chemical Society journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As expected , the 2 comparison groups are not equal in all respects .

label: Research method
text: Cumulative citation data were analyzed from years 2-5 following an article 's publication date .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A citation advantage for open access articles was correlated with the journal impact factor ( IF ) in low and medium IF journals , but not in high IF journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Open access articles have a 24 % higher mean citation rate than their subscription counterparts in low IF journals ( confidence limits 8-42 % , p = .0022 ) and similarly , a 26 % higher mean citation rate in medium IF journals ( confidence limits 14-40 % , p < .001 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Open access articles in high IF journals had no significant difference compared to subscription access articles ( 13 % lower mean citation rate , confidence limits -27-3 % , p = .10 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These results are correlative , not causative , and may not be completely due to an open access effect .

label: Research method
text: Authors of the open access articles were also surveyed to determine why they chose a hybrid open access option , paid the required article processing charge , and whether they believed it was money well spent .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Authors primarily chose open access because of funding mandates ; however , most considered the money well spent because open access increases information access to the scientific community and the general public , and potentially increases citations to their scholarship .

label: Research method
text: This article investigates the extent to which academics exploit journalism using content and citation analyses of online BBC News stories cited by Scopus articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A total of 27,234 Scopus-indexed publications have cited at least one BBC News story , with a steady annual increase .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Citations from the arts and humanities ( 2.8 % of publications in 2015 ) and social sciences ( 1.5 % ) were more likely than citations from medicine ( 0.1 % ) and science ( < 0.1 % ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Surprisingly , half of the sampled Scopus-cited science and technology ( 53 % ) and medicine and health ( 47 % ) stories were based on academic research , rather than otherwise unpublished information , suggesting that researchers have chosen a lower-quality secondary source for their citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , the BBC News stories that were most frequently cited by Scopus , Google Books , and Wikipedia introduced new information from many different topics , including politics , business , economics , statistics , and reports about events .

label: Research questions
text: Thus , news stories are mediating real-world knowledge into the academic domain , a potential cause for concern .

label: Research questions
text: When policy-makers call for interdisciplinarity , however , they often mean synergy .

label: Research questions
text: Synergy is generated when the whole offers more possibilities than the sum of its parts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An increase in the number of options above the sum of the options in subsets can be measured as redundancy ; that is , the number of not-yet-realized options .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The number of options available to an innovation system for realization can be as decisive for the system 's survival as the historically already-realized innovations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Unlike interdisciplinarity , synergy can also be generated in sectorial or geographical collaborations .

label: Research questions
text: The measurement of synergy , however , requires a methodology different from the measurement of interdisciplinarity .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we discuss recent advances in the operationalization and measurement of interdisciplinarity , and propose a methodology for measuring synergy based on information theory .

label: Research questions
text: The sharing of meanings attributed to information from different perspectives can increase redundancy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Increasing redundancy reduces the relative uncertainty , for example , in niches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The operationalization of the two concepts-interdisciplinarity and synergy-as different and partly overlapping indicators allows for distinguishing between the effects and the effectiveness of science-policy interventions in research priorities .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper studies the problem of leveraging the context of the items presented to the user in a user/system interaction session to improve the recommender system 's ranking prediction .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We propose a novel model that incorporates the opportunity cost of giving up the other items in the session and computes session-specific relevance values for items for context-aware recommendation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The model can work on a variety of different problems settings with emphasis on implicit user feedback as it supports varying levels of ordinal relevance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental evaluation demonstrates the advantages of our new model with respect to the ranking quality .

label: Research method
text: We analyzed the current state of the iSchool community in the U.S. with a special focus on the evolution of the community .

label: Research method
text: We conducted our study from the perspectives of acquiring talents and producing research , including the analysis on iSchool faculty members ' educational backgrounds , research topics , and the hiring network among iSchools .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Applying text mining techniques and social network analysis to data from various sources , our research revealed how the iSchool community gradually built its own identity over time , including the growing number of faculty members who received their doctorates from the field that studies information , the deviation from computer science and library science , the rising emphasis on the intersection of information , technology , and people , and the increasing educational and research homogeneity as a community .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions suggest that iSchools in the U.S. are evolving into a mature and independent discipline with a more established identity .

label: Research questions
text: In CIS , collaborative sensemaking is an important but understudied aspect .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A thorough understanding of collaborative sensemaking behavior in CIS tasks is essential to develop tools to support collaborative sensemaking activities in CIS .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we investigate the general patterns and differences in collaborative sensemaking behavior in travel planning and topic research tasks using the data from 2 observational user studies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show the common stages of the collaborative sensemaking process and the differences in users ' collaborative sensemaking strategies and activities between the 2 tasks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This comparative study enhances our understanding of the collaborative sensemaking process in CIS tasks and the differences in user 's sensemaking behavior according to tasks , and describes implications for supporting collaborative sensemaking behavior in CIS tasks .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing upon self-determination theory , we investigate 2 forms of motivation : internally driven ( autonomous motivation ) and externally driven ( controlled motivation ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Knowledge sharing could be viewed as a required in-role activity or as discretionary extra-role behavior .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we examine the moderating effect of role perceptions on the relations between each of the two motivational constructs and knowledge sharing , paying particular attention to the affordances of the enabling information technology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An analysis of survey data from a wiki-based organizational encyclopedia in a large , multinational firm reveals that when contributors ' motivation is externally driven , they are more likely to share knowledge if this activity is viewed as in-role behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , when contributors ' motivation is internally driven , they are more likely to participate in knowledge sharing when this activity is viewed as extra-role behavior .

label: Research method
text: Theoretical and practical implications are discussed .

label: Research questions
text: In response to Dodd-Frank , a series of rules relating to swaps record keeping have been issued , and one such rule calls for the creation of a financial products classification system .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The manner in which financial products are classified will have a profound effect on data integration and analysis in the financial industry .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article considers various approaches that can be taken when classifying financial products and recommends the use of facet analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The article argues that this type of analysis is flexible enough to accommodate multiple viewpoints and rigorous enough to facilitate inferences that are based on the hierarchical structure .

label: Research method
text: Various use cases are examined that pertain to the organization of financial products .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The use cases confirm the practical utility of taxonomies that are designed according to faceted principles .

label: Research method
text: An intellectual structure consists of clusters of related documents ascribed to individual factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Documents ascribed to a factor are generally associated with a common research theme .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As such , the contents of documents ascribed to a factor are theorized to be similar to each other .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study shows that the link-based relatedness implies content-based similarity .

label: Research method
text: The intellectual structures of two research domains were derived from data sets retrieved from the Microsoft Academic Search database .

label: Research method
text: The collection of documents ascribed to a factor is referred to as a factor-based document cluster , which the content-based document clusters are compared with .

label: Research method
text: All documents in an intellectual structure are re-clustered based on their content similarity , which is derived from the cosine of their vector form encoded in documents ' term frequency inverse document frequency ( TF-IDF ) weighted terms .

label: Research method
text: The factor-based document clusters are then compared with the content-based clusters for congruity .

label: Research method
text: We used the Rand index and kappa coefficient to check the congruity between the factor-based and content-based document clusters .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The kappa coefficient indicates that there is fair to moderate agreement between the clusters derived from these two different bases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The mixing of research methods requires an epistemological framework that embraces the reality uncovered by different research methods .

label: Research method
text: Three formal ontological categories are introduced for deconstructing the polarized view of reality in objectivism and relativism and for differentiating the nature and characteristics of objective , subjective , and normative validity claims as well as the conditions for justifying objectivity in social research .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The characterization of information as objective , subjective , and normative-evaluative simultaneously demands the study of conditions of information-related phenomena that may call for mixed methods research in library and information science .

label: Research questions
text: Current theories and tools are directed at finding a paper or website , not gaining an understanding of the key papers , authors , controversies , and hypotheses .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This report presents an effort to integrate statistics , text analytics , and visualization in a multiple coordinated window environment that supports exploration .

label: Research method
text: Our prototype system , Action Science Explorer ( ASE ) , provides an environment for demonstrating principles of coordination and conducting iterative usability tests of them with interested and knowledgeable users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We developed an understanding of the value of reference management , statistics , citation text extraction , natural language summarization for single and multiple documents , filters to interactively select key papers , and network visualization to see citation patterns and identify clusters .

label: Research method
text: A three-phase usability study guided our revisions to ASE and led us to improve the testing methods .

label: Research method
text: The present study evaluates how three sets of employee characteristics ( demographic , company-specific , and skills-based ) predict an employee 's likelihood of becoming a security breach victim .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In order to move beyond traditional evaluations of security threats , which generally consider security threats individually , analyses in this paper approach security vulnerability from a more holistic approach to analyze four risk categories concurrently : phishing , passwords , bring your own device ( BYOD ) , and company-supplied laptops .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions from a survey of 250 employees at a medium-sized American information technology ( IT ) consulting firm identify higher-risk employees across the four risk areas and provide new insights into the challenges organizations face when trying to ensure the protection of company data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The matching allows exploiting the rich and controlled vocabulary of medical subject headings ( MeSH ) of Medline/PubMed with additional fields of WoS .

label: Research method
text: The integration provides data ( e.g. , citation data , list of cited reference , list of the addresses of authors ' host organizations , WoS subject categories ) to perform a variety of scientometric analyses .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This brief communication describes medlineR , the method on which it relies , and the steps the user should follow to perform the matching across the two databases .

label: Research questions
text: To demonstrate the differences from Leydesdorff and Opthof ( Journal of the American Society for Information Science and Technology , 64 ( 5 ) , 1076-1080 ) , we conclude this artcle by testing the routine on the MeSH category Burgada syndrome .

label: Research questions
text: Recently , digital technology and Internet file sharing led to the delocalization of professional recording studios and the decline of traditional record companies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A direct consequence of this new paradigm is that studio professions found themselves in a transitional phase , needing to be reinvented .

label: Research questions
text: To understand the scope of these recent technological advances , we first offer an overview of musical recording culture and history and show how studio recordings became a sophisticated form of musical artwork that differed from concert representations .

label: Research questions
text: We then trace the economic evolution of the recording industry through technological advances and present positive and negative impacts of the decline of the traditional business model on studio practices and professions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we report Research findings/conclusions from interviews with six world-renowned record producers reflecting on their recording approaches , the impact of recent technological advances on their careers , and the future of their profession .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Interviewees appreciate working on a wider variety of projects than they have in the past , but they all discuss trade-offs between artistic expectations and budget constraints in the current paradigm .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our investigations converge to show that studio professionals have adjusted their working settings to the new economic situation , although they still rely on the same aesthetic approaches as in the traditional business model to produce musical recordings .

label: Research questions
text: While literature increasingly establishes that people consult multiple information sources in disaster situations , little is known about the patterns in which multiple media and personal network sources are combined simultaneously and sequentially across decision-making phases .

label: Research method
text: We address this gap using survey data collected from households in Jacksonville , Florida affected by 2016 's Hurricane Matthew .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results direct attention to perceived consistency of information as a key predictor of uncertainty regarding hurricane impact and evacuation logistics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Frequently utilizing National Weather Service , national and local TV channels , and personal network contacts contributed to higher perceived consistency of information , while the use of other local and online sources was associated with lower perceived consistency .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , combining a larger number of media and official sources predicted higher levels of perceived information consistency .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One 's perception of information amount did not significantly explain uncertainty .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study contributes to the theorizing of individuals ' information environment from the perspective of media and network multiplexity and provides practical implications regarding the need of information coordination for improved evacuation decision-making .

label: Research questions
text: Previous studies show that users search such content regularly but are often dissatisfied with current search facilities .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that an enhanced understanding of the motivations for search would aid the design of improved search systems , better reflecting what people need .

label: Research method
text: Building on previous research , we present qualitative analyses of two sources of data regarding how and why people search Twitter .

label: Research method
text: The first , a diary study ( p=68 ) , provides descriptions of Twitter information needs ( n=117 ) and important meta-data from active study participants .

label: Research method
text: The second data set was established by collecting first-person descriptions of search behavior ( n=388 ) tweeted by twitter users themselves ( p=381 ) and complements the first data set by providing similar descriptions from a more plentiful source .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of our analyses reveal numerous characteristics of Twitter search that differentiate it from more commonly studied search domains , such as web search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions also shed light on some of the difficulties users encounter .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By highlighting examples that go beyond those previously published , this article adds to the understanding of how and why people search such content .

label: Research questions
text: Based on these new insights , we conclude with a discussion of possible design implications for search systems that index micro-blogging content .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Noticeably missing from this metadata are classifications of visual style-despite the overwhelmingly visual nature of most video games and the interest in visual style among video game users .

label: Research questions
text: One explanation for this paucity is the difficulty in eliciting consistent judgements about visual style , likely due to subjective interpretations of terminology and a lack of demonstrable testing for coinciding judgements .

label: Research method
text: This study presents a taxonomy of video game visual styles constructed from the Research findings/conclusions of a 22-participant cataloging user study of visual styles .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A detailed description of the study , and its value and shortcomings , are presented along with reflections about the challenges of cultivating consensus about visual style in video games .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The high degree of overall agreement in the user study demonstrates the potential value of a descriptor like visual style and the use of a cataloging study in developing visual style taxonomies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The resulting visual style taxonomy , the methods and analysis described herein may help improve the organization and retrieval of video games and possibly other visual materials like graphic designs , illustrations , and animations .

label: Research method
text: Through interviews with 16 Korean immigrants in the United States , we explored their information behaviors in the settlement process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In line with prior work ( Shoham & Strauss , 2008 ) , we found that Korean immigrants needed various types of information : housing , work , banking , transportation , law , school , health , and language .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Out of these information types , the Korean immigrants prioritized information for education and struggled to seek health and legal information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We further uncovered that various information needs are closely intertwined and found an additional type of information need : to build a new social network after migration .

label: Research questions
text: They often used Information and Communication Technologies ( ICTs ) as information sources while adapting the ICT infrastructures of the U.S. into their information practices .

label: Research questions
text: ICTs enabled them to build and maintain local and global identity ; however , they may struggle to assess user-generated content in the new context .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We noted that their strong use of ICTs for intraethnic interaction might slow down their integration into the host society .

label: Research questions
text: We discuss implications for future work to support immigrants ' settlement in the host country .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This requires cognitive effort that can be demanding .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Building on prior sensemaking models and expanding them with ideas from learning and cognitive psychology , we examined the use of cognitive mechanisms during individual sensemaking .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a qualitative user study of 15 students who searched for and made sense of information for business analysis and news writing tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Through the analysis of think-aloud protocols , recordings of screen movements , intermediate work products of sensemaking , including notes and concept maps , and final reports , we observed the use of 17 data-driven and structure-driven mechanisms for processing new information , examining individual concepts and relationships , and detecting anomalies .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These cognitive mechanisms , as the basic operators that move sensemaking forward , provide in-depth understanding of how people process information to produce sense .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Meaningful learning and sensemaking are closely related , so our Research findings/conclusions apply to learning as well .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our results contribute to a better understanding of the sensemaking process-how people think-and this better understanding can inform the teaching of thinking skills and the design of improved sensemaking assistants and mind tools .

label: Research questions
text: In a primarily linguistic environment such as cyberspace , words are an expressed form of intent and actions .

label: Research questions
text: We investigate the functions of words and actions in identifying behavioral anomalies of social actors to safeguard the virtual organization .

label: Research questions
text: Social actors are likened to sensors as they observe changes in a focal individual 's behavior during computer-mediated communications .

label: Research questions
text: Based on social psychology theories and pragmatic views of words and actions in online communications , we theorize a dyadic attribution model that helps make sense of anomalous behavior in creative online experiments .

label: Research method
text: This model is then tested in an experiment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions show that observation of the behavioral differences between words and actions , based on either external or internal causality , can offer increased ability to detect the compromised trustworthiness of observed individuals-possibly leading to early detection of insider threat potential .

label: Research questions
text: The dyadic attribution model developed in this sociotechnical study can function to detect behavioral anomalies in cyberspace , and protect the operations of a virtual organization .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results demonstrate that the core-scatter distribution of cited authors , institutions , and journals varies for authors in each impact and productivity class .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: All authors in the science network receive the majority of their credit from high-impact authors ; however , this effect decreases as authors ' impact levels decrease .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Similarly , the proportion of citations that lower-impact authors make to each other increases as authors ' impact levels decrease .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: High-impact authors , who have the highest degree of membership in the science network , publish fewer papers in comparison to highly productive authors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , authors with the highest impact make both more references per paper and also more citations to papers in the science network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This suggests that high-impact authors produce the most relevant work in the science network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Comparing practices by productivity level , authors receive the majority of their credit from highly productive authors and authors cite highly productive authors more frequently than less productive authors .

label: Research method
text: Drawing on a random sample survey in Austin , TX , it borrows the concepts of cultural omnivores and univores to investigate how health information repertoire are related to social capital and digital inequalities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results demonstrate that both the size and the composition of health information repertoires vary by social and digital connectivity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: People with greater social capital have a larger repertoire and are less likely to be univores dependent on the Internet or interpersonal contacts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: People with Internet access have a larger repertoire and are less likely to be univores dependent on television .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More skilled Internet users are less likely to be univores dependent on interpersonal contacts , whereas frequent Internet users are more likely to be omnivores with a four-channel repertoire including the Internet , interpersonal contacts , television , and newspaper .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The positive relationship between social capital and repertoire size is stronger among less-skilled Internet users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There are significant variations in health information repertoires in terms of media access and sociodemographic characteristics .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Scholarly and practical implications are discussed .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although a number of literature reviews have provided overviews of this vast body of research , none has specifically focused on the readers of Wikipedia and issues concerning its readership .

label: Research method
text: In this systematic literature review , we review 99 studies to synthesize current knowledge regarding the readership of Wikipedia and provide an analysis of research methods employed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The scholarly research has found that Wikipedia is popular not only for lighter topics such as entertainment but also for more serious topics such as health and legal information .

label: Research questions
text: Scholars , librarians , and students are common users , and Wikipedia provides a unique opportunity for educating students in digital literacy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude with a summary of key Research findings/conclusions , implications for researchers , and implications for the Wikipedia community .

label: Research method
text: A network data set is prepared that comprises 27 subjects and their citations aggregated from more than 27,000 journals and proceedings indexed in the Scopus database .

label: Research method
text: A maximum spanning tree method is employed to extract paths in the weighted , directed , and cyclic networks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This paper finds that subjects such as Medicine , Biochemistry , Chemistry , Materials Science , Physics , and Social Sciences are the ones with multiple branches in the spanning tree .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This paper also finds that most paths connect science , technology , engineering , and mathematics ( STEM ) fields ; 2 critical paths connecting STEM and non-STEM fields are the one from Mathematics to Decision Sciences and the one from Medicine to Social Sciences .

label: Research method
text: Furthermore , queries are selected by the researchers .

label: Research method
text: We address these issues by taking a random representative sample of 1,000 informational and 1,000 navigational queries from a major German search engine and comparing Google 's and Bing 's results based on this sample .

label: Research method
text: Jurors were found through crowdsourcing , and data were collected using specialized software , the Relevance Assessment Tool ( RAT ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that although Google outperforms Bing in both query types , the difference in the performance for informational queries was rather low .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , for navigational queries , Google found the correct answer in 95.3 % of cases , whereas Bing only found the correct answer 76.6 % of the time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that search engine performance on navigational queries is of great importance , because users in this case can clearly identify queries that have returned correct results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: So , performance on this query type may contribute to explaining user satisfaction with search engines .

label: Research method
text: Using data on 7,700+ articles of Internet studies published in 100+ Social Sciences Citation Index ( SSCI ) -listed journals in 20002009 , the study adopted a multilevel model to disentangle the impact between article- and journal-level factors on citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This research strategy resulted in a number of both expected and surprising Research findings/conclusions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The primary determinants for citations are found to be journal-level factors , accounting for 14 % of the variances in citations of Internet studies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The impact of some , if not all , article-level factors on citations are moderated by journal-level factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Internet studies , like studies in other areas ( e.g. , management , demography , and ecology ) , are cited more for rhetorical Research questionss , as suggested by the social constructivist approach , rather than as a form of reward , as argued by normative theory .

label: Research questions
text: The impact of time on citations varies across journals , which creates a growing citation gap for Internet studies published in journals with different characteristics .

label: Research method
text: The 100 journals in this sample included research and practitioner venues across a range of subdomains and specializations .

label: Research method
text: The authors gathered data for 3 points in time , at 10-year intervals during a 20-year period , from 1989-2009 .

label: Research method
text: They examined the following in detail : journal profiles for publishing characteristics , submission specifications for manuscript parameters , and full-text published manuscripts for compliance with specifications .

label: Research method
text: All were analyzed as point-in-time comparisons as well as trajectories of change over time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Journal profiles demonstrated patterns of increased centralization and digitization , inclusiveness of readership , increased frequency of issues , and increased length of articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Key Research findings/conclusions for manuscript parameter trends included increased specificity of detail , range of manuscript types and research designs accepted , and average manuscript length .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In addition , journals have more explicitly specified elements previously left implicit , such as professional and ethical standards .

label: Research method
text: Criteria for submission procedures and manuscript quality are consistent with university faculty performance standards for productivity and technological advancement .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions carry implications for publishing , journal management , faculty work , and performance evaluation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Access to this literature is crucial for researchers and the general public .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Apparently , bibliogifts are available online for free from text-sharing platforms .

label: Research questions
text: However , little is known about such platforms .

label: Research method
text: What is the size of the underlying digital libraries ?

label: Research questions
text: What are the topics covered ?

label: Research questions
text: Where do these documents originally come from ?

label: Research method
text: This article reports on a study of the Library Genesis platform ( LibGen ) .

label: Research method
text: The 25 million documents ( 42 terabytes ) it hosts and distributes for free are mostly research articles , textbooks , and books in English .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The article collection stems from isolated , but massive , article uploads ( 71 % ) in line with a biblioleaks scenario , as well as from daily crowdsourcing ( 29 % ) by worldwide users of platforms such as Reddit Scholar and Sci-Hub .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By relating the DOIs registered at CrossRef and those cached at LibGen , this study reveals that 36 % of all DOI articles are available for free at LibGen .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This figure is even higher ( 68 % ) for three major publishers : Elsevier , Springer , and Wiley .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More research is needed to understand to what extent researchers and the general public have recourse to such text-sharing platforms and why .

label: Research method
text: We collected Twitter data over 51 days , related to the first 30 Italian organizations in the 2015 ranking of Forbes Global 2000out of which we selected the five with the most relevant volumes of tweets .

label: Research method
text: We analyzed the communication of the company leaders , together with the dialogue among the stakeholders of each company , to understand the association with perceived leadership styles and dimensions .

label: Research method
text: To assess leadership profiles , we referred to the 10-factor model developed by Barchiesi and La Bella in 2007 .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We maintain the distinctiveness of the approach we propose , as it allows a rapid assessment of the perceived leadership capabilities of an enterprise , as they emerge from its social media interactions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It can also be used to show how companies respond and manage their communication when specific events take place , and to assess their stakeholder 's reactions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study serves to fill this gap by using a large longitudinal dataset to examine these differences .

label: Research method
text: Using CiteScore as a proxy for journal scientific impact , we employ a series of statistical tests to identify the quartile categories and disciplinary areas in which impact trends differ notably between closed-and open-access journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that closed-access journals have a noticeable advantage in social sciences ( for example , business and economics ) , whereas open-access journals perform well in medical and healthcare domains ( for example , health profession and nursing ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , we find that after controlling for a journal 's rank and disciplinary differences , there are statistically more closed-access journals in the top 10 % , Quartile 1 , and Quartile 2 categories asmeasured by CiteScore ; in contrast , more open-access journals in Quartile 4 gained scientific impact from 2011 to 2015 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Considering dynamic and disciplinary trends in tandem , we find that more closed-access journals in Social Sciences gained in impact , whereas in biochemistry and medicine , more open-access journals experienced such gains .

label: Research questions
text: Traditional methods of community detection usually assume that the network 's structural information is fully known , which is not the case in many practical networks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Moreover , most previous community detection algorithms do not differentiate multiple relationships between objects or persons in the real world .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose a new approach that utilizes social interaction data ( e.g. , users ' posts on Facebook ) to address the community detection problem in Facebook and to find the multiple social groups of a Facebook user .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Some advantages to our approach are ( a ) it does not depend on structural information , ( b ) it differentiates the various relationships that exist among friends , and ( c ) it can discover a target user 's multiple communities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the experiment , we detect the community distribution of Facebook users using the proposed method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experiment shows that our method can achieve the result of having the average scores of Total-Community-Purity and Total-Cluster-Purity both at approximately 0.8 .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This networked nature has been relatively less explored in the literature on altmetrics , although new network-level approaches are starting to appear .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A general conceptualization of the role of social media networks in science communication , and particularly of social media as a specific type of interface between science and society , is still missing .

label: Research questions
text: The aim of this paper is to provide a conceptual framework for appraising interactions between science and society in multiple directions , in what we call heterogeneous couplings .

label: Research method
text: Heterogeneous couplings are conceptualized as the co-occurrence of science and non-science objects , actors , and interactions in online media environments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This conceptualization provides a common framework to study the interactions between science and non-science actors as captured via online and social media platforms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The conceptualization of heterogeneous couplings opens wider opportunities for the development of network applications and analyses of the interactions between societal and scholarly entities in social media environments , paving the way toward more advanced forms of altmetrics , social ( media ) studies of science , and the conceptualization and operationalization of more advanced science-society studies .

label: Research method
text: Combining data from the entirety of arXiv and the Web of Science ( WoS ) , this article investigates ( a ) the proportion of papers across all disciplines that are on arXiv and the proportion of arXiv papers that are in the WoS , ( b ) the elapsed time between arXiv submission and journal publication , and ( c ) the aging characteristics and scientific impact of arXiv e-prints and their published version .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It shows that the proportion of WoS papers found on arXiv varies across the specialties of physics and mathematics , and that only a few specialties make extensive use of the repository .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Elapsed time between arXiv submission and journal publication has shortened but remains longer in mathematics than in physics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In physics , mathematics , as well as in astronomy and astrophysics , arXiv versions are cited more promptly and decay faster than WoS papers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The arXiv versions of papers-both published and unpublished-have lower citation rates than published papers , although there is almost no difference in the impact of the arXiv versions of published and unpublished papers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Its meaning has been stretched to apply to experiences ranging from the mundane to the exceptional .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Serendipity , however , is consistently associated with unexpected and positive personal , scholarly , scientific , organizational , and societal events and discoveries .

label: Research questions
text: Diverse serendipitous experiences share a conceptual space ; therefore , what lessons can we draw from an exploration of how serendipity unfolds and what may influence it ?

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article describes an investigation of work-related serendipity .

label: Research method
text: Twelve professionals and academics from a variety of fields were interviewed .

label: Research method
text: The core of the semi-structured interviews focused on participants ' own work-related experiences that could be recalled and discussed in depth .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research validated and augmented prior research while consolidating previous models of serendipity into a single model of the process of serendipity , consisting of : Trigger , Connection , Follow-up , and Valuable Outcome , and an Unexpected Thread that runs through 1 or more of the first 4 elements .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Together , the elements influence the Perception of Serendipity .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Furthermore , this research identified what factors relating to the individual and their environment may facilitate the main elements of serendipity and further influence its perception .

label: Research method

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One reason these journals may have vanished is that they were predatory journals : a possibility the original paper did not consider .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The delisting of predators from the Directory of Open Access Journals in 2014 and the abundance of predatory journals and awareness thereof in North America parsimoniously explain the temporal and geographic patterns Laakso et al .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The major challenges for question retrieval in cQA are related to solving the lexical gap problem and estimating the relevance between questions .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we first solve the lexical gap problem using a translation-based language model ( TRLM ) .

label: Research method
text: Thereafter , we determine features and methods that are competent for estimating the relevance between two questions .

label: Research questions
text: For this Research questions , we explore ways to use the results of a dependency parser and question classification for category information .

label: Research method
text: Head-dependent pairs are first extracted as bigram features , called dependency bigrams , from the analysis results of the dependency parser .

label: Research method
text: The probability of each category is estimated using the softmax approach based on the scores of the classification results .

label: Research method
text: Subsequently , we propose two retrieval models-the dependency-based model ( DM ) and category-based model ( CM ) -and they are applied to the previous model , TRLM .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results demonstrate that the proposed methods significantly improve the performance of question retrieval in cQA services .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most sentiment analysis strategies fall into 2 categories : lexicon-based and corpus-based approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While the latter often requires sentiment-labeled data to build a machine learning model , both approaches need sentiment-labeled data for evaluation .

label: Research questions
text: Unfortunately , most data domains lack sufficient quantities of labeled data , especially at the subdocument level .

label: Research questions
text: Semisupervised learning ( SSL ) , a machine learning technique that requires only a few labeled examples and can automatically label unlabeled data , is a promising strategy to deal with the issue of insufficient labeled data .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although previous studies have shown promising results of applying various SSL algorithms to solve a sentiment-analysis problem , co-training , an SSL algorithm , has not attracted much attention for sentiment analysis largely due to its restricted assumptions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Therefore , this study focuses on revisiting co-training in depth and discusses several co-training strategies for sentiment analysis following a loose assumption .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results suggest that co-training can be more effective than can other currently adopted SSL methods for sentiment analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Download counts tend to be 2 orders of magnitude higher and less skewedly distributed than citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A mathematical model based on the sum of two exponentials does not adequately capture monthly download counts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The degree of correlation at the article level within a journal is similar to that at the journal level in the discipline covered by that journal , suggesting that the differences between journals are , to a large extent , discipline specific .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite the fact that in all studied journals download and citation counts per article positively correlate , little overlap may exist between the set of articles appearing in the top of the citation distribution and that with the most frequently downloaded ones .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Usage and citation leaks , bulk downloading , differences between reader and author populations in a subject field , the type of document or its content , differences in obsolescence patterns between downloads and citations , and different functions of reading and citing in the research process all provide possible explanations of differences between download and citation distributions .

label: Research method
text: We used latent class analysis to categorize institutions based on their publications in certain subject areas .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Even though this categorization does not relate directly to scientific performance , our results show that it exercises an important influence on the outcome of a performance measurement : Certain subject area types of institutions have an advantage in the ranking positions when compared with others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This advantage manifests itself not only when performance is measured with an indicator that is not field-normalized but also for indicators that are field-normalized .

label: Research questions
text: Previous studies have created various bibliographic indicators for the identification of emerging research topics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , as indicated by Rotolo et al .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: ( Research Policy 44 , 1827-1843 , ) , the most serious problems are the lack of an acknowledged definition of emergence and incomplete elaboration of the linkages between the definitions that are used and the indicators that are created .

label: Research method
text: With these issues in mind , this study first adjusts the definition of an emerging technology that Rotolo et al .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: ( 2015 ) have proposed to accommodate the analysis .

label: Research method
text: Next , a set of criteria for the identification of emerging topics is proposed according to the adjusted definition and attributes of emergence .

label: Research method
text: Using two sets of parameter values , several emerging research topics are identified .

label: Research method
text: Finally , evaluation tests are conducted by demonstration of the proposed approach and comparison with previous studies .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The strength of the present methodology lies in the fact that it is fully transparent , straightforward , and flexible .

label: Research questions
text: This article seeks to address this gap through an international and interdisciplinary survey of academics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Issues covered include : use of and intentions regarding OAP , and perceptions regarding advantages and disadvantages of OAP , journal article publication services , peer review , and reuse .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite reporting engagement in OAP , academics were unsure about their future intentions regarding OAP .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Broadly , academics identified the potential for wider circulation as the key advantage of OAP , and were more positive about its benefits than they were negative about its disadvantages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As regards services , rigorous peer review , followed by rapid publication were most valued .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Academics reported strong views on reuse of their work ; they were relatively happy with noncommercial reuse , but not in favor of commercial reuse , adaptations , and inclusion in anthologies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Comparing science , technology , and medicine with arts , humanities , and social sciences showed a significant difference in attitude on a number of questions , but , in general , the effect size was small , suggesting that attitudes are relatively consistent across the academic community .

label: Research method
text: Also the concave or convex relation between the proportion of top 100 theta % publications , for different fractions theta , is explained using the obtained new informetric model .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: However , only a limited number of studies have showed the relationship between cognitive styles and web search behavior .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Most importantly , it is not clear which components of web search behavior are influenced by cognitive styles .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article examines the relationships between users ' cognitive styles and their web searching and develops a model that portrays the relationship .

label: Research method
text: The study uses qualitative and quantitative analyses based on data gathered from 50 participants .

label: Research method
text: A questionnaire was utilized to collect participants ' demographic information , and Riding 's ( 1991 ) Cognitive Styles Analysis ( CSA ) test to assess their cognitive styles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that users ' cognitive styles influenced their information-searching strategies , query reformulation behavior , web navigational styles , and information-processing approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The user model developed in this study depicts the fundamental relationships between users ' web search behavior and their cognitive styles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Modeling web search behavior with a greater understanding of users ' cognitive styles can help information science researchers and information systems designers to bridge the semantic gap between the user and the systems .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Implications of the research for theory and practice , and future work , are discussed .

label: Research questions
text: Key to the success of this digital medium is its ability to support information exchange when compared with face-to-face communication .

label: Research questions
text: Its potential is highlighted by the literature illustrating the inadequacy of traditional computer-mediated communication ( CMC ) tools , such as e-mail and video conferencing , to support communication among geographically dispersed coworkers .

label: Research questions
text: Many of the traditional CMC tools lack the needed support for effective information exchange to varying degrees .

label: Research questions
text: The emergence of a sophisticated virtual world , such as Second Life , has met this dearth .

label: Research questions
text: We draw on the theories of task closure and media richness to propose a parsimonious model of information exchange behavior in a virtual world context .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Observations from a series of group-based project discussion sessions in face-to-face and virtual world settings , respectively , suggest that the information exchange between coworkers in both settings could be similar .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , virtual coworkers might be able to achieve task closure ( i.e. , the complete transmission of intended work-related information ) in the same way as their counterparts in the face-to-face context .

label: Research questions
text: Their main focus is to discover and display new knowledge in large document databases .

label: Research questions
text: They have broad and innovative fields of application for strategic scouting in science and technology , knowledge management , business intelligence , and scientific and technological evaluation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article presents a new method for mapping the strategic research network and illustrates its application to the strategic analysis of the knowledge domain Spanish Research in Protected Areas for the Period 1981-2005 .

label: Research method
text: This strategic knowledge is displayed through a set of two-dimensional cartographic maps and three-dimensional images of two networks : the international network WoS_KWAJ ( 1981-2005 ) and the national network IEDCYT_KWAJ ( 1981-2005 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These maps can be very useful in decision-making processes for science and technology policy .

label: Research method
text: This is achieved through an identification of the antecedents and effects of experiences that contribute to negative emotions or to a reduction in interest in using social networks with the help of a mixed-methods study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Five generic antecedents and varying effects of these antecedents on individual user activities have been identified .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Fatigue experiences could result from social dynamics or social interactions of the members of the community , content made available on social networks , unwanted changes to the platform that hosts the network , self-detected immersive tendencies of the users themselves , or a natural maturing of the life cycle of the community to which the user belongs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The intensity of the fatigue experience varies along a continuum ranging from a mild or transient experience to a more severe experience , which may eventually result in the user 's decision to quit the environment that causes stress .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , users were found to take short rest breaks from the environment , moderate their activities downward , or suspend their social network activities altogether as a result of fatigue experiences .

label: Research questions
text: From user-generated content to crowdsourcing to peer production to fan fiction to citizen science , the concept remains both unexamined and heterogeneous in its definition .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Intuitions about participation are confirmed by some examples , but scandalized by others , and it is difficult to pinpoint why participation seems to be robust in some cases and partial in others .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this paper we offer an empirically based , comparative analysis of participation that demonstrates its multidimensionality and provides a framework that allows clear distinctions and better analyses of the role of participation .

label: Research method
text: We derive 7 dimensions of participations from the literature on participation and exemplify those dimensions using a set of 102 cases of contemporary participation that include uses of the Internet and new media .

label: Research questions
text: For many search sessions it is essential to achieving the task goal .

label: Research method
text: This work investigates text relevance decision dynamics in a question-answering task by direct measurement of eye movement using eye-tracking and brain activity using electroencephalography EEG .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The EEG measurements are correlated with the user 's goal-directed attention allocation revealed by their eye movements .

label: Research method
text: In a within-subject lab experiment ( N=24 ) , participants read short news stories of varied relevance .

label: Research method
text: Eye movement and EEG features were calculated in three epochs of reading each news story ( early , middle , final ) and for periods where relevant words were read .

label: Research method
text: Perceived relevance classification models were learned for each epoch .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show reading epochs where relevant words were processed could be distinguished from other epochs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The classification models show increasing divergence in processing relevant vs. irrelevant documents after the initial epoch .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This suggests differences in cognitive processes used to assess texts of varied relevance levels and provides evidence for the potential to detect these differences in information search sessions using eye tracking and EEG .

label: Research questions
text: The fundamental assumption in group assignments is that students ' collaboration substantially enhances their learning .

label: Research method
text: The present study focused on the group work strategies adopted by upper secondary school students in source-based writing assignments .

label: Research method
text: Seventeen groups authored Wikipedia or Wikipedia-style articles and were interviewed during and after the assignment .

label: Research method
text: Group work strategies were analyzed in 6 activities : planning , searching , assessing sources , reading , writing , and editing .

label: Research method
text: The students used 2 cooperative strategies : delegation and division of work , and 2 collaborative strategies : pair and group collaboration .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Division of work into independently conducted parts was the most popular group work strategy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also group collaboration , where students worked together to complete an activity , was commonly applied .

label: Research method
text: Division of work was justified by efficiency in completing the project and by ease of control in the fair division of contributions .

label: Research method
text: The motivation behind collaboration was related to quality issues and shared responsibility .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We suggest that the present designs of learning tasks lead students to avoid collaboration , increasing the risk of low learning outcomes in information literacy instruction .

label: Research questions
text: Can citation patterns of highly-cited papers be distinguished in an early phase as fast-breaking papers ?

label: Research questions
text: Can late bloomers or sleeping beauties be identified ?

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most interesting , we find differences between sticky knowledge claims that continue to be cited more than 10 years after publication and transient knowledge claims that show a decay pattern after reaching a peak within a few years .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Only papers following the trajectory of a sticky knowledge claim can be expected to have a sustained impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions raise questions about indicators of excellence that use aggregated citation rates after 2 or 3 years ( e. g. , impact factors ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Because aggregated citation curves can also be composites of the two patterns , fifth-order polynomials ( with four bending points ) are needed to capture citation curves precisely .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For the journals under study , the most frequently cited groups were furthermore much smaller than 10 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although GBTM has proved a useful method for investigating differences among citation trajectories , the methodology does not allow us to define a percentage of highly cited papers inductively across different fields and journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using multinomial logistic regression , we conclude that predictor variables such as journal names , number of authors , etc. , do not affect the stickiness of knowledge claims in terms of citations but only the levels of aggregated citations ( which are field-specific ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Social impact of papers can be defined as the net effect of citations on a network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A publication exerts direct and indirect influence on others ( e.g. , by citing articles ) and is itself influenced directly and indirectly ( e.g. , by cited articles ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This network leads to an influence structure of citing and cited publications .

label: Research method
text: Drawing on cooperative game theory , our research problem is to translate into mathematical equations the rules that govern the social impact of a paper in a citation network .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this article , we show that when citation relationships between academic papers function within a citation structure , the result is social impact instead of the ( individual ) citation impact of each paper .

label: Research method
text: Mathematical equations explain the interaction between papers in such a citation structure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The equations show that the social impact of a paper is affected by the ( individual ) citation impact of citing publications , immediacy of citing articles , and number of both citing and cited papers .

label: Research method
text: Examples are provided for several academic papers .

label: Research questions
text: Publication fees or article-processing charges ( APC ) s have become the predominant means for funding professional OA publishing .

label: Research method
text: We surveyed 1,038 authors who recently published articles in 74 OA journals that charge APCs stratified into seven discipline categories .

label: Research method
text: Authors were asked about the source of funding for the APC , factors influencing their choice of a journal and past history publishing in OA and subscription journals .

label: Research method
text: Additional information about the journal and the authors ' country were obtained from the journal website .

label: Research method
text: A total of 429 ( 41 % ) authors from 69 journals completed the survey .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There were large differences in the source of funding among disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Journals with impact factors charged higher APCs as did journals from disciplines where grant funding is plentiful .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Fit , quality , and speed of publication were the most important factors in the authors ' choice of a journal .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: OA was less important but a significant factor for many authors in their choice of a journal to publish .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions are consistent with other research on OA publishing and suggest that OA publishing funded through APCs is likely to continue to grow .

label: Research questions
text: Reusing text without crediting the original authors is considered plagiarism .

label: Research questions
text: A number of studies have reported the prevalence of plagiarism in academia .

label: Research questions
text: As a consequence , numerous institutions and researchers are dedicated to devising systems to automate the process of checking for plagiarism .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This work focuses on the problem of detecting text reuse in scientific papers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The contributions of this paper are twofold : ( a ) we survey the existing approaches for plagiarism detection based on content , based on content and structure , and based on citations and references ; and ( b ) we compare content and citation-based approaches with the goal of evaluating whether they are complementary and if their combination can improve the quality of the detection .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We carry out experiments with real data sets of scientific papers and concluded that a combination of the methods can be beneficial .

label: Research questions
text: Finding credible health information from a plethora of information on the web may be more challenging for older adults , who have relatively less experience with the Internet .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article reports on the Research findings/conclusions of an exploratory study of older adults & apos ; credibility assessments of online health information .

label: Research method
text: The data collected through semistructured interviews with 21 older adult Internet users in the United States were analyzed based on the extended typology of web credibility ( Choi & Stvilia , 2015 , Journal of the Association for Information Science and Technology , 66 , 2399-2414 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions of the study revealed that older adults paid closer attention to operator-related credibility cues and heuristics when judging the credibility of health information on the web , followed by content- and design-related ones .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , the Research findings/conclusions suggest that participants who were younger and used the Internet more frequently employed a wider variety of cues and heuristics to evaluate the credibility of online health information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on these Research findings/conclusions , both theoretical and practical implications of the research and future research directions are discussed .

label: Research questions
text: Negation is usually considered as a polarity shifter , whereas intensifiers are regarded as amplifiers or diminishers of the strength of such polarity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Modality , in turn , has only been addressed in a very naive fashion , so that modal forms are treated as polarity blockers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , processing these constructions as mere polarity modifiers may be adequate for polarity classification , but it is not enough for more complex tasks ( e.g. , intensity classification ) , for which a more fine-grained model based on emotions is needed .

label: Research questions
text: In this work , we study the effect of modifiers on the emotions affected by them and propose a model of negation , intensifiers , and modality especially conceived for sentiment analysis tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We compare our emotion-based strategy with two traditional approaches based on polar expressions and find that representing the text as a set of emotions increases accuracy in different classification tasks and that this representation allows for a more accurate modeling of modifiers that results in further classification improvements .

label: Research questions
text: We also study the most common uses of modifiers in opinionated texts and quantify their impact in polarity and intensity classification .

label: Research questions
text: Finally , we analyze the joint effect of emotional modifiers and find that interesting synergies exist between them .

label: Research method
text: This study analyses Web information search behavior , and applies the multiple demand theory to propose two models to help a visitor allocate time for multiple links .

label: Research method
text: The process of searching is viewed as a formal choice problem in which the visitor attempts to choose from multiple Web links to maximize the total utility .

label: Research method
text: The proposed models are calibrated to clickstream data collected from an educational institute over a seven-and-a-half month period .

label: Research method
text: Based on the best fit model , a metric , utility loss , is constructed to measure the performance of each link and arrange them accordingly .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Empirical results show that the proposed metric is highly efficient for prioritizing the links on a homepage and the methodology can also be used to study the feasibility of introducing a new function in a Website .

label: Research method
text: Methods used include cognitive task analysis and facet analysis to better understand the information-seeking and information-use practices of people working with folktales and the intellectual dimensions of the domain .

label: Research method
text: Interviews were conducted with 9 informants , representing scholars , storytellers , and teachers who rely on folktales in their professional lives to determine common tasks across user groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Four tasks were identified : collect , create , instruct , and study .

label: Research method
text: Facet analysis was conducted on the transcripts of these interviews , and a representative set of literature that included subject indexing material and a random stratified set of document surrogates drawn from a collection of folktales , including bibliographic records , introductions , reviews , tables of contents , and bibliographies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Eight facets were identified as most salient for this group of users : agent , association , context , documentation , location , subject , time , and viewpoint .

label: Research findings/conclusions
