text: Implications include the need for systems designers to devise methods for harvesting and integrating extant contextual material into search and discovery systems , and to take into account user-desired features in the development of enhanced services for digital repositories .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research examined the dynamic processes of relationship formation , maintenance , and demise in a massively multiplayer online game .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing from evolutionary and ecological theories of social networks , this study focuses on the impact of three sets of evolutionary factors in the context of social relationships in the online game EverQuest II ( EQII ) : the aging and maturation processes , social architecture of the game , and homophily and proximity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A longitudinal analysis of tie persistence and decay demonstrated the transient nature of social relationships in EQII , but ties became considerably more durable over time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , character level similarity , shared guild membership , and geographic proximity were powerful mechanisms in preserving social relationships .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Others may wish to mine these data for new discoveries and innovations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , research data are not readily available as sharing is common in only a few fields such as astronomy and genomics .

label: Research questions
text: Data sharing practices in other fields vary widely .

label: Research questions
text: Moreover , research data take many forms , are handled in many ways , using many approaches , and often are difficult to interpret once removed from their initial context .

label: Research questions
text: Data sharing is thus a conundrum .

label: Research method
text: Four rationales for sharing data are examined , drawing examples from the sciences , social sciences , and humanities : ( 1 ) to reproduce or to verify research , ( 2 ) to make results of publicly funded research available to the public , ( 3 ) to enable others to ask new questions of extant data , and ( 4 ) to advance the state of research and innovation .

label: Research questions
text: These rationales differ by the arguments for sharing , by beneficiaries , and by the motivations and incentives of the many stakeholders involved .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The challenges are to understand which data might be shared , by whom , with whom , under what conditions , why , and to what effects .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Answers will inform data policy and practice .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a survey of 307 reviewers of submissions to the International Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems ( CHI 2011 ) to gain a better understanding of their motivations for reviewing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that encouraging high-quality research , giving back to the research community , and finding out about new research were the top general motivations for reviewing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We further found that relevance of the submission to a reviewer 's research and relevance to the reviewer 's expertise were the strongest motivations for accepting a request to review , closely followed by a number of social factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Gender and reviewing experience significantly affected some reviewing motivations , such as the desire for learning and preparing for higher reviewing roles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We discuss implications of our Research findings/conclusions for the design of future peer review processes and systems to support them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the data protection lens is too narrow to analyze personalization .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To define conditions for personalization , we should understand data protection in its larger fundamental rights context , starting with the closely connected right to privacy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: If the right to privacy is considered along with other European fundamental rights that protect information and communication flows , namely , communications confidentiality ; the right to receive information ; and freedom of expression , opinion , and thought , these rights are observed to enable what I call a personal information sphere for each person .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This notion highlights how privacy interferences affect other fundamental rights .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The personal information sphere is grounded in European case law and is thus not just an academic affair .

label: Research questions
text: The essence of the personal information sphere is control , yet with a different meaning than mere control as guaranteed by data protection law .

label: Research questions
text: The personal information sphere is about people controlling how they situate themselves in information and communication networks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It follows that , to respect privacy and related rights , online personalization providers should actively involve users in the personalization process and enable them to use personalization for personal goals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Current online tools and visualization prototypes show small , localized subsets and do not provide the ability to explore the predominant patterns of the overall subject structure .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study describes subject tree modifications that facilitate browsing for documents by capitalizing on the highly uneven distribution of real-world collections .

label: Research method
text: The approach is demonstrated on two large collections organized by the Library of Congress Subject Headings ( LCSH ) and Medical Subject Headings ( MeSH ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that the LCSH subject tree can be reduced to 49 % of its initial complexity while maintaining access to 83 % of the collection , and the MeSH tree can be reduced to 45 % of its initial complexity while maintaining access to 97 % of the collection .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A simple solution to negate the loss of access is discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The visual impact is demonstrated by using traditional outline views and a slider control allowing searchers to change the subject structure dynamically according to their needs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study has implications for the development of information organization theory and human-information interaction techniques for subject trees .

label: Research method
text: The algorithm groups web results according to the individuals they refer to .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The best state-of-the-art approaches require training data in order to learn thresholds for deciding when to group the webpages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the ambiguity level of person names on the web could not be previously estimated and the results of those methods strongly depend on the thresholds obtained with the training collections .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We present the concept of adaptive threshold , which avoids the need of a previous supervised learning process , depending only on the content of the compared documents to decide if they refer to the same person .

label: Research method
text: We evaluated our approach using three datasets reaching close results to those obtained by the most successful algorithms in the state-of-the-art that require such a learning process , and outperforming the results of those obtained by algorithms that do not require it .

label: Research questions
text: How well do or can these measures measure or predict the past , current , or future scholarly performance of an individual ?

label: Research method
text: Using data from the Smithsonian/NASA Astrophysics Data System we analyze the publication , citation , download , and distinction histories of a cohort of 922 individuals who received a U.S. PhD in astronomy in the period 1972-1976 .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By examining the same and different measures at the same and different times for the same individuals we are able to show the capabilities and limitations of each measure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Because the distributions are lognormal , measurement uncertainties are multiplicative ; we show that in order to state with 95 % confidence that one person 's citations and downloads are significantly higher than another person 's , the log difference in the ratio of counts must be at least 0.3dex , which corresponds to a multiplicative factor of 2 .

label: Research questions
text: This study analyzes ( a ) whether search expertise , prior topic knowledge , topic interest , or flow experience during a search of the World Wide Web ( WWW ) influence success in finding relevant information and ( b ) whether the effects of these predictors vary during the course of the search process .

label: Research method
text: Two different search tasks are investigated : The evaluating task focuses on the selection of relevant websites from a large number of potentially relevant sites , whereas the finding task focuses on the difficulty of finding information in the case of a lack of potentially relevant websites .

label: Research method
text: Survival analysis is applied to data from a quasi-experiment .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This analysis considers not only the question of whether information is found , but also when .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions show that search expertise and flow explain success in the evaluation task ; however , flow is only influential in the first phase of the search process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For the finding task , the predictors have no explanatory strength .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Simulation results show that the rate of forgetting has a significantly negative effect on stakeholders ' perceptions and the incremental increase in the number of affected individuals has a positive effect on the maximum level of stakeholders ' perceptions , but negative effect on the duration of stakeholders ' perceptions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additionally , a delay effect , a stagnation effect , and a cumulative effect exist in the evolution of stakeholders ' perceptions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There is a spike at the beginning of the profile of stakeholders ' perceptions in the Damped Exponential Model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An empirical test supports the validity of this model of stakeholders ' disaster perceptions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The overlays indicate both the quantity and the quality of patents at the city level .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This information is relevant for research questions in technology analysis , innovation studies , and evolutionary economics , as well as economic geography .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The resulting maps can also be relevant for technological innovation policies and research and development management , because the U.S. market can be considered the leading market for patenting and patent competition .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In addition to the maps , the routines provide quantitative data about the patents for statistical analysis .

label: Research method
text: The cities on the map are colored according to the results of significance tests .

label: Research method
text: The overlays are explored for the Netherlands as a national system of innovations and further elaborated in two cases of emerging technologies : ribonucleic acid interference ( RNAi ) and nanotechnology .

label: Research questions
text: Self-perception theory posits that individuals come to know their own internal beliefs by inferring them partially from observations of their own overt behavior .

label: Research method
text: Building on self-perception theory and adhering to the principle that the relationship between behavior and beliefs is one of mutual influence , we develop a research model to explore the behavioral transfer from knowledge seeking to knowledge contributing and consider the mediating effect of intrinsic motivation .

label: Research method
text: Data collected from 430 users of Web 2.0 applications were used to test the model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The mediating role of intrinsic motivation between knowledge seeking and knowledge contributing is confirmed .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These Research findings/conclusions and their implications for theory and practice are discussed .

label: Research questions
text: Here , we investigate a means for influencing the performance of citizen scientists toward enhancing overall participation .

label: Research method
text: Building on past social comparison research , we pair citizen scientists with a software-based virtual peer in an environmental monitoring project .

label: Research method
text: Through a series of experiments in which virtual peers outperform , underperform , or perform similarly to human participants , we investigate the influence of their presence on citizen science participation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To offer insight into the psychological determinants to the response to this intervention , we propose a new dynamic model describing the bidirectional interaction between humans and virtual peers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results demonstrate that participant contribution can be enhanced through the presence of a virtual peer , creating a feedback loop where participants tend to increase or decrease their contribution in response to their peers ' performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By including virtual peers that systematically outperform the participants , we demonstrate a fourfold increase in their contribution to the citizen science project .

label: Research questions
text: This article conceptualizes personally meaningful activities as a site for information behavior research .

label: Research questions
text: Personal meaning is discussed as a necessity for human beings .

label: Research questions
text: In the information age , there is an ethical directive for developers of information technology to promote and afford personally meaningful activities .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article builds on discussions of the pleasurable and profound in information science conceptually and empirically .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: First , it argues for the necessity of phenomenology in these discussions , which heretofore has been mostly absent .

label: Research method
text: Next , it presents results from a qualitative , empirical study on information in personally meaningful activities .

label: Research method
text: The empirical study uses interpretative phenomenological analysis to examine information experience in three domains of personal meaning : Bible reading , ultramarathon running , and art-making .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The following themes emerge and are discussed : identity , central practice , curiosity , and presence .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Opportunities for technological development and further research are outlined .

label: Research questions
text: The migration of a database for preservation Research questionss poses several challenges .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , our Research findings/conclusions show that relevant issues are file-format heterogeneity , collection volume , time and database structure evolution , and deviation from the governing standard .

label: Research questions
text: This article presents and discusses how such issues interfere with an organization 's ability to undertake a migration , for preservation Research questionss , of records from a relational database .

label: Research method
text: The case study at hand concerns six Norwegian municipality record-keeping databases covering a period from 1999 to 2012 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions are presented with a discussion on how these issues manifest themselves as a problem for long-term preservation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results discussed here may help an organization and Information Systems ( IS ) manager to establish a best practice when undertaking a migration project and enable them to avoid some of the pitfalls that were discovered during this project .

label: Research questions
text: However , because global citation databases seem to offer weak coverage of books outside the West , it is not clear whether the influence of non-Western books can be assessed with citations .

label: Research method
text: To investigate this , citations were extracted from Google Books and Google Scholar to 1,357 arts , humanities and social sciences ( AHSS ) books published by 5 university presses during 19612012 in 1 non-Western nation , Malaysia .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A significant minority of the books ( 23 % in Google Books and 37 % in Google Scholar , 45 % in total ) had been cited , with a higher proportion cited if they were older or in English .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The combination of Google Books and Google Scholar is therefore recommended , with some provisos , for non-Western countries seeking to differentiate between books with some impact and books with no impact , to identify the highly-cited works or to develop an indicator of academic publisher prestige .

label: Research questions
text: As artifacts , ontologies can have diverse applications in knowledge management , information retrieval , and information systems , to mention a few .

label: Research questions
text: They have been largely applied to organize information in complex fields like Biomedicine .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we present the OntoNeo Ontology , an initiative to build a formal ontology in the obstetrics and neonatal domain .

label: Research questions
text: OntoNeo is a resource that has been designed to serve as a comprehensive infrastructure providing scientific research and healthcare professionals with access to relevant information .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of OntoNeo is twofold : ( a ) to organize specialized medical knowledge , and ( b ) to provide a potential consensual representation of the medical information found in electronic health records and medical information systems .

label: Research method
text: To describe our initiative , we first provide background information about distinct theories underlying ontology , top-level computational ontologies and their applications in Biomedicine .

label: Research method
text: Then , we present the methodology employed in the development of OntoNeo and the results obtained to date .

label: Research questions
text: Finally , we discuss the applicability of OntoNeo by presenting a proof of concept that illustrates its potential usefulness in the realm of healthcare information systems .

label: Research questions
text: Several techniques have been proposed but maintaining consistent accuracy levels over all data sets is still a major challenge .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We identify two major issues associated with the AND problem .

label: Research questions
text: First , the namesake problem in which two or more authors with the same name publishes in a similar domain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Second , the diverse topic problem in which one author publishes in diverse topical domains with a different set of coauthors .

label: Research questions
text: In this work , we initially propose a method named ATGEP for AND that addresses the namesake issue .

label: Research method
text: We evaluate the performance of ATGEP using various ambiguous name references collected from the Arnetminer Citation ( AC ) and Web of Science ( WoS ) data set .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We empirically show that the two aforementioned problems are crucial to address the AND problem that are difficult to handle using state-of-the-art techniques .

label: Research method
text: To handle the diverse topic issue , we extend ATGEP to a new variant named ATGEP-web that considers external web information of the authors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments show that with enough information available from external web sources ATGEP-web can significantly improve the results further compared with ATGEP .

label: Research questions
text: The aim of this study is to develop an integrative understanding of the impact of two diffusion channels ( i.e. , broadcasting vs. virality ) on innovation adoption .

label: Research method
text: Using citations of a series of classic algorithms and the time series of co-authorship as the footprints of their diffusion trajectories , we propose a novel method to analyze the intertwining relationships between broadcasting and virality in the innovation diffusion process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions show that broadcasting and virality have similar diffusion power , but play different roles across diffusion stages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Broadcasting is more powerful in the early stages but may be gradually caught up or even surpassed by virality in the later period .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Meanwhile , diffusion speed in virality is significantly faster than broadcasting and members from virality channels tend to adopt the same innovation repetitively .

label: Research method
text: A model of these motivations was developed based on two existing motivation models : motivation for self-archiving in academia and motivations for information sharing in social media .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proposed model is composed of 18 factors drawn from personal , social , professional , and external contexts , including enjoyment , personal/professional gain , reputation , learning , self-efficacy , altruism , reciprocity , trust , community interest , social engagement , publicity , accessibility , self-archiving culture , influence of external actors , credibility , system stability , copyright concerns , additional time , and effort .

label: Research method
text: Two hundred and twenty-six ResearchGate users participated in the survey .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Accessibility was the most highly rated factor , followed by altruism , reciprocity , trust , self-efficacy , reputation , publicity , and others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Personal , social , and professional factors were also highly rated , while external factors were rated relatively low .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Motivations were correlated with one another , demonstrating that RG motivations for self-archiving could increase or decrease based on several factors in combination with motivations from the personal , social , professional , and external contexts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We believe the Research findings/conclusions from this study can increase our understanding of users ' motivations in sharing their research and provide useful implications for the development and improvement of ASNS services , thereby attracting more active users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the most widespread applications are difficult to use for people with disabilities , or may involve some risks if no previous training has been undertaken .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This work describes a novel social network for cognitively disabled people along with a clustering-based method for modeling activity and socialization processes of its users in a noninvasive way .

label: Research method
text: This closed social network is specifically designed for people with cognitive disabilities , called Guremintza , that provides the network administrators ( e.g. , social workers ) with two types of reports : summary statistics of the network usage and behavior patterns discovered by a data mining process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments made in an initial stage of the network show that the discovered patterns are meaningful to the social workers and they find them useful in monitoring the progress of the users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , citation counts may accrue too slowly for use in some formal and informal evaluations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is therefore important to investigate whether alternative metrics could be used as substitutes .

label: Research method
text: This article assesses whether one such altmetric , Mendeley readership counts , correlates strongly with citation counts across all medical fields , whether the relationship is stronger if student readers are excluded , and whether they are distributed similarly to citation counts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on a sample of 332,975 articles from 2009 in 45 medical fields in Scopus , citation counts correlated strongly ( about 0.7 ; 78 % of articles had at least one reader ) with Mendeley readership counts ( from the new version 1 applications programming interface [ API ] ) in almost all fields , with one minor exception , and the correlations tended to decrease slightly when student readers were excluded .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Readership followed either a lognormal or a hooked power law distribution , whereas citations always followed a hooked power law , showing that the two may have underlying differences .

label: Research questions
text: These systems typically rest on the concepts of objects and fields , both bound to coordinates , as two general paradigms of geographic representation .

label: Research questions
text: The match between notions of place occurring in everyday where questions and the data available to answer such questions is unclear and hinders progress in place-based information systems .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This is particularly true in novel application areas such as the Digital Humanities or speech-based human-computer interaction , but also for location-based services .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although this shortcoming has been observed before , we approach the challenges of relating places to information system representations with a fresh view , based on a set of core concepts of spatial information .

label: Research questions
text: These concepts have been proposed in information science with the intent of serving human-machine spatial question asking and answering .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Clarifying the relationship of the notion of place to these concepts is a significant step toward geographically intelligent systems .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main result of the article is a demonstration that the notion of place fits existing concepts of spatial information , when these are adequately exploited and combined .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this work we suggest an option for exploring networks , called the h-strength , with explicit focus on links and their strengths .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The h-strength and its extensions can naturally simplify a complex network to a small and concise subnetwork ( h-subnet ) but retains the most important links with its core structure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Its applications in 2 typical information networks , the paper cocitation network of a topic ( the h-index ) and 5 scientific collaboration networks in the field of water resources , suggest that h-strength and its extensions could be a useful choice for abstracting , simplifying , and visualizing a complex network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , we observe that the 2 informetric models , the Glanzel-Schubert model and the Hirsch model , roughly hold in the context of the h-strength for the collaboration networks .

label: Research questions
text: The term ontology is employed within philosophy , computer science , and information science with different meanings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To take advantage of what ontology theories have to offer , one should understand what they address and where they come from .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In information science , except for a few papers , there is no initiative toward clarifying what ontology really is and the connections that it fosters among different research fields .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article provides such a clarification .

label: Research questions
text: We begin by revisiting the meaning of the term in its original field , philosophy , to reach its current use in other research fields .

label: Research questions
text: We advocate that ontology is a genuine and relevant subject of research in information science .

label: Research questions
text: Finally , we conclude by offering our view of the opportunities for interdisciplinary research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This multidevice environment increases the popularity of cross-device search activities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Cross-device search can be seen as a special case of cross-session search .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous studies regarded re-finding behaviors in cross-session search as task resumption .

label: Research method
text: Based on this , this article proposes considering 2 phases of cross-device search : task preparation and task resumption and to explore their features by modeling .

label: Research method
text: A within-subject user experiment was designed to collect data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Four groups of features were captured from specific behaviors of querying , clicking , gazing , and cognition .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article tested 3 machine-learning methods and found that the C5.0 decision tree performed best .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Five features were included in the task preparation behavior model , and 3 in the task resumption behavior model .

label: Research method
text: The difference and relationship between task preparation and task resumption were investigated by comparing their behavioral features .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is concluded that information need remains blurred in task preparation and becomes clear in task resumption .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The changing states of information need suggest an exploratory process in cross-device search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also identify some implications for search engine designers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The information has to be organized and synthesized into a coherent whole through relationships and information structures .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: There is hardly any research on the information structure of research papers , and how information structure supports rhetorical and argument structures .

label: Research questions
text: Thus , this study is focused on information organization in the and Introduction sections of sociology research papers , analyzing the information structure of research objective , question , hypothesis , and result statements .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study is limited to research papers reporting research that investigated cause-effect relations between two concepts .

label: Research method
text: Two semantic frames were developed to specify the types of information associated with cause-effect and comparison relations , and used as coding schemes to annotate the text for different information types .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Six link patterns between the two frames were identified-showing how comparisons are used to support the claim that the cause-effect relation is valid .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study demonstrated how semantic frames can be incorporated in discourse analysis to identify deep structures underlying the argument structure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results carry implications for the knowledge representation of academic research in knowledge graphs , for semantic relation extraction , and teaching of academic writing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that , in most cases , the citations of the award articles are more numerous than the median , belonging to the Top-50 % stratum .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Only 15.6 % of the award articles have the status of being the most-cited article of the year in which the article was published ; 24.4 % belong to the Top-5 % stratum of the publication year ; 44.4 % belong to the Top10 % stratum of the publication year ; and 73.3 % belong to the Top-25 % stratum of the publication year .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Surprisingly , from 2000 to 2012 , none of the award articles made it to the Top-10 % stratum , apart from the year 2004 ; the leastcited award article received only three citations during a 5-year period .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show a wide range of citations among the Best JASIST Papers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study also observes that the number of articles changed little from 1969 to 1995 but grew rapidly from 1996 to 2012 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Suggestions for possible ways to better meet the challenges of the journal 's growth in size and scope in selecting award articles are provided .

label: Research questions
text: Epistemicide is the killing , silencing , annihilation , or devaluing of a knowledge system .

label: Research questions
text: We argue epistemicide happens when epistemic injustices are persistent and systematic and collectively work as a structured and systemic oppression of particular ways of knowing .

label: Research questions
text: We present epistemicide as a conceptual approach for understanding and analyzing ways knowledge systems are silenced or devalued within Information Science .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We extend Fricker 's framework by : ( a ) identifying new types of epistemic injustices , and ( b ) by adding to Fricker 's concepts of Primary and Secondary Harm and introducing the concept of a Third Harm happening at an intergenerational level .

label: Research questions
text: Addressing epistemicide is critical for information professionals because we task ourselves with handling knowledge from every field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Acknowledgement of and taking steps to interrupt epistemic injustices and these specific harms are supportive of the social justice movements already happening .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper serves as an interruption of epistemic injustice by presenting actions toward justice in the form of operationalized interventions of epistemicide .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It points out , initially , that such aspirations are similar to the now-discredited inductivist approach to science .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: On the positive side , Big Data may permit larger sample sizes , cheaper and more extensive testing of theories , and the continuous assessment of theories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: On the negative side , data-driven science encourages passive data collection , as opposed to experimentation and testing , and hornswoggling ( unsound statistical fiddling ) .

label: Research questions
text: The roles of theory and data in inductive algorithms , statistical modeling , and scientific discoveries are analyzed , and it is argued that theory is needed at every turn .

label: Research questions
text: Data-driven science is a chimera .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper proposes a novel approach for estimating a database 's omitted-citation rate , based on the combined use of 2 or more bibliometric databases .

label: Research method
text: A statistical model is also presented for ( a ) estimating the true number of citations received by individual papers or sets of papers , and ( b ) defining an appropriate confidence interval .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The proposed approach could represent a first step towards the definition of a standard for evaluating the accuracy level of databases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We investigated the same relationship , but for realistic , complex search tasks required in clinical decision making .

label: Research method
text: One hundred and nine clinicians and final year medical students answered 16 clinical questions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although the search engine did improve answer accuracy by 20 percentage points , there was no significant difference when participants used a more effective , state-of-the-art search engine .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also found that the search engine effectiveness difference , identified in the lab , was diminished by around 70 % when the search engines were used with real users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite the aid of the search engine , half of the clinical questions were answered incorrectly .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We further identified the relative contribution of search engine effectiveness to the overall end task success .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that the ability to interpret documents correctly was a much more important factor impacting task success .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: If these Research findings/conclusions are representative , information retrieval research may need to reorient its emphasis towards helping users to better understand information , rather than just finding it for them .

label: Research questions
text: As libraries transition to learning spaces , youth librarians can engage in aspects of democratic design that empowers youth .

label: Research questions
text: Participatory design ( PD ) is a user-centered design method that can support librarians in the democratic development of digital learning spaces .

label: Research questions
text: However , while PD has been used in libraries , we have little knowledge of how youth librarians can act as codesign partners .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We need a conceptual model to understand the role of youth librarians in codesign , and how their experiences are integrated into youth design partnerships .

label: Research method
text: To generate this model , we examine a case study of the evolutionary process of a single librarian and the development of a library system 's learning activities through PD .

label: Research method
text: Using the idea of equal design partnerships , we analyzed video recordings and stakeholder interviews on how children ( ages 7-11 ) worked together with a librarian to develop new digital learning activities .

label: Research questions
text: Our discussion focuses on the development of a participatory librarian design conceptual model that situates librarians as design partners with youth .

label: Research questions
text: The article concludes with recommendations for integrating PD methods into libraries to create digital learning spaces and suggestions for moving forward with this design perspective .

label: Research method
text: The U.S. has 11 federal agencies dedicated to supporting programs and providing funding for research and curriculum development .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The domain of STEM education has significant implications in preparing the desired workforce with the requisite knowledge , developing appropriate curricula , providing teachers the necessary professional development , focusing research dollars on areas that have maximum impact , and developing national educational policy and standards .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A complex undertaking such as STEM education , which attracts interest and valuable resources from a number of stakeholders needs to be well understood .

label: Research method
text: In light of this , we attempt to describe the underlying structure of STEM education , its core areas , and their relationships through co-word analyses of the titles , keywords , and abstracts of the relevant literature using visualization and bibliometric mapping tools .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Implications are drawn with respect to the nature of STEM education as well as curriculum and policy development .

label: Research method
text: To define the style of each presidency , we have applied a principal component analysis ( PCA ) based on the part-of-speech ( POS ) frequencies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From Roosevelt ( 1934 ) , each president tends to own a distinctive style whereas previous presidents tend usually to share some stylistic aspects with others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Applying an automatic classification based on the frequencies of all content-bearing word-types we show that chronology tends to play a central role in forming clusters , a factor that is more important than political affiliation .

label: Research method
text: Using the 300 most frequent word-types , we generate another clustering representation based on the style of each president .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This second view shares similarities with the first one , but usually with more numerous and smaller clusters .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , an authorship attribution approach for each speech can reach a success rate of around 95.7 % under some constraints .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When an incorrect assignment is detected , the proposed author often belongs to the same party and has lived during roughly the same time period as the presumed author .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A deeper analysis of some incorrect assignments reveals interesting reasons justifying difficult attributions .

label: Research questions
text: Missing citation metadata in scholarly databases , however , create problems for classical citation-based ranking algorithms and challenge the performance of citation-based retrieval systems .

label: Research method
text: In this research , we utilize a two-step citation analysis method to investigate the importance of publications for which citation information is partially missing .

label: Research method
text: First , we calculate the importance of the author and then use his importance to estimate the publication importance for some selected articles .

label: Research method
text: To evaluate this method , we designed a simulation experimentrandom citation-missingto test the two-step citation analysis that we carried out with the Association for Computing Machinery ( ACM ) Digital Library ( DL ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this experiment , we simulated different scenarios in a large-scale scientific digital library , from high-quality citation data , to very poor quality data , The results show that a two-step citation analysis can effectively uncover the importance of publications in different situations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More importantly , we found that the optimized impact from the importance of an author ( first step ) is exponentially increased when the quality of citation decreases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions from this study can further enhance citation-based publication-ranking algorithms for real-world applications .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Most theoretical and empirical studies are centered on information needs and seeking , rather than on information outcomes .

label: Research questions
text: This review 's Research questions is to explore and explain health outcomes of Online Consumer Health Information ( OCHI ) in primary care .

label: Research method
text: A participatory systematic mixed studies review with a framework synthesis was undertaken .

label: Research method
text: Starting from an initial conceptual framework , our specific objectives were to ( a ) identify types of OCHI outcomes in primary care , ( b ) identify factors associated with these outcomes , and ( c ) integrate these factors and outcomes into a comprehensive revised framework combining an information theory and a psychosocial theory of behavior .

label: Research method
text: The results of 65 included studies were synthesized using a qualitative thematic data analysis .

label: Research method
text: The themes derived from the literature underwent a harmonization process that produced a comprehensive typology of OCHI outcomes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The revised conceptual framework specifies four individual and one organizational level of OCHI outcomes , while including factors such as consumers ' information needs and four interdependent contextual factors .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It contributes to theoretical knowledge about OCHI health outcomes , and informs future research , information assessment methods , and tools to help consumers find and use health information .

label: Research method
text: The hypothesis is that a wide range of heterogeneous data resources can be characterized and classified due to their particular configurations of hypertext features such as scripts , links , interactive processes , and time scalings , and that the hypertext configuration is a major but not sole source of the messiness of big data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The notion of hypertext will be revalidated , placed at the center of the interpretation of networked digital media , and used in the analysis of the fast-growing amounts of heterogeneous digital collections , assemblages , and corpora .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The introduction summarizes the wider background of a fast-changing data landscape .

label: Research method
text: Citation and content analysis were applied to articles grouped by accessibility ( libre , gratis , and fee for access ) for various bibliometric attributes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Open access literature does not differ from fee-for-access literature in terms of impact factor , detection of error , or change in postretraction citation rates .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Literature found in the PubMed Central Open Access subset provides detailed information about the nature of the anomaly more often than less accessible works .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Open access literature appears to be of similar reliability and integrity as the population of biomedical literature in general , with the added value of being more forthcoming about the nature of errors when they are identified .

label: Research questions
text: With several commercial entities providing these electronic resources , the result can be silo systems and processes to evaluate cost and usage of these resources , making it difficult to provide meaningful analytics .

label: Research method
text: In this research , we examine a subset of journals from a large research library using a web analytics approach with the goal of developing a framework for the analysis of library subscriptions .

label: Research method
text: This foundational approach is implemented by comparing the impact to the cost , titles , and usage for the subset of journals and by assessing the funding area .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , the results highlight the benefit of a web analytics evaluation framework for university libraries and the impact of classifying titles based on the funding area .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , they show the statistical difference in both use and cost among the various funding areas when ranked by cost , eliminating the outliers of heavily used and highly expensive journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Future work includes refining this model for a larger scale analysis tying metrics to library organizational objectives and for the creation of an online application to automate this analysis .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These services are valuable because users get an enhanced search experience .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the compiled user profiles may contain sensitive information that might represent a privacy threat .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This issue should be addressed in a way that it also preserves the utility of the profile with regard to search services .

label: Research questions
text: State-of-the-art approaches tackle these issues by generating and submitting fake queries that are related to the interests of the user .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This technique allows the WSE to only know general ( and useful ) data while the detailed ( and potentially private ) data are obfuscated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To build fake queries , these proposals rely on past queries to obtain user interests .

label: Research questions
text: However , we argue that this is not always the best strategy and , in this article , we study the use of social networks to gather more accurate user profiles that enable better personalized service while offering a similar , or even better , level of practical privacy .

label: Research method
text: These hypotheses are empirically supported by evaluations using real profiles gathered from Twitter and a set of AOL search queries .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Digital preservation research has focused on identifying technical , economic , and organizational sources of risk and has relied on an assumption that individuals will behave in rational and predictable ways in response to the same information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article asserts that viewing digital preservation as a process that takes place in complex social contexts is just as important as thinking about digital preservation in terms of technological or economic issues .

label: Research questions
text: This is particularly important for understanding how individuals involved in digital preservation construct their understanding of risk because social factors influence how people construct their understanding of , and behave in response to , risk information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The author proposes an eight-factor model for the social construction of risk , which includes : communication , complexity , expertise , organizations , political culture , trust , uncertainty , and vulnerability .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The article demonstrates how these factors influence individuals as they construct their understanding of risk in the context of digital preservation and how this in turn affects digital preservation decisions .

label: Research method
text: To assess how common such practices are and whether they vary by discipline , gender , and country , the authors conducted a large-scale e-mail survey of astronomy and astrophysics , public health , environmental engineering , and philosophy across 15 European countries and analyzed hyperlinks from web CVs of academics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: About 60 % of the 2,154 survey responses reported having a web CV or something similar , and there were differences between disciplines , genders , and countries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A follow-up outlink analysis of 2,700 web CVs found that a third had at least one outlink to an OA target , typically a public eprint archive or an individual self-archived file .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This proportion was considerably higher in astronomy ( 48 % ) and philosophy ( 37 % ) than in environmental engineering ( 29 % ) and public health ( 21 % ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There were also differences in linking to publishers ' websites , resources , and discussions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Perhaps most important , however , the amount of linking to OA publications seems to be much lower than allowed by publishers and journals , suggesting that many opportunities for disseminating full-text research online are being missed , especially in disciplines without established repositories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , few academics seem to be exploiting their CVs to link to discussions , resources , or article abstracts , which seems to be another missed opportunity for publicizing research .

label: Research method
text: Four indicators , the mean reference rate per page , the percentage of references to Web of Science journal literature , the mean reference age , and Price Index , were applied to analyze the reference patterns of three publication types : books , book chapter articles and journal articles .

label: Research method
text: References of publications indexed in Web of Science Core Collection were analyzed for two periods ( 2005-2009 , 2010-2013 ) and across 15 disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Journal article authors cite more recent references and more references from serial publications than monograph authors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The difference between the sciences and the SSH is as obvious as the difference between periodical and non-serial publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the reference patterns of social sciences are much more similar to science fields than humanities , especially for monographs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The subject characteristics of reference pattern are strongly affected by publication types .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , journal publications have stronger associations between ageing indicators and the share of WoS journal references than monographs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Counts of the number of patents citing an organization 's website may therefore provide an indicator of its technological capacity or relevance .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article introduces methods to extract URL citations from patents and evaluates the usefulness of counts of patent web citations as a technology indicator .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An analysis of patents citing 200 US universities or 177 UK universities found computer science and engineering departments to be frequently cited , as well as research-related webpages , such as Wikipedia , YouTube , or the Internet Archive .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , however , patent URL citations seem to be frequent enough to be useful for ranking major US and the top few UK universities if popular hosted subdomains are filtered out , but the hit count estimates on the first search engine results page should not be relied upon for accuracy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The specialties investigated are systems librarian , electronic resource librarian , digital librarian , institutional repository manager , clinical librarian and informationist , digital curator/research data manager , teaching librarian/information literacy educator , and information and knowledge manager .

label: Research method
text: Piecemeal literature based on job advertisements , surveys , and individual case studies is consolidated to offer a novel perspective on the evolution of the profession .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The resilience of the profession 's core jurisdiction is apparent despite pressures to erode it .

label: Research questions
text: Forays into teaching , and more recently into open access and data management , can be understood as responses to such pressure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The attractions but also the risks of embedded roles and overextended claims become apparent when comparing past and prospective specialties .

label: Research questions
text: Prior art patent search is the task of identifying related patents for a given patent file , and is an essential step in judging the validity of a patent application .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article proposes an automated query generation and postprocessing method for prior art patent search .

label: Research method
text: The proposed approach first constructs structured queries by combining terms extracted from different fields of a query patent and then reranks the retrieved patents by utilizing the International Patent Classification ( IPC ) code similarities between the query patent and the retrieved patents along with the retrieval score .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An extensive set of empirical results carried out on a large-scale , real-world dataset shows that utilizing 20 or 30 query terms extracted from all fields of an original query patent according to their log ( tf ) idf values helps form a representative search query out of the query patent and is found to be more effective than is using any number of query terms from any single field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is shown that combining terms extracted from different fields of the query patent by giving higher importance to terms extracted from the abstract , claims , and description fields than to terms extracted from the title field is more effective than treating all extracted terms equally while forming the search query .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , utilizing the similarities between the IPC codes of the query patent and retrieved patents is shown to be beneficial to improve the effectiveness of the prior art search .

label: Research questions
text: However , the majority of TC algorithms assume that the underlying data distribution does not change over time .

label: Research questions
text: In this work , we are concerned with the challenges imposed by the temporal dynamics observed in textual data sets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We provide evidence of the existence of temporal effects in three textual data sets , reflected by variations observed over time in the class distribution , in the pairwise class similarities , and in the relationships between terms and classes .

label: Research method
text: We then quantify , using a series of full factorial design experiments , the impact of these effects on four well-known TC algorithms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that these temporal effects affect each analyzed data set differently and that they restrict the performance of each considered TC algorithm to different extents .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The reported quantitative analyses , which are the original contributions of this article , provide valuable new insights to better understand the behavior of TC algorithms when faced with nonstatic ( temporal ) data distributions and highlight important requirements for the proposal of more accurate classification models .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This makes it difficult for users to pick relevant documents , especially given that they are not knowledgeable of the topics .

label: Research questions
text: To explore how systems can better help users find relevant documents from search results , the current research analyzed document selection behaviors of users with different levels of domain knowledge ( DK ) .

label: Research method
text: Data were collected in a laboratory study with 35 participants each searching on four tasks in the genomics domain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that users with high and low DK levels selected different sets of documents to view ; those high in DK read more documents and gave higher relevance ratings for the viewed documents than those low in DK did .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Users with low DK tended to select documents ranking toward the top of the search result lists , and those with high in DK tended to also select documents ranking down the search result lists .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions help design search systems that can personalize search results to users with different levels of DK .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although citation counts are a recognized indicator of scholarly impact , alternative data is needed to provide evidence of other types of impact , including within education and wider society .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Wikipedia is a logical choice for both of these because the role of a general encyclopaedia is to be an understandable repository of facts about a diverse array of topics and hence it may cite research to support its claims .

label: Research method
text: To test whether Wikipedia could provide new evidence about the impact of scholarly research , this article counted citations to 302,328 articles and 18,735 monographs in English indexed by Scopus in the period 2005 to 2012 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that citations from Wikipedia to articles are too rare for most research evaluation Research questionss , with only 5 % of articles being cited in all fields .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In contrast , a third of monographs have at least one citation from Wikipedia , with the most in the arts and humanities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Hence , Wikipedia citations can provide extra impact evidence for academic monographs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , the results may be relatively easily manipulated and so Wikipedia is not recommended for evaluations affecting stakeholder interests .

label: Research questions
text: However , creating such detailed metadata can be onerous , and there are few structured methods for doing so .

label: Research method
text: In this case study of data curation in support of geobiology research conducted at Yellowstone National Park , we describe a method of Research Process Modeling for documenting noncomputational data provenance in a structured yet flexible way .

label: Research method
text: The method combines systems analysis techniques to model research activities , the World Wide Web Consortium Provenance ( PROV ) ontology to illustrate relationships between data products , and simple inventory methods to account for research processes and data products .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It also supports collaborative data curation between information professionals and researchers , and is therefore a significant step toward producing more useable and interpretable research data .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We demonstrate how this method describes data provenance more robustly than flat metadata alone and fills a critical gap in the documentation of provenance for field-based and noncomputational workflows .

label: Research questions
text: We discuss potential applications of this approach to other research domains .

label: Research method
text: Using a content analysis approach to determine data breach severity attributes ( measured by the total number of breached records , type of data accessed , the source of the data breach , and how the data were used ) , in conjunction with readability measures ( reading complexity , numerical intensity , length of letter , word size , and unique words ) , 512 data breach incidents from 281 U.S. firms across the 2012-2015 period were examined .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that data breach severity has a positive impact on reading complexity , length of letter , word size , and unique words , and a negative impact on numerical terms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Interpreting the results collectively through the lens of impression management , it can be inferred that business managers may be attempting to obfuscate bad news associated with high data breach severity incidents by manipulating syntactical features of the data breach notification letters in a way that makes the message difficult for individuals to comprehend .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study contributes to the information studies and impression management behavior literatures by analyzing linguistic cues in notifications following a data breach incident .

label: Research questions
text: Existing conceptual models such as the Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records ( FRBR ) are not adequate to represent the unique descriptive attributes , levels of variance , and relationships among video games .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous video game-specific models tend to focus on the development of video games and their technical aspects .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our model instead attempts to reflect how users such as game players , collectors , and scholars understand video games and the relationships among them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We specifically consider use cases of gamers , with future intentions of using this conceptual model as a foundation for developing a union catalog for various libraries and museums .

label: Research questions
text: In the process of developing the model , we encountered many challenges , including conceptual overlap with and divergence from FRBR , entity scoping , complex relationships among entities , and the question of how to model additional content for game expansion .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Future work will focus on making this model interoperable with existing ontologies as well as further understanding and description of content and relationships .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is found that closely related areas have a high propensity to share a larger number of common authors .

label: Research method
text: A method for comparing areas of vastly different sizes and to handle name homonymy is constructed , allowing for the robust deployment of this method on real data sets .

label: Research method
text: A statistical analysis of the probability distributions of the common author overlap that accounts for noise is carried out along with the production of network maps with weighted links proportional to the overlap strength .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This is demonstrated on 2 case studies , complexity science and neutrino physics , where the level of relatedness of areas within each area is expected to vary greatly .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is found that the results returned by this method closely match the intuitive expectation that the broad , multidisciplinary area of complexity science possesses areas that are weakly related to each other , whereas the much narrower area of neutrino physics shows very strongly related areas .

label: Research method
text: We focus on a specific phenomenon : users reading several articles related to a particular news development , which we call story-focused reading .

label: Research questions
text: Our goal is to understand the effect of story-focused reading on user engagement and how news sites can support this phenomenon .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that most users focus on stories that interest them and that even casual news readers engage in story-focused reading .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: During story-focused reading , users spend more time reading and a larger number of news sites are involved .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , readers employ different strategies to find articles related to a story .

label: Research questions
text: We also analyze how news sites promote story-focused reading by looking at how they link their articles to related content published by them , or by other sources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that providing links to related content leads to a higher engagement of the users , and that this is the case even for links to external sites .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also show that the performance of links can be affected by their type , their position , and how many of them are present within an article .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To induce rational regulations for protecting personal information , it is necessary to separately estimate consumers ' values related to different types of personal information .

label: Research method
text: In this article , discrete choice experiments using hypothetical information leakage situations given certain compensation amounts and discrete choice models were used to quantitatively analyze the value of personal information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that consumers generally place high value on information that could cause immediate and actual damage from the leakage after identification , such as basic personal information and purchase list and payment information .

label: Research questions
text: Consumers value location information and personal medical information differently based on their perceived importance of privacy and their prior experience with personal information leakage .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We suggest that the level of regulation should differ according to the type of personal information based on the consumers ' valuation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article contributes to a better understanding of a quantitative approach to pricing personal information .

label: Research questions
text: The identification of such concepts is a challenging prediction task that would help multiple parties-including researchers and the general public-focus their attention within the vast scientific literature .

label: Research method
text: In this paper we present a system that predicts the future impact of a scientific concept , represented as a technical term , based on the information available from recently published research articles .

label: Research method
text: We analyze the usefulness of rich features derived from the full-text of the articles through a variety of approaches , including rhetorical sentence analysis , information extraction , and time-series analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results from two large-scale experiments with 3.8 million full-text articles and 48 million metadata records support the conclusion that full-text features are significantly more useful for prediction than metadata-only features and that the most accurate predictions result from combining the metadata and full-text features .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Surprisingly , these results hold even when the metadata features are available for a much larger number of documents than are available for the full-text features .

label: Research questions
text: Simply stated , these students tend to believe that they have above-average IL skills , when , in fact , an objective test of their ability indicates that they are below-proficient in terms of their actual skills .

label: Research method
text: This investigation was part of an Institute of Museum and Library Services-funded project and includes demographic data about participants , their scores on an objective test of their information literacy skills , and self-estimates of their ability .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions support previous research that indicates many students come to college without proficient IL skills , that students with below-proficient IL skills have inflated views of their ability , and that this miscalibration can also be expressed by students who test as proficient .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Implications for research and practice are discussed .

label: Research questions
text: These are core concerns for researchers working within the area of critical information studies-yet these companies have also demonstrated novel tactics for obscuring their operations , reducing the ability of scholars to speak about how harms are perpetuated or to link them to larger systems .

label: Research questions
text: While scholars ' methods and ethical conventions have historically privileged the agency of research participants , the current landscape suggests the value of exploring methods that would reveal actions that are Research questionsfully hidden .

label: Research questions
text: We propose investigation as a model for critical information studies and review the methods and epistemological conventions of investigative journalists as a provocative example , noting that their orientation toward those in power enables them to discuss societal harms in ways that academic researchers often can not .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude by discussing key topics , such as process accountability and institutional norms , that should feature in discussions of how academic researchers might position investigation in relation to their own work .

label: Research questions
text: However , access to this information can sometimes be restricted or blocked in various ways .

label: Research method
text: This research adopts Jaeger and Burnett 's ( 2005 ) conceptualization of information access as the presence of a robust system through which information is made available to citizens and others ( p. 465 ) with physical , intellectual , and social components .

label: Research method
text: This provides the conceptual framework through which incidents of restricted access to science policy ( RASP ) were analyzed in a comparative case study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The research found that citizens ' physical , intellectual , and social access to scientific research was restricted in these cases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , the theoretical framework of democratic accountability held normative and symbolic power for the respondents ; although democratic accountability did not accurately predict respondents ' actions , it was used as a significant justification for their actions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research suggests that the conceptual framework of information access ( with physical , intellectual , and social components ) and the theoretical framework of democratic accountability ( although primarily normative ) may be useful approaches to subsequent investigations of censorship and restricted access in other situations and research areas .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , the demand for academic materials produced in nonWestern societies is increasing among English-speaking users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In order to search among such material , users rely on keywords such as author names .

label: Research questions
text: However , Asian nations such as Korea and China have markedly different methods of writing personal names from Western naming traditions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among these differences are name components , structure , writing customs , and distribution of surnames .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These differences influence the Anglicization of Asian academic researchers ' names , often leading to them being written in various fashions , unlike Western personal names .

label: Research questions
text: These inconsistent formats can often lead to difficulties in searching and finding academic materials for Western users unfamiliar with Korean and Asian personal names .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article presents methods for precisely understanding and categorizing Korean personal names in order to make academic materials by Korean authors easier to find for Westerners .

label: Research questions
text: As such , this article discusses characteristics particular to Korean personal names and furthermore analyzes how the personal names of Korean academic researchers are currently being written in English .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our longitudinal analysis shows , among other things , that the bandwidth share distributions-and thus bandwidth differences-exhibit considerable path dependence where country proportions of international bandwidth in 2011 can be substantially accounted for by a preferential attachment-based mixture of micro-level processes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our preferential attachment model , consistent with empirical data , does not predict increasing concentration of bandwidth within top-ranked countries .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that recognizing the strong , but nuanced , historical inertia of bandwidth distributions is helpful in better discriminating among competing theoretical perspectives on the global digital divide as well as in clarifying policy discussions related to gaps between bandwidth-rich and bandwidth-poor countries .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Specifically , through the lens of trust judgments , it demonstrates that gender is a determinant of the information evaluation process .

label: Research method
text: A questionnaire-based survey collected data from adults regarding the factors that influence their judgment of the trustworthiness of online health information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Both men and women identified credibility , recommendation , ease of use , and brand as being of importance in their trust judgments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , women also take into account style , while men eschew this for familiarity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , men appear to be more concerned with the comprehensiveness and accuracy of the information , the ease with which they can access it , and its familiarity , whereas women demonstrate greater interest in cognition , such as the ease with which they can read and understand the information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
