text: These gender differences are consistent with the demographic data , which suggest that : women consult more types of sources than men ; men are more likely to be searching with respect to a long-standing health complaint ; and , women are more likely than men to use tablets in their health information seeking .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Recommendations for further research to better inform practice are offered .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of this study is to evaluate the change in user assessment of search results and explore how users ' judgements change .

label: Research method
text: To this end , we conducted a large-scale user study with 86 participants who evaluated 2 different queries and 4 diverse result sets twice with an interval of 2 months .

label: Research questions
text: To analyze the results we investigate whether 2 types of patterns of user behavior from the theory of categorical thinking hold for the case of evaluation of search results : ( a ) coarseness and ( b ) locality .

label: Research method
text: To quantify these patterns we devised 2 new measures of change in user judgements and distinguish between local ( when users swap between close ranks and relevance values ) and nonlocal changes .

label: Research method
text: Two types of judgements were considered in this study : ( a ) relevance on a 4-point scale , and ( b ) ranking on a 10-point scale without ties .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that users tend to change their judgements of the results over time in about 50 % of cases for relevance and in 85 % of cases for ranking .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the majority of these changes were local .

label: Research method
text: The study adopts a two-stage sequential mixed-methods design .

label: Research method
text: The first stage is a quantitative survey of 447 citizens from two countries .

label: Research method
text: The second stage involves 50 qualitative interviews which further untangle the roles of privacy concern and benefits .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The integrated Research findings/conclusions provide evidence that a privacy paradox exists .

label: Research questions
text: While individuals continue to express a high desire for privacy , their consideration of the benefits and privacy concerns prior to adoption is largely skewed toward the benefits , due to a lack of privacy knowledge , emphasis on immediate gratification , overestimation of the benefits , and underestimation of the risks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study further extends the privacy calculus theory to the health context and acknowledges the factors impacting this comparison of benefits and privacy concerns prior to and postadoption of a new technology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study provides actionable insights for practice , highlighting the importance of privacy education to foster awareness and control mechanisms to negate the potential negative effects of privacy concern .

label: Research method

label: Research questions
text: In the last few years , strategies that are based on the explicit knowledge of query aspects emerged as highly effective ways of diversifying search results .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our contributions in this article are two-fold .

label: Research questions
text: First , we extensively evaluate the performance of a state-of-the-art explicit diversification strategy and pin-point its potential weaknesses .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We propose basic yet novel optimizations to remedy these weaknesses and boost the performance of this algorithm .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: As a second contribution , inspired by the success of the current diversification strategies that exploit the relevance of the candidate documents to individual query aspects , we cast the diversification problem into the problem of ranking aggregation .

label: Research method
text: To this end , we propose to materialize the re-rankings of the candidate documents for each query aspect and then merge these rankings by adapting the score ( -based ) and rank ( -based ) aggregation methods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our extensive experimental evaluations show that certain ranking aggregation methods are superior to existing explicit diversification strategies in terms of diversification effectiveness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , these ranking aggregation methods have lower computational complexity than the state-of-the-art diversification strategies .

label: Research method
text: This article investigates the influence of time on the number of Mendeley readers of an article through a theoretical discussion and an investigation into the relationship between counts of readers of , and citations to , 4 general library and information science ( LIS ) journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For this discipline , it takes about 7 years for articles to attract as many Scopus citations as Mendeley readers , and after this the Spearman correlation between readers and citers is stable at about 0.6 for all years .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This suggests that Mendeley readership counts may be useful impact indicators for both newer and older articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The lack of dates for individual Mendeley article readers and an unknown bias toward more recent articles mean that readership data should be normalized individually by year , however , before making any comparisons between articles published in different years .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous studies on the digital divide were unable to capture the detected trends appropriately , because they worked with proxies , such as the number of subscriptions or related investments , without considering the vast heterogeneity in informational performance among technological devices .

label: Research method
text: We created a comprehensive data set ( based on over 1,100 sources ) that allows measuring information capacity directly , in bits per second , bits , and instructions per second .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The newly proposed indicators provide insights into inequalities in access to , usage of , and impact of digitized information flows .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It shows that the digital divide has gone into a second stage , which is based on a relative universalization of technological devices and a continuously evolving divide in terms of communication capacity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Recently , methods that exploit named entities have been shown to be more effective for query expansion than traditional pseudorelevance feedback methods .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we introduce a supervised learning approach that exploits named entities for query expansion using Wikipedia as a repository of high-quality feedback documents .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In contrast with existing entity-oriented pseudorelevance feedback approaches , we tackle query expansion as a learning-to-rank problem .

label: Research method
text: As a result , not only do we select effective expansion terms but we also weigh these terms according to their predicted effectiveness .

label: Research method
text: To this end , we exploit the rich structure of Wikipedia articles to devise discriminative term features , including each candidate term 's proximity to the original query terms , as well as its frequency across multiple article fields and in category and infobox descriptors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments on three Text REtrieval Conference web test collections attest the effectiveness of our approach , with gains of up to 23.32 % in terms of mean average precision , 19.49 % in terms of precision at 10 , and 7.86 % in terms of normalized discounted cumulative gain compared with a state-of-the-art approach for entity-oriented query expansion .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Instead , there is a need to harness the collective IT resources of the diverse stakeholders operating in the interorganizational business networks that characterize the contemporary business landscape .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This , in turn , demands an appropriate leadership structure .

label: Research questions
text: However , the notion of green leadership has not received adequate research attention to date .

label: Research questions
text: Using a case study of green IT implementation at China Mobile , the world 's largest mobile telecommunications provider , this study seeks to shed light on the underlying process through which green leadership is achieved and subsequently enacted to facilitate collective green IT initiatives .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: With its Research findings/conclusions , this study presents a process theory that complements the dominant , internally-oriented perspective of green IT and provides practitioners with a useful reference for leveraging the collective IT resources of their network partners to contribute toward preserving the environment for future generations .

label: Research method
text: We compare ( a ) normalization by counting citations in proportion to the length of the reference list ( 1/N of references ) with ( b ) rescaling by dividing citation scores by the arithmetic mean of the citation rate of the cluster .

label: Research method
text: Rescaling is analytical and therefore independent of the quality of the attribution to the sets , whereas fractional counting provides an empirical strategy for normalization among sets ( by evaluating the between-group variance ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By the fairness test of Radicchi and Castellano ( 2012a ) , rescaling outperforms fractional counting of citations for reasons that we consider .

label: Research questions
text: This study aimed to bridge the gap by exploring i ) the relationship between task complexity and difficulty ; ii ) factors affecting task difficulty ; and iii ) the relationship between task difficulty , task complexity , and user search behaviors in MIR .

label: Research method
text: An empirical user experiment was conducted with 51 participants and a novel MIR system .

label: Research method
text: The participants searched for 6 topics across 3 complexity levels .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results revealed that i ) perceived task difficulty in music search is influenced by task complexity , user background , system affordances , and task uncertainty and enjoyability ; and ii ) perceived task difficulty in MIR is significantly correlated with effectiveness metrics such as the number of songs found , number of clicks , and task completion time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions have implications for the design of music search tasks ( in research ) or use cases ( in system development ) as well as future MIR systems that can detect task difficulty based on user effectiveness metrics .

label: Research questions
text: Within the broad context of data citation , we focus on the automatic construction of citations problem for hierarchically structured data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We present the learning to cite framework , which enables the automatic construction of human- and machine-readable citations with different levels of coarseness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main goal is to reduce the human intervention on data to a minimum and to provide a citation system general enough to work on heterogeneous and complex XML data sets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We describe how this framework can be realized by a system for creating citations to single nodes within an XML data set and , as a use case , show how it can be applied in the context of digital archives .

label: Research method
text: We conduct an extensive evaluation of the proposed citation system by analyzing its effectiveness from the correctness and completeness viewpoints , showing that it represents a suitable solution that can be easily employed in real-world environments and that reduces human intervention on data to a minimum .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose that the nature of the knowledge shared and an individual 's social network influence employees to find more value in person-to-person knowledge sharing , which could lead them to bypass the codified knowledge provided by a knowledge management system ( KMS ) .

label: Research method
text: We surveyed employees of a workman 's compensation board in Canada and used social network analysis and hierarchical linear modeling to analyze the data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that knowledge complexity and knowledge teachability increased the likelihood of finding value in person-to-person knowledge transfer , but knowledge observability did not .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Contrary to expectations , whether the knowledge was available in the KMS had no impact on the value of person-to-person knowledge transfer .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In terms of the social network , individuals with larger networks tended to perceive more value in the person-to-person transfer of knowledge than those with smaller networks .

label: Research questions
text: More recently , the same authors ( Egghe & Rousseau , 2012b ) have presented a new ( implicit ) formula based on the so-called shifted Lotka function to allow for the objection that the original model makes no allowance for papers receiving zero citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Here it is shown , through a small empirical study , that the formulae actually give very similar results whether or not the uncited papers are included .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , and more important , it is found that they both seriously underestimate the true h-index , and we suggest that the reason for this is that this is a contextthe citation distribution of an author-in which straightforward Lotkaian informetrics is inappropriate .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Indeed , the analysis suggests that even if we restrict attention to the upper tail of the citation distribution , a simple Lotka/Pareto-like model can give misleading results .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: However , the differential impacts of such social influence on developers ' initial and sustained participation behaviors were largely overlooked in previous research .

label: Research method
text: We empirically studied the impacts of two social influence mechanisms-word-of-mouth ( WOM ) and observational learning ( OL ) -on these two types of participation , using data collected from a large OSS development platform called Open Hub .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that action ( OL ) speaks louder than words ( WOM ) with regard to sustained participation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , project age positively moderates the impacts of social influence on both types of participation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For projects with a higher average workload , the impacts of OL are reduced on initial participation but are increased on sustained participation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our study provides a better understanding of how social influence affects OSS developers ' participation behaviors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It also offers important practical implications for designing software development platforms that can leverage social influence to attract more initial and sustained participation .

label: Research questions
text: General methodologies , best practice , and guidelines for web information architecture ( IA ) have been developed and refined .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research paper extends the knowledge base for web IA by examining situated practice within large organizations and building theory to provide a deeper understanding of how large organizations construct information-rich websites .

label: Research method
text: A grounded theory , The Situated Practice of Web IA in Large Organizations , is proposed as an integrated theoretical framework for practice in this context .

label: Research method
text: The theoretical framework is composed of 4 foundational constructs titled : owning , negotiating , enacting , and knowing web IA .

label: Research questions
text: Building on these foundations , an integrating central construct of practicing web IA is proposed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This theoretical framework will inform large organizations and practitioners as they approach web IA .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Such scholarship promotes reuse of digital data , provokes new research questions , and cultivates new audiences .

label: Research questions
text: Digital curation , the process of managing a trusted body of information for current and future use , helps maximize the value of research in digital humanities .

label: Research method
text: Predicated on semistructured interviews , this naturalistic case study explores the creation , use , storage , and planned reuse of data by 45 interviewees involved with 19 Office of Digital Humanities Start-Up Grant ( SUG ) projects .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Interviewees grappled with challenges surrounding data , collaboration and communication , planning and project management , awareness and outreach , resources , and technology .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Overall this study explores the existing digital curation practices and needs of scholars engaged in innovative digital humanities work and to discern how closely these practices and needs align with the digital curation literature .

label: Research questions
text: The trade-off users have to make between using sites such as Facebook to connect with their friends versus protecting their personal privacy is not well understood .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Furthermore , very little behavioral research has focused on how personal privacy concerns are related to information disclosures made by one 's friends .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our survey study of 116 Facebook users shows that engaging with friends through tagging activity and third-party application use is associated with higher levels of personal Facebook usage and a stronger emotional attachment to Facebook .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , users who have high levels of personal privacy concern and perceive a lack of effectiveness in Facebook 's privacy policies tend to engage less frequently in tagging and app activities with friends , respectively .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our model and results explore illustrate the complexity of the trade-off between privacy concerns , engaging with friends through tagging and apps , and Facebook usage .

label: Research questions
text: However , existing search systems often fail to provide users with a good list of medical search results , especially for classic ( keyword-based ) queries .

label: Research questions
text: In this article we elaborate on whether and how we can exploit biomedicine-related entities from the emerging Web of Data for improving ( through reranking ) the results returned by a search system .

label: Research questions
text: The aim is to promote relevant but low-ranked hits containing entities that are important to the current search context .

label: Research method
text: We introduce an approach that is based on entity extraction applied on the retrieved documents , yielding a graph of documents along with entities , which in turn is analyzed probabilistically using a Random Walk-based method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proposed approach is independent of the submitted query and the underlying retrieval models , and thus can be applied over any ranked list of medical search results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Evaluation results using the data set of TREC Clinical Decision Support track demonstrate that the proposed approach can significantly improve the results returned by classic and widely applicable retrieval models .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results also enabled us to identify cases where the proposed reranking method fails to improve the ranking .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There is a huge semantic gap between different modalities on account of heterogeneous properties .

label: Research questions
text: How to establish the correlation among different modality data faces enormous challenges .

label: Research questions
text: In this work , we propose a novel end-to-end framework named Dual Multi-Angle Self-Attention ( DMASA ) for cross-modal retrieval .

label: Research method
text: Multiple self-attention mechanisms are applied to extract fine-grained features for both images and texts from different angles .

label: Research method
text: We then integrate coarse-grained and fine-grained features into a multimodal embedding space , in which the similarity degrees between images and texts can be directly compared .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , we propose a special multistage training strategy , in which the preceding stage can provide a good initial value for the succeeding stage and make our framework work better .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Very promising experimental results over the state-of-the-art methods can be achieved on three benchmark datasets ofFlickr8k , Flickr30k , andMSCOCO .

label: Research questions
text: The aim of this task is to classify opinions as positive or negative .

label: Research method
text: There are two main approaches to carrying out polarity classification : machine learning and semantic orientation based on the integration of knowledge resources .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we propose to combine both approaches using a voting system based on the majority rule .

label: Research questions
text: In this way , we attempt to improve the polarity classification of two parallel corpora such as the opinion corpus for Arabic ( OCA ) and the English version of the OCA ( EVOCA ) .

label: Research method
text: Several experiments have been performed to check the feasibility of the proposed method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that the experiment that took into account both approaches in the voting system obtained the best performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , it is also shown that the proposed method slightly improves the best results obtained using machine learning approaches solely over the OCA and the EVOCA separately .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Therefore , we can conclude that the approach proposed here might be considered a good strategy for polarity detection when we work with bilingual parallel corpora .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A series of reasons have been highlighted in previous studies .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research explores another possibilitywhether there is a clubbing effect in China 's surge in research citations , in which a higher rate of internal citing takes place among influential Chinese researchers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Focusing on the most highly cited research articles in nanotechnology , we find that a larger proportion of Chinese nanotechnology research citations are localized within individual , institutional , and national networks within China .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Both descriptive and statistical tests suggest that highly cited Chinese papers are more likely than similar U.S. papers to receive internal and localized citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Tentative explanations and policy implications are discussed .

label: Research method
text: The result was a productivity distribution described by a power law .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , Lotka 's original data on author productivity in chemistry are reconsidered .

label: Research method
text: We define a discrete power law with exponential cutoff , test Lotka 's data , and compare the fit to the discrete power law .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Research examining how data papers report data events , such as data transactions and manipulations , is limited .

label: Research method
text: The research reported on in this article addresses this limitation and investigated how data events are inscribed in data papers .

label: Research method
text: A content analysis was conducted examining the full texts of 82 data papers , drawn from the curated list of data papers connected to the Global Biodiversity Information Facility .

label: Research method
text: Data events recorded for each paper were organized into a set of 17 categories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Many of these categories are described together in the same sentence , which indicates the messiness of data events in the laboratory space .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions challenge the degrees to which data papers are a distinct genre compared to research articles and they describe data-centric research processes in a through way .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article also discusses how our results could inform a better data publication ecosystem in the future .

label: Research method
text: We conducted an experiment to test a comprehensive model of user experience with news sites that was developed previously by means of an online survey .

label: Research method
text: Level of adoption ( novel or adopted site ) was controlled with a between-subjects manipulation .

label: Research method
text: We collected participants ' answers to psychometric scales at 2 times : after presentation of 5 screenshots of a news site and directly after 10 minutes of hands-on experience with the site .

label: Research method
text: The model was extended with the prediction of users ' satisfaction with news sites as a high-level design goal .

label: Research method
text: A psychometric measure of trust in news providers was developed and added to the model to better predict people 's intention to use particular news sites .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The model presented in this article represents a theoretically founded , empirically tested basis for evaluating news websites , and it holds theoretical relevance to user-experience research in general .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Finally , the Research findings/conclusions and the model are applied to provide practical guidance in design prioritization .

label: Research method
text: We compare author citation ranking and cocitation mapping results in the stem cell research field from 2004 to 2009 using two AND approaches : the traditional simplified approach of using author surname and first initial and a sophisticated algorithmic approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that the traditional approach leads to extremely distorted rankings and substantially distorted mappings of authors in this field when based on first- or all-author citation counting , whereas last-author-based citation ranking and cocitation mapping both appear relatively immune to the author name ambiguity problem .

label: Research questions
text: This is largely because Romanized names of Chinese and Korean authors , who are very active in this field , are extremely ambiguous , but few of these researchers consistently publish as last authors in bylines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that a more earnest effort is required to deal with the author name ambiguity problem in both citation analysis and information retrieval , especially given the current trend toward globalization .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the stem cell research field , in which laboratory heads are traditionally listed as last authors in bylines , last-author-based citation ranking and cocitation mapping using the traditional approach to author name disambiguation may serve as a simple workaround , but likely at the price of largely filtering out Chinese and Korean contributions to the field as well as important contributions by young researchers .

label: Research questions
text: The objective of the evaluation was to detect deficiencies in the taxonomy and to infer problems of applied construction steps from users ' navigation difficulties .

label: Research method
text: The evaluation approach included scenario-based navigation exercises and postexercise interviews .

label: Research method
text: Navigation exercise errors and underlying reasons were analyzed in relation to specific components of the taxonomy and applied construction steps .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Guidelines for the construction of the hierarchical structure and categories of an organizational taxonomy using existing general classification schemes and domain thesauri were derived from the evaluation results .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article presents the framework and a thorough evaluation of each of its components .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results on a large data set of 18 mood categories show that combining lyrics and audio significantly outperformed systems using audio-only features .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Automatic feature selection techniques were further proved to have reduced feature space .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , the examination of learning curves shows that the hybrid systems using lyrics and audio needed fewer training samples and shorter audio clips to achieve the same or better classification accuracies than systems using lyrics or audio singularly .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Last but not least , performance comparisons reveal the relative importance of audio and lyric features across mood categories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In some domains , the existence of less content in the users ' native language may not be problematic and even help to cope with the information overload .

label: Research questions
text: Yet , in domains such as health , where information quality is critical , a larger quantity of information may mean easier access to higher quality content .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Query translation may be a good strategy to access content in other languages , but the presence of medical terms in health queries makes the translation process more difficult , even for users with very good language proficiencies .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we evaluate how translating a health query affects users with different language proficiencies .

label: Research method
text: We chose English as the non-native language because it is a widely spoken language and it is the most used language on the web .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions suggest that non-English-speaking users having at least elementary English proficiency can benefit from a system that suggests English alternatives for their queries , or automatically retrieves English content from a non-English query .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This awareness of the user profile results in higher precision , more accurate medical knowledge , and better access to high-quality content .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , the suggestions of English-translated queries may also trigger new health search strategies .

label: Research method
text: First , approximate string matching methods were used to generate lists of index words most similar to contemporary query terms in a digitized newspaper collection from the 1800s .

label: Research method
text: Top index word variants were categorized to estimate the appropriate query expansion ranges in the retrieval test .

label: Research method
text: Second , the effectiveness of approximate string matching methods , automatically generated inflectional forms , and their combinations were measured in a Cranfield-style test .

label: Research method
text: Finally , a detailed topic-level analysis of test results was conducted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the index of historical newspaper collection the occurrences of a word typically spread to many linguistic and historical variants along with optical character recognition ( OCR ) errors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: All query expansion methods improved the baseline results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Extensive expansion of around 30 variants for each query word was required to achieve the highest performance improvement .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Query expansion based on approximate string matching was superior to using the inflectional forms of the query words , showing that coverage of the different types of variation is more important than precision in handling one type of variation .

label: Research questions
text: Measuring the Semantic Similarity ( SS ) with higher accuracy is a challenging task .

label: Research questions
text: In this context , the Information Content ( IC ) -based SS measure has gained popularity over the others .

label: Research questions
text: The notion of IC evolves from the science of information theory .

label: Research questions
text: Information theory has very high potential to characterize the semantics of concepts .

label: Research method
text: Designing an IC-based SS framework comprises ( i ) an IC calculator , and ( ii ) an SS calculator .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose a generic intrinsic IC-based SS calculator .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We also introduce here a new structural aspect of an ontology called DCS ( Disjoint Common Subsumers ) that plays a significant role in deciding the similarity between two concepts .

label: Research method
text: We evaluated our proposed similarity calculator with the existing intrinsic IC-based similarity calculators , as well as corpora-dependent similarity calculators using several benchmark data sets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results show that the proposed similarity calculator produces a high correlation with human evaluation over the existing state-of-the-art IC-based similarity calculators .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although the individual influences of these attributes on the structure and function of a network have been analyzed in detail , a more accurate picture emerges in proper perspective and context only when research methods are employed to integrate their collective impacts on the network .

label: Research method
text: In a major research project , we have undertaken this examination .

label: Research method
text: This paper presents an extract from this project , using a global network assessment of these characteristics .

label: Research method
text: We apply our methods to analyze the collaboration networks of a subset of researchers in India through their coauthored papers in peer-reviewed journals and conference proceedings in management science , including related areas of information technology and economics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find the Indian networks to be currently suffering from a high degree of fragmentation , which severely restricts researchers ' long-rage connectivities in the networks .

label: Research method
text: Comparisons are made with networks of a similar sample of researchers working in the United States .

label: Research method
text: By using information retrieval and metasearch methodologies , different types of referential metadata ( related Wikipedia pages , data sets , source code , video lectures , presentation slides , and online tutorials ) for an assortment of publications and scientific topics will be automatically retrieved , associated , and ranked ( via the language model and the inference network model ) to provide easily understandable cyberlearning resources to answer students ' questions .

label: Research method
text: We also designed an experimental system to automatically answer students ' questions for a specific academic publication and then evaluated the quality of the answers ( the recommended resources ) using mean reciprocal rank and normalized discounted cumulative gain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: After examining preliminary evaluation results and student feedback , we found that cyberlearning resources can provide high-quality and straightforward answers for students ' and scholars ' questions concerning the content of academic publications .

label: Research questions
text: When studying technology and innovation through patent analysis it is well known that similar amounts of technological knowledge can produce different numbers of patented innovation as output .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A new multilayered approach to measure the technological value of patents based on ego patent citation networks ( PCNs ) is developed in this study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that the structural indicators for the ego PCN developed in this contribution can characterize groups of patents and , hence , in an indirect way , the health of companies .

label: Research questions
text: Its accomplishments in this regard have made it a point of inquiry for researchers from different fields of knowledge .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A decade of research has thrown light on many aspects of the Wikipedia community , its processes , and its content .

label: Research questions
text: However , due to the variety of fields inquiring about Wikipedia and the limited synthesis of the extensive research , there is little consensus on many aspects of Wikipedia 's content as an encyclopedic collection of human knowledge .

label: Research method
text: This study addresses the issue by systematically reviewing 110 peer-reviewed publications on Wikipedia content , summarizing the current Research findings/conclusions , and highlighting the major research trends .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Two major streams of research are identified : the quality of Wikipedia content ( including comprehensiveness , currency , readability , and reliability ) and the size of Wikipedia .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , we present the key research trends in terms of the domains of inquiry , research design , data source , and data gathering methods .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This review synthesizes scholarly understanding of Wikipedia content and paves the way for future studies .

label: Research method
text: The paper reviews and extends existing sensemaking models with ideas from learning and cognition .

label: Research method
text: It reviews literature on sensemaking models in human-computer interaction ( HCI ) , cognitive system engineering , organizational communication , and library and information sciences ( LIS ) , learning theories , cognitive psychology , and task-based information seeking .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The model resulting from this synthesis moves to a stronger basis for explaining sensemaking behaviors and conceptual changes .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The model illustrates the iterative processes of sensemaking , extends existing models that focus on activities by integrating cognitive mechanisms and the creation of instantiated structure elements of knowledge , and different types of conceptual change to show a complete picture of the cognitive processes of sensemaking .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The processes and cognitive mechanisms identified provide better foundations for knowledge creation , organization , and sharing practices and a stronger basis for design of sensemaking assistant systems and tools .

label: Research questions
text: Traditionally , impact has been measured by citations ; yet these are problematic metrics for nontraditional outputs like sound recordings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Social media data provide a promising avenue of investigation for measuring scholarly as well as societal impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Twitter in particular has been shown to provide a high number of references for cultural and research outputs in all disciplines .

label: Research method
text: This study analyzes Twitter references pertaining to the collections of five digital sound archives : British Library Sounds , Europeana Sounds , the Internet Archive Audio Archive , PennSound , and UbuWeb .

label: Research method
text: By using text analysis methods to identify high-frequency events and trends , and labeling them with a rubric designed for measuring the impact of digital heritage resources , this study provides preliminary insights on user values as they relate to digital sound collections .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite the limitations of using social media data , the evidence gathered in this case study characterizes aspects of the use of digital sound collections , and may point to future priorities for the digital preservation of sound .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Besides reporting usual bibliographic indicators , we investigated the human cornerstone of any peer-reviewed journal : its editorial board .

label: Research method
text: Demographic data about the 2,846 gatekeepers serving in information systems ( IS ) editorial boards were collected .

label: Research method
text: We discuss various scientometric indicators supported by descriptive statistics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions reflect the great variety of IS journals in terms of research output , author communities , editorial boards , and gatekeeper demographics ( e.g. , diversity in gender and location ) , seniority , authority , and degree of involvement in editorial boards .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We believe that these results may help the general public and scholars ( e.g. , readers , authors , journal gatekeepers , policy makers ) to revise and increase their knowledge of scholarly communication in the IS field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The EB_IS_2009 dataset supporting this scientometric study is released as online supplementary material to this article to foster further research on editorial boards .

text: Hence , studying how this sentiment emerges is important .

label: Research questions
text: In years past , this was straightforward , often dictated by journalists who cover financial news , but this has become more complex now .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , we focus on how social media sentiment affects mass media sentiment .

label: Research method
text: Using data from Sina Weibo and Sina Finance ( around 60 million weibos and 6.2 million news articles ) , we show that social media does influence mass media sentiment emergence for financial news .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The sentiment consistency between social media reaction and prior news articles amplifies the persistence of mass media sentiment over time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By contrast , we found limited evidence of social media reducing the persistence of mass media sentiment over time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results have significant implications for understanding how 2 types of media , treated separately in the literature , may be connected .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By the example of ACM SIGMOD E.F. Codd Innovations Award winners and Priestley Medal recipients , we illustrate how the new rating can be represented by a single number and visualized .

text: This base map enables users to overlay downloads from Scopus interactively .

label: Research method
text: Using a single year ( e.g. , 2012 ) , results can be compared with mappings based on the Journal Citation Reports at the Web of Science ( N=10,936 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Scopus maps are more detailed at both the local and global levels because of their greater coverage , including , for example , the arts and humanities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The base maps can be interactively overlaid with journal distributions in sets downloaded from Scopus , for example , for the Research questions of portfolio analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Rao-Stirling diversity can be used as a measure of interdisciplinarity in the sets under study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Maps at the global and the local level , however , can be very different because of the different levels of aggregation involved .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Two journals , for example , can both belong to the humanities in the global map , but participate in different specialty structures locally .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The base map and interactive tools are available online ( with instructions ) at http : //www.leydesdorff.net/scopus_ovl .

label: Research method
text: We develop an integrative synthesis of different overlay mapping techniques and associated perspectives on technological emergence across geographical , social , and cognitive spaces .

label: Research method
text: To do so , we longitudinally analyze ( with publication and patent data ) three case studies of emerging technologies in the medical domain .

label: Research questions
text: These are RNA interference ( RNAi ) , human papillomavirus ( HPV ) testing technologies for cervical cancer , and thiopurine methyltransferase ( TPMT ) genetic testing .

label: Research questions
text: Given the flexibility ( i.e. , adaptability to different sources of data ) and granularity ( i.e. , applicability across multiple levels of data aggregation ) of overlay mapping techniques , we argue that these techniques can favor the integration and comparison of results from different contexts and cases , thus potentially functioning as a platform for distributed strategic intelligence for analysts and decision makers .

label: Research questions
text: It is shown that several factors contribute to the overall energy and environmental costs of information and communication technology ( ICT ) in general and digital information systems and services in particular .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is also shown that end-user energy costs play a key role in the overall environmental costs of a digital library or information service .

label: Research questions
text: It is argued that appropriate user research , transaction log analysis , user modeling , and better design and delivery of services can significantly reduce the user interaction time , and thus the environmental costs , of digital information systems and services , making them more sustainable .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using textual analyses we provide a classification of emotions within posts across three main themes of interaction emotions , response emotions , and preoccupation emotions and show that many requests for information by young first-time mothers are motivated by negative emotions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This has implications for how moderators of online news groups respond to online request for help and for understanding how to support vulnerable young parents .

label: Research questions
text: In order to engage with these emergent realities , understanding who people are in terms of their social identities , social power , and as epistemic agents-that is , knowers , speakers , listeners , and informants-may provide insight into human information interactions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These are matters of epistemic injustice .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing heavily from Miranda Fricker 's work Epistemic Injustice : Power & the Ethics of Knowing , I use the concept of epistemic injustice ( testimonial , systematic , and hermeneutical injustice ) to consider people as epistemic beings rather than users in order to potentially illuminate new understandings of the subfields of information behavior and information literacy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Focusing on people as knowers , speakers , listeners , and informants rather than users presents an opportunity for information researchers , practitioners , and LIS educators to work in service of the epistemic interests of people and in alignment with liberatory aims .

label: Research questions
text: In this research , we present the results of experiments designed to evaluate the performance of a real-time interest model ( RIM ) that attempts to identify the dynamic and changing query level interests regarding social media outputs .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Unlike most existing ranking methods , our ranking approach targets calculation of the probability that user interest in the content of the document is subject to very dynamic user interest change .

label: Research method
text: We describe 2 formulations of the model ( real-time interest vector space and real-time interest language model ) stemming from classical relevance ranking methods and develop a novel methodology for evaluating the performance of RIM using Amazon Mechanical Turk to collect ( interest-based ) relevance judgments on a daily basis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that the model usually , although not always , performs better than baseline results obtained from commercial web search engines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We identify factors that affect RIM performance and outline plans for future research .

label: Research method
text: Here we identify the 250 most heavily used journals in each of 26 research fields ( 4,721 journals , 19.4M articles ) indexed by the Scopus database , and test whether topic , academic status , and accessibility make articles from these journals more or less likely to be referenced on Wikipedia .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that a journal 's academic status ( impact factor ) and accessibility ( open access policy ) both strongly increase the probability of it being referenced on Wikipedia .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Controlling for field and impact factor , the odds that an open access journal is referenced on the English Wikipedia are 47 % higher compared to paywall journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions provide evidence is that a major consequence of open access policies is to significantly amplify the diffusion of science , through an intermediary like Wikipedia , to a broad audience .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Identifying the sentiment present in them can be helpful for measuring the frame of mind of the public , their satisfaction with respect to a product , or their support of a social event .

label: Research questions
text: In this context , polarity classification is a subfield of sentiment analysis focused on determining whether the content of a text is objective or subjective , and in the latter case , if it conveys a positive or a negative opinion .

label: Research questions
text: Most polarity detection techniques tend to take into account individual terms in the text and even some degree of linguistic knowledge , but they do not usually consider syntactic relations between words .

label: Research questions
text: This article explores how relating lexical , syntactic , and psychometric information can be helpful to perform polarity classification on Spanish tweets .

label: Research method
text: We provide an evaluation for both shallow and deep linguistic perspectives .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Empirical results show an improved performance of syntactic approaches over pure lexical models when using large training sets to create a classifier , but this tendency is reversed when small training collections are used .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In particular , literature on the emergence of collective intelligence in social tagging systems has increased .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose a probabilistic generative model to detect latent topical communities among users .

label: Research method
text: Social tags and resource contents are leveraged to model user interest in two similar and correlated ways .

label: Research questions
text: Our primary goal is to capture user tagging behavior and interest and discover the emergent topical community structure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The communities should be groups of users with frequent social interactions as well as similar topical interests , which would have important research implications for personalized information services .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results on two real social tagging data sets with different genres have shown that the proposed generative model more accurately models user interest and detects high-quality and meaningful topical communities .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although these criticisms have been noted , they have been largely brushed aside or ignored , not addressed head on .

label: Research questions
text: This may be for a number of reasons , but we believe the main one is that these criticisms undermine the desire to have an easy scientificthat is , quantitativemethod of evaluation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Consequently , we continue and update our criticism of the use of citations for evaluation .

label: Research questions
text: Such tags can act as navigational cues that enable users to discover meaningful and relevant information in a Web 2.0 environment .

label: Research questions
text: This is particularly critical for nonexperts for understanding formal academic or scientific resources , also known as hard content .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of this study was to develop a novel one-bit comparison ( OBC ) metric and to assess in what circumstances a set of tags describing a hard-content resource is mature and representative .

label: Research method
text: We compared OBC with the conventional Shannon entropy approach to determine performance when distinguishing tags generated by domain experts and nonexperts in the early and later stages under social influence .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicated that OBC can accurately distinguish mature tags generated by a strong expert consensus from other tags , and outperform Shannon entropy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions support tag-based learning , and provide insights and tools for the design of applications involving tags , such as tag recommendation and tag-based organization .

label: Research method
text: During the experiment , participants were asked to search Google to obtain information on the two given search tasks .

label: Research method
text: Participants ' primary emotions were inferred from analysis of their facial expressions , data on secondary emotions were obtained through participant interviews , and mood was measured using the Positive Affect Negative Affect Scale ( PANAS ; Watson , Clark , & Tellegen , 1988 ) prior , during , and after the search .

label: Research method
text: The search process was represented by the collection of search actions , search performance , and search outcome quality variables .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions suggest existence of direct relationships between primary emotions and search actions , which in turn imply the possibility of inferring emotions from search actions and vice versa .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The link between secondary emotions and searchers ' evaluative judgments , and lack of evidence of any relationships between secondary emotions and other search process variables , point to the strengths and weaknesses of self-reported emotion measures in understanding searchers ' affective experiences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our study did not find strong relationships between mood and search process and outcomes , indicating that while mood can have a limited effect on search activities , it is a relatively stable and long-lasting state that can not be easily altered by the search experience and , in turn , can not significantly affect the search .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The article proposes a model of relationships between emotions , mood , and several facets of the search process .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Directions for future work are also discussed .

label: Research method
text: The empirical data are taken from two online surveys of European authors .

label: Research method
text: Taking a domain analytic approach , the analysis draws on Becher and Trowler 's ( 2001 ) and Whitley 's ( 2000 ) theories to gain a deeper understanding of why OA repositories ( OAR ) play a particularly important role in the chosen disciplines .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The surveys provided a unique opportunity to compare perceptions , motivations , and behaviors of researchers at the discipline level with the parent metadiscipline .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It should be noted that participants were not drawn from a stratified sample of all the different subdisciplines that constitute each discipline , and therefore the generalizability of the Research findings/conclusions to the discipline may be limited .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The differential role of informal and formal communication in each of the three disciplines has shaped green OA practices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For physicists and economists , preprints are an essential feature of their respective OAR landscapes , whereas for clinical medics final published articles have a central role .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In comparing the disciplines with their parent metadisciplines there were some notable similarities/differences , which have methodological implications for studying research cultures .

label: Research method
text: A secondary analysis was carried out on three different data sets .

label: Research method
text: They were ( a ) country-level data on ISU from World Values Survey ( 2005-2009 ) ; ( b ) country-specific mean scores of Hofstede 's national culture dimensions ( HNCD ) of individualism ( IDV ) , power distance ( PDI ) , time orientation , uncertainty avoidance ( UAI ) , masculinity ( MAS ) , and indulgence ( IVR ) ; and ( c ) measures of wealth .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis showed the importance of three national culture dimensions of PDI ( the way people of a nation interact with authorities ) , IDV ( the degree of centrality of person or groups in a country ) , and IVR ( the agreeableness of joy and happiness in a country ) for explaining the cross-cultural differences of ISU .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions were explained through HNCD , and four cultural patterns of ISU were identified .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , further research is required to better understand the complex relationships of cultural factors , ISU , and other societal variables .

label: Research method
text: The groups and intergroup relations can be analyzed and visualized using tools from network analysis .

label: Research method
text: Using the so-called excellence indicator PPtop-10 % -the proportion of the top-10 % most-highly-cited papers assigned to a university-we pursue a classification using ( a ) overlapping stability intervals , ( b ) statistical-significance tests , and ( c ) effect sizes of differences among 902 universities in 54 countries ; we focus on the UK , Germany , Brazil , and the USA as national examples .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although the groupings remain largely the same using different statistical significance levels or overlapping stability intervals , these classifications are uncorrelated with those based on effect sizes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Effect sizes for the differences between universities are small ( w < .2 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The more detailed analysis of universities at the country level suggests that distinctions beyond three or perhaps four groups of universities ( high , middle , low ) may not be meaningful .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Given similar institutional incentives , isomorphism within each eco-system of universities should not be underestimated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results suggest that networks based on overlapping stability intervals can provide a first impression of the relevant groupings among universities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the clusters are not well-defined divisions between groups of universities .

label: Research method
text: Traditionally , the main methodologies employed for representing data are multidimensional scaling , principal component analysis , or correspondence analysis .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper we aim to present a visualization methodology known as biplot analysis for representing bibliometric and science and technology indicators .

label: Research method
text: A biplot is a graphical representation of multivariate data , where the elements of a data matrix are represented according to dots and vectors associated with the rows and columns of the matrix .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , we explore the possibilities of applying biplot analysis in the research policy area .

label: Research method
text: More specifically , we first describe and introduce the reader to this methodology and secondly , we analyze its strengths and weaknesses through 3 different case studies : countries , universities , and scientific fields .

label: Research method
text: For this , we use a biplot analysis known as JK-biplot .

label: Research method
text: Finally , we compare the biplot representation with other multivariate analysis techniques .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that biplot analysis could be a useful technique in scientometrics when studying multivariate data , as well as an easy-to-read tool for research decision makers .

label: Research method
text: In a two-phase survey , we investigate scholars ' familiarity and usage of traditional metrics and altmetrics .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , we present the second phase with 448 participants .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found few traditional metrics , like the Journal Impact Factor and number of citations , are familiar to and often used by scholars for research evaluation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among altmetrics , only views/downloads , readers , and followers are known to more than half the respondents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Unseen benefits and lack of time are hindrances to using metrics for the evaluation of research outputs .

label: Research questions
text: Although social media are well-known , scholars prefer promoting their research by publishing in journals and attending conferences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found social media usage , perceived ease of use and usefulness of altmetrics affect the usage of altmetrics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions suggest altmetrics have attracted attention in academia and could be considered complementary to traditional metrics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We acknowledge that due to the limited sample size , statistics and demographics in this study , Research findings/conclusions can not be said to be representative of the entire academic population worldwide .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Future studies are needed that cover a wider range of academic disciplines around the world .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the number of yearly citations depends upon time for multiple reasons : a ) general time trends in citation data , b ) changing coverage of databases , c ) individual citation life-cycles , and d ) selection on citation impact .

label: Research questions
text: Hence , it is often ill-advised to simply compare the average number of citations before and after an event to estimate its causal effect .

label: Research questions
text: Using a recent publication in this journal on the potential citation chain reaction of a Nobel Prize , we demonstrate that a simple pre-post comparison can lead to biased and misleading results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We propose using matched control groups to improve causal inference and illustrate that the inclusion of a tailor-made synthetic control group in the statistical analysis helps to avoid methodological artifacts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results suggest that there is neither a Nobel Prize effect as regards citation impact of the Nobel laureate under investigation nor a related chain reaction in the citation network , as suggested in the original study .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Finally , we explain that these methodological recommendations extend far beyond the study of Nobel Prize effects in citation data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , such techniques work only for objects with previously assigned tags .

label: Research questions
text: Here we focus on tag recommendation for objects with no tags , a variation of the well-known \textit { cold start } problem .

label: Research questions
text: We start by evaluating state-of-the-art co-occurrence based methods in cold start .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that the effectiveness of these methods suffers in this situation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , we show that employing various automatic filtering strategies to generate an initial tag set that enables the use of co-occurrence patterns produces only marginal improvements .

label: Research method
text: We then propose a new approach that exploits both positive and negative user feedback to iteratively select input tags along with a genetic programming strategy to learn the recommendation function .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our experimental results indicate that extending the methods to include user relevance feedback leads to gains in precision of up to 58 % over the best baseline in cold start scenarios and gains of up to 43 % over the best baseline in objects that contain some initial tags ( i.e. , no cold start ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also show that our best relevance-feedback-driven strategy performs well even in scenarios that lack user cooperation ( i.e. , users may refuse to provide feedback ) and user reliability ( i.e. , users may provide the wrong feedback ) .

label: Research method
text: In the similarity-oriented approach , an assessed article 's raw citation count is compared with a reference value that is derived from a reference set , which is constructed in such a way that articles in this set are estimated to address a subject matter similar to that of the assessed article .

label: Research method
text: This estimation is based on second-order similarity and utilizes a combination of 2 feature sets : bibliographic references and technical terminology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The contribution of an article in a given reference set to the reference value is dependent on its degree of similarity to the assessed article .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is shown that reference values calculated by the similarity-oriented approach are considerably better at predicting the assessed articles ' citation count compared to the reference values given by the journal-set approach , thus significantly reducing the variability in the observed citation distribution that stems from the variability in the articles ' addressed subject matter .

label: Research questions
text: They often influence , reflect , and reinforce gender stereotypes , including those that represent occupations .

label: Research questions
text: This study examines the prevalence of gender stereotypes on digital media platforms and considers how human efforts to create and curate messages directly may impact these stereotypes .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: While gender stereotyping in social media and algorithms has received some examination in the recent literature , its prevalence in different types of platforms ( for example , wiki vs. news vs. social network ) and under differing conditions ( for example , degrees of human- and machine-led content creation and curation ) has yet to be studied .

label: Research questions
text: This research explores the extent to which stereotypes of certain strongly gendered professions ( librarian , nurse , computer programmer , civil engineer ) persist and may vary across digital platforms ( Twitter , the New York Times online , Wikipedia , and Shutterstock ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that gender stereotypes are most likely to be challenged when human beings act directly to create and curate content in digital platforms , and that highly algorithmic approaches for curation showed little inclination towards breaking stereotypes .

label: Research questions
text: Implications for the more inclusive design and use of digital media platforms , particularly with regard to mediated occupational messaging , are discussed .

label: Research questions
text: The research sought to determine the differences in the perceived usefulness of CBIR technologies among image user groups from several domains and explicate the reasons given regarding the utility of CBIR systems for their professional tasks .

label: Research method
text: Twenty participants ( archaeologists , architects , art historians , and artists ) , individuals who rely on images of cultural materials in the performance of their work , took part in the study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions of the study reveal that interest in CBIR methods varied among the different professional user communities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Individuals who showed an interest in these systems were primarily those concerned with the formal characteristics ( i.e. , color , shape , composition , and texture ) of the images being sought .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In contrast , those participants who expressed a strong interest in images of known items , images illustrating themes , and/or items from specific locations believe concept-based searches to be the most direct route .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These image users did not see a practical application for CBIR systems in their current work routines .

label: Research questions
text: The objective of this study is to characterize the citation patterns in bioinformatics journals and their correspondent knowledge subfields .

label: Research method
text: Our study analyzed bibliometric data ( impact factor , cited-half-life , and references-per-article ) of bioinformatics journals and their related subfields collected from the Journal Citation Reports ( JCR ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions showed that bioinformatics journals ' citations are field-dependent , with scattered patterns in article life span and citing propensity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Bioinformatics journals originally derived from biology-related subfields have shorter article life spans , more citing on average , and higher impact factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Those journals , derived from mathematics and statistics , demonstrate converse citation patterns .

label: Research method
text: Journal impact factors were normalized , taking into account the impacts of article life spans and citing propensity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A comparison of these normalized factors to JCR journal impact factors showed rearrangements in the ranking orders of a number of individual journals , but a high overall correlation with JCR impact factors .

label: Research questions
text: Given the increasing popularity of social tagging and the limitations of controlled indexing ( primarily cost and scalability ) , it is reasonable to investigate to what degree social tagging could substitute for controlled indexing .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we compared CiteULike tags to Medical Subject Headings ( MeSH ) terms for 231,388 citations indexed in MEDLINE .

label: Research method
text: In addition to descriptive analyses of the data sets , we present a paper-by-paper analysis of tags and MeSH terms : the number of common annotations , Jaccard similarity , and coverage ratio .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the analysis , we apply three increasingly progressive levels of text processing , ranging from normalization to stemming , to reduce the impact of lexical differences .

label: Research method
text: Annotations of our corpus consisted of over 76,968 distinct tags and 21,129 distinct MeSH terms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The top 20 tags/MeSH terms showed little direct overlap .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: On a paper-by-paper basis , the number of common annotations ranged from 0.29 to 0.5 and the Jaccard similarity from 2.12 % to 3.3 % using increased levels of text processing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: At most , 77,834 citations ( 33.6 % ) shared at least one annotation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that CiteULike tags and MeSH terms are quite distinct lexically , reflecting different viewpoints/processes between social tagging and controlled indexing .

label: Research method
text: Our methodological approach supports focused thinking about how online groups differ from each other , and diverge from their face-to-face counterparts .

label: Research method
text: Group Informatics is grounded in 5 years of empirical studies of technologically mediated groups in online learning , software engineering , online political discourse , crisis informatics , and other domains .

label: Research method
text: We describe the Group Informatics model and the related , 2-phase methodological approach in detail .

label: Research method
text: Phase one of the methodological approach centers on a set of guiding research questions aimed at directing the application of Group Informatics to new corpora of integrated electronic trace data and qualitative research data .

label: Research method
text: Phase 2 of the methodological approach is a systematic set of steps for transforming electronic trace data into weighted social networks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although these models have already shown good performance , the word independency assumption seems to be unrealistic from a natural language point of view , which considers that terms are related to each other .

label: Research questions
text: Therefore , such an assumption leads to two well-known problems in information retrieval ( IR ) , namely , polysemy , or term mismatch , and synonymy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In language models , these issues have been addressed by considering dependencies such as bigrams , phrasal-concepts , or word relationships , but such models are estimated using simple n-grams or concept counting .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , we address polysemy and synonymy mismatch with a concept-based language modeling approach that combines ontological concepts from external resources with frequently found collocations from the document collection .

label: Research method
text: In addition , the concept-based model is enriched with subconcepts and semantic relationships through a semantic smoothing technique so as to perform semantic matching .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments carried out on TREC collections show that our model achieves significant improvements over a single word-based model and the Markov Random Field model ( using a Markov classifier ) .

label: Research questions
text: Science is increasingly becoming data-intensive , where large volumes of data are collected and analyzed to discover complex patterns through simulations and experiments , and most scientific reference works have been replaced by online curated data sets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Yet , given a data set , there is no quantitative , consistent , and established way of knowing how it has been used over time , who contributed to its curation , what results have been yielded , or what value it has .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The development of a theory and practice of data citation is fundamental for considering data as first-class research objects with the same relevance and centrality of traditional scientific products .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Many works in recent years have discussed data citation from different viewpoints : illustrating why data citation is needed , defining the principles and outlining recommendations for data citation systems , and providing computational methods for addressing specific issues of data citation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The current panorama is many-faceted and an overall view that brings together diverse aspects of this topic is still missing .

label: Research questions
text: Therefore , this paper aims to describe the lay of the land for data citation , both from the theoretical ( the why and what ) and the practical ( the how ) angle .

label: Research questions
text: Governments and decision makers at all levels are faced with the huge opportunities generated by the availability of new knowledge and information and , simultaneously , are pressed by tight budget constraints .

label: Research questions
text: University rankings , in particular , are attracting policy and media attention , but at the same time receive harsh methodological criticism .

label: Research findings/conclusions
