text: Currently , the practice of formal data citation-where data references are included alongside bibliographic references in the reference section of a publication-is uncommon .

label: Research method
text: We examine the prevalence of data citation , documenting data sharing and reuse , in a sample of full text articles from the biological/biomedical sciences , the fields with the most public data sets available documented by the Data Citation Index ( DCI ) .

label: Research method
text: We develop a method that combines automated text extraction with human assessment for revealing candidate occurrences of data sharing and reuse by using terms that are most likely to indicate their occurrence .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis reveals that informal data citation in the main text of articles is far more common than formal data citations in the references of articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As a result , data sharers do not receive documented credit for their data contributions in a similar way as authors do for their research articles because informal data citations are not recorded in sources such as the DCI .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Ongoing challenges for the study of data citation are also outlined .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study identifies types of social support in the QuitStop forum and brings insights to exchange patterns of social support and user behaviors with content analysis and social network analysis .

label: Research method
text: Motivated by user information behavior , this study defines two patterns to describe social support exchange : initiated support exchange and invited support exchange .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is found that users with a longer quitting time tend to actively give initiated support , and recent quitters with a shorter abstinent time are likely to seek and receive invited support .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study also finds that support givers of informational support quit longer ago than support givers of nurturant support , and support receivers of informational support quit more recently than support receivers of nurturant support .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Usually , informational support is offered by users at late quit stages to users at early quit stages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nurturant support is also exchanged among users within the same quit stage .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions help us understand how health consumers are supporting each other and reveal new capabilities of online intervention programs that can be designed to offer social support in a timely and effective manner .

label: Research questions
text: Cloud storage , personal network-attached storage ( NAS ) , and external hard drives are more affordable than ever before and one would think that backing up personal digital information is a straightforward process nowadays .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite this , small group studies and corporate surveys show the opposite .

label: Research method
text: In this paper we present the results from a quantitative and qualitative survey of 319 participants about how they back up their personal computers and restore personal information in case of computer failures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that the majority of users do manual , selective , and noncontinuous backups , rely on a set of planned and unplanned backups ( as a consequence of other activities ) , have inadequate knowledge about possible solutions and implications of using known solutions , and so on .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study also reveals that around a fifth of all computers are not backed up , and a quarter of most important files and a third of most important folders at the time of the survey could not be ( fully ) restored in the event of computer failure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the results , several implications for practice and research are presented .

label: Research questions
text: In reality , their world is part-paper/part-digital , in constant transition among successive forms of digital storage and communication devices .

label: Research questions
text: Studying for a degree is the daily work of these young people , and effective management of paper and digital academic materials and resources contributes crucially to their success in life .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Students must also constantly manage their work against deadlines to meet their course and university requirements .

label: Research questions
text: This study , following the Personal Information Management ( PIM ) paradigm , examines student academic information management under these various constraints and pressures .

label: Research method
text: A total of 41 18- to 22-year-old students were interviewed and observed regarding the content , structure , and uses of their immediate working environment within their dormitory rooms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Students exhibited remarkable creativity and variety in the mixture of automated and manual resources and devices used to support their academic work .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The demands of a yearlong procession of assignments , papers , projects , and examinations increase the importance of time management activities and influence much of their behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results provide insights on student use of various kinds of information technology and their overall planning and management of information associated with their studies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Access rate falls as an inverse power of time passed since publication .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The power law holds for periods of up to 1,000 days .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The exponents are different for different blogs and are distributed between 0.6 and 3.2 .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that the decay of attention to a web article is caused by the link to it first dropping down the list of links on the website 's front page and then disappearing from the front page and its subsequent movement further into background .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The other proposed explanations that use a decaying with time novelty factor , or some intricate theory of human dynamics , can not explain all of the experimental observations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: But a journal has multidimensional prestige only if it is a prestigious journal with respect to a number of dimensionse.g. , Institute for Scientific Information Impact Factor , immediacy index , eigenfactor score , and article influence score .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The multidimensional prestige of influential journals takes into account the fact that several prestige indicators should be used for a distinct analysis of the impact of scholarly journals in a subject category .

label: Research method
text: After having identified the multidimensionally influential journals , their prestige scores can be aggregated to produce a summary measure of multidimensional prestige for a subject category , which satisfies numerous properties .

label: Research method
text: Using this measure of multidimensional prestige to rank subject categories , we have found the top scientific subject categories of Web of Knowledge as of 2010 .

label: Research method
text: The activities of asking for and providing information in a forum were explored , and a set of messages extracted from a French forum targeting adolescents was analyzed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that the messages initiating the threads are often requests for information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Teenagers mainly ask for peers ' opinions on personal matters and specific verifiable information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The discussions following these requests take the form of an exchange of advice ( question/answer ) or a coconstruction of the final answer between the participants ( with assessments of participants ' responses , requests for explanations , etc . ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that discussion forums present different advantages for adolescents ' information-seeking activities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The first is that this social medium allows finding specialized information on topics specific to this age group .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The second is that the collaborative aspect of information seeking in a forum allows these adolescents to overcome difficulties commonly associated with the search process ( making a precise request , evaluating a result ) .

label: Research questions
text: However , both computing neurophysiologic responses and retrieving documents are characterized by uncertainty because of noisy signals and incomplete or inconsistent representations of the data .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We present the first-of-its-kind , fully integrated information retrieval system that makes use of online implicit relevance feedback generated from brain activity as measured through electroencephalography ( EEG ) , and eye movements .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions of the evaluation experiment ( N = 16 ) show that we are able to compute online neurophysiology-based relevance feedback with performance significantly better than chance in complex data domains and realistic search tasks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We contribute by demonstrating how to integrate in interactive intent modeling this inherently noisy implicit relevance feedback combined with scarce explicit feedback .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although experimental measures of task performance did not allow us to demonstrate how the classification outcomes translated into search task performance , the experiment proved that our approach is able to generate relevance feedback from brain signals and eye movements in a realistic scenario , thus providing promising implications for future work in neuroadaptive information retrieval ( IR ) .

label: Research questions
text: Technical developments in the area of search , such as Google 's Page Rank algorithm , have proved so good at serving relevant results that Internet search has become integrated into daily human activity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One can endlessly explore topics of interest simply by querying and reading through the resulting links .

label: Research questions
text: Yet , although search engines are well known for providing relevant results based on users ' queries , users do not always receive the results they are looking for .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Google 's Director of Research describes clickstream evidence of frustrated users repeatedly reformulating queries and searching through page after page of results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Given the general quality of search engine results , one must consider the possibility that the frustrated user 's query is not effective ; that is , it does not describe the essence of the user 's interest .

label: Research questions
text: Indeed , extensive research into human search behavior has found that humans are not very effective at formulating good search queries that describe what they are interested in .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Ideally , the user should simply point to a portion of text that sparked the user 's interest , and a system should automatically formulate a search query that captures the essence of the text .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , we describe an implemented system that provides this capability .

label: Research questions
text: We first describe how our work differs from existing work in automatic query formulation , and propose a new method for improved quantification of the relevance of candidate search terms drawn from input text using phrase-level analysis .

label: Research method
text: We then propose an implementable method designed to provide relevant queries based on a user 's text input .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We demonstrate the quality of our results and performance of our system through experimental studies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results demonstrate that our system produces relevant search terms with roughly two-thirds precision and recall compared to search terms selected by experts , and that typical users find significantly more relevant results ( 31 % more relevant ) more quickly ( 64 % faster ) using our system than self-formulated search queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further , we show that our implementation can scale to request loads of up to 10 requests per second within current online responsiveness expectations ( < 2-second response times at the highest loads tested ) .

label: Research questions
text: But what is a good weighting scheme ?

label: Research method
text: We compare 12 different in-text citation frequency-weighting schemes in the field of library and information science ( LIS ) and explore author citation impact patterns based on their performance in these schemes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that the ranks of authors vary widely with different weighting schemes that favor or are biased against common citation impact patternssubstantiated , applied , or noted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These variations separate LIS authors quite clearly into groups with these impact patterns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: With consensus rank limits , the hard upper and lower bounds for reasonable author ranks that they provide suggest that author citation ranks may be subject to something like an uncertainty principle .

label: Research questions
text: While humans find it easy to determine that a person named in one story is the same person referenced in a second story , machines rely heavily on crude heuristics such as string matching and stemming to make guesses as to whether nouns are coreferent .

label: Research questions
text: A key advantage that humans have over machines is the ability to mentally make connections between ideas and , based on these connections , reason how likely two entities are to be the same .

label: Research method
text: Mirroring this natural thought process , we have created a prototype framework for disambiguating entities that is based on connectedness .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this article , we demonstrate it in the practical application of disambiguating authors across a large set of bibliographic records .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By representing knowledge from the records as edges in a graph between a subject and an object , we believe that the problem of disambiguating entities reduces to the problem of discovering the most strongly connected nodes in a graph .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The knowledge from the records comes in many different forms , such as names of people , date of publication , and themes extracted from the text of the abstract .

label: Research method
text: These different types of knowledge are fused to create the graph required for disambiguation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , the resulting graph and framework can be used for more complex operations .

label: Research questions
text: Using a case study approach , the aim of this study is to investigate what types of sources and channels , with a special emphasis on social processes and structures of information , support collaborative information work , and the emergence of knowledge in a museum environment .

label: Research method
text: The empirical study was conducted using a combination of ethnographic observation of and interviews with staff members at a medium-sized museum in a Nordic country .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study shows that much of the daily information work is routinized and infrastructuralized in social information exchange and reproduction of documented information and museum collections .

label: Research questions
text: While data work presents new opportunities for discovery , value creation , and decision making , its emergence also raises significant ethical issues , including those of ownership , privacy , and trust .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article presents a review of data work , and how negotiating a trade-off between its value and risks requires locating its processes within the contexts of its conditions and consequences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These include international , national , and sectoral conditions of law , policy , and regulation at a macro level ; organizational conditions of information and data governance that aim to address the value and risks of data work at a meso level ; along with attention to the everyday contexts of data and information handling by data information and other professionals at a micro level .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In conclusion , a conceptual framework is presented that locates the processes of data work within the matrix of its macro meso and micro conditions , its consequences for individuals , organizations , and society , and the relations between them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Suggestions are given for how research into the study of data work-its value risks and governance- can be advanced by using this framework .

label: Research questions
text: IN refers to a complex concept : at the very initial state of the phenomenon ( that is , at a visceral level ) , even the searcher may not be aware of its existence .

label: Research questions
text: Thus , despite advances in the past few decades in both the IR and relevant scientific communities , we do not fully understand how an IN emerges and how it is physically manifested .

label: Research questions
text: In this article we aim to inform a holistic view of the realization of IN using functional magnetic resonance imaging .

label: Research method
text: We collected new data of brain activity of 24 participants while they formulated and stated a realization of IN in a Question Answering task , focusing on a distributed set of brain regions associated with activities related to IN , found in our previous study .

label: Research method
text: Results of a functional connectivity analysis led us to propose a neuropsychological model of the realization of IN .

label: Research method
text: Our model consists of three components : ( a ) a successful memory retrieval component , ( b ) an information flow regulation component , and ( c ) a high-level perception component .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We believe this study constitutes an important step in unraveling the nature of IN and how to better satisfy IN .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Unlike the majority of approaches in the literature , we use the raw Wikipedia text for knowledge acquisition .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main assumption made is that the concepts classified under the same node in a taxonomy are described in a comparable way in Wikipedia .

label: Research method
text: The annotation of the extracted knowledge is done at two levels : ontological and logical .

label: Research method
text: The extracted properties are evaluated in the traditional way , that is , by computing the precision of the extraction procedure and in a clustering task .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The second method of evaluation is seldom used in the natural language processing community , but it is regularly employed in cognitive psychology .

label: Research method
text: A total of 1,125 Sci-Tech policy-related papers ( 873 journal papers [ 78 % ] , 205 conference papers [ 18 % ] , and 47 review papers [ 4 % ] ) have been retrieved from the Web of Science database for quantitative analysis and mapping .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Different network and contour maps based on these 1,125 papers can be constructed by choosing different information as the main actor , such as the paper title , the institute , the country , or the author keywords , to reflect Sci-Tech policy research structures in micro- , meso- , and macro-levels , respectively .

label: Research method
text: The quantitative way of exploring Sci-Tech policy research papers is investigated to unveil important or emerging Sci-Tech policy implications as well as to demonstrate the dynamics and visualization of the evolution of Sci-Tech policy research .

label: Research method
text: To uncover the differences in English scientific writing between native English-speaking scholars ( NESs ) and NNESs , we collected a large-scale data set containing more than 150,000 full-text articles published in PLoS between 2006 and 2015 .

label: Research method
text: We divided these articles into three groups according to the ethnic backgrounds of the first and corresponding authors , obtained by Ethnea , and examined the scientific writing styles in English from a two-fold perspective of linguistic complexity : ( a ) syntactic complexity , including measurements of sentence length and sentence complexity ; and ( b ) lexical complexity , including measurements of lexical diversity , lexical density , and lexical sophistication .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The observations suggest marginal differences between groups in syntactical and lexical complexity .

label: Research questions
text: Inspired by successful practices in the areas of SERVQUAL , capability-based theories , and IT-related capability management , the efficient delivery of EGS should derive from the high capabilities of a government to provide such services .

label: Research questions
text: This article aims to develop a conceptual framework to assess and empirically examine EGSC using data from local governments in Mainland China .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The fitness test and the case study prove that the conceptual framework was suitable in analyzing China 's EGSC .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , the EGSC can be examined from 3 dimensions/layers : content service capability , service delivery capability , and on-demand capability .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of the structural analysis illustrate the practical management applications of EGSC , which can facilitate the improvement of EGS .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The successful transformation of patients from passive recipients to active participants is largely attributed to increased access to healthcare information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Online support groups present a platform to seek and exchange information in an inclusive environment .

label: Research questions
text: As the volume of text on online support groups continues to grow exponentially , it is imperative to improve the quality of retrieved information in terms of relevance , reliability , and usefulness .

label: Research method
text: We present a text-mining approach that generates a knowledge extraction layer to address this void in personalized information retrieval from online support groups .

label: Research method
text: The knowledge extraction layer encapsulates an ensemble of text-mining techniques with a domain ontology to interpose an investigable and extensible structure on hitherto unstructured text .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This structure is not limited to personalized information retrieval for patients , as it also imparts aggregates for crowdsourcing analytics by healthcare researchers .

label: Research method
text: The proposed approach was successfully trialed on an active online support group consisting of 800,000 posts by 72,066 participants .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Demonstrations for both patient and researcher use cases accentuate the value of the proposed approach to unlock a broad spectrum of personalized and aggregate knowledge concealed within crowdsourced content .

label: Research method
text: We studied the APCs charged and article volumes of journals that were listed in the Directory of Open Access Journals as charging APCs .

label: Research method
text: These included 1,370 journals that published 100,697 articles in 2010 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The average APC was $ 906 ? U.S .

label: Research method
text: dollars ( USD ) calculated over journals and $ 904 USD calculated over articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The price range varied between $ 8 and $ 3,900 USD , with the lowest prices charged by journals published in developing countries and the highest by journals with high-impact factors from major international publishers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Journals in biomedicine represent 59 % of the sample and 58 % of the total article volume .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: They also had the highest APCs of any discipline .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Professionally published journals , both for profit and nonprofit , had substantially higher APCs than journals published by societies , universities , or scholars/researchers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These price estimates are lower than some previous studies of OA publishing and much lower than is generally charged by subscription publishers making individual articles OA in what are termed hybrid journals .

label: Research questions
text: However , because it is jointly written by many contributors , it is subject to constant manipulation by contributors attempting to add biographies of non-notable people .

label: Research method
text: Over time , Wikipedia has developed inclusion criteria for notable people ( e.g. , receiving a significant award ) based on which newly contributed biographies are evaluated .

label: Research method
text: In this paper we present and analyze a set of simple indicators that can be used to predict which article will eventually be accepted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These indicators do not refer to the content itself , but to meta-content features ( such as the number of categories that the biography is associated with ) and to author-based features ( such as if it is a first-time author ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By training a classifier on these features , we successfully reached a high predictive performance ( area under the receiver operating characteristic [ ROC ] curve [ AUC ] of 0.97 ) even though we overlooked the actual biography text .

label: Research questions
text: However , the diffusion mechanisms underlying the citation process remain poorly understood , despite the frequent and longstanding use of citation counts for assessment Research questionss within the scientific community .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Here , we extend the study of citation dynamics to a more general diffusion process to understand how citation growth associates with different diffusion patterns .

label: Research method
text: Using a classic diffusion model , we quantify and illustrate specific diffusion mechanisms which have been proven to exert a significant impact on the growth and decay of citation counts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments reveal a positive relation between the low p and low q pattern and high scientific impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A sharp citation peak produced by rapid change of citation counts , however , has a negative effect on future impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , we have suggested a simple indicator , saturation level , to roughly estimate an individual article 's current stage in the life cycle and its potential to attract future attention .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proposed approach can also be extended to higher levels of aggregation ( e.g. , individual scientists , journals , institutions ) , providing further insights into the practice of scientific evaluation .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a pilot study to understand the ecosystem in which research software participates , and to identify significant characteristics that have high potential to support future scholarly practices .

label: Research method
text: A set of topical curation dimensions were derived from the extant literature and applied to select cases of institutionally significant research software .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This approach yields our main contribution , a curation model and decision framework for preserving research software as a scholarly object .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of our study highlight the unique characteristics and challenges at play in building curation services in academic research libraries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This is consequential for communities of researchers , educators , and practitioners concerned with studying , supporting , and educating information professionals .

label: Research questions
text: In the face of new developments in artificial intelligence ( AI ) , the research community faces 3 questions : ( a ) How is AI becoming part of the world of work ?

label: Research questions
text: ( b ) How is the world of work becoming part of AI ?

label: Research questions
text: and ( c ) How can the information community help address this topic of Work in the Age of Intelligent Machines ( WAIM ) ?

label: Research method
text: This opinion piece considers these 3 questions by drawing on discussion from an engaging 2019 iConference workshop organized by the NSF supported WAIM research coordination network ( note : ) .

label: Research questions
text: The US National Security Agency ( NSA ) intelligence documents revealed by Edward Snowden in June of 2013 brought the term metadata into the public consciousness .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Surprisingly little discussion in the information sciences has since occurred on the nature and importance of metadata within networked communication systems .

label: Research questions
text: The collection of digital metadata impacts the ways that people experience social and technical communication .

label: Research questions
text: Without such metadata , networked communication can not exist .

label: Research questions
text: The NSA leaks , and numerous recent hacks of corporate and government communications , point to metadata as objects of new scholarly inquiry .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: If we are to engage in meaningful discussions about our digital traces , or make informed decisions about new policies and technologies , it is essential to develop theoretical and empirical frameworks that account for digital metadata .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This opinion paper presents 5 key sociotechnical characteristics of metadata within digital networks that would benefit from stronger engagement by the information sciences .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Considering how scientific collaboration is actually initiated , this study focuses on the organization and sector levels of international coauthorship networks , going beyond a country-level description .

label: Research questions
text: Based on a network analysis of coauthorship networks between members of the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development ( OECD ) , this study attempts to gain a better understanding of international scientific collaboration by exploring the structure of the coauthorship network in terms of university-industry-government ( UIG ) relationships , the mode of knowledge production , and the underlying dynamic of collaboration in terms of geographic , linguistic , and economic factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that the United States showed overwhelming dominance in all bilateral UIG combinations with the exception of the government-government ( GG ) network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Scientific collaboration within the industry sector was concentrated in a few players , whereas that between the university and industry sectors was relatively less concentrated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite the growing participation from other sectors , universities were still the main locus of knowledge production , with the exception of 5 countries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The university sector in English-speaking wealthy countries and the government sector of non-English-speaking , less-wealthy countries played a key role in international collaborations between OECD countries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions did not provide evidence supporting the institutional proximity argument .

label: Research questions
text: We explore whether the peaks in the spectrograms generated by Reference Publication Years Spectroscopy ( RPYS ) indicate such long-term impact by comparing across RPYS for subsequent time intervals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Multi-RPYS enables us to distinguish between short-term citation peaks at the research front that decay within 10 years versus historically constitutive ( long-term ) citations that function as concept symbols .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using these constitutive citations , one is able to cluster document sets ( e.g. , journals ) in terms of intellectually shared histories .

label: Research method
text: We test this premise by clustering 40 journals in the Web of Science Category of Information and Library Science using multi-RPYS .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It follows that RPYS can not only be used for retrieving roots of sets under study ( cited ) , but also for algorithmic historiography of the citing sets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Significant references are historically rooted symbols among other citations that function as currency .

label: Research method
text: We present a map of Finnish science based on unsupervised-learning classification , and discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this approach vis-a-vis those generated by human reasoning .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that from theoretical and practical perspectives there exist several challenges for human reasoning-based classification frameworks of scientific knowledge , as they typically try to fit new-to-the-world knowledge into historical models of scientific knowledge , and can not easily be deployed for new large-scale data sets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Automated classification schemes , in contrast , generate classification models only from the available text corpus , thereby identifying credibly novel bodies of knowledge .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: They also lend themselves to versatile large-scale data analysis , and enable a range of Big Data possibilities .

label: Research questions
text: However , we also argue that it is neither possible nor fruitful to declare one or another method a superior approach in terms of realism to classify scientific knowledge , and we believe that the merits of each approach are dependent on the practical objectives of analysis .

label: Research questions
text: This article explores the conceptual frameworks , methods , and data sources used in bibliometrics to study the nature of the humanities , and its differences and similarities in comparison with other scientific domains .

label: Research method
text: We give a historical overview of bibliometric scholarship between 1965 and 2018 that studies the humanities empirically and distinguishes between two periods in which the configuration of the bibliometric system differs remarkably .

label: Research method
text: The first period , 1965 to the 1980s , is characterized by bibliometric methods embedded in a sociological theoretical framework , the development and use of the Price Index , and small samples of journal publications from which references are used as data sources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The second period , the 1980s to the present day , is characterized by a new intellectual hinterland-that of science policy and research evaluation-in which bibliometric methods become embedded .

label: Research method
text: Here metadata of publications becomes the primary data source with which publication profiles of humanistic scholarly communities are analyzed .

label: Research questions
text: We unpack the differences between these two periods and critically discuss the analytical avenues that different approaches offer .

label: Research questions
text: We believe that in this astonishing historical moment of new directions and new opportunities both the existing paradigms and conceptual models in the field of information can benefit from re-examination to stay current with the times .

label: Research method
text: We propose a framework articulating key narratives associated with the why , what , how , and who dimensions to discuss paradigm shift ( s ) .

label: Research questions
text: The Research questions of this opinion paper is to initiate dialogues on ground-breaking ideas and innovative solutions as well as support research that addresses contemporary challenges in the field of information .

label: Research method
text: PPA is compared with the Thomson-Reuters Institute for Scientific Information ( TR ) 5-year and 2-year impact factors and with expert opinion .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The ranking produced by the method under study is only partially correlated with citation-based measures ( TR ) , but exhibits close agreement with expert survey rankings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A simple average of TR and power rankings results in a new ranking that is highly correlated with the expert survey rankings .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This evidence suggests that power ranking can contribute to evaluating artificial intelligence journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Hence , papers now can be read and cited based on their own merits , independently of the journal 's physical availability , reputation , or impact factor ( IF ) .

label: Research method
text: We compare the strength of the relationship between journals ' IFs and the actual citations received by their respective papers from 1902 to 2009 .

label: Research questions
text: Throughout most of the 20th century , papers ' citation rates were increasingly linked to their respective journals ' IFs .

label: Research questions
text: However , since 1990 , the advent of the digital age , the relation between IFs and paper citations has been weakening .

label: Research questions
text: This began first in physics , a field that was quick to make the transition into the electronic domain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , since 1990 the overall proportion of highly cited papers coming from highly cited journals has been decreasing and , of these highly cited papers , the proportion not coming from highly cited journals has been increasing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Should this pattern continue , it might bring an end to the use of the IF as a way to evaluate the quality of journals , papers , and researchers .

label: Research questions
text: Citations are relevant as potential evidence in appointment and promotion decisions , but it is unclear whether there have been historical gender differences in average citation impact that might explain the current shortfall of senior female academics .

label: Research method
text: This study investigates the evolution of gender differences in citation impact 1996-2018 for six million articles from seven large English-speaking nations : Australia , Canada , Ireland , Jamaica , New Zealand , UK , and the USA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that a small female citation advantage has been the norm over time for all these countries except the USA , where there has been no practical difference .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The female citation advantage is largest , and statistically significant in most years , for Australia and the UK .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This suggests that any academic bias against citing female-authored research can not explain current employment inequalities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , comparisons using recent citation data , or avoiding it altogether , during appointments or promotion may disadvantage females in some countries by underestimating the likely greater impact of their work , especially in the long term .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Browsing by category is rarely supported .

label: Research questions
text: Although helpful machine-learning methods have been applied successfully to similar situations for English news articles , limited research has been completed to yield suitable solutions for Arabic news .

label: Research method
text: In connection with a Qatar National Research Fund ( QNRF ) -funded project to build digital library community and infrastructure in Qatar , we developed software for browsing a collection of about 237,000 Arabic news articles , which should be applicable to other Arabic news collections .

label: Research method
text: We designed a simple taxonomy for Arabic news stories that is suitable for the needs of Qatar and other nations , is compatible with the subject codes of the International Press Telecommunications Council , and was enhanced with the aid of a librarian expert as well as five Arabic-speaking volunteers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We developed tailored stemming ( i.e. , a new Arabic light stemmer called P-Stemmer ) and automatic classification methods ( the best being binary Support Vector Machines classifiers ) to work with the taxonomy .

label: Research method
text: Using evaluation techniques commonly used in the information retrieval community , including 10-fold cross-validation and the Wilcoxon signed-rank test , we showed that our approach to stemming and classification is superior to state-of-the-art techniques .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , it is not clear whether this citation advantage is the result of higher quality research or due to other factors , such as a larger audience for the publications .

label: Research questions
text: To test whether the apparent advantage of internationally collaborative research may be due to additional interest in articles from the countries of the authors , this article assesses the extent to which the national affiliations of the authors of articles affect the national affiliations of their Mendeley readers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on English-language Web of Science articles in 10 fields from science , medicine , social science , and the humanities , the results of statistical models comparing author and reader affiliations suggest that , in most fields , Mendeley users are disproportionately readers of articles authored from within their own country .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , there are several cases in which Mendeley users from certain countries tend to ignore articles from specific other countries , although it is not clear whether this reflects national biases or different national specialisms within a field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In conclusion , research funders should not incentivize international collaboration on the basis that it is , in general , higher quality because its higher impact may be primarily due to its larger audience .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , authors should guard against national biases in their reading to select only the best and most relevant publications to inform their research .

label: Research questions
text: Images are increasingly ubiquitous in daily communication due to advances in visually enabled information and communication technologies ( ICT ) , such as information visualization applications , image retrieval systems , and virtual collaborative work tools .

label: Research questions
text: Although images are often used in social contexts , information science research concerned with the visual representation of information typically focuses on the image artifact and system building .

label: Research method
text: To learn more about image making as a form of social interaction and as a form of information practice , a qualitative study examined face-to-face conversations involving the creation of ad hoc visualizations ( i.e. , napkin drawings ) .

label: Research method
text: Interactional sociolinguistic concepts of conversational involvement and coordination guided multimodal analysis of video-recorded interactions that included spontaneous drawing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions show patterns in communicative activities associated with the visual representation of information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , the activity of mark making contributes to the maintenance of conversational involvement in ways that are not always evident in the drawn artifact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This research has implications for the design and evaluation of visually enabled virtual collaboration environments , visual information extraction and retrieval systems , and data visualization tools .

label: Research questions
text: One of these repositories , Wikipedia , is facing an important problem : assessing the quality of Wikipedia .

label: Research method
text: Existing approaches exploit techniques such as statistical models or machine leaning algorithms to assess Wikipedia article quality .

label: Research questions
text: However , existing models do not provide satisfactory results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , these models fail to adopt a comprehensive feature framework .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we conduct an extensive survey of previous studies and summarize a comprehensive feature framework , including text statistics , writing style , readability , article structure , network , and editing history .

label: Research method
text: Selected state-of-the-art deep-learning models , including the convolutional neural network ( CNN ) , deep neural network ( DNN ) , long short-term memory ( LSTMs ) network , CNN-LSTMs , bidirectional LSTMs , and stacked LSTMs , are applied to assess the quality of Wikipedia .

label: Research method
text: A detailed comparison of deep-learning models is conducted with regard to different aspects : classification performance and training performance .

label: Research method
text: We include an importance analysis of different features and feature sets to determine which features or feature sets are most effective in distinguishing Wikipedia article quality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This extensive experiment validates the effectiveness of the proposed model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One topic discussed vehemently online that could benefit from this type of analysis is vaccines .

label: Research method
text: We carried out a study analyzing the web presence of both sides of this debate .

label: Research method
text: We collected a variety of webometric data and analyzed the data both quantitatively and qualitatively .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study found far more anti- than pro-vaccine web domains .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The anti and pro sides had similar web visibility as measured by the number of links coming from general websites and Tweets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the links to the pro domains were of higher quality measured by PageRank scores .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The result from the qualitative content analysis confirmed this finding .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis of site ages revealed that the battle between the two sides had a long history and is still ongoing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The web scene was polarized with either pro or anti views and little neutral ground .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study suggests ways that professional information can be promoted more effectively on the web .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study demonstrates that webometrics analysis is effective in studying online information dissemination .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This kind of analysis can be used to study not only health information but other information as well .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , practitioners and researchers alike need a better understanding of what outcome they can reasonably expect of the reconciliation process between their local metadata and established controlled vocabularies which are already a part of the Linked Data cloud .

label: Research method
text: This paper offers an in-depth analysis of how a locally developed vocabulary can be successfully reconciled with the Library of Congress Subject Headings ( LCSH ) and the Arts and Architecture Thesaurus ( AAT ) through the help of a general-Research questions tool for interactive data transformation ( OpenRefine ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Issues negatively affecting the reconciliation process are identified and solutions are proposed in order to derive maximum value from existing metadata and controlled vocabularies in an automated manner .

label: Research questions
text: Predicting a user 's knowledge level from implicit evidence such as search behaviors could allow an adaptive information retrieval system to better personalize its interaction with users .

label: Research method
text: This study examines whether user domain knowledge can be predicted from search behaviors by applying a regression modeling analysis method .

label: Research method
text: We identify behavioral features that contribute most to a successful prediction model .

label: Research method
text: A user experiment was conducted with 40 participants searching on task topics in the domain of genomics .

label: Research method
text: Participant domain knowledge level was assessed based on the users ' familiarity with and expertise in the search topics and their knowledge of MeSH ( Medical Subject Headings ) terms in the categories that corresponded to the search topics .

label: Research method
text: Users ' search behaviors were captured by logging software , which includes querying behaviors , document selection behaviors , and general task interaction behaviors .

label: Research method
text: Multiple regression analysis was run on the behavioral data using different variable selection methods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Four successful predictive models were identified , each involving a slightly different set of behavioral variables .

label: Research method
text: The models were compared for the best on model fit , significance of the model , and contributions of individual predictors in each model .

label: Research method
text: Each model was validated using the split sampling method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The final model highlights three behavioral variables as domain knowledge level predictors : the number of documents saved , the average query length , and the average ranking position of the documents opened .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results are discussed , study limitations are addressed , and future research directions are suggested .

label: Research questions
text: The literature is unclear , however , about the relationship between the size of crowds and its impact on outcomes .

label: Research method
text: To better understand the effects of crowd size we conducted a study on the retention and performance based on 4,317 articles in the WikiProject Film community .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results suggest that crowds benefit from their size when they are diverse , experienced , and have low retention rates .

label: Research method
text: Our hypothesis was that DSQ are distinct and complementary dimensions , in opposition to the overlapping of DSQ proposed in the SERVQUAL and LibQUAL+ ( R ) models .

label: Research questions
text: In addition , the influence of PSQ on user loyalty ( UL ) was investigated .

label: Research method
text: Using structural equation modeling , we analyzed the survey data of 1,028 users of a network of academic libraries and report 2 main Research findings/conclusions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , it was shown that the 10 DSQ are statistically significant for the evaluation of PSQ .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Second , we demonstrated the positive effect of PSQ for UL .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The model presented may be used as a diagnostic and benchmarking tool for managers , coordinators , and librarians who seek to evaluate and/or assess the quality of the services offered by their libraries , as well as to identify and/or manage the loyalty level of their users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The number of retractions each year has also increased tremendously , especially in the biomedical field , and scientific misconduct accounts for more than half of those retractions .

label: Research questions
text: It is assumed that co-authors of retracted papers are affected by their colleagues ' misconduct , and the aim of this study is to provide empirical evidence of the effect of retractions in biomedical research on co-authors ' research careers .

label: Research method
text: Using data from the Web of Science , we measured the productivity , impact , and collaboration of 1,123 co-authors of 293 retracted articles for a period of 5 years before and after the retraction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found clear evidence that collaborators do suffer consequences of their colleagues ' misconduct and that a retraction for fraud has higher consequences than a retraction for error .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results also suggest that the extent of these consequences is closely linked with the ranking of co-authors on the retracted paper , being felt most strongly by first authors , followed by the last authors , with the impact is less important for middle authors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By using a worldwide survey among demographers in developed and developing countries , the authors show that the large majority perceive the publication pressure as high , but more so in Anglo-Saxon countries and to a lesser extent in Western Europe .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , scholars see both the pros ( upward mobility ) and cons ( excessive publication and uncitedness , neglect of policy issues , etc . )

label: Research questions
text: of the so-called publish-or-perish culture .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By measuring behavior in terms of reading and publishing , and perceived extrinsic rewards and stated intrinsic rewards of practicing science , it turns out that publication pressure negatively affects the orientation of demographers towards policy and knowledge sharing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There are no signs that the pressure affects reading and publishing outside the core discipline .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Prior work has used such embeddings to identify shifts in the meaning of individual words .

label: Research questions
text: However , simply knowing that a word has changed in meaning is insufficient to identify the instances of word usage that convey the historical meaning or the newer meaning .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this study , we link diachronic word embeddings to documents , by situating those documents as leaders or laggards with respect to ongoing semantic changes .

label: Research questions
text: Specifically , we propose a novel method to quantify the degree of semantic progressiveness in each word usage , and then show how these usages can be aggregated to obtain scores for each document .

label: Research method
text: We analyze two large collections of documents , representing legal opinions and scientific articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Documents that are scored as semantically progressive receive a larger number of citations , indicating that they are especially influential .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our work thus provides a new technique for identifying lexical semantic leaders and demonstrates a new link between progressive use of language and influence in a citation network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This framework provides a method to describe precisely aspects of privacy and context and a flexible vocabulary and notation for such descriptions and comparisons .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Moreover , it links philosophical and conceptual work on privacy to social science and policy work and accommodates different conceptions of the nature and value of privacy .

label: Research questions
text: The article begins with an outline of the framework .

label: Research method
text: It then refines the view by describing a hypothetical application .

label: Research method
text: Finally , it applies the framework to a real-world privacy issue-campaign finance disclosure laws in the United States and France .

label: Research questions
text: The article concludes with an argument that the framework offers important advantages to privacy scholarship and for privacy policy makers .

label: Research method
text: Using the methods described in this article , we provide Eigenfactor rankings for 84,808 disambiguated authors of 240,804 papers in the Social Science Research Network ( SSRN ) a preprint and postprint archive devoted to the rapid dissemination of scholarly research in the social sciences and humanities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As an additive metric , the Eigenfactor scores are readily computed for collectives such as departments or institutions as well .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that a collective 's Eigenfactor score can be computed either by summing the Eigenfactor scores of its members or by working directly with a collective-level cross-citation matrix .

label: Research method
text: We provide Eigenfactor rankings for institutions and countries in the SSRN repository .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: With a network-wide comparison of Eigenfactor scores and download tallies , we demonstrate that Eigenfactor scores provide information that is both different from and complementary to that provided by download counts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We see author-level ranking as one filter for navigating the scholarly literature , and note that such rankings generate incentives for more open scholarship , because authors are rewarded for making their work available to the community as early as possible and before formal publication .

label: Research method
text: We explore the directions and the evolution of evaluation research for the period 2001-2011 by studying the evaluation initiatives presented at 2 main conferences of the digital library domain , namely the Association for Computing Machinery and the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers ( ACM/IEEE ) Joint Conference on Digital Libraries ( JCDL ) , and the European Conference on Digital Libraries ( ECDL ; since 2011 renamed to the International Conference on Theory and Practice of Digital Libraries [ TPDL ] ) .

label: Research method
text: The literature is annotated using a domain ontology , named DiLEO , which defines explicitly the main concepts of the digital library evaluation domain and their correlations .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The ontology instances constitute a semantic network that enables the uniform and formal representation of the critical evaluation constructs in both conferences , untangles their associations , and supports the study of their evolution .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We discuss interesting patterns in the evaluation practices as well as in the research foci of the 2 venues , and outline current research trends and areas for further research .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we study the generation of query-biased summaries as a sentence ranking approach , and methods to evaluate their effectiveness .

label: Research method
text: Using sentence-level relevance assessments from the TREC Novelty track , we gauge the benefits of query expansion to minimize the vocabulary mismatch problem between informational requests and sentence ranking methods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results from an intrinsic evaluation show that query expansion significantly improves the selection of short relevant sentences ( 5-13 words ) between 7 % and 11 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , query expansion does not lead to improvements for sentences of medium ( 14-20 words ) and long ( 21-29 words ) lengths .

label: Research method
text: In a separate crowdsourcing study , we analyze whether a summary composed of sentences ranked using query expansion was preferred over summaries not assisted by query expansion , rather than assessing sentences individually .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that participants chose summaries aided by query expansion around 60 % of the time over summaries using an unexpanded query .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that query expansion techniques can benefit the selection of sentences for the construction of query-biased summaries at the summary level rather than at the sentence ranking level .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This brief communication examines the basis for such beliefs and finds it wanting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Indeed , in this study of over 9,000 OA journals included in the Directory of Open Access Journals , only 28 % charged authors for publishing in their journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This figure , however , was highest in various disciplines in medicine ( 47 % ) and the sciences ( 43 % ) and lowest in the humanities ( 4 % ) and the arts ( 0 % ) .

label: Research method
text: Research questions included what content is communicated between the child and the tablet computer and how engaged are children in the interaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that mathematics applications developers have focused on creating applications for the practice of a priori knowledge , rather than on creating instructional applications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show preliminary evidence that child-tablet communication is generally successful , but this success comes at the cost of richer , multimodal interactions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Tablet computer application developers are being cautious in offering a variety of options for children to interact with the devices , and we suggest that there is scope for a broadening of communicative interaction modes .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study integrates attitude and identity theory within a cross-sectional survey design .

label: Research method
text: The sample consists of about 1,600 researchers in Norway , and the data were collected via e-mail invitation using a digital surveying tool and analyzed using structural equation modeling techniques .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We determined that perceived impact-quality increases the intention to publish non-OA , while decreasing the intention to publish OA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Content quality is only associated with non-OA journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Perceived visibility increases the intention to publish OA , while the opposite effect is found for non-OA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Career-self salience has the strongest effect on impact-quality , while content quality is most important when work-self is salient .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research contributes to a deeper understanding about how perceived quality influences intention to publish in OA and non-OA journals , and how self-identity salience affects different facets of perceived quality in valence and strength .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions have implications for policy development , implementation , and assessment and may contribute to improving OA adoption .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Given its radical departure from previous encyclopedias , it is not surprising that it is controversial .

label: Research questions
text: Wikipedia is freely editable , leading to debates over accuracy and writing style .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It has also included topics , especially in the area of popular culture , which some believe are not appropriate for a serious , comprehensive encyclopedia .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , I do not examine these arguments , but , rather , a different problem confronting Wikipedia .

label: Research method
text: Through a case study of Cambodian history articles , I demonstrate how Wikipedia limits itself through a largely unconscious appropriation of the dominant discourse of representation surrounding its objects of inquiry .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When article quality is examined , a distinct pattern emerges that can readily be matched to the dominant historiographical tradition of Cambodian history .

label: Research questions
text: As well as presenting this case study as a demonstration of the influence of dominant discursive narratives , I wish to contextualize this privileging of particular discourses within debates about the New World Information and Communication Order ( NWICO ) that emerged in the 1970s .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: I argue that the NWICO can be useful in our thinking about the relationship of information professionals to Wikipedia today .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Interestingly , in the business domain , the text mining and machine learning community has minimally explored company annual reports with their mandatory disclosures .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we explore the question How can annual reports be used to predict change in company performance from one year to the next ?

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: from a text mining perspective .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our article contributes a systematic study of the potential of company mandatory disclosures using a computational viewpoint in the following aspects : ( a ) We characterize our research problem along distinct dimensions to gain a reasonably comprehensive understanding of the capacity of supervised learning methods in predicting change in company performance using annual reports , and ( b ) our Research findings/conclusions from unbiased systematic experiments provide further evidence about the economic incentives faced by analysts in their stock recommendations and speculations on analysts having access to more information in producing earnings forecast .

label: Research method
text: We present a study , involving interviews ( n= 43 ) and ethnographic observation , of how two libraries partnered with the Sloan Digital Sky Survey ( SDSS ) to curate a significant astronomy dataset .

label: Research method
text: Each library took different decisions : one library assigned activities to a unit specializing in digital curation , while the other distributed activities across its existing units .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Neither approach proved a silver bullet .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While library staff members felt the outcomes largely met their expectations , SDSS leaders expressed mixed opinions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We identify three factors that contributed to these differences in perspective : differing strategic motivations for undertaking this Data Transfer Process , SDSS leaders ' misperceptions about libraries , and organizational mismatches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These factors contributed to four differences in perspective between SDSS leaders and library staff : provenance as technical information or as information about social context , dataset as a live research object or as a static object to be preserved , systems and services tailored to the dataset or easily adaptable to other datasets , and obstacles as setbacks or as opportunities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Only those differences that emerged when SDSS collaboration members and library staff communicated frequently were resolved .

label: Research method
text: The data analysis in the study was divided into 3 phases : analysis of indexing consistency , analysis of tagging effectiveness , and analysis of the semantic values of tags .

label: Research method
text: To analyze indexing consistency , this study employed the vector space model-based indexing consistency measures .

label: Research method
text: An analysis of tagging effectiveness with tagging exhaustivity and tag specificity was conducted to ameliorate the drawbacks of consistency analysis based on only the quantitative measures of vocabulary matching .

label: Research method
text: To further investigate the semantic values of tags at various levels of specificity , a latent semantic analysis ( LSA ) was conducted .

label: Research method
text: To test statistical significance for the relation between tag specificity and semantic quality , correlation analysis was conducted .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research demonstrates the potential of tags for web document indexing with a complete assessment of tagging quality and provides a basis for further study of the strengths and limitations of tagging .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results , based on statistical analyses of a population-based survey ( N ? = ? 616 ) conducted in Finland , indicate that health information behavior is influenced by an individual 's stage of change in the context of physical activity and exercise .

label: Research questions
text: In pre-action stages ( precontemplation , contemplation , preparation ) where individuals do not exercise regularly and are uninformed or lack motivation , commitment , or skills to change behaviors , information is most often encountered through the passive practice of nondirected monitoring .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the action stage , where individuals have recently changed their exercise behaviors , information is obtained most frequently by active seeking .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the maintenance stage , where individuals maintain earlier adopted behaviors , information is habitually obtained through active scanning .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These results support the TTM in its postulation that individuals may benefit from stage-tailored health-communication strategies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The limitations of this study include self-reported behaviors , cross-sectional study design , and a possibly biased sample .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further research is needed to explore the role of information behavior in the process of behavior change in greater detail .

label: Research method
text: I apply standard information retrieval techniques to build a list of the most frequent terms in each set of definitions .

label: Research method
text: I then apply information extraction techniques to analyze how the top terms are used in the definitions .

label: Research method
text: As a result , I draw data-driven conclusions about the aggregate opinion of the experts .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: I contrast this with the original analysis of the data to provide readers with an alternative viewpoint on what the data tell us .

label: Research questions
text: The teams use information and computing technologies ( ICTs ) to communicate between team members , who originate from different cultures using different languages .

label: Research questions
text: This paper investigates the usability and utility of a range of ICTs used for communication between team members from different cultures .

label: Research method
text: The research used an intercultural heuristic evaluation tool , or I-CHET , to evaluate nine ICTs used by Australian and Lao scientists for team communication .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The evaluation showed that asynchronous ICTs ( e.g. , e-mail ) were preferred by non-native English speakers , while synchronous media ( e.g. , audio conferencing , instant messaging , Skype ) presented considerable problems between team members from different cultures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most ICTs evaluated in the study demonstrated little consideration for non-native English speakers and for inexperienced ICTs users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , all evaluated ICTs demonstrated the ability to transmit information and encourage communication between information users in scientific collaborations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The I-CHET assessment tool highlights the ongoing need for a tool-box of communication ICTs for research collaborations that can be adapted to suit the cultural and professional needs of multinational teams , worldwide .

label: Research questions
text: However , current methods in role analysis have overlooked content generated by users ( e.g. , posts ) in social media and hence focus more on user behavior analysis .

label: Research questions
text: The user-generated content is very important for characterizing users .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this paper , we propose a novel method which integrates both user behavior and posted content by users to identify roles in online social networks .

label: Research method
text: The proposed method models a role as a joint distribution of Gaussian distribution and multinomial distribution , which represent user behavioral feature and content feature respectively .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proposed method can be used to determine the number of roles concerned automatically .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results show that the proposed method can be used to identify various roles more effectively and to get more insights on such characteristics .

label: Research questions
text: The article begins with an overview of Rawls 's work , paying particular attention to its foundations and methods .

label: Research method
text: Subsequently , a 2-phase discussion of the literature is presented .

label: Research method
text: The first phase reviews engagements with Rawls from more than 150 scholarly articles from databases and journals dedicated to information and technology ethics , information/technology studies , philosophy of technology , and technology and human values .

label: Research method
text: The second phase focuses on scholars who have demonstrated a significant commitment to Rawlsian theory in these areas .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , the review demonstrates that most significant applications of Rawls are oriented toward unequal distributions of informational goods exacerbated by advanced information and communication technologies ( ICTs ) .

label: Research questions
text: Critically , however , scholars in this area have overlooked the relevance of Rawls 's foundations for the sorts of complex networked relationships afforded by those same advanced ICTs .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Rather than representing a fatal gap , it opens up a new avenue for the renewed consideration of Rawlshis ideas on the basic structure of society and the importance of self-respect are offered as 2 possible paths forward .

label: Research questions
text: Done under the banner of learning analytics , this work can-and often does-surface sensitive data and information about , inter alia , a student 's demographics , academic performance , offline and online movements , physical fitness , mental wellbeing , and social network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: With these data , institutions and third parties are able to describe student life , predict future behaviors , and intervene to address academic or other barriers to student success ( however defined ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Learning analytics , consequently , raise serious issues concerning student privacy , autonomy , and the appropriate flow of student data .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that issues around privacy lead to valid questions about the degree to which students should trust their institution to use learning analytics data and other artifacts ( algorithms , predictive scores ) with their interests in mind .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that higher education institutions are paradigms of information fiduciaries .

label: Research questions
text: As such , colleges and universities have a special responsibility to their students .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we use the information fiduciary concept to analyze cases when learning analytics violate an institution 's responsibility to its students .

label: Research method
text: Our approach is to set up a traditional model in which the true quality or impact of a university department is determined by a panel of experts , but a citation metric is regarded as a reasonable proxy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the model assumes that the information contained in the scores provided by an expert panel exceeds that contained in a citation metric ( HEFCE , 2015 ) .

label: Research method
text: Finally , we extend this model by including altmetric data to see if it adds information about a department 's performance that can not be gleaned from citations alone .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find the presence of altmetric data for the cited underpinning research to be highly correlated with peer review scores for societal impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
