text: Conversely , no such connection was seen with the assessment of research quality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions therefore suggest altmetric data could be useful as an aid to assessing impact .

label: Research questions
text: With the explosive growth of web documents , sentiment analysis is becoming a hot topic in both academic research and system design .

label: Research method
text: Fine-grained sentiment analysis is traditionally solved as a 2-step strategy , which results in cascade errors .

label: Research questions
text: Although joint models , such as joint sentiment/topic and maximum entropy ( MaxEnt ) /latent Dirichlet allocation , are proposed to tackle this problem of sentiment analysis , they focus on the joint learning of both aspects and sentiments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , they are not appropriate to solve the cascade errors for sentiment analysis at the sentence or subsentence level .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this article , we present a novel jointly fine-grained sentiment analysis framework at the subsentence level with Markov logic .

label: Research method
text: First , we divide the task into 2 separate stages ( subjectivity classification and polarity classification ) .

label: Research method
text: Then , the 2 separate stages are processed , respectively , with different feature sets , which are implemented by local formulas in Markov logic .

label: Research method
text: Finally , global formulas in Markov logic are adopted to realize the interactions of the 2 separate stages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The joint inference of subjectivity and polarity helps prevent cascade errors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments on a Chinese sentiment data set manifest that our joint model brings significant improvements .

label: Research questions
text: However , it is not always easy to find the desired information and in clinical routine the time to fulfil an information need is often very limited .

label: Research questions
text: Information retrieval systems are a useful tool to provide access to these documents/images in the biomedical literature related to information needs of medical professionals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Shangri-La is a medical retrieval system that can potentially help clinicians to make decisions on difficult cases .

label: Research method
text: It retrieves articles from the biomedical literature when querying a case description and attached images .

label: Research method
text: The system is based on a multimodal retrieval approach with a focus on the integration of visual information connected to text .

label: Research method
text: The approach includes a query-adaptive multimodal fusion criterion that analyses if visual features are suitable to be fused with text for the retrieval .

label: Research method
text: Furthermore , image modality information is integrated in the retrieval step .

label: Research method
text: The approach is evaluated using the ImageCLEFmed 2013 medical retrieval benchmark and can thus be compared to other approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that the final approach outperforms the best multimodal approach submitted to ImageCLEFmed 2013 .

label: Research questions
text: Although the evidence that shelf browsing is an important part of information behavior is increasing , information browsing as a behavior is somewhat of a black box ( in contrast to web browsing , which is relatively well understood ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It seems likely from early work that browsing is not , in fact , a monolithic behavior , but rather a set of behaviors and goals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The typologies presented in these works , however , are of a too high level to offer much insight into what support is needed for successful online browsing .

label: Research questions
text: In contrast , a recent spate of speculative browsing technologies meet some browsing needs , but offer little theoretical understanding of how systems support browsing .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The major contribution of this article is a new typology of library browsing behavior based on recent observations of browsing behavior in libraries .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The secondary contribution is an understanding of the interface features that would support these types of information browsers in an online environment .

label: Research method
text: Half a million units of data at firm level in 2011 were obtained from the Orbis database of Bureau Van Dijk .

label: Research method
text: The firm level data were aggregated at the levels of 8 Federal Districts , the regional level of 83 Federal Subjects , and the single level of the Russian Federation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Not surprisingly , the knowledge base of the economy is concentrated in the Moscow region ( 22.8 % ) and Saint Petersburg ( 4.0 % ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Except in Moscow itself , high-tech manufacturing does not add synergy to any other unit at any of the various levels of geographical granularity ; instead it disturbs regional coordination .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Knowledge-intensive services ( KIS ; including laboratories ) contribute to the synergy in all Federal Districts ( except the North-Caucasian Federal District ) , but only in 30 of the 83 Federal Subjects .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The synergy in KIS is concentrated in centers of administration .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The knowledge-intensive services ( which are often state affiliated ) provide backbone to an emerging knowledge-based economy at the level of Federal Districts , but the economy is otherwise not knowledge based ( except for the Moscow region ) .

label: Research questions
text: Nevertheless , despite evidence of gender influences within the site for some topics , the extent to which YouTube reflects or promotes male/female or other gender divides is unknown .

label: Research method
text: This article analyses 10,211 YouTube videos published in 12 months from 2014 to 2015 using commenter-portrayed genders ( inferred from usernames ) and view counts from the end of 2019 .

label: Research method
text: Nonbinary genders are omitted for methodological reasons .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although there were highly male and female topics or themes ( e.g. , vehicles or beauty ) and male or female gendering is the norm , videos with topics attracting both males and females tended to have more viewers ( after approximately 5 years ) than videos in male or female gendered topics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Similarly , within each topic , videos with gender balanced sets of commenters tend to attract more viewers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , YouTube does not seem to be driving male-female gender differences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is , however , limited , as it assumes all citations are of similar value and weights each equally .

label: Research questions

text: This approach enables relevance or pseudo-relevance feedback to be incorporated within the language modeling framework of IR .

label: Research method
text: In the traditional RM , the feedback information is used to improve the estimate of the query language model .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we introduce an extension of RM in the setting of relevance feedback .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our method provides an additional way to incorporate feedback via the improvement of the document language models .

label: Research method
text: Specifically , we make use of the context information of known relevant and nonrelevant documents to obtain weighted counts of query terms for estimating the document language models .

label: Research method
text: The context information is based on the words ( unigrams or bigrams ) appearing within a text window centered on query terms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments on several Text REtrieval Conference ( TREC ) collections show that our context-dependent relevance model can improve retrieval performance over the baseline RM .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations

label: Research questions
text: However , the large volumes and variety of expressions on social media have challenged traditional policy analysis and public sentiment assessment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this article , we describe a framework for social-media-based public policy informatics and a system called iMood that addresses the needs for sentiment and network analyses of U.S. immigration and border security .

label: Research method
text: iMood collects related messages on Twitter , extracts user sentiment and emotion , and constructs networks of the Twitter users , helping policy makers to identify opinion leaders , influential users , and community activists .

label: Research method
text: We evaluated the sentiment , emotion , and network characteristics found in 909,035 tweets posted by over 300,000 users during three phases between May and November 2013 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Statistical analyses reveal significant differences in emotion and sentiment among the 3 phases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Twitter networks of the 3 phases also had significantly different relationship counts , network densities , and total influence scores from those of other phases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This research should contribute to developing a new framework and a new system for social-media-based public policy informatics , providing new empirical Research findings/conclusions and data sets of sentiment and network analyses of U.S. immigration and border security , and demonstrating a general applicability to different domains .

label: Research questions
text: Although many researchers have attempted to explain why and how people use this new medium , previous studies have produced relatively inconclusive results .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: For instance , in most of these studies , microblogging has been considered a social networking activity ; however , quantitative analyses of microblogging usage have shown that people use microblogging as an information-broadcasting platform .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we identified the factors that drive microblogging and which of them lead to user satisfaction .

label: Research method
text: We developed a theoretical framework and then empirically validated the factors and the emergent mechanisms ( value evaluation processes ) .

label: Research method
text: We empirically tested our research model using a sample of 230 microbloggers , and the results showed that content and technology gratifications are the two key factors that drive user satisfaction with microblogging .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: That is , it is the value of information dissemination rather than social networking that makes people feel satisfied with the use of microblogging .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We believe that this study will generate interest among researchers in social media .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results also provide platform administrators with insights into how people use microblogging and why they are satisfied with the technology .

label: Research questions
text: Yet the literature has not adequately considered the disparate social processes by which texts are produced .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing on communication theory , we identify three common processes by which documents might be detectably similar in their textual featuresauthors sharing subject matter , sharing goals , and sharing sources .

label: Research questions
text: We hypothesize that these processes produce distinct , detectable relationships between authors in different kinds of textual overlap .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We develop a novel n-gram extraction technique to capture such signatures based on n-grams of different lengths .

label: Research method
text: We test the hypothesis on a corpus where the author attributes are observable : the public statements of the members of the U.S. Congress .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article presents the first empirical finding that shows different social relationships are detectable through the structure of overlapping textual features .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our study has important implications for designing text modeling techniques to make sense of social phenomena from aggregate digital traces .

label: Research method
text: This article specifically examines the project 's gathered data on creative writing faculty from North American institutions who were surveyed and interviewed about online poetry publishing as both creators and consumers of the literary works .

label: Research questions
text: This study also explores creative writing faculty members ' opinions about publishing in online literary publications in regard to career impact , including tenure and promotion .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: As online literary publishing disrupts what continues to be a very print-oriented practice , Rogers ' diffusion of innovations provides a useful framework for exploring these issues .

label: Research method
text: Because this project considers how innovations diffuse throughout a specific group of artists and scholars , and the information needs that emerge from these transformations , the concept of communities of practice also informed data analysis .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To understand the influence of online reviews , this study extends prior research on information adoption by incorporating the perspective of herd behavior .

label: Research method
text: We develop and empirically test a research model using data collected from an existing book review site .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We report 2 major Research findings/conclusions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , argument quality and source credibility predict information usefulness , which affects the adoption of online reviews .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Second , we determine that the adoption of online reviews is also influenced by 2 herd factors , namely , discounting own information and imitating others .

label: Research questions
text: We further identify the key determinants of these herd factors , including background homophily and attitude homophily .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The theoretical and practical implications are discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Two approaches for making use of this evidence include fusing search results from an anchor text representation and the original text representation based on a document 's relevance score or rank position , and combining term frequency from both representations during the retrieval process .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although these approaches have each been tested and compared against baselines , different evaluations have used different baselines ; no consistent work enables rigorous cross-comparison between these methods .

label: Research questions
text: The Research questions of this work is threefold .

label: Research method
text: First , we survey existing fusion methods of using anchor text in search .

label: Research questions
text: Second , we compare these methods with common testbeds and web search tasks , with the aim of identifying the most effective fusion method .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Third , we try to correlate search performance with the characteristics of a test collection .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our experimental results show that the best performing method in each category can significantly improve search results over a common baseline .

label: Research questions
text: However , there is no single technique that consistently outperforms competing approaches across different collections and search tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We identify 4 criteria that are relevant for evaluating the quality of knowledge worker support : context relevance , document relevance , prediction of user action , and diversity of the suggestions .

label: Research method
text: We compare 3 different context-aware recommendation methods for information re-finding in a writing support task .

label: Research method
text: The first method uses contextual prefiltering and content-based recommendation ( CBR ) , the second uses the just-intime information retrieval paradigm ( JITIR ) , and the third is a novel network-based recommendation system where context is part of the recommendation model ( CIA ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that each method has its own strengths : CBR is strong at context relevance , JITIR captures document relevance well , and CIA achieves the best result at predicting user action .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Weaknesses include that CBR depends on a manual source to determine the context and in JITIR the context query can fail when the textual content is not sufficient .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that to truly support a knowledge worker , all 4 evaluation criteria are important .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In light of that conclusion , we argue that the network-based approach the CIA offers has the highest robustness and flexibility for context-aware information recommendation .

label: Research method
text: To assess the difference between the two approaches , 1,040 articles with a variant of the phrase evolutionarily stable strategies ( ESS ) were identified by searching the Web of Science ( Thomson Reuters , Philadelphia , PA ) and discipline-level databases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The majority ( 72 % ) of all articles were published in life sciences journals .

label: Research method
text: The ESS concept is associated with a small set of canonical publications by John Maynard Smith ; OBI represents a decoupling of the use of the phrase and a citation to a John Maynard Smith publication .

label: Research method
text: Across all articles at the record level , OBI is measured by the number of articles with the phrase in the database record but which lack a reference to a source article ( implicit citations ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: At the citation-in-context level , articles that coupled a non-Maynard Smith citation with the ESS phrase ( indirect citations ) were counted along with those that cited relevant Maynard Smith publications ( explicit citations ) and OBI counted only based on those articles that lacked any citation coupled with the ESS text phrase .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The degree of OBI observed depended on the level of analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Record-level OBI trended upward , peaking in 2002 ( 62 % ) , with a secondary drop and rebound to 53 % ( 2008 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Citation-in-context OBI percentages were lower with no clear pattern .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Several issues relating to the design of empirical OBI studies are discussed .

label: Research method
text: This new measure is parsimonious as it looks for the smallest set of citing authors ( citers ) who have read a certain paper .

label: Research questions
text: The Parsimonious Citer-Based Measure aims to address potential distortion in the values of existing citer-based measures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These distortions occur because of various factors , such as the practice of hyperauthorship .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This new measure is empirically compared with existing measures , such as the number of citers and the number of citations in the field of artificial intelligence ( AI ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that the new measure is highly correlated with those two measures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the new measure is more robust against citation manipulations and better differentiates between prominent and nonprominent AI researchers than the above-mentioned measures .

label: Research method
text: It applied multiple methods , including eye tracking and stimulated recall interviews , to investigate important aspects of faceted search interface use , specifically : ( a ) searcher gaze behavior-what components of the interface searchers look at ; ( b ) how gaze behavior differs when training is and is not provided ; ( c ) how gaze behavior changes as searchers become familiar with the interface ; and ( d ) how gaze behavior differs depending on the stage of the search process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results confirm previous Research findings/conclusions that facets account for approximately 10-30 % of interface use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: They show that providing a 60-second video demonstration increased searcher use of facets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , searcher use of the facets did not evolve during the study session , which suggests that searchers may not , on their own , rapidly apply the faceted interfaces .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions also suggest that searcher use of interface elements varied by the stage of their search during the session , with higher use of facets during decision-making stages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions will be of interest to librarians and interface designers who wish to maximize the value of faceted searching for patrons , as well as to researchers who study search behavior .

label: Research method
text: A case study was designed focusing on 762 financed articles with a project of FIS-2012 of the Instituto de Salud Carlos III , the Spanish national health service 's main management body for health research .

label: Research method
text: Its finance is therefore subject to the Spanish Government OA mandate .

label: Research method
text: A search was carried out for full-text OA copies of the 762 articles using the four tools being evaluated and with identification of the repository housing these items .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Of the 762 articles concerned , 510 OA copies were found of 353 unique articles ( 46.3 % ) in 68 repositories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: OA copies were found of 81.9 % of the articles in PubMed Central and copies of 49.5 % of the articles in an institutional repository ( IR ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: BASE and GS identified 93.5 % of the articles and OpenAIRE 86.7 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Recolecta identified just 62.2 % of the articles deposited in a Spanish IR .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: BASE achieved the greatest success , by locating copies deposited in IR , while GS found those deposited in disciplinary repositories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: None of the tools identified copies of all the articles , so they need to be used in a complementary way when evaluating OA policies .

label: Research method
text: The present work analyzes the degree of collaboration among scientists from different disciplines to identify the most frequent combinations of knowledge in research activity .

label: Research method
text: The methodology adopts an innovative bibliometric approach based on the disciplinary affiliation of publication coauthors .

label: Research method
text: The field of observation includes all publications ( 167,179 ) indexed in the Science Citation Index Expanded for the years 2004-2008 , authored by all scientists in the hard sciences ( 43,223 ) at Italian universities ( 68 ) .

label: Research method
text: The analysis examines 205 research fields grouped in 9 disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Identifying the fields with the highest potential of interdisciplinary collaboration is useful to inform research polices at the national and regional levels , as well as management strategies at the institutional level .

label: Research questions
text: Perceptions of and reactions to trolling behaviors varies significantly from one community to another , as trolling behaviors are contextual and vary across platforms and communities .

label: Research questions
text: Through an examination of seven trolling scenarios , this article intends to answer the following questions : how do trolling behaviors differ across contexts ; how do perceptions of trolling differ from case to case ; and what aspects of context of trolling are perceived to be important by the public ?

label: Research method
text: Based on focus groups and interview data , we discuss the ways in which community norms and demographics , technological features of platforms , and community boundaries are perceived to impact trolling behaviors .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Two major contributions of the study include a codebook to support future analysis of trolling and formal concept analysis surrounding contextual perceptions of trolling .

label: Research questions
text: However , we still do not understand how knowledge-sharing intention ( KSI ) is formed across poster and lurker groups .

label: Research questions
text: Accordingly , this study seeks to provide a fuller understanding of the formation of behavioral intention in PVCs by decomposing the psychological formation of KSI and focusing on factors deemed likely to influence the KSI of posters and lurkers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study 's online survey of 177 posters and 246 lurkers from 3 PVCs demonstrated that enjoyment in helping others positively influenced posters ' attitudes toward knowledge sharing , whereas reciprocity and technology adoption variables ( perceived ease of use and compatibility ) positively influenced lurkers ' attitudes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Interpersonal trust and peer influence strongly affected the subjective norm of knowledge sharing in both groups , with posters emphasizing interpersonal trust and lurkers emphasizing peer influence .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , knowledge self-efficacy and resource availability enhanced the perceived behavioral control of knowledge sharing in both groups , with knowledge self-efficacy affecting posters the most and resource availability influencing lurkers the most .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of this study have important implications for both research and practice .

label: Research questions
text: Although there exists an ample amount of research into understanding exploration , most of the major information retrieval ( IR ) systems do not provide tailored and adaptive support for such tasks .

label: Research questions
text: One reason is the lack of empirical knowledge on how to distinguish exploratory and lookup search behaviors in IR systems .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of this article is to investigate how to separate the 2 types of tasks in an IR system using easily measurable behaviors .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we first review characteristics of exploratory search behavior .

label: Research method
text: We then report on a controlled study of 6 search tasks with 3 exploratory-comparison , knowledge acquisition , planning-and 3 lookup tasks-fact-finding , navigational , question answering .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results are encouraging , showing that IR systems can distinguish the 2 search categories in the course of a search session .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The most distinctive indicators that characterize exploratory search behaviors are query length , maximum scroll depth , and task completion time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , 2 tasks are borderline and exhibit mixed characteristics .

label: Research method
text: We assess the applicability of this finding by reporting on several classification experiments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results have valuable implications for designing tailored and adaptive IR systems .

label: Research method
text: From approximately 15 million queries , we identified 124,422 that were part of 60,759 user sessions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We present a method for categorizing queries based on related terms and show differences in search patterns between religious searches and web searching more generally .

label: Research method
text: We also investigate the search patterns found in queries related to 5 religions : Christianity , Hinduism , Islam , Buddhism , and Judaism .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Different search patterns are found to emerge .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Results from this study complement existing studies of religious information searching and provide a level of detailed analysis not reported to date .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show , for example , that sessions involving religion-related queries tend to last longer , that the lengths of religion-related queries are greater , and that the number of unique URLs clicked is higher when compared to all queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of the study can serve to provide information on what this large population of users is actually searching for .

label: Research questions
text: Although some software vendors and experimental researchers claim the tools can replace manual subject indexing , hard scientific evidence of their performance in operating information environments is scarce .

label: Research questions
text: A major reason for this is that research is usually conducted in laboratory conditions , excluding the complexities of real-life systems and situations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The article reviews and discusses issues with existing evaluation approaches such as problems of aboutness and relevance assessments , implying the need to use more than a single gold standard method when evaluating indexing and retrieval , and proposes a comprehensive evaluation framework .

label: Research method
text: The framework is informed by a systematic review of the literature on evaluation approaches : evaluating indexing quality directly through assessment by an evaluator or through comparison with a gold standard , evaluating the quality of computer-assisted indexing directly in the context of an indexing workflow , and evaluating indexing quality indirectly through analyzing retrieval performance .

label: Research questions
text: Communities may evolve over time , because of changes in users ' interests , activities , and new users joining the network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To better understand user interactions in CQA communities , it is necessary to analyze the community structures and track community evolution over time .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Existing work in CQA focuses on question searching or content quality detection , and the important problems of community extraction and evolutionary pattern detection have not been studied .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose a probabilistic community model ( PCM ) to extract overlapping community structures and capture their evolution patterns in CQA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The empirical results show that our algorithm appears to improve the community extraction quality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show empirically , using the iPhone data set , that interesting community evolution patterns can be discovered , with each evolution pattern reflecting the variation of users ' interests over time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis suggests that individual users could benefit to gain comprehensive information from tracking the transition of products .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also show that the communities provide a decision-making basis for business .

label: Research questions
text: The sensitive nature of much of this information creates a serious privacy threat when documents are uncontrollably made available to untrusted third parties .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In such cases , appropriate data protection measures should be undertaken by the responsible organization , especially under the umbrella of current legislation on data privacy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To do so , human experts are usually requested to redact or sanitize document contents .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To relieve this burdensome task , this paper presents a privacy model for document redaction/sanitization , which offers several advantages over other models available in the literature .

label: Research method
text: Based on the well-established foundations of data semantics and information theory , our model provides a framework to develop and implement automated and inherently semantic redaction/sanitization tools .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Moreover , contrary to ad-hoc redaction methods , our proposal provides a priori privacy guarantees which can be intuitively defined according to current legislations on data privacy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Empirical tests performed within the context of several use cases illustrate the applicability of our model and its ability to mimic the reasoning of human sanitizers .

label: Research questions
text: Biomedical journals are a rich source of information for such multimodal content indexing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For multipanel figures in these journals , it is critical to develop automatic figure panel splitting and label recognition algorithms to associate individual panels with text metadata in the figure caption and the body of the article .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Challenges in this task include large variations in figure panel layout , label location , size , contrast to background , and so on .

label: Research method
text: In this work , we propose a deep convolutional neural network , which splits the panels and recognizes the panel labels in a single step .

label: Research method
text: Visual features are extracted from several layers at various depths of the backbone neural network and organized to form a feature pyramid .

label: Research method
text: These features are fed into classification and regression networks to generate candidates of panels and their labels .

label: Research method
text: These candidates are merged to create the final panel segmentation result through a beam search algorithm .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We evaluated the proposed algorithm on the ImageCLEF data set and achieved better performance than the results reported in the literature .

label: Research method
text: In order to thoroughly investigate the proposed algorithm , we also collected and annotated our own data set of 10,642 figures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experiments , trained on 9,642 figures and evaluated on the remaining 1,000 figures , show that combining panel splitting and panel label recognition mutually benefit each other .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The fusion of information is currently done at query-processing time , which has a direct effect on the response time of search systems .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous research also shows that an alternative to improve search efficiency in textual databases is to precompute term impacts at indexing time .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this article , we propose a novel alternative to precompute term impacts , providing a generic framework for combining any distinct set of sources of evidence by using a machine-learning technique .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This method retains the advantages of producing high-quality results , but avoids the costs of combining evidence at query-processing time .

label: Research method
text: Our method , called Learn to Precompute Evidence Fusion ( LePrEF ) , uses genetic programming to compute a unified precomputed impact value for each term found in each document prior to query processing , at indexing time .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Compared with previous research on precomputing term impacts , our method offers the advantage of providing a generic framework to precompute impact using any set of relevance evidence at any text collection , whereas previous research articles do not .

label: Research method
text: The precomputed impact values are indexed and used later for computing document ranking at query-processing time .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By doing so , our method effectively reduces the query processing to simple additions of such impacts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that this approach , while leading to results comparable to state-of-the-art ranking methods , also can lead to a significant decrease in computational costs during query processing .

label: Research questions
text: However , collaboration may be difficult to achieve because of 2 major barriers : geographic distance and social divides .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is predicted that the advancement of information communication technologies ( ICTs ) will bring a puzzled conclusion for collaboration in the scientific community : the Global Village trend with significantly increased physical distance among collaborated scientists and the Virtual Balkans trend with significantly increased social stratification among collaborated scientists .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of this study reveal that the scientific community evolves towards the Global Village generally on both the geographic and social dimension , but with variations in term of collaboration patterns .

label: Research questions
text: The influence of such collaboration patterns on research performance ( that is , productivity and impact ) , however , is asymmetric to each side of collaborators .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When researchers from top-tier and general-tier institutions collaborate , researchers from top-tier institutions face a decrease in research productivity and impact , whereas researchers from general-tier institutions increase in research productivity and impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , the development of ICTs plays an important role in shaping the evolving trends and moderating effects of collaboration patterns .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our Research findings/conclusions provide a comprehensive understanding of scientific collaboration in the geographic , social , and technological aspect .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To interpret the results , one needs a dynamic theory of word meaning .

label: Research questions
text: We suggest that conceptual dynamics as the interaction between kinds of intellectual and emotional content and language is key for such a theory .

label: Research method
text: We demonstrate our method by two-way seriation , which is a popular technique to analyze groups of similar instances and their features as well as the connections between the groups themselves .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The two-way seriated data may be visualized as a two-dimensional heat map or as a three-dimensional landscape in which color codes or height correspond to the values in the matrix .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we focus on two-way seriation of sparse data in the Reuters-21568 test collection .

label: Research method
text: To achieve a meaningful visualization , we introduce a compactly supported convolution kernel similar to filter kernels used in image reconstruction and geostatistics .

label: Research method
text: This filter populates the high-dimensional sparse space with values that interpolate nearby elements and provides insight into the clustering structure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also extend two-way seriation to deal with online updates of both the row and column spaces and , combined with the convolution kernel , demonstrate a three-dimensional visualization of dynamics .

label: Research questions
text: In addition to longstanding players , regional powers and peripheral countries have sought for ways of acquiring and/or developing them .

label: Research questions
text: The authors postulate that to express the capabilities , relative positions , and interrelations of the countries involved in the production of nuclear weaponization knowledge , dynamic network analysis provides valuable insight .

label: Research method
text: In this article , the authors use a computational framework that combines techniques from dynamic network analysis and text mining to mine and analyze large-scale networks that are extracted from open theoretical and experimental nuclear research publications of the last two decades .

label: Research questions
text: More specifically , they build interlinked , dynamic networks that model relationships of nuclear researchers based on the open literature and supplement this information with text mining to classify the nuclear weaponization capabilities of each publication-of each author , organization , city , and country .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using such a comprehensive computational framework , they are able to ( a ) elicit the hot topics in nuclear weaponization research , ( b ) assess the nuclear expertise level of each country , ( c ) differentiate between established and emergent players , and ( d ) identify the key entities at various levels such as organization , city , and country .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The ranking includes 500 major universities from 41 different countries .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper provides an extensive discussion of the Leiden Ranking 2011/2012 .

label: Research method
text: The ranking is compared with other global university rankings , in particular the Academic Ranking of World Universities ( commonly known as the Shanghai Ranking ) and the Times Higher Education World University Rankings .

label: Research method
text: The comparison focuses on the methodological choices underlying the different rankings .

label: Research method
text: Also , a detailed description is offered of the data collection methodology of the Leiden Ranking 2011/2012 and of the indicators used in the ranking .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Various innovations in the Leiden Ranking 2011/2012 are presented .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These innovations include ( 1 ) an indicator based on counting a university 's highly cited publications , ( 2 ) indicators based on fractional rather than full counting of collaborative publications , ( 3 ) the possibility of excluding non-English language publications , and ( 4 ) the use of stability intervals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , some comments are made on the interpretation of the ranking and a number of limitations of the ranking are pointed out .

text: Using another somewhat larger empirical sample of 26 data sets I show that the difference may be larger and I argue in favor of the g-index .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this position paper , we highlight and expand on these components and show how they are integrated in various research and educational activities related to data science that are being carried out at iSchools .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that the iSchool way of doing data science is not only highly relevant to the current times , but also crucial in solving problems of tomorrow .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , we accentuate the issues of developing insights and solutions that are not only data-driven , but also incorporate human values , including transparency , privacy , ethics , fairness , and equity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This approach to data science has meaningful implications on how we educate the students and train the next generation of scholars and policymakers .

label: Research questions
text: Here , we provide some of those design decisions , rooted in evidence-based research , along with our perspective on how data science is currently situated and how it should be advanced in iSchools .

label: Research method
text: We analyzed total Web of Science- ( WoS ) -indexed publication output in years 2011-2013 for 67 institutions in which OA was mandated to estimate the mandates ' effectiveness : How well did the MELIBEA score and its individual conditions predict what percentage of the WoS-indexed articles is actually deposited in each institution 's OA repository , and when ?

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found a small but significant positive correlation ( 0.18 ) between the MELIBEA strength score and deposit percentage .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For three of the eight MELIBEA conditions ( deposit timing , internal use , and opt-outs ) , one value of each was strongly associated with deposit percentage or latency ( [ a ] immediate deposit required ; [ b ] deposit required for performance evaluation ; [ c ] unconditional opt-out allowed for the OA requirement but no opt-out for deposit requirement ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When we updated the initial values and weights of the MELIBEA formula to reflect the empirical association we had found , the score 's predictive power for mandate effectiveness doubled ( 0.36 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There are not yet enough OA mandates to test further mandate conditions that might contribute to mandate effectiveness , but the present Research findings/conclusions already suggest that it would be productive for existing and future mandates to adopt the three identified conditions so as to maximize their effectiveness , and thereby the growth of OA .

label: Research method
text: Survivors as well as abusers post high-risk health , legal , and financial questions to Q & A sites ; answers come from individuals who self-identify as lawyers , experts , survivors , and abusers .

label: Research method
text: Using grounded theory this study examines 1,241 individual posts , each within its own context , raising issues of agency and expectations .

label: Research method
text: Informed by Savolainen 's everyday life information seeking ( ELIS ) and Nahl 's affective load theory ( ALT ) , the resultant Q & A typology suggests implications for IPV service design , policy development , and research priorities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In many cases they have to be accessible long after the life of the business processes or information systems in connection with which they were created .

label: Research questions
text: To improve the management and preservation of documents , organizations are deploying Extensible Markup Language ( XML ) as a standardized format for documents .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of this paper is to increase understanding of XML document management and provide a framework to enable the analysis and description of the management of XML documents throughout their life .

label: Research method
text: We followed the design science approach .

label: Research method
text: We introduce a document life cycle model consisting of five phases .

label: Research method
text: For each of the phases we describe the typical activities related to the management of XML documents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , we also identify the typical actors , systems , and types of content items associated with the activities of the phases .

label: Research method
text: We demonstrate the use of the model in two case studies : one concerning the State Budget Proposal of the Finnish government and the other concerning a faculty council meeting agenda at a university .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Scholarly journals have started promoting their research articles to a wide range of audiences via social media platforms .

label: Research questions
text: This article aims to investigate the social media presence of scholarly journals across disciplines .

label: Research method
text: We extracted journals from Web of Science and searched for the social media presence of these journals on Facebook and Twitter .

label: Research method
text: Relevant metrics and content relating to the journals ' social media accounts were also crawled for data analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From our results , the social media presence of scholarly journals lies between 7.1 % and 14.2 % across disciplines ; and it has shown a steady increase in the last decade .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The popularity of scholarly journals on social media is distinct across disciplines .

label: Research questions
text: Further , we investigated whether social media metrics of journals can predict the Journal Impact Factor ( JIF ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that the number of followers and disciplines have significant effects on the JIF .

label: Research method
text: In addition , a word co-occurrence network analysis was also conducted to identify popular topics discussed by scholarly journals on social media platforms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we highlight challenges and issues faced in this study and discuss future research directions .

label: Research questions
text: Given the pooled documents , a number of studies have proposed different prioritization methods to adjudicate documents for judgment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These methods follow different strategies to reduce the assessment effort .

label: Research questions
text: However , there is no clear guidance on how many relevance judgments are required for creating a reliable test collection .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this article we investigate and further develop methods to determine when to stop making relevance judgments .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We propose a highly diversified set of stopping methods and provide a comprehensive analysis of the usefulness of the resulting test collections .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Some of the stopping methods introduced here combine innovative estimates of recall with time series models used in Financial Trading .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results on several representative collections show that some stopping methods can reduce up to 95 % of the assessment effort and still produce a robust test collection .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We demonstrate that the reduced set of judgments can be reliably employed to compare search systems using disparate effectiveness metrics such as Average Precision , NDCG , P @ 100 , and Rank Biased Precision .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: With all these measures , the correlations found between full pool rankings and reduced pool rankings is very high .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Classification usually takes place at the level of journals , where the Web of Science subject categories are the most popular classification system .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , journal-level classification systems have two important limitations : They offer only a limited amount of detail , and they have difficulties with multidisciplinary journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To avoid these limitations , we introduce a new methodology for constructing classification systems at the level of individual publications .

label: Research method
text: In the proposed methodology , publications are clustered into research areas based on citation relations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The methodology is able to deal with very large numbers of publications .

label: Research method
text: We present an application in which a classification system is produced that includes almost 10 million publications .

label: Research method
text: Based on an extensive analysis of this classification system , we discuss the strengths and the limitations of the proposed methodology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Important strengths are the transparency and relative simplicity of the methodology and its fairly modest computing and memory requirements .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main limitation of the methodology is its exclusive reliance on direct citation relations between publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The accuracy of the methodology can probably be increased by also taking into account other types of relationsfor instance , based on bibliographic coupling .

label: Research method
text: Using data about people who register in Mendeley as readers of articles , this article explores different types of users of Clinical Medicine , Engineering and Technology , Social Science , Physics , and Chemistry articles inside and outside academia .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The majority of readers for all disciplines were PhD students , postgraduates , and postdocs but other types of academics were also represented .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , many Clinical Medicine articles were read by medical professionals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The highest correlations between citations and Mendeley readership counts were found for types of users who often authored academic articles , except for associate professors in some sub-disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This suggests that Mendeley readership can reflect usage similar to traditional citation impact if the data are restricted to readers who are also authors without the delay of impact measured by citation counts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: At the same time , Mendeley statistics can also reveal the hidden impact of some research articles , such as educational value for nonauthor users inside academia or the impact of research articles on practice for readers outside academia .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: While much research in IR has considered the effectiveness of IR systems , there is still a significant gap in the understanding of how users contribute to the effectiveness of these systems .

label: Research questions
text: The paper aims to contribute to this by studying how clinicians search for information .

label: Research method
text: Multiple representations of an information needfrom verbose patient case descriptions to ad-hoc querieswere considered in order to understand their effect on retrieval .

label: Research method
text: Four clinicians provided queries and performed relevance assessment to form a test collection used in this study .

label: Research method
text: The different query formulation strategies of each clinician , and their effectiveness , were investigated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that query formulation had more impact on retrieval effectiveness than the particular retrieval systems used .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The most effective queries were short , ad-hoc keyword queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Different clinicians were observed to consistently adopt specific query formulation strategies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The most effective queriers were those who , given their information need , inferred novel keywords most likely to appear in relevant documents .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study reveals aspects of how people search within the clinical domain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This can help inform the development of new models and methods that specifically focus on the query formulation process to improve retrieval effectiveness .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study examined the information interactions in an Israeli virtual health community on Facebook dealing with ulcerative colitis and Crohn 's disease drawing from the weak ties network theory as a theoretical framework .

label: Research questions
text: Weak ties are social ties or acquaintances that can function as an important source for diversified experiential information and emotional support , reducing stigma and providing a sense of belonging .

label: Research method
text: The study consisted of 23 semistructured interviews with registered members of the group .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions of this study parallel the four functions of weak ties by allowing chronically ill patients : access to diverse sources of information including experiential information from others suffering from the same illness ; the possibility to disclose personal information reducing fear from stigma or rejection ; and a sense of belonging .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study proposes a reflective pause on the HIS adoption literature to broaden our understanding of factors contributing to the user adoption of electronic medical record ( EMR ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper provides a comprehensive taxonomy of the factors influencing the user adoption of EMR and classifies these factors into meaningful categories .

label: Research method
text: We searched the selected keywords on several academic databases and found an initial set of 9,684 studies .

label: Research method
text: We excluded papers on the basis of their title , abstract , and full text ( 89 remaining papers ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The effectiveness of adoption theories has been explored based on the empirical results identified in the EMR research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , according to the conceptualization of the factors in the literature , a list of 78 factors affecting EMR adoption was identified .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These factors were classified to eight categories : individual factors , psychological factors , behavioural factors , environmental factors , organizational factors , financial factors , legal factors , and technical factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results have implications for researchers and practitioners , including policymakers , marketers , information technology ( IT ) professionals , health information management ( HIM ) practitioners , health practice managers , and EMR system developers .

label: Research questions
text: This study therefore examines the impacts of key factors from theories of information systems ( IS ) success and sense of community ( SOC ) on users ' continuance intention in the social cataloging context .

label: Research method
text: Data collected from an online survey of 323 social cataloging users provide empirical support for the research model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions indicate that both information quality ( IQ ) and system quality ( SQ ) are significant predictors of satisfaction and SOC , which in turn lead to users ' intentions to continue using these sites .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , SOC was found to affect continuance intention not only directly , but also indirectly through satisfaction .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Theoretically , this study draws attention to a largely unexplored but essential area of research in the social cataloging literature and provides a fundamental basis to understand the determinants of continued social cataloging usage .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From a managerial perspective , the Research findings/conclusions suggest that social cataloging service providers should constantly focus their efforts on the quality control of their contents and system , and the enhancement of SOC among their users .

label: Research method
text: Legal ideas are encoded as topicswords statistically linked in documentsderived from topic modeling the corpus of constitutions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using these topics we derive a diffusion network for borrowing from ancestral constitutions back to the US Constitution of 1789 and reveal that constitutions are complex cultural recombinants .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find systematic variation in patterns of borrowing from ancestral texts and biological-like behavior in patterns of inheritance , with the distribution of offspring arising through a bounded preferential-attachment process .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This process leads to a small number of highly innovative ( influential ) constitutions some of which have yet to have been identified as so in the current literature .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our Research findings/conclusions thus shed new light on the critical nodes of the constitution-making network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The constitutional network structure reflects periods of intense constitution creation , and systematic patterns of variation in constitutional lifespan and temporal influence .

label: Research questions
text: It further examines if reviews are cited more frequently than are normal articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: All research questions are answered affirmatively : The absolute as well as the relative numbers of reviews in these three subfields are indeed increasing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , reviews in these fields are cited more frequently than are normal articles : about 70 % more often than are normal articles in Infectious Diseases and Oncology and about 50 % more often in Tropical Medicine .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The article discusses possible reasons for this increase and concludes that medical journals should strive to achieve an optimal balance between review papers and original articles .

label: Research questions
text: A growing emphasis on open science and reproducibility is changing how authors cite and acknowledge research infrastructures-entities that are used as inputs to or as underlying foundations for scholarly research , including data sets , software packages , computational models , observational platforms , and computing facilities .

label: Research questions
text: At the same time , stakeholder interest in quantitative understanding of impact is spurring increased collection and analysis of metrics related to use of research infrastructures .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article reviews work spanning several decades on tracing and assessing the outcomes and impacts from these kinds of research infrastructures .

label: Research method
text: We discuss how research infrastructures are identified and referenced by scholars in the research literature and how those references are being collected and analyzed for the Research questionss of evaluating impact .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Synthesizing common features of a wide range of studies , we identify notable challenges that impede the analysis of impact metrics for research infrastructures and outline key open research questions that can guide future research and applications related to such metrics .

label: Research method
text: The work is based on an exhaustive search in databasesparticularly those in library and information scienceand on citation chaining from papers on citation analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results confirm that use of this technique in the humanities is limited , and although there was some growth in the 1970s and 1980s , it has stagnated in the past 2 decades .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most of the work has been done by research staff , but almost one third involves library staff , and 15 % has been done by students .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study also showed that less than one fourth of the works used a citation database such as the Arts & Humanities Citation Index and that 21 % of the works were in publications other than library and information science journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The United States has the greatest output , and English is by far the most frequently used language , and 13.9 % of the studies are in other languages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Citations are based on the assessment of many which is why they can be considered to have some credibility .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , we show that citations are incomplete assessments and that one can not assume that a high number of citations correlates with a high level of usefulness .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Only when one knows that a rarely cited paper has been widely read is it possible to say-strictly speaking-that it was obviously of little use for further research .

label: Research method
text: Using a comparison with like data , we try to determine that cited reference analysis allows for a more meaningful analysis of bibliometric data than times-cited analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Entity type models contain sets of patterns aiming to capture the ways geo-located entities are described in natural language .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: They are automatically derived from texts about geo-located entities of the same type ( e.g. , churches , lakes ) .

label: Research method
text: We integrate entity type models into a multi-document summarizer and use them to address the 2 major tasks in extractive multi-document summarization : sentence scoring and summary composition .

label: Research method
text: We experiment with 3 different representation methods for entity type models : signature words , n-gram language models , and dependency patterns .

label: Research method
text: We evaluate the summarizer with integrated entity type models relative to ( a ) a summarizer using standard text-related features commonly used in text summarization and ( b ) the Wikipedia location descriptions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that entity type models significantly improve the quality of output summaries over that of summaries generated using standard summarization features and Wikipedia summaries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The representation of entity type models using dependency patterns is superior to the representations using signature words and n-gram language models .

label: Research method
text: By emulating the team science approaches of the scientists studied , the UCLA Center for Knowledge Infrastructures accumulated a comprehensive collection of qualitative data about how scientists generate , manage , use , and reuse data across domains .

label: Research questions
text: Building upon Paul N. Edwards 's model of making global data-collecting signals via consistent methods , technologies , and policies-to make data global-comparing and integrating those data , the research team has managed and exploited these data as a collaborative resource .

label: Research questions
text: This article reflects on the social , technical , organizational , economic , and policy challenges the team has encountered in creating new knowledge from data old and new .

label: Research questions
text: We reflect on continuity over generations of students and staff , transitions between grants , transfer of legacy data between software tools , research methods , and the role of professional data managers in the social sciences .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In her contribution , Bates warns that understanding information behavior demands recognizing and studying any one important element of the ecology [ in which humans are embedded ] .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Hartel , on the other hand , suggests that LIS would not lose much but would have lots to gain by focusing on core LIS themes instead of embodied information , since the latter may be unproductive , as LIS scholars are latecomer [ s ] to a mature research domain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: I would argue that LIS as a discipline can not avoid dealing with those pesky mammals aka patrons or users ; like the cognate discipline and community of communities human computer interaction ( HCI ) , LIS needs the interdisciplinarity to succeed .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: LIS researchers are uniquely positioned to help bring together LIS 's deep understanding of information and embodiment perspectives that may or may not have been developed in other disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: LIS researchers need to be more explicit about what their original contribution is , though , and what may have been appropriated from other disciplines .

label: Research questions
text: Author verification is a fundamental task where , given a set of texts written by a certain author , we should decide whether another text is also by that author .

label: Research questions
text: In this article we systematically study the usefulness of topic modeling in author verification .

label: Research method
text: We examine several author verification methods that cover the main paradigms , namely , intrinsic ( attempt to solve a one-class classification task ) and extrinsic ( attempt to solve a binary classification task ) methods as well as profile-based ( all documents of known authorship are treated cumulatively ) and instance-based ( each document of known authorship is treated separately ) approaches combined with well-known topic modeling methods such as Latent Semantic Indexing ( LSI ) and Latent Dirichlet Allocation ( LDA ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We use benchmark data sets and demonstrate that LDA is better combined with extrinsic methods , while the most effective intrinsic method is based on LSI .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , topic modeling seems to be particularly effective for profile-based approaches and the performance is enhanced when latent topics are extracted by an enriched set of documents .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The comparison to state-of-the-art methods demonstrates the great potential of the approaches presented in this study .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It is also demonstrates that even when genre-agnostic external documents are used , the proposed extrinsic models are very competitive .

label: Research method
text: In our study , we conducted a lab experiment to examine the effect of prediscussion note-taking on this phenomenon .

label: Research method
text: The experiment used a murder-mystery hidden profile task .

label: Research method
text: In all , 192 undergraduate students were recruited and randomly assigned into 48 four-person groups with gender being the matching variable ( i.e. , each group consisted of four same-gender participants ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: During the decision-making processes , some groups were asked to take notes while reading task materials and had their notes available in the following group discussion , while the other groups were not given this opportunity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis results suggest that ( a ) the presence of an information piece in group members ' notes positively correlates with its appearance in the subsequent discussion and note-taking positively affects the group 's information repetition rate ; ( b ) group decision quality positively correlates with the group 's information sampling rate and negatively correlates with the group 's information sampling/repetition bias ; and ( c ) gender has no statistically significant moderating effect on the relationship between note-taking and information sharing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These results imply that prediscussion note-taking could facilitate information sharing but could not alleviate the biased information pooling in hidden profile tasks .

text: Their Research findings/conclusions reveal that Academy of Management Journal , Academy of Management Review , and Administrative Science Quarterly are the top three management journals , respectively .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: They also discovered that these three journals play the role of a knowledge hub in the domain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , when compared with Journal Citation Reports ( Thomson Reuters , Philadelphia , PA ) , their results closely match expert opinions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: During the first step , real-world heuristics on coauthors are able to produce highly pure ( although fragmented ) clusters .

text: The most representative of these clusters are then selected to serve as training data for the third supervised author assignment step .

label: Research method
text: The third step exploits a state-of-the-art transductive disambiguation method capable of detecting unseen authors not included in any training example and incorporating reliable predictions to the training data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments conducted with standard public collections , using the minimum set of attributes present in a citation , demonstrate that our proposed method outperforms all representative unsupervised author grouping disambiguation methods and is very competitive with fully supervised author assignment methods .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Thus , different from other bootstrapping methods that explore privileged , hard to obtain information such as self-citations and personal information , our proposed method produces topnotch performance with no ( manual ) training data or parameterization and in the presence of scarce information .

text: Text postings only become the actions they perform , such as an information request or deliverable , through the recipient 's work of reading .

text: Text postings thus are designed for their recipients and are built in ways that instruct particular readings .

text: In this paper , I show that patron requests are interactional achievements co-constituted by librarians and patrons through the exchange of text postings that are designed to be seen as requests .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Reference and User Services Association offers guidelines for online interactions between librarians and patrons .

text: However , such guidelines provide only general recommendations by which librarians may overcome difficulties in identifying the specific information needs of patrons .

text: I examine actual chat logs of virtual reference interactions and describe how librarians engage with patrons to co-construct actionable requests to specify and fulfill patron information needs .

label: Research questions
text: This article assesses whether ResearchGate usage and publication data broadly reflect existing academic hierarchies and whether individual countries are set to benefit or lose out from the site .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that rankings based on ResearchGate statistics correlate moderately well with other rankings of academic institutions , suggesting that ResearchGate use broadly reflects the traditional distribution of academic capital .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , while Brazil , India , and some other countries seem to be disproportionately taking advantage of ResearchGate , academics in China , South Korea , and Russia may be missing opportunities to use ResearchGate to maximize the academic impact of their publications .

text: Multiple methods were employed for data collection : questionnaires , think-aloud protocols , and transaction logs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The paper identifies seven types of orientation tactics applied by the two groups of users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While sighted users focused on skimming DL content , blind users concentrated on exploring DL structure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , the authors discovered 13 types of system , user , and interaction factors that led to the use of orientation tactics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More system factors than user factors affect blind users ' tactics in browsing DL structures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions of this study support the social model that the sight-centered design of DLs , rather than blind users ' disability , prohibits them from effectively interacting with a DL .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Simultaneously , the results reveal the limitation of existing interactive information retrieval models that do not take people with disabilities into consideration .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: DL design implications are discussed based on the identified factors .
