label: Research method
text: This study attempts to provide insights into how information is managed in Flemish archeological processes and how this management process can be enhanced : an exploratory study based on an analysis of the new Flemish Immovable Heritage Decree , informal interviews with Flemish archeological organizations , and the results of an international survey .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Three main processes , in which certified archeologists and the Flemish Heritage agency are key actors , were identified .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Multiple types of information , the majority of which contain a geographical component , are recorded , acquired , used , and exchanged .

label: Research questions
text: Geographical information systems ( GIS ) and geodatabases therefore appear to be valuable components of an archeology-specific data infrastructure .

label: Research questions
text: This is of interest because GIS are widely adopted in archeology and multiple Flemish archeological organizations are in favor of a government-provided exchange standard or database templates for data recording .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , free and open source software is preferred to ensure cost efficiency and customizability .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper provides an early review of administrative costs incurred by universities in making research outputs OA , either via publication in journals ( Gold OA ) , involving payment of article-processing charges ( APCs ) , or via deposit in repositories ( Green OA ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using data from 29 UK institutions , it finds that the administrative time , as well as the cost incurred by universities , to make an article OA using the Gold route is over 2.5 times higher than Green .

label: Research method
text: Costs are then modeled at a national level using recent UK policy initiatives from Research Councils UK and the Higher Education Funding Councils ' Research Excellence Framework as case studies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study also demonstrates that the costs of complying with research funders ' OA policies are considerably higher than where an OA publication is left entirely to authors ' discretion .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Key target areas for future efficiencies in the business processes are identified and potential cost savings calculated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis is designed to inform ongoing policy development at the institutional and national levels .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose to study the multidimensional user relevance model ( MURM ) on large scale query logs , which record users ' various search behaviors ( e.g. , query reformulations , clicks and dwelling time , etc . )

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: in natural search settings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We advance an existing MURM model ( including five dimensions : topicality , novelty , reliability , understandability , and scope ) by providing two additional dimensions , that is , interest and habit .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The two new dimensions represent personalized relevance judgment on retrieved documents .

label: Research method
text: Further , for each dimension in the enriched MURM model , a set of computable features are formulated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By conducting extensive document ranking experiments on Bing 's query logs and TREC session Track data , we systematically investigated the impact of each dimension on retrieval performance and gained a series of insightful Research findings/conclusions which may bring benefits for the design of future IR systems .

label: Research method
text: The Leiden Ranking 2011/2012 ( LR ) was published early in 2012 .

label: Research method
text: Starting from Goldstein and Spiegelhalter 's ( 1996 ) recommendations for conducting quantitative comparisons among institutions , in this study we undertook a reformulation of the LR by means of multilevel regression models .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , with our models we replicated the ranking results ; second , the reanalysis of the LR data showed that only 5 % of the PPtop10 % total variation is attributable to differences between universities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Beyond that , about 80 % of the variation between universities can be explained by differences among countries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: If covariates are included in the model the differences among most of the universities become meaningless .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions have implications for conducting university rankings in general and for the LR in particular .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For example , with Goldstein-adjusted confidence intervals , it is possible to interpret the significance of differences among universities meaningfully : Rank differences among universities should be interpreted as meaningful only if their confidence intervals do not overlap .

label: Research method
text: Three test collections were built .

label: Research method
text: The first collection tests the impact of tags on retrieval performance when only the title and abstract are available ( the abstract environment ) .

label: Research method
text: The second tests the impact of tags when the full text is available ( the full-text environment ) .

label: Research method
text: The third compares the retrieval effectiveness of tags and author keywords in the abstract environment .

label: Research method
text: In addition , both single-word queries and phrase queries are tested to understand the impact of different query types .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions suggest that including tags and author keywords in indexes can enhance recall but may improve or worsen average precision depending on retrieval environments and query types .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Indexing tags and author keywords for searching using phrase queries in the abstract environment showed improved average precision , whereas indexing tags for searching using single-word queries in the full-text environment led to a significant drop in average precision .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The comparison between tags and author keywords in the abstract environment indicates that they have comparable impact on average precision , but author keywords are more advantageous in enhancing recall .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions from this study provide useful implications for designing retrieval systems that incorporate tags and author keywords .

label: Research method
text: This article presents a mixed-methods study of LibraryThing and Goodreads , which have characteristics of information-centric online communities and social digital libraries , with attention to their roles as boundary objects , users ' information values , and information behavior , and other boundaries and boundary objects at play .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Content analysis of messages , a survey of users , and qualitative interviews show LibraryThing and Goodreads help establish community and organizational structure ; support sharing of information values ; and facilitate the building and maintenance of social ties .

label: Research questions
text: Translation of meanings and understandings within and between communities is a key activity in these roles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Online communities and social digital libraries should highlight translation processes and resources ; provide user profiles and off-topic spaces and encourage their use ; take a sociotechnical approach to tailor technology and community features to the right audiences ; and facilitate the establishment of shared structure , values , and ties and the work of boundary spanners .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further implications exist for research on and theorizing of information-centric online communities , boundaries , and boundary objects as part of the sociotechnical infrastructure surrounding online information sharing .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research defines the leadership role based on the corresponding author 's affiliation , and presents the first quantitative research on the factors and evolution of 5 proximity dimensions ( geographical , cognitive , institutional , social , and economic ) of research leadership .

label: Research method
text: The data to capture research leadership consist of a set of multi-institution articles in the fields of Life Sciences & Biomedicine , Technology , Physical Sciences , Social Sciences , and Humanities & Arts during 2013-2017 from the Web of Science Core Citation Database .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A Tobit regression-based gravity model indicates that the mass of research leadership of both the leading and participating institutions and the geographical , cognitive , institutional , social , and economic proximities are important factors for the flow of research leadership among Chinese institutions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In general , the effect of these proximities for research leadership flow has been declining recently .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The outcome of this research sheds light on the leadership evolution and flow among Chinese institutions , and thus can provide evidence and support for grant allocation policies to facilitate scientific research and collaborations .

label: Research method
text: We introduce the label and the logic behind it .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A label for peer-reviewed books encourages transparency in academic book publishing .

label: Research questions
text: It is especially relevant for the social sciences and humanities and in the context of performance-based funding of university research .

label: Research method
text: Automatic query expansion is the process of reformulating the original query with the goal of improving retrieval effectiveness .

label: Research questions
text: Many successful query expansion techniques model syntagmatic associations that infer two terms co-occur more often than by chance in natural language .

label: Research questions
text: However , structural linguistics relies on both syntagmatic and paradigmatic associations to deduce the meaning of a word .

label: Research questions
text: Given the success of dependency-based approaches to query expansion and the reliance on word meanings in the query formulation process , we argue that modeling both syntagmatic and paradigmatic information in the query expansion process improves retrieval effectiveness .

label: Research method
text: This article develops and evaluates a new query expansion technique that is based on a formal , corpus-based model of word meaning that models syntagmatic and paradigmatic associations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We demonstrate that when sufficient statistical information exists , as in the case of longer queries , including paradigmatic information alone provides significant improvements in retrieval effectiveness across a wide variety of data sets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More generally , when our new query expansion approach is applied to large-scale web retrieval it demonstrates significant improvements in retrieval effectiveness over a strong baseline system , based on a commercial search engine .

label: Research method
text: To explore the diversity of research collaborations , this article performs a temporal analysis on the scientific careers of researchers in the field of computer science .

label: Research method
text: Specifically , we analyze collaborators using 2 indicators : the research topic diversity , measured by the Author-Conference-Topic model and cosine , and the impact diversity , measured by the normalized standard deviation of h-indices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that the collaborators of high-impact researchers tend to study diverse research topics and have diverse h-indices .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Moreover , by setting PhD graduation as an important milestone in researchers ' careers , we examine several indicators related to scientific collaboration and their effects on a career .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that collaborating with authoritative authors plays an important role prior to a researcher 's PhD graduation , but working with non-authoritative authors carries more weight after PhD graduation .

label: Research method
text: CoLiDeS and CoLiDeS+ were extended to predict user clicks on search engine result pages .

label: Research method
text: Their performance was evaluated using actual behavioral data from an experiment in which 2 types of information search tasks ( simple vs. difficult ) , were presented to younger and older participants .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results showed that the model predictions matched significantly better with the actual user behavior on difficult tasks compared to simple tasks and with younger participants compared to older participants , especially for difficult tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , the matches were significantly better with CoLiDeS+ compared to CoLiDeS , especially for difficult tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that the advanced capabilities of CoLiDeS+ , such as incorporating contextual information and implementing backtracking strategies enable it to predict user behavior significantly better than CoLiDeS , especially on difficult tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The usefulness of these modeling outcomes for the design of support systems for older adults is discussed .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we drew from the existing principles and evaluation methods to develop a User Interaction Framework , with concrete criteria in five dimensions : Access , Trust , Understand , Engage-integrate , and Participate .

label: Research method
text: The framework was then used to evaluate the current OGD sites created and maintained by 34 U.S. municipal government agencies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that , overall , portals perform well in terms of providing access , but not so well in helping users understand and engage with data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions indicate room for improvement in multiple areas and suggest potential roles for information professionals as data mediators .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study also reveals that portals using the Socrata platform performed better , regarding user access , trust , engagement , and participation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the variability among portals indicates that some portals should improve their platforms to achieve greater user engagement and participation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , city governments need to develop clear plans about what data should be available and how to make them available to their public .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In turn , a lack of physical cues , challenges in establishing common ground with others and reduced face-to-face interaction each has the potential to hinder communication within an organization .

label: Research questions
text: Large multinational organizations may rely on transactive memory systems as a means of sharing knowledge and helping employees to accomplish day-to-day tasks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Research demonstrates that new information communication technology facilitates the development of transactive memory systems , but the role of transactive memory in virtual work arrangements is less studied .

label: Research questions
text: This article explores how dimensions of virtual work impact transactive memory systems .

label: Research method
text: Data were collected from a large multinational organization that provides technology consulting services .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions from this study demonstrate a clear relationship between the formation of transactive memory systems and the degree of geographic dispersion of employees .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , the formation of transactive memory systems is negatively impacted by the diversity of teams ' job functions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The use of internal information communication technology plays a positive role in influencing organizational memory when teams are geographically and functionally diverse .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results provide insight into how organizations can better utilize transactive memory systems to improve communication in virtual settings .

label: Research questions
text: In this domain , users often misspell or lack knowledge of the proper medical terms to use in queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To overcome these difficulties and attempt to retrieve higher-quality content , we developed a query suggestion system that provides alternative queries combining the Portuguese or English language with lay or medico-scientific terminology .

label: Research questions
text: Here we evaluate this system 's impact on the medical accuracy of the knowledge acquired during the search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Evaluation shows that simply providing these suggestions contributes to reduce the quantity of incorrect content .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This indicates that even when suggestions are not clicked , they are useful either for subsequent queries ' formulation or for interpreting search results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Clicking on suggestions , regardless of type , leads to answers with more correct content .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An analysis by type of suggestion and user characteristics showed that the benefits of certain languages and terminologies are more perceptible in users with certain levels of English proficiency and health literacy .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This suggests a personalization of this suggestion system toward these characteristics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , the effect of language is more preponderant than the effect of terminology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Clicks on English suggestions are clearly preferable to clicks on Portuguese ones .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There are several methods developed , covering distinct aspects of the problem and disparate strategies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , no single technique fits well in all cases or for all data sources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Supervised approaches may be able to adapt to specific situations , but require manually labeled training , which is very cumbersome and expensive to acquire , mainly for a new application .

label: Research questions
text: In this context , we propose to combine several popular and effective state-of-the-practice sentiment analysis methods by means of an unsupervised bootstrapped strategy .

label: Research questions
text: One of our main goals is to reduce the large variability ( low stability ) of the unsupervised methods across different domains .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results demonstrate that our combined method ( aka , 10SENT ) improves the effectiveness of the classification task , considering thirteen different data sets .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Also , it tackles the key problem of cross-domain low stability and produces the best ( or close to best ) results in almost all considered contexts , without any additional costs ( e.g. , manual labeling ) .

label: Research questions
text: Finally , we also investigate a transfer learning approach for sentiment analysis to gather additional ( unsupervised ) information for the proposed approach , and we show the potential of this technique to improve our results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Its short text nature means that the service is open to a variety of different usage patterns , which have evolved rapidly in terms of user base and utilization .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Prior work has categorized Twitter users , as well as studied the use of lists and re-tweets and how these can be used to infer user profiles and interests .

label: Research questions
text: The focus of this article is on studying why and how Twitter users mark tweets as favoritesa functionality with currently poorly understood usage , but strong relevance for personalization and information access applications .

label: Research method
text: Firstly , manual analysis and classification are carried out on a randomly chosen set of favorited tweets , which reveal different approaches to using this functionality ( i.e. , bookmarks , thanks , like , conversational , and self-promotion ) .

label: Research method
text: Secondly , an automatic favorites classification approach is proposed , based on the categories established in the previous step .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our machine learning experiments demonstrate a high degree of success in matching human judgments in classifying favorites according to usage type .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In conclusion , we discuss the Research questionss to which these data could be put , in the context of identifying users ' patterns of interests .

label: Research questions
text: In this work , we explore various methods of predicting the ratio of male viewers to female viewers onYouTube .

label: Research method
text: First , we propose and examine two hypotheses relating to audience consistency and topic consistency .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The former means that videos made by the same authors tend to have similar male-to-female audience ratios , whereas the latter means that videos with similar topics tend to have similar audience gender ratios .

label: Research method
text: To predict the audience gender ratio before video publication , two features based on these two hypotheses and other features are used in multiple linear regression ( MLR ) and support vector regression ( SVR ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that these two features are the key indicators of audience gender , whereas other features , such as gender of the user and duration of the video , have limited relationships .

label: Research method
text: Second , another method is explored to predict the audience gender ratio .

label: Research method
text: Specifically , we use the early comments collected after video publication to predict the ratio via simple linear regression ( SLR ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experiments indicate that this model can achieve better performance by using a few early comments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also observe that the correlation between the number of early comments ( cost ) and the predictive accuracy ( gain ) follows the law of diminishing marginal utility .

label: Research method
text: We build the functions of these elements via curve fitting to find the appropriate number of early comments ( approximately 250 ) that can achieve maximum gain at minimum cost .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Public-funded , international , and collaborative research in DH furthers institutional research missions and enriches networked knowledge .

label: Research method
text: The Digging into Data 3 challenge ( DID3 ) ( 2014-2016 ) , an international and interdisciplinary grant initiative embracing big data , included 14 teams sponsored by 10 funders from four nations .

label: Research method
text: A qualitative case study that relies on purposive sampling and grounded analysis , this article centers on the information practices of DID3 participants .

label: Research method
text: Semistructured interviews were conducted with 53 participants on 11 of the 14 DID3 projects .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study explores how Data Management Plan requirements affect work practices in public-funded DH , how scholars grapple with key data management challenges , and how they plan to reuse and share their data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It concludes with three recommendations and three directions for future research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Existing manual subject indexing systems generally produce binary outcomes for whether or not to assign an indexing term .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This does not sufficiently reflect the extent to which the indexing terms are associated with the documents .

label: Research questions
text: On the other hand , the idea of probabilistic or weighted indexing was proposed a long time ago and has seen success in capturing uncertainties in the automatic indexing process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One hurdle to overcome in implementing weighted indexing in manual subject indexing systems is the practical burden that could be added to the already intensive indexing process .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study proposes a method to infer automatically the associations between subject terms and documents through text mining .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By uncovering the connections between MeSH descriptors and document text , we are able to derive the weights of MeSH descriptors manually assigned to documents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our initial results suggest that the inference method is feasible and promising .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study has practical implications for improving subject indexing practice and providing better support for information retrieval .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These links must support user navigation and provide a deeper semantic interpretation of the content .

label: Research method
text: Current wikification methods exploit machine learning techniques to capture characteristics of the concepts and its associations .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In previous work , we proposed a preliminary prediction model combining traditional predictors with a latent component which captures the concept graph topology by means of matrix factorization .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this work , we provide a detailed description of our method and a deeper comparison with a state-of-the-art wikification method using a sample of Wikipedia and report a gain up to 13 % in F1 score .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We also provide a comprehensive analysis of the model performance showing the importance of the latent predictor component and the attributes derived from the associations between the concepts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , we include an analysis that allows us to conclude that the model is resilient to ambiguity without including a disambiguation phase .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We finally report the positive impact of selecting training samples from specific content quality classes .

label: Research questions
text: Specifically , we look at the 2009 Victorian bushfires in Australia as an instructive case of early warning information seeking .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The bushfires , the worst in Australia 's recorded history , were unique in its ferocity and damage caused , but also in the amount of data and research that was generated .

label: Research method
text: We analyzed the affected residents ' information needs , seeking and use in terms of their cognitive , affective , and situational dimensions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that residents wanted information that would act as a trigger for action , provide timely warning , and indicate clearly fire severity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nearly two thirds of residents surveyed did not receive an official warning .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Almost half first found out that the bushfire was in their area through personal observation of smoke , embers , or flames .

label: Research questions
text: We suggest that a form of normalcy bias may have been at work during information seeking , causing people to interpret their situations as normal even when disaster warnings have been issued .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although the authorities had adopted a Stay or Go policy to help residents use warning information to decide between staying to defend their property or leaving early , the policy 's effectiveness was undermined by information challenges .

label: Research questions
text: The recent rise in multi-lingual content on the Web has increased cross-language text reuse to an unprecedented scale .

label: Research questions
text: Although researchers have proposed methods to detect it , one major drawback is the unavailability of large-scale gold standard evaluation resources built on real cases .

label: Research method
text: To overcome this problem , we propose a cross-language sentence/passage level text reuse corpus for the English-Urdu language pair .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Cross-Language English-Urdu Corpus ( CLEU ) has source text in English whereas the derived text is in Urdu .

label: Research method
text: It contains in total 3,235 sentence/passage pairs manually tagged into three categories that is near copy , paraphrased copy , and independently written .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Further , as a second contribution , we evaluate the Translation plus Mono-lingual Analysis method using three sets of experiments on the proposed dataset to highlight its usefulness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Evaluation results ( f ( 1 ) =0.732 binary , f ( 1 ) =0.552 ternary classification ) indicate that it is harder to detect cross-language real cases of text reuse , especially when the language pairs have unrelated scripts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The corpus is a useful benchmark resource for the future development and assessment of cross-language text reuse detection systems for the English-Urdu language pair .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous work focused on developing machine-learning classifiers restricted to specific disasters , such as storms or wild-fires .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We investigate for the first time methods to detect such messages where the type of the crisis is not known in advance , that is , the data are highly heterogeneous .

label: Research questions
text: Data heterogeneity causes significant difficulties for learning algorithms to generalize and accurately label incoming data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our main contributions are as follows .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: First , we evaluate the extent of this problem in the context of disaster management , finding that the performance of traditional learners drops by up to 40 % when trained and tested on heterogeneous data vis-a-vis homogeneous data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Then , in order to overcome data heterogeneity , we propose a new ensemble learning method , and found this to perform on a par with the Gradient Boosting and AdaBoost ensemble learners .

label: Research method
text: The methods are studied on a benchmark data set comprising 26 disaster events and four classification problems : detection of relevant messages , informative messages , eyewitness reports , and topical classification of messages .

label: Research method
text: Finally , in a case study , we evaluate the proposed methods on a real-world data set to assess its practical value .

label: Research questions
text: These notions are very similar to the notions of independence and consistency , yet slightly different .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is shown that percentile rank scores , as recently introduced by Leydesdorff , Bornmann , Mutz , and Opthof ( 2011 ) , are strictly congruous indicators of relative performance , and similarly , that the Integrated Impact Indicator ( I3 ) , introduced by Leydesdorff and Bornmann ( 2011 ) , is a strictly congruous indicator of absolute performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis highlights the challenge of finding adequate axioms for ranking and for research evaluation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , information from reports is represented in free text , which is difficult to query against for secondary use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Automatic extraction of important information , such as tumor events using natural language processing , offers possibilities in improved clinical decision support , cohort identification , and retrospective evidence-based research for cancer patients .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of this work was to classify tumor event attributes : negation , temporality , and malignancy , using biomedical ontology and linguistically enriched features .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We report our results on an annotated corpus of 101 hepatocellular carcinoma patient radiology reports , and show that the improved classification improves overall template structuring .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Classification performances for negation identification , past temporality classification , and malignancy classification were at 0.94 , 0.62 , and 0.77 F1 , respectively .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Incorporating the attributes into full templates led to an improvement of 0.72 F1 for tumor-related events over a baseline of 0.65 F1 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Improvement of negation , malignancy , and temporality classifications led to significant improvements in template extraction for the majority of categories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We present our machine-learning approach to identifying these several tumor event attributes from radiology reports , as well as highlight challenges and areas for improvement .

label: Research method
text: Using two Nobel Prize-winning contributions , the scanning tunneling microscope ( STM ) and the discovery of Buckminsterfullerenes ( BUF ) , we examine the growth of follow-up research via citation networks at the author and subdiscipline level .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A longitudinal network analysis suggests that structure , cohesiveness , and interdisciplinarity vary considerably with the type of breakthrough and over time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Scientific progress appears to be multifaceted , including not only theoretical advances but also the discovery of new instrumentation and new matter .

label: Research questions
text: In addition , we argue that scientific growth does not necessarily lead to the formation of new specialties or new subdisciplines .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Rather , we observe the emergence of a research community formed at the intersection of subdisciplinary boundaries .

label: Research method
text: Bibliometric data for Slovenian researchers registered at the Slovenian Research Agency were used .

label: Research method
text: These data were obtained from the Slovenian National Current Research Information System .

label: Research method
text: We applied a recently developed hierarchical clustering procedure for symbolic data to the coauthorship structure of scientific disciplines .

label: Research method
text: To track temporal changes , we divided data for the period 1986-2010 into five 5-year time periods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The clusters of disciplines for the Slovene science system revealed 5 clusters of scientific disciplines that , in large measure , correspond with the official national classification of sciences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , there were also some significant differences pointing to the need for a dynamic classification system of sciences to better characterize them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Implications stemming from these results , especially with regard to classifying scientific disciplines , understanding the collaborative structure of science , and research and development policies , are discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Extractive summarizers can select such sentencespotentially adding hundreds of unnecessary words to the summaryor exclude them and lose important content .

label: Research questions
text: Sentence simplification or compression seems on the surface to be a promising solution .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , compression removes words before the selection algorithm can use them , and simplification generates sentences that may be ambiguous in an extractive summary .

label: Research method
text: We therefore compare the performance of an extractive summarizer selecting from the sentences of the original document with that of the summarizer selecting from sentences shortened in three ways : simplification , compression , and disaggregation , which splits one sentence into several according to rules designed to keep all meaning .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that on legal cases and biomedical articles , these shortening methods generate ungrammatical output .

label: Research method
text: Human evaluators performed an extrinsic evaluation consisting of comprehension questions about the summaries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Evaluators given compressed , simplified , or disaggregated versions of the summaries answered fewer questions correctly than did those given summaries with unaltered sentences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Error analysis suggests 2 causes : Altered sentences sometimes interact with the sentence selection algorithm , and alterations to sentences sometimes obscure information in the summary .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We discuss future work to alleviate these problems .

label: Research method
text: The term heritage is used broadly to include scientific and scholarly publications and data .

label: Research questions
text: Although the preservation of heritage is generally seen as inherently good , this activity implies the exercise of difficult moral choices .

label: Research method
text: The ethical complexity of the preservation of digital heritage is illustrated by means of two hypothetical cases .

label: Research method
text: The first deals with the harvesting and preservation in a wealthy country of political websites originating in a less affluent country .

label: Research method
text: The second deals with a project initiated by a wealthy country to digitize the cultural heritage of a less affluent country .

label: Research method
text: The ethical reflection that follows is structured within the framework of social justice and a set of information rights that are identified as corollaries of generally recognized human rights .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main moral agents , that is , the parties that have an interest , and may be entitled to exercise rights , in relation to digital preservation , are identified .

label: Research questions
text: The responsibilities that those who preserve digital content have toward these parties , and the political-economic considerations that arise , are then analyzed .

label: Research questions
text: This article examines the questions of why and how the Web of Data , expressed in the Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) , has come to be known as the Semantic Web .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Contrary to previous papers , we deliberately take a descriptive stance and do not start from preconceived ideas about the nature of semantics .

label: Research method
text: Instead , we mainly base our analysis on early design documents of the ( Semantic ) Web .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main determining factor is shown to be link typing , coupled with the influence of online metadata .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Both factors already were present in early web standards and drafts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions indicate that the Semantic Web is directly linked to older artificial intelligence work , despite occasional claims to the contrary .

label: Research questions
text: Because of link typing , the Semantic Web can be considered an example of a semantic network .

label: Research questions
text: Originally network representations of the meaning of natural language utterances , semantic networks have eventually come to refer to any networks with typed ( usually directed ) links .

label: Research questions
text: We discuss possible causes for this shift and suggest that it may be due to confounding paradigmatic and syntagmatic semantic relations .

label: Research questions
text: This increase in tag popularity has led to a vast literature on tag recommendation methods .

label: Research questions
text: These methods aim at assisting users in the tagging process , possibly increasing the quality of the generated tags and , consequently , improving the quality of the information retrieval ( IR ) services that rely on tags as data sources .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Regardless of the numerous and diversified previous studies on tag recommendation , to our knowledge , no previous work has summarized and organized them into a single survey article .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose a taxonomy for tag recommendation methods , classifying them according to the target of the recommendations , their objectives , exploited data sources , and underlying techniques .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Moreover , we provide a critical overview of these methods , pointing out their advantages and disadvantages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we describe the main open challenges related to the field , such as tag ambiguity , cold start , and evaluation issues .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Existing studies are mainly based on Broder 's classification scheme and classify user queries into navigational , informational , and transactional categories according to users ' information needs .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this article , we present a novel classification scheme from the perspective of queries ' temporal patterns .

label: Research method
text: Queries ' temporal patterns are inherent time series patterns of the search volumes of queries that reflect the evolution of the popularity of a query over time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By analyzing the temporal patterns of queries , search engines can more deeply understand the users ' search intents and thus improve performance .

label: Research method
text: Furthermore , we extract three groups of features based on the queries ' search volume time series and use a support vector machine ( SVM ) to automatically detect the temporal patterns of user queries .

label: Research method
text: Extensive experiments on the Million Query Track data sets of the Text REtrieval Conference ( TREC ) demonstrate the effectiveness of our approach .

label: Research questions
text: We consider the example of a journal editor ( the principal ) wondering whether his or her reviewer ( the agent ) is recommending rejection of a manuscript because it does not have enough quality to be published or because the reviewer dislikes effort and he/she must work to acquire in-depth knowledge of the content of the manuscript .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The reviewer 's effort provides him or her with superior information about a manuscript 's quality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: If this information is not correctly communicated , the reviewer has more information when compared with the journal editor .

label: Research questions
text: This inherently leads to an encouragement of moral hazard , where the editor will not know whether the reviewer has done his or her job in accordance to the editor 's interest .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Prescriptions need to be given as to how the journal editor should control the reviewers to curb self-interest .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Besides the associate editors monitoring the peer-review process , incentives can be employed to limit moral hazard on the part of the reviewer .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing on agency theory , we examine the incentives motivating the reviewers to expend effort to generate information about the quality of submissions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This model predicts that for reviewers early in their careers , promotion-based incentives may mean there is no need for within-job incentives , but also that within-job rewards for a referee 's performance should depend on individual differences in ability and promotion opportunities .

label: Research questions
text: This study uses the tasktechnology fit ( TTF ) model to explore the interrelationships of e-books , the affordances offered by smart readers , the information needs of academics , and the fit of technology to tasks as well as performance .

label: Research questions
text: We propose that the adoption of e-books will be dependent on how academics perceive the fit of this new medium to the tasks they undertake as well as what added-value functionality is delivered by the information technology that delivers the content .

label: Research method
text: The study used content analysis and an online survey , administered to the faculty in Medicine , Science and Engineering at the University of New South Wales , to identify the attributes of a TTF construct of e-books in academic settings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using exploratory factor analysis , preliminary Research findings/conclusions confirmed annotation , navigation , and output as the core dimensions of the TTF construct .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of confirmatory factor analysis using partial least squares path modeling supported the overall TTF model in reflecting significant positive impact of task , technology , and individual characteristics on TTF for e-books in academic settings ; it also confirmed significant positive impact of TTF on individuals ' performance and use , and impact of using e-books on individual performance .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our research makes two contributions : the development of an e-book TTF construct and the testing of that construct in a model validating the efficacy of the TTF framework in measuring perceived fit of e-books to academic tasks .

label: Research method
text: To explore the use of information as a concept within dominant public health behavior models and the manner in which information practices are handled therein , we undertook a scoping study .

label: Research method
text: We scoped the use of information within core English-language health behavior textbooks and examined dominant models of health behavior for information practices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Index terms within these texts indicated a lack of common language around information-related concepts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nine models/theories were discussed in a majority of the texts .

label: Research method
text: These were grouped by model type and examined for information-related concepts/constructs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Information was framed as a thing or resource , and information practices were commonly included or implied .

label: Research questions
text: However , lack of specificity regarding the definition of information , how it differs from knowledge , and how context affects information practices make the exact role of information within health behavior models unclear .

label: Research questions
text: Although health information interventions may be grounded in behavioral theory , a limited understanding of the ways information works within people 's lives hinders our ability to effectively use information to improve health .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By the same token , information scientists should explore public health 's interventionist approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A key underlying aspect that emerged when addressing this concept is the aggregation of the relevance assessments related to each of the considered dimensions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The most commonly adopted forms of aggregation are based on classical weighted means and linear combination schemes to address this issue .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although some initiatives were recently proposed , none was concerned with considering the inherent dependencies and interactions existing among the relevance criteria , as is the case in many real-life applications .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we present a new fuzzy-based operator , called iAggregator , for multidimensional relevance aggregation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Its main originality , beyond its ability to model interactions between different relevance criteria , lies in its generalization of many classical aggregation functions .

label: Research method
text: To validate our proposal , we apply our operator within a tweet search task .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments using a standard benchmark , namely , Text REtrieval Conference Microblog , emphasize the relevance of our contribution when compared with traditional aggregation schemes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , it outperforms state-of-the-art aggregation operators such as the Scoring and the And prioritized operators as well as some representative learning-to-rank algorithms .

label: Research method
text: This study measures the degree of compliance with a Spanish government OA mandate 2.5 years after its implementation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A total of 58.4 % of articles resulting from publicly funded research had at least one OA copy available 1 year after publication .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among these , 23.8 % were in gold OA , 21.8 % in green OA and 12.8 % in gray OA , i.e. , posted on websites and social networks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most of the green OA articles were in 2 disciplinary repositories : arXiv and PubMed Central .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Just 14.4 % of the articles resulting from publicly funded research were available in institutional repositories , although more than 90 % of the articles in the data set were the result of projects carried out at institutions that have such an archive .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There is great potential for growth in green OA , because over two thirds of the articles that were not available as OA were published in journals whose publishers allow a preprint or a postprint copy to be deposited .

label: Research questions
text: Science linkage is also regarded as noisy because the subject of patent citation behavior varies from inventors/applicants to examiners .

label: Research method
text: In order to identify and ultimately reduce this noise , we analyzed the different citing motivations of examiners and inventors/applicants .

label: Research method
text: We built 4 hypotheses based upon our study of patent law , the unique economic nature of a patent , and a patent citation 's market effect .

label: Research method
text: To test our hypotheses , we conducted an expert survey based on our science linkage calculation in the domain of catalyst from U. S. patent data ( 2006-2009 ) over 3 types of citations : self-citation by inventor/applicant , non-self-citation by inventor/applicant , and citation by examiner .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: According to our results , evaluated by domain experts , we conclude that the non-self-citation by inventor/applicant is quite noisy and can not indicate science linkage and that self-citation by inventor/applicant , although limited , is more appropriate for understanding science linkage .

label: Research method
text: Specifically , we gathered data on authors ' genre preferences , rates and modes of scholarly production , and coauthorship patterns .

text: We also explored the role played by gender and place in determining mentoring and collaboration practices across time .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our biobibliometric profiles of the sextet reveal the different shapes a scholar 's career can take .

label: Research findings/conclusions

label: Research method
text: This article is the result of a 2-year ethnography comprising online archives analysis , participant observation , and 31 interviews .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the course of the research , the Research findings/conclusions revealed that , not only did participants exchange valuable information and helpful social support , there was often little separation between the two , with each overlaying the other throughout most interactions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Expressions of support permeated many informational messages and at the same time served as information to participants .

label: Research questions
text: This article argues that social support and information were inextricably connected within participant interactions and that social support is , itself , a form of information that impacts actions and emotional experiences , contributing to participants being able to make sense of their experiences and to move forward both physically and emotionally .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research builds on work in information science that looks at the ways in which people exchange information in informal environments and extends that research by drawing on conceptualizations of social support to exhibit the connections between social support and information .

label: Research questions
text: Its Research questions was to identify whether query modification patterns were related to users ' contextual factors and content sources as well as whether the patterns characterize the use of semantic attributes expressed in users ' search queries in an interactive web-searching process .

label: Research method
text: To this end , a collection of 970 image search queries executed by undergraduate students in a naturalistic setting was analyzed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study 's Research findings/conclusions showed that query modification patterns were significantly associated with content sources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among the types of query modification employed , Reformulation and New were the most frequently used .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Terms related to format , object , or place associated with an image also were found to be frequently used in search queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Terms referring to type or genre were the most frequent attributes in web image search queries , which suggests a change from previous Research findings/conclusions of search queries in a professional context .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Implications are discussed in terms of search assistants for web image searches and semantic annotation to improve image indexing .

label: Research questions
text: Retraction is a self-correction mechanism of the scientific community to maintain and safeguard the integrity of scientific literature .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , a retracted article may pose a profound and long-lasting threat to the credibility of the literature .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: New articles may unknowingly build their work on false claims made in retracted articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Such dependencies on retracted articles may become implicit and indirect .

label: Research questions
text: Consequently , it becomes increasingly important to detect implicit and indirect threats .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , our aim is to raise the awareness of the potential threats of retracted articles even after their retraction and demonstrate a visual analytic study of retracted articles with reference to the rest of the literature and how their citations are influenced by their retraction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The context of highly cited retracted articles is visualized in terms of a co-citation network as well as the distribution of articles that have high-order citation dependencies on retracted articles .

label: Research method
text: Survival analyses of time to retraction and postretraction citation are included .

label: Research method
text: Sentences that explicitly cite retracted articles are extracted from full-text articles .

label: Research method
text: Transitions of topics over time are depicted in topic-flow visualizations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We recommend that new visual analytic and science mapping tools should take retracted articles into account and facilitate tasks specifically related to the detection and monitoring of retracted articles .

label: Research questions
text: In interdisciplinary and cross-sector projects , team members may hold distinct views on the types of impact they want to create .

label: Research method
text: Set in the context of an interdisciplinary , cross-sector project comprised of partners from academia , industry , and the nonprofit sector , our paper unpacks how these diverse project members understand impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis shows that interdisciplinary projects offer a unique opportunity to create impact on a number of different levels .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Moreover , it demonstrates that a lack of accountable design and collaboration practices can potentially hinder pathways to impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we find that the interdisciplinary perspectives that such projects introduce encourage a rich gamut of sustainable outcomes that go beyond commercialization .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions support researchers working in these complex contexts to appreciate the opportunities and challenges involved in interdisciplinary cross-sector research contexts while imparting them with strategies for overcoming these challenges .

label: Research questions
text: The aim of fake news is usually to confuse readers and trigger intense emotions to them in an attempt to be spread through social networks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Even though recent studies have explored the effectiveness of different linguistic patterns for fake news detection , the role of emotional signals has not yet been explored .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , we focus on extracting emotional signals from claims and evaluating their effectiveness on credibility assessment .

label: Research questions
text: First , we explore different methodologies for extracting the emotional signals that can be triggered to the users when they read a claim .

label: Research method
text: Then , we present emoCred , a model that is based on a long-short term memory model that incorporates emotional signals extracted from the text of the claims to differentiate between credible and non-credible ones .

label: Research method
text: In addition , we perform an analysis to understand which emotional signals and which terms are the most useful for the different credibility classes .

label: Research method
text: We conduct extensive experiments and a thorough analysis on real-world datasets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results indicate the importance of incorporating emotional signals in the credibility assessment problem .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , these clinically oriented terminologies and ontologies can not provide sufficient support when integrated into consumer-oriented applications , because these applications must understand both technical and lay vocabulary .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The latter is not part of these specialized terminologies and ontologies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this article , we propose a two-step approach for building consumer health terminologies from text : 1 ) automatic extraction of definitions from consumer-oriented articles and web documents , which reflects language in use , rather than relying solely on dictionaries , and 2 ) learning to map definitions expressed in natural language to terminological knowledge by inducing a syntactic-semantic grammar rather than using hand-written patterns or grammars .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We present quantitative and qualitative evaluations of our two-step approach , which show that our framework could be used to induce consumer health terminologies from text .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , there are still no satisfactory solutions ; addressing mistakes are not detected and in some cases correct recipients are wrongly marked as potential mistakes .

label: Research questions
text: In this article we present a new approach for preventing e-mail addressing mistakes in organizations .

label: Research method
text: The approach is based on an analysis of e-mail exchanges among members of an organization and the identification of groups based on common topics .

label: Research method
text: When a new e-mail is about to be sent , each recipient is analyzed .

label: Research method
text: A recipient is approved if the e-mail 's content belongs to at least one common topic to both the sender and the recipient .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This can be applied even if the sender and recipient have never communicated directly before .

label: Research method
text: The new approach was evaluated using the Enron e-mail data set and was compared with a well known method for the detection of e-mail addressing mistakes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that the proposed approach is capable of detecting 87 % of nonlegitimate recipients while incorrectly classifying only 0.5 % of the legitimate recipients .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These results outperform previous work , which reports a detection rate of 82 % without reference to the false positive rate .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conduct a quasi-field experiment with 30 bilingual searchers and the results suggested that the ISP model was applicable in studying searchers ' information retrieval behavior in search tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The ISP model was applicable in studying searchers ' information retrieval behavior in simple tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , searchers ' emotional responses differed from those of the ISP model for a complex task .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By testing searchers using different search strategies , the results suggested that search engines with multilanguage search functions provide an advantage for bilingual searchers in the Internet 's multilingual environment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions showed that when searchers used a search engine as a tool for problem solving , they might experience different feelings in each ISP stage than in searching for information for a term paper using a library .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results echo other research Research findings/conclusions that indicate that information seeking is a multifaceted phenomenon .

label: Research questions
text: By the beginning of the 21st century , however , departments of ( library and ) information science had turned instead towards the social sciences .

label: Research questions
text: These programs address a variety of important topics , but they have been less successful in providing a coherent explanation of the nature and scope of the field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Progress can be made towards a coherent , unified view of the roles of archives , libraries , museums , online information services , and related organizations if they are treated as information-providing services .

label: Research questions
text: However , such an approach seems significantly incomplete on ordinary understandings of the providing of information .

label: Research questions
text: Instead of asking what information science is or what we might wish it to become , we ask instead what kind of field it can be given our assumptions about it .

label: Research method
text: We approach the question by examining some keywords : science , information , knowledge , and interdisciplinary .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that if information science is concerned with what people know , then it is a form of cultural engagement , and at most , a science of the artificial .

label: Research questions
text: There is a variety of proposed quality assurance frameworks applied in repositories that are deployed in various contexts .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although studies report that there is an improvement of the quality of the metadata in many of the applications , the transfer of a successful approach from one application context to another has not been studied to a satisfactory extent .

label: Research method
text: This article presents the empirical results of the application of a metadata quality assurance process that has been developed and successfully applied in an educational context ( learning repositories ) to 2 different application contexts to compare results with the previous application and assess its generalizability .

label: Research questions
text: More specifically , it reports results from the adaptation and application of this process in a library context ( institutional repositories ) and in a cultural context ( digital cultural repositories ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Initial empirical Research findings/conclusions indicate that content providers seem to be gaining a better understanding of metadata when the proposed process is put in place and that the quality of the produced metadata records increases .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We make two contributions : an empirical and conceptual development of knowledge management as it relates to independent workers and an advancement of social informatics that builds on Gibson 's ecological perspective .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Digital nomads provide an empirical basis to better understand how knowledge management is shifting from organization-centric , with its concomitant emphasis on organizational information systems , to worker-centric , which relies on personal knowledge ecologies .

label: Research questions
text: We advance this concept as a combination of personal knowledge management activities and the digital technologies that support them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our data make clear that individuals are the locus of personal knowledge ecologies , but these ecologies are embedded in a larger community of collaborators , clients , and peers who are often extensively mediated by digital technologies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This embedding and mediation are at the core of the sociotechnical arrangements that define the personal knowledge ecologies that we document .

label: Research questions
text: Assuming that meaning can not be communicated , we extend Shannon 's theory by defining mutual redundancy as a positional counterpart of the relational communication of information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Mutual redundancy indicates the surplus of meanings that can be provided to the exchanges in reflexive communications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The information is redundant because it is based on pure sets ( i.e. , without subtraction of mutual information in the overlaps ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that in the three-dimensional case ( e. g. , of a triple helix of university-industry-government relations ) , mutual redundancy is equal to mutual information ( R-xyz = T-xyz ) ; but when the dimensionality is even , the sign is different .

label: Research method
text: We generalize to the measurement in N dimensions and proceed to the interpretation .

label: Research method
text: Using Niklas Luhmann 's ( 1984-1995 ) social systems theory and/or Anthony Giddens 's ( 1979 , 1984 ) structuration theory , mutual redundancy can be provided with an interpretation in the sociological case : Different meaning-processing structures code and decode with other algorithms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A surplus of ( absent ) options can then be generated that add to the redundancy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Luhmann 's functional ( sub ) systems of expectations or Giddens 's ruleresource sets are positioned mutually , but coupled operationally in events or instantiated in actions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Shannon-type information is generated by the mediation , but the structures are ( re- ) positioned toward one another as sets of ( potentially counterfactual ) expectations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The structural differences among the coding and decoding algorithms provide a source of additional options in reflexive and anticipatory communications .

label: Research method
text: We provide base maps for Mendeley reader count data using the publication year 2012 from the Web of Science data .

label: Research method
text: Example networks are shown and explained .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The reader can use our base maps to visualize other results with the VOSViewer .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proposed overlay maps are able to show the impact of publications in terms of readership data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The advantage of using our base maps is that it is not necessary for the user to produce a network based on all data ( e.g. , from 1 year ) , but can collect the Mendeley data for a single institution ( or journals , topics ) and can match them with our already produced information .

label: Research questions
text: Generation of such large-scale networks is still a demanding task despite the available computer power and digital data availability .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Therefore , it is very useful to have base maps and create the network with the overlay technique .

label: Research method
text: In-depth telephone interviews with 50 VRS librarians included questions on collaboration , referral practices , and attitudes toward Social Question and Answer ( SQA ) services using the Critical Incident Technique ( Flanagan , ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Community of Practice ( CoP ) ( Wenger , ; Davies , ) framework was found to be a useful conceptualization for understanding VRS professionals ' approaches to their work .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions indicate that participants usually refer questions from outside of their area of expertise to other librarians , but occasionally refer them to nonlibrarian experts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These referrals are made possible because participants believe that other VRS librarians are qualified and willing collaborators .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Barriers to collaboration include not knowing appropriate librarians/experts for referral , inability to verify credentials , and perceived unwillingness to collaborate .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Facilitators to collaboration include knowledge of appropriate collaborators who are qualified and willingness to refer .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Answers from SQA services were perceived as less objective and authoritative , but participants were open to collaborating with nonlibrarian experts with confirmation of professional expertise or extensive knowledge .

label: Research method
text: Using a set of chemistry papers and conducting interviews with their authors ( n = 32 ) , I characterize the type of relation the author has with the authors of the references contained in his/her paper ( n = 3,623 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: I show that citation relationships do not always involve underlying personal exchanges and that unknown references are an essential component , revealing segmentations in scientific groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The relationships implied by references are of various strengths and origins .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Several inclusive social circles are then identified : co-authors , close acquaintances , colleagues , invisible colleges , peers , contactables , and strangers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: I conclude that publication is a device that contributes to a relatively stable distribution among the various social circles that structure scientific sociability .

label: Research questions
text: The concept of CoPs was originally developed as a social learning theory , and CoPs were defined by their informal emergent nature .

label: Research questions
text: This informal nature has been recognized to be of value to organizations , resulting in a desire to design CoPs .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , the nature of CoPs is addressed by focusing on aspects of formality and informality in relationships and learning ; CoPs are described as emergent and designed practices .

label: Research questions
text: Furthermore , it is questioned whether a designed CoP may realize the essential characteristics attributed to an emergent CoP .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is argued that it is crucial to recognize the informal nature of CoPs in order to either encourage them as informal phenomena or to use the concept of CoPs as inspiration for designing imitations of them .

label: Research questions
text: However , when attempting to design them , the original meaning of a CoP is lost , even though , in some cases , the consequences of such a design may be beneficial to organizations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , when not taking the nature of a CoP into account , a designed construct may have a negative impact on learning and knowing .

label: Research questions
text: Over the past decade or so , the general needs of people with impairments have increasingly been recognized as something to be addressed , an issue embedded both in international treaties and in state legislation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The same tendency can be found in research , where a growing number of user studies including people with impairments have been conducted .

label: Research questions
text: The Research questions of these studies is typically to uncover potential barriers for access to information , especially in the context of inaccessible search user interfaces .

label: Research method
text: This literature review provides an overview of research on the information seeking and searching of users with impairments .

label: Research questions
text: The aim is to provide an overview to both researchers and practitioners who work with any of the user groups identified .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Some diagnoses are relatively well represented in the literature ( for instance , visual impairment ) , but there is very little work in other areas ( for instance , autism ) and in some cases no work at all ( for instance , aphasia ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Gaps are identified in the research , and suggestions are made regarding areas where further research is needed .

label: Research method
text: We then examined the boundary conditions of these models of technology adoption when applied to the household context using longitudinal empirical data from households regarding their purchase and use decisions related to household technologies .

label: Research method
text: We conducted 2 studies and collected 1,247 responses from U.S. households for the first study and 2,064 responses from U.S. households for the second study .

label: Research method
text: Those households that had adopted household technologies were surveyed regarding their use behavior .

label: Research method
text: Potential adopters ( i.e. , those who had currently not adopted ) were surveyed regarding their purchase intentions .

label: Research method
text: This allowed us to identify the most influential factors affecting a household 's decision to adopt and use technologies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that the model of adoption of technology in the household provided the richest explanation and explained best why households purchase and use technologies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We present reflective examples from the literature in some detail , which should appeal to readers interested in a deeper perspective on the various methods and systems implemented in the outlined literature .

label: Research method
text: The presentation covers graph exploration and propagation methods , adaptations of classic probabilistic retrieval models , and query-independent link analysis via flexible extensions to the PageRank algorithm .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Future research directions are discussed , including development of more cohesive retrieval models to unlock further potentials and uses , data indexing schemes , integration with user interfaces , and building community consensus for more systematic evaluation and gradual development .

text: This study examines the effects of a tailored health education site on participants ' evaluations of and elaboration on health messages .

text: A total of 151 teens were randomly assigned to explore a tailored Web site or a nontailored Web site on adolescent sexual health and decision making .
