label: Research method
text: We conducted a 12-month randomized controlled trial to examine whether the promotion of article links in an online cross-publisher distribution platform ( TrendMD ) affects citations .

label: Research method
text: In all , 3,200 articles published in 64 peer-reviewed journals across eight subject areas were block randomized at the subject level to either the TrendMD group ( n = 1,600 ) or the control group ( n = 1,600 ) of the study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our primary outcome compares the mean citations of articles randomized to TrendMD versus control after 12 months .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Articles randomized to TrendMD showed a 50 % increase in mean citations relative to control at 12 months .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The difference in mean citations at 12 months for articles randomized to TrendMD versus control was 5.06 , 95 % confidence interval [ 2.87 , 7.25 ] , was statistically significant ( p < .001 ) and found in three of eight subject areas .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: At 6 months following publication , articles randomized to TrendMD showed a smaller , yet statistically significant ( p = .005 ) , 21 % increase in mean citations , relative to control .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To our knowledge , this is the first randomized controlled trial to demonstrate how an intervention can be used to increase citations of peer-reviewed articles after they have been published .

label: Research method
text: We performed a crowdsourced experiment that demonstrates that transcripts of spoken documents created using Automated Speech Recognition ( ASR ) , even with significant errors , are effective sources of document summaries or snippets for supporting users in making relevance judgments against a query .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , the results show that summaries generated from ASR transcripts are comparable , in utility and user-judged preference , to spoken summaries generated from error-free manual transcripts of the same collection .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also observed that content-based audio summaries are at least as preferred as synthesized summaries obtained from manually curated metadata , such as title and description .

label: Research method
text: We describe a methodology for constructing a new test collection , which we have made publicly available .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There have been a handful of arguments given for DIR-coverage , effectiveness , and ease of use , for example-but these are not borne out by experience .

label: Research questions
text: Are there uses for DIR ?

label: Research questions
text: There are , but generally for organizational not technical reasons , and they have not been well studied .

label: Research questions
text: Existing citation analysis methods assume that all citations in a paper are equally important , and they simply count the number of citations .

label: Research questions
text: Here we argue that the citations in a paper are not equally important and some citations are more important than the others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We use a strength value to assess the importance of each citation and propose to use the regression method with a few useful features for automatically estimating the strength value of each citation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Evaluation results on a manually labeled data set in the computer science field show that the estimated values can achieve good correlation with human-labeled values .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We further apply the estimated citation strength values for evaluating paper influence and author influence , and the preliminary evaluation results demonstrate the usefulness of the citation strength values .

label: Research questions
text: In this work , we propose a novel descriptive clustering framework , referred to as CEDL .

label: Research method
text: It relies on the formulation and generation of 2 types of heterogeneous objects , which correspond to documents and candidate phrases , using multilevel similarity information .

label: Research method
text: CEDL is composed of 5 main processing stages .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: First , it simultaneously maps the documents and candidate phrases into a common co-embedded space that preserves higher-order , neighbor-based proximities between the combined sets of documents and phrases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Then , it discovers an approximate cluster structure of documents in the common space .

label: Research method
text: The third stage extracts promising topic phrases by constructing a discriminant model where documents along with their cluster memberships are used as training instances .

label: Research method
text: Subsequently , the final cluster labels are selected from the topic phrases using a ranking scheme using multiple scores based on the extracted co-embedding information and the discriminant output .

label: Research method
text: The final stage polishes the initial clusters to reduce noise and accommodate the multitopic nature of documents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The effectiveness and competitiveness of CEDL is demonstrated qualitatively and quantitatively with experiments using document databases from different application fields .

label: Research method
text: We approach the detection of such articles from three different perspectives in order to provide different typologies of breakthrough articles .

label: Research method
text: In all three cases we use the hierarchical classification of scientific publications developed at CWTS based on direct citation relationships .

label: Research method
text: We assume that such contextualized articles focus on similar research interests .

label: Research method
text: We utilize the characteristics scores and scales ( CSS ) approach to partition citation distributions and implement a specific filtering algorithm to sort out potential highly-cited followers , articles not considered breakthroughs .

label: Research method
text: After invoking thresholds and filtering , three methods are explored : A very exclusive one where only the highest cited article in a micro-cluster is considered as a potential breakthrough article ( M1 ) ; as well as two conceptually different methods , one that detects potential breakthrough articles among the 2 % highest cited articles according to CSS ( M2a ) , and finally a more restrictive version where , in addition to the CSS 2 % filter , knowledge diffusion is also considered ( M2b ) .

label: Research method
text: The advance citation-based methods are explored and evaluated using validated publication sets linked to different Danish funding instruments including centers of excellence .

label: Research questions
text: However , the nature of communication channels and how information is produced by and shared with users has fundamentally changed in the last 80 years .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One significant change is the growing use of technology-enabled metadata like hashtags when sharing information on social media .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Rarely any study investigates whether hashtags can perform gatekeeping of information and what it means for information gatekeeping .

label: Research method
text: This paper fills in the gap by conducting a content analysis of 77 interdisciplinary studies on hashtags and gatekeeping to confirm how they can implement six gatekeeping mechanisms .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study shows that hashtags expand our understanding of the role of technology solutions in gatekeeping and advance research on hierarchical gatekeeping .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The benefits of hashtags for gatekeeping suggest that they act as information anchors for online communities , thereby highlighting the utility of information gatekeepers for society .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It is even more important for users of online health communities because health benefits usually come with sustained use .

label: Research questions
text: However , little is known about what retains a user .

label: Research method
text: We interviewed 21 participants who had been using online diabetes communities in a sustained manner .

label: Research questions
text: Guided by self-determination theory , which posits that behaviors are sustained when they can satisfy basic human needs for autonomy , competence , and relatedness , we identified mechanisms that help satisfy these needs , and thus sustain users in online health communities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Autonomy-supportive mechanisms include being respected and supported as a unique individual , feeling free in making choices , and receiving meaningful rationales about others ' decisions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Competence-cultivating mechanisms include seeking information , providing information , and exchanging information with others to construct knowledge .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Mechanisms that cultivate relatedness include seeing similarities between oneself and peers , receiving responses from others , providing emotional support , and forming small underground groups for closer interactions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that , like emotions , information and small group interactions also play a key role in retaining users .

label: Research method
text: System design and community management strategies are discussed based on these mechanisms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The transformation seems to originate from a growing interest in bibliometric topics .

label: Research method
text: This is evident from a longitudinal study ( 1990-2012 ) of the bibliometric coupling strength between Scientometrics and other LIS-core journals ( including JASIST ) .

label: Research questions
text: The cause of this gradual transformation is discussed , and possible explanations are analyzed .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Such studies uncover rich information about these organizations .

label: Research questions
text: In recent years , however , there has been a dearth of co-link analysis , mainly due to the lack of sources from which co-link data can be collected directly .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although several commercial services such as Alexa provide inlink data , none provide co-link data .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We propose a new approach to web co-link analysis that can alleviate this problem so that researchers can continue to mine the valuable information contained in co-link data .

label: Research method
text: The proposed approach has two components : ( a ) generating co-link data from inlink data using a computer program ; ( b ) analyzing co-link data at the site level in addition to the page level that previous co-link analyses have used .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The site-level analysis has the potential of expanding co-link data sources .

label: Research method
text: We tested this proposed approach by analyzing a group of websites focused on vaccination using Moz inlink data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that the approach is feasible , as we were able to generate co-link data from inlink data and analyze the co-link data with multidimensional scaling .

label: Research questions
text: Their primary goal is to revise or establish beliefs in one or more outcomes .

label: Research questions
text: Search engines are not designed to furnish answers , and instead provide results that may contain answers .

label: Research questions
text: Information retrieval research has targeted aspects of information access such as query formulation , relevance , and search success .

label: Research questions
text: However , there are important unanswered questions on how beliefs-and potential biases in those beliefs-affect search behaviors and how beliefs are shaped by searching .

label: Research method
text: To understand belief dynamics , we focus on yes-no medical questions ( e.g. , Is congestive heart failure a heart attack ?

label: Research method
text: ) , with consensus answers from physicians .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that ( a ) presearch beliefs are affected only slightly by searching and changes are likely to skew positive ( yes ) ; ( b ) presearch beliefs affect search behavior ; ( c ) search engines can shift some beliefs by manipulating result rank and availability , but strongly-held beliefs are difficult to move using uncongenial information and can be counterproductive , and ( d ) search engines exhibit near-random answer accuracy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions suggest that search engines should provide correct answers to searchers ' questions and develop methods to persuade searchers to shift strongly held but factually incorrect beliefs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We believe comments left on these videos can provide insight into user interests , but to this point have not been used to map out a specific video community .

label: Research method
text: Our study investigates whether and how user commenting behavior impacts the topology of the K-pop video community through analysis of co-commenting behavior on these videos .

label: Research method
text: We apply a traditional author cocitation analysis to this behavior , in a process we refer to as co-comment analysis , to detect the topology of this community .

label: Research method
text: This involves : a ) an analysis of user co-comments to elicit the inclination of user homophily within the community ; b ) an analysis of user co-comments , weighted frequency of co-comments , to detect user interests in the community ; and c ) an analysis of user co-comments , weighted sentiment scores , to capture user opinions by polarity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that users who comment on specific K-pop videos also tend to comment on topically similar YouTube videos .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also find that the number of comments made by users correlates with the degree of positivity of their comments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Conversely , users who comment negatively on K-pop videos are not inclined to form specific user groups , but rather present only their opinions individually .

label: Research method
text: First , we create a data preprocessing model for accurate term cleaning , consolidating , and clustering .

label: Research method
text: Then we construct a simulated data streaming function and introduce a learning process to train a relationship identification function to adapt to changing environments in real time , where relationships of topic evolution , fusion , death , and novelty are identified .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main result of the method is a map of scientific evolutionary pathways .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The visual routines provide a way to indicate the interactions among scientific subjects and a version in a series of time slices helps further illustrate such evolutionary pathways in detail .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The detailed outline offers sufficient statistical information to delve into scientific topics and routines and then helps address meaningful insights with the assistance of expert knowledge .

label: Research method
text: This empirical study focuses on scientific proposals granted by the United States National Science Foundation , and demonstrates the feasibility and reliability .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our method could be widely applied to a range of science , technology , and innovation policy research , and offer insight into the evolutionary pathways of scientific activities .

label: Research questions
text: This study investigates how sustained student engagement in game design and social media use can attenuate the relations between socioeconomic factors and digital inequality among youth .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study of 242 middle and high school students participating in the Globaloria project shows that participation eliminates gender effects , and reduces parent education effects in home computer use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further , students from schools with lower parent education show greater increases in frequency of school technology engagement .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Globaloria participation also weakens the link between prior school achievement and advanced technology activities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results offer evidence that school-based digital literacy programs can attenuate digital divide effects known to occur cross-sectionally in the general U.S. population .

label: Research questions
text: But there is an often-neglected prehistory of OA that can be found in the early DIY publishers of the late 1980s and early 1990s .

label: Research method
text: Managed entirely by working academics , these journals published research in the humanities and social sciences and stand out for their unique set of motivations and practices .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article explores this separate lineage in the history of the OA movement through a critical-theoretical analysis of the motivations and practices of the early scholar-led publishers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Alongside showing the involvement of the humanities and social sciences in the formation of OA , the analysis reveals the importance that these journals placed on experimental practices , critique of commercial publishing , and the desire to reach new audiences .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Understood in today 's context , this research is significant for adding complexity to the history of OA , which policymakers , advocates , and publishing scholars should keep in mind as OA goes mainstream .

label: Research method
text: We investigated Chinese and English speakers ' processing of 4 types of visual stimuli : icons , pictures , Chinese characters , and English words .

label: Research questions
text: The goal was to examine , via functional magnetic resonance imaging ( fMRI ) data , the hypothesis that people cognitively process icons as logographic words and to provide neurological evidence related to human-computer interaction ( HCI ) , which has been rare in traditional information system studies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: According to the neuroimaging data of 19 participants , we conclude that icons are not cognitively processed as logographical words like Chinese characters , although they both stimulate the semantic system in the brain that is needed for language processing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Instead , more similar to images and pictures , icons are not as efficient as words in conveying meanings , and brains ( people ) make more effort to process icons than words .

label: Research questions
text: We use this study to demonstrate that it is practicable to test information system constructs such as elements of graphical user interfaces ( GUIs ) with neuroscience data and that , with such data , we can better understand individual or group differences related to system usage and user-computer interactions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The two key Research findings/conclusions are the following .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , country citation distributions are highly skewed and very similar to each other in all fields .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Second , to a large extent , differences in country citation distributions can be accounted for by scale factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Empirical situation described in the article helps to understand why international comparisons of citation impact according to ( a ) mean citations and ( b ) the percentage of articles in each country belonging to the top 10 % of the most cited articles are so similar to each other .

label: Research questions
text: However , a series of early and recent studies demonstrate the existence of indirect and continuous citation impact across generations .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Adding to the literature on high-order citations , we introduce the concept of a citation cascade : the constitution of a series of subsequent citing events initiated by a certain publication .

label: Research method
text: We investigate this citation structure by analyzing more than 450,000 articles and over 6 million citation relations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that citation impact exists not only within the three generations documented in prior research but also in much further generations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Still , our experimental results indicate that two to four generations are generally adequate to trace a work 's scientific impact .

label: Research questions
text: We also explore specific structural properties-such as depth , width , structural virality , and size-which account for differences among individual citation cascades .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we find evidence that it is more important for a scientific work to inspire trans-domain ( or indirectly related domain ) works than to receive only intradomain recognition in order to achieve high impact .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our methods and Research findings/conclusions can serve as a new tool for scientific evaluation and the modeling of scientific history .

label: Research questions
text: Meanwhile , interdisciplinary research is increasingly being promoted as a route to advance the complex challenges we face as a society .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , we use Latent Dirichlet Allocation ( LDA ) citation as a proxy context for the diffusion of an innovation .

label: Research method
text: With an analysis of topic evolution , we divide the diffusion process into five stages : testing and evaluation , implementation , improvement , extending , and fading .

label: Research method
text: Through a correlation analysis of topic and subject , we show the application of LDA in different subjects .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also reveal the cross-boundary diffusion between different subjects based on the analysis of the interdisciplinary studies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that as LDA is transferred into different areas , the adoption of each subject is relatively adjacent to those with similar research interests .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our Research findings/conclusions further support researchers ' understanding of the impact formation of innovation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A comprehensive benchmark is needed to inform best practices in this broad application field .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous benchmarks have evaluated performance for a few supervised classification and feature selection methods and limited ways to optimize them .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The present work updates prior benchmarks by increasing the number of classifiers and feature selection methods order of magnitude , including adding recently developed , state-of-the-art methods .

label: Research method
text: Specifically , this study used 229 text categorization data sets/tasks , and evaluated 28 classification methods ( both well-established and proprietary/commercial ) and 19 feature selection methods according to 4 classification performance metrics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We report several key Research findings/conclusions that will be helpful in establishing best methodological practices for text categorization .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Censorship of identity occurs in different contexts-for example , the military censors the identity of personnel and the judiciary censors the identity of minors and victims .

label: Research questions
text: We address three objectives : ( a ) assess the relevance of identity censorship in the presence of user-generated comments , ( b ) understand the fashion of censorship circumvention ( what people say and how ) , and ( c ) determine how comment analysis can aid in identifying decensorship and information leakage through comments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: After examining 3,582 comments made on 48 articles containing obfuscated terms , we find that a systematic examination of comments can compromise identity censorship .

label: Research method
text: We identify and categorize information leakage in comments indicative of knowledge of censored information that may result in information decensorship .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that the majority of censored articles contained at least one comment leading to censorship circumvention .

label: Research questions
text: Query suggestions may help , but research suggests these often go unused .

label: Research questions
text: Although much is known about how searchers scan results pages when assessing relevance , little is known about the processes searchers use when struggling to reformulate queries .

label: Research questions
text: Investigating how searchers overcome query difficulties , and how search systems help and hinder that process , requires enquiry into the cognitive procedures searchers use to select words for queries .

label: Research questions
text: The Research questions of this paper is to investigate one cognitive process involved : semantic priming of words in memory .

label: Research method
text: A framework for conceptualizing the role of semantic priming in search interaction is presented , along with results from two experiments that applied research methods from cognitive psychology , in an investigation of word selection and subsequent search for selected words .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that word selection activates related words in memory and that looking for a selected word among related words is effortful .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The finding suggests that semantic priming may play a role in the difficulties people experience when reformulating queries .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Ideas for continued development of semantic priming methods and their use in future research are also presented .

label: Research method
text: We use a Web of Science data set consisting of 3.6 million articles published in 2003 to 2008 and classified into 5,119 clusters .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main Research findings/conclusions are the following .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , the universality claim , according to which all university-citation distributions , appropriately normalized , follow a single functional form , is not supported by the data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Second , the 500 university citation distributions are all highly skewed and very similar .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Broadly speaking , university citation distributions appear to behave as if they differ by a relatively constant scale factor over a large , intermediate part of their support .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Third , citation-impact differences between universities account for 3.85 % of overall citation inequality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This percentage is greatly reduced when university citation distributions are normalized using their mean normalized citation scores ( MNCSs ) as normalization factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , regarding practical consequences , we only need a single explanatory model for the type of high skewness characterizing all university citation distributions , and the similarity of university citation distributions goes a long way in explaining the similarity of the university rankings obtained with the MNCS and the Top 10 % indicator .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: An agenda for future research on information credibility is also discussed .

label: Research method
text: This study examines the preference for e-books and print books in the contexts of reading Research questions , reading situation , and contextual variables such as age , gender , education level , race/ethnicity , income , community type , and Internet use .

label: Research questions
text: In addition , this study aims to identify factors that contribute to e-book adoption .

label: Research method
text: Participants were a nationally representative sample of 2,986 people in the United States from the Reading Habits Survey , conducted by the Pew Research Center 's Internet & American Life Project ( http : //pewinternet.org/Shared-Content/Data-Sets/2011/December-2011-Reading -Habits.aspx ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While the results of this study support the notion that e-books have firmly established a place in people 's lives , due to their convenience of access , e-books are not yet positioned to replace print books .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Both print books and e-books have unique attributes and serve irreplaceable functions to meet people 's reading needs , which may vary by individual demographic , contextual , and situational factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: At this point , the leading significant predictors of e-book adoption are the number of books read , the individual 's income , the occurrence and frequency of reading for research topics of interest , and the individual 's Internet use , followed by other variables such as race/ethnicity , reading for work/school , age , and education .

label: Research method
text: Main path analysis , a method used commonly to trace the most critical path in a citation network , helps describe the developmental trajectory of a research field .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study extends the main path analysis method and applies text-mining techniques in the new method , which reflects the trajectory of conceptual development in an academic research field more accurately than citation frequency , which represents only the articles examined .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Articles can be merged based on similarity of concepts , and by merging concepts the history of a research field can be described more precisely .

label: Research method
text: The new method was applied to the h-index and text mining fields .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The precision , recall , and F-measures of the h-index were 0.738 , 0.652 , and 0.658 and those of text-mining were 0.501 , 0.653 , and 0.551 , respectively .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Last , this study not only establishes the conceptual trajectory map of a research field , but also recommends keywords that are more precise than those used currently by researchers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These precise keywords could enable researchers to gather related works more quickly than before .

label: Research method
text: On the basis of the supplementary data , we up-scaled the design using Web of Science data for the decade 2003-2013 and OECD funding data for the corresponding decade assuming a 2-year delay ( 2001-2011 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using negative binomial regression analysis , we found very small coefficients , but the effects of international collaboration are positive and statistically significant , whereas the effects of government funding are negative , an order of magnitude smaller , and statistically nonsignificant ( in two of three analyses ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In other words , international collaboration improves the impact of research articles , whereas more government funding tends to have a small adverse effect when comparing OECD countries .

label: Research method
text: The study used interviews to examine how refugees and asylum seekers dealt with their information needs , finding that information gaps were bridged through people and places .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: People included friends , solicitors , and caseworkers , whereas places included service providers , detention centers , and refugee camps .

label: Research method
text: The information needs matrix was used as an analytical tool to examine the operation of sources on refuge-seekers ' integration journeys .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions expand understandings of information sources and information grounds .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The matrix can be used to enhance host societies ' capacity to make appropriate information available and to provide evidence for the implementation of the information needs matrix .

label: Research questions
text: Behavioral financial theory draws on social psychology to explain some of the irrational behaviors associated with financial decisions to help explain some of the fluctuations .

label: Research questions
text: In this study we argue that social media users who demonstrate an interest in finance can offer insights into ways in which irrational behaviors may affect a stock market .

label: Research method
text: To test this , we analyzed all the data collected over a 3-month period in 2011 from Tencent Weibo ( one of the largest microblogging websites in China ) .

label: Research method
text: We designed a social influence ( SI ) -based Tencent finance-related moods model to simulate investors ' irrational behaviors , and designed a Tencent Moods-based Stock Trend Analysis ( TM_STA ) model to detect correlations between Tencent moods and the Hushen-300 index ( one of the most important financial indexes in China ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results show that the proposed method can help explain the data fluctuation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The Research findings/conclusions support the existing behavioral financial theory , and can help to understand short-term rises and falls in a stock market .

label: Research method
text: We use behavioral financial theory to further explain our Research findings/conclusions , and to propose a trading model to verify the proposed model .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: What makes archival collections valuable as evidence is that they are organized in a way that connects the materials to their creator ( s ) , their associated activities , and recordkeeping systems .

label: Research questions
text: In order to create this organization archivists engage in a complex process that involves arranging materials physically and intellectually .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This arrangement focuses on documenting the original order of the materials and making them evident to secondary users .

label: Research questions
text: The time-consuming nature of this process has resulted in a massive backlog of unprocessed ( and thus unavailable ) collections , which represents an impediment to the investigative activities of scholars and researchers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To help alleviate such a situation , this article presents a novel approach to archival arrangement , using tabletop computers and digitized images .

label: Research method
text: The article explains the project design and implementation and discusses the evaluation results .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This work provides several major contributions to the field , including : a new system that allows archival collections to be arranged digitally , new methods and metrics for evaluating archival arrangements , a detailed analysis of the steps involved in archival arrangement and how they correlate with the final outcomes of the process , and a method for analyzing arrangements based on the topologies created by processing archivists .

label: Research method
text: For this , we conducted an analysis of the availability statuses of over 2.6 million Twitter mentions received by the 1,154 most tweeted scientific publications recorded by up to October 2017 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that of the Twitter mentions for these highly tweeted publications , about 14.3 % had become unavailable by April 2019 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Deletion of tweets by users is the main reason for unavailability , followed by suspension and protection of Twitter user accounts .

label: Research method
text: This study proposes two measures for describing the Twitter dissemination structures of publications : Degree of Originality ( i.e. , the proportion of original tweets received by an article ) and Degree of Concentration ( i.e. , the degree to which retweets concentrate on a single original tweet ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Twitter metrics of publications with relatively low Degree of Originality and relatively high Degree of Concentration were observed to be at greater risk of becoming unstable due to the potential disappearance of their Twitter mentions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In light of these results , we emphasize the importance of paying attention to the potential risk of unstable Twitter counts , and the significance of identifying the different Twitter dissemination structures when studying the Twitter metrics of scientific publications .

label: Research questions
text: Due to the interdependent nature of queries in a session , it has been challenging to analyze query reformulation data while controlling for possible dependencies among queries .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study proposes a multilevel modeling approach in an attempt to analyze the effects of contextual factors and system features on types of query reformulation , as well as the relationship between types of query reformulation and search performance within a single research model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results revealed that system features and users ' educational background significantly influence users ' query reformulation behaviors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , types of query reformulation had a significant impact on search performance .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The main contribution of this study lies in that it adopted the multilevel modeling method to analyze query reformulation behavior while considering the nested structure of search session data .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Multilevel analysis enables us to design an extensible research model to include both session-level and action-level factors , which provides a more extended understanding of the relationships among factors that influence query reformulation behavior and search performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The multilevel modeling used in this study has practical implications for future query reformulation studies .

label: Research method
text: The ex-ante peer evaluation ( EXANTE ) of N=8,496 grant applications submitted to the Austrian Science Fund from 1999 to 2009 was statistically analyzed .

label: Research method
text: For 1,689 funded research projects an ex-post peer evaluation ( EXPOST ) was also available ; for the rest of the grant applications a multilevel missing data imputation approach was used to consider verification bias for the first time in peer-review research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Without imputation , the predictive validity of EXANTE was low ( r=.26 ) but underestimated due to verification bias , and with imputation it was r=.49 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: That is , the decision-making procedure is capable of selecting the best research proposals for funding .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the EXANTE there were several potential biases ( e.g. , gender ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: With respect to the EXPOST there was only one real bias ( discipline-specific and year-specific differential prediction ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The novelty of this contribution is , first , the combining of theoretical concepts of validity and fairness with a missing data imputation approach to correct for verification bias and , second , multilevel modeling to test peer review-based funding decisions for both validity and fairness in terms of potential and real biases .

label: Research method
text: Through qualitative coding and bibliometric methods , this meta-synthesis provides an in-depth description of acknowledgments research and reveals the five main thematic categories that emerge from this corpus of literature .

label: Research method
text: Adopting a historical approach , this review shows a diversified and scattered research landscape .

label: Research questions
text: Despite five decades of analysis putting forward the potential value of acknowledgments as markers of scientific capital , the literature still lacks consensus as to the value and functions of acknowledgments within the reward system of science .

label: Research method
text: This study adopted a design-based approach to incorporate robotic assistance in investigating the book-locating behaviors of child patrons , and developed a service robot for child patrons in library settings .

label: Research method
text: We describe the iterative cycles and process to develop a robot to assist with locating resources in libraries .

label: Research method
text: Stakeholders , including child patrons and librarians , were consulted about their needs , preferences , and performance in locating library resources with robotic assistance .

label: Research method
text: Their needs were analyzed and incorporated into the design of the library robot to provide comprehensive support .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of the study suggest that the library robot was effective as a mobile and humanoid service agent for providing motivation and knowledgeable guidance to help child patrons in the initially complicated sequence of locating resources .

label: Research questions
text: Such challenges may be particularly acute when laypeople are considering specialized or technical information pertaining to topics over which knowledge is contested .

label: Research method
text: Within a constructivist grounded theory study of the health information practices of 39 young parents in urban Canada , a complex practice of information triangulation was observed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Triangulation comprised an iterative process of seeking , assessment , and sense-making , and typically resulted in a decision or action .

label: Research method
text: This paper examines the emergent concept of information triangulation in everyday life , using data from the young parent study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Triangulation processes in this study could be classified as one of four types , and functioned as an exercise of agency in the face of structures of expertise and exclusion .

label: Research questions
text: Although triangulation has long been described and discussed as a practice among scientific researchers wishing to validate and enrich their data , it has rarely been identified as an everyday practice in information behavior research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Future investigations should consider the use of information triangulation for other types of information , including by other populations and in other areas of contested knowledge .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Many previous studies have relied on online social network data , providing insights into the ISB of those with Internet access .

label: Research questions
text: However , in a large-scale natural disaster such as the Great East Japan Earthquake of 2011 , people in the most severely affected areas tended to have limited Internet access .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Therefore , an alternative data source should be explored to investigate disaster-related ISB .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study 's contributions are twofold .

label: Research method
text: First , we provide a detailed description of natural disaster-related ISB of people who experienced a large-scale earthquake and tsunami , based on analysis of written testimonies published by local authorities .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This provided insight into the relationship between information needs , channels , and sources of disaster-related ISB .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Also , our approach facilitates the study of ISB of people without Internet access both during and after a disaster .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Second , we provide empirical evidence to demonstrate that the temporal stages of a disaster can characterize people 's ISB during the disaster .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Therefore , we propose further consideration of the temporal aspects of events for improved understanding of disaster-related ISB .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , the reasons that Wikipedia is still struggling to gain acceptance among many academics and higher education professionals are identified .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These include common misconceptions about Wikipedia , doubts about its quality , uneasiness with the challenge that it poses to the traditional peer-review system , and a lack of career-enhancing motivations related to using Wikipedia .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Second , the benefits of teaching with Wikipedia for educators , students , and the wider society , as discussed in the current teaching literature , are explored .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , the article presents an argument for using Wikipedia in a variety of ways to help students develop critical and academic writing skills .

label: Research method
text: The body of scientific literature examined in this investigation was constituted from scientific research that developed alongside the epidemic and was extracted from MEDLINE , a bibliographic database of the United States .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: National Library of Medicine .

label: Research method
text: Content analysis methods were employed for qualitative data reduction , and regression analysis was used to assess whether variation in the trajectory of the epidemic co-occurred with variation in the publication of specific genres of content within the scientific literature relating to HIV/AIDS .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The regression model confirmed a statistically significant association between the representative body of HIV/AIDS scientific literature and the epidemic trajectory , and identified three research categories , namely , ameliorative drug treatments , other clinical protocols , and health education , as being most significantly associated with the epidemic trajectory .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Implicit in the Research findings/conclusions of this study are areas of scientific research that are of functional and practical interest to clinicians , policy makers , the lay public , and contributors to the body of scientific literature .

label: Research method
text: The social website Goodreads seems to be a reasonable source for this Research questions because it includes a large number of book reviews and ratings by many users inside and outside of academia .

label: Research method
text: To check this , Goodreads book metrics were compared with different book-based impact indicators for 15,928 academic books across broad fields .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Goodreads engagements were numerous enough in the arts ( 85 % of books had at least one ) , humanities ( 80 % ) , and social sciences ( 67 % ) for use as a source of impact evidence .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Low and moderate correlations between Goodreads book metrics and scholarly or non-scholarly indicators suggest that reader feedback in Goodreads reflects the many Research questionss of books rather than a single type of impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although Goodreads book metrics can be manipulated , they could be used guardedly by academics , authors , and publishers in evaluations .

label: Research method
text: Quantitative data were collected via an online questionnaire distributed to students on various postgraduate programs at a large UK university .

label: Research method
text: In total , 291 responses were processed for descriptive statistics , Principal Component Analysis , and Poisson regression .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Search engines are the most frequently used among the four channels of information discussed in this study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Credibility , ease of use , style , usefulness , and recommendation are the key factors influencing users ' judgments of information characteristics ( explaining over 62 % of the variance ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Poisson regression indicated that individuals ' channel experience , age , student status , health status , and triangulation ( comparing sources ) as well as style , credibility , usefulness , and recommendation are substantive predictors for channel selection of OHI .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Recently , while many researchers have adopted generative probabilistic models for topic detection and tracking , few have compared generative probabilistic models with traditional cocitation and co-word methods in terms of their overall performance .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we compare the performance of hierarchical Dirichlet process ( HDP ) , a promising generative probabilistic model , with that of the 2 traditional topic detecting and tracking methodscocitation analysis and co-word analysis .

label: Research method
text: We visualize and explore the relationships between topics identified by the 3 methods in hierarchical edge bundling graphs and time flow graphs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our result shows that HDP is more sensitive and reliable than the other 2 methods in both detecting and tracking emerging topics .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Furthermore , we demonstrate the important topics and topic evolution trends in the literature of terrorism research with the HDP method .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The inclusion of creativity in originality , in a minimal degree of creativity , and in a creative spark below the level required for originality , is first established .

label: Research method
text: Conditions for creativity are simultaneously derived .

label: Research method
text: Clauses negatively implying creativity are then identified and considered .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The clauses that imply creativity can be extensively correlated with conceptions of computability .

label: Research method
text: The negative of creativity is then understood as an automatic mechanical or computational procedure or a so routine process that results in a highly routine product .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Conversely , creativity invariantly involves a not mechanical procedure .

label: Research method
text: The not mechanical is then populated by meaning , in accord with accepted distinctions , drawing on a range of discourses .

label: Research questions
text: Meaning is understood as a different level of analysis to the syntactic or mechanical and also as involving direct human engagement with meaning .

label: Research questions
text: As direct engagement with meaning , it can be connected to classic concepts of creativity , through the association of dissimilars .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Creativity is finally understood as not mechanical human activity above a certain level of routinicity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Creativity is then integrated with a minimal degree of creativity and with originality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The level of creativity required for a minimal degree is identified as intellectual .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The combination of an intellectual level with a sufficient amount of creativity can be read from the exchange values connected with the product of creative activity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Humanly created bibliographic records and indexes are then possible correlates to , or constituents of , a minimal degree of creativity .

label: Research method
text: A four-stage discriminatory process for determining originality is then specified .

label: Research method
text: Finally , the strength and value of the argument are considered .

label: Research method
text: We searched the Web of Science and the Chinese National Knowledge Infrastructure database for papers related to EBM .

label: Research method
text: We applied information visualization techniques , citation analysis , cocitation analysis , cocitation cluster analysis , and network analysis to construct historiographies , themes networks , and chronological theme maps regarding EBM in China and the West .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: EBM appeared to develop in 4 stages : incubation ( 1972-1992 in the West vs. 1982-1999 in China ) , initiation ( 1992-1993 vs. 1999-2000 ) , rapid development ( 1993-2000 vs. 2000-2004 ) , and stable distribution ( 2000 onwards vs. 2004 onwards ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although there was a lag in EBM initiation in China compared with the West , the pace of development appeared similar .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our study shows that important differences exist in research themes , domain structures , and development depth , and in the speed of adoption between China and the West .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In the West , efforts in EBM have shifted from education to practice , and from the quality of evidence to its translation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In China , there was a similar shift from education to practice , and from production of evidence to its translation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , this concept has diffused to other healthcare areas , leading to the development of evidence-based traditional Chinese medicine , evidence-based nursing , and evidence-based policy making .

label: Research method
text: We evaluated different methods for acquiring user profiles based on declared and actual interest in various news topics and items .

label: Research method
text: In an experiment , 36 students rated their interest in six news topics and in specific news items and read on 6 days standard , nonpersonalized editions and personalized ( basic or adaptive ) news editions .

label: Research method
text: We measured subjective satisfaction with the editions and expressed preferences , along with objective measures , to infer actual interest in items .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Users ' declared interest in news topics did not strongly predict their actual interest in specific news items .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Satisfaction with all news editions was high , but participants preferred the personalized editions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: User interest was weakly correlated with reading duration , article length , and reading order .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Different measures predicted interest in different news topics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Explicit measures predicted interest in relatively clearly defined topics such as sports , but were less appropriate for broader topics such as science and technology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results indicate that explicit and implicit methods should be combined to generate user profiles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We suggest that a personalized newspaper should contain both general information and personalized items , selected based on specific combinations of measures for each of the different news topics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the Research findings/conclusions , we present a general model to decide on the personalization of news content to generate personalized editions for readers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An incomplete metadata record is a record of degraded quality .

label: Research questions
text: Existing approaches to measure metadata completeness limit their scope in counting the existence of values in fields , regardless of the metadata hierarchy as defined in international standards .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Such a traditional approach overlooks several issues that need to be taken into account .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper presents a fine-grained metrics system for measuring metadata completeness , based on field completeness .

label: Research method
text: A metadata field is considered to be a container of multiple pieces of information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this regard , the proposed system is capable of following the hierarchy of metadata as it is set by the metadata schema and admeasuring the effect of multiple values of multivalued fields .

label: Research method
text: An application of the proposed metrics system , after being configured according to specific user requirements , to measure completeness of a real-world set of metadata is demonstrated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results prove its ability to assess the sufficiency of metadata to describe a resource and provide targeted measures of completeness throughout the metadata hierarchy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One of the major resources for environmental scanning is online news documents , which are readily accessible on news websites or infomediaries .

label: Research questions
text: However , the proliferation of the World Wide Web , which increases information sources and improves information circulation , has vastly expanded the amount of information to be scanned .

label: Research questions
text: Thus , it is essential to develop an effective event episode discovery mechanism to organize news documents pertaining to an event of interest .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we propose two new metrics , Term Frequency x Inverse Document Frequency ( Tempo ) ( TFxIDF ( Tempo ) ) and TFxEnhanced-IDFTempo , and develop a temporal-based event episode discovery ( TEED ) technique that uses the proposed metrics for feature selection and document representation .

label: Research method
text: Using a traditional TFxIDF-based hierarchical agglomerative clustering technique as a performance benchmark , our empirical evaluation reveals that the proposed TEED technique outperforms its benchmark , as measured by cluster recall and cluster precision .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , the use of TFxEnhanced-IDFTempo significantly improves the effectiveness of event episode discovery when compared with the use of TFxIDF ( Tempo ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Several previous studies have reported differences in user interaction between conventional desktop computer and mobile device-based web searches , so it is imperative to consider the differences in user behavior for web search engine interface design on mobile devices .

label: Research questions
text: However , it is still unknown how the diversification of screen sizes on hand-held devices affects how users search .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we investigate search performance and behavior on three different small screen sizes : early smart phones , recent smart phones , and phablets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found no significant difference with respect to the efficiency of carrying out tasks , however participants exhibited different search behaviors : less eye movement within top links on the larger screen , fast reading with some hesitation before choosing a link on the medium , and frequent use of scrolling on the small screen .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This result suggests that the presentation of web search results for each screen needs to take into account differences in search behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We suggest several ideas for presentation design for each screen size .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions indicate that the elaborations are based on two main approaches : adding novel , context-specific components in the model and redefining and restructuring the components .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The elaborations have contributed to conceptual growth in three major ways .

text: First , integrating formerly separate parts of knowledge ; second , generalizing and explaining lower abstraction-level knowledge through higher-level constructs ; and third , expanding knowledge by identifying new characteristics of the object of study , that is , information-seeking behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that automated Twitter accounts create a considerable amount of tweets to scientific articles and that they behave differently than common social bots , which has critical implications for the use of raw tweet counts in research evaluation and assessment .

label: Research questions
text: Collaborations have been studied and encouraged in many disciplines .

label: Research questions
text: However , little is known about how a team really functions from the detailed division of labor within .

label: Research questions
text: In this research , we investigate the patterns of scientific collaboration and division of labor within individual scholarly articles by analyzing their co-contributorship networks .

label: Research method
text: Co-contributorship networks are constructed by performing the one-mode projection of the author-task bipartite networks obtained from 138,787 articles published in PLoS journals .

label: Research method
text: Given an article , we define 3 types of contributors : Specialists , Team-players , and Versatiles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specialists are those who contribute to all their tasks alone ; team-players are those who contribute to every task with other collaborators ; and versatiles are those who do both .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that team-players are the majority and they tend to contribute to the 5 most common tasks as expected , such as data analysis and performing experiments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The specialists and versatiles are more prevalent than expected by our designed 2 null models .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Versatiles tend to be senior authors associated with funding and supervision .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specialists are associated with 2 contrasting roles : the supervising role as team leaders or marginal and specialized contributors .

label: Research questions
text: At the same time , firms are increasingly dependent on employees ' willingness and ability to make sense of novel tasks , problems , and rapidly changing situations .

label: Research questions
text: Yet , in spite of its importance , the impact of technology-enabled distributed work arrangements on sensemaking behavior is largely unknown .

label: Research questions
text: Sensemaking remains something that is perceived by many to be an idiosyncratic behavior that is , at best , loosely related to sociotechnical context and culture .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing on previous studies of cognitive dispositions ( need for cognition , tendency for decisiveness , intolerance for ambiguity , and close-mindedness ) and research on how technology-enabled distributed work arrangements affect interpersonal interaction , we theorize how workgroup geographic distribution interacts with individual cognitive differences to affect employees ' willingness to engage in the core sociocognitive activities of sensemaking .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that the consequences of individual tendencies can vary under different work arrangements , suggesting that managers seeking to facilitate sensemaking activities must make careful choices about the composition of distributed work groups , as well as how collaboration technologies can be used to encourage sensemaking behaviors .

label: Research questions
text: The frontline of defense against such threats is the privacy settings controls provided by OSNs such as Facebook .

label: Research questions
text: However , the efficacy of these settings is often undermined by their poor design .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The current design fatigues users with information overload and fails to provide them with a more integrative and global understanding of their information-sharing practices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this article , we develop a more efficacious design for the display of OSNs ' privacy settings by following recommendations for appropriate use of visualization techniques .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The new wheel interface simplifies the presentation of privacy settings to reduce information overload .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It also incorporates an additional layer of information , indicating the safety of users ' settings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A within-subject experiment with 67 students suggests that this interface is more versatile than the current tabular interfaces typically used on OSNs .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: More important , it allows users to easily comprehend complex information and provides them with a more integrative , higher level understanding of their privacy settings .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research focuses on an important niche at the intersection of information representation , interface design , and OSN privacy .

label: Research method
text: Interdisciplinarity is operationalized by the diversity of subject fields assigned to cited items in the article 's reference list .

label: Research method
text: Subject fields and subfields were obtained from the Leuven-Budapest ( ECOOM ) subject-classification scheme , while disciplinary diversity was measured taking variety , balance , and disparity into account .

label: Research method
text: As diversity measure we use a Hill-type true diversity in the sense of Jost and Leinster-Cobbold .

label: Research method
text: The analysis is conducted in 3 steps .

label: Research method
text: In the first part , the properties of this measure are discussed , and , on the basis of these properties it is shown that the measure has the potential to serve as an indicator of interdisciplinarity .

label: Research method
text: In the second part the applicability of this indicator is shown using selected journals from several research fields ranging from mathematics to social sciences .

label: Research method
text: Finally , the often-heard argument , namely , that interdisciplinary research exhibits larger visibility and impact , is studied on the basis of these selected journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Yet , as only 7 journals , representing a total of 15,757 articles , are studied , albeit chosen to cover a large range of interdisciplinarity , further research is still needed .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article demonstrates the use of data analysis and visualization as a means to empower students , teachers , researchers , and platform developers by making large volumes of data easy to understand .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , we introduce the insight needs of different stakeholder groups .

text: Second , we compare the wide variety of data provided by major MOOC platforms .

label: Research method
text: We then review the state of the art MOOC visual analytics using a tabulation of stakeholder needs versus visual analytics workflow types .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Finally , we present new data analysis and visualization workflows for statistical , geospatial , and topical insights .

label: Research method
text: The workflows have been optimized and validated in the Information Visualization MOOC ( IVMOOC ) annually taught at Indiana University since 2013 .

label: Research findings/conclusions

label: Research questions
text: Over the past several years , it has also become evident that user-centered evaluation based on realistic tasks is essential for creating systems that are commercially marketable .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although user-oriented research has been increasing , the MIR field is still lacking in holistic , user-centered approaches to evaluating music services beyond measuring the performance of search or classification algorithms .

label: Research method
text: In light of this need , we conducted a user study exploring how users evaluate their overall experience with existing popular commercial music services , asking about their interactions with the system as well as situational and personal characteristics .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , we present a qualitative heuristic evaluation of commercial music services based on Jakob Nielsen 's 10 usability heuristics for user interface design , and also discuss 8 additional criteria that may be used for the holistic evaluation of user experience in MIR systems .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we recommend areas of future user research raised by trends and patterns that surfaced from this user study .

label: Research method
text: First , we compare a Web of Science ( WoS ) journal-level classification system , consisting of 236 subject categories , and a publication-level algorithmically constructed system , denoted G8 , consisting of 5,119 clusters .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The result is that the consequences of the move from the WoS to the G8 system using the Top 1 % citation impact indicator are much greater than the consequences of this move using the Top 10 % indicator .

label: Research method
text: Second , we compare the G8 classification system and a publication-level alternative of the same family , the G6 system , consisting of 1,363 clusters .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The result is that , although less important than in the previous case , the consequences of the move from the G6 to the G8 system under the Top 1 % indicator are still of a large order of magnitude .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For a specific event , messages collected from the Twitter Stream based on either location constraint or predefined keywords would contain a lot of noise .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose a method to achieve both high-precision and high-recall in collecting event-related tweets .

label: Research method
text: Our method involves an automatic keyword generation component , and an event-related tweet identification component .

label: Research method
text: For keyword generation , we consider three properties of candidate keywords , namely relevance , coverage , and evolvement .

label: Research method
text: The keyword updating mechanism enables our method to track the main topics of tweets along event development .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To minimize annotation effort in identifying event-related tweets , we adopt active learning and incorporate multiple-instance learning which assigns labels to bags instead of instances ( that is , individual tweets ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Through experiments on two real-world events , we demonstrate the superiority of our method against state-of-the-art alternatives .

label: Research questions
text: Research on collective trolling , which involves an organized group trolling effort , is in its infancy perhaps because early works on online trolling depicted it as the deviant behavior of individuals who acted in isolation and under hidden identity .

label: Research questions
text: Thus , it is still unclear what collective trolling is and how it evolves .

label: Research method
text: To address this gap , we collected 12,840 posts and comments pertinent to a brief , controversial , and very visible collective trolling event .

label: Research questions
text: The event , which surrounded Chinese rapper PG One on the Chinese microblogging platformSina Weibo , received 40 million reads in 1 day and a lot of media attention .

label: Research method
text: Based on a thematic content analysis of 480 posts , we describe the collective trolling lifecycle through five distinct stages defined by posting frequency and content of posts .

label: Research questions
text: We also explain the transformation of participants ' roles , tactics , motives , behavioral tone , and the variations in their thematic content , stakeholder group affiliation , and roles over time .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The major contributions of the study are the characterization of collective trolling , and the addition of a lifecycle model to the understanding of trolling as sociotechnical , context-dependent , and multidimensional phenomenon .

label: Research method
text: Concretely , we compare the citations received by American scientists in Nature , Science , and the Proceedings of theNationalAcademy ofSciences of theUnitedStates ofAmerica ( PNAS ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is shown that , statistically , American scientists publishing in Nature and Science do not benefit from international collaboration .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This statement also holds for communicated submissions , but not for direct and for contributed submissions , to PNAS .

label: Research questions
text: This article examines some of these , namely , whether the sex , age , and identifiability of blog authors , as well as the genre of communication , affect communication strategies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions suggest that the level of identifiability of the blog author has a limited effect upon their communication strategies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , sex appeared to influence online behavior in so far as men were more likely to swear and attack others in their blogs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Genre had an important influence on disclosure with more self-disclosure taking place in the diary genre ( i.e. , blogs in which people talk about their own lives ) comparative to the filter genre ( i.e. , blogs in which people talk about events external to their lives ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Age affected both self-disclosure and language use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For example , younger bloggers tended to use more swearing , express more negative emotions and disclose more personal information about others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions suggest that age , sex , genre , and identifiability form a cluster of variables that influence the language style and self-disclosure patterns of bloggers ; however , the level of identifiability of the blogger may be less important in this respect .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Implications of these Research findings/conclusions are discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We surveyed 100 computer science students and found that 94 % ( of respondents ) searched for places online ; 87 % had done so as part of a group .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Search for place by multiple active participants was experienced by 78 % , with group sizes typically being 2 or 3 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Search occurred in a range of settings with both desktop PCs and mobile devices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Difficulties were reported with coordinating tasks , sharing results , and making decisions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that finding a place of interest is a quite different group-based search than other multiparty information-seeking activities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that local search systems , their interfaces and the devices that access them can be made more usable for collaborative search if they include support for coordination , sharing of results , and decision making .

label: Research questions
text: Although most sentiment analysis addresses commercial tasks , such as extracting opinions from product reviews , there is increasing interest in the affective dimension of the social web , and Twitter in particular .

label: Research questions
text: Most sentiment analysis algorithms are not ideally suited to this task because they exploit indirect indicators of sentiment that can reflect genre or topic instead .

label: Research questions
text: Hence , such algorithms used to process social web texts can identify spurious sentiment patterns caused by topics rather than affective phenomena .

label: Research method
text: This article assesses an improved version of the algorithm SentiStrength for sentiment strength detection across the social web that primarily uses direct indications of sentiment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results from six diverse social web data sets ( MySpace , Twitter , YouTube , Digg , Runners World , BBC Forums ) indicate that SentiStrength 2 is successful in the sense of performing better than a baseline approach for all data sets in both supervised and unsupervised cases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: SentiStrength is not always better than machine-learning approaches that exploit indirect indicators of sentiment , however , and is particularly weaker for positive sentiment in news-related discussions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , the results suggest that , even unsupervised , SentiStrength is robust enough to be applied to a wide variety of different social web contexts .

label: Research method
