text: Respondents to our survey are mostly active in the information sciences , including librarians .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Besides WTW , other attributes included in the study are the quality of the editorial board , the quality of referee reports , the probability of being accepted , the ISI impact factor , and the standing of the journal among peers .

label: Research method
text: Interaction effects originating from scientists ' personal characteristics ( age , region of origin , motivations to publish ) with the WTW are highlighted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A difference was made between submitting a high quality article and a standard article .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among the interesting results obtained from our analysis we mention that for a high-quality article , researchers are willing to wait some 18 months longer for a journal with an ISI impact factor above 2 than for a journal without an impact factor , keeping all other factors constant .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For a standard article , the WTW decreases to some 8 months .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Gender had no effect on our conclusions .

label: Research method
text: To effectively study major life transitions and events , we surveyed a large U.S. sample ( n = 554 ) to create the Major Life Events Taxonomy , a list of 121 life events in 12 categories .

label: Research method
text: We then applied this taxonomy to a second large U.S. survey sample ( n = 775 ) to understand on average how much social readjustment each event required , how likely each event was to be shared on social media with different types of audiences , and how much online network separation each involved .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that social readjustment is positively correlated with sharing on social media , with both broad audiences and close ties as well as in online spaces separate from one 's network of known ties .

label: Research questions
text: Some life transitions involve high levels of sharing with both separate audiences and broad audiences on social media , providing evidence for what previous research has called social media as social transition machinery .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Researchers can use the Major Life Events Taxonomy to examine how people 's life transition experiences relate to their behaviors , technology use , and health and well-being outcomes .

label: Research method
text: Function analysis was based on manual coding of a small dataset in the field of library and information studies , whereas the analyses by frequency and location used both this small dataset and a large dataset from PubMed Central .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Strong evidence was found that self-citations appear more likely to serve as substantial citations in a text than do external citations .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This finding challenges previous studies that assumed that self-citations should be discounted or even removed and suggests that self-citations should be given more weight in citation analysis , if anything .

label: Research method
text: The ILT contains 40 multiple-choice questions ( available in Appendix ) with four possible answers and follows the recommendations of information literacy ( IL ) standards for higher education .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It assesses different levels of thinking skills and is intended to be freely available to educators , librarians , and higher education managers , as well as being applicable internationally for study programs in all scientific disciplines .

label: Research method
text: Testing of the ILT was performed on a group of 536 university students .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The overall test analysis confirmed the ILT reliability and discrimination power as appropriate ( Cronbach 's alpha 0.74 ; Ferguson 's delta 0.97 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The students ' average overall achievement was 66 % , and IL increased with the year of study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The students were less successful in advanced database search strategies , which require a combination of knowledge , comprehension , and logic , and in topics related to intellectual property and ethics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A group of 163 students who took a second ILT assessment after participating in an IL-specific study course achieved an average posttest score of 78.6 % , implying an average IL increase of 13.1 % , with most significant improvements in advanced search strategies ( 23.7 % ) , and in intellectual property and ethics ( 12.8 % ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: If so , sources central to international news may also be central to international recall patterns ; in particular , they may reflect an American-centric focus , given the previously proposed central U.S. position in the news marketplace .

label: Research method
text: We asked people of four different nationalities ( China , Israel , Switzerland , and the United States ) to list all the countries they could name .

label: Research method
text: We also constructed a network representation of the world for each nation based on the co-occurrence pattern of countries in the news .

label: Research method
text: To compare news and memories , we developed a computational model that predicts the recall order of countries based on the news networks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Consistent with previous reports , the U.S. news was central to the news networks overall .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , although national recall patterns reflected their corresponding national news sources , the Chinese news was substantially better than other national news sources at predicting both individual and aggregate memories across nations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results suggest that news and memories are related but may also reflect biases in the way information is transferred to long-term memory , potentially biased against the transient coverage of more free presses .

label: Research questions
text: We discuss possible explanations for this Chinese news effect in relation to prominent cognitive and communications theories .

label: Research questions
text: Hence , specific techniques may tend to generate high-impact Research findings/conclusions within science .

label: Research method
text: This article estimates the citation advantage of a technique by calculating the average citation rank of articles using it in the issue of the journal in which they were published .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Applied to structural equation modeling ( SEM ) and four related techniques in 3 broad fields , the results show citation advantages that vary by technique and broad field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For example , SEM seems to be more influential in all broad fields than the 4 simpler methods , with one exception , and hence seems to be particularly worth adding to statistical curricula .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In contrast , Pearson correlation apparently has the highest average impact in medicine but the least in psychology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In conclusion , the results suggest that the importance of a statistical technique may vary by discipline and that even simple techniques can help to generate high-impact research in some contexts .

label: Research method
text: This was undertaken in the context of a qualitative study into decision making in the initial stages of emergency response to major incidents .

label: Research method
text: The research took an interpretive approach in which activity theory is used as an analytical framework .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The research provides further evidence that the context of the activity and individual differences influence the choice of decision mode and associated information behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also established that information is often not used to resolve uncertainty in decision making and indeed information is often sought and used after the decision is made to justify the decision .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we point to the significance of both expertise and confidence in understanding information behavior .

label: Research method
text: The contribution of the research to existing theoretical frameworks is discussed and a modified version of Wilson 's problem-solving model is proposed .

label: Research questions
text: However , such freedom also carries concerns about content quality .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this work , we propose an automatic framework to assess the quality of collaboratively generated content .

label: Research method
text: Quality is addressed as a multidimensional concept , modeled as a combination of independent assessments , each regarding different quality dimensions .

label: Research method
text: Accordingly , we adopt a machine-learning ( ML ) based multiview approach to assess content quality .

label: Research method
text: We perform a thorough analysis of our framework on two different domains : Questions and Answer Forums and Collaborative Encyclopedias .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This allowed us to better understand when and how the proposed multiview approach is able to provide accurate quality assessments .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our main contributions are : ( a ) a general ML multiview framework that takes advantage of different views of quality indicators ; ( b ) the improvement ( up to 30 % ) in quality assessment over the best state-of-the-art baseline methods ; ( c ) a thorough feature and view analysis regarding impact , informativeness , and correlation , based on two distinct domains .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the impact of journal articles extends beyond formal scholarly discourse .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Measuring online scholarly impact calls for new indices , complementary to the older ones .

label: Research method
text: This article examines a possible alternative metric source , blog posts aggregated at ResearchBlogging.org , which discuss peer-reviewed articles and provide full bibliographic references .

label: Research method
text: Articles reviewed in these blogs therefore receive blog citations .

label: Research method
text: We hypothesized that articles receiving blog citations close to their publication time receive more journal citations later than the articles in the same journal published in the same year that did not receive such blog citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Statistically significant evidence for articles published in 2009 and 2010 support this hypothesis for seven of 12 journals ( 58 % ) in 2009 and 13 of 19 journals ( 68 % ) in 2010 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We suggest , based on these results , that blog citations can be used as an alternative metric source .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we investigate how makers obtain information for their makerspace projects .

label: Research method
text: The study focuses on four sources of information : people , documents , experimentation , and prior knowledge .

label: Research method
text: On the basis of interviews with 13 makers , we analyze their use of these information sources in relation to different knowledge areas , creative-process stages , and relevance criteria .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our main Research findings/conclusions are that ( a ) experimentation is a prime source of information , ( b ) ease and pleasure are the dominant relevance criteria , ( c ) process and situation receive little attention , and ( d ) information sources vary across process stages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , experimentation is the dominant information source during the construction stage .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , the relevance criteria show that the makers turn to people because it is pleasurable , to documents because it is easy , and to experimentation because it results in quality products .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These results emphasize the importance of experimentation and suggest that it warrants closer attention in studies of the information behavior of makers and , more broadly , creative professionals .

label: Research method
text: Users ' access trails in terms of category sequences in click-through data are employed to mine users ' web browsing behaviors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Contextual relationships of URL categories are learned by the hidden Markov model .

label: Research method
text: The top-level domains ( TLDs ) extracted from URLs themselves and the corresponding categories are caught by the TLD model .

label: Research method
text: Given a URL to be predicted , its TLD and current context are empirically combined in an aggregation model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition to the uses of the current context , the predictions of the URL accessed previously in different contexts by various users are also considered by majority rule to improve the aggregation model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Large-scale experiments show that the advanced aggregation approach achieves promising performance while maintaining an acceptably low false positive rate .

label: Research questions
text: Different strategies are introduced to integrate the model with the blacklist it generates for filtering objectionable web pages without analyzing their content .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In practice , this is complementary to the existing content analysis from users ' behavioral perspectives .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most of the studies show that the two variables are closely related : An increasing collaboration activity ( measured in terms of number of authors , number of affiliations , and number of countries ) is associated with an increased citation impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , it is not clear whether the increased citation impact is based on the higher quality of papers that profit from more than one scientist giving expert input or other ( citation-specific ) factors .

label: Research method
text: Thus , the current study addresses this question by using two comprehensive data sets with publications ( in the biomedical area ) including quality assessments by experts ( F1000Prime member scores ) and citation data for the publications .

label: Research method
text: The study is based on more than 15,000 papers .

label: Research method
text: Robust regression models are used to investigate the relationship between number of authors , number of affiliations , and number of countries , respectively , and citation impact-controlling for the papers ' quality ( measured by F1000Prime expert ratings ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results point out that the effect of collaboration activities on impact is largely independent of the papers ' quality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The citation advantage is apparently not quality related ; citation-specific factors ( e.g. , self-citations ) seem to be important here .

label: Research questions
text: This article presents a potential solution : an empirical approach to quantitatively measure both the degree and nature of differences among disciplinary tongues through the social and epistemic terms used ( a research area we refer to as discourse epistemetrics ) , in a case study comparing dissertations in philosophy , psychology , and physics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using a support-vector model of machine learning to classify disciplines based on relative frequencies of social and epistemic terms , we were able to markedly improve accuracy over a random selection baseline ( distinguishing between disciplines with as high as 90 % accuracy ) as well as acquire sets of most indicative terms for each discipline by their relative presence or absence .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These lists were then considered in light of Research findings/conclusions of sociological and epistemological studies of disciplines and found to validate the approach 's measure of social and epistemic disciplinary identities and contrasts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the Research findings/conclusions of our study , we conclude by considering the beneficiaries of research in this area , including bibliometricians , students , and science policy makers , among others , as well as laying out a research program that expands the number of disciplines , considers shifts in socio-epistemic identities over time and applies these methods to nonacademic epistemological communities ( e.g. , political groups ) .

label: Research method
text: This mixed-methods study investigates information value cocreation from the social informatics perspective to surface sociotechnical implications for IT design and use , since cocreation is inherently social and technology-mediated .

label: Research questions
text: Specifically , the cocreation of software as an information-intensive product is examined .

label: Research method
text: Data on the cocreation of Xiaomi 's MIUI firmware were collected from two sources : 49 interviews of staff and user participants and web crawling of the cocreation platform .

label: Research method
text: They were analyzed with interpretive analysis , topic modeling , and social network analysis for triangulation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions indicate three sociotechnical information practices co-constituted by information , IT , people , and their activities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Each practice is instrumental in rapidly and continuously converting external information into cocreated information value .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The adsorption information practice attracts new and diverse external information ; the absorption practice integrates external and internal information rapidly by involving users ; the desorption practice allows rapid adoption of the cocreated product so that information value can be realized and demonstrated for further cocreation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Critically analyzing these practices reveals unanticipated or paradoxical issues affecting the design and use of common cocreation technology such as discussion forums .

label: Research questions
text: It also describes the rationale provided by repositories for their decisions to control data or provide means for depositors to do so .

label: Research method
text: Using a purposive exploratory sample , we employed content analysis of repository website documentation , a web survey of repository managers , and selected follow-up interviews to generate data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results describe the range and variation in access and use control policies and tools employed , identifying both commonalities and distinctions across repositories .

label: Research method
text: Using concepts from commons theory as a guiding theoretical framework , our analysis describes the following five dimensions of repository rules , or data commons boundaries : locus of decision making ( depositor vs. repository ) , degree of variation in terms of use within the repository , the mission of the repository in relation to its scholarly field , what use means in relation to specific sorts of data , and types of exclusion .

label: Research questions
text: Leveraging advantages of digital publishing , megajournals are characterized by large publication volume , broad interdisciplinary scope , and peer-review filters that select primarily for scientific soundness as opposed to novelty or originality .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These publishing innovations are complementary and competitive vis-a-vis traditional journals .

label: Research method
text: We analyze how megajournals ( PLOS One , Scientific Reports ) are represented in different fields relative to prominent generalist journals ( Nature , PNAS , Science ) and quasi-megajournals ( Nature Communications , PeerJ ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that both megajournals and prominent traditional journals have distinctive niches , despite the similar interdisciplinary scopes of such journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These niches-defined by publishing volume and disciplinary diversity-are dynamic and varied over the relatively brief histories of the analyzed megajournals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although the life sciences are the predominant contributor to megajournals , there is variation in the disciplinary composition of different megajournals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The growth trajectories and disciplinary composition of generalist journals-including megajournals-reflect changing knowledge dissemination and reward structures in science .

label: Research questions
text: Current interest has turned to making more explicit our commonly tacit knowledge processes that involve people and technology .

label: Research questions
text: Knowledge creation , sharing , and management processes are commonly hidden , and this is even more the case regarding ignorance processes such as the denial and obfuscation of knowledge .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Understanding the construction , generation , and perpetuation of ignorance can : ( i ) provide insights into social phenomena that might otherwise seem inexplicable ( for instance , persistence of urban myths ) , and ( ii ) enable development of interventions to either facilitate ( as with privacy-sensitive material ) or combat ( as with malicious disinformation ) ignorance .

label: Research questions
text: Although several pressing information issues relate to ignorance , agnotology ( the study of ignorance ) has only recently entered into the information science literature .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: An agnotologic approach expands the repertoire of methods and approaches in social informatics , better enabling the field to grapple with pressing contemporary issues of mis/dis/lack of information .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Using Robert Proctor 's typology of constructions of ignorance , this article describes ways that each type may be germane to and within social informatics , highlighting social informatics topics that would benefit from agnotologic exploration , and suggesting theoretical and methodological approaches useful to a social informatics of ignorance .

label: Research questions
text: In order to examine the influential factors that inspire dynamic and eager participation , this study investigates what motivates social media users to share their personal experiences , information , and social support with anonymous others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A variety of information-sharing activities in social media , including creating postings , photos , and videos in 5 different types of social media : Facebook , Twitter , Delicious , YouTube , and Flickr , were observed .

label: Research method
text: Ten factors : enjoyment , self-efficacy , learning , personal gain , altruism , empathy , social engagement , community interest , reciprocity , and reputation , were tested to identify the motivations of social media users based on reviews of major motivation theories and models .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions from this study indicate that all of the 10 motivations are influential in encouraging users ' information sharing to some degree and strongly correlate with one another .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: At the same time , motivations differ across the 5 types of social media , given that they deliver different information content and serve different Research questionss .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Understanding such differences in motivations could benefit social media developers and those organizations or institutes that would like to use social media to facilitate communication among their community members ; appropriate types of social media could be chosen that would fit their own Research questionss and they could develop strategies that would encourage their members to contribute to their communities through social media .

label: Research questions
text: Specifically , it articulates the nature of information practices in the lives of 14 newcomers to Canada who have migrated from the Philippines to the medium-size city of Winnipeg .

label: Research method
text: Using a qualitative and exploratory approach , this study applies a transnational lens to this area of research to make explicit the detailed activities and outcomes of newcomer information practices , in particular drawing out the dimensions and implications of newcomers ' participation within and across local and global social networks , translocal information landscapes , and across their settlement trajectories .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The result is a Translocal Meaning Making process that describes how newcomers come to make sense and use information across distinct and sometimes contradictory information spaces .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions suggest that migrant information practices shift across space and time and are constituted both individually , through cognitive and affective processes , and socially , through shared imaginaries , through interactions within and across translocal information landscapes , and through complex deterritorialized networks of people and resources .

label: Research method
text: Quantitative and qualitative textual analyses are combined to map conceptual relations in these reactions , and to explore how understandings of scholarly communication and publishing relate to specific conceptualizations of science and of the hedging of scientific knowledge .

label: Research method
text: A discussion of the connection of trust and scientific knowledge and of the role of peer review for establishing and communicating this connection provides for the theoretical and topical framing .

label: Research questions
text: Special attention is paid to the pervasiveness of digital technologies in formal scholarly communication processes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Three dimensions of trust are traced in the material analyzed : ( a ) trust through personal experience and informal knowledge , ( b ) trust through organized , internal control , ( c ) trust through form .

label: Research questions
text: The article concludes by discussing how certain understandings of the conditions for trust in science are challenged by perceptions of possibilities for deceit in digital environments .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we investigate retractions from a quantitative perspective , aiming to answer two fundamental questions .

label: Research questions
text: One , how do retractions influence the scholarly impact of retracted papers , authors , and institutions ?

label: Research questions
text: Two , does this influence propagate to the wider academic community through scholarly associations ?

label: Research method
text: Specifically , we analyzed a set of retracted articles indexed in Thomson Reuters Web of Science ( WoS ) , and ran multiple experiments to compare changes in scholarly impact against a control set of nonretracted articles , authors , and institutions .

label: Research method
text: We further applied the Granger Causality test to investigate whether different scientific topics are dynamically affected by retracted papers occurring within those topics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show two key Research findings/conclusions : first , the scholarly impact of retracted papers and authors significantly decreases after retraction , and the most severe impact decrease correlates with retractions based on proven , Research questionsful scientific misconduct ; second , this retraction penalty does not seem to spread through the broader scholarly social graph , but instead has a limited and localized effect .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions may provide useful insights for scholars or science committees to evaluate the scholarly value of papers , authors , or institutions related to retractions .

label: Research method
text: This exploratory mixed-methods study examines how people discuss and disclose the use of two different drugsmarijuana and opioidson Reddit .

label: Research method
text: In this study , hermeneutic content analysis is employed to describe the type of comments people make in forums dedicated to discussions about illicit drugs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: With inductive analysis , seven categories of comments were identified : disclosure , instruction and advice , culture , community norms , moralizing , legality , and banter .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our subsequent quantitative analysis indicates that although the amounts of disclosure are similar in each subreddit , there are more instances of instruction and advice in discussions about opiates , and more examples of banter in comments about marijuana use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In fact , both subreddits have high rates of banter .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that banter fosters disclosure in both subreddits , and that banter and disclosure are linked with information-seeking behaviors in online forums .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This work has implications for future explorations of disclosure online and for public health interventions aimed at disseminating credible information about drug use to at-risk individuals .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article reports on one of the few studies of information sharing during such incidents .

label: Research method
text: Interviews drawing on the critical incident technique were conducted with offshore emergency responders and supplemented by internal organizational reports and observations of emergency response exercises .

label: Research questions
text: We propose a counterintuitive relationship between trust and information sharing .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that better information sharing plays a crucial role in instilling or enhancing trust and that in the time-bound , uncertain , and highly volatile context of offshore emergency response , if trust collapses , then it must be rebuilt swiftly and this can be done through more effective information sharing .

label: Research questions
text: We explore this argument using the activity theory concept of contradictions and argue that apparent contradictions in the activity system and the behavior of emergency responders should be analyzed and interpreted by taking into account crucial contextual characteristics .

label: Research method
text: The article draws on further support from relevant literature , including that of the information science , organization , and communication fields .

label: Research questions
text: We present the Data Practices and Curation Vocabulary ( DPCVocab ) , a functional vocabulary created for specifying relationships among data practices in research , types of data produced and used , and curation roles and activities .

label: Research method
text: The vocabulary consists of 3 categoriesResearch Data Practices , Data , and Curationwith 187 terms validated through empirical studies of scientific data practices in the Earth and life sciences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The present article covers the DPCVocab development process and examines applications for mapping relationships across the 3 categories , identifying factors for projecting curation costs and important differences in curation requirements across disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As a tool for curators , the vocabulary provides a framework for charting curation options and guiding systematic administration of curation services .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It can serve as a shared terminology or lingua franca to support interactions and collaboration among curators , data producers , system developers , and other stakeholders in data infrastructure and services .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The DPCVocab as a whole supports both the technical and the human aspects of professional curation work essential to the modern research system .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Without this information , it is not possible to give a confident interpretation of altmetrics derived from Mendeley .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In response , a survey of 860 Mendeley users shows that it is reasonable to use Mendeley bookmarking counts as an indication of readership because most ( 55 % ) users with a Mendeley library had read or intended to read at least half of their bookmarked publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This was true across all broad areas of scholarship except for the arts and humanities ( 42 % ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: About 85 % of the respondents also declared that they bookmarked articles in Mendeley to cite them in their publications , but some also bookmark articles for use in professional ( 50 % ) , teaching ( 25 % ) , and educational activities ( 13 % ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Of course , it is likely that most readers do not record articles in Mendeley and so these data do not represent all readers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In conclusion , Mendeley bookmark counts seem to be indicators of readership leading to a combination of scholarly impact and wider professional impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The mechanism can also be used to compare the same metric across different academic fields .

label: Research method
text: The mechanism operates by selecting an optimal normalization factor and an optimal distributional adjustment for the rank-score curve , both of which are instrumental in making sound intermetric and interfield journal comparisons .

label: Research questions
text: Ads can greatly affect user perceptions and behavior .

label: Research questions
text: In mobile apps , ads often follow a native format : they are designed to conform in both format and style to the actual content and context of the application .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Clicking on the ad leads users to a second destination , outside of the hosting app , where the unified experience provided by native ads within the app is not necessarily reflected by the landing page the user arrives at .

label: Research questions
text: Little is known about whether and how this type of mobile ads is impacting user experience .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , we use both quantitative and qualitative methods to study the impact of two design decisions for the landing page of a native ad on the user experience : ( i ) native ad style ( following the style of the application ) versus a non-native ad style ; and ( ii ) pages with multimedia versus static pages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found considerable variability in terms of user experience with mobile ad landing pages when varying presentation style and multimedia usage , especially interaction between presence of video and ad style ( native or non-native ) .

label: Research questions
text: We also discuss insights and recommendations for improving the user experience with mobile native ads .

label: Research method
text: This study uses a concrete example in an attempt to evaluate a research institute from the area of social sciences and humanities with the help of data from Google Scholar ( GS ) .

label: Research method
text: In order to use GS for a bibliometric study , we developed procedures for the normalization of citation impact , building on the procedures of classical bibliometrics .

label: Research method
text: In order to test the convergent validity of the normalized citation impact scores , we calculated normalized scores for a subset of the publications based on data from the Web of Science ( WoS ) and Scopus .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Even if scores calculated with the help of GS and the WoS/Scopus are not identical for the different publication types ( considered here ) , they are so similar that they result in the same assessment of the institute investigated in this study : For example , the institute 's papers whose journals are covered in the WoS are cited at about an average rate ( compared with the other papers in the journals ) .

label: Research method
text: This article describes the construction of 6 test collections for cross-language person-entity linking that together span 22 languages .

label: Research method
text: Fully automated components were used together with 2 crowdsourced validation stages to affordably generate ground-truth annotations with an accuracy comparable to that of a completely manual process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The resulting test collections each contain between 642 ( Arabic ) and 2,361 ( Romanian ) person references in non-English texts for which the correct resolution in English Wikipedia is known , plus a similar number of references for which no correct resolution into English Wikipedia is believed to exist .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Fully automated cross-language person-name linking experiments with 20 non-English languages yielded a resolution accuracy of between 0.84 ( Serbian ) and 0.98 ( Romanian ) , which compares favorably with previously reported cross-language entity linking results for Spanish .

label: Research method
text: The synergy at the national level is decomposed at the level of states , Core-Based Statistical Areas ( CBSA ) , and Combined Statistical Areas ( CSA ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We zoom in to the state of California and in more detail to Silicon Valley .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results do not support the assumption of a national system of innovations in the U.S.A .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Innovation systems appear to operate at the level of the states ; the CBSA are too small , so that systemness spills across their borders .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Decomposition of the sample in terms of high-tech manufacturing ( HTM ) , medium-high-tech manufacturing ( MHTM ) , knowledge-intensive services ( KIS ) , and high-tech services ( HTKIS ) does not change this pattern , but refines it .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The East Coast-New Jersey , Boston , and New York-and California are the major players , with Texas a third one in the case of HTKIS .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Chicago and industrial centers in the Midwest also contribute synergy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Within California , Los Angeles contributes synergy in the sectors of manufacturing , the San Francisco area in KIS .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: KIS in Silicon Valley and the Bay Area-a CSA composed of seven CBSA-spill over to other regions and even globally .

label: Research method
text: These numbers can then be compared between the institutes .

label: Research questions
text: This study aims to present a new approach for the evaluation of citation data at the institutional level , based on regression models .

label: Research method
text: As example data , the study includes all articles and reviews from the Web of Science for the publication year 2003 ( n=886,416 papers ) .

label: Research method
text: The study is based on an in-house database of the Max Planck Society .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study investigates how much the expected number of citations for a publication changes if it contains the address of an institute .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The calculation of the expected values allows , on the one hand , investigating how the citation impact of the papers of an institute appears in comparison with the total of all papers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: On the other hand , the expected values for several institutes can be compared with one another or with a set of randomly selected publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Besides the institutes , the regression models include factors which can be assumed to have a general influence on citation counts ( e.g. , the number of authors ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is also crucial for promoting online community health by motivating participation .

label: Research questions
text: However , how gratitude occurs and can be encouraged in online communities is not yet well understood .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This exploratory study investigated how online community users experience gratitude , focusing on how gratitude expression and acknowledgment occurs , can break down or can be reinforced .

label: Research method
text: Semistructured Critical Incident interviews were conducted with 8 users of various online communities , including discussion and support groups , social Q & A sites , and review sites , eliciting 17 memorable examples of giving and receiving thanks online .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions gave rise to a process model of gratitude in online communities-the gratitude cycle , which provides a detailed , holistic understanding of the experience of gratitude online that can inform the design of online community platforms that aim to motivate users to perpetuate the cycle .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An enriched understanding of gratitude in online communities can help ensure future platforms better support the expression and acknowledgment of thanks , encouraging participation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although this theory is one of the dominant models of sensemaking , it has not been extensively tested with a range of sensemaking tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The tasks discussed here focused on making sense of structures rather than processes or narratives .

label: Research method
text: Eleven researchers were asked to construct understanding of how a scientific community in a particular domain is organized ( e.g. , people , relationships , contributions , factors ) by exploring the concept of influence in academia .

label: Research method
text: This topic was chosen because , although researchers frequently handle this type of task , it is unlikely that they have explicitly sought this type of information .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a think-aloud study and semistructured interviews with junior and senior researchers from the human-computer interaction ( HCI ) domain , asking them to identify current leaders and rising stars in both HCI and chemistry .

label: Research method
text: Data were coded and analyzed using the Data/Frame Model to both test and extend the model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Three themes emerged from the analysis : novices and experts ' sensemaking activity chains , constructing frames through indicators , and characteristics of structure tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We propose extensions to the Data/Frame Model to accommodate structure sensemaking .

label: Research questions
text: One successful collection is hosted on the TED ( Technology , Entertainment , Design ) website .

label: Research method
text: This study uses a range of bibliometric ( citation ) and webometric ( usage and bookmarking ) indicators to examine TED videos in order to provide insights into the type and scope of their impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that TED Talks impact primarily the public sphere , with about three-quarters of a billion total views , rather than the academic realm .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Differences were found among broad disciplinary areas , with art and design videos having generally lower levels of impact but science and technology videos generating otherwise average impact for TED .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Many of the metrics were only loosely related , but there was a general consensus about the most popular videos as measured through views or comments on YouTube and the TED site .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , most videos were found in at least one online syllabus and videos in online syllabi tended to be more viewed , discussed , and blogged .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Less-liked videos generated more discussion , although this may be because they are more controversial .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Science and technology videos presented by academics were more liked than those by nonacademics , showing that academics are not disadvantaged in this new media environment .

label: Research method
text: By conducting a thematic analysis of four key UN policy documents related to sustainable development , this paper argues that alongside financial and other resources , access to , and use of , appropriate information are essential for achieving SDGs .

label: Research method
text: The paper also reviews research on information and sustainability undertaken at the iSchools and the computer and human-computer interaction HCI communities .

label: Research questions
text: Given that the mission of iSchools is to connect people and society with the required information through the use of appropriate technologies and tools , this paper argues that iSchools can play a key role in helping people , institutions , and businesses , and thus countries around the world achieve SDGs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The paper identifies 4 broad areas of teaching and research that can help iSchools around the world prepare a trained workforce who can manage , and facilitate access to , information in specific domains and contexts .

label: Research questions
text: It is also argued that cooperation and collaborations among iSchools can promote a culture of sustainable information practices among university graduates and researchers in different disciplines that will pave the way for achieving SDGs in every sector .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The corporate information agency is a corporate library or an information/knowledge center .

label: Research questions
text: CI practitioner refers to those business professionals , in various organizations , who are particularly committed to strategic and competitive intelligence analysis and production activities .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we administered a survey to a sample of 214 CI practitioners to ascertain the extent to which they utilize , are aware of , and perceive the usefulness of corporate information agencies provided by their organizations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: With 63 valid responses , we observed high degrees of use , awareness , and perceived usefulness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Multiple regression results also show significant correlations between perceived usefulness and use of the corporate information agency among the responding CI practitioners .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Supported by empirical evidence , these Research findings/conclusions provide a benchmark of knowledge regarding the value of corporate information agencies in CI practices .

label: Research questions
text: Managing data set producer expectations and guiding future development of library services requires understanding the decisions libraries make about curatorial activities , why they make these decisions , and the effects on future data reuse .

label: Research method
text: We present a study , comprising interviews ( n = 43 ) and ethnographic observation , of two university libraries who partnered with the Sloan Digital Sky Survey ( SDSS ) collaboration to curate a significant astronomy data set .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The two libraries made different choices of the materials to curate and associated services , which resulted in different reuse possibilities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Each of the libraries offered partial solutions to the SDSS leaders ' objectives .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The libraries ' approaches to curation diverged due to contextual factors , notably the extant infrastructure at their disposal ( including technical infrastructure , staff expertise , values and internal culture , and organizational structure ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Data Transfer Process case offers lessons in understanding how libraries choose curation paths and how these choices influence possibilities for data reuse .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Outcomes may not match data producers ' initial expectations but may create opportunities for reusing data in unexpected and beneficial ways .

label: Research questions
text: The aim of this research was to examine the relationship between relevance criteria use and visual behavior in the context of predictive relevance judgments .

label: Research method
text: To address this objective , a multimethod research design was employed that involved observation of participants eye movements , talk-aloud protocols , and postsearch interviews .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , the results reported in this article came from the analysis of 281 predictive relevance judgments made by 24 participants using the Google search engine .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We present a novel stepwise methodological framework for the analysis of relevance judgments and eye movements on the Web and show new patterns of relevance criteria use during predictive relevance judgment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For example , the Research findings/conclusions showed an effect of ranking order and surrogate components ( Title , Summary , and URL ) on the use of relevance criteria .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , differences were observed in the cognitive effort spent between very relevant and not relevant judgments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude with the implications of this study for IR research .

label: Research method
text: Data collected covered journal impact factor ( JIF ) , number of issues per year , number of authors per article , longevity , editorial board membership , frequency of publication , number of databases indexing the journal , number of aggregators providing full-text access , country of publication , JCR categories , Dewey decimal classification , and journal statement of scope .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Three features significantly correlated with JIF : number of editorial board members and number of JCR categories in which a journal is listed correlated positively ; journal longevity correlated negatively with JIF .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Coword analysis of journal descriptions provided a proximity clustering of journals , which differed considerably from the clusters based on editorial board membership .

label: Research method
text: Finally , a multiple linear regression model was built to predict the JIF based on all the collected bibliographic features .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Thus , the current study examines some of the characteristics and motivations common among answerers , who produce health-related answers to questions asked by anonymous others in a social Q & A site , Yahoo !

label: Research method
text: Answers .

label: Research method
text: An online survey questionnaire was distributed to top and recent answerers to investigate their demographics , areas of health expertise , and other characteristics related to answering behaviors online .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , 10 motivation factors are proposed and tested in the survey : enjoyment , efficacy , learning , personal gain , altruism , community interest , social engagement , empathy , reputation , and reciprocity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions show that altruism is the most influential motivation , while personal gain is the least .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Enjoyment and efficacy are more influential than other social motivations , such as reputation or reciprocity , although there are some variations across different groups of answerers .

label: Research method
text: Motivational factors among top answerers or health experts are further analyzed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions of this study have practical implications for promoting health answerers to share knowledge and experiences in social contexts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , the study design of the current study can be used to examine motivations of answerers in other topic areas as well as other social contexts .

label: Research method
text: Three hypotheses were proposed in this study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , research collaboration increases in the post-web stage relative to the pre-web stage .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Second , research collaboration is positively related to research impact , operationally defined as the number of citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Lastly , the positive relationship between research collaboration and research impact is stronger in the post-web stage than that in the pre-web stage .

label: Research method
text: Articles published in the field of information systems in both time periods were collected to test the hypotheses .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The empirical results strongly support H1 and H2 , showing that co-authorship increases in the post-web stage , and positively correlates with citations received by information systems articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The positive effects of interdisciplinary collaborations and collaborations among multiple authors are enhanced in the post-web stage , but such enhancement is not found for international collaboration .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: H3 is partially supported .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the proposed HTEM , topics near the root of the hierarchy are more abstract and also evolve in the longer timescales than those near the leaves .

label: Research questions
text: To achieve this goal , the distance-dependent Chinese restaurant process ( ddCRP ) is extended to a new nested process that is able to simultaneously model the dependencies among data and the relationship between clusters .

label: Research method
text: The HTEM is proposed based on the new process for time-stamped documents , in which the timestamp is utilized to measure the dependencies among documents .

label: Research method
text: Moreover , an efficient Gibbs sampler is developed for the proposed HTEM .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our experimental results on two popular real-world data sets verify that the proposed HTEM can capture coherent topics and discover their hierarchical evolutions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It also outperforms the baseline model in terms of likelihood on held-out data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Heavy investment favoring Gold over Green OA has been associated with increased total publication costs , inequality of opportunity to publish , and concerns about integrity in science reporting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Notwithstanding current fluidity because of ongoing competition for market share between supporters of the major alternative publishing strategies , emerging trends indicate the need for material and human resources to be redirected away from Gold and toward Green OA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Doing so will reduce total publication costs , increase equality of access for authors and readers , and remove the financial incentives that have encouraged poor and corrupt publishing practices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that in the beginning stage , that is , from zero to one citation , high- , medium- , and low-cited publications do not obviously exhibit different lengths of time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , in the accumulative stage , that is , from one to N citations , highly cited publications begin to receive citations much more rapidly than medium- and low-cited publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , as N increases , the difference in receiving new citations among high- , medium- , and low-cited publications increases quite significantly .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose innovative and economic methods of generating knowledge-based structural metadata ( structural keywords ) using a combination of natural language processing-based machine-learning techniques and human intelligence .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By allowing low-barrier participation through a social media system , scholars ( both as authors and users ) can participate in the metadata editing and enhancing process and benefit from more accurate and effective information retrieval .

label: Research method
text: Our experimental web system ScholarWiki uses machine learning techniques , which automatically produce increasingly refined metadata by learning from the structural metadata contributed by scholars .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The cumulated structural metadata add intelligence and automatically enhance and update recursively the quality of metadata , wiki pages , and the machine-learning model .

label: Research questions
text: However , little evidence exists to provide robust methods for assessing the state of any given format technology and describing its evolution over time .

label: Research method
text: This article introduces relevant models from diffusion theory and market research and presents a replicable analysis method to compute models of technology evolution .

label: Research method
text: Data cleansing and the combination of multiple data sources enable the application of nonlinear regression to estimate the parameters of the Bass diffusion model on format technology market lifecycles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Through its application to a longitudinal data set from the UK Web Archive , we demonstrate that the method produces reliable results and show that the Bass model can be used to describe format lifecycles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By analyzing adoption patterns across market segments , new insights are inferred about how the diffusion of formats and products such as applications occurs over time .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The analysis provides a stepping stone to a more robust and evidence-based approach to model technology evolution .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: While there have been efforts at evaluating different aspects of journal impact , the dimension of knowledge trading is largely absent .

label: Research method
text: To fill the gap , this study employed a set of trading-based indicators , including weighted degree centrality , Shannon entropy , and weighted betweenness centrality , to assess sources ' trading impact .

label: Research method
text: These indicators were applied to several time-sliced source-to-source citation networks that comprise 33,634 sources indexed in the Scopus database .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that several interdisciplinary sources , such as Nature , PLoS One , Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences , and Science , and several specialty sources , such as Lancet , Lecture Notes in Computer Science , Journal of the American Chemical Society , Journal of Biological Chemistry , and New England Journal of Medicine , have demonstrated their marked importance in knowledge trading .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , this study also reveals that , overall , sources have established more trading partners , increased their trading volumes , broadened their trading areas , and diversified their trading contents over the past 15 years from 1997 to 2011 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These results inform the understanding of source-level impact assessment and knowledge diffusion .

label: Research method
text: Using the Science Citation Index Expanded , we looked at the yearly percentages of lifetime citations of papers published in 1990 first cited in review articles in 1992 and 1995 in the field of biomedical research , and found that no significant change occurred after citation in a review article , regardless of the papers ' citation activity or specialty .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additional comparison was done for papers from the field of clinical research , and this yielded no meaningful results to support the notion that review articles have any substantial effect on the citation count of the papers they review .

label: Research questions
text: We describe the knowledge loss that occurs when information is aggregated across diverse ontologies into databases or archives relying on a single schema and use a series of illustrative examples demonstrate the significance of this information loss for policy design and implementation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While there are important gains from information aggregation across ontologies , the potential trade-offs involved in creating large-scale databases are significant .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The differences between locally constituted ways of knowing and the organizing ontology used for larger scale databases affects the extent to which these collections , or knowledge banks , provide accurate guidance for policy and action .

label: Research method
text: The article draws on insights from information science and social science to discuss two classes of socio-technical approaches for overcoming information loss at the interface between ontologies : first , technology-enabled efforts to soften ontological interfaces by making data open , unconstructed , and available and/or creating ontologies collaboratively and , second , organizational changes that reduce the need for information to cross interfaces , such as reconstructing knowledge platforms to be more interactive , thereby decentralizing decision-making .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The framing of the challenges involved in building large-scale knowledge banks as a matter of ontology mismatch creates an opportunity for an interdisciplinary and analytically integrated research agenda to implement and test these potential approaches .

label: Research method
text: The metadata usage ratio is introduced as a means of assessing the usage of a popular tag as metadata .

label: Research method
text: We also compare how popular tags are used as image tags or metadata in the Flickr general collection and the Library of Congress 's photostream ( LCP ) , also in Flickr .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Flickr popular tags in the list overall are categorically stable , and the changes that do appear reflect Flickr users ' evolving technology-driven cultural experience .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The popular tags in Flickr had a high number of generic objects and specific locations-related tags and were rarely at the abstract level .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Conversely , the popular tags in the LCP describe more in the specific objects and time categories .

label: Research method
text: Flickr users copied the Library of Congress-supplied metadata that related to specific objects or events and standard bibliographic information ( e. g. , author , format , time references ) as popular tags in the LCP .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Those popular tags related to generic objects and events showed a high metadata usage ratio , while those related to specific locations and objects showed a low image metadata usage ratio .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Popular tags in Flickr appeared less frequently as image metadata when describing specific objects than specific times and locations for historical images in Flickr LCP collections .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Understanding how people contribute image tags or image metadata in Flickr helps determine what users need to describe and query images , and could help improve image browsing and retrieval .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Constructing such a patent network requires a proper measure of the distance between different classes of patents in the patent classification systems .

label: Research questions
text: Despite the existence of various distance measures in the literature , it is unclear how to consistently assess and compare them , and which ones to select for constructing patent technology network maps .

label: Research questions
text: This ambiguity has limited the development and applications of such technology maps .

label: Research questions
text: Herein , we propose to compare alternative distance measures and identify the superior ones by analyzing the differences and similarities in the structural properties of resulting patent network maps .

label: Research method
text: Using United States patent data from 1976 to 2006 and the International Patent Classification ( IPC ) system , we compare 12 representative distance measures , which quantify interfield knowledge base proximity , field-crossing diversification likelihood or frequency of innovation agents , and co-occurrences of patent classes in the same patents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our comparative analyses suggest the patent technology network maps based on normalized coreference and inventor diversification likelihood measures are the best representatives .

label: Research questions
text: Searchers who are learning often exhibit exploratory behaviors , and so current research is often focused on improving support for exploratory search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Consequently , we need effective measures of learning to demonstrate better support for exploratory search .

label: Research questions
text: Some approaches , such as quizzes , measure recall when learning from a fixed source of information .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research , however , focuses on techniques for measuring open-ended learning , which often involve analyzing handwritten summaries produced by participants after a task .

label: Research method
text: There are two common techniques for analyzing such summaries : ( a ) counting facts and statements and ( b ) judging topic coverage .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Both of these techniques , however , can be easily confounded by simple variables such as summary length .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article presents a new technique that measures depth of learning within written summaries based on Bloom 's taxonomy ( B.S .

label: Research questions
text: Bloom & M.D .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Engelhart , 1956 ) .

label: Research method
text: This technique was generated using grounded theory and is designed to be less susceptible to such confounding variables .

label: Research method
text: Together , these three categories of measure were compared by applying them to a large collection of written summaries produced in a task-based study , and our results provide insights into each of their strengths and weaknesses .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Both fact-to-statement ratio and our own measure of depth of learning were effective while being less affected by confounding variables .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Recommendations and clear areas of future work are provided to help continued research into supporting sensemaking and learning .

label: Research method
text: This study analyzes data from 23 UK institutions covering the period 2007-2014 modeling the TCP .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It shows a clear rise in centrally managed APC payments from 2012 onward , with payments projected to increase further .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As well as evidencing the growing availability and acceptance of OA publishing , these trends reflect particular UK policy developments and funding arrangements intended to accelerate the move toward OA publishing ( Gold OA ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although the mean value of APCs has been relatively stable , there was considerable variation in APC prices paid by institutions since 2007 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , hybrid subscription/OA journals were consistently more expensive than fully OA journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most APCs were paid to large traditional commercial publishers who also received considerable subscription income .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: New administrative costs reported by institutions varied considerably .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The total cost of publication modeling shows that APCs are now a significant part of the TCP for academic institutions , in 2013 already constituting an average of 10 % of the TCP ( excluding administrative costs ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Essential to developing such systems are a description of expert search behavior and an understanding of how it may be acquired .

label: Research method
text: The present study contributes a detailed analysis of the query behavior of 10 students as they completed assigned exercises during a semester-long course on expert search .

label: Research method
text: Detailed query logs were coded for three dimensions of query expression : the information structure searched , the type of query term used , and intent of the query with respect to specificity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Patterns of query formulation were found to evidence a progression of instruction , suggesting that the students gained knowledge of fundamental system-independent constructs that underlie expert search , and that domain-independent search expertise may be defined as the ability to use these constructs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Implications for system design are addressed .

label: Research questions
text: However , prior studies placed a great emphasis on proactive knowledge behaviors , such as knowledge sharing and contribution , but failed to consider the uniqueness of knowledge withholding .

label: Research method
text: To capture the social-deviant nature of knowledge withholding and to better understand how people deal with counterproductive knowledge behaviors , this study develops a research model based on the secondary control perspective .

label: Research method
text: Empirical analyses were conducted using the data collected from an online knowledge space .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that both predictive control and vicarious control exert a positive influence on knowledge withholding .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study also incorporates knowledge-withholding acceptability as a moderating variable of secondary control strategies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , knowledge-withholding acceptability enhances the impact of predictive control , whereas it weakens the effect of vicarious control on knowledge withholding .

label: Research questions
text: This study concludes with a discussion of the key Research findings/conclusions , and the implications for both research and practice .

label: Research questions
text: This phenomenon has intensified the competition among service providers for user loyalty .

label: Research questions
text: There were plenty of studies investigating user loyalty in the mobile-app context ; nevertheless , most failed to identify those true loyalty users who embraced attitudinal and behavioral loyalty .

label: Research questions
text: To address this research gap , this study aims to understand and predict user loyalty by an extended RFD model .

label: Research method
text: We propose that recency , frequency , and duration are able to reflect behavioral loyalty , while category frequency rate and category duration rate are representations of attitudinal loyalty .

label: Research method
text: Using the actual data collected from a third-party app , we calculate the weights of each variable through the entropy weight method , evaluate users ' loyalty in two dimensions , and classify users into four groups ( i.e. , true loyalty , latent loyalty , moderate loyalty , and no loyalty ) .

label: Research method
text: We also conduct a dynamic analysis to investigate how users move across different loyalty conditions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that majority of users tend to stay on their initial loyalty conditions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For those who have changed their loyalty conditions , it is found that true loyalty users are more likely to become latent loyalty users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The most straightforward percentile-based indicator is the proportion of frequently cited publications , for instance , the proportion of publications that belong to the top 10 % most frequently cited of their field .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Recently , more complex percentile-based indicators have been proposed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A difficulty in the calculation of percentile-based indicators is caused by the discrete nature of citation distributions combined with the presence of many publications with the same number of citations .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We introduce an approach to calculating percentile-based indicators that deals with this difficulty in a more satisfactory way than earlier approaches suggested in the literature .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We show in a formal mathematical framework that our approach leads to indicators that do not suffer from biases in favor of or against particular fields of science .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although there are websites dedicated to individual universes , the information found on these sites separate out the various formats , concentrate on only the bibliographic aspects of the material , and are only searchable with full text .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We have created an ontological model that will allow various user groups interested in transmedia to search for and retrieve the information contained in these worlds based upon their structure .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a domain analysis and user studies based on the contents of Harry Potter , Lord of the Rings , the Marvel Universe , and Star Wars in order to build a new model using Ontology Web Language ( OWL ) and an artificial intelligence-reasoning engine .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This model can infer connections between transmedia properties such as characters , elements of power , items , places , events , and so on .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This model will facilitate better search and retrieval of the information contained within these vast story universes for all users interested in them .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The result of this project is an OWL ontology reflecting real user needs based upon user research , which is intuitive for users and can be used by artificial intelligence systems .

label: Research method
text: This article presents a study that investigates tweets related to 5 major library and information science ( LIS ) professional organizations in the United States .

label: Research method
text: This study applies a systematic tweets analysis framework , including descriptive analytics , network analytics , and co-word analysis of hashtags .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions shed light on user engagement with LIS professional organizations and the trending discussion topics on Twitter , which is valuable for enabling more successful social media use and greater influence .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Earlier research found that participants employed voice search much less frequently than keyboard search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main reasons that participants disliked voice search are system mistakes and the inability to modify queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In keyboard search , query reformulation is facilitated by partial query modification , which is not supported by most of the current voice search systems .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Consequently , users need to speak the complete query in voice search even with only minor changes .

label: Research questions
text: This article focuses on examining partial query modification during voice search through a Wizard of Oz user experiment .

label: Research questions
text: It examines if users would prefer partial query modification and how they perform it in voice search .

label: Research method
text: Thirty-two participants participated in the experiment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results indicated that when given the opportunity , the users performed more partial query modifications than complete queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Common partial query modification strategies and patterns emerged from the experiment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results can be used to improve the voice search system design and benefit the research community in general .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: System implications and future work were discussed .

label: Research questions
text: In the context of information , privilege , and community , politics of marginalization drive stigmatized groups to develop collective norms for locating , sharing , and hiding information .

label: Research questions
