text: In this paper , we investigate the information practices of a subcultural community whose activities are both stigmatized and of uncertain legal status : the extreme body modification community .

label: Research method
text: We use the construct of information poverty to analyze the experiences of 18 people who had obtained , were interested in obtaining , or had performed extreme body modification procedures .

label: Research questions
text: With a holistic understanding of how members of this community use information , we complicate information poverty by working through concepts of stigma and community norms .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our research contributes to human information behavior scholarship on marginalized groups and to Internet studies research on how communities negotiate collective norms of information sharing online .

label: Research method
text: Lexical translation evidence is assembled from Wikipedia and from a large machine-readable dictionary , statistical translation evidence is drawn from parallel corpora , and evidence from co-occurrence in the document language provides a basis for limiting the adverse effect of translation ambiguity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Coverage statistics for NII Testbeds and Community for Information Access Research ( NTCIR ) queries confirm that these resources have complementary strengths .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments with translation evidence from a small parallel corpus indicate that even rather rough estimates of translation probabilities can yield further improvements over a strong technique for translation weighting based on using Jensen-Shannon divergence as a term-association measure .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Finally , a novel approach to posttranslation query expansion using a random walk over the Wikipedia concept link graph is shown to yield further improvements over alternative techniques for posttranslation query expansion .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Evaluation results on the NTCIR-5 English-Korean test collection show statistically significant improvements over strong baselines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It finds that , first , 4 groups , instead of a binary haves versus have-nots , best characterize Chinese urban society informationally ; second , the distribution of people among these groups conforms to normal distribution , in striking contrast with the pyramid-shaped socioeconomic structure of Chinese society ; third , although the demographic characteristics of these groups suggest a significant correlation between people 's informational and socioeconomic statuses , the 2 are far from identical ; fourth , although the 4 groups differ in all aspects investigated , they differ most notably in information assets and the range and type of materials they choose as their regular information resources ; fifth , although the 4 groups vary significantly , each differs from the others in its own way .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study concludes that society 's informational and socioeconomic structures are 2 related but distinctive structures , and that the informational structure is characterized by highly complicated textures of inequality .

label: Research questions
text: Increasing numbers of these are being developed in digital curation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Their central role in strategic decision making raises the need to evaluate their fitness for this Research questions and develop guidelines for their design and evaluation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A comprehensive review of assessment frameworks , however , found little evidence that existing assessment frameworks have been evaluated systematically , and no methods for their evaluation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article proposes a new methodology for evaluating the design and use of assessment frameworks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It builds on prior research on maturity models and combines analytic and empirical evaluation methods to explain how the design of assessment frameworks influences their application in practice , and how the design process can effectively take this into account .

label: Research method
text: We present the evaluation methodology and its application to two frameworks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The evaluation results lead to guidelines for the design process of assessment frameworks in digital curation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The methodology provides insights to the designers of the evaluated frameworks that they can consider in future revisions ; methodical guidance for researchers in the field ; and practical insights and words of caution to organizations keen on diagnosing their abilities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Complex noun phrases and even sentences can be turned into a hashtag .

label: Research questions
text: Breaking hashtags into their words is a challenging task due to the irregular and compact nature of the language used in Twitter .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we investigate feature-based machine learning and language model ( LM ) -based approaches for hashtag segmentation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that LM alone is not successful at segmenting nontrivial hashtags .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , when the N-best LM-based segmentations are incorporated as features into the feature-based approach , along with context-based features proposed in this study , state-of-the-art results in hashtag segmentation are achieved .

label: Research method
text: In addition , we provide an analysis of over two million distinct hashtags , autosegmented by using our best configuration .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis reveals that half of all 60 million hashtag occurrences contain multiple words and 80 % of sentiment is trapped inside multiword hashtags , justifying the need for hashtag segmentation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , we analyze the grammatical structure of hashtags by parsing them and observe that 77 % of the hashtags are noun-based , whereas 11.9 % are verb-based .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although both have been investigated to discover whether they correlate with article citations , it is not known whether users tend to tweet or save ( in Mendeley ) the same kinds of articles that they cite .

label: Research method
text: In response , this article compares pairs of articles that are tweeted , saved to a Mendeley library , or cited by the same user , but possibly a different user for each source .

label: Research method
text: The study analyzes 1,131,318 articles published in 2012 , with minimum tweeted ( 10 ) , saved to Mendeley ( 100 ) , and cited ( 10 ) thresholds .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show surprisingly minor overall overlaps between the three phenomena .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The importance of journals for Twitter and the presence of many bots at different levels of activity suggest that this site has little value for impact altmetrics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The moderate differences between patterns of saving and citation suggest that Mendeley can be used for some types of impact assessments , but sensitivity is needed for underlying differences .

label: Research method
text: A series of data sets are examined and joined in order to analyze the citations of over 195,000 conference papers and 108,000 journal papers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Two means of evaluating the citations of journals and conferences are explored : h ( 5 ) and average citations per paper ; it was found that h ( 5 ) has certain biases that make it a difficult measure to use ( despite it being the main measure used by Google Scholar ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results from the analysis show that CS , as a discipline , values conferences as a publication venue more highly than any other academic field of study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis also shows that a small number of elite CS conferences have the highest average paper citation rate of any publication type , although overall , citation rates in conferences are no higher than in journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is also shown that the length of a paper is correlated with citation rate .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These cases illustrate different diffusion characteristics of academic knowledge , depending on the nature of the knowledge in the new publications .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This work adds to the study of the development of science and links this development to citation analysis .

label: Research questions
text: The problem is that while many journals are assigned to a single subfield , many others are assigned to several .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article discusses a multiplicative and a fractional strategy to deal with this situation .

label: Research method
text: The empirical part studies different aspects of citation distributions under the two strategies , namely : the number of articles , the mean citation rate , the broad shape of the distribution , their characterization in terms of size- and scale-invariant indicators of high and low impact , and the presence of extreme distributions , that is , distributions that behave very differently from the rest .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that , despite large differences in the number of articles according to both strategies , the similarity of the citation characteristics of articles published in journals assigned to one or several subfields guarantees that choosing one of the two strategies may not lead to a radically different picture in practical applications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , the characterization of citation excellence through a high-impact indicator may considerably differ depending on that choice .

label: Research method
text: Simon and Derek John de Solla Price .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These models each have 2 distinct aspects : growth , which is the introduction of new articles , and preferential attachment , which describes how established articles accumulate new citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The attachment rules are the subtle portion of these models that supply the interesting explanatory power .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous treatments included both aspects .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Here we separate preferential attachment from the growth aspect of the model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This separation allows us to examine the results of the preferential attachment rules without confounding these with growth in the number of articles available to receive citations .

label: Research method
text: We introduce the method using Markov chains .

label: Research method
text: We show how to overcome the mathematical and computational complexity to obtain results .

label: Research method
text: A comparison of Simon 's and Price 's rules are computed in 3 JournalCitationReports subject categories using articles published in the 1960s and allowed to accumulate citations to 1980 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This comparison can not be made through analysis of power laws .

label: Research questions
text: We extended the Speech Act Theory ( SAT ) to this context by developing the Dialog Conversion Model ( DCM ) that elucidates the characteristics of online dialog between shoppers and retailers .

label: Research method
text: We validated the DCM using quantitative and qualitative data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The quantitative analyses of 1,185 communication sessions and related purchase records reflect that shoppers ' cognitive , rather than affective , expressions tend to indicate their purchase intentions , and retailers should emphasize cognitive expressions to the extent possible while being strategic in their choice of expressions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , the affective expressions ( in positive and negative forms ) articulated by retailers have a considerable influence on purchase conversion .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the same is not true for shoppers .

label: Research method
text: Post-hoc interviews were conducted with shoppers to gain additional insights .

label: Research questions
text: This article aims to map the landscape of research in this area , evaluate the current maturity of knowledge on this central question in DP and provide direction for future research .

label: Research method
text: To do so , this paper reviews assessment frameworks in digital preservation through a systematic literature search and categorizes the literature by type of research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis shows that publication output around assessment in digital preservation has increased markedly over time , but most existing work focuses on developing new models rather than rigorous evaluation and validation of existing frameworks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Significant gaps are present in the application of robust conceptual foundations and design methods , and in the level of empirical evidence available to enable the evaluation and validation of assessment models .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis and comparison with other fields suggest that the design of assessment models in DP should be studied rigorously in both theory and practice , and that the development of future models will benefit from applying existing methods , processes , and principles for model design .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A proposal for such a measure by Bartolucci is improved .

label: Research method
text: In the first bootstrap stage , a collection of high-precision features is used to bootstrap a training set with positive and negative examples of coreferring authors .

label: Research method
text: A supervised feature-based classifier is then trained on the bootstrap clusters and used to cluster the authors in a larger unlabeled dataset .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our self-supervised approach shares the advantages of unsupervised approaches ( no need for expensive hand labels ) as well as supervised approaches ( a rich set of features that can be discriminatively trained ) .

label: Research method
text: The algorithm disambiguates 54,000,000 author instances in Thomson Reuters ' Web of Knowledge with B3 F1 of.807 .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We analyze parameters and features , particularly those from citation networks , which have not been deeply investigated in author disambiguation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The most important citation feature is self-citation , which can be approximated without expensive extraction of the full network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For the supervised stage , the minor improvement due to other citation features ( increasing F1 from.748 to.767 ) suggests they may not be worth the trouble of extracting from databases that do n't already have them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A lean feature set without expensive abstract and title features performs 130 times faster with about equal F1 .

label: Research questions
text: Every day , Internet users with similar information needs have the potential to collaborate .

label: Research questions
text: However , online search is typically performed in solitude .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Existing search systems do not promote explicit collaborations , and collaboration opportunities ( collabportunities ) are missed .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we describe a method to evaluate the feasibility of transforming these collabportunities into recommendations for explicit collaboration .

label: Research method
text: We developed a technique called pseudocollaboration to evaluate the benefits and costs of collabportunities through simulations .

label: Research method
text: We evaluate the performance of our method using three data sets : ( a ) data from single users ' search sessions , ( b ) data with collaborative search sessions between pairs of searchers , and ( c ) logs from a large-scale search engine with search sessions of thousands of searchers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results establish when and how collabportunities would significantly help or hinder the search process versus searches conducted individually .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The method that we describe has implications for the design and implementation of recommendation systems for explicit collaboration .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It also connects system-mediated and user-mediated collaborative search , whereby the system evaluates the likely benefits of collaborating for a search task and helps searchers make more informed decisions on initiating and executing such a collaboration .

label: Research method
text: To investigate how users categories search engine results , we perform several experiments where users are asked to group a list of 20 search results into several categories , while attaching a relevance judgment to each formed category .

label: Research method
text: Moreover , to determine how users change their minds over time , each experiment was repeated three times under the same conditions , with a gap of one month between rounds .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that on average users form 4-5 categories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Within each round the size of a category decreases with the relevance of a category .

label: Research method
text: To measure the agreement between the search engine 's ranking and the users ' relevance judgments , we defined two novel similarity measures , the average concordance and the MinMax swap ratio .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Similarity is shown to be the highest for the third round as the users ' opinion stabilizes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Qualitative analysis uncovered some interesting points that users tended to categories results by type and reliability of their source , and particularly , found commercial sites less trustworthy , and attached high relevance to Wikipedia when their prior domain knowledge was limited .

text: Second , the lack of strict orthographic standards .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , diachronic and geographical variations in Spanish from the 12th to 15th century .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this period , named entities usually appear as complex text structure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For example , it was frequent to add nicknames and information about the persons role in society and geographic origin .

label: Research method
text: To tackle this complexity , named entity recognition and classification system has been implemented .

label: Research method
text: The system uses contextual cues based on semantics to detect entities and assign a type .

label: Research method
text: Given the occurrence of entities with attached attributes , entity contexts are also parsed to determine entity-type-specific dependencies for these attributes .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Moreover , it uses a variant generator to handle the diachronic evolution of Spanish medieval terms from a phonetic and morphosyntactic viewpoint .

label: Research method
text: The tool iteratively enriches its proper lexica , dictionaries , and gazetteers .

label: Research method
text: The system was evaluated on a corpus of over 3,000 manually annotated entities of different types and periods , obtaining F1 scores between 0.74 and 0.87 .

label: Research questions
text: Social tagging systems can simplify the involvement of a large number of users and improve the metadata-generation process .

label: Research questions
text: Current research is exploring social tagging systems as a mechanism to allow nonprofessional catalogers to participate in metadata generation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Because social tags are not from controlled vocabularies , there are issues that have to be addressed in finding quality terms to represent the content of a resource .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research explores ways to obtain a set of tags representing the resource from the tags provided by users .

label: Research method
text: Two metrics are introduced .

label: Research questions
text: Annotation Dominance ( AD ) is a measure of the extent to which a tag term is agreed to by users .

label: Research questions
text: Cross Resources Annotation Discrimination ( CRAD ) is a measure of a tag 's potential to classify a collection .

label: Research questions
text: It is designed to remove tags that are used too broadly or narrowly .

label: Research method
text: Using the proposed measurements , the research selects important tags ( meta-terms ) and removes meaningless ones ( tag noise ) from the tags provided by users .

label: Research method
text: To evaluate the proposed approach to find classificatory metadata candidates , we rely on expert users ' relevance judgments comparing suggested tag terms and expert metadata terms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that processing of user tags using the two measurements successfully identifies the terms that represent the topic categories of web resource content .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The suggested tag terms can be further examined in various usages as semantic metadata for the resources .

label: Research questions
text: The discussion grapples with the ambiguous relationship between digitizations and their exemplars in the well-known database , Early English Books Online ( EEBO ) , and suggests ways in which digitizations might be analyzed as witnesses of current perceptions about the past and used accordingly in scholarly research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The article therefore offers a critical reading of EEBO and its digitizations as part of a broader effort to investigate the role of digitally encoded resources in the transmission of ideas and the production of cultural heritage .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A novel porn-detection framework that can find newly appearing pornographic web pages by mining search query logs is proposed .

label: Research method
text: First , suspected queries are identified along with their clicked URLs by an automatically constructed lexicon .

label: Research method
text: Then , a candidate URL is determined if the number of clicks satisfies majority voting rules .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , a candidate whose URL contains at least one categorical keyword will be included in a blacklist .

label: Research method
text: Several experiments are conducted on an MSN search porn dataset to demonstrate the effectiveness of our method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The resulting blacklist generated by our search-intent-based method achieves high precision ( 0.701 ) while maintaining a favorably low false-positive rate ( 0.086 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experiments of a real-life filtering simulation reveal that our proposed method with its accumulative update strategy can achieve 44.15 % of a macro-averaging blocking rate , when the update frequency is set to 1 day .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , the overblocking rates are less than 9 % with time change due to the strong advantages of our search-intent-based method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This user-behavior-oriented method can be easily applied to search engines for incorporating only implicit collective intelligence from query logs without other efforts .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In practice , it is complementary to intelligent content analysis for keeping up with the changing trails of objectionable websites from users ' perspectives .

label: Research method
text: Liu , Kim , and Creel ( 2015 ) ( denoted LKC15 ) developed a 21-item search task difficulty reason scheme using a controlled laboratory experiment .

label: Research method
text: The current study simplified the scheme through another experiment that followed the same design as LKC15 and involved 32 university students .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study had one added questionnaire item that provided a list of the 21 difficulty reasons in the multiple-choice format .

label: Research method
text: By comparing the current study with LKC15 , a concept of primary top difficulty reasons was proposed , which reasonably simplified the 21-item scheme to an 8-item top reason list .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This limited number of reasons is more manageable and makes it feasible for search systems to predict task difficulty reasons from observable user behaviors , which builds the basis for systems to improve user satisfaction based on predicted search difficulty reasons .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper unites these theories by examining how individual privacy preferences impact context-dependent privacy expectations .

label: Research questions
text: The paper theorizes that experience provides a bridge between individuals ' general privacy attitudes and nuanced contextual factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This leads to the hypothesis that , when making judgments about privacy expectations , individuals with less experience in a context rely more on individual preferences such as their generalized privacy beliefs , whereas individuals with more experience in a context are influenced by contextual factors and norms .

label: Research method
text: To test this hypothesis , 1,925 American users of mobile applications made judgments about whether varied real-world scenarios involving data collection and use met their privacy expectations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Analysis of the data suggests that experience using mobile applications did moderate the effect of individual preferences and contextual factors on privacy judgments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experience changed the equation respondents used to assess whether data collection and use scenarios met their privacy expectations .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Discovering the bridge between 2 dominant theoretical models enables future privacy research to consider both personal and contextual variables by taking differences in experience into account .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among others , the number of retweets ( RTs ) and user types are the two important items of analysis for understanding the transmission of information on Twitter .

label: Research method
text: To analyze this point , we applied text classification and feature extraction experiments using random forests machine learning with conventional stylistic and Twitter-specific features .

label: Research method
text: We first collected tweets from 40 accounts with a high number of followers and created tweet texts from 28,756 tweets .

label: Research method
text: We then conducted 15 types of classification experiments using a variety of combinations of features such as function words , speech terms , Twitter 's descriptive grammar , and information roles .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We deliberately observed the effects of features for classification performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicated that class classification per user indicated the best performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , we observed that certain features had a greater impact on classification .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the case of the experiments that assessed the level of RT quantity , information roles had an impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the case of user experiments , important features , such as the honorific postpositional particle and auxiliary verbs , such as desu and masu , had an impact .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research clarifies the features that are useful for categorizing tweets according to the number of RTs and user types .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Only a comparison with the performance of all other institutions makes it possible to say exactly where an institution stands .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In order to interpret the results of the SCImago Institutions Ranking ( based on Scopus data ) and the Leiden Ranking ( based on Web of Science data ) , in this study we offer thresholds with which it is possible to assess whether an institution belongs to the top 1 % , top 5 % , top 10 % , top 25 % , or top 50 % of institutions in the world .

label: Research method
text: The thresholds are based on the excellence rate or PPtop 10 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Both indicators measure the proportion of an institution 's publications which belong to the 10 % most frequently cited publications and are the most important indicators for measuring institutional impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For example , while an institution must achieve a value of 24.63 % in the Leiden Ranking 2013 to be considered one of the top 1 % of institutions worldwide , the SCImago Institutions Ranking requires 30.2 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The two ways of achieving OA are self-archiving of scientific work by the authors ( Green OA ) and publishing in OA journals ( Gold OA ) .

label: Research questions
text: But there is still no consensus which model should be supported in particular .

label: Research questions
text: The aim of this simulation study is to discover mechanisms and predict developments that may lead to specific outcomes of possible market transformation scenarios .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It contributes to theories related to OA by substantiating the argument of a citation advantage of OA articles and by visualizing the mechanisms of a journal system collapsing in the long-term due to the continuation of the serials crisis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The practical contribution of this research stems from the integration of all market players : Decisions regarding potential financial support of OA models can be aligned with our Research findings/conclusions , as well as the decision of a publisher to migrate his/her journals to Gold OA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results indicate that for scholarly communication in general , a transition to Green OA combined with a certain level of subscription-based publishing and a migration of few top journals is the most beneficial development .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: GIBIR provides an effective way to retrieve bibliographic information .

label: Research method
text: The system represents bibliographic information as networks and provides a form-based query interface .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Users can develop their queries interactively by referencing the system-generated graph queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Complex queries such as papers on information retrieval , which were cited by John 's papers that had been presented in SIGIR can be effectively answered by the system .

label: Research method
text: We evaluate the proposed system by developing another relational database-based bibliographic information retrieval system with the same interface and functions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiment results show that the proposed system executes the same queries much faster than the relational database-based system , and on average , our system reduced the execution time by 72 % ( for 3-node query ) , 89 % ( for 4-node query ) , and 99 % ( for 5-node query ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In their tweets , users often reveal their location information and short-term visiting histories or plans .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Capturing user 's short-term activities could benefit many applications for providing the right context at the right time and location .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper we are interested in extracting locations mentioned in tweets at fine-grained granularity , with temporal awareness .

label: Research method
text: Specifically , we recognize the points-of-interest ( POIs ) mentioned in a tweet and predict whether the user has visited , is currently at , or will soon visit the mentioned POIs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A POI can be a restaurant , a shopping mall , a bookstore , or any other fine-grained location .

label: Research method
text: Our proposed framework , named TS-Petar ( Two-Stage POI Extractor with Temporal Awareness ) , consists of two main components : a POI inventory and a two-stage time-aware POI tagger .

label: Research method
text: The POI inventory is built by exploiting the crowd wisdom of the Foursquare community .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It contains both POIs ' formal names and their informal abbreviations , commonly observed in Foursquare check-ins .

label: Research method
text: The time-aware POI tagger , based on the Conditional Random Field ( CRF ) model , is devised to disambiguate the POI mentions and to resolve their associated temporal awareness accordingly .

label: Research method
text: Three sets of contextual features ( linguistic , temporal , and inventory features ) and two labeling schema features ( OP and BILOU schemas ) are explored for the time-aware POI extraction task .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our empirical study shows that the subtask of POI disambiguation and the subtask of temporal awareness resolution call for different feature settings for best performance .

label: Research method
text: We have also evaluated the proposed TS-Petar against several strong baseline methods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results demonstrate that the two-stage approach achieves the best accuracy and outperforms all baseline methods in terms of both effectiveness and efficiency .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The popularity of well-known packages and corresponding large numbers of citations received bear testimony of the contribution of scientific software to academic research .

label: Research questions
text: Yet software is not generally recognized as an academic outcome .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this study , a usage-based model is proposed with varied indicators including citations , mentions , and downloads to measure the importance of scientific software .

label: Research method
text: We performed an investigation on a sample of international bioinformatics research articles , and on a sample from the Chinese community .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis shows that scientists in the field of bioinformatics rely heavily on scientific software : the major differences between the international community and the Chinese example being how scientific packages are mentioned in publications and the time gap between the introduction of a package and its use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Biologists publishing in international journals tend to apply the latest tools earlier ; Chinese scientists publishing in Chinese tend to follow later .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further , journals with higher impact factors tend to publish articles applying the latest tools earlier .

label: Research questions
text: Researchers and practitioners have both touted the benefits and warned of the drawbacks associated with data science and big data approaches , but few studies investigate how data science is carried out on the ground .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , we first review the hype and criticisms surrounding data science and big data approaches .

label: Research method
text: We then present the Research findings/conclusions of semistructured interviews with 18 data analysts from various industries and organizational roles .

label: Research method
text: Using qualitative coding techniques , we evaluated these interviews in light of the hype and criticisms surrounding data science in the popular discourse .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that although the data analysts we interviewed were sensitive to both the allure and the potential pitfalls of data science , their motivations and evaluations of their work were more nuanced .

label: Research questions
text: We conclude by reflecting on the relationship between data analysts ' work and the discourses around data science and big data , suggesting how future research can better account for the everyday practices of this profession .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we study the example of adverse selection of reviewers when a potential referee whose ability is his private information faces a finite sequence of review processes for several scholarly journals , one after the other .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our editor 's problem is to design a system that guarantees that each manuscript is reviewed by a referee if and only if the reviewer 's ability matches the review 's complexity .

label: Research method
text: As is typically the case in solving problems of adverse selection in agency theory , the journal editor offers a menu of contracts to the potential referee , from which the reviewer chooses the contract that is best for him given his ability .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The optimal contract will be the one that provides the right incentives to match the complexity of the review and the ability of the reviewer .

label: Research method
text: The payment of contracts is made through a proportional increment of the reviewer factor , which measures the importance of reviewers to their field .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we present the results of a preliminary study of cyberlearning projects funded by the National Science Foundation ( NSF ) that address these issues .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our work demonstrates that text-mining tools can be used to partially automate the process of finding NSF 's cyberlearning awards and characterizing the fine-grained topics implicit in award abstracts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The methodology we have established to assess NSF 's cyberlearning investments should generalize to other areas of research and other repositories of public-access documents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that data set mentions and citations varied greatly among disciplines in terms of how data sets were collected , referenced , and curated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While a majority of articles provided free access to data , formal ways of data attribution such as DOIs and data citations were used in a limited number of articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , data reuse took place in less than 30 % of the publications that used data , suggesting that researchers are still inclined to create and use their own data sets , rather than reusing previously curated data .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper provides a comprehensive understanding of how data sets are used in science and helps institutions and publishers make useful data policies .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although some scholars have recognized the gatekeeping role of review usefulness , whereby consumers always follow useful reviews , this is the first study that attempts to provide a better understanding of the gatekeeping role of review valence .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing on loss aversion theory , we propose that review valence provides more diagnostic value than review usefulness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Its crucial role is demonstrated in that only when reviews are perceived as positive do highly useful ( rather than lowly useful ) reviews increase consumers ' adoption of them , whereas the difference appears less evident when reviews are perceived as negative .

label: Research method
text: We empirically test the model from two perspectives including product level and review level .

label: Research method
text: The results of a mixed-method approach - a large-scale panel study ( product level ) followed by two experimental studies ( review level ) - provide empirical evidence for the above hypotheses .

label: Research method
text: Relevance is defined as a Relationship ( R ) between an Information Object ( I ) and an Information Need ( N ) ( which consists of Topic , User , Problem/Task , and Situation/ Context ) with focus on R. This defines Relevance-as-is ( conceptual relevance , strong relevance ) .

label: Research method
text: To determine relevance , an Agent A ( a person or system ) operates on a representation I of the information object and a representation N of the information need , resulting in relevance-as-determined ( operational measure of relevance , weak relevance , an approximation ) .

label: Research method
text: Retrieval tests compare relevance-as-determined by different agents .

label: Research method
text: This article discusses and compares two major approaches to conceptualizing relevance : the entityfocused approach ( focus on elaborating the entities involved in relevance ) and the relationship-focused approach ( focus on explicating the relational nature of relevance ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The article argues that because relevance is fundamentally a relational construct the relationshipfocused approach deserves a higher priority and more attention than it has received .

label: Research method
text: The article further elaborates on the elements of the framework with a focus on clarifying several critical issues on the discourse on relevance .

label: Research method
text: Citation data were obtained using text extraction from a collection of PDF files with significant manual postprocessing performed to clean up the results .

label: Research method
text: Manual annotation of the references was then performed to complete the citation network .

label: Research method
text: We analyzed the networks of paper citations , author citations , and author collaborations in an attempt to identify the most central papers and authors .

label: Research method
text: The analysis includes general network statistics , PageRank , metrics across publication years and venues , the impact factor and h-index , as well as other measures .

label: Research questions
text: Social media has thus become a rich and real-time source for various kinds of public opinion and sentiment studies .

label: Research questions
text: According to psychology and neuroscience , human emotions are known to be strongly dependent on sensory perceptions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although sensation is the most fundamental antecedent of human emotions , prior works have not looked into their relation to emotions based on social media texts .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , we report the results of our study on sensation effects that underlie human emotions as revealed in social media .

label: Research method
text: We focus on the key five types of sensations : sight , hearing , touch , smell , and taste .

label: Research questions
text: We first establish a correlation between emotion and sensation in terms of linguistic expressions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Then , in the second part of the paper , we define novel features useful for extracting sensation information from social media .

label: Research method
text: Finally , we design a method to classify texts into ones associated with different types of sensations .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The sensation dataset resulting from this research is opened to the public to foster further studies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Practice is inherently embodied too , which means embodiment can be utilized as a vantage point to seek conceptual grounding for the rather diverse range of theories and models in information behavior research .

label: Research questions
text: The challenge then is to articulate in what ways and on what levels a particular approach contributes to advancing information behavior research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Conceptual clarity would also help information behavior models and theories developed in libraries and information science become more accessible and hopefully also more relevant to researchers in cognate disciplines .

label: Research questions
text: We investigate the current practices of media studies researchers and how these practices affect their research questions .

label: Research method
text: Through the analysis of 27 interviews about the research practices of media studies researchers during a research project we developed a model of the activities in their research cycle .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that information gathering and analysis activities are dominating the research cycle .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These activities influence the research outcomes as they determine how research questions asked by media studies researchers evolve .

label: Research questions
text: Specifically , we show how research questions are related to the availability and accessibility of data as well as new information sources for contextualization of the research topic .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our contribution is a comprehensive account of the overall research cycle of media studies researchers as well as specific aspects of the research cycle , i.e. , information sources , information seeking challenges , and the development of research questions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This work confirms Research findings/conclusions of previous work in this area using a previously unstudied group of researchers , as well as providing new details about how research questions evolve .

label: Research questions
text: Many studies have investigated the emergence of information grounds in public places .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study pays attention to the emergence , peak , and abeyance of an online information ground .

label: Research questions
text: It investigates a Facebook group used by youth for sharing information when misinformation spread wildly during the 2011 violence in Ambon , Indonesia .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions demonstrate change and continuity in an online information ground ; it became an information hub when reaching a peak cycle , and an information repository when entering into abeyance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite this period of nonactivity , the friendships and collective memories resulting from information ground interactions last over time and can be used for reactivating the online information ground when new needs emerge .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Illuminating the lifecycles of an online information ground , the Research findings/conclusions have potential to explain the dynamic of users ' interactions with others and with information in quotidian spaces .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This critical evaluation may be beyond the capabilities of students from primary and secondary school .

label: Research method
text: We conducted 2 studies to assess how students from primary , secondary , and undergraduate education perceive and use 2 relevant credibility cues in forums : author 's identity and evidence used to support his answer .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Students did n't use these cues when they evaluated forums with a single answer ( Experiment 1 ) , but they recommended more often answers from self-reported experts than from users with a pseudonym when multiple sources were discussed in the forum ( Experiment 2 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This pattern of results suggested that multiple viewpoints increase students ' attention to source features in forum messages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiment 2 also revealed that primary school students preferred personal experience as evidence in the messages , whereas undergraduate students preferred the inclusion of documentary sources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , while children mimic the adult preference for expert sources in web forums , they treat source information in a rather superficial manner .

label: Research questions
text: To conclude , we outline possible mechanisms to understand how credibility assessment evolves across educational levels , and discuss potential implications for the educational curriculum in information literacy .

label: Research questions
text: Climate change research has become more interdisciplinary and even transdisciplinary as a typical Mode-2 science that is also dependent on an application context for its further development .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We propose to approach interdisciplinarity as a co-construction of the knowledge base in the reference patterns and the programmatic focus in the editorials in the core journal of the climate-change sciencesClimaticChangeduring the period 1977-2013 .

label: Research method
text: First , we analyze the knowledge base of the journal and map journal-journal relations on the basis of the references in the articles .

label: Research questions
text: Second , we follow the development of the programmatic focus by analyzing the semantics in the editorials .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that interdisciplinarity is a result of the co-construction between different agendas : The selection of publications into the knowledge base of the journal , and the adjustment of the programmatic focus to the political context in the editorials .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show a widening of the knowledge base from referencing the multidisciplinary journals Nature and Science to citing journals from specialist fields .

label: Research method
text: The programmatic focus follows policy-oriented issues and incorporates public metaphors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This index can be applied to both researchers and journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , we show that it fills the gap of the h-index and similar measures that do not take into account the effect of self-citations for authors or journals impact evaluation .

label: Research method
text: We provide 2 real-world examples : First , we evaluate the research impact of the most productive scholars in computer science ( according to DBLP Computer Science Bibliography , Universitat Trier , Trier , Germany ) ; then we revisit the impact of the journals ranked in the Computer Science Applications section of the SCImago Journal & Country Rank ranking service ( Consejo Superior de Investigaciones Cientificas , University of Granada , Extremadura , Madrid , Spain ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We observe how self-citations , in many cases , affect the rankings obtained according to different measures ( including h-index and ch-index ) , and show how the proposed measure mitigates this effect .

label: Research questions
text: Previous social tagging studies have collected social tagging data and analyzed how tagging functions as a tool to organize and retrieve information .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Many studies focused on the patterns of tagging rather than the users ' perspectives .

label: Research method
text: To provide a more comprehensive picture of users ' social tagging activities in institutional collections , and how this compares to social tagging in a more personal context , we collected data from social tagging users by surveying 7,563 participants in the Library of Congress 's Flickr Collection .

label: Research method
text: We asked users to describe their motivations for activities within the LC Flickr Collection in their own words using open-ended questions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As a result , we identified 11 motivations using a bottom-up , open-coding approach : affective reactions , opinion on photo , interest in subject , contribution to description , knowledge sharing , improving findability , social network , appreciation , personal use , and personal relationship .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our study revealed that affective or emotional reactions play a critical role in the use of social tagging of institutional collections by comparing our Research findings/conclusions to existing frameworks for tagging motivations .

label: Research questions
text: We also examined the relationships between participants ' occupations and our 11 motivations .

label: Research method
text: We divide them into two categories , social Q & A ( SQA ) and virtual reference ( VR ) , and examine how experts ( librarians ) and end users ( students ) evaluate information within both categories .

label: Research method
text: To accomplish this , we first performed an extensive literature review and compiled a list of the aspects found to contribute to a good answer .

label: Research method
text: These aspects were divided among three high-level concepts : relevance , quality , and satisfaction .

label: Research method
text: We then interviewed both experts and users , asking them first to reflect on their online Q & A experiences and then comment on our list of aspects .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These interviews uncovered two main disparities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One disparity was found between users expectations with these services and how information was actually delivered among them , and the other disparity between the perceptions of users and experts with regard to the aforementioned three characteristics of relevance , quality , and satisfaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using qualitative analyses of both the interviews and relevant literature , we suggest ways to create better hybrid solutions for online Q & A and to bridge the gap between experts and users understandings of relevance , quality , and satisfaction , as well as the perceived importance of each in contributing to a good answer .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research empirically tested a taxonomy of functional units in a prototype journal system .

label: Research method
text: This taxonomy was developed by identifying functions of the smallest information units within four journal article components ( i.e. , introduction , methods , results , discussion ) , and their associations with information tasks of using journal articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results show that functional units can be utilized in supporting navigation , close reading , comprehension , and information use of journal articles to various extents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results provide evidence that an individual functional unit has varying relevance to information use tasks , and has varying relevance to other functional units in the same or another component for a particular task .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research suggests that the information within a journal article can be organized and presented by functions to enhance effectiveness and efficiency in reading process and reading outcome .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This qualitative study examines the practices of decision makers as they engage with DSS-DD at a large U.S. Midwestem university and uncovers the socio-technical characteristics that lead to limited or non-use of dashboards .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To examine these practices and characteristics , this study presents a framework grounded in socio-technical interaction networks from social informatics and sociomateriality from information systems that explores the socio-technical practices of users within organizations , while acknowledging the impact of the users ' socio-technical contexts on their DSS-DD practices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that during the design and implementation phases of these dashboards the institutional contexts that the dashboards are meant to inform are often ignored ; and that as users interact with these systems they develop unintended and shadow practices that lead to limited or non-use of the dashboards for decision making Research questionss .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additionally , the study finds that users ' practices are influenced by their local socio-technical networks , which includes their prior experiences using institutional data , other actors within their institutional unit , and the political and social contexts which shape the users ' decision making behavior and data-use practices .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of this study was to determine how to better facilitate satisfaction through shared leadership , individual trust , and autonomy .

label: Research questions
text: Specifically , in this study we sought a better understanding of the effects of shared leadership , team members ' trust , and autonomy on satisfaction .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a study with 163 individuals in 44 virtual teams .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that shared leadership facilitates satisfaction in virtual teams both directly and indirectly through the promotion of trust .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Shared leadership moderated the relationships of individual trust and individual autonomy with satisfaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Team-level satisfaction was a strong predictor of virtual team performance .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We discuss these Research findings/conclusions and the implications for theory and design .

label: Research questions
text: We study the effect of search assistance , operationalized as an interactive faceted query suggestion , for both whole-session effectiveness and engagement through interactive faceted query suggestion .

label: Research method
text: A user experiment is reported , where users performed exploratory search tasks , comparing interactive faceted query suggestion and a control condition with only conventional typed-query interaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Data comprised of interaction and search logs show that the availability of interactive faceted query suggestion substantially improves whole-session effectiveness by increasing recall without sacrificing precision .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The increased engagement with interactive faceted query suggestion is targeted to direct situated navigation around the initial query scope , but is not found to improve individual queries on average .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results imply that research in exploratory search should focus on measuring and designing tools that engage users with directed situated navigation support for improving whole-session performance .

label: Research questions
text: Driven by a classic approach to defining concepts , scholars have not been able to agree on a unified definition of privacy .

label: Research questions
text: This poses a barrier to those who seek to implement privacy through their decisions .

label: Research questions
text: A critical component of their work involves anticipating and responding to potential privacy risks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In choosing one definition over another , practitioners might be missing nuanced contextual overlaps that bear on privacy and thus bias their subsequent decisions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For these practical endeavors , it is important to adopt an inclusive and rich definition .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Such a definition should also be responsive to how those affected by decisions that might compromise privacy , namely citizens and technology users , conceive of privacy .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The present paper applies a prototype perspective on privacy that acknowledges the fuzziness of concepts and goes on to develop such a definition in a series of empirical studies .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The relevance of the privacy prototype is then explored as it applies to privacy theorists , practitioners , and methodologists , suggesting new avenues for future research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results demonstrate that an increase in the number of authors leads to an increase in impact , from the beginning of the last century onward , and that this is not due simply to self-citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A similar trend is also observed for the number of addresses and number of countries represented in the byline of an article .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the constant inflation of collaboration since 1900 has resulted in diminishing citation returns : Larger and more diverse ( in terms of institutional and country affiliation ) teams are necessary to realize higher impact .

label: Research questions
text: The article concludes with a discussion of the potential causes of the impact gain in citations of collaborative papers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To address this gap , this article reports on the study of the information behavior and related activities of older persons during natural disasters .

label: Research method
text: Based on a qualitative study , we draw on the theory of information worlds to study the key activities of preparing , responding , and recovering from disasters .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The article contributes to the information behavior literature by developing a more informed understanding of both the interrelationship between the information worlds and activities of older persons , and how older persons seek and share information during disasters .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of subjective language identification is to determine that a private state is expressed , without considering its polarity or specific emotion .

label: Research questions
text: A component of word meaning , Personal Sense , has clear potential in the field of subjective language identification , as it reflects a meaning of words in terms of unique personal experience and carries personal characteristics .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper we investigate how Personal Sense can be harnessed for the Research questions of identifying subjectivity in news titles .

label: Research questions
text: In the process , we develop a new Personal Sense annotation framework for annotating and classifying subjectivity , polarity , and emotion .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Personal Sense framework yields high performance in a fine-grained subsentence subjectivity classification .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our experiments demonstrate lexico-syntactic features to be useful for the identification of subjectivity indicators and the targets that receive the subjective Personal Sense .

text: The resulting implicit opinions are more difficult to extract and label than explicit ones .

text: In this paper , cutting-edge machine-learning approaches - deep neural network and word-embedding - are adopted for implicit opinion mining at the snippet and clause levels .

text: Hotel reviews written in Chinese are collected and annotated as the experimental data set .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show the convolutional neural network models not only outperform traditional support vector machine models , but also capture hidden knowledge within the raw text .

text: The strength of word-embedding is also analyzed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There is a trend toward using common repositories with many organizations encouraging workers to use GIM to avoid duplication of files and management .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: So far , PIM and GIM have been studied by different research communities , so their effectiveness for file retrieval has not yet been systematically compared .

label: Research method
text: We compared PIM and GIM in a large-scale elicited personal information retrieval study .

label: Research method
text: We asked 275 users to retrieve 860 of their own shared files , testing the effect of sharing method on success and efficiency of retrieval .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Participants preferred PIM over GIM .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More important , PIM retrieval was more successful : Participants using GIM failed to find 22 % of their files compared with 13 % failures using PIM .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This may be because active organization aids retrieval : When using personally created folders , the failure percentage was 65 % lower than when using default folders ( e.g. , My Documents ) , and more than 5 times lower than when using folders created by others for GIM .

label: Research method
text: Theoretical reasons for this are discussed .

text: The novelty of our approach lies in the exploitation of the Web page PageRank values as indicators of the significance the different senses of a term carry when employed in search queries .

label: Research questions
text: We also aim at scalable query sense resolution techniques that can be applied without loss of efficiency to large data sets such as those on the Web .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our experimental Research findings/conclusions validate that the proposed techniques perform more accurately than do the traditional disambiguation strategies and improve the quality of the search results , when involved in query expansion .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: User tags on documents in a social bookmarking site reflect a user 's views of an information object , which can augment the content description and provide more effective representation of information .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study presents a study of tag analysis to uncover semantic relations among tag terms implicit in user tagging .

label: Research questions
text: The objective was to identify the syntagmatic semantic cores of topic and comment in user tags evidenced by the meaning attached to the information object by users .

label: Research method
text: The study focused on syntagmatic relations , which were based on the way in which terms were used within the information content among users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Analysis of descriptive tag terms found three primary categories of concepts : content-topic , content-comment , and context of use .

label: Research method
text: The relations among terms within a group and between the content-topic and content-comment groups were determined by inferring user meaning from the user notes and from the context of the source text .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Intergroup relations showed syntagmatic associations between the topic and comment , whereas intragroup relations were more general but were limited in the document context .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions are discussed with regard to the semantics of concepts and relations in user tagging .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An implication of syntagmatic relations to information search suggests that concepts can be combined by a specific association in the context of the actual use of terms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Author profiles can be useful for evaluation Research questionss once the advantages and the shortcomings of these services are described and taken into consideration .

label: Research method
text: In total , 771 personal profiles appearing in both the MAS and the GSC databases were analyzed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that the GSC profiles include more documents and citations than those in MAS but with a strong bias toward the information and computing sciences , whereas the MAS profiles are disciplinarily better balanced .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: MAS shows technical problems such as a higher number of duplicated profiles and a lower updating rate than GSC .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is concluded that both services could be used for evaluation proposes only if they are applied along with other citation indices as a way to supplement that information .

label: Research method
text: This article examines variability in data and metadata practices using institutions as the key theoretical concept .

label: Research questions
text: Institutions , in the sense used here , are stable patterns of human behavior that structure , legitimize , or delegitimize actions , relationships , and understandings within particular situations .

label: Research method
text: Based on prior conceptualizations of institutions , a theoretical framework is presented that outlines 5 categories of institutional carriers for data practices : ( a ) norms and symbols , ( b ) intermediaries , ( c ) routines , ( d ) standards , and ( e ) material objects .

label: Research questions
text: These institutional carriers are central to understanding how scientific data and metadata practices originate , stabilize , evolve , and transfer .

label: Research method
text: This institutional framework is applied to 3 case studies : the Center for Embedded Networked Sensing ( CENS ) , the Long Term Ecological Research ( LTER ) network , and the University Corporation for Atmospheric Research ( UCAR ) .

label: Research questions
text: These cases are used to illustrate how institutional support for data and metadata management are not uniform within a single organization or academic discipline .

label: Research questions
text: Instead , broad spectra of institutional configurations for managing data and metadata exist within and across disciplines and organizations .

label: Research questions
text: This has raised doubts about its usefulness for predicting future scientific achievements .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Here , I investigate a variant that considers only recent publications and is therefore more useful in academic hiring processes and for the allocation of research resources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is simply defined in analogy to the usual h-index , but takes into account only publications from recent years , and it can easily be determined from the ISI Web of Knowledge .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Goodreads has tens of millions of book reviews , recommendations , and ratings that may help librarians and readers to select relevant books .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article describes a first investigation of the properties of Goodreads users , using a random sample of 50,000 members .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that about three quarters of members with a public profile are female , and that there is little difference between male and female users in patterns of behavior , except for females registering more books and rating them less positively .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Goodreads librarians and super-users engage extensively with most features of the site .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The absence of strong correlations between book-based and social usage statistics ( e.g. , numbers of friends , followers , books , reviews , and ratings ) suggests that members choose their own individual balance of social and book activities and rarely ignore one at the expense of the other .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Goodreads is therefore neither primarily a book-based website nor primarily a social network site but is a genuine hybrid , social navigation site .

label: Research questions
text: This feature is essentially used for two Research questionss : to capture query terms proximity or to boost the weight of terms appearing in some parts of a document .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , we are interested in this second category .

label: Research questions
text: We propose two novel query-independent techniques based on absolute term positions in a document , whose goal is to boost the weight of terms appearing in the beginning of a document .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The first one considers only the earliest occurrence of a term in a document .

label: Research method
text: The second one takes into account all term positions in a document .

label: Research method
text: We formalize each of these two techniques as a document model based on term position , and then we incorporate it into a basic language model ( LM ) .

label: Research method
text: Two smoothing techniques , Dirichlet and Jelinek-Mercer , are considered in the basic LM .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments conducted on three TREC test collections show that our model , especially the version based on all term positions , achieves significant improvements over the baseline LMs , and it also often performs better than two state-of-the-art baseline models , the chronological term rank model and the Markov random field model .

label: Research method
text: The students listed their topic and thesis in the proposal , and information in support of their thesis .

text: The study 's focus is this topic-to-thesis transition .

label: Research method
text: The study 's conceptual framework is Kuhlthau 's six stage ISP Model 's transition from exploring information in Stage 3 to formulating a focus or personal perspective on the assignment topic in Stage 4 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our study coding scheme identifies elements of the students ' implicit knowledge in the 16 proposals .

label: Research method
text: To validate implicit knowledge as a predictor of successful student performance , implicit knowledge was coded , scored , and then the correlation coefficient was established between the score and the students ' instructors ' marks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In Part 2 of the study we found strong and significant association between the McGill coding scores and the instructors ' marks for the 16 proposals .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study is a first step in identifying , operationalizing , and testing user-centered implicit knowledge elements for future implementation in interactive information systems designed for middle school students researching a thesis-objective history assignment .
