text: stems from the observation that searching is currently a that searching is currently taken for granted and it is natural for users to assume that search engines are available and work well .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As a consequence , users may assume the utility they have in finding relevant documents , which is the focus of traditional measures , as granted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: On the contrary , they may feel uneasy when the system returns nonrelevant documents because they are then forced to do additional work to get the desired information , and this causes avoidable effort .

label: Research questions
text: The latter is the focus of , which evaluates the effectiveness of a system from the point of view of the effort required to the users to retrieve the desired information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We provide a formal definition of , a demonstration of its properties , and introduce the notion of effort/gain plots , which complement traditional utility-based measures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By means of an extensive experimental evaluation , is shown to grasp different aspects of system performances , to not require extensive and costly assessments , and to be a robust tool for detecting differences between systems .

label: Research method
text: This study evaluated academics ' receptiveness to information proposed by a mobile app , the SerenA Notebook : information that is based in their inferred interests but does not relate directly to a prior recognized need .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The evaluated app aimed at creating the experience of serendipitous encounters : generating ideas and inspiring thoughts , and potentially triggering follow-up actions , by providing users with suggestions related to their work and leisure interests .

label: Research method
text: We studied how 20 academics interacted with messages sent by the mobile app ( 3 per day over 10 consecutive days ) .

label: Research method
text: Collected data sets were analyzed using thematic analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that contextual factors ( location , activity , and focus ) strongly influenced their responses to messages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Academics described some unsolicited information as interesting but irrelevant when they could not make immediate use of it .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: They highlighted filtering information as their major struggle rather than finding information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Some messages that were positively received acted as reminders of activities participants were meant to be doing but were postponing , or were relevant to ongoing activities at the time the information was received .

label: Research questions
text: It can be very efficient in conveying quantitative ( and sometimes qualitative ) information that can be difficult to read within one or two sentences , but which is too simple to present within a regular table .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although this format has been used in the scientific literature , and indeed recommended in some sources , its effectiveness has not been studied in formal surveys .

label: Research method
text: This article presents the results of one such survey in which three examples were considered .

label: Research method
text: Scientists representing mathematics , statistics , and similar disciplines and scientists representing biology , agriculture , and similar disciplines were asked to participate in the survey ; 189 representing the former and 201 representing the latter agreed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results clearly showed for both groups , when the data presented were suitable for such a layout , that the text tables were much preferred to the original sentences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main conclusion from this work , therefore , is that scientific authors should use text tables whenever appropriate .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study finds that while the women investigators ' presence in NIH grants is generally low , higher women investigator presence is on average related to slightly lower number of publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study finds empirically that women investigators elect to work in fields in which fewer publications per million-dollar funding is the norm .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For fields where women investigators are relatively well represented , they are as productive as men .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The overall lower productivity of women investigators may be attributed to the low representation of women in high productivity fields dominated by men investigators .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The Research findings/conclusions shed light on possible reasons for gender disparity in grant productivity .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We introduce and formalize the concept of co-utility as the property that any pair of recommended items has of being useful to a user , and exploit it to improve collaborative filtering recommendations .

label: Research method
text: We present different techniques to estimate co-utility probabilities , all of them independent of content information , and compare them with each other .

label: Research method
text: We use these probabilities , as well as normalized predicted ratings , in an instance of an NP-hard problem termed the Max-Sum Dispersion Problem ( MSDP ) .

label: Research method
text: A solution to MSDP hence corresponds to a set of items for recommendation .

label: Research method
text: We study one heuristic and one exact solution to MSDP and perform comparisons among them .

label: Research method
text: We also contrast our solutions ( the best heuristic to MSDP ) to different baselines by comparing the ratings users give to different recommendations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We obtain expressive gains in the utility of recommendations and our solutions also recommend higher-rated items to the majority of users .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Finally , we show that our co-utility solutions are scalable in practice and do not harm recommendations ' diversity .

label: Research method
text: Twenty-three participants were interviewed about their definitions of and relationships with digital possessions to identify the most salient characteristics of digital possessions and to inform preservation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions indicate that digital possessions are characterized as ( a ) providing evidence of the individual , ( b ) representing the individual 's identity , ( c ) being recognized as having value , and ( d ) exhibiting a sense of bounded control .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , archival concepts of primary , secondary , and intrinsic values provide the frame for the defining characteristics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although several Research findings/conclusions from this study are consistent with former studies of material possessions and digital possessions , this study expands research in the area using the concept of digital possessions to inform preservation and by applying archival principles of value .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Understanding the nature of the individual and digital item relationship provides potential to explore new areas of reference and outreach services in libraries and archives .

label: Research questions
text: As the nature of archival and library reference services evolves , some scholars have predicted that archives and libraries will play a part in helping individuals manage their personal collections An exploration of individuals ' relationships with their digital possessions can serve as a starting point at which scholars can explore the potential of personal information management consulting as a new area of reference and information services , specifically for the preservation of personal digital material .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Popular or influential users tweet their status and are retweeted , mentioned , or replied to by their audience .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Sentiment analysis of the tweets by popular users and their audience reveals whether the audience is favorable to popular users .

label: Research method
text: We analyzed over 3,000,000 tweets mentioning or replying to the 13 most influential users to determine audience sentiment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Twitter messages reflect the landscape of sentiment toward its most popular users .

label: Research method
text: We used the sentiment analysis technique as a valid popularity indicator or measure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , we distinguished between the positive and negative audiences of popular users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Second , we found that the sentiments expressed in the tweets by popular users influenced the sentiment of their audience .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Third , from the above two Research findings/conclusions we developed a positive-negative measure for this influence .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , using a Granger causality analysis , we found that the time-series-based positive-negative sentiment change of the audience was related to the real-world sentiment landscape of popular users .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We believe that the positive-negative influence measure between popular users and their audience provides new insights into the influence of a user and is related to the real world .

label: Research questions
text: This article discusses how young people might interact with , and be affected by , CEM .

label: Research method
text: The article first considers the effect of CEM on young victims abused to generate the material .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It then explains the paucity of data regarding the prevalence with which young people view CEM online , inadvertently or deliberately .

label: Research method
text: New analyses are presented from a 2010 study of search terms entered on an internationally popular peer-to-peer website , isoHunt .

label: Research method
text: Over 91 days , 162 persistent search terms were recorded .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most of these related to file sharing of popular movies , music , and so forth .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thirty-six search terms were categorized as specific to a youth market and perhaps a child market .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additionally , 4 deviant , and persistent search terms were found , 3 relating to CEM and the fourth to bestiality .

label: Research questions
text: The article discusses whether the existence of CEM on a mainstream website , combined with online subcultural influences , may normalize the material for some youth and increase the risk of onset ( first deliberate viewing ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among other things , the article proposes that future research examines the relationship between onset and sex offending by youth .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , existing bibliometric indices are computed based on the number of citations received by each article , but they do not consider the frequency with which individual citations are mentioned in an article .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We use citation mention to denote a unique occurrence of a cited reference mentioned in the citing article , and thus some citations may have more than one mention in an article .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: According to our analysis of the ACL Anthology Network corpus in the natural language processing field , more than 40 % of cited references have been mentioned twice or in corresponding citing articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We argue that citation mention is a preferable for representing the citation relationships between articles , that is , a reference article mentioned m times in the citing article will be considered to have received m citations , rather than one citation .

label: Research method
text: Based on this assumption , we revise the h-index and propose a new bibliometric index , the WL-index , to evaluation an individual 's scientific impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: According to our empirical analysis , the proposed WL-index more accurately discriminates between program committee chairs of reputable conferences and ordinary authors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There are a number of CDR types , however , and the effectiveness of facilitation efforts will require sensitivity to that diversity .

label: Research method
text: This article presents a method characterizing a spectrum of CDR designed to inform facilitation efforts that relies on bibliometric techniques and citation data .

label: Research questions
text: We illustrate its use by the Toolbox Project , an ongoing effort to enhance cross-disciplinary communication in CDR teams through structured , philosophical dialogue about research assumptions in a workshop setting .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Toolbox Project workshops have been conducted with more than 85 research teams , but the project 's extensibility to an objectively characterized range of CDR collaborations has not been examined .

label: Research method
text: To guide wider application of the Toolbox Project , we have developed a method that uses multivariate statistical analyses of transformed citation proportions from published manuscripts to identify candidate areas of CDR , and then overlays information from previous Toolbox participant groups on these areas to determine candidate areas for future application .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The approach supplies 3 results of general interest : 1 .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A way to employ small data sets and familiar statistical techniques to characterize CDR spectra as a guide to scholarship on CDR patterns and trends .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A model for using bibliometric techniques to guide broadly applicable interventions similar to the Toolbox .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A method for identifying the location of collaborative CDR teams on a map of scientific activity , of use to research administrators , research teams , and other efforts to enhance CDR projects .

label: Research method
text: A typical discussion thread consists of a sequence of posts posted by multiple users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Each post in a thread serves a different Research questions providing different types of information and , thus , may not be equally useful for all applications .

label: Research questions
text: Identifying the Research questions and nature of each post in a discussion thread is thus an interesting research problem as it can help in improving information extraction and intelligent assistance techniques .

label: Research method
text: We study the problem of classifying a given post as per its Research questions in the discussion thread and employ features based on the post 's content , structure of the thread , behavior of the participating users , and sentiment analysis of the post 's content .

label: Research method
text: We evaluate our approach on two forum data sets belonging to different genres and achieve strong classification performance .

label: Research questions
text: We also analyze the relative importance of different features used for the post classification task .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Next , as a use case , we describe how the post class information can help in thread retrieval by incorporating this information in a state-of-the-art thread retrieval model .

label: Research method
text: We use a novel data set of manually extracted and coded data on the funding acknowledgements of 7,510 publications representing UK cancer research in the year 2011 and compare these reference data with funding data provided by Web of Science ( WoS ) and MEDLINE/PubMed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions show high recall ( around 93 % ) of WoS funding data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By contrast , MEDLINE/ PubMed data retrieved less than half of the UK cancer publications acknowledging at least one funder .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Conversely , both databases have high precision ( +90 % ) : That is , few cases of publications with no acknowledgment to funders are identified as having funding data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nonetheless , funders acknowledged in UK cancer publications were not correctly listed by MEDLINE/PubMed and WoS in around 75 % and 32 % of the cases , respectively .

label: Research method
text: Reference data on the UK cancer research funding system are used as a case study to demonstrate the utility of funding data for strategic intelligence applications ( e.g. , mapping of funding landscape and co-funding activity , comparison of funders ' research portfolios ) .

label: Research questions
text: However , there is little empirical evidence on the adoption and use of consumer electronics by backpackers , nor the implications this has for their habits , practices , and interactions .

label: Research method
text: We investigate long-distance backpackers ' articulations with mobile information technology during the TGO Challenge , a coast-to-coast crossing of the Scottish Highlands .

label: Research method
text: By employing mixed methods , we explore how and why backpackers use such technology when planning and undertaking their journeys via a survey ( n = 116 ) , pre- and post-challenge interviews with selected TGO participants , and daily in-field video-logs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results suggest many advantages to using technology in this context , including fluidity of communications and access , while noting that reliance on technology is leading to issues such as increased need for battery power management , and deskilling .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions highlight implications for the juxtaposition between outdoor recreation , information behavior , and human computer interaction ( HCI ) and suggest future work in this area .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In tweet messages , URLs to web resources and hashtags are often included .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study investigates the potential of the hyperlinks and hashtags as topical clues and indicators to tweet messages .

label: Research method
text: For this study , we crawled and analyzed about 1.5 million tweets for a 3-month period covering any topic or subject .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions of this study revealed a power law relationship for the ranking and frequency of ( a ) the host names of URLs , and ( b ) a pair of hashtags and URLs that appeared in the tweet messages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study also discovered that the most popular URLs used in tweets come from news and media websites , and a majority of the hyperlinked resources are news web pages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One implication of this study is that Twitter users are becoming more active in sharing already published information than producing new information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , our investigation on hashtags for web resource indexing reveals that hashtags have the potential to be used as indexing terms for co-occurring URLs in the same tweet .

label: Research questions
text: We also discuss the implications of this study for web resource recommendation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions support our theoretical hypotheses that an institution 's research resources are positively related to its central position in the network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Astronomical institutions with superior resources , such as being equipped with international observational facilities and having substantial research manpower , tend to have more foreign partners ( high degree centrality ) and play an influential role ( high betweenness centrality ) in the international collaboration network .

label: Research questions
text: An institution becomes more and more active in international collaborations as its research population expands .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In terms of the relationship , which is captured by an actor institution 's co-authorship preference for each partner in the network , the effect of research resources is not as significant as expected .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that astronomical institutions are not necessarily preferentially co-authoring with partners that have better research resources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , this study indicates that geographic closeness ( or geographic proximity ) largely affects the occurrence of international collaboration .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The investigated institutions apparently prefer partners from neighboring countries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This finding gives an indication of the phenomenon of regional homophily in the international collaboration network .

label: Research method
text: Specifically , the conceptual model integrates the fundamental attributes of the canonical AL service together with those more relevant of the new and widely considered AL Electronic Service ( e-services ) .

label: Research method
text: As concerns the evaluation approach , it incorporates the Fuzzy Sets Theory ( FST ) so as to deal with the students ' uncertainty over their own judgments on the AL service quality and a Structural Equation Model ( SEM ) to validate the conceptual model and to determine the key drivers of the AL service quality .

label: Research method
text: The effectiveness of the proposed approach is proved by an empirical study concerning the AL of the Polytechnic School of the University of Palermo ( Italy ) .

label: Research method
text: Data collected via a survey involving more than 600 students are used , and the key drivers of the AL service quality are found out .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Particularly , the obtained results reveal that Collections and materials represents the main driver of the AL service quality followed by Infrastructure and Access to the service , whereas Staff plays the fundamental role of interface between AL service aspects and students ' needs and necessities .

label: Research questions
text: A number of works have tried to uncover this hidden intellectual structure by analyzing citation contexts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , none of them analyzed by document logical structures such as sections .

label: Research questions
text: The two major goals of this study are to find characteristics of authors who are highly cited section-wise and to identify the differences in section-wise author networks .

label: Research method
text: This study uses 29,158 of research articles culled from the ACL Anthology , which hosts articles on computational linguistics and natural language processing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that the distribution of citations across sections is skewed and that a different set of highly cited authors share distinct academic characteristics , according to their citation locations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , the author networks based on citation context similarity reveal that the intellectual structure of a domain differs across different sections .

label: Research method
text: We analyze whether a paper has a higher citation rate when it is published in one of the large publisher nations , the U.S. , U.K. , or the Netherlands , compared to a hypothetical situation when the same paper is published in journals of different origin .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This would constitute a free lunch , which could be explained by a Matthew effect visible on the country-level , similar to the well-documented Matthew effect on the author-level .

label: Research method
text: We first use a simulation model that highlights increasing citation returns to quality as the central key condition on which such a Matthew effect may emerge .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Then we use an international bibliometric panel data set of forty-nine countries for the years 2000-2010 and show that such a free lunch implied by this Matthew effect can be observed for top journals from the U.S. and depending on the specification also from the U.K. and the Netherlands , while there is no effect for lower-ranked American journals and negative effects for lower-ranked British journals as well as those coming from the Netherlands .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From the use of individual measures to the use of multiple features from different sources ( multimodality ) , studies have shown the feasibility to automatically detect whether a document is relevant .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite promising results , it is not clear yet to what extent multimodality constitutes an effective approach compared to unimodality .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we hypothesize that it is possible to build unimodal models capable of outperforming multimodal models in the detection of perceived relevance .

label: Research method
text: To test this hypothesis , we conducted three experiments to compare unimodal and multimodal classification models built using a combination of 24 features .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our classification experiments showed that a univariate unimodal model based on the left-click feature supports our hypothesis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: On the other hand , our prediction experiment suggests that multimodality slightly improves early classification compared to the best unimodal models .

label: Research questions
text: Based on our results , we argue that the feasibility for practical applications of state-of-the-art multimodal approaches may be strongly constrained by technology , cultural , ethical , and legal aspects , in which case unimodality may offer a better alternative today for supporting relevance detection in interactive information retrieval systems .

label: Research questions
text: However , although the amount of published data continues to grow and terms such as data deluge and big data today characterize numerous ( research ) initiatives , much work is still needed in the direction of publishing data in order to make them effectively discoverable , available , and reusable by others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Several barriers hinder data publishing , from lack of attribution and rewards , vague citation practices , and quality issues to a rather general lack of a data-sharing culture .

label: Research questions
text: Lately , data journals have overcome some of these barriers .

label: Research method
text: In this study of more than 100 currently existing data journals , we describe the approaches they promote for data set description , availability , citation , quality , and open access .

label: Research questions
text: We close by identifying ways to expand and strengthen the data journals approach as a means to promote data set access and exploitation .

label: Research questions
text: Portable , web-enabled music devices are widespread , and listeners now enjoy a plethora of options regarding formats , devices , and access methods .

label: Research questions
text: Yet in this mobile music environment , listeners ' access and management strategies for music collections are poorly understood , because behaviors surrounding the organization and retrieval of music collections have received little formal study .

label: Research questions
text: Our current research seeks to enrich our knowledge of people 's music listening and collecting behavior through a series of systematic user studies .

label: Research method
text: In this paper we present our Research findings/conclusions from interviews involving 20 adult and 20 teen users of commercial cloud music services .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our results contribute to theoretical understandings of users ' music information behavior in a time of upheaval in music usage patterns , and more generally , the Research questionss and meanings users ascribe to personal media collections in cloud-based systems .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions suggest improvements to the future design of cloud-based music services , as well as to any information systems and services designed for personal media collections , benefiting both commercial entities and listeners .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study contributes towards better understanding of scientists ' perceptions of and priorities for data quality and data quality assurance skills needed in genome annotation .

label: Research method
text: This study was guided by a previously developed general framework for assessment of data quality and by a taxonomy of data-quality ( DQ ) skills , and intended to define context-sensitive models of criteria for data quality and skills for genome annotation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Analysis of the results revealed that genomics scientists recognize specific sets of criteria for quality in the genome-annotation context .

label: Research method
text: Seventeen data quality dimensions were reduced to 5-factor constructs , and 17 relevant skills were grouped into 4-factor constructs .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The constructs defined by this study advance the understanding of data quality relationships and are an important contribution to data and information quality research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , the resulting models can serve as valuable resources to genome data curators and administrators for developing data-curation policies and designing DQ-assurance strategies , processes , procedures , and infrastructure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study 's Research findings/conclusions may also inform educators in developing data quality assurance curricula and training courses .

label: Research method
text: State-of-the-art image retrieval models are classified into three categories : content-based ( visual ) models , textual models , and combined models .

label: Research method
text: Content-based models use visual features to answer image queries , textual image retrieval models use word matching to answer textual queries , and combined image retrieval models , use both textual and visual features to answer queries .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Nevertheless , most of previous works in this field have used the same image retrieval model independently of the query type .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we define a list of generic and specific medical query features and exploit them in an association rule mining technique to discover correlations between query features and image retrieval models .

label: Research method
text: Based on these rules , we propose to use an associative classifier ( NaiveClass ) to find the best suitable retrieval model given a new textual query .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also propose a second associative classifier ( SmartClass ) to select the most appropriate default class for the query .

label: Research method
text: Experiments are performed on Medical ImageCLEF queries from 2008 to 2012 to evaluate the impact of the proposed query features on the classification performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that combining our proposed specific and generic query features is effective in query classification .

label: Research method
text: To collect data , a questionnaire , a diary study , and 2 semistructured interviews were conducted with each of 18 participants .

label: Research method
text: Then a content analysis was used to analyze the data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the analysis of the data , this study identified 3 different types of categorizers : ( i ) rigid categorizers , ( ii ) fuzzy categorizers , and ( iii ) flexible categorizers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study provides a unique way to understand personal information categorization by showing how it reflects the mindscapes of the categorizers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In particular , this study explains why people organize their personal information differently and have different tendencies in developing and maintaining their organizational structures .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The Research findings/conclusions provide insights on different ways of categorizing personal information and deepen our knowledge of categorization , personal information management , and information behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In practice , understanding different types of personal digital information categorization can make contributions to the development of systems , tools , and applications that support effective personal digital information categorization .

label: Research method
text: To this end , a conceptual analysis was made by comparing key models which approach information seeking as stage-based and cyclic processes .

label: Research questions
text: The nature of such processes was scrutinized by devoting attention to two main aspects , that is , the temporal order in which the constituents of information seeking appear during the process , and the changes occurring in the constituents .

label: Research questions
text: Stage-based approaches draw on linear time concept by conceptualizing such processes as sets of consecutive activities progressing toward a final point .

label: Research questions
text: Cyclic approaches conceptualize information-seeking processes as sets of iterative activities which may be repeated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions suggest that stage-based and cyclic approaches should not be opposite approaches ; rather , they complement each other .

label: Research questions
text: However , cyclic models emphasizing the importance of feedback loops have gained more popularity in the modeling of web searching , whereas the interest in the development of stage-based approaches has decreased since the 1990s .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We believe that journals in which researchers from academic institutions publish their works can be considered as useful identifiers for representing the relationships between these institutions and establishing comparisons .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , when academic journals are used for research output representation , distinctions must be introduced between them , based on their value as institution descriptors .

label: Research method
text: This leads us to the use of journal weights attached to the institution identifiers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Since a journal in which researchers from a large proportion of institutions published their papers may be a bad indicator of similarity between two academic institutions , it seems reasonable to weight it in accordance with how frequently researchers from different institutions published their papers in this journal .

label: Research method
text: Cluster analysis can then be applied to group the academic institutions , and dendrograms can be provided to illustrate groups of institutions following agglomerative hierarchical clustering .

label: Research method
text: In order to test this methodology , we use a sample of Spanish universities as a case study .

label: Research method
text: We first map the study sample according to an institution 's overall research output , then we use it for two scientific fields ( Information and Communication Technologies , as well as Medicine and Pharmacology ) as a means to demonstrate how our methodology can be applied , not only for analyzing institutions as a whole , but also in different disciplinary contexts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although sales data may give credible evidence for textbooks , these data may poorly reflect educational uses of other types of books .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As an alternative , this article proposes a method to search automatically for mentions of books in online academic course syllabi based on Bing searches for syllabi mentioning a given book , filtering out false matches through an extensive set of rules .

label: Research method
text: The method had an accuracy of over 90 % based on manual checks of a sample of 2,600 results from the initial Bing searches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Over one third of about 14,000 monographs checked had one or more academic syllabus mention , with more in the arts and humanities ( 56 % ) and social sciences ( 52 % ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Low but significant correlations between syllabus mentions and citations across most fields , except the social sciences , suggest that books tend to have different levels of impact for teaching and research .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In conclusion , the automatic syllabus search method gives a new way to estimate the educational utility of books in a way that sales data and citation counts can not .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One approach is to use n-grams in document representation instead of unigrams .

label: Research questions
text: However , the majority of early works on n-grams obtained only modest performance improvement .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: On the other hand , the use of information based on supporting terms or contexts of queries has been found to be promising .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , recent studies showed that using new context-dependent term weights improved the performance of relevance feedback ( RF ) retrieval compared with using traditional bag-of-words BM25 term weights .

label: Research method
text: Calculation of the new term weights requires an estimation of the local probability of relevance of each query term occurrence .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In previous studies , the estimation of this probability was based on unigrams that occur in the neighborhood of a query term .

label: Research method
text: We explore an integration of the n-gram and context approaches by computing context-dependent term weights based on a mixture of unigrams and bigrams .

label: Research method
text: Extensive experiments are performed using the title queries of the Text Retrieval Conference ( TREC ) -6 , TREC-7 , TREC-8 , and TREC-2005 collections , for RF with relevance judgment of either the top 10 or top 20 documents of an initial retrieval .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We identify some crucial elements needed in the use of bigrams in our methods , such as proper inverse document frequency ( IDF ) weighting of the bigrams and noise reduction by pruning bigrams with large document frequency values .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that enhancing context-dependent term weights with bigrams is effective in further improving retrieval performance .

label: Research questions
text: The efficiency of creating new knowledge is considered to have a geographical component , that is , some regions are more capable in terms of scientific knowledge production than others .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article presents a method of using a network representation of scientific interaction to assess the relative efficiency of regions with diverse boundaries in channeling knowledge through a science system .

label: Research method
text: In a first step , a weighted aggregate of the betweenness centrality is produced from empirical data ( aggregation ) .

label: Research method
text: The subsequent randomization of this empirical network produces the necessary null model for significance testing and normalization ( randomization ) .

label: Research method
text: This step is repeated to provide greater confidence about the results ( re-sampling ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results are robust estimates for the relative regional efficiency of brokering knowledge , which is discussed along with cross-sectional and longitudinal empirical examples .

label: Research method
text: The network representation acts as a straightforward metaphor of conceptual ideas from economic geography and neighboring disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the procedure is not limited to centrality measures , nor is it limited to geographical aggregates .

label: Research questions
text: Therefore , it offers a wide range of applications for scientometrics and beyond .

label: Research method
text: This study compares the team size and field normalized citation impact of research across all 27 Scopus broad fields in the 10 countries with the most journal articles indexed in Scopus 2008-2012 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that team size varies substantially by discipline and country , with Japan ( 4.2 ) having two-thirds more authors per article than the United Kingdom ( 2.5 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Solo authorship is rare in China ( 4 % ) but common in the United Kingdom ( 27 % ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While increasing team size associates with higher citation impact in almost all countries and fields , this association is much weaker in China than elsewhere .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There are also field differences in the association between citation impact and collaboration .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For example , larger team sizes in the Business , Management & Accounting category do not seem to associate with greater research impact , and for China and India , solo authorship associates with higher citation impact in this field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , there are substantial international and field differences in the extent to which researchers collaborate and the extent to which collaboration associates with higher citation impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The suggested index provides a benchmark for domain name traders and investors looking for information on price trends , historical returns , and the fundamental risk of Internet domain names .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The index increases transparency in the market for this newly emerged asset class .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Acointegration analysis shows that domain registrations and resale prices form a long-run equilibrium and indicates supply constraints in domain space .

label: Research method
text: This study explores a large data set of domain sales spanning the years 2006 to 2013 .

label: Research method
text: Differences in the quality of individual domain names are controlled for in hedonic repeat sales regressions .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , I propose a method of searching the literature by systematically mining the various types of citation relationships between articles .

label: Research method
text: I then test the method by comparing its precision and recall to that of 14 published systematic reviews .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The method successfully retrieved 74 % of the studies included in these reviews and 90 % of the studies it could reasonably be expected to retrieve .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The method also retrieved fewer than half of the total number of publications retrieved by these reviews and can be performed in substantially less time .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This suggests that the proposed method offers a promising complement to traditional text-based methods of literature identification and retrieval for systematic reviews .

label: Research method
text: The method starts with a small set of seed words , representing the target category , and calculates distributional similarity between the candidate and seed words .

label: Research method
text: We compare 3 distributional similarity measures ( Lin 's , Weeds 's , and balAPinc ) , and a document retrieval function , BM25 , adapted as a word similarity measure .

label: Research method
text: We then introduce a method for identifying multiword aspects by using a combination of syntactic rules and a co-occurrence association measure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we describe a method for ranking multiword aspects by the likelihood of belonging to the target aspect category .

label: Research method
text: The task used for evaluation is extraction of restaurant dish names from a corpus of restaurant reviews .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Studying more than 15 million authors and 22 million articles from 40 countries we document that : In 2019 , almost one in three articles was ( co- ) authored by authors with multiple affiliations and the share of authors with multiple affiliations increased from around 10 % to 16 % since 1996 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The growth of multiple affiliations is prevalent in all fields and it is stronger in high impact journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: About 60 % of multiple affiliations are between institutions from within the academic sector .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: International co-affiliations , which account for about a quarter of multiple affiliations , most often involve institutions from the United States , China , Germany and the United Kingdom , suggesting a core-periphery network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Network analysis also reveals a number communities of countries that are more likely to share affiliations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We discuss potential causes and show that the timing of the rise in multiple affiliations can be linked to the introduction of more competitive funding structures such as excellence initiatives in a number of countries .

label: Research method
text: We discuss implications for science and science policy .

label: Research method
text: We choose candidate expansion terms from a set of pseudo-relevant documents ; however , the usefulness of these terms is measured based on their definitions provided in a hand-crafted lexical resource such as WordNet .

label: Research method
text: Experiments with a number of standard TREC collections WordNet-based that this method outperforms existing WordNet-based methods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It also compares favorably with established QE methods such as KLD and RM3 .

label: Research method
text: Leveraging earlier work in which a combination of QE methods was found to outperform each individual method ( as well as other well-known QE methods ) , we next propose a combination-based QE method that takes into account three different aspects of a candidate expansion term 's usefulness : ( a ) its distribution in the pseudo-relevant documents and in the target corpus , ( b ) its statistical association with query terms , and ( c ) its semantic relation with the query , as determined by the overlap between the WordNet definitions of the term and query terms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This combination of diverse sources of information appears to work well on a number of test collections , viz. , TREC123 , TREC5 , TREC678 , TREC robust ( new ) , and TREC910 collections , and yields significant improvements over competing methods on most of these collections .

label: Research method
text: We construct international networks based on the co-occurrences of country names in news items and trace changes in their distribution of centrality over time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Supporting previous studies , our Research findings/conclusions indicate a consistent gap between the most central and the least central countries over the years , with the United States remaining at the center of the network and African countries at its peripheries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Surprisingly , the most dynamic changes in the past 50 years occurred in what we call the middle range .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In both outlets , we identified a trend of convergence , in other words , a more equal centrality of European , Middle Eastern , and Asian countries in the news .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The implications of these Research findings/conclusions are discussed .

label: Research method
text: The new method expands the initial query with a structured representation made of weighted word pairs ( WWP ) extracted from a set of training documents ( relevance feedback ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Standard text retrieval systems can handle a WWP structure through custom Boolean weighted models .

text: We experimented with both the explicit and pseudorelevance feedback schemas and compared the proposed term extraction method with others in the literature , such as KLD and RM3 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , to evaluate more fully the value of blog citations , it is necessary to investigate whether research blogs focus on particular types of articles or give new perspectives on scientific discourse .

label: Research questions
text: Therefore , we studied the characteristics of peer-reviewed references in blogs and the typical content of blog posts to gain insight into bloggers ' motivations .

label: Research method
text: The sample consisted of 391 blog posts from 2010 to 2012 in Researchblogging.org 's health category .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The bloggers mostly cited recent research articles or reviews from top multidisciplinary and general medical journals .

label: Research method
text: Using content analysis methods , we created a general classification scheme for blog post content with 10 major topic categories , each with several subcategories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that health research bloggers rarely self-cite and that the vast majority of their blog posts ( 90 % ) include a general discussion of the issue covered in the article , with more than one quarter providing health-related advice based on the article ( s ) covered .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These factors suggest a genuine attempt to engage with a wider , nonacademic audience .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , almost 30 % of the posts included some criticism of the issues being discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Having to adhere to requirements of platforms such as Twitter , researchers can only release a list of unique identifiers , which others can then use to recollect the data themselves .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This leads to subsets of the data no longer being available , as content can be deleted or user accounts deactivated .

label: Research method
text: To quantify the long-term impact of this in the replicability of datasets , we perform a longitudinal analysis of the persistence of 30 Twitter datasets , which include more than 147 million tweets .

label: Research method
text: By recollecting Twitter datasets ranging from 0 to 4 years old by using the tweet IDs , we look at four different factors quantifying the extent to which recollected datasets resemble original ones : completeness , representativity , similarity , and changingness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although the ratio of available tweets keeps decreasing as the dataset gets older , we find that the textual content of the recollected subset is still largely representative of the original dataset .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The representativity of the metadata , however , keeps fading over time , both because the dataset shrinks and because certain metadata , such as the users ' number of followers , keeps changing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our study has important implications for researchers sharing and using publicly shared Twitter datasets in their research .

label: Research questions
text: We do so by tracking entities that emerge in public discourse , that is , in online text streams such as social media and news streams , before they are incorporated into Wikipedia , which , we argue , can be viewed as an online place for collective memory .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By tracking how entities emerge in public discourse , that is , the temporal patterns between their first mention in online text streams and subsequent incorporation into collective memory , we gain insights into how the collective remembrance process happens online .

label: Research method
text: Specifically , we analyze nearly 80,000 entities as they emerge in online text streams before they are incorporated into Wikipedia .

label: Research method
text: The online text streams we use for our analysis comprise of social media and news streams , and span over 579 million documents in a time span of 18 months .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We discover two main emergence patterns : entities that emerge in a bursty fashion , that is , that appear in public discourse without a precedent , blast into activity and transition into collective memory .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Other entities display a delayed pattern , where they appear in public discourse , experience a period of inactivity , and then resurface before transitioning into our cultural collective memory .

label: Research questions
text: However , such data present challenges for both human and computational methods , requiring a diverse range of specialist skills , often shared across a number of individuals .

label: Research method
text: In this paper we use the analysis of a real-world data set as our case study , and use this exploration as a demonstration of our insight workflow , which we present for use and adaptation by other researchers .

label: Research method
text: The data we use are impact case study documents collected as part of the UK Research Excellence Framework ( REF ) , consisting of 6,679 documents and 6.25 million words ; the analysis was commissioned by the Higher Education Funding Council for England ( published as report HEFCE 2015 ) .

label: Research method
text: In our exploration and analysis we used a variety of techniques , ranging from keyword in context and frequency information to more sophisticated methods ( topic modeling ) , with these automated techniques providing an empirical point of entry for in-depth and intensive human analysis .

label: Research method
text: We present the 60 topics to demonstrate the output of our methods , and illustrate how the variety of analysis techniques can be combined to provide insights .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We note potential limitations and propose future work .

label: Research questions
text: It poses significant threats to organizational operations and information security .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article reviews insider threat research and outlines key propositions to conceptualize the interpretation of dynamic human information behavior in an organizational setting , which represent an integration of trustworthiness and human sensors ' attribution in close relationships .

label: Research questions
text: These propositions posit that when a focal individual violates integrity-based trust , the group can collectively attribute a shift in trustworthiness , triggering a natural peer attribution process that assigns cause to observed behavior .

label: Research questions
text: Group communication can thus reflect subtle changes in a focal individual 's perceived trustworthiness .

label: Research questions
text: The ability to understand group-based computer-mediated communication patterns over time may become essential in safeguarding information assets and the digital well-being of today 's organizations .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article contributes a novel theoretical lens to examine dynamic insights on insider threat detection .

label: Research questions
text: Although differences in determining trustworthiness and authority of scholarly resources exist among age groups and fields of study , traditional methods and criteria remain important across the board .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Peer review is considered the most important factor for determining the quality and trustworthiness of research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Researchers continue to read abstracts , check content for sound arguments and credible data , and rely on journal rankings when deciding whether to trust scholarly resources in reading , citing , or publishing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Social media outlets and open access publications are still often not trusted , although many researchers believe that open access has positive implications for research , especially if the open access journals are peer reviewed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Being able to provide a reason why items are similar has applications in recommendation , personalization , and search .

label: Research method
text: We investigate the problem within the context of Europeana , a large digital library containing items related to cultural heritage .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A range of types of similarity in this collection were identified .

label: Research method
text: A set of 1,500 pairs of items from the collection were annotated using crowdsourcing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A high intertagger agreement ( average 71.5 Pearson correlation ) was obtained and demonstrates that the task is well defined .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We also present several approaches to automatically identifying the type of similarity .

label: Research method
text: The best system applies linear regression and achieves a mean Pearson correlation of 71.3 , close to human performance .

label: Research method
text: The problem formulation and data set described here were used in a public evaluation exercise , the * SEM shared task on Semantic Textual Similarity .

label: Research method
text: The task attracted the participation of 6 teams , who submitted 14 system runs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: All annotations , evaluation scripts , and system runs are freely available .

label: Research method
text: This intersection is described by a summary of conceptualizations of research synthesis in a diverse set of research fields and in the context of Swanson 's ( 1986 ) discussion of undiscovered public knowledge .

label: Research method
text: Through a selective literature review , research topics that intersect with LIS and RSM are outlined .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Topics identified include open access , information retrieval , bias and research information ethics , referencing practices , citation patterns , and data science .

label: Research method
text: Subsequently , bibliometrics and topic modeling are used to present a systematic overview of the visibility of RSM in LIS .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This analysis indicates that RSM became visible in LIS in the 1980s .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , LIS research has drawn substantially from general and internal medicine , the field 's own literature , and business ; and is drawn on by health and medical sciences , computing , and business .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Through this analytical overview , it is confirmed that research synthesis is more visible in the health and medical literature in LIS ; but suggests that , LIS , as a meta-science , has the potential to make substantive contributions to a broader variety of fields in the context of topics related to research synthesis methods .

label: Research method
text: We analyze a dataset of 150 long essays whose authors searched the ClueWeb09 corpus for source material , while all querying , clicking , and writing activity was meticulously recorded .

label: Research method
text: We model the effect of search and writing behavior on essay quality using path analysis .

label: Research method
text: Since the boil-down and build-up writing strategies identified in previous research have been found to affect search behavior , we model each writing strategy separately .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis shows that the search process contributes significantly to essay quality through both direct and mediated effects , while the author 's writing strategy moderates this relationship .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our models explain 25-35 % of the variation in essay quality through rather simple search and writing process characteristics alone , a fact that has implications on how search engines could personalize result pages for writing tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Authors ' writing strategies and associated searching patterns differ , producing differences in essay quality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In a nutshell : essay quality improves if search and writing strategies harmonize-build-up writers benefit from focused , in-depth querying , while boil-down writers fare better with a broader and shallower querying strategy .

label: Research questions
text: With the popularity of crowdsourcing , different types of HCGs have been developed using various gameplay mechanics to attract online users to contribute outputs .

label: Research method
text: Two commonly used mechanics are collaboration and competition .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Yet there is little research examining whether HCGs perform better than nongame applications in terms of motivations and perceptions .

label: Research questions
text: Thus , this study investigates the effects of collaborative and competitive mechanics on intrinsic motivation and perceived output quality in mobile content sharing HCGs .

label: Research method
text: Using a within-subjects experiment , 160 participants were recruited from 2 local universities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions suggest that the nongame application was perceived to yield better quality output than both HCGs , but the latter offered a greater satisfaction of motivational needs , which may motivate individuals to continue playing them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Taken together , the present Research findings/conclusions inform researchers and designers of HCGs that games could serve as a motivator to encourage participation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the usefulness of HCGs may be dependent on how one can effectively manage the entertainment-output generation duality of such games .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article concludes by presenting implications , limitations , and future research directions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research contributes to the discussion on solving digital exclusion issues by addressing the emergent roles and challenges of Lithuanian public libraries in reducing the digital divide .

label: Research method
text: The article combines a multilevel model of the digital divide with the concept of business idea and analyzes the future scenarios of Lithuanian public libraries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions highlight the public libraries ' importance in conducting training , consultancy , and experiential learning to stimulate digital inclusion .

label: Research questions
text: Potentially , libraries can motivate users to adopt digital technologies , but this role is still not sufficiently visible .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions show that libraries face challenges of redefining their social value and obtaining the sustaining funds , skills , and infrastructure necessary for digital inclusion programs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , they can use collaboration networks , effective cost management , and external expertise to overcome these obstacles .

label: Research questions
text: These state-of-the-art strategies are highly dependent on linguistic features that best suit the language for which they were intended , constraining their adaptability and making it difficult to determine whether they would remain effective if they were applied to estimate the level of difficulty of texts in other languages .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we present the results of a study designed to determine the feasibility of a cross-lingual readability assessment strategy .

label: Research method
text: For doing so , we first analyzed the most common features used for readability assessment and determined their influence on the readability prediction process of 6 different languages : English , Spanish , Basque , Italian , French , and Catalan .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In addition , we developed a cross-lingual readability assessment strategy that serves as a means to empirically explore the potential advantages of employing a single strategy ( and set of features ) for readability assessment in different languages , including interlanguage prediction agreement and prediction accuracy improvement for low-resource languages .

label: Research questions
text: In such research , opinions about politicians are typically divided into positive , negative , or neutral .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In our research , the goal is to mine political opinion from social media at a higher resolution by assessing statements of opinion related to the personality traits of politicians ; this is an angle that has not yet been considered in social media research .

label: Research questions
text: A second goal is to contribute a novel retrieval-based approach for tracking public perception of personality using Gough and Heilbrun 's Adjective Check List ( ACL ) of 110 terms describing key traits .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This is in contrast to the typical lexical and machine-learning approaches used in sentiment analysis .

label: Research method
text: High-precision search templates developed from the ACL were run on an 18-month span of Twitter posts mentioning Obama and Romney and these retrieved more than half a million tweets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For example , the results indicated that Romney was perceived as more of an achiever and Obama was perceived as somewhat more friendly .

label: Research method
text: The traits were also aggregated into 14 broad personality dimensions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For example , Obama rated far higher than Romney on the Moderation dimension and lower on the Machiavellianism dimension .

text: The temporal variability of such perceptions was explored .

label: Research questions
text: To better understand the intellectual heritage and major influences shaping the development of the individual and collective identities in iSchools , we develop a classification of the intellectual domains of iSchool faculty education .

text: We use this to develop a descriptive analysis of the community 's intellectual composition .

label: Research questions
text: The discussion focuses on characterizing intellectual diversity in the iSchools .

text: We conclude with a discussion of the potential implications of these trends relative to the future development of the iSchool community .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This ranking is intended to be a helpful amendment of other available institutional rankings .

label: Research questions
text: In addition to authoritative health information sites maintained by government health departments and healthcare institutions , there are many social media sites carrying user-contributed information .

label: Research questions
text: This study sought to identify the types of drug information available on consumer-contributed drug review sites when compared with authoritative drug information websites .

label: Research method
text: Content analysis was performed on the information available for nine drugs on three authoritative sites ( RxList , eMC , and PDRhealth ) as well as three drug review sites ( WebMD , RateADrug , and PatientsLikeMe ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The types of information found on authoritative sites but rarely on drug review sites include pharmacology , special population considerations , contraindications , and drug interactions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Types of information found only on drug review sites include drug efficacy , drug resistance experienced by long-term users , cost of drug in relation to insurance coverage , availability of generic forms , comparison with other similar drugs and with other versions of the drug , difficulty in using the drug , and advice on coping with side effects .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Drug efficacy ratings by users were found to be different across the three sites .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Side effects were vividly described in context , with user assessment of severity based on discomfort and effect on their lives .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we investigate how providing different kinds of awareness support affects people 's coordination behavior in a CIS task , as reflected by the communication that took place between them .

label: Research method
text: We describe a laboratory study with 84 participants in 42 pairs with an experimental CIS system .

label: Research method
text: These participants were brought to the laboratory for two separate sessions and given two exploratory search tasks .

label: Research method
text: They were randomly assigned to one of the three systems , defined by the kind of awareness support provided .

label: Research method
text: We analyzed the messages exchanged between the participants of each team by coding them for their coordination attributes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: With this coding , we show how the participants employed different kinds of coordination during the study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using qualitative and quantitative analyses , we demonstrate that the teams with no awareness , or with only personal awareness support , needed to spend more time and effort doing coordination than those with proper group awareness support .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We argue that appropriate and adequate awareness support is essential for a CIS system for reducing coordination costs and keeping the collaborators well coordinated for a productive collaboration .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions have implications for system designers as well as cognitive scientists and CIS researchers in general .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Examples include visual analytics , decision support , and educational tools .

label: Research questions
text: Through interaction with visual representations of information at the visual interface of these tools , a joint , coordinated cognitive system is formed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This partnership results in a number of relational properties-those depending on both humans and tools-that researchers and designers must be aware of if such tools are to effectively support the performance of complex cognitive activities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article presents 10 properties of interactive visual representations that are essential and relational and whose values can be adjusted through interaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By adjusting the values of these properties , better coordination between humans and tools can be effected , leading to higher quality performance of complex cognitive activities .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article examines how the values of these properties affect cognitive processing and visual reasoning and demonstrates the necessity of making their values adjustable-all of which is situated within a broader theoretical framework concerned with human-information interaction in complex cognitive activities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This framework can facilitate systematic research , design , and evaluation in numerous fields including information visualization , health informatics , visual analytics , and educational technology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: With secondary data from a 2012 survey ( N=622 ) , the final well-fitting structural equation model revealed that teen online privacy concerns were primarily influenced by parental interpersonal trust and parental concerns about teens ' online privacy , whereas teen privacy protection behaviors were primarily predicted by teen cost-benefit appraisal of online interactions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In turn , teen online privacy concerns predicted increased privacy protection behaviors and lower teen information disclosure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , restrictive and instructive parental mediation exerted differential influences on teens ' privacy protection behaviors and online information disclosure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Unfortunately , the majority of published books are assigned a readability level range , which is not useful to readers who look for books at a particular grade level .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Existing readability formulas/analysis tools require at least an excerpt of a book to estimate its readability level , which is a severe constraint , since copyright laws prohibit book contents from being made publicly accessible .

label: Research method
text: To alleviate the constraint , we have developed TRoLL which relies on publicly accessible online book metadata , in addition to using a book 's snippet , if it is available , to predict its readability level .

label: Research method
text: Based on a multi-dimensional regression analysis , TRoLL determines the grade level of any book instantly , even without a sample of its text , and considers its topical suitability , which is unique .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Furthermore , TRoLL is a significant contribution to the educational community , since its computed book readability levels can enrich K-12 readers ' book selections and aid parents , teachers , and librarians in locating reading materials suitable for their K-12 readers , which can be a time-consuming and frustrating task that does not always yield a quality outcome .

label: Research method
text: Conducted empirical studies have verified the prediction accuracy of TRoLL and demonstrated its superiority over well-known readability formulas/analysis tools .

label: Research method
text: In the Gmail study , we informed 75 participants about both folder-labeling and tag-labeling , observed their storage behavior after 1 month , and asked them to estimate the proportions of different retrieval options in their behavior .

label: Research method
text: In the Windows 7 study , we informed 23 participants about tags and asked them to tag all their files for 2 weeks , followed by a period of 5 weeks of free choice between the 2 methods .

label: Research method
text: Their storage and retrieval habits were tested prior to the learning session and , after 7 weeks , using special classification recording software and a retrieval-habits questionnaire .

label: Research method
text: A controlled retrieval task and an in-depth interview were conducted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results of both studies show a strong preference for folders over tags for both storage and retrieval .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the minority of cases where tags were used for storage , participants typically used a single tag per information item .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , when multiple classification was used for storage , it was only marginally used for retrieval .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The controlled retrieval task showed lower success rates and slower retrieval speeds for tag use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Possible reasons for participants ' preferences are discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The differences between them are only the features selected and the method used for weighting them .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this article , we present an unsupervised method for polarity classification in Twitter .

label: Research method
text: The method is based on the expansion of the concepts expressed in the tweets through the application of PageRank to WordNet .

label: Research method
text: In addition , we integrate SentiWordNet to compute the final value of polarity .

label: Research method
text: The synsets values are weighted with the PageRank scores obtained in the previous random walk process over WordNet .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results obtained show that disambiguation and expansion are good strategies for improving overall performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Here I advocate and demonstrate adaption of the h-index and the g-index to the top video content creators on YouTube .

label: Research method
text: The h-index for Internet video media is based on videos and their view counts .

label: Research method
text: The h-index is defined as the number of videos with > = h x 10 ( 5 ) views .

label: Research method
text: The g-index is defined as the number of videos with > = g x 10 ( 5 ) views on average .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When compared with a video creator 's total view count , the h-index and g-index better capture both productivity and impact in a single metric .

label: Research questions
