text: One area where consumers are particularly prone to make costly decision-making errors is long-term saving , which requires understanding of complex concepts such as uncertainty and trade-offs .

label: Research questions
text: Although most people are poorly equipped to deal with such concepts , interactive design can potentially help users make better decisions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We developed an interactive information label to assist consumers with retirement saving decision-making .

label: Research method
text: To evaluate it , we exposed 450 users to one of four user interface conditions in a retirement saving simulator where they made 35 yearly decisions under changing circumstances .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found a significantly better ability of users to reach their goals with the information label .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , users who interacted with the label made better decisions than those who were presented with a static information label .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Lastly , we found the label particularly effective in helping novice savers .

label: Research method
text: Through a qualitative content analysis of 200 posts across Internet groups , we identify topics and information needs expressed by people who feel they have no other sources of support available to them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We uncover various health , well-being , social , and identity issues that are not only crucial to the lives of the people posting but which they are unwilling to risk revealing elsewhere-offering evidence that these online environments provide an outlet for the expression of critical and hidden information needs .

label: Research method
text: To enable this analysis , we first describe our method for reliably identifying situations of information poverty in messages posted to these groups and outline our coding approach .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our work contributes to the study of both information seeking within the context of information poverty and the use of Internet groups as sources of information and support , bridging the two by exploring the manifestation of information poverty in this particular online setting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , the numbers of inlinks to academic websites are associated with academic performance , while the counts of inlinks to company websites correlate with business variables .

label: Research questions
text: However , the scarcity of sources from which to collect inlink data in recent years has required us to seek new data sources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The recent demise of the inlink search function of Yahoo !

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: made this need more pressing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Different alternative variables or data sources have been proposed .

label: Research method
text: This study compared three types of web data to determine which are better as academic and business quality estimates , and what are the relationships among the three data sources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study found that Alexa inlink and Google URL citation data can replace Yahoo !

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: inlink data and that the former is better than the latter .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Alexa is even better than Yahoo ! , which has been the main data source in recent years .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The unique nature of Alexa data could explain its relative advantages over other data sources .

label: Research method
text: Using a coding scheme developed through qualitative analysis of transcribed interviews , these data can be subjected to exploratory statistical analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The reasons given by respondents for getting the ICD differed by both region and gender , and show some correlations with whether the device has or has not delivered any stimulation ( shocks ) since implantation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Cluster analysis reveals association among certain important themes in the discussion of the decision process , particularly linking rather opposite concepts into clusters related to specific dimensions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest the importance , to patients , of maintaining the integrity of the self by asserting control and independence .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The majority of the respondents ( 61 % ) have not received the primary intended benefit of the device ( stimulation ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , the Research findings/conclusions suggest that psychological benefits alone of having the device ( such as anxiety reduction ) serve to justify acceptance of a computerized device .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Implications for other lines of computerized health support and for further study of these issues are discussed .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this work we attempt to help users browsing a large number of accumulated posts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We propose a personalized word cloud generation as a means for users ' navigation .

label: Research method
text: Various user past activities such as user published tweets , retweets , and seen but not retweeted tweets are leveraged for enhanced personalization of word clouds .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The best personalization results are attained with user past retweets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , users ' own past tweets are not as useful as retweets for personalization .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Negative preferences derived from seen but not retweeted tweets further enhance personalized word cloud generation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The ranking combination method outperforms the preranking approach and provides a general framework for combined ranking of various user past information for enhanced word cloud generation .

label: Research method
text: To better capture subtle differences of generated word clouds , we propose an evaluation of word clouds with a mean average precision measure .

label: Research questions
text: This study aimed to unpack how young people ( middle and high schoolers ) sought , used , and shared information in voluntary free-choice library makerspace activities .

label: Research method
text: Qualitative methods , including individual interviews , observations , photovoice , and focus groups , were used to elicit 21 participants ' experiences at two library makerspaces .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions showed that young people engaged in dynamic practices of information seeking , use , and sharing , and revealed how the historical , sociocultural , material , and technological contexts embedded in makerspace activities shaped these information practices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Information practices of tinkering , sensing , and imagining in makerspaces were highlighted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Various criteria that young people used in evaluating human sources and online information were identified as well .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study also demonstrated the communicative and collaborative aspects of young people 's information practices through information sharing .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The Research findings/conclusions extended Savolainen 's everyday information practices model and addressed the gap in the current literature on young people 's information behavior and information practices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Understanding how young people interact with information in makerspaces can help makerspace facilitators and information professionals better support youth services and facilitate makerspace activities .

label: Research questions
text: The increasing practice of interdisciplinary research challenges the effectiveness of journal-based assessments .

label: Research questions
text: The aim of this article is to highlight topics as a valuable unit of analysis .

label: Research method
text: A set of topic-based approaches is applied to a data set on library and information science publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that topic-based approaches are capable of revealing the research dynamics , impact , and dissemination of the selected data set .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The article also identifies a nonsignificant relationship between topic popularity and impact and argues for the need to use both variables in describing topic characteristics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additionally , a flow map illustrates critical topic-level knowledge dissemination channels .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Science publications written in other languages do not gain the same exposure to the international scientific community as does the material in English .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this sense , non-English articles constitute an invisible science for the rest of the scientific world .

label: Research method
text: This study compares publications indexed in the academic-oriented Hebrew Index of Periodicals ( IHP ) database with those in the Science Citation Index Expanded ( SCIE ) in order to document the amount of scientific material published in Israel , where Hebrew is the native language .

label: Research questions
text: Except for abstracts , which are sometimes given in English , as well as Hebrew , and therefore provide some idea of a paper 's content , most of this research remains hidden from the international scientific community .

label: Research method
text: The SCIE and IHP databases for our examination cover the three grand disciplines : the exact and life sciences , the social sciences , and the humanities .

label: Research questions
text: Additionally , the study probes the coverage of medical publications in the two databases .

label: Research questions
text: The difference between old and emerging disciplines in the use of a language other than Hebrew is observed and non-English citation patterns for various disciplines are examined .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results confirm the dominance of English as the lingua franca of science and point to the large number of scientific studies in Hebrew that lack international exposure .

label: Research method
text: This article describes the application of analysis methods from two distinct fields , one method from interpretive social science and one method from statistical machine learning , to the same survey data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that the two analyses produce some similar and some complementary insights about the phenomenon of interest , in this case , nonuse of social media .

label: Research method
text: We compare both the processes of conducting these analyses and the results they produce to derive insights about each method 's unique advantages and drawbacks , as well as the broader roles that these methods play in the respective fields where they are often used .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These insights allow us to make more informed decisions about the tradeoffs in choosing different methods for analyzing textual data .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Furthermore , this comparison suggests ways that such methods might be combined in novel and compelling ways .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An online discussion forum ( ODF ) is one of these mechanisms , but it will only be successful if students are willing to participate .

label: Research questions
text: Stimulating students is a challenge many institutions currently face .

label: Research questions
text: The objective of this study was to analyze the social interaction among participants in ODFs using Social Network Analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Knowing the characteristics of these networks and its participants is important to design actions to improve the use of ODFs .

label: Research method
text: As a case study , data were collected from ODF logs of the majors in Business Administration and Accounting in a Brazilian private university .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study found out that these interaction networks are sparse , which shows that students could be more engaged in interacting and collaborating with others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Students , in general , tend to interact more in the first semester and interaction diminishes as time passes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The number of active ODF participants has been around 45-50 % , which shows that students currently do not participate very often in ODFs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Their main incentive seems to exist when they are graded .

label: Research method
text: Popular ODFs were also analyzed .

label: Research method
text: This article expands on the data sharing component of a paper presented at the 2013 ASIST conference .

label: Research method
text: A three-phase project is reported .

label: Research method
text: Conducted between 2011 and 2013 within an environmental voluntary group , the Australian Plants Society Victoria ( APSV ) , the interviews of the first phase are the major data source .

label: Research method
text: Because the project revealed the importance of data sharing with professional scientists , their views are included in the literature review where four themes are explored : lack of shared disciplinary culture , trust , responsibility and controlled access to data , and describing data to enable reuse .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions , presented under these themes , revealed that , within APSV , sharing among members is mostly generous and uninhibited .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Beyond APSV , when online repositories were involved , barriers came very strongly into play .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Trust was weaker and barriers also included issues of data quality , data description , and ownership and control .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The conclusion is that further investigation of these barriers , including the attitudes of professional scientists to using data contributed by citizen scientists , would indicate how more extensive and useful data sharing could be achieved .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , we identify spatial patterns of collaboration in Brazil and measure the role of geographic proximity in determining the interaction among researchers .

label: Research method
text: Using a database comprising more than one million researchers and seven million publications , we consolidated information on interregional research collaboration in terms of scientific coauthorship networks among 4,615 municipalities during the period between 1992 and 2009 , which allowed us to analyze a range of data unprecedented in the literature .

label: Research method
text: The effects of geographic distance on collaboration were measured for different areas by estimating spatial interaction models .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main results provide strong evidence of geographic deconcentration of collaboration in recent years , with increased participation of authors in scientifically less traditional regions , such as south and northeast Brazil .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Distance remains a significant factor in determining the intensity of knowledge flow in collaboration networks in Brazil , as an increase of 100km between two researchers reduces the probability of collaboration by an average of 16 % , and there is no evidence that the effect of distance has diminished over time , although the magnitude of such effects varies among networks of different areas .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It has been pointed out that very little is known about the psychosocial variables that predict people 's use of these websites .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , our general objective is to understand behavioral intentions to use SNS employing the well-known unified theory of acceptance and use of technology ( UTAUT ) , which has been validated in a number of studies .

label: Research method
text: Data were collected through a questionnaire survey from a final sample of 1,039 social networking website users in Africa .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We have shown that there are contexts , such as the African context , in which the UTAUT does not hold up .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Explanations are provided to support the Research findings/conclusions .

label: Research method
text: Kuhlthau 's 7-stage Information Search Process ( ISP ) model forms the conceptual framework for the study .

label: Research questions
text: The aim of the study was to define an end game for the ISP model by answering the following question : How do the student participants ' feelings , thoughts , and information behavior lead to the construction of new knowledge ?

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Study Research findings/conclusions tentatively indicate that knowledge construction results from an iterative process between the student and information , which can be divided into 3 phases .

label: Research method
text: In the first phase , the students formulate questions from their previous knowledge to start knowledge construction ; in the second phase , newly found topic information causes students to ask questions ; and in the third phase , the students answer the questions asked by this newly found topic information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on these results and Kuhlthau 's own ISP stage 7 assessment definition of the ISP model end game , we propose a model of knowledge construction inserted as an extra row in the ISP model framework .

label: Research questions
text: Online fake news is a specific type of digital misinformation that poses serious threats to democratic institutions , misguides the public , and can lead to radicalization and violence .

label: Research questions
text: Hence , fake news detection is an important problem for information science research .

label: Research questions
text: While there have been multiple attempts to identify fake news , most of such efforts have focused on a single modality ( e.g. , only text-based or only visual features ) .

label: Research questions
text: However , news articles are increasingly framed as multimodal news stories , and hence , in this work , we propose a multimodal approach combining text and visual analysis of online news stories to automatically detect fake news .

label: Research method
text: Drawing on key theories of information processing and presentation , we identify multiple text and visual features that are associated with fake or credible news articles .

label: Research method
text: We then perform a predictive analysis to detect features most strongly associated with fake news .

label: Research method
text: Next , we combine these features in predictive models using multiple machine-learning techniques .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results indicate that a multimodal approach outperforms single-modality approaches , allowing for better fake news detection .

label: Research method
text: The authors considered this problem by examining the domains , objectives , and architectures of nine metadata schemes used to document scientific data in the physical , life , and social sciences .

label: Research method
text: They used a mixed-methods content analysis and Greenberg 's ( ) metadata objectives , principles , domains , and architectural layout ( MODAL ) framework , and derived 22 metadata-related goals from textual content describing each metadata scheme .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Relationships are identified between the domains ( e.g. , scientific discipline and type of data ) and the categories of scheme objectives .

label: Research method
text: For each strong correlation ( > 0.6 ) , a Fisher 's exact test for nonparametric data was used to determine significance ( p ? < ? .05 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Significant relationships were found between the domains and objectives of the schemes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Schemes describing observational data are more likely to have scheme harmonization ( compatibility and interoperability with related schemes ) as an objective ; schemes with the objective abstraction ( a conceptual model exists separate from the technical implementation ) also have the objective sufficiency ( the scheme defines a minimal amount of information to meet the needs of the community ) ; and schemes with the objective data publication do not have the objective element refinement .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis indicates that many metadata-driven goals expressed by communities are independent of scientific discipline or the type of data , although they are constrained by historical community practices and workflows as well as the technological environment at the time of scheme creation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis reveals 11 fundamental metadata goals for metadata documenting scientific data in support of sharing research data across disciplines and domains .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The authors report these results and highlight the need for more metadata-related research , particularly in the context of recent funding agency policy changes .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Existing research mainly focuses on the ways in which SNSs are used in libraries and on librarians ' or users ' attitudes towards these SNSs .

label: Research method
text: This study focused on the flow of information via SNS interactions between librarians and users on library Facebook , Twitter , and Chinese Weibo sites , and developed an SNS user interaction type model based on these information flows .

label: Research method
text: A mixed-method approach was employed combining quantitative data generated from the analysis of 1,753 posts sampled from 40 library SNSs and qualitative data from interviews with 10 librarians .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Four types of interactions were identified : information/knowledge sharing , information dissemination , communication , and information gathering .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study found that SNSs were used primarily as channels for disseminating news and announcements about things currently happening in the library .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Communication allowed open-ended questions and produced more replies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In Facebook posts , Chinese Facebook users generated less likes than English-speaking users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The comparison of data between Facebook-like and Twitter-like SNSs in different library settings suggested that libraries need to coordinate different types of SNSs , and take library settings and sociocultural environments into consideration in order to enhance and encourage user engagement and interaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Bibliometric and patent file searches indicate that the Syntex industrial laboratory located in Mexico and the Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Mexico ( UNAM ) produced about 54 % of the relevant papers published in mainstream journals , which in turn generated over 80 % of the citations and in the case of Syntex , all industrial patents in the field between 1950 and 1965 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This course of events , which was unprecedented at that time in a developing country , was interrupted when Syntex moved its research division to the US , leaving Mexico with a small but productive research group in the chemistry of natural products .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These training sets are costly and laborious to produce , requiring human annotators to assess the relevance or order of the documents in relation to a query .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Active learning algorithms are able to reduce the labeling effort by selectively sampling an unlabeled set and choosing data instances that maximize a learning function 's effectiveness .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this article , we propose a novel two-stage active learning method for L2R that combines and exploits interesting properties of its constituent parts , thus being effective and practical .

label: Research method
text: In the first stage , an association rule active sampling algorithm is used to select a very small but effective initial training set .

label: Research method
text: In the second stage , a query-by-committee strategy trained with the first-stage set is used to iteratively select more examples until a preset labeling budget is met or a target effectiveness is achieved .

label: Research method
text: We test our method with various LETOR benchmarking data sets and compare it with several baselines to show that it achieves good results using only a small portion of the original training sets .

label: Research method
text: In this article , through an observational user study , we investigate the search behavior of 15 visually impaired and 15 sighted searchers while they complete complex search tasks online .

label: Research questions
text: We study complex search tasks because they are challenging , cognitively intensive and affect performance of searchers .

label: Research method
text: We compare the behavior of the two groups of searchers at four stages of the information-seeking process namely , Query Formulation , Search Results Exploration , Query Reformulation , and Search Results Management .

label: Research method
text: For each stage , we identify research questions to investigate the impact of speech-based screen readers on the information-seeking behavior of visually impaired users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Significant differences were observed during query formulation and in the use of query-level support features such as query suggestions and spelling suggestions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , screen-reader users submitted a lower number of queries and displayed comparatively limited exploratory behavior during search results exploration .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We investigate how a lack of visual cues affected visually impaired searchers ' approach towards query reformulation and observed different strategies to manage and use information encountered during the search process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We discuss the implications that our Research findings/conclusions have for the design of search interfaces and propose a set of design guidelines to consider when designing interfaces that are usable and accessible with screen readers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This work also enhances our understanding of search behavior when using an auditory interface and could be useful when designing audio-based information retrieval systems .

label: Research method
text: A questionnaire was administered to 1,048 students in the 7th to 11th grades in six different schools , one class in each grade .

label: Research method
text: The questionnaire included personal data , characteristics of Internet interaction patterns , moral dilemmas in daily life , and moral dilemmas in the virtual environment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: No significant differences were found between the genders regarding the age usage of the Internet began , Internet experience , and average daily hours of Internet use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that boys prefer , more than girls , to surf at school and in Internet cafes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Girls tend to use the Internet more for doing homework and blogs than boys , whereas boys tend to play Internet games more than girls .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Gender differences were found regarding immoral behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Boys were involved more frequently than girls in behaviors such as cyberbullying , plagiarism , impersonation , and downloading music and movies illegally from the Internet .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A correlation was found between gender and moral judgment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although both boys and girls made relatively little humane judgment in the Internet environment , girls tended to make humane judgment more frequently than boys .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the Internet environment , boys tended to make absence of judgment evaluations more than girls .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Girls tended , relatively more , toward normative judgment that reflects adherence to peer-group conventions with minimal reflexivity .

label: Research questions
text: Distributed individuals independently edit , revise , or refine content , thereby creating knowledge artifacts of considerable breadth and quality .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our study explores the mechanisms that control and guide the content creation process and develops an understanding of open content governance .

label: Research method
text: The repertory grid method is employed to systematically capture the experiences of individuals involved in the open content creation process and to determine the relative importance of the diverse control and guiding mechanisms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions illustrate the important control and guiding mechanisms and highlight the multifaceted nature of open content governance .

label: Research questions
text: A range of governance mechanisms is discussed with regard to the varied levels of formality , the different loci of authority , and the diverse interaction environments involved .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Limitations and opportunities for future research are provided .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The sole protection for any user are three sets of privacy protections afforded by Facebook : settings that control information privacy ( i.e. , security of social media accounts and identity information ) , accessibility privacy or anonymity ( i.e. , manage who can connect with a user ) , and those that control expressive privacy ( i.e. , control who can see a user 's posts and tag you ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using these settings , however , involves a trade-off between making oneself accessible and thereby vulnerable to potential attacks , or enacting stringent protections that could potentially make someone inaccessible thereby reducing the benefits that are accruable through social media .

label: Research method
text: Using two theoretical frameworks , Uses and Gratifications ( U & G ) and Protection Motivation Theory ( PMT ) , the research examined how individuals congitvely juxtaposed the cost of maintaining privacy through the use of these settings against the benefits of openness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The application of the U & G framework revealed that social need fulfillment was the single most significant benefit driving privacy management .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From the cost standpoint , the PMT framework pointed to perceived severity impacting expressive and information privacy , and perceived susceptability influencing accessibility privacy .

label: Research questions
text: CC has been expected to alleviate societal problems such as hyper-consumption , pollution , and poverty by lowering the cost of economic coordination within communities .

label: Research questions
text: However , beyond anecdotal evidence , there is a dearth of understanding why people participate in CC .

label: Research questions
text: Therefore , in this article we investigate people 's motivations to participate in CC .

label: Research method
text: The study employs survey data ( N=168 ) gathered from people registered onto a CC site .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that participation in CC is motivated by many factors such as its sustainability , enjoyment of the activity as well as economic gains .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An interesting detail in the result is that sustainability is not directly associated with participation unless it is at the same time also associated with positive attitudes towards CC .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This suggests that sustainability might only be an important factor for those people for whom ecological consumption is important .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , the results suggest that in CC an attitude-behavior gap might exist ; people perceive the activity positively and say good things about it , but this good attitude does not necessary translate into action .

label: Research questions
text: Social support is crucial to the well-being and quality of life of people with unpredictable and incurable diseases such as ALS .

label: Research questions
text: Members of the PatientsLikeMe ( PLM ) ALS online support community share social support but also exchange and build distributed knowledge within their discussion forum .

label: Research method
text: This qualitative analysis of 1,000 posts from the PLM ALS online discussion examines the social support within the PLM ALS online community and explores ways community members share and build knowledge .

label: Research method
text: The analysis responds to 3 research questions : RQ1 : How and why is knowledge shared among the distributed participants in the PLM-ALS threaded discussion forum ?

label: Research questions
text: ; RQ2 : How do the participants in the PLM-ALS threaded discussion forum work together to discover knowledge about treatments and to keep knowledge discovered over time ?

label: Research questions
text: ; and RQ3 : How do participants in the PLM-ALS forum co-create and treat authoritative knowledge from multiple sources including the medical literature , healthcare professionals , lived experiences of patients and other sources of information such as lay literature and alternative health providers ?

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions have implications for supporting knowledge sharing and discovery in addition to social support for patients .

label: Research questions
text: Being a new form of work facilitated by information technology , the rise of crowdsourcing calls for the development of new theoretical insights .

label: Research questions
text: Our focus in this article is on extra-role behavioremployees ' voluntary activities , which are not part of their prescribed duties .

label: Research questions
text: Specifically , we explored how user interface design can help increase extra-role behavior among crowdsourcing workers .

label: Research method
text: In a randomized experiment , we examined the joint effects of the presentation of a performance display to crowdsourcing workers and the personal attributes of these workers on the workers ' likelihood to engage in extra-role behavior .

label: Research method
text: The experimental setting included an image analysis task performed on an environmental monitoring website .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We compared workers ' behavior across the different experimental conditions and found that the interaction between the presence of a performance display and the workers ' personality trait of curiosity has a significant impact on the likelihood of engaging in extra-role behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , the presence of a performance display was associated with increased likelihood of extra-role behavior among low-curiosity workers , and no change in extra-role behavior was observed among high-curiosity users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Implications for design are discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As such , PAC provides a framework for a theory of research evaluation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study examined the success factors of online posts from organizations in evoking a high level of response from group members .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , appeals to community belongingness were discovered to be effective at motivating user engagement on social media .

label: Research method
text: The impact of community-focused language on garnering likes , comments , and shares was assessed using a methodology that combined text analytics , supervised machine learning , and multilevel regression .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In 51,760 postings from 100 academic libraries , it was found that general community appeals increase likes by 60 % , comments by 130 % , and shares by 39 % , whereas specific intracommunity , locally meaningful references increase likes by 16 % and shares by 12 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions have both theoretical implications , as they constitute a large-scale , empirical confirmation of the belongingness hypothesis from social psychology , and practical implications , as they suggest best practices for maintaining an organizational online presence .

label: Research method
text: To steer readers ' attention to the most important papers , journals use several techniques ( e.g. , lead paper ) .

label: Research questions
text: Angewandte Chemie International Edition ( AC ) , a leading international journal in chemistry , signals high-quality papers through designating them as a very important paper ( VIP ) .

label: Research questions
text: This study aims to investigate the citation impact of Communications in AC receiving the special feature VIP , both cumulated and over time .

label: Research method
text: Using propensity score matching , treatment group ( VIP ) and control group ( non-VIP ) were balanced for 14 covariates to estimate the unconfounded average treatment effect on the treated for the VIP designation .

label: Research method
text: Out of N = 3,011 Communications published in 2007 and 2008 , N = 207 received the special feature VIP .

label: Research method
text: For each Communication , data were collected from AC ( e.g. , referees ' ratings ) and from the databases Chemical Abstracts ( e.g. , sections ) and the Web of Science ( e.g. , citations ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The estimated unconfounded average treatment effect on the treated ( that is , Communications designated as a VIP ) was statistically significant and amounted to 19.83 citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , the special feature VIP fostered the cumulated annual citation growth .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For instance , the time until a Communication reached its maximum annual number of citations , was reduced .

label: Research questions
text: Currently more art than science , UE has gained theoretical and methodological traction over the past decade , yet there is still a need to establish empirical links between UE and desired outcomes ( e.g. , learning , behavior change ) , and to understand the myriad user , system , contextual , and so on , factors that predict successful digital engagement .

label: Research questions
text: This paper focuses on the relationship between UE and media format as a potential antecedent , and the outcome of learning , operationalized as short-term knowledge retention .

label: Research method
text: Participants interacted with two human-interest stories in one of four media formats : video , audio , narrative text , or transcript-style text ; short-term knowledge retention was measured using post-task multiple choice and short-answer questions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It was anticipated that format would have a strong effect on UE , and that more engaged users would recall more information about the stories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , these hypotheses were not fully supported , and the nature of the relationship between UE and learning was more nuanced than expected .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This research has implications for the design of information systems and , more fundamentally , the impetus to make digital environments engaging .

label: Research questions
text: Little is known about professional information practices or actions outside of traditional , centralized offices ; however , the dynamic , unconventional , and less stable mobile work context diverges substantially from this model , and presents significant challenges and opportunities for the accomplishing of work tasks .

label: Research method
text: This article identifies 5 main information practices geared toward mobilizing work , based on in-depth interviews with 31 mobile knowledge workers ( MKWs ) .

label: Research questions
text: It then uses these 5 practices as starting points for beginning to delineate the context of mobile knowledge work .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that the information practices and information contexts of MKWs are mutually constitutive : challenges and opportunities of their work arrangements are what enable the development of practices that continually ( re ) construct productive spatial , temporal , social , and material contexts for work .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article contributes to an empirical understanding of the information practices of an increasingly visible yet understudied population , and to a theoretical understanding of the contemporary mobile knowledge work information context .

label: Research method
text: In this study we use complete publication data for all researchers employed at Norwegian universities over a 4-year period , linked to biographic data for each researcher .

label: Research method
text: Using this detailed and complete data set , we compare research productivity between five main scientific domains ( and subfields within them ) , across academic positions , and in terms of age and gender .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study 's key finding is that researchers from medicine , natural sciences , and technology are most productive when whole counts of publications are used , while researchers from the humanities and social sciences are most productive when article counts are fractionalized according to the total number of authors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The strong differences between these fields in publishing forms and patterns of coauthorship raise questions as to whether publication indicators can justifiably be used for comparison of productivity across scientific disciplines .

label: Research questions
text: Their potential influence on decision making is the focus of the present research .

label: Research questions
text: Based on interplay between Social Judgment Theory and Framing Theory this study investigates whether the information delivered by technology blogs is treated differently during investment decision making than information from traditional financial newspapers in digital form , while containing information cues and text framing .

label: Research method
text: Using an online experiment with a 3 x 2 design , this research compares the influence of this trio of variables on the investment decisions of 236 participants .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results indicate a complex investment decision-making process differing according to the type of medium presented , the text framing , the information cues , and the decision maker 's background .

label: Research method
text: Seed selection refers to choosing an initial sample set to label to form an initial learning model .

label: Research method
text: Sample selection refers to selecting informative samples to update the model at each iteration of the active learning process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Compared to supervised machine learning approaches , active learning offers the opportunity to build statistical classifiers with a reduced amount of training samples that require manual annotation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Reducing the manual annotation effort can support automating the clinical information extraction process .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This is particularly beneficial in the clinical domain , where manual annotation is a time-consuming and costly task , as it requires extensive labor from clinical experts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our empirical Research findings/conclusions demonstrate that ( a ) using sequence representations along with the length of sequence for seed selection shows potential towards more effective initial models , and ( b ) using sequence representations for sample selection leads to significantly lower manual annotation efforts , with up to 3 % and 6 % fewer tokens and concepts requiring annotation , respectively , compared to state-of-the-art query strategies .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Recently , text mining was adopted to augment journal ranking-based evaluation with the content analysis of a discipline taking a time-variant factor into consideration .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: However , previous studies focused mainly on a silo analysis of a discipline using either citation-or content-oriented approaches , and no attempt was made to analyze topical journal ranking and its change over time in a seamless and integrated manner .

label: Research method
text: To address this issue , we propose a journal-time-topic model , an extension of Dirichlet multinomial regression , which we applied to the field of bioinformatics to understand journal contribution to topics in a field and the shift of topic trends .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The journal-time-topic model allows us to identify which journals are the major leaders in what topics and the manner in which their topical focus .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It also helps reveal an interesting distinct pattern in the journal impact factor of high- and low-ranked journals .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study results shed a new light for understanding topic specific journal rankings and shifts in journals ' concentration on a subject .

label: Research method
text: F1000Prime is a postpublication peer review system of the biomedical literature ( papers from medical and biological journals ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study is concerned with the interrater reliability and convergent validity of the peer recommendations formulated in the F1000Prime peer review system .

label: Research method
text: The study is based on about 100,000 papers with recommendations from faculty members .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Even if intersubjectivity plays a fundamental role in science , the analyses of the reliability of the F1000Prime peer review system show a rather low level of agreement between faculty members .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This result is in agreement with most other studies that have been published on the journal peer review system .

label: Research method
text: Logistic regression models are used to investigate the convergent validity of the F1000Prime peer review system .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As the results show , the proportion of highly cited papers among those selected by the faculty members is significantly higher than expected .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , better recommendation scores are also associated with higher performing papers .

label: Research questions
text: We start by critically examining Westin 's conceptualization of information privacy and argue for a contextual approach that holds promise for overcoming some of Westin 's weaknesses .

label: Research method
text: We then highlight three contextual considerations for studying privacy-digital networks , marginalized populations , and the global context-and close by discussing how these considerations advance privacy theorization and technology design .

label: Research questions
text: Modeling these dynamic contextual effects is an important challenge facing the research community because it has the potential to lead to more responsive search systems .

label: Research method
text: With this motivation , a study of software engineers was conducted to understand the role that contextual factors play in shaping their information-seeking behavior .

label: Research method
text: Research was conducted in the field in a large technology company and comprised six unstructured interviews , a focus group , and 13 in-depth , semistructured interviews .

label: Research method
text: Qualitative analysis revealed a set of contextual factors and related information behaviors .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Results are formalized in the contextual model of source selection , the main contributions of which are the identification of two types of conditioning variables ( requirements and constraints ) that mediate between the contextual factors and source-selection decisions , and the articulation of dominant source-selection patterns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study has implications for the design of context-sensitive search systems in this domain and may inform contextual approaches to information seeking in other professional domains .

label: Research method
text: First , we present Indexing by latent Dirichlet allocation ( LDI ) , an automatic document indexing method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Many ad hoc applications , or their variants with smoothing techniques suggested in LDA-based language modeling , can result in unsatisfactory performance as the document representations do not accurately reflect concept space .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To improve document retrieval performance , we introduce a new definition of document probability vectors in the context of LDA and present a novel scheme for automatic document indexing based on LDA .

label: Research questions
text: Second , we propose an Ensemble Model ( EnM ) for document retrieval .

label: Research method
text: EnM combines basic indexing models by assigning different weights and attempts to uncover the optimal weights to maximize the mean average precision .

label: Research method
text: To solve the optimization problem , we propose an algorithm , which is derived based on the boosting method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of our computational experiments on benchmark data sets indicate that both the proposed approaches are viable options for document retrieval .

label: Research questions
text: Building on our previous study demonstrating enhanced engagement in citizen science through social information about others ' contributions , we propose a novel framework for effective telerehabilitation that integrates citizen science and social information into physical exercise .

label: Research questions
text: We hypothesized that social information about others ' contributions would augment engagement in physical activity by encouraging people to invest more effort toward discovery of novel information in a citizen science context .

label: Research method
text: We recruited healthy participants to monitor the environment of a polluted canal by tagging images using a haptic device toward gathering environmental information .

label: Research method
text: Along with the images , we displayed the locations of the tags created by the previous participants .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that participants increased both the amount and duration of physical activity when presented with a larger number of the previous tags .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further , they increased the diversity of tagged objects by avoiding the locations tagged by the previous participants , thereby generating richer information about the environment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results suggest that social information is a viable means to augment engagement in rehabilitation exercise by incentivizing the contribution to scientific activities .

label: Research questions
text: Few , if any , studies , however , examine scientists ' problem-solving uses of PubMed in actual contexts of work and corresponding needs for better tool support .

label: Research method
text: Addressing this gap , we conducted a field study of novice scientists ( 14 upper-level undergraduate majors in molecular biology ) as they engaged in a problem-solving activity with PubMed in a laboratory setting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions reveal many common stages and patterns of information seeking across users as well as variations , especially variations in cognitive search styles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on these Research findings/conclusions , we suggest tool improvements that both confirm and qualify many results found in other recent studies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions highlight the need to use results from context-rich studies to inform decisions in tool design about when to offer improved features to users .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we build on two current lines of research .

label: Research method
text: ( a ) We use Waisda ? , an existing labeling game , to add timebased annotations to content .

label: Research questions
text: ( b ) In this context , we investigate the role of experts in human-based computation ( nichesourcing ) .

label: Research method
text: We report on a small-scale experiment in which we applied Waisda ?

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: to content from film archives .

label: Research questions
text: We study the differences in the type of timebased tags between experts and novices for film clips in a crowdsourcing setting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions show high similarity in the number and type of tags ( mostly factual ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the less frequent tags , however , experts used more domain-specific terms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that competitive games are not suited to elicit real expert-level descriptions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also confirm that providing guidelines , based on conceptual frameworks that are more suited to moving images in a time-based fashion , could result in increasing the quality of the tags , thus allowing for creating more tag-based innovative services for online audiovisual heritage .

label: Research method
text: To enable integrated searches , the proposed WikiMap ( + ) integrates search functions and IV tools ( i.e. , a topic network and hierarchical topic tree ) and gathers information from Wikipedia pages and Google Search results .

label: Research method
text: To evaluate the effectiveness of the proposed interfaces , we design subject-oriented tasks and adopt extended evaluation measures .

label: Research method
text: We recruited 48 novices and 48 knowledgeable users , that is , intermediates , for the evaluation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that novices using the proposed interface demonstrate better search performance than intermediates using Wikipedia .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We therefore conclude that our tools help close the gap between novices and intermediates in information searches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results also show that intermediates can take advantage of the search tool by leveraging the IV tools to browse subtopics , and formulate better queries with less effort .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that embedding the IV and the search tools in the interface can result in different search behavior but improved task performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We provide implications to design search systems to include IV features adapted to user levels of subject knowledge to help them achieve better task performance .

label: Research questions
text: As adoption of innovations and CSR commitment are linked with firm size and national culture/legislation , we hypothesize that size and national culture/legislation , may have an effect on WA level .

label: Research method
text: The authors studied an international sample made up of companies included in EUROSTOXX600 ( The STOXX Europe 600 Index ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main results suggest that both size and culture have a significant effect on WA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Large firms as well as Anglo-Saxon companies are more prone to have higher WA levels .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A deeper analysis , which was done through the estimation of quantile regression equations , showed that the influence of size is significant for companies trying to excel or for those trying to avoid the worst WA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the effect of size is significant only in the lowest part of the conditional distribution .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Intuitively , when we read , more important words will occupy a longer reading time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Hence , by leveraging human reading time , we can find the salient words in the corresponding content .

label: Research questions
text: However , previous studies on keyphrase extraction ignore human reading features .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we aim to leverage human reading time to extract keyphrases from microblog posts .

label: Research questions
text: There are two main tasks in this study .

label: Research questions
text: One is to determine how to measure the time spent by a human on reading a word .

label: Research method
text: We use eye fixation durations ( FDs ) extracted from an open source eye-tracking corpus .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Moreover , we propose strategies to make eye FD more effective on keyphrase extraction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The other task is to determine how to integrate human reading time into keyphrase extraction models .

label: Research method
text: We propose two novel neural network models .

label: Research method
text: The first is a model in which the human reading time is used as the ground truth of the attention mechanism .

label: Research method
text: In the second model , we use human reading time as the external feature .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Quantitative and qualitative experiments show that our proposed models yield better performance than the baseline models on two microblog datasets .

label: Research questions
text: So far , automated tools have been developed either to account for the social networks among participants in the debates , or to analyze the content of these debates .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Less attention has been paid to mapping co-occurrences of actors ( participants ) and topics ( content ) in online debates that can be considered as socio-semantic networks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We propose a new , automated approach that uses the whole matrix of co-addressed topics and actors for understanding and visualizing online debates .

label: Research method
text: We show the advantages of the new approach with the analysis of two data sets : first , a large set of English-language Twitter messages at the Rio + 20 meeting , in June 2012 ( 72,077 tweets ) , and second , a smaller data set of Dutch-language Twitter messages on bird flu related to poultry farming in 2015-2017 ( 2,139 tweets ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We discuss the theoretical , methodological , and substantive implications of our approach , also for the analysis of other social media data .

label: Research questions
text: However , the use of IM at work remains controversial , owing to its unclear benefits to organizations .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we employ media performance theories and the concept model of communicative ecology to examine the impact of an IM tool on shaping guanxi ( i.e. , interpersonal relationship ) networks in the workplace .

label: Research questions
text: Specifically , we propose that IM has the potential to enhance guanxi networks by improving communication quality and building interlocutors ' mutual trust in the workplace .

label: Research method
text: The conceptual model is validated with 253 survey responses collected from working professionals in China .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The data indicate that communication quality and mutual trust contribute to the development of guanxi networks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The theoretical and practical implications of the Research findings/conclusions are discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Uncertainties and ambiguities in the evaluation of percentile ranks can be demonstrated most easily with small data sets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: But for larger data sets , an often large number of papers with the same citation count leads to the same uncertainties and ambiguities , which can be avoided by fractional scoring , demonstrated by four different empirical data sets with several thousand publications each , which are assigned to six percentile rank classes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Only by utilizing fractional scoring does , the total score of all papers exactly reproduce the theoretical value in each case .

label: Research questions
text: Despite efforts for the preservation of cultural heritages around the world , no well-accepted metadata schema has been developed for murals and stone cave temples , which are often high-value heritages built in ancient times .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In addition , the literature is scarce on the user-centered evaluation of metadata schemas of this kind .

label: Research questions
text: This study therefore aims to offer insights on developing and evaluating a metadata schema for organizing information of these historic and complex cultural heritages .

label: Research method
text: In-depth interviews were conducted with a total of 30 users , including 18 professional and 12 public users , and interview transcripts were coded through a qualitative content analysis approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions reveal the importance of specific metadata elements as perceived by the two groups of end users , which correlated with their cultural heritage information-seeking behaviors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , the issues of standardization of cataloging of cultural heritage information and interoperability among metadata schemas have been raised by users for enhancing the user experience with digital platforms of cultural heritage information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The coding schema developed in this study can serve as a framework for follow-up evaluations of metadata schemas , contributing to the ongoing development of cultural heritage metadata .

label: Research method
text: The exercise was carried out in order to assess whether these highly sophisticated , state-of-the-art filters can distinguish between papers that are controversial or have gone past their sell-by date , and otherwise normal papers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that not even the arXiv filters , which are otherwise successful in filtering fringe-topic papers , can fully acquire Domain-Specific Discrimination and thus distinguish technical papers that are taken seriously by an expert community from those that are not .

label: Research questions
text: Finally , we discuss the implications this has for citizen and policy-maker engagement with the Primary Source Knowledge of a technical domain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A key concern captured in these movements is that the metrics appear to carry authority even where established agents of quality control have explicitly outlined limits to their validity and reliability as measurement tools .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This raises a number of challenging questions for those readers of this journal who are implicated in questions of indicator production and , by extension , effects .

label: Research questions
text: In this opinion piece we wish to critically engage the question of how producers of indicators can come to terms with their role as ( partly ) responsible parties in the current age of evaluative bibliometrics .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We do so through the illuminating case of the professional scientometrics community .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The blogosphere is characterized by large amounts of noise , including incohesive , off-topic content and spam .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Consequently , the classical bag-of-words unigram IR models are not reliable enough to provide robust and effective retrieval performance .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose to boost the blog postretrieval performance by employing term proximity information .

label: Research method
text: We investigate a variety of popular and state-of-the-art proximity-based statistical IR models , including a proximity-based counting model , the Markov random field ( MRF ) model , and the divergence from randomness ( DFR ) multinomial model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Extensive experimentation on the standard TREC Blog06 test dataset demonstrates that the introduction of term proximity information is indeed beneficial to retrieval from the blogosphere .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results also indicate the superiority of the unordered bi-gram model with the sequential-dependence phrases over other variants of the proximity-based models .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Finally , inspired by the effectiveness of proximity models , we extend our study by exploring the proximity evidence between uery terms and opinionated terms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The consequent opinionated proximity model shows promising performance in the experiments .

label: Research method
text: We combine questions about Google 's business with task-based studies in which users were asked to distinguish between ads and organic results in screenshots of results pages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that only a small percentage of users can reliably distinguish between ads and organic results , and that user knowledge of Google 's business model is very limited .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that ads are insufficiently labelled as such , and that many users may click on ads assuming that they are selecting organic results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most existing methods have two steps , weighting citation arcs based on search path counting and exploring main paths in a greedy fashion , with the assumption that citation networks are acyclic .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The only available proposal that avoids manual cycle removal is to preprint transform a cyclic network to an acyclic counterpart .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Through a detailed discussion about the issues concerning this approach , especially deriving the de-preprinted main paths for the original network , this article proposes an alternative solution with two-fold contributions .

label: Research method
text: Based on the argument that a publication can not influence itself through a citation cycle , the SimSPC algorithm is proposed to weight citation arcs by counting simple search paths .

label: Research method
text: A set of algorithms are further proposed for main path exploration and extraction directly from cyclic networks based on a novel data structure main path tree .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experiments on two cyclic citation networks demonstrate the usefulness of the alternative solution .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the meanwhile , experiments show that publications in strongly connected components may sit on the turning points of main path networks , which signifies the necessity of a systematic way of dealing with citation cycles .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The contributions of this study are twofold .

label: Research method
text: First , I apply a fuzzy string matching algorithm for self-citation detection and benchmark this approach and other common methods of exclusively author name-based self-citation detection against a manually curated ground truth sample .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Near full recall can be achieved with the proposed method while incurring only negligible precision loss .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Second , I report some important observations from the results about the extent of latent self-citations and their characteristics and give an example of the effect of improved self-citation detection on the document level self-citation rate of real data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Because only a small amount of social media data have been geolocation-annotated , inference techniques play a substantial role to increase the volume of annotated data .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Conventional research in this area has been based on the text content of posts from a given user or the social network of the user , with some recent crossovers between the text- and network-based approaches .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper proposes a novel approach to categorize highly-mentioned users ( celebrities ) into Local and Global types , and consequently use Local celebrities as location indicators .

label: Research method
text: A label propagation algorithm is then used over the refined social network for geolocation inference .

label: Research method
text: Finally , we propose a hybrid approach by merging a text-based method as a back-off strategy into our network-based approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Empirical experiments over three standard Twitter benchmark data sets demonstrate that our approach outperforms state-of-the-art user geolocation methods .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Exceeding traditional empirical approaches , Big Data opens a new perspective on scientific work in which data comes to play a role in the development of the scientific problematic to be developed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Addressing this reconfiguration of our relationship with data through readings of Wittgenstein , Macherey , and Popper , we propose a picture of science that encourages scientists to engage with the data in a direct way , using the data itself as an instrument for scientific investigation .

label: Research questions
text: Using GIS as a theme , we develop the concept of cyber-human systems of thought and understanding to bridge the divide between representative ( theoretical ) thinking and ( non-theoretical ) data-driven science .

label: Research questions
text: At the foundation of these systems , we invoke the concept of the semantic pixel to establish a logical and virtual space linking data and the work of scientists .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It is with this discussion of the relationship between analysts in their pursuit of knowledge and the rise of Big Data that this present discussion of the philosophical foundations of Big Data addresses the central questions raised by social informatics research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For example , Edinburgh Castle and Bodiam Castle are two objects of the same type : castle .

label: Research method
text: The question is whether specific information is requested for the object type castle and how this information differs for objects of other types ( e.g. , church , museum , or lake ) .

label: Research method
text: We aim to answer this question using an online survey .

label: Research method
text: In the survey , we showed 184 participants 200 images pertaining to urban and rural objects and asked them to write questions for which they would like to know the answers when seeing those objects .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis of the 6,169 questions collected in the survey shows that humans have shared ideas of what to ask about geographical objects .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When the object types resemble each other ( e.g. , church and temple ) , the requested information is similar for the objects of these types .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Otherwise , the information is specific to an object type .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results may be very useful in guiding Natural Language Processing tasks involving automatic generation of templates for image descriptions and their assessment , as well as image indexing and organization .

label: Research questions
text: The aim of this study was to develop a scholar classification scheme from publication patterns in academic science .

label: Research questions
text: Classification schemes are ways of describing groups that display different clusters of behaviors , approaches , or perspectives , and useful in the development of typologies .

label: Research method
text: In this research , sample data are selected from three representative universities , considered a leading university , a middle-tier university , and a noncomprehensive university .

label: Research method
text: A final set of 11,427 effective scholars and their 284,128 journal publication records were used to develop the classification scheme via cluster analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results identify six types of scholars , labeled as : singleton ( 8 % ) , small-team low performer ( 16 % ) , small-team high performer ( 17 % ) , big-team strategist ( 22 % ) , free-style follower ( 21 % ) , and life-time warrior ( 17 % ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These six scholar types demonstrate different approaches to publishing that can be used to understand both individual and research team performance across different institutional settings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additionally , possible future work was identified that uses the scholar classification scheme to define the behavior for agents in an agent-based model to simulate the strategic-behavior-driven academic publication system .

label: Research method
text: The analysis studies 3 different information-seeking approaches : keyword searching , browsing , and case-based reasoning ( CBR ) searching provided by the system by examining the query logs that stretch over 8 years .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The longitudinal dimension of this study offers unique possibilities to see how users used the 3 different approaches over time .

label: Research method
text: Various user information-seeking patterns and trends are identified through the query usage pattern analysis and session analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study identified different user groups and found that a majority of the users tend to stick to their favorite information-seeking approach to meet their immediate information needs and do not seem to care whether alternative search options will offer greater benefits .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study also found that return users used CBR searching much more frequently than 1-time users and tend to use more query terms to look for information than 1-time users .

label: Research questions
text: Glanzel and Schoepflin ( 1994 ) first raised the issue of bibliometric standards in bibliometric research and this concern has been echoed by several additional bibliometric researchers over time ( Braun , 2010 ; Glanzel , 1996 ; Abbott , Cyranoski , Jones , Maher , Schiermeier , & Van Noorden , 2010 ; Lane , 2010 ; Nature , 2010 ; van Noorden , 2010 ; Wallin , 2005 ) .

label: Research method
text: We compare the characteristics of articles published within and outside the Library and Information Science ( LIS ) field , including the relative impact and the affiliation of the contributing authors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that although the visibility of bibliometric articles within LIS is higher , it is not significant .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , a statistically significant growth in the number of articles written by authors without a bibliometric affiliation was found .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article provides an independent empirical investigation of publication trends potentially underlying Gl nzel and Schoepflin 's ( 1994 ) concerns regarding the misuse of bibliometric results , and the inaccurate dissemination of concepts , results , and methods outside of the bibliometric field .

label: Research questions
text: As a starting point , this work investigates how the emotion of interest can be influenced by modifying the complexity of the information presented to users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The appraisal theory of interest suggests a sweet spot where interest will be at its peak : information that is novel and complex yet still comprehensible .

label: Research method
text: This sweet spot is approximated using two studies .

label: Research method
text: Study One develops a computational model of textual complexity founded on psycholinguistic theory on processing difficulty .

label: Research method
text: The model was trained and tested on 12,420 articles , achieving a classification performance of 90.87 % on two classes of complexity .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Study Two puts the model to its ultimate test : Its application to change the user 's IX .

label: Research method
text: Using 18 news articles the influence of complexity on interest and its appraisals is unveiled .

label: Research findings/conclusions
