text: A structural equation model shows a positive influence of complexity on interest , yet a negative influence of comprehensibility , confirming a seemingly paradoxical relationship between complexity and interest .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By showing when complexity becomes interesting , this paper shows how information systems can use the model of textual complexity to construct an interesting IX .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study is the first attempt to investigate the top three help-seeking situations as well as associated factors in blind users ' DL interactions .

label: Research method
text: A mixed-method approach was adopted for this study .

label: Research method
text: Multiple methods were applied to collect data from 30 blind subjects : questionnaires , presearch interviews , think aloud protocols , transaction logs , and postsearch interviews .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The paper identifies the top three help-seeking situations , and associated factors in relation to user , system , task , and interaction .

label: Research method
text: Moreover , different types of main-level factors were tested to investigate if they are correlated to each type of top situation , and qualitative data of sublevel factors offer insight into how these factors are associated with various situations .

label: Research questions
text: Without a clear understanding of these situations and factors , the objective of universal access to information in DLs can not be achieved .

label: Research questions
text: DL design implications are further discussed with the goal of providing system design recommendations for reducing blind users ' help-seeking situations .

label: Research questions
text: I employ affordances as a process concept to understand the recursive relationship between individuals and technologies and envision information practices as an outcome of this relationship .

label: Research method
text: Guided by this conceptual framework , I conducted 30 semistructured interviews with LGBTQ+ individuals between the ages of 18 and 38 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Data analysis identified 3 key affordances that enable and constrain participants ' information practices : visibility , anonymity , and association .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions indicate that participants are highly skilled in appropriating technological features to engage in desired information practices , such as seeking and creating .

label: Research questions
text: However , they also must contend with significant sociocultural barriers encoded into these features , which reinforce hetero- and cisnormative identity discourses .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Library practitioners and systems designers can use these Research findings/conclusions to offer services and systems inclusive of LGBTQ+ populations .

label: Research method
text: We report Research findings/conclusions from interviews and focus groups with 49 UK state and voluntary sector professionals providing support to young ( < 21 ) mothers from areas of multiple deprivations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We evidence an important information intermediary role with three key contributions to information behaviors in disadvantaged and dependent circumstances .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Intermediaries : facilitate information needs recognition , and consider Research questionsful action within problematic situations ; are a key source of information in themselves , and a key integrative connection to other external sources not otherwise accessed ; and tailor and personalize information for relevance , and communicate via incremental and recursive cycles that take into account learning needs .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We provide parameters for a theory of information intermediary intervention to guide future examination of an important and understudied role ; and conceptualize important theoretical relationships between information behavior and social capital , and in particular shared concepts of social integration , and the progressive and integrative intermediary role within .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions have significant practical implications for public health policy and digital health strategies , as they evidence an important human information intermediary role among an at-risk group , with implications for disadvantaged and vulnerable populations more broadly .

label: Research questions
text: With millions of users , these are a significant addition to the scholarly communication and academic information-seeking eco-structure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There is thus a need to understand the role that they play and the changes , if any , that they can make to the dynamics of academic careers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article investigates attributes of philosophy scholars on Academia.edu , introducing a median-based , time-normalizing method to adjust for time delays in joining the site .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In comparison to students , faculty tend to attract more profile views but female philosophers did not attract more profile views than did males , suggesting that academic capital drives philosophy uses of the site more than does friendship and networking .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Secondary analyses of law , history , and computer science confirmed the faculty advantage ( in terms of higher profile views ) except for females in law and females in computer science .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There was also a female advantage for both faculty and students in law and computer science as well as for history students .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Hence , Academia.edu overall seems to reflect a hybrid of scholarly norms ( the faculty advantage ) and a female advantage that is suggestive of general social networking norms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , traditional bibliometric measures did not correlate with any Academia.edu metrics for philosophers , perhaps because more senior academics use the site less extensively or because of the range informal scholarly activities that can not be measured by bibliometric methods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Referees are expected to evaluate submissions equitably according to objective criteria ( e.g. , originality of the contribution , soundness of the theory , validity of the experiments ) .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that the submission date of papers is a subjective factor playing a role in the way they are evaluated .

label: Research method
text: Indeed , program committee ( PC ) chairs and referees process submission lists that are usually sorted by paperIDs .

label: Research method
text: This order conveys chronological information , as papers are numbered sequentially upon reception .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that order effects lead to unconscious favoring of early-submitted papers to the detriment of later-submitted papers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our point is supported by a study of 42 peer-reviewed conferences in Computer Science showing a decrease in the number of bids placed on submissions with higher paperIDs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is advised to counterbalance order effects during the bidding phase of peer review by promoting the submissions with fewer bids to potential referees .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This manipulation intends to better share bids out among submissions in order to attract qualified referees for all submissions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This would secure reviews from confident referees , who are keen on voicing sharp opinions and recommendations ( acceptance or rejection ) about submissions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This work contributes to the integrity of peer review , which is mandatory to maintain public trust in science .

label: Research questions
text: As these movements incorporate many of the past critiques concerning social fit and situational context leveled against them by Social Informatics research , more subtle and more deeply ingrained modes of ideological practice have risen to support movements of computerization .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among these , the current emphasis on the promises of data and data analytics presents the most obvious ideological challenge .

label: Research questions
text: In order to reorient Social Informatics in relation to these new ideological challenges , Louis Althusser 's theory of ideology is discussed , with its implications for Social Informatics considered .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among these implications , a changed relationship between Social Informatics 's critical stance and its reliance on empirical methods is advanced .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Addressed at a fundamental level , the practice of Social Informatics comes to be reoriented in a more distinctly reflective and ethical direction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: How they select targeted publications can influence competitive relationships among journals .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , the author quantifies the publishing choices of a set of scholars to confirm this ecological perspective .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate a strong focus on a small number of journals .

label: Research method
text: A measure of author publishing choices was used to define four ecological characteristics : coverage , coreness , exclusivity , and journal overlap .

label: Research method
text: Several types of journals indexed in the Information Science and Library Science section of the Journal Citation Reports are compared in terms of their ecological characteristics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The data show that some journals cover large numbers of authors , but compete with other journals in subcommunities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Some journals with author profiles similar to those of high-ranking journals lost potential submissions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Others with low coverage , high coreness , and high exclusivity were found to have groups of fans who used them for all of their submissions , but still exhibited a strong need to sustain their exclusivity .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It is hoped that the method and results presented in this paper will provide useful information for editorial boards interested in managing their submissions according to author profiles .

label: Research questions
text: The research objective was to identify , describe , and hypothesize about features of the behavior that are indicative of procedural knowledge gained during guided instruction .

label: Research method
text: Log-data of search interaction were coded using a conceptual framework focused on components of search practice hypothesized to organize an expert searcher 's attention during search .

label: Research method
text: The coded data were analyzed using a measure of pointwise mutual information and state-transition analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results of the study provide important insight for future investigation of domain-independent search expertise and for the design of systems that assist searchers in gaining expertise .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Some work suggests that information may have social uses , hinting that information use is more complicated than previous frameworks suggest .

label: Research questions
text: Therefore , we use a micro-sociological , symbolic interactionist approach to examine the use of one type of informationbiomedical informationin the everyday life interactions of chronic illness patients and their families .

label: Research method
text: Based on a grounded theory analysis of 60 semi-structured interviews ( 30 individual patient interviews and 30 family group interviews ) and observations within the family group interviews , we identify 4 categories of information use : ( a ) knowing my body ; ( b ) mapping the social terrain ; ( c ) asserting autonomy ; and ( d ) puffing myself up .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Extending previous research , the Research findings/conclusions demonstrate use of biomedical information in interactions that construct a valued self for the patient : a person who holds authority , and who is unique and cared for .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In so doing , we contribute novel insights regarding the use of information to manage social emotions such as shame , and to construct embodied knowledge that is mobilized in action to address disease-related challenges .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We thus offer an expanded conceptualization of information use that provides new directions for research and practice .

label: Research method
text: The proposed extractive summarization method uses tags ( viewer- and author-assigned terms ) as key concepts .

label: Research method
text: Our method employs Flickr tag clusters and WordNet synonyms to expand tags and detect the semantic relations between tags .

label: Research method
text: This method helps select sentences that have a greater number of semantically related key concepts .

label: Research method
text: To investigate the effectiveness and uniqueness of the proposed method , we compare it with an existing technique , latent semantic analysis ( LSA ) , using intrinsic and extrinsic evaluations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of intrinsic evaluation show that the tag-based method is as or more effective than the LSA method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also observe that in the extrinsic evaluation , the grand mean accuracy score of the tag-based method is higher than that of the LSA method , with a statistically significant difference .

label: Research questions
text: Elaborating on our results , we discuss the theoretical and practical implications of our Research findings/conclusions for speech video summarization and retrieval .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Google covers multiple different international patent office databases but does not index patent citations or allow automatic searches .

label: Research method
text: In response , this article introduces a semiautomatic indirect method via Bing to extract and filter patent citations from Google to academic papers with an overall precision of 98 % .

label: Research method
text: The method was evaluated with 322,192 science and engineering Scopus articles from every second year for the period 1996-2012 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although manual Google Patent searches give more results , especially for articles with many patent citations , the difference is not large enough to be a major problem .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Within Biomedical Engineering , Biotechnology , and Pharmacology & Pharmaceutics , 7 % to 10 % of Scopus articles had at least one patent citation but other fields had far fewer , so patent citation analysis is only relevant for a minority of publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Low but positive correlations between Google Patent citations and Scopus citations across all fields suggest that traditional citation counts can not substitute for patent citations when evaluating research .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Coauthor network analysis has been utilized to study scholars ' collaborations for a long time , but these studies have not simultaneously taken different collaboration features into consideration .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this paper , we present a systematic approach to analyze the differences in possibilities that two authors will cooperate as seen from the effects of homophily , transitivity , and preferential attachment .

label: Research method
text: Exponential random graph models ( ERGMs ) are applied in this research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that different types of publications one author has written play diverse roles in his/her collaborations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An author 's tendency to form new collaborations with her/his coauthors ' collaborators is strong , where the more coauthors one author had before , the more new collaborators he/she will attract .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We demonstrate that considering the authors ' attributes and homophily effects as well as the transitivity and preferential attachment effects of the coauthorship network in which they are embedded helps us gain a comprehensive understanding of scientific collaboration .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These give evidence that research Research findings/conclusions have been used to inform the day-to-day practice of medical staff .

label: Research questions
text: To identify whether citations from guidelines can give different information from that of traditional citation counts , this article assesses the extent to which references in clinical guidelines tend to be highly cited in the academic literature and highly read in Mendeley .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using evidence from the United Kingdom , references associated with the UK 's National Institute of Health and Clinical Excellence ( NICE ) guidelines tended to be substantially more cited than comparable articles , unless they had been published in the most recent 3 years .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Citation counts also seemed to be stronger indicators than Mendeley readership altmetrics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Hence , although presence in guidelines may be particularly useful to highlight the contributions of recently published articles , for older articles citation counts may already be sufficient to recognize their contributions to health in society .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It does not , however , take into consideration the scholar 's position in the authorship list .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: I recommend a new supplementary index to score academics , representing the relative contribution to the papers with impact , be reported alongside the h-index .

label: Research method
text: I call this index the AP-index , and it is simply defined as the average position in which an academic appears in authorship lists , on articles that factor in to that academic 's h-index .

label: Research method
text: We have therefore used it to study the scholarly output and impact of three scientific disciplines , management , economics , and sociology , in Spain and France , comparing some of the results with those retrieved with Scopus .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions show that scientific articles are the predominant form of scholarly communication in Google Scholar for our selected fields and countries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , our results indicate that in Google Scholar the vernacular languages of each country are more used than English in all cases , but economics in France .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The opposite occurs in Scopus , except for the case of sociology articles in France We also show that books receive on average more citations than other published documents in Google Scholar .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we demonstrate that publishing in English is associated with greater scholarly impact , except for the case of France in Google Scholar for articles in sociology and books in the three fields .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we scrutinize one of these cases where the continued use of technology can not be explained by one of the most prominent traditional IS models to date .

label: Research method
text: We analyze our qualitative case study by juxtaposing two theoretical lenses : a traditional IS perspective ( i.e. , the unified theory of acceptance and use model ) versus an evolutionary psychology perspective ( i.e. , the four-drive model ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that a more comprehensive understanding of continued IS usage is possible when including an evolutionary psychology perspective to the existing models .

label: Research questions
text: Specifically , we propose three new concepts , including evolved performance expectancy , evolved effort expectancy , and evolved social influence .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also demonstrate that , in some situations , cognitive and social constructs dominate , whereas in other situations , the evolutionary dependent constructs associated with human nature take over .

label: Research questions
text: However , concerns remain over unequal technological access in our society , as political resources available on the internet empower those with the resources and motivation to take advantage of them , leaving those who are disengaged farther behind .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Hence , those who face digital inequalities are not only deprived of the benefits of the so-called Information Society , they are also deprived of exercising their civic rights .

label: Research questions
text: To promote political engagement among the marginalized , we analyze different sociotechnical factors that may play a role in promoting their inclusion in future political activities .

label: Research method
text: We employed a survey for marginalized communities to analyze a set of research questions relating to sociotechnical factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that online content creation , digital freedom , and access to the mobile Internet may positively impact political engagement .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The development of these factors may not only promote the inclusion of marginalized populations in future political events , but also help to build a more equal society where everyone 's voice has a chance to be heard .

label: Research method
text: The academic information collected in this data set is used to evaluate , analyze , and document the scientific production of research groups .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Information about the interactions between Brazilian researchers in the form of coauthorships , however , has not been analyzed .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we identified and characterized Brazilian academic coauthorship networks of researchers registered in the Lattes Platform using topological properties of graphs .

label: Research method
text: For this Research questions , we explored ( a ) strategies to develop a large Lattes curricula vitae data set , ( b ) an algorithm for identifying automatic coauthorships based on bibliographic information , and ( c ) topological metrics to investigate interactions among researchers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study characterized coauthorship networks to gain an in-depth understanding of the network structures and dynamics ( social behavior ) among researchers in all available major Brazilian knowledge areas .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we evaluated information from a total of 1,131,912 researchers associated with the eight major Brazilian knowledge areas : agricultural sciences ; biological sciences ; exact and earth sciences ; humanities ; applied social sciences ; health sciences ; engineering ; and linguistics , letters , and arts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: They need a strategy to filter this barrage of massive data sets , and to find all of the information responding to their information needs , despite the pressures imposed by schedules and budgets .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this applied research , we present an exploratory search strategy that allows professional information seekers to efficiently and effectively triage all of the data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We demonstrate that exploratory search is particularly useful for information filtering and large-scale information triage , regardless of the language of the data , and regardless of the particular industry , whether finance , medical , business , government , information technology , news , or legal .

label: Research method
text: Our strategy reduces a dauntingly large volume of information into a manageable , high-precision data set , suitable for focused reading .

label: Research method
text: This strategy is interdisciplinary , integrating concepts from information filtering , information triage , and exploratory search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Key aspects include advanced search software , interdisciplinary paired search , asynchronous collaborative search , attention to linguistic phenomena , and aggregated search results in the form of a search matrix or search grid .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We present the positive results of a task-oriented evaluation in a real-world setting , discuss these results from a qualitative perspective , and share future research areas .

label: Research questions
text: However , the role of journals has been called into question because new preprint archives and academic search engines make it easier to find articles independent of the journals that publish them .

label: Research questions
text: Research on this issue is complicated by the deeply confounded relationship between article quality and journal reputation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We present an innovative proxy for individual article quality that is divorced from the journal 's reputation or impact factor : the number of citations to preprints posted on .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using this measure to study three subfields of physics that were early adopters of arXiv , we show that prior estimates of the effect of journal reputation on an individual article 's impact ( measured by citations ) are likely inflated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While we find that higher-quality preprints in these subfields are now less likely to be published in journals compared to prior years , we find little systematic evidence that the role of journal reputation on article performance has declined .

label: Research questions
text: In recent times , there have been several research efforts toward devising a variety of techniques to summarize tweets in Twitter .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , these techniques are either not personal ( that is , consider only tweets in the timeline of a specific user ) or are too expensive to be realized on a mobile device .

label: Research questions
text: Given that 80 % of active Twitter users access the site on mobile devices , in this article we present a lightweight , personal , on-demand , topic modeling-based tweets summarization engine called TOTEM , designed for such devices .

label: Research method
text: Specifically , TOTEM first preprocesses recent tweets in a user 's timeline and exploits Latent Dirichlet Allocation-based topic modeling to assign each preprocessed tweet to a topic .

label: Research method
text: Then it generates a ranked list of relevant tweets , a topic label , and a topic summary for each of the topics .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our experimental study with real-world data sets demonstrates the superiority of TOTEM .

label: Research questions
text: The amount of funds and effort devoted to such projects is enormous , and now they are providing greater opportunities and convenience for researchers to view and make use of important , rare , and/or brittle historical materials .

label: Research questions
text: However , little attention has been paid in the information science field as to how much impact these projects to digitalize archival collections have had on actual historical research publications .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Existing studies are largely devoted to system designs and the user/usability interface , as well as users ' search behaviors .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Little has been done to determine the direct relationship between digital resources and historical research .

label: Research method
text: This study surveyed research articles in the field of history to observe how frequently and widely digital collections were used , what kinds of digital collections were used more extensively and for what Research questionss , and what the current status of digital archival collections among other resources is in historical research .

label: Research method
text: Citations and figures in articles of the American Historical Review for the period 20012010 were analyzed with a specific focus on digital archives collection .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The usage patterns by material types and formats of references and the impacts of digital archival collections among other sources are identified from two perspectives of impact : intensity and extensity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Observation of the direct relationships with digital collections and historical studies suggest some practical guidelines for future digital projects with concrete data .

label: Research questions
text: One frequent research question has been how different conference and journal publications are , considering an article as a unit of analysis .

label: Research method
text: This study takes an author-based approach to analyze the publishing patterns of 517,763 scholars who have ever published both in CS conferences and journals for the last 57 years , as recorded in DBLP .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis shows that the majority of CS scholars tend to make their scholarly debut , publish more articles , and collaborate with more coauthors in conferences than in journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Importantly , conference articles seem to serve as a distinct channel of scholarly communication , not a mere preceding step to journal publications : coauthors and title words of authors across conferences and journals tend not to overlap much .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study corroborates Research findings/conclusions of previous studies on this topic from a distinctive perspective and suggests that conference authorship in CS calls for more special attention from scholars and administrators outside CS who have focused on journal publications to mine authorship data and evaluate scholarly performance .

label: Research method
text: We examine the role of human values in shaping the Net neutrality debate through a content analysis of testimonies from U.S. Senate and FCC hearings on Net neutrality .

label: Research method
text: The analysis is based on a coding scheme that we developed based on a pilot study in which we used the Schwartz Value Inventory .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that the policy debate surrounding Net neutrality revolves primarily around differences in the frequency of expression of the values of innovation and wealth , such that the proponents of Net neutrality more frequently invoke innovation , while the opponents of Net neutrality more frequently invoke wealth in their prepared testimonies .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The paper provides a novel approach for examining the Net neutrality debate and sheds light on the connection between information policy and research on human values .

label: Research questions
text: A common challenge is to identify which aspects of online interaction influence user engagement the most .

label: Research method
text: In this article , through an analysis of a news article collection obtained from Yahoo News US , we demonstrate that news articles exhibit considerable variation in terms of the sentimentality and polarity of their content , depending on factors such as news provider and genre .

label: Research method
text: Moreover , through a laboratory study , we observe the effect of sentimentality and polarity of news and comments on a set of subjective and objective measures of engagement .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , we show that attention , affect , and gaze differ across news of varying interestingness .

label: Research questions
text: As part of our study , we also explore methods that exploit the sentiments expressed in user comments to reorder the lists of comments displayed in news pages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results indicate that user engagement can be anticipated predicted if we account for the sentimentality and polarity of the content as well as other factors that drive attention and inspire human curiosity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research libraries and archives , as well as groups from within the humanities disciplines themselves , are being tasked with providing robust support for information management practices , including helping to engage humanities scholars with appropriate digital technologies in ways that are sensitive to disciplinary-based cultures and practices .

label: Research questions
text: However , infrastructure ( services , tools , and collaborative networks ) to support scholarly information significant barriers impede this work , primarily because the management is still under development .

label: Research questions
text: Under the aegis of the Scholars Tracking Archival Resources ( STAR ) project we are studying how humanities scholars gather and manage primary source materials with a goal of developing software to support their information management practices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article reports the Research findings/conclusions from our interviews with 26 humanities scholars , in conjunction with a set of initial requirements for a mobile application that will support scholars in capturing documents , recreating the archival context , and uploading these documents to cloud storage for access and sharing from other devices .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article reports the development and evaluation of CharaParser , a software application for semantic annotation of morphological descriptions .

label: Research method
text: CharaParser annotates semistructured morphological descriptions in such a detailed manner that all stated morphological characters of an organ are marked up in Extensible Markup Language1 format .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using an unsupervised machine learning algorithm and a general Research questions syntactic parser as its key annotation tools , CharaParser requires minimal additional knowledge engineering work and seems to perform well across different description collections and/or taxon groups .

label: Research method
text: The system has been formally evaluated on over 1,000 sentences randomly selected from Volume 19 of Flora of North American and Part H of Treatise on Invertebrate Paleontology .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: CharaParser reaches and exceeds 90 % in sentence-wise recall and precision , exceeding other similar systems reported in the literature .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It also significantly outperforms a heuristic rule-based system we developed earlier .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Early evidence that enriching the lexicon of a syntactic parser with domain terms alone may be sufficient to adapt the parser for the biodiversity domain is also observed and may have significant implications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In many cases , the collaborations are technology supported , meaning that the work is done through shared documents .

label: Research method
text: We develop a framework articulating the characteristics of documents supporting collaborators with access to asymmetric knowledge versus those with access to symmetric knowledge .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing on theories about document genre , boundary objects , and provenance , we hypothesize that documents supporting asymmetric collaborators are likely to articulate or prescribe their own ( a ) Research questions , ( b ) context of use , ( c ) content and form , and ( d ) provenance in greater detail than documents supporting symmetric collaborators .

label: Research method
text: We explore these hypotheses through content analysis of documents and instructions for documents from a variety of free/libre open-source projects ( FLOSS ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We present Research findings/conclusions consistent with the hypotheses developed as well as results extending beyond our theory-derived assumptions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When participants have access to the same knowledge , the study suggests that prescriptions about the content of documents become less important compared with prescriptions about the context , provenance , and process of work .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study contributes with a dynamic perspective on communicative practices that consider an often-uneven distribution of knowledge in virtual collaborations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When threats materialize , the consequences can be significant .

label: Research questions
text: Most large organizations invest in a dedicated information security management ( ISM ) function to ensure that digital assets are protected .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The ISM function conducts risk assessments , develops strategy , provides policies and training to define roles and guide behavior , and implements technological controls such as firewalls , antivirus , and encryption to restrict unauthorized access .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite these protective measures , incidents ( security breaches ) will occur .

label: Research questions
text: Alongside the security management function , many organizations also retain an incident response ( IR ) function to mitigate damage from an attack and promptly restore digital services .

label: Research questions
text: However , few organizations integrate and learn from experiences of these functions in an optimal manner that enables them to not only respond to security incidents , but also proactively maneuver the threat environment .

label: Research questions
text: In this article we draw on organizational learning theory to develop a conceptual framework that explains how the ISM and IR functions can be better integrated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The strong integration of ISM and IR functions , in turn , creates learning opportunities that lead to organizational security benefits including : increased awareness of security risks , compilation of threat intelligence , removal of flaws in security defenses , evaluation of security defensive logic , and enhanced security response .

label: Research method
text: We examined a large-scale data file comprised of nearly 7,000,000 records spanning 33 consecutive months of a major US retailer 's search engine marketing campaign .

label: Research method
text: The theoretical foundation is serial position effect to explain searcher behavior when interacting with ranked ad listings .

label: Research method
text: We control for temporal effects and use one-way analysis of variance ( ANOVA ) with Tamhane 's T2 tests to examine the effect of ad rank on critical keyword advertising metrics , including clicks , cost-per-click , sales revenue , orders , items sold , and advertising return on investment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions show significant ad rank effect on most of those metrics , although less effect on conversion rates .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A primacy effect was found on both clicks and sales , indicating a general compelling performance of top-ranked ads listed on the first results page .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Conversion rates , on the other hand , follow a relatively stable distribution except for the top 2 ads , which had significantly higher conversion rates .

label: Research questions
text: However , examining conversion potential ( the effect of both clicks and conversion rate ) , we show that ad rank has a significant effect on the performance of keyword advertising campaigns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Conversion potential is a more accurate measure of the impact of an ad 's position .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In fact , the first ad position generates about 80 % of the total profits , after controlling for advertising costs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition to providing theoretical grounding , the research results reported in this paper are beneficial to companies using search engine marketing as they strive to design more effective advertising campaigns .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: As such , the current paper proposes a new measurement for quantifying journals ' diversity by utilizing the abstracts of scientific publications in journals , namely topic diversity ( TD ) .

label: Research method
text: Specifically , we apply a topic detection method to extract fine-grained topics , rather than disciplines , in journals and adapt certain diversity indicators to calculate TD .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Since TD only needs as inputs abstracts of publications rather than citing relationships between publications , this measurement has the potential to be widely used in scientometrics .

label: Research method
text: Through 2 case studies we show how information and the genres used for communicating that information was perceived and used by the relevant agents involved with the genres .

label: Research method
text: Based on the case studies , we conclude by discussing how the fields of information history and rhetorical genre theory can inform each other .

label: Research questions
text: In this brief communication , we assess some of the methodological difficulties that have arisen in this context .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These difficulties encompass issues of data availability , suitability of indicators , nature and Research questions of tables and graphs , and the role of supplementary information .

label: Research questions
text: In particular , this study aims to investigate the potentials of imparting richer collective intelligence to existing knowledge representation systems in health .

label: Research questions
text: The study focuses on detecting semantic relationships between semantic groups of major concepts mined from health consumers ' descriptions of health issues and associated user-generated metadata ( i.e. , tags ) .

label: Research method
text: A total of 50,263 blogs and associated 341,720 tags were collected from Tumblr , a blogging social networking site .

label: Research method
text: Text mining and semantic network analysis methods were used to explore the usage patterns at semantic type levels of the identified medical concepts in tags , in blogs , and between tags and blogs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More various associations among semantic types were identified both in tags and in blogs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These associations were more diverse and complicated than the relationships in the Unified Medical Language System Semantic Network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among the groups of concepts in tags and blogs , groups showed relatively stronger and more diverse relationships with other groups of concepts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , many direct and close relations were found between tags and blogs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Conventional measures are brittle : They estimate the surface overlap between documents based on the words they mention and ignore deeper semantic connections .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We propose a new measure that assesses similarity at both the lexical and semantic levels , and learns from human judgments how to combine them by using machine-learning techniques .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments show that the new measure produces values for documents that are more consistent with people 's judgments than people are with each other .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also use it to classify and cluster large document sets covering different genres and topics , and find that it improves both classification and clustering performance .

label: Research method
text: Narrative inquiry was used as a research method , allowing two focus groupsone composed of teens and the other of undergraduate studentsto map out 4 cyberbullying stories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Each cyberbullying story revealed 2 subplotsthe story that is ( as perceived by these participants ) and the story that could be ( if the participants ' design recommendations were embedded in social media ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study resulted in a user-generated framework for designing affordances on social media sites to counter acts of cyberbullying .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Seven emergent design themes are evident in the participants ' cyberbullying narratives : design for hesitation , design for consequence , design for empathy , design for personal empowerment , design for fear , design for attention , and design for control and suppression .

label: Research method
text: We conclude with a typological analysis of the values present in the participants ' design recommendations , applying Cheng and Fleischman 's values framework ( 2010 ) .

label: Research questions
text: This study aimed to develop an analytical framework to identify self-disclosing health information with unusual messages on web forums by leveraging advanced text-mining techniques .

label: Research method
text: To demonstrate the performance of the proposed analytical framework , we conducted an experimental study on 2 major human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) /acquired immune deficiency syndrome ( AIDS ) forums in Taiwan .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results show that the classification accuracy increased significantly ( up to 83.83 % ) when using features selected by the information gain technique .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results also show the importance of adopting domain-specific features in analyzing unusual messages on web forums .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study has practical implications for the prevention and support of HIV/AIDS healthcare .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For example , public health agencies can re-allocate resources and deliver services to people who need help via social media sites .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , individuals can also join a social media site to get better suggestions and support from each other .

label: Research questions
text: Strategies to streamline data management across disciplines are of key importance .

label: Research method
text: This paper presents results of an institutional survey ( N = 258 ) at a medium-sized Austrian university with a STEM focus , supplemented with interviews ( N = 18 ) , to give an overview of the state-of-play of RDM practices across faculties and disciplinary contexts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: RDM services are on the rise but remain somewhat behind leading countries like the Netherlands and UK , showing only the beginnings of a culture attuned to RDM .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There is considerable variation between faculties and institutes with respect to data amounts , complexity of data sets , data collection and analysis , and data archiving .

label: Research questions
text: Data sharing practices within fields tend to be inconsistent .

label: Research questions
text: RDM is predominantly regarded as an administrative task , to the detriment of considerations of good research practice .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Problems with RDM fall in two categories : Generic problems transcend specific research interests , infrastructures , and departments while discipline-specific problems need a more targeted approach .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The paper extends the state-of-the-art on RDM practices by combining in-depth qualitative material with quantified , detailed data about RDM practices and needs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions should be of interest to any comparable research institution with a similar agenda .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous research dealing with privacy concerns has studied mostly worries about information misuse , focusing on the protection aspects of privacy .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By adopting an interpersonal conception of privacy and communication privacy management theory , this study offers a new way of understanding privacy concerns by examining the social and presentational aspects of privacy .

label: Research questions
text: It examines privacy concerns in terms not only of others ' misuse but of others ' misunderstanding and personal information in terms not only of identity but of self-presentational information .

label: Research questions
text: Furthermore , it investigates the ways in which information and social risks inherent in SNS influence privacy concerns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A structural equation modeling analysis of a cross-sectional survey of 396 Facebook users finds that longer usage does not alleviate the impact of information risk on either concern , that a greater proportion of offline friends among one 's SNS friends aggravates the impact of social risk on both concerns , and that concerns about information misuse affect the provision only of identity information , whereas concerns about information misunderstanding affect the provision of both identity and self-presentational information .

label: Research questions
text: Although they are well studied in the literature , little research examines how sociotechnical design changes influence the sustainability of support communities for different medical conditions .

label: Research method
text: We compare the impact of a single design change on 49 disease-specific health support forums hosted on the WebMD platform , a popular online health information service .

label: Research method
text: A statistical analysis showcases changes in posting patterns before and after the design intervention ; a subsequent interpretive examination of forum content reveals how the design change affected members ' perceived affordances of the platform .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions suggest that , despite differences between communities , the design change triggered a common set of cascading effects : it made it difficult for core users to create and maintain relationships , that led them to ultimately leave the site , and , in turn , reduced the activity drawing newcomers to the platform .

label: Research questions
text: Using these Research findings/conclusions , we argue that the design of sustainable and robust online communities must account for systemic , sociotechnical dynamics .

label: Research method
text: Through the analysis of scientific production indexed in the Web of Science for the years 2006-2010 , the new knowledge is classified in subject categories and mapped according to an algorithm for the reconciliation of authors ' affiliations .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Unlike other studies in the literature based on simple counting of publications , the present study adopts an indicator , Scientific Strength , which takes account of both the quantity of scientific production and its impact on the advancement of knowledge .

label: Research method
text: The differences in the results that arise from the 2 approaches are examined .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of works of this kind can inform public research policies , at national and local levels , as well as the localization strategies of research-based companies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Scientific impact , particularly , plays a significant role in the academia .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper attempts to understand researchers ' career trajectories by considering the research community as a social network , where individuals build ties with each other via coauthorship .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The resulting linkage facilitates information flow and affects researchers ' future impact .

label: Research questions
text: Consequently , we systematically investigate the career trajectories of researchers with respect to research impact using the social capital theory as our theoretical foundation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , for early-stage and mid-career academics , we find that connections with prominent researchers associate with greater impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Brokerage positions , in addition , are beneficial to a researcher 's research impact in the long run .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For senior researchers , however , the only social network feature that significantly affects their future impact is the reputation of their recently built ties .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we build predictive models on future research impact which can be leveraged by both organizations and individuals .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper provides empirical evidence for how social networks provide signals on researchers ' career dynamics guided by social capital theory .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions have implications for individual researchers to strategically plan and promote their careers and for research institutions to better evaluate current as well as prospective employees .

label: Research method
text: We contacted these authors to ask about their research processes , with regard to digital archival collections , and their perceptions of the usefulness of digital archival collections to historical research .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study presents a realistic portrayal of the uses and impacts of digital primary sources from the perspectives of historians who use digital collections for their research projects .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions from this study indicate that digital archival collections are important source materials for historical studies for various reasons .

label: Research questions
text: However , the amount of authority digital materials possess as historical resources was disputed .

label: Research questions
text: Many historians preferred documents in their original form , but historians ' preferences began to change as they increasingly consulted digital formats .

label: Research questions
text: As the web has developed into an important research platform , historians have adopted different research patterns , one of which is using random web searches to find digital primary sources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Historians ' understandings of the use of digital archival collections revealed a spectrum of activities including finding , understanding , interpreting , and citing digital information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Historians in this study worked concurrently on multiple studies or on a larger project for a book , and each of their searches for digital collections had the potential to provide them with useful results for several research studies .

label: Research method
text: In a naturalistic setting and across a range of curriculum areas , it investigated the behavior of secondary school students undertaking information search tasks .

label: Research method
text: Research questions focused on students ' criteria for assessing the relevance and reliability of information .

label: Research method
text: Thirty-seven students between 14 and 17 years of age from a southeastern Australian school participated .

label: Research method
text: The study collected data from journals ; interviews , including video-stimulated recall interviews ; think-aloud reports ; video screen captures ; and questionnaires .

label: Research method
text: Data analysis culminated in grounded theory .

label: Research method
text: Initial judgments of an item 's relevance were based on comprehensibility , completeness of source , whether the item needed to be purchased , whether video sources were suitable , and whether factual or opinionative material met students ' needs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Participants preferred information that provided topic overviews , information that linked to prior knowledge , and sources that treated topics in acceptable depth and were structured to facilitate accessibility .

label: Research method
text: Students derived clues about reliability from URLs and considered the reputation of sources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The ability of an item to corroborate prior knowledge , its graphic design , its style of writing , and the perceived authority of its creators influenced participants ' decisions about reliability .

label: Research method
text: A unique dataset of Airbnb listings in Beijing is collected to perform an empirical analysis and a model simulation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of this study demonstrate that the spillover of listings ' recommendation information decays with spatial distance and this decay follows a certain attenuation mode ( i.e. , has a certain attenuation rate and attenuation point ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: As one of the first to investigate the attenuation mechanism of information spillover , this communication enriches the current research on information transmission and brings a novel topic to the attention of the community .

label: Research questions
text: Previous studies have attempted to infer influence from blog features , but they have ignored the possible influence styles that describe the different ways in which influence is exerted .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We propose a novel approach to analyzing bloggers ' influence styles and using the influence styles as features to improve the performance of influence diffusion detection among linked bloggers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proposed influence style ( INFUSE ) model describes bloggers ' influence through their engagement style , persuasion style , and persona .

label: Research method
text: Methods used include similarity analysis to detect the creating-sharing aspect of engagement style , subjectivity analysis to measure persuasion style , and sentiment analysis to identify persona style .

label: Research method
text: We further extend the INFUSE model to detect influence diffusion among linked bloggers based on the bloggers ' influence styles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The INFUSE model performed well with an average F1 score of 76 % compared with the in-degree and sentiment-value baseline approaches .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous studies have focused on the existence of influence among linked bloggers in detecting influence diffusion , but our INFUSE model is shown to provide a fine-grained description of the manner in which influence is diffused based on the bloggers ' influence styles .

label: Research questions
text: More researchers are designing and evaluating interactive information retrieval ( IIR ) systems and beginning to innovate in evaluation methods .

label: Research questions
text: Maturation of a research specialty relies on the ability to replicate research , provide standards for measurement and analysis , and understand past endeavors .

label: Research method
text: This article presents a historical overview of 40 years of IIR evaluation studies using the method of systematic review .

label: Research method
text: A total of 2,791 journal and conference units were manually examined and 127 articles were selected for analysis in this study , based on predefined inclusion and exclusion criteria .

label: Research method
text: These articles were systematically coded using features such as author , publication date , sources and references , and properties of the research method used in the articles , such as number of subjects , tasks , corpora , and measures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results include data describing the growth of IIR studies over time , the most frequently occurring and cited authors and sources , and the most common types of corpora and measures used .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: An additional product of this research is a bibliography of IIR evaluation research that can be used by students , teachers , and those new to the area .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To the authors ' knowledge , this is the first historical , systematic characterization of the IIR evaluation literature , including the documentation of methods and measures used by researchers in this specialty .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The existence of those transitions could be regarded because of the diversity in collaboration behaviors of scientific fields .

label: Research method
text: A growing geometric hypergraph built on a cluster of concentric circles is proposed to model two specific collaboration behaviors , namely the behaviors of research team leaders and those of the other team members .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The model successfully predicts the transitions , as well as many common features of coauthorship networks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Particularly , it realizes a process of deriving the complex scale-free property from the simple yes/no decisions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Moreover , it provides a reasonable explanation for the emergence of transitions with the difference of collaboration behaviors between leaders and other members .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The difference emerges in the evolution of research teams , which synthetically addresses several specific factors of generating collaborations , namely the communications between research teams , academic impacts and homophily of authors .

label: Research method
text: Using the full text of 45,000 papers published in the PLoS series of journals as a case study , this paper investigates , from the viewpoint of bibliometrics , how references are distributed along the structure of scientific papers as well as the age of these cited references .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Once the sections of articles are realigned to follow the IMRaD sequence , the position of cited references along the text of articles is invariant across all PLoS journals , with the introduction and discussion accounting for most of the references .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It also provides evidence that the age of cited references varies by section , with older references being found in the methods and more recent references in the discussion .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These results provide insight into the different roles citations have in the scholarly communication process .

label: Research method
text: This study presents a general bibliometric analysis on the new funding acknowledgment ( FA ) information available in the Web of Science .

label: Research method
text: All publications covered by the database in 2009 have been analyzed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The presence and length of the FA text , as well as the presence of peer interactive communication in the acknowledgments , are related to impact indicators , distribution of papers by fields , countries of the authors , and collaboration level of the papers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is observed that publications with FAs present a higher impact as compared with publications without them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There are also differences across countries and disciplines in the share of publications with FAs and the acknowledgment of peer interactive communication .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: China is the country with the highest share of publications acknowledging funding , while the presence of FAs in the humanities and social sciences is very low compared to the more basic disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The presence of peer interactive communication in acknowledgments can be linked to countries that have a strong scientific tradition and are incorporated in scientific networks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Peer interactive communication is also common in the fields of humanities and social sciences and can be linked to lower levels of co-authorship .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Observed patterns are explained and topics of future research are proposed .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: As a technique , it is more interested in the what than in the why of data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It does not need theories that explain how things work , it just needs the results .

label: Research questions
text: As a science , however , working strictly from data and without theories contradicts the post-empiricist view of science .

label: Research questions
text: In this view , theories come before data and data is used to corroborate or falsify theories .

label: Research questions
text: Nevertheless , one of the most controversial statements about Data Science is that it is a science that can work without theories .

label: Research method
text: In this conceptual paper , we focus on the science aspect of Data Science .

label: Research questions
text: How is Data Science as a science ?

label: Research method
text: We propose a three-phased view of Data Science that shows that different theories have different roles in each of the phases we consider .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We focus on when theories are used in Data Science rather than the controversy of whether theories are used in Data Science or not .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the end , we will see that the statement Data Science works without theories is better put as in some of its phases , Data Science works without the theories that originally motivated the creation of the data .

label: Research questions
text: As an alternative and motivated by the success of term familiarity , we test a complementary measure : grammar familiarity .

label: Research method
text: Grammar familiarity is measured as the frequency of the 3rd level sentence parse tree and is useful for evaluating individual sentences .

label: Research method
text: We created a database of 140K unique 3rd level parse structures by parsing and binning all 5.4M sentences in English Wikipedia .

label: Research method
text: We then calculated the grammar frequencies across the corpus and created 11 frequency bins .

label: Research method
text: We evaluate the measure with a user study and corpus analysis .

label: Research method
text: For the user study , we selected 20 sentences randomly from each bin , controlling for sentence length and term frequency , and recruited 30 readers per sentence ( N = 6,600 ) on Amazon Mechanical Turk .

label: Research method
text: We measured actual difficulty ( comprehension ) using a Cloze test , perceived difficulty using a 5-point Likert scale , and time taken .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Sentences with more frequent grammatical structures , even with very different surface presentations , were easier to understand , perceived as easier , and took less time to read .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Outcomes from readability formulas correlated with perceived but not with actual difficulty .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our corpus analysis shows how the metric can be used to understand grammar regularity in a broad range of corpora .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Highly cited papers serve as a proxy for excellence and coauthored papers as a measure of collaborative efforts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that currently research institutes ( of the Russian Academy of Sciences as well as others ) remain the key players despite recent government initiatives to stimulate university science .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The contribution of the commercial sector to high-impact research is negligible .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More than 90 % of Russian highly cited papers involve international collaboration , and Russian institutions often do not play a dominant role .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Partnership with U.S. , German , U.K. , and French scientists increases markedly the probability of a Russian paper becoming highly cited .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Patterns of national ( intranational ) collaboration in world-class research differ significantly across different types of organizations ; the strongest ties are between three nuclear/particle physics centers .

label: Research method
text: Finally , we draw a coauthorship map to visualize collaboration between Russian centers of excellence .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Recent research has developed sophisticated financial polarity lexicons for investigating how financial sentiments relate to future company performance .

label: Research questions
text: However , based on experience from fields that commonly analyze sentiment , it is well known that the overall semantic orientation of a sentence may differ from that of individual words .

label: Research questions
text: This article investigates how semantic orientations can be better detected in financial and economic news by accommodating the overall phrase-structure information and domain-specific use of language .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our three main contributions are the following : ( a ) a human-annotated finance phrase bank that can be used for training and evaluating alternative models ; ( b ) a technique to enhance financial lexicons with attributes that help to identify expected direction of events that affect sentiment ; and ( c ) a linearized phrase-structure model for detecting contextual semantic orientations in economic texts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The relevance of the newly added lexicon features and the benefit of using the proposed learning algorithm are demonstrated in a comparative study against general sentiment models as well as the popular word frequency models used in recent financial studies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proposed framework is parsimonious and avoids the explosion in feature space caused by the use of conventional n-gram features .

label: Research questions
text: Compared to the face-to-face communications , it can be particularly more challenging for users to understand and evaluate another 's perspective in online communications .

label: Research questions
text: On the other hand , the availability of the communication record in online communications offers a potential to leverage computational techniques to automatically detect user opinions and rationales .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One promising approach to automatically detect the rationales is to detect the common discourse relations in rationale texts .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: However , no empirical work has been done with regard to which discourse relations are commonly present in the users ' rationales in online communications .

label: Research method
text: To fill this gap , we annotated the discourse relations in the text segments that contain the rationales ( N = 527 text segments ) .

label: Research method
text: These text segments are obtained from five datasets that consist of five online posts and the first 100 comments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We identified 10 discourse relations that are commonly present in this sample .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our finding marks an important contribution to this rationale detection approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We encourage more empirical work , preferably with a larger sample , to examine the generalizability of our Research findings/conclusions .

label: Research questions
text: Even though teaching is a mainstream , information-rich profession , teachers are understudied as information users .

label: Research questions
text: More specifically , not much is known about teacher personal information management ( PIM ) .

label: Research questions
text: Teacher PIM is critically important , as teachers navigate a complex information space complicated by the duality of digital and physical information streams and changing demands on instruction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our research study increases understanding of teacher PIM and informs the development of tools to support educators .

label: Research questions
text: Some important unknowns exist about teachers as information users : What are teachers ' PIM practices ?

label: Research questions
text: What are the perceived consequences of these practices for teaching and learning ?

label: Research questions
text: How can PIM practices be facilitated to benefit teaching and learning ?

label: Research method
text: This study employed a qualitative research design , with interviews from 24 primary and secondary teachers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We observed various systems for information organization , and teachers report their systems to be effective .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Important sources for teachers ' information in order of importance are personal collections , close colleagues , and the Internet .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Key Research findings/conclusions reveal that inheriting and sharing information play an important part in information acquisition for teachers and that information technology supporting education creates unintentional demands on information management .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions on the nature of teacher information , teacher information finding , keeping , and organizational practices have important implications for teachers themselves , school principals , digital library developers , school librarians , curriculum developers , educational technology developers , and educational policy makers .

label: Research method
text: We concentrated on the explanatory power of early attention on conference papers for citations collected from Google Scholar and Scopus .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The early attention data includes users ' online activities in a conference support system : CN3 .

label: Research method
text: Bookmarks from the bibliographic management system , Citeulike , were used as a collateral source of early attention .

label: Research method
text: To examine the chronological contributions of 13 factors on citations , a multiple sequential regression analysis was conducted for three timepoints of the publication cycle-paper submission , time of conferences , and months after conferences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results illustrate that online readers ' early attention of Citeulike bookmarks were found to have the most influence on the future impact of the conference papers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The early attention records from CN3 made noteworthy improvements to explaining both the Google and Scopus citations as well .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also found that the type of papers the number of papers presented at a conference , and the best article award records were significant factors influencing future citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the magnitude of the effects made by online readers ' early attention from both sources appears to be larger than these three traditional factors .

label: Research method
text: A framework for understanding KC with hermeneutic phenomenology is developed , based on an analysis of recent KC research and key texts on hermeneutic phenomenology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results obtained indicate that recent KC research still emphasizes the concept of knowledge as an asset inside the human mind , although the interest is in knowing and interpersonal relationships in working communities .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Exploration of the use of the effect of interaction in research on KC shows that successful interaction is connected to the ideas of openness , critical thinking , and awareness of past experiences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These elements reflect the general ideas of the hermeneutic tradition without taking into account the historical roots of hermeneutics or questioning the concept of a human being behind them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is concluded that the hermeneutic circle and phenomenological conceptualization of a human being provide a better defined and more coherent structure for understanding the event of KC as a future-oriented , conscious act of interaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The framework developed offers three fundamental areas for exploration : structure of the interactive event , construction of the human experience in interaction , and modes of being in interaction .

label: Research method
text: We analyzed 127,812 articles published between 1988 and 2013 in 173 journals on the ISI Web of Science in the management category .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Collaboration occurred in approximately 60 % of all articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A power-law relationship was found between citation-based performance and journal size and collaboration patterns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The number of citations expected by collaborative articles increases 2 ( 1.89 ) or 3.7 times when the number of collaborative articles published in a journal doubles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
