text: The number of citations expected by noncollaborative articles only increases 2 ( 1.35 ) or 2.55 times if a journal publishes double the number of noncollaborative articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Matthew effect is stronger for collaborative than for noncollaborative articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Scale-independent indicators increase the confidence in the evaluation of the impact of the articles published in management journals .

label: Research questions
text: Literature suggests that if a person is information-related competent in one context , then he or she will be competent in the rest of the contexts of action .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: But this is only true for a basic level of information competencies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article reports results from 24 interviews performed to mature e-learning students and suggests that in a more advanced level of information competencies , some competencies that appear in one context are not manifested in another context .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Several factors have been found to be related with information competencies transfer between contexts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Attitude is a key factor and feelings regarding Internet use is another critical factor .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically in learning environments , the results suggest that canned content and planned learning strategies can discourage a proactive attitude and enthusiasm for information and communication technologies , and therefore the acquisition of information-related competencies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Understanding the differences and common patterns between these contexts may be useful for designing better information systems , services and instruction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that the award of the Nobel Prize in 2005 affected not only the citations to his work , but also affected the citations to the references in his scientific oeuvre .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that the spillover effect is almost as powerful as the effect itself .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We are consequently able to document a ripple effect in which the awarding of the Nobel Prize ignites a citation chain reaction to Aumann 's scientific ouvre and to the references in its nearest citation network .

label: Research questions
text: The effect is discussed using innovation decision process theory as a point of departure to identify the factors that created a bandwagon effect leading to the reported observations .

label: Research questions
text: In this exploratory study , we investigate how employees use and get value from a variety of social networking technologies .

label: Research method
text: The context of this research is 4 software firms located in China .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Notwithstanding differences in corporate attitudes toward social networking , we identify common themes in the way Web 2.0 technologies are leveraged as value is created by employees at all levels .

label: Research method
text: We draw on the communication ecology framework to analyze the application of various technologies .

label: Research method
text: We inductively develop 5 propositions that describe how social networking technologies contribute directly to horizontal and vertical communication in organizations , and ultimately to individual , team , and organizational performance .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Implications for research and practice are discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , existing general-Research questions social web sentiment analysis algorithms may not be optimal for texts focussed around specific topics .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article introduces 2 new methods , mood setting and lexicon extension , to improve the accuracy of topic-specific lexical sentiment strength detection for the social web .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Mood setting allows the topic mood to determine the default polarity for ostensibly neutral expressive text .

label: Research method
text: Topic-specific lexicon extension involves adding topic-specific words to the default general sentiment lexicon .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments with 8 data sets show that both methods can improve sentiment analysis performance in corpora and are recommended when the topic focus is tightest .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study integrates online community with urban-rural health inequality in China to empirically explore whether online communities reduce health disparities between urban and rural areas in China .

label: Research method
text: By collecting a unique data set from an online community in China that focuses on one disease , an exponential random graph model was used to empirically analyze the network structures and relationships formed in this community .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that technology-mediated online health communities can alleviate health disparities in China by exchanging information and improving the health capabilities of rural residents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We discuss the implications and guidelines for future research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most Twitter search systems generally treat a Tweet as a plain text when modeling relevance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , a series of conventions allows users to Tweet in structural ways using a combination of different blocks of texts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These blocks include plain texts , hashtags , links , mentions , etc .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Each block encodes a variety of communicative intent and the sequence of these blocks captures changing discourse .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous work shows that exploiting the structural information can improve the structured documents ( e.g. , web pages ) retrieval .

label: Research method
text: In this study we utilize the structure of Tweets , induced by these blocks , for Twitter retrieval and Twitter opinion retrieval .

label: Research method
text: For Twitter retrieval , a set of features , derived from the blocks of text and their combinations , is used into a learning-to-rank scenario .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We show that structuring Tweets can achieve state-of-the-art performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our approach does not rely on social media features , but when we do add this additional information , performance improves significantly .

label: Research questions
text: For Twitter opinion retrieval , we explore the question of whether structural information derived from the body of Tweets and opinionatedness ratings of Tweets can improve performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results show that retrieval using a novel unsupervised opinionatedness feature based on structuring Tweets achieves comparable performance with a supervised method using manually tagged Tweets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Topic-related specific structured Tweet sets are shown to help with query-dependent opinion retrieval .

label: Research questions
text: Our hypothesis is that named entities ( NEs ) are more informative than other features in the news when clustering fine grained topics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The algorithm does not need as input any information related to the number of clusters , and carries out the clustering only based on information regarding the shared named entities of the news items .

label: Research method
text: This proposal is evaluated using different data sets and outperforms other state-of-the-art algorithms , thereby proving the plausibility of the approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , because the applicability of our approach depends on the possibility of identifying equivalent named entities among the news , we propose a heuristic system to identify equivalent named entities in the same and different languages , thereby obtaining good performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This approach involves achieving informational privacy , through the features of anonymity and obscurity , through an optimal balance of ontological frictions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This approach may be used to modify models for information behavior and for information literacy , giving them a fuller and more effective coverage of privacy issues in the infosphere .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For information behavior , the Information Seeking and Communication Model and the Information Grounds conception are most appropriate for this Research questions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For information literacy , the metaliteracy model , using a modification a privacy literacy framework , is most suitable .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An effective mechanism that provides high quality app recommendations becomes necessary .

label: Research questions
text: However , existing recommendation techniques tend to recommend similar items but fail to consider users ' functional requirements , making them not effective in the app domain .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose a recommendation architecture that can generate app recommendations at the functionality level .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We address the redundant recommendation problem in the app domain by highlighting users ' functional requirements , an element that has received scant attention from existing recommendation research .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Another main feature of our work is extracting app functionalities from textural user reviews for recommendation .

label: Research questions
text: We also propose an effective approach for functionality extraction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments conducted on a real-world dataset show that our proposed AppRank method outperforms other commonly used recommendation methods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , it doubles the recall value of the second best method under an extremely sparse setting , increases the overall ranking accuracy of the second best method by 14.27 % , and retains a high diversity of 0.99 .

label: Research questions
text: When dealing with user-generated text , the diverse and informal writing style makes traditional approaches much less effective .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: On the other hand , in many types of text on social media such as user comments , tweets , or question-answer posts , the contextual connections between documents do exist .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Examples include posts in a thread discussing the same topic , tweets that share a hashtag about the same entity .

label: Research questions
text: Our idea in this work is utilizing the related contexts across documents to perform mention recognition in a collective manner .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Intuitively , within a mention coreference graph , the labels of mentions are expected to propagate from more confidence cases to less confidence ones .

label: Research questions
text: To this end , we propose a novel semisupervised inference algorithm named parameterized label propagation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In our model , the propagation weights between mentions are learned by an attention-like mechanism , given their local contexts and the initial labels as input .

label: Research method
text: We study the performance of our approach in the Yahoo !

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: News data set , where comments and articles within a thread share similar context .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that our model significantly outperforms all other noncollective NER baselines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that web technologies continue to drive developments , especially at the research front , although perhaps more indirectly than before .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A broadening of perspectives is visible in IS 2006-2010 , where network science becomes influential and where full-text analysis methods complement traditional computer science influences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research in the areas of the h-index and mapping of science appears to have been highlights of IS 2006-2011 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study tests and confirms a forecast made previously by comparing knowledge-base and research-front Research findings/conclusions for IS 2001-2005 , which expected both the information retrieval ( IR ) systems and webometrics specialties to shrink in 2006 to 2010 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A corresponding comparison of the knowledge base and research front of IS 2006-2010 suggests a continuing decline of the IR systems specialty in the near future , but also a considerable ( re ) growth of the webometrics area after a period of decline from 2001 to 2005 and 2006 to 2010 , with the latter due perhaps in part to its contribution to an emerging web science .

label: Research method
text: Taking a sociocultural approach , this article covers two main types of epistemology beyond the brain , namely , embodied epistemology and nonindividualist epistemology .

label: Research method
text: Using citizen science and music to illustrate related concepts of intuition , experience , and embodiment , this article describes intuition as a cultural system , beyond a purely individual possession .

label: Research questions
text: We describe howin cultural practices such as musicintuition acts as mediator between knowledge and embodiment , and intuition is built and modified by experience over time .

label: Research questions
text: Building on Dick 's ( ) notion of holistic perspectivism , we pose a holistic epistemology approach that embraces knowledge that extends well beyond the purely cognitive , in both embodied situations and systemic manifestations .

label: Research questions
text: As information research becomes increasingly interested in the role of the body and its relationship to information , knowledge , intuition , and memory , we argue that such an approach will uncover further dimensions of nonindividualist , systemic , and embodied knowledge .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we perform extensive analyses on a large-scale online video viewing log on smart TVs .

label: Research questions
text: Because time influences almost every aspect of our lives , our aim is to understand temporal patterns of the online video viewing behavior of smart TV viewers at the crowd level .

label: Research method
text: First , we measure the amount of time per hour spent in watching online videos on smart TV by each household on each day .

label: Research method
text: By applying clustering techniques , we identify eight daily patterns whose peak hours occur in different segments of the day .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The differences among households can be characterized by three types of temporal habits .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also uncover five periodic weekly patterns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There seems to be a circadian rhythm at the crow level .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further analysis confirms that there exists a holiday effect in the online video viewing behavior on smart TVs .

label: Research questions
text: Finally , we investigate the popularity variations of different video categories over the day .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The obtained insights shed light on how we can partition a day to improve the performance of time-aware video recommendations for smart TV viewers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Links between various data sources play a key role insofar as they allow software applications ( e.g. , browsers , search engines ) to operate over the aggregated data space as if it was a unique local database .

label: Research method
text: In this new data space , where DBpedia , a data set including structured information from Wikipedia , seems to be the central hub , we analyzed and highlighted outgoing links from this hub in an effort to discover broken links .

label: Research method
text: The paper reports on an experiment to examine the causes of broken links and proposes some treatments for solving this problem .

label: Research method
text: We call this type of ontology a single-viewpoint ontology .

label: Research questions
text: There can be a variety of such single viewpoint ontologies that represent a wide spectrum of subfields and expert opinions on the domain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , to have a complete formal vocabulary for the domain they need to be linked and unified into a multi-viewpoint model while having the subjective viewpoint statements marked and distinguished from the objectively true statements .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we propose and implement a two-phase methodology for multiviewpoint ontology construction by nonexpert users .

label: Research method
text: The proposed methodology was implemented for the domain of the effect of diet on health .

label: Research method
text: A large-scale crowdsourcing experiment was conducted with about 750 ontological statements to determine whether each of these statements is objectively true , viewpoint , or erroneous .

label: Research method
text: Typically , in crowdsourcing experiments the workers are asked for their personal opinions on the given subject .

label: Research questions
text: However , in our case their ability to objectively assess others ' opinions was examined as well .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show substantially higher accuracy in classification for the objective assessment approach compared to the results based on personal opinions .

label: Research method
text: Initial repository development was focused on North America , Western Europe , and Australasia , particularly the United States , United Kingdom , Germany , and Australia , followed by Japan .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Since 2010 , there has been repository growth in East Asia , South America , and Eastern Europe , especially in Taiwan , Brazil , and Poland .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: During the period , some countries , including France , Italy , and Spain , have maintained steady growth , whereas other countries , notably China and Russia , have experienced limited growth .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Globally , repositories are predominantly institutional , multidisciplinary and English-language based .

label: Research questions
text: They typically use open-source OAI-compliant software but have immature licensing arrangements .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although the size of repositories is difficult to assess accurately , available data indicate that a small number of large repositories and a large number of small repositories make up the repository landscape .

label: Research method
text: These trends are analyzed using innovation diffusion theory , which is shown to provide a useful explanatory framework for repository adoption at global , national , organizational , and individual levels .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Major factors affecting both the initial development of repositories and their take-up include IT infrastructure , cultural factors , policy initiatives , awareness-raising activity , and usage mandates .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Mandates are likely to be crucial in determining future repository development .

label: Research questions
text: The study also compares the associations between the factors and uploading intentions of two different cultures , the United States and South Korea .

label: Research method
text: Using data from surveys of college students from the two countries ( n=249 and 173 ) , structural equation modeling analyses revealed that ego involvement not only plays an essential role in explaining uploading intention but also functions as an antecedent of attitude and perceived behavioral control in both countries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the subjective norm was not significantly associated with uploading intention in either country , and the descriptive norm was a marginally significant factor in accounting for uploading intention in the United States .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , it was found that , only in the United States , attitude was significantly associated with uploading intention , whereas perceived behavioral control was a significant factor in explaining uploading intention in both countries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions suggest that the effects of cultural differences , the impact of subjective norms in particular , may be weakened with the more self-oriented nature of Web 2.0 applications and social media such as Wikipedia .

label: Research method
text: Theoretical implications are discussed .

label: Research method
text: The semantic annotation system ( OPTIMA ) performs the tasks of Named Entity Recognition , Relation Extraction , Negation Detection , and Word-Sense Disambiguation using hand-crafted rules and terminological resources for associating contextual abstractions with classes of the standard ontology CIDOC Conceptual Reference Model ( CRM ) for cultural heritage and its archaeological extension , CRM-EH .

label: Research method
text: Relation Extraction ( RE ) performance benefits from a syntactic-based definition of RE patterns derived from domain oriented corpus analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The evaluation also shows clear benefit in the use of assistive natural language processing ( NLP ) modules relating to Word-Sense Disambiguation , Negation Detection , and Noun Phrase Validation , together with controlled thesaurus expansion .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The semantic indexing results demonstrate the capacity of rule-based Information Extraction techniques to deliver interoperable semantic abstractions ( semantic annotations ) with respect to the CIDOC CRM and archaeological thesauri .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Major contributions include recognition of relevant entities using shallow parsing NLP techniques driven by a complimentary use of ontological and terminological domain resources and empirical derivation of context-driven RE rules for the recognition of semantic relationships from phrases of unstructured text .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: F1000 recommends important publications in the biomedical literature , and from this perspective F1000 could be an interesting tool for research evaluation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By linking the complete database of F1000 recommendations to the Web of Science bibliographic database , we are able to make a comprehensive comparison between F1000 recommendations and citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that about 2 % of the publications in the biomedical literature receive at least one F1000 recommendation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Recommended publications on average receive 1.30 recommendations , and more than 90 % of the recommendations are given within half a year after a publication has appeared .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There turns out to be a clear correlation between F1000 recommendations and citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the correlation is relatively weak , at least weaker than the correlation between journal impact and citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More research is needed to identify the main reasons for differences between recommendations and citations in assessing the impact of publications .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The genre structure and relationships among genre structure constituents shed new light on organizing information by Research questions or function .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study examines the relationships among a set of functional units previously constructed in a taxonomy , each of which is a chunk of information embedded in a document and is distinct in terms of its communicative function .

label: Research method
text: Through a card-sort study , relationships among functional units were identified with regard to their occurrence and function .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions suggest that a group of functional units can be identified , collocated , and navigated by particular relationships .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Understanding how functional units are related to each other is significant in linking information pieces in documents to support finding , aggregating , and navigating information in a distributed information environment .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that the notion of location as it manifests itself in location-based systems is being produced as an object of exchange .

label: Research questions
text: Here we are specifically concerned with what happens to institutional roles , power relationships , and decision-making processes when a particular type of informationthat of spatiotemporal location of peopleis made into a technologically tradable object through the use of location-based systems .

label: Research questions
text: We examine the introduction of GPS ( Global Positioning Systems ) technologies by the California criminal justice system and the institution of parole for monitoring the movements of parolees , with consequences both for the everyday lives of these parolees and the work practices of their parole officers .

label: Research questions
text: We document the ways in which broad adoption of location-based and mobile technologies has the capacity to radically reconfigure the spatiotemporal arrangement of institutional processes .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The presence of digital location traces creates new forms of institutional accountability , facilitates a shift in the understood relation between location and action , and necessitates new models of interpretation and sense making in practice .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It shows that doctoral students tend to cite more documents per article than faculty members , and that the literature they cite is , on average , more recent .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It also demonstrates that doctoral students cite a larger proportion of conference proceedings and journal articles than faculty members and faculty members are more likely to self-cite and cite theses than doctoral students .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Analysis of the impact of cited journals indicates that in health research , faculty members tend to cite journals with slightly lower impact factors whereas in social sciences and humanities , faculty members cite journals with higher impact factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , it provides evidence that , in every discipline , faculty members tend to cite a higher proportion of clinical/applied research journals than doctoral students .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study contributes to the understanding of referencing patterns and age stratification in academia .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Implications for understanding the information-seeking behavior of academics are discussed .

label: Research method
text: The evolution of search algorithms ( based on the Web of Science and Web of Knowledge database platforms ) was used to show the impact of errors of omission and commission in the outcomes of scientometric research .

label: Research method
text: Optimization of the search algorithm led to the complete reassessment of previously published Research findings/conclusions on the performance of environmental tobacco smoke research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Instead of strong continuous growth , the field of environmental tobacco smoke research was shown to experience stagnation or slow growth since mid-1990s when evaluated quantitatively .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Qualitative analysis revealed steady but slow increase in the citation rate and decrease in uncitedness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Country analysis revealed the North-European countries as leaders in environmental tobacco smoke research ( when the normalized results were evaluated both quantitatively and qualitatively ) , whereas the United States ranked first only when assessing the total number of papers produced .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Scientometric research artifacts , including both errors of omission and commission , were shown to be capable of completely obscuring the real output of the chosen research field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This may leave out opportunities for making recommendations that analyze the search process and/or recommend alternative search process instead of objects .

label: Research questions
text: To overcome this limitation , we investigated whether by analyzing a searcher 's current processes we could forecast his likelihood of achieving a certain level of success with respect to search performance in the future .

label: Research method
text: We propose a machine-learning-based method to dynamically evaluate and predict search performance several time-steps ahead at each given time point of the search process during an exploratory search task .

label: Research method
text: Our prediction method uses a collection of features extracted from expression of information need and coverage of information .

label: Research method
text: For testing , we used log data collected from 4 user studies that included 216 users ( 96 individuals and 60 pairs ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show 80-90 % accuracy in prediction depending on the number of time-steps ahead .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In effect , the work reported here provides a framework for evaluating search processes during exploratory search tasks and predicting search performance .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Importantly , the proposed approach is based on user processes and is independent of any IR system .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we used a multiscale framework to reduce the effects caused by noise and to extract explainable geometric properties to characterize finite metric spaces .

label: Research method
text: We conducted lab experiments that integrated the use of eye-tracking , electrodermal activity ( EDA ) , and user logs to explore users ' information-seeking behaviors on search engine result pages ( SERPs ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results of 1,590 search queries showed that the proposed strategies effectively predicted query-level user satisfaction using EDA and eye-tracking data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The bootstrap analysis showed that combining EDA and eye-tracking data with user behavior data extracted from user logs led to a significantly better linear model fit than using user behavior data alone .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , cross-user and cross-task validations showed that our methods can be generalized to different search engine users performing different preassigned tasks .

label: Research method
text: Study I explored the experiences of women striving to make sense of symptoms associated with menopause ; Study II examined posts from two online discussion groups for people with symptoms of obsessive compulsive disorder .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Joint data analysis demonstrates that normality was initially perceived as the absence of illness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A breakdown in perceived normality because of disruptive symptoms created gaps and discontinuities in understanding .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As participants interacted with information about the experiences of health-challenged peers , socially constructed notions of normality emerged .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This was internalized as a new normal .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions demonstrate normality as an element of sense making that changes and develops over time , and experiential information and social contexts as central to health-related sense making .

label: Research questions
text: Re-establishing perceptions of normality , as experienced by health-challenged peers , was an important element of sense making .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This investigation provides nuanced insight into notions of normality , extends understanding of social processes involved in sense making , and represents the first theorizing of and model development for normality within the information science and sense making literature .

label: Research questions
text: Various human evaluation techniques as well as automatic metrics have been proposed and investigated in the last decade .

label: Research questions
text: However , very few evaluation methods take the linguistic aspect into account .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we use an objective evaluation method for machine translation output that classifies all translation errors into one of the five following linguistic levels : orthographic , morphological , lexical , semantic , and syntactic .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Linguistic guidelines for the target language are required , and human evaluators use them in to classify the output errors .

label: Research method
text: The experiments are performed on English-to-Catalan and Spanish-to-Catalan translation outputs generated by four different systems : 2 rule-based and 2 statistical .

label: Research method
text: All translations are evaluated using the 3 following methods : a standard human perceptual evaluation method , several widely used automatic metrics , and the human linguistic evaluation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Pearson and Spearman correlation coefficients between the linguistic , perceptual , and automatic results are then calculated , showing that the semantic level correlates significantly with both perceptual evaluation and automatic metrics .

label: Research questions
text: Some fields are well known for using alphabetic author order , while others put a great emphasis on the meaning of the author order and place authors according to contribution .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article is the first to use mixed method to examine the extent of alphabetic author order and to examine why researchers adopt a certain author order norm in the fields of economics and political science .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The article finds that alphabetic authorship has been and is the norm in economics , while some tendency towards it exists in political science .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The differences in the intellectual and social organization of the fields seem to be a factor in the extent that these researchers will adopt a certain norm .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , the increasing number of authors per article and the publish-or-perish culture seems to put pressure on the alphabetic norm because it creates greater attention to the reputational advantages of being first-author .

label: Research method
text: Data regarding 4 aspects of their music-related psychological traits-music involvement , musical identity , preference diversity , and preference openness-were also collected through a background questionnaire .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A classification of music access modes was proposed based on the circumstances that lead to a music listening experience .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A mixed regression analysis revealed several significant interaction effects between psychological traits and the mode of music access on music enjoyment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Foremost among these was a positive interaction effect between preference openness and the playing of a known track triggered by musical cues , and that between preference diversity and exposure to new music played by others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Individuals with a strong musical identity tended to enjoy music played of their own volition without any apparent triggers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , a multimodal logistic regression analysis also revealed the relationships between these psychological traits and the likelihood of different music access modes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Preference diversity significantly increased the likelihood of music listening triggered by need arousal .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results support the proposition that users ' music-related psychological traits should be considered in personalized recommendation strategies .

label: Research method
text: This article investigates the relationship between changes in the share of the world 's scientific output and changes in relative citation impact for 2.6 million articles from 26 fields in the 25 countries with the most Scopus-indexed journal articles from 1996 to 2015 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There is a negative correlation between expansion and relative citation impact , but their relationship varies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: China , Spain , Australia , and Poland were successful overall across the 26 fields , expanding both their share of the world 's output and its relative citation impact , whereas Japan , France , Sweden , and Israel had decreased shares and relative citation impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In contrast , the USA , UK , Germany , Italy , Russia , The Netherlands , Switzerland , Finland , and Denmark all enjoyed increased relative citation impact despite a declining share of publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , India , South Korea , Brazil , Taiwan , and Turkey all experienced sustained expansion but a recent fall in relative citation impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These results may partly reflect changes in the coverage of Scopus and the selection of fields .

label: Research questions
text: Numerous bibliometric indices have been proposed for the ranking of research performance , mainly on an ad hoc basis .

label: Research questions
text: We introduce the novel class of Scientific Research Measures ( SRMs ) to rank scientists ' research performance and provide a rigorous theoretical foundation for these measures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In contrast to many bibliometric indices , SRMs take into account the whole citation curve of the scientist , offer appealing structural properties , allow a finer ranking of scientists , correspond to specific features of different disciplines , research areas and seniorities , and include several bibliometric indices as special cases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus SRMs result in more accurate rankings than ad hoc bibliometric indices .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We also introduce the further general class of Dual SRMs that reflect the value of journals and permit the ranking of research institutions based on theoretically sound criteria , which has been a central theme in the scientific community over recent decades .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An empirical application to the citation curves of 173 finance scholars shows that SRMs can be easily calibrated to actual citation curves and generate different authors ' rankings than those produced by seven traditional bibliometric indices .

label: Research questions
text: What is the reason behind whether a university places higher or lower in the ranking ?

label: Research questions
text: Taking the example of ETH Zurich , the aim of this communication is to reconstruct how the high position of ETHZ ( in Europe rank no .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: 1 in PP [ top 10 % ] ) in the Centre for Science and Technology Studies ( CWTS ) Leiden Ranking 2013 in the field social sciences , arts and humanities came about .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: According to our analyses , the bibliometric indicator values of a university depend very strongly on weights that result in differing estimates of both the total number of a university 's publications and the number of publications with a citation impact in the 90th percentile , or PP ( top 10 % ) .

label: Research questions
text: In addition , we examine the effect of weights at the level of individual publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the results , we offer recommendations for improving the Leiden Ranking ( for example , publication of sample calculations to increase transparency ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This implies that disambiguation approaches might be improved if ethnic name groups are distinguished before disambiguation .

label: Research method
text: We explore the potential of ethnic name partitioning by comparing performance of four machine learning algorithms trained and tested on the entire data or specifically on individual name groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that ethnicity-based name partitioning can substantially improve disambiguation performance because the individual models are better suited for their respective name group .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The improvements occur across all ethnic name groups with different magnitudes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Performance gains in predicting matched name pairs outweigh losses in predicting nonmatched pairs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Feature ( e.g. , coauthor name ) similarities of name pairs vary across ethnic name groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Such differences may enable the development of ethnicity-specific feature weights to improve prediction for specific ethic name categories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions are observed for three labeled data with a natural distribution of problem sizes as well as one in which all ethnic name groups are controlled for the same sizes of ambiguous names .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study is expected to motive scholars to group author names based on ethnicity prior to disambiguation .

label: Research method
text: For this Research questions , a theoretical approach is applied that comprises the analytical notion of material objects and a document theory .

label: Research method
text: Empirical material was primarily ethnographically produced over a period of 6 months , including 2 seminars within the network .

label: Research questions
text: Trajectories of sharing that reach across time and space have been identified by studying how people interact with multidimensional objects , such as documents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These were found to coordinate and shape the social practice under study .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The theoretical framework has made it possible to highlight aspects of information sharing that have tended to be blackboxed in previous research .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It has been suggested in previous research that the concept of information sharing can be reduced to that of mere sharing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Such a stance potentially entails reduction of conceptual ambiguity but may also decrease analytical sharpness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the present study , it appears beneficial to adopt the concept of document into the discourse of information-sharing research .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By adding the concept of document to our analytical toolbox , which hitherto has been dominated by the slightly diffuse concept of information , material features can be emphasized without reducing the social and cognitive dimensions of information sharing .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The article offers insight into the information-sharing activities of design researchers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Through its focus on materiality , it presents a novel theoretical approach and methodological strategy for studying information practices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We showcase the set of developed language-dependent and language-independent features , the model of training examples , consisting of pairs of equal features for known and unknown texts , and the appropriate method of authorship verification .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An authorship verification accuracy greater than 90 % was accomplished via the application of stylometric methods on four different languages ( English , Greek , Spanish , and Dutch , while the verification for Dutch is slightly lower ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For the multilingual case , the highest authorship verification accuracy using basic machine-learning methods , over 90 % , was achieved by the application of the kNN and SVM-SMO methods , using the feature selection method SVM-RFE .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The improvement in authorship verification accuracy in multilingual cases , over 94 % , was accomplished via ensemble learning methods , with the MultiboostAB method being a bit more accurate , but Random Forest is generally more appropriate .

label: Research questions
text: But inclusivity within this online encyclopedia is not a simple matter of just allowing anyone to contribute .

label: Research questions
text: In its quest for legitimacy as an encyclopedia , Wikipedia relies on outsiders to judge claims championed by rival editors .

label: Research method
text: In choosing these experts , Wikipedians define the boundaries of acceptable comment on any given subject .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Inclusivity then becomes a matter of how the boundaries of expertise are drawn .

label: Research questions
text: In this article I examine the nature of these boundaries and the implications they have for inclusivity and credibility as revealed through the talk pages produced and sources used by a particular subset of Wikipedia 's creatorsthose involved in writing articles on the topic of Philippine history .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results confirm that the presence and density of social media altmetric counts are still very low and not very frequent among scientific publications , with 15 % -24 % of the publications presenting some altmetric activity and concentrated on the most recent publications , although their presence is increasing over time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Publications from the social sciences , humanities , and the medical and life sciences show the highest presence of altmetrics , indicating their potential value and interest for these fields .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis of the relationships between altmetrics and citations confirms previous claims of positive correlations but is relatively weak , thus supporting the idea that altmetrics do not reflect the same kind of impact as citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , altmetric counts do not always present a better filtering of highly-cited publications than journal citation scores .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Altmetric scores ( particularly mentions in blogs ) are able to identify highly-cited publications with higher levels of precision than journal citation scores ( JCS ) , but they have a lower level of recall .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The value of altmetrics as a complementary tool of citation analysis is highlighted , although more research is suggested to disentangle the potential meaning and value of altmetric indicators for research evaluation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , it is unclear how users identify the most satisfying reply .

label: Research method
text: Based on the dual-process theory of knowledge adoption , we developed a conceptual model and empirical method to study which factors influence adoption of a reply .

label: Research method
text: We extracted 6 variables for argument quality ( Ease of understanding , Relevance , Completeness , Objectivity , Timeliness , Structure ) and 4 for source credibility ( Physician 's online experience , Physician 's offline expertise , Hospital location , Hospital level ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The empirical results indicate that both central and peripheral routes affect user 's adoption of a response .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Physician 's offline expertise negatively affects user 's adoption decision , while physician 's online experience positively affects it ; this effect is positively moderated by user involvement .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the method may negatively impact the retrieval performance when some irrelevant terms are used in the expanded query .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Therefore , it is necessary to refine the expansion terms .

label: Research questions
text: Learning to rank methods have proven effective in information retrieval to solve ranking problems by ranking the most relevant documents at the top of the returned list , but few attempts have been made to employ learning to rank methods for term refinement in pseudo relevance feedback .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article proposes a novel framework to explore the feasibility of using learning to rank to optimize pseudo relevance feedback by means of reranking the candidate expansion terms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We investigate some learning approaches to choose the candidate terms and introduce some state-of-the-art learning to rank methods to refine the expansion terms .

label: Research questions
text: In addition , we propose two term labeling strategies and examine the usefulness of various term features to optimize the framework .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results with three TREC collections show that our framework can effectively improve retrieval performance .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , we conduct a comprehensive and in-depth bibliometric analysis of the field of bioinformatics by extracting citation data from PubMed Central full-text .

label: Research method
text: Citation data for the period 2000 to 2011 , comprising 20,869 papers with 546,245 citations , was used to evaluate the productivity and influence of this emerging field .

label: Research method
text: Four measures were used to identify productivity ; most productive authors , most productive countries , most productive organizations , and most popular subject terms .

label: Research method
text: Research impact was analyzed based on the measures of most cited papers , most cited authors , emerging stars , and leading organizations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show the overall trends between the periods 2000 to 2003 and 2004 to 2007 were dissimilar , while trends between the periods 2004 to 2007 and 2008 to 2011 were similar .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , the field of bioinformatics has undergone a significant shift , co-evolving with other biomedical disciplines .

label: Research method
text: Twenty students engaged in making projects of their choice with low- and high-technologies for 15 weeks .

label: Research method
text: Data collection included visual process mapping activities , surveys , and Dervin 's Sense-Making Methodology-informed interviews .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions included inspirations , actions , emotions , challenges , helps , and learning that occurred during the making processes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Information played an integral role as students engaged in creative production and learning .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Students identified information as helps , challenges , how they learn , and learning outcomes .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study proposes a new , evolving process model of making that illustrates production-centered information behavior and learning .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The model 's spiral form emphasizes the non-linear and cyclical nature of the making process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Squiggly lines represent how the making process is gap-filled and uncertain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study contributes to the scholarly and professional fields of information science , library and information studies , maker , and STEAM ( Science , Technology , Engineering , Art , and Math ) learning .

label: Research questions
text: To fill this gap , this article assesses whether a number of simple metrics derived from Amazon.com reviews of academic books could provide evidence of their impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on a set of 2,739 academic monographs from 2008 and a set of 1,305 best-selling books in 15 Amazon.com academic subject categories , the existence of significant but low or moderate correlations between citations and numbers of reviews , combined with other evidence , suggests that online book reviews tend to reflect the wider popularity of a book rather than its academic impact , although there are substantial disciplinary differences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Metrics based on online reviews are therefore recommended for the evaluation of books that aim at a wide audience inside or outside academia when it is important to capture the broader impacts of educational or cultural activities and when they can not be manipulated in advance of the evaluation .

label: Research questions
text: Such tasks are challenging because searchers must keep track of their search progress and the information they encounter across sessions .

label: Research questions
text: Multi-session tasks can be cognitively taxing for visually impaired users because the lack of persistence of screen readers causes the load on working memory to be high .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we first discuss the habitual behavior of visually impaired participants for multi-session tasks when using popular search interfaces .

label: Research method
text: We then present the evaluation of a search interface developed to support complex information seeking for visually impaired users .

label: Research method
text: The user evaluation was structured in two sessions to simulate a multi-session task .

label: Research questions
text: Thus , we discuss the strategies observed among participants to resume the search , to review previously encountered information , and to satisfy their evolved information need .

label: Research questions
text: We also compare the information-seeking behavior across the two sessions and examine how the proposed interface supports participants for multi-session tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions from this evaluation contribute to our understanding of the information-seeking behavior of visually impaired users and have implications for the design of tools to support searchers to manage and make sense of information during multi-session search tasks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Burrell ( 2013 ) showed that efforts to derive formulae from the mathematical framework of Lotkaian informetrics could lead to misleading results .

label: Research questions
text: On this note , we argue that a simple heuristic thermodynamical model can enable a better three-dimensional ( 3D ) evaluation of the information production process leading to what we call the zynergy-index .

label: Research questions
text: Due to this trend , researchers in various disciplines have become interested in studying relationships between real-world phenomena and their virtual representations .

label: Research questions
text: One such area of emerging research seeks to study relationships between real-world and virtual activism of social movement organization ( SMOs ) .

label: Research questions
text: In particular , SMOs holding extreme social perspectives are often studied due to their tendency to have robust virtual presences to circumvent real-world social barriers preventing information dissemination .

label: Research questions
text: However , many previous studies have been limited in scope because they utilize manual data-collection and analysis methods .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: They also often have failed to consider the real-world aspects of groups that partake in virtual activism .

label: Research method
text: We utilize automated data-collection and analysis methods to identify significant relationships between aspects of SMO virtual communities and their respective real-world locations and ideological perspectives .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results also demonstrate that the interconnectedness of SMO virtual communities is affected specifically by aspects of the real world .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These observations provide insight into the behaviors of SMOs within virtual environments , suggesting that the virtual communities of SMOs are strongly affected by aspects of the real world .

label: Research method
text: We explore the range of factors motivating and impacting individuals ' happy information-sharing behavior within a casual leisure context through 30 semistructured interviews .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions reveal that the factors influencing individuals ' happy information-sharing behavior are numerous , and impact each other .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most individuals considered sharing happy information important to their friendships and relationships .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In various contexts the act of sharing happy information was shown to enhance the sharer 's happiness .

label: Research questions
text: The benefits of PHRs and barriers preventing their adoption are also widely discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These issues are affected by technology infrastructure , and current and planned technology infrastructure deployment will be key determinants in the selection and design of PHR architectures .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Assumptions about the community-wide deployment of required technologies such as hardware and internet accessibility are implicit in the architectural selection of PHRs and these dependencies have not been fully appreciated or addressed in the existing literature .

label: Research method
text: This review article introduces and describes two infrastructural driversubiquitous technology baseline for PHRs and connectivity coverageand examines their inter-relationships with the selected PHR architectures .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Eleven functional capabilities are also described , providing a basis for the analysis of the relationships between the two infrastructural drivers and architectural selection .

label: Research questions
text: Designing digital information environments to support serendipity can not only provide users with new knowledge , but also propel them in directions they might not otherwise have traveled insurprising and delighting them along the way .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As serendipity involves unexpected circumstances it can not be directly controlled , but it can be potentially influenced .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: However , to the best of our knowledge , no previous work has focused on providing a rich empirical understanding of how it might be influenced .

label: Research method
text: We interviewed 14 creative professionals to identify their self-reported strategies aimed at increasing the likelihood of serendipity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These strategies form a framework for examining ways existing digital environments support serendipity and for considering how future environments can create opportunities for it .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This is a new way of thinking about how to design for serendipity ; by supporting the strategies found to increase its likelihood rather than attempting to support serendipity as a discrete phenomenon , digital environments not only have the potential to help users experience serendipity but also encourage them to adopt the strategies necessary to experience it more often .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that in prior network analyses of coauthorship networks , the information on ordering has been insufficiently considered because ties between authors are typically symmetrized .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This is basically the same as assuming that each coauthor has contributed equally to a paper .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We introduce a solution to this problem by adopting a coauthorship credit allocation model proposed by Kim and Diesner ( 2014 ) , which in its core conceptualizes coauthoring as a directed , weighted , and self-looped network .

label: Research method
text: We test and validate our application of the adopted framework based on a sample data of 861 authors who have published in the journal Psychometrika .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The results suggest that this novel sociometric approach can complement traditional measures based on undirected networks and expand insights into coauthoring patterns such as the hierarchy of collaboration among scholars .

label: Research method
text: As another form of validation , we also show how our approach accurately detects prominent scholars in the Psychometric Society affiliated with the journal .

label: Research method
text: It uses a citation data set of Scopus-indexed journals and proceedings .

label: Research method
text: The journal-level citation data set is aggregated into 27 subject areas and these subjects are selected as the unit of analysis .

label: Research method
text: A 3-step approach is employed : the first step examines disciplines ' citation characteristics through scientific trading dimensions ; the second step analyzes citation flows between pairs of disciplines ; and the third step uses egocentric citation networks to assess individual disciplines ' citation flow diversity through Shannon entropy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that measured by scientific impact , the subjects of Chemical Engineering , Energy , and Environmental Science have the fastest growth .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , most subjects are carrying out more diversified knowledge trading practices by importing higher volumes of knowledge from a greater number of subjects .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study also finds that the growth rates of disciplinary citations align with the growth rates of global research and development ( R & D ) expenditures , thus providing evidence to support the impact of R & D expenditures on knowledge production .

label: Research questions
text: Although the transfer of knowledge is largely unobservable , citations from one discipline to another have been proven to be an effective proxy to study disciplinary knowledge flow .

label: Research method
text: This study constructs a knowledge-flow network in which a node represents a Journal Citation Reports subject category and a link denotes the citations from one subject category to another .

label: Research method
text: Using the concept of shortest path , several quantitative measurements are proposed and applied to a knowledge-flow network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on an examination of subject categories in Journal Citation Reports , this study indicates that social science domains tend to be more self-contained , so it is more difficult for knowledge from other domains to flow into them ; at the same time , knowledge from science domains , such as biomedicine- , chemistry- , and physics-related domains , can access and be accessed by other domains more easily .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study also shows that social science domains are more disunified than science domains , because three fifths of the knowledge paths from one social science domain to another require at least one science domain to serve as an intermediate .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This work contributes to discussions on disciplinarity and interdisciplinarity by providing empirical analysis .

label: Research questions
text: Finding and indexing visual material to assist the process of ideation often fall on the designer , leading to user experiences that are less than ideal .

label: Research method
text: To inform development of computer systems to assist graphic designers in the ideation phase of the design process , we conducted interviews with 15 professional graphic designers about their design process and visual information needs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the study , we propose a set of requirements for an ideation-support system for graphic design .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We criticize the h-index from a theoretical point of view .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that for the Research questions of measuring the overall scientific impact of a scientist ( or some other unit of analysis ) , the h-index behaves in a counterintuitive way .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In certain cases , the mechanism used by the h-index to aggregate publication and citation statistics into a single number leads to inconsistencies in the way in which scientists are ranked .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our conclusion is that the h-index can not be considered an appropriate indicator of a scientist 's overall scientific impact .

label: Research method
text: Based on recent theoretical insights , we discuss what kind of indicators can be used as an alternative to the h-index .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We pay special attention to the highly cited publications indicator .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This indicator has a lot in common with the h-index , but unlike the h-index it does not produce inconsistent rankings .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a study in which 30 people browsed and selected content within an online news website .

label: Research method
text: Data collected included psychometric scales ( User Engagement , Cognitive Absorption , System Usability Scales ) , self-reported interest in news content , and performance metrics ( i.e. , reading time , browsing time , total time , number of pages visited , and use of recommended links ) ; a subset of the participants had their physiological responses recorded during the interaction ( i.e. , heart rate , electrodermal activity , electrocmytogram ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions demonstrated the concurrent validity of the psychometric scales and interest ratings and revealed that increased time on tasks , number of pages visited , and use of recommended links were not necessarily indicative of greater self-reported engagement , cognitive absorption , or perceived usability .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Positive ratings of news content were associated with lower physiological activity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The implications of this research are twofold .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: First , we propose that user experience is a useful framework for studying online information interactions and will result in a broader conceptualization of information interaction and its evaluation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Second , we advocate a mixed-methods approach to measurement that employs a suite of metrics capable of capturing the pragmatic ( e.g. , usability ) and hedonic ( e.g. , fun , engagement ) aspects of information interactions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We underscore the importance of using multiple measures in information research , because our results emphasize that performance and physiological data must be interpreted in the context of users ' subjective experiences .

label: Research questions
text: Being attributed to the original 140-character length , Twitter provides its users with quick-posting and easy-forwarding features that facilitate the timely dissemination of warnings and alerts .

label: Research questions
text: However , a concern arises with respect to the terseness of tweets that restricts the amount of information conveyed in a tweet and thus increases a tweet & apos ; s uncertainty .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We tackle such concerns by proposing entropy as a measure for a tweet & apos ; s uncertainty .

label: Research questions
text: Based on the perspectives of Uncertainty Reduction Theory ( URT ) , we theorize that the more uncertain information of a disaster tweet , the higher the entropy , which will lead to a lower retweet count .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By leveraging the statistical and predictive analyses , we provide evidence supporting that entropy validly and reliably assesses the uncertainty of a tweet .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study contributes to improving our understanding of information propagation on Twitter during disasters .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Academically , we offer a new variable of entropy to measure a tweet & apos ; s uncertainty , an important factor influencing disaster tweets & apos ; retweeting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Entropy plays a critical role to better comprehend URLs and emoticons as a means to convey information .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Practically , this research suggests a set of guidelines for effectively crafting disaster messages on Twitter .

label: Research questions
text: What , precisely , is meant by this term , sharing economy ?

label: Research questions
text: The literature to date offers many , often incomplete and conflicting definitions .

label: Research questions
text: This makes it difficult for researchers to lead a coherent discourse , to compare Research findings/conclusions and to select appropriate cases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Alternative terms ( e.g. , collaborative consumption , gig economy , and access economy ) are a further complication .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To resolve this issue , our article develops a consolidated ( based on all prior work ) and systemic ( relating to the phenomenon in its entire scope ) definition of the sharing economy .

label: Research method
text: The definition is based on the detailed analysis of definitions and explanations in 152 sources identified in a systematic literature review .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We identify 36 original understandings of the term sharing economy .

label: Research method
text: Using semantic integration strategies , we consolidate 84 semantic facets in these definitions into 18 characteristics of the sharing economy .

label: Research questions
text: Resolving conflicts in the meaning and scope of these characteristics , we arrive at a consolidated , systemic definition .

label: Research method
text: We evaluate the definition 's appropriateness and applicability by applying it to cases claimed by the media to be examples of the sharing economy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article 's definition is useful for future research and discourse on the sharing economy .

label: Research method
text: We conducted our experiments on 8 benchmark data sets , and computed Spearman correlations between the outputs of our methods and the ground truth .

label: Research method
text: We report our results together with 3 state-of-the-art approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results show that our method can outperform state-of-the-art approaches in all the selected English benchmark data sets .

label: Research questions
text: In particular , the increasing use of the web for health information prompts us to reexamine our existing delivery mechanisms .

label: Research method
text: We present enquireMe , which is a contextual question answering system that provides lay users with the ability to obtain responses about a wide range of health topics by vaguely expressing at the start and gradually refining their information needs over the course of an interaction session using natural language .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: enquireMe allows the users to engage in conversations about their health concerns , a process that can be therapeutic in itself .

label: Research method
text: The system uses community-driven question-answer pairs from the web together with a decay model to deliver the top scoring answers as responses to the users ' unrestricted inputs .

label: Research method
text: We evaluated enquireMe using benchmark data from WebMD and TREC to assess the accuracy of system-generated answers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite the absence of complex knowledge acquisition and deep language processing , enquireMe is comparable to the state-of-the-art question answering systems such as START as well as those interactive systems from TREC .

label: Research method
text: It models the total cost of publicationcomprising costs of journal subscriptions , OA article-processing charges ( APCs ) , and new administrative costs-for a sample of 24 institutions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: APCs are shown to constitute 12 % of the total cost of publication , APC administration , 1 % , and subscriptions , 87 % ( for a sample of seven publishers ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: APC expenditure in institutions rose between 2012 and 2014 at the same time as rising subscription costs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There was disproportionately high take up of Gold options for Health and Life Sciences articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: APC prices paid varied widely , with a mean APC of 1,586 pound in 2014 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Hybrid options ( subscription journals also offering OA for individual articles on payment of an APC ) were considerably more expensive than fully OA titles , but the data indicate a correlation between APC price and journal quality ( as reflected in the citation rates of journals ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The policy implications of these developments are explored , particularly in relation to hybrid OA and potential of offsetting subscription and APC costs .

label: Research method
text: Most researchers used RIMSs to discover research content .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Fewer used RIMSs for sharing and promoting their research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Early career researchers were more frequent users of RIMSs than were associate and full professors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Likewise , assistant professors and postdocs exhibited a higher probability of using RIMSs to promote their research than did students and full professors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Humanities researchers were the least frequent users of RIMSs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , humanities scholars used RIMSs to evaluate research less than did scholars in other disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The tasks of discovering papers , monitoring the literature , identifying potential collaborators , and promoting research were predictors of higher RIMS use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Researchers who engaged in promoting their research , evaluating research , or monitoring the literature showed a greater propensity to have a public RIMS profile .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , researchers mostly agreed that not being required , having no effect on their status , not being useful , or not being a norm were reasons for not having a public RIMS profile .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Humanities scholars were also more likely than social scientists to agree that having a RIMS profile was not a norm in their fields .

label: Research method
text: Grounded on singular value decomposition , the model represents terms and documents by the distribution signatures of their statistical contribution across the top-ranking latent concept dimensions .

label: Research method
text: LSISSM matches term signatures with document signatures according to their mapping coherence between latent semantic indexing ( LSI ) term subspace and LSI document subspace .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: LSISSM does feature reduction and finds a low-rank approximation of scalable and sparse term-document matrices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments demonstrate that this approach significantly improves the performance of major clustering algorithms such as standard K-means and self-organizing maps compared with the vector space model and the traditional LSI model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The unique contribution ranking mechanism in LSISSM also improves the initialization of standard K-means compared with random seeding procedure , which sometimes causes low efficiency and effectiveness of clustering .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A two-stage initialization strategy based on LSISSM significantly reduces the running time of standard K-means procedures .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Theoretical contributions to knowledge organization and decision making are stressed .

label: Research method
