text: We chose to work with a type of methodology known as multiple criteria decision making-Saaty 's analytical hierarchies process ( AHP ) .

label: Research method
text: This made it possible to develop a detailed analysis of the decision-making process and arrive at a hierarchical model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The model provided a structure representing the studied field , where an order of priority could be given to the decision-making process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The knowledge derived may be used in other fields of study such as information retrieval and knowledge representation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Each group may require task-related knowledge of different topic domains and documents to accomplish its tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Document recommendation methods are very useful to resolve the information overload problem and proactively support knowledge workers in the performance of tasks by recommending appropriate documents to meet their information needs .

label: Research questions
text: A worker 's document referencing behavior can be modeled as a knowledge flow ( KF ) to represent the evolution of his information needs over time .

label: Research questions
text: However , the information needs of workers and groups may change over time , so that modeling the knowledge referencing behavior of a group of workers is difficult .

label: Research questions
text: Additionally , most traditional recommendation methods which provide personalized recommendations do not consider workers ' KFs , or the information needs of the majority of workers in a group to recommend task knowledge .

label: Research questions
text: In this work , I integrate the KF mining method and propose group-based recommendation methods , including group-based collaborative filtering ( GCF ) and group content-based filtering ( GCBF ) , to actively provide task-related documents for groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results show that the proposed methods have better performance than the personalized recommendation methods in recommending the needed documents for groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , the recommended documents can fulfill the groups ' task needs and facilitate knowledge sharing among groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This presentation can be used to detect and describe different paradigmatic types of reception speed for scientific journals .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: They offer easily accessible platforms for users to seek , receive , and provide supports by posting .

label: Research method
text: Taking the advantage of text mining and machine learning techniques , we identified social support type ( s ) in each post and a new user 's support needs in an OHC .

label: Research method
text: We examined a user 's first-time support-seeking experience by measuring both quantity and quality of received support .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results revealed that the amount and match of received support are positive and significant predictors of new users ' continued engagement .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our outcomes can provide insight for designing and managing a sustainable OHC by retaining users .

label: Research questions
text: Traditional approaches for discovering publication outlets mainly focus on manually matching research relevance in terms of keywords as well as comparing journal qualities , but other research-relevant information such as social connections , publication rewards , and productivity of authors are largely ignored .

label: Research questions
text: To assist in identifying effective publication outlets and to support effective journal recommendations for manuscripts , a three-dimensional profile-boosted research analytics framework ( RAF ) that holistically considers relevance , connectivity , and productivity is proposed .

label: Research method
text: To demonstrate the usability of the proposed framework , a prototype system was implemented using the ScholarMate research social network platform .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Evaluation results show that the proposed RAF-based approach outperforms traditional recommendation techniques that can be applied to journal recommendations in terms of quality and performance .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research is the first attempt to provide an integrated framework for effective recommendation in the context of scientific item recommendation .

label: Research questions
text: Investor opinions extracted from online investment communities capture crowd wisdom and have begun to play an important role in financial markets .

label: Research questions
text: Existing research confirms the importance of crowd wisdom in stock predictions , but fails to investigate factors influencing crowd performance ( that is , crowd prediction accuracy ) .

label: Research questions
text: In order to help improve crowd performance , our research strives to investigate the impact of crowd characteristics on crowd performance .

label: Research method
text: We conduct an empirical study using a large data set collected from a popular online investment community , StockTwits .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions show that experience diversity , participant independence , and network decentralization are all positively related to crowd performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , crowd size moderates the influence of crowd characteristics on crowd performance .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: From a theoretical perspective , our work enriches extant literature by empirically testing the relationship between crowd characteristics and crowd performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From a practical perspective , our Research findings/conclusions help investors better evaluate social sensors embedded in user-generated stock predictions , based upon which they can make better investment decisions .

label: Research questions
text: To absorb salient content from the vast bulk of microblog posts , this article focuses on the task of microblog keyphrase extraction .

label: Research questions
text: In previous work , most efforts treat messages as independent documents and might suffer from the data sparsity problem exhibited in short and informal microblog posts .

label: Research questions
text: On the contrary , we propose to enrich contexts via exploiting conversations initialized by target posts and formed by their replies , which are generally centered around relevant topics to the target posts and therefore helpful for keyphrase identification .

label: Research method
text: Concretely , we present a neural keyphrase extraction framework , which has 2 modules : a conversation context encoder and a keyphrase tagger .

label: Research method
text: The conversation context encoder captures indicative representation from their conversation contexts and feeds the representation into the keyphrase tagger , and the keyphrase tagger extracts salient words from target posts .

label: Research method
text: The 2 modules were trained jointly to optimize the conversation context encoding and keyphrase extraction processes .

label: Research method
text: In the conversation context encoder , we leverage hierarchical structures to capture the word-level indicative representation and message-level indicative representation hierarchically .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In both of the modules , we apply character-level representations , which enables the model to explore morphological features and deal with the out-of-vocabulary problem caused by the informal language style of microblog messages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Extensive comparison results on real-life data sets indicate that our model outperforms state-of-the-art models from previous studies .

label: Research method
text: In order to fill this gap , we conducted a large-scale user survey questioning various aspects of people 's music information needs and behaviors .

label: Research questions
text: In particular , we investigated if general music users ' needs and behaviors have significantly changed over time by comparing our current survey results with a similar survey conducted in 2004 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this paper , we present the key Research findings/conclusions from the survey data and discuss 4 emergent themes- ( a ) the shift in access and use of personal music collections ; ( b ) the growing need for tools to support collaborative music seeking , listening , and sharing ; ( c ) the importance of visual music experiences ; and ( d ) the need for ontologies for providing rich contextual information .

label: Research questions
text: We conclude by making specific recommendations for improving the design of MIR systems and services .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although previous studies focus on knowledge contribution quantity , this study regards quantity and quality as two important , yet distinct , aspects of knowledge contribution .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing on self-determination theory , this study proposes that five motivational factors , categorized along the extrinsic-intrinsic spectrum of motivation , have differential effects on knowledge contribution quantity versus quality in the context of online Q & A communities .

label: Research method
text: An online survey with 367 participants was conducted in a leading online Q & A community to test the research model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that rewards in the reputation system , learning , knowledge self-efficacy , and enjoy helping stand out as important motivations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , rewards in the reputation system , as a manifestation of the external regulation , is more effective in facilitating the knowledge contribution quantity than quality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Knowledge self-efficacy , as a manifestation of intrinsic motivation , is more strongly related to knowledge contribution quality , whereas the other intrinsic motivation , enjoy helping , is more strongly associated with knowledge contribution quantity .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Both theoretical and practical implications are discussed .

label: Research questions
text: Little is known about how the increasing variety of available metrics affects researchers ' processes of selecting literature to read .

label: Research method
text: We conducted ranking experiments embedded into an online survey with 247 participating researchers , most from social sciences .

label: Research method
text: Participants completed series of tasks in which they were asked to rank fictitious publications regarding their expected relevance , based on their scores regarding six prototypical metrics .

label: Research method
text: Through applying logistic regression , cluster analysis , and manual coding of survey answers , we obtained detailed data on how prominent metrics for research impact influence our participants in decisions about which scientific articles to read .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Survey answers revealed a combination of qualitative and quantitative characteristics that researchers consult when selecting literature , while regression analysis showed that among quantitative metrics , citation counts tend to be of highest concern , followed by Journal Impact Factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results suggest a comparatively favorable view of many researchers on bibliometrics and widespread skepticism toward altmetrics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions underline the importance of equipping researchers with solid knowledge about specific metrics ' limitations , as they seem to play significant roles in researchers ' everyday relevance assessments .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article enhances our understanding of successive information searches by employing an experimental method to observe whether and how the behavioral characteristics of searchers statistically significantly changed over sessions .

label: Research questions
text: It focuses on a specific type of successive search called transmuting successive searches , in which searchers learn about and gradually refine their information problems during the course of the information search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that searchers ' behavioral characteristics indeed exhibit different patterns in different sessions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The identification of the behavioral characteristics can help information retrieval systems to detect stages or sessions of the information search process .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The Research findings/conclusions also help validate a theoretical framework to explain successive searches and suggest system requirements for supporting the associated search behavior .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study is one of the first to not only test for statistical significance among research propositions concerning successive searches but to also apply the research principles of implicit relevance feedback to successive searches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Seven search roles , representing distinct behavior patterns displayed by children when interacting with the Google search engine , are described , including Developing Searchers , Domain-specific Searchers , Power Searchers , Nonmotivated Searchers , Distracted Searchers , Rule-bound Searchers , and Visual Searchers .

label: Research method
text: Other trends are described and selected to present a view of the whole child searcher .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These roles and trends are used to make recommendations to designers , researchers , educators , and parents about the directions to take when considering how to best aid children to become search literate .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most science mapping studies use a single method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , as research fields have various properties , a valid map of a field should actually be composed of a set of maps derived from a series of investigations using different methods .

label: Research questions
text: That leads to the question of what can be learned from a combination-triangulation-of these different science maps .

label: Research method
text: In this paper we propose a method for triangulation , using the example of water science .

label: Research method
text: We combine three different mapping approaches : journal-journal citation relations ( JJCR ) , shared author keywords ( SAK ) , and title word-cited reference co-occurrence ( TWRC ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results demonstrate that triangulation of JJCR , SAK , and TWRC produces a more comprehensive picture than each method applied individually .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The outcomes from the three different approaches can be associated with each other and systematically interpreted to provide insights into the complex multidisciplinary structure of the field of water research .

label: Research method
text: We examined the effect of social information ( i.e. , tweets ) on the accuracy of the generated summaries by comparing the user preference for TBS ( tweet-biased summary ) with GS ( generic summary ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The result of crowdsourcing-based evaluation shows that the user preference for TBS was significantly higher than GS .

label: Research method
text: We also took random samples of the documents to see the performance of summaries in a traditional evaluation using ROUGE , which , in general , TBS was also shown to be better than GS .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We further analyzed the influence of the number of tweets pointed to a web document on summarization accuracy , finding a positive moderate correlation between the number of tweets pointed to a web document and the performance of generated TBS as measured by user preference .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that incorporating social information into the summary generation process can improve the accuracy of summary .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The reason for people choosing one summary over another in a crowdsourcing-based evaluation is also presented in this article .

label: Research method
text: Using nearly 1 million articles , and three classification systems with different levels of granularity , we study the effects of number of cited references , share of references covered by Web of Science , mean age of references and mean citation rate of references on field normalized citation rate .

label: Research method
text: To expose the relationship between the predictor variables and the response variable , we use quantile regression .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that a higher number of references , a higher share of references to publications within Web of Science and references to more recent publications correlate with citation impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A correlation was observed even when normalization was done with a finely grained classification system .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The predictor variables affected citation impact to a larger extent at higher quantile levels .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Regarding the relative importance of the predictor variables , citation impact of the cited references was in general the least important variable .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Number of cited references carried most of the importance for both low and medium quantile levels , but this importance was lessened at the highest considered level .

label: Research questions
text: One of the core issues in medical information retrieval ( IR ) is diversity of tasks that lead to diversity of categories of information needs and queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From the evaluation perspective , another related and challenging issue is the limited availability of appropriate test collections allowing the experimental validation of medically task oriented IR techniques and systems .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , we explore the peculiarities of TREC and CLEF medically oriented tasks and queries through the analysis of the differences and the similarities between queries across tasks , with respect to length , specificity , and clarity features and then study their effect on retrieval performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that , even for expert oriented queries , language specificity level varies significantly across tasks as well as search difficulty .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additional Research findings/conclusions highlight that query clarity factors are task dependent and that query terms specificity based on domain-specific terminology resources is not significantly linked to term rareness in the document collection .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The lessons learned from our study could serve as starting points for the design of future task-based medical information retrieval frameworks .

label: Research method
text: These were assessed in relation to previous research undertaken linking information behavior and experience with paradigm , metatheory , and discourse .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research assesses how the epistemic concept is treated , both within information science and within disciplines that have affinities to the topics or agents that have been the subject of inquiry within the field .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: An attempt is made to clarify the types of connections that are associated with the epistemic concept and to provide a clearer view of how research focused on information behavior might consider the questions underpinning assumptions relating to knowledge and knowing .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The symbiotic connection between epistemics and information science is advanced as a suitably nuanced conception of socially organized knowledge from which to define the appropriate level at which knowledge claims can be usefully advanced .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is proposed that fostering a better understanding of epistemics as a research practice might also provide for the development of a range of insights and methods that reflect the dynamic context within which the study of information behavior and information experience is located .

label: Research method
text: Given the limitations on searching Twitter 's public application programming interface ( API ) , we used the Topsy search engine as a source for compiling tweets .

label: Research method
text: To this end , we took a global sample of 200 universities and compiled all the tweets with hyperlinks to any of these institutions .

label: Research method
text: Further link data was obtained from alternative sources ( MajesticSEO and OpenSiteExplorer ) in order to compare the results .

label: Research method
text: Thereafter , various statistical tests were performed to determine the correlation between the indicators and the possibility of predicting external links from the collected tweets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate a high volume of tweets , although they are skewed by the performance of specific universities and countries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The data provided by Topsy correlated significantly with all link indicators , particularly with OpenSiteExplorer ( r=0.769 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , prediction models do not provide optimum results because of high error rates .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that the use of Twitter ( via Topsy ) as a source of hyperlinks to universities produces promising results due to its high correlation with link indicators , though limited by policies and culture regarding use and presence in social networks .

label: Research method
text: All single authors from two econometrics journals over a 10-year time period form the basis of the analysis of how experience and prestige affect the number of references in their publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Preliminary results from linear regression models suggest that two author types can be characterized using this analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Review experience seems to be the decisive factor in the data .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The article discusses the implications of the Research findings/conclusions and offers suggestions for future research within this new and promising area .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These different areas of knowledge have different restrictions on use of vocabulary ; thesauri are used only in information search and retrieval contexts , whereas lexicons are mental systems and generally applicable in all domains of life .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A set of vocabulary requirements that defines the more concrete characteristics of vocabulary items in the 2 contexts can be derived from this framework : lexicon items have to be learnable , complex , transparent , etc. , whereas thesaurus terms must be effective , current and relevant , searchable , etc .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The differences in vocabulary properties correlate with 2 other factors , the well-known dimension of Control ( deliberate , social activities of building and maintaining vocabularies ) , and Syntagmatization , which is less known and describes vocabulary items ' varying formal preparedness to exit the thesaurus/lexicon , enter into linear syntactic constructions , and , finally , acquire communicative functionality .

label: Research method
text: It is proposed that there is an inverse relationship between Control and Syntagmatization .

label: Research questions
text: Satisfaction with the data reuse experience , however , has not been widely studied .

label: Research method
text: Drawing from the information systems and information science literature , we developed a model to examine the relationship between data quality and data reusers ' satisfaction .

label: Research method
text: Based on a survey of 1,480 journal article authors who cited Inter-University Consortium for Political and Social Research ( ICPSR ) data in published papers from 2008-2012 , we found several data quality attributes-completeness , accessibility , ease of operation , and credibility-had significant positive associations with data reusers ' satisfaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There was also a significant positive relationship between documentation quality and data reusers ' satisfaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This share was repeatedly reported to exceed 10 % of the total papers produced , without any explanation of this phenomenon and the lack of difference in uncitedness between average and successful researchers .

label: Research method
text: In this report , we analyze the uncitedness among two independent groups of highly visible scientists ( mathematicians represented by Fields medalists , and researchers in physiology or medicine represented by Nobel Prize laureates in the respective field ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Analysis of both groups led to the identical conclusion : over 90 % of the uncited database records of highly visible scientists can be explained by the inclusion of editorial materials progress reports presented at international meetings ( meeting abstracts ) , discussion items ( letters to the editor , discussion ) , personalia ( biographic items ) , and by errors of omission and commission of the Web of Science ( WoS ) database and of the citing documents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Only a marginal amount of original articles and reviews were found to be uncited ( 0.9 and 0.3 % , respectively ) , which is in strong contrast with the previously reported data , which never addressed the document types among the uncited records .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous work has reported descriptive statistics about these scientists ' information-seeking behavior .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study extends that work to examine relationships between scientists ' information-seeking behaviors and their personal and environmental factors .

label: Research method
text: Several regression models , including the Poisson model , the logit model , and the ordered logit model , are built to interpret the correlation among scientists ' behaviors .

label: Research method
text: In addition , exploratory factor analysis is used for data reduction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , many factors were found to affect the specific information-seeking behaviors of scientists , including demographic , psychological , role-related , and environmental factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Of the factors having an effect , academic position was the most important determinant of information behavior .

label: Research questions
text: As the number of new scientific publications arrives at a rate that rapidly outpaces our capacity of reading , analyzing , and synthesizing scientific knowledge , we need to augment ourselves with information that can effectively guide us through the rapidly growing intellectual space .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we address a fundamental issue concerning what kinds of information may serve as early signs of potentially valuable ideas .

label: Research questions
text: In particular , we are interested in information that is routinely available and derivable upon the publication of a scientific paper without assuming the availability of additional information such as its usage and citations .

label: Research method
text: We propose a theoretical and computational model that predicts the potential of a scientific publication in terms of the degree to which it alters the intellectual structure of the state of the art .

label: Research method
text: The structural variation approach focuses on the novel boundary-spanning connections introduced by a new article to the intellectual space .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We validate the role of boundary-spanning in predicting future citations using three metrics of structural variation-namely , modularity change rate , cluster linkage , and Centrality Divergence-along with more commonly studied predictors of citations such as the number of coauthors , the number of cited references , and the number of pages .

label: Research method
text: Main effects of these factors are estimated for five cases using zero-inflated negative binomial regression models of citation counts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Key Research findings/conclusions indicate that ( a ) structural variations measured by cluster linkage are a better predictor of citation counts than are the more commonly studied variables such as the number of references cited , ( b ) the number of coauthors and the number of references are both good predictors of global citation counts to a lesser extent , and ( c ) the Centrality Divergence metric is potentially valuable for detecting boundary-spanning activities at interdisciplinary levels .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The structural variation approach offers a new way to monitor and discern the potential of newly published papers in context .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The boundary-spanning mechanism offers a conceptually simplified and unifying explanation of the roles played by commonly studied extrinsic properties of a publication in the study of citation behavior .

label: Research questions
text: To apply search tactics in the information retrieval ( IR ) processes , users make decisions and take actions in the search process , while IR systems assist them by providing different system features .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: After analyzing 61 participants ' information searching diaries and questionnaires we identified various types of user involvement and system support in applying different types of search tactics .

label: Research method
text: Based on quantitative analysis , search tactics were classified into 3 groups : user-dominated , system-dominated , and balanced tactics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We further explored types of user involvement and types of system support in applying search tactics from the 3 groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions show that users and systems play major roles in applying user-dominated and system-dominated tactics , respectively .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When applying balanced tactics , users and systems must collaborate closely with each other .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose a model that illustrates user involvement and system support as they occur in user-dominated tactics , system-dominated tactics , and balanced tactics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most important , IR system design implications are discussed to facilitate effective and efficient applications of the 3 groups of search tactics .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we introduce a gold-standard dataset of software mentions from the manual annotation of 4,971 academic PDFs in biomedicine and economics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The dataset is intended to be used for automatic extraction of software mentions from PDF format research publications by supervised learning at scale .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We provide a description of the dataset and an extended discussion of its creation process , including improved text conversion of academic PDFs .

label: Research questions
text: Finally , we reflect on our challenges and lessons learned during the dataset creation , in hope of encouraging more discussion about creating datasets for machine learning use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Many approaches operate in two steps .

label: Research method
text: Themes are first identified from the set , and then a summary is formed by extracting salient sentences within the different documents of each of the identified themes .

label: Research questions
text: Among these approaches , latent semantic analysis ( LSA ) based approaches rely on spectral decomposition techniques to identify the themes .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose a major extension of these techniques that relies on the quantum information access ( QIA ) framework .

label: Research method
text: The latter is a framework developed for modeling information access based on the probabilistic formalism of quantum physics .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The QIA framework not only points out the limitations of the current LSA-based approaches , but motivates a new principled criterium to tackle multidocument summarization that addresses these limitations .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: As a byproduct , it also provides a way to enhance the LSA-based approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Extensive experiments on the DUC 2005 , 2006 and 2007 datasets show that the proposed approach consistently improves over both the LSA-based approaches and the systems that competed in the yearly DUC competitions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This demonstrates the potential impact of quantum-inspired approaches to information access in general , and of the QIA framework in particular .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: While this view provides a profound understanding of how people seek , use , and access information , it often overlooks the larger structure of the information landscapes that shape people 's information access .

label: Research questions
text: However , theorizing the information landscape of a local community at the community level is challenging because of the diverse contexts and users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One way to minimize the complexity is to focus on the materiality of information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By highlighting the material aspects of information , it becomes possible to understand the community-level structure of local information .

label: Research questions
text: This paper develops a theory of local information landscapes ( LIL theory ) to conceptualize the material structure of local information .

label: Research questions
text: LIL theory adapts a concept of the virtual as an ontological view of the local information that is embedded in technical infrastructures , spaces , and people .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By complementing existing theories , this paper provides a new perspective on how information deserts manifest as a material pre-condition of information inequality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on these theoretical models , a research agenda is presented for future studies of local communities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Three simple examples are presented , in which the indicators fluctuate strongly and the ranking of scientists in the evaluated group is sometimes completely mixed up by minor changes in the database .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The erratic behavior is traced to the specific way in which weights are attributed to the six percentile rank classes , specifically for the tied papers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For 100 percentile rank classes , the effects will be less serious .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For the six classes , it is demonstrated that a different way of assigning weights avoids these problems , although the nonlinearity of the weights for the different percentile rank classes can still lead to ( much less frequent ) changes in the ranking .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This behavior is not undesired because it can be used to correct for differences in citation behavior in different fields .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Remaining deviations from the theoretical value R ( 6 , k ) ? = ? 1.91 can be avoided by a new scoring rule : the fractional scoring .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previously proposed consistency criteria are amended by another property of strict independence at which a performance indicator should aim .

label: Research questions
text: A plethora of consumer health information products and services exist to inform people with hypertension and to promote self-management among them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Promotion of information sharing by African-American women represents a promising , culturally applicable strategy for consumer health information services focused on hypertension self-management .

label: Research questions
text: Yet how African-American women share hypertension information with others is unclear .

label: Research questions
text: The Research questions of this qualitative , descriptive study was to examine practices of information sharing in African-American women with hypertension .

label: Research method
text: Thirteen women ( mean age=73 , SD=9.87 ) participated in one of 2 focus groups held at an urban community health center .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thematic analysis revealed that the women shared information about how they self-managed their blood pressure i ) with female family members and friends , ii ) about ways in which they adapted self-management strategies to work for them , iii ) mostly in group settings , and iv ) because they wanted to prevent others from suffering and reinforce their own knowledge about hypertension self-management .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: New Research findings/conclusions emerged regarding assessing readiness for information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Study Research findings/conclusions will be used to inform the design of an information-sharing intervention to support self-management of hypertension in African-American women .

label: Research questions
text: Yet , typing even short queries becomes tedious on ever shrinking ( virtual ) keyboards .

label: Research questions
text: Meanwhile , speech processing is maturing rapidly , facilitating everyday language input .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , wearable technology can inform users proactively by listening in on their conversations or processing their social media interactions .

label: Research questions
text: Given these developments , everyday language may soon become the new input of choice .

label: Research method
text: We present an information retrieval ( IR ) algorithm specifically designed to accept everyday language .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It integrates two paradigms of information retrieval , previously studied in isolation ; one directed mainly at the surface structure of language , the other primarily at the underlying meaning .

label: Research method
text: The integration was achieved by a Markov machine that encodes meaning by its transition graph , and surface structure by the language it generates .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A rigorous evaluation of the approach showed , first , that it can compete with the quality of existing language models , second , that it is more effective the more verbose the input , and third , as a consequence , that it is promising for an imminent transition from keyword input , where the onus is on the user to formulate concise queries , to a modality where users can express more freely , more informal , and more natural their need for information in everyday language .

label: Research method
text: To achieve this objective , the citation network of seven selected metrics and their information environment is analyzed .

label: Research questions
text: Citation networks are important in studying knowledge flows ; however , citation network analysis has primarily focused on binary networks in which the individual citation influences of each cited paper in a citing paper are considered identical , even though not all cited papers have a significant influence on the cited publication .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Accordingly , it is necessary to build and analyze a citation network comprising scholarly publications that notably impact one another , thus identifying topic evolution in a more precise manner .

label: Research method
text: To measure the strength of citation influence and identify paper topics , we employ a citation influence topic model primarily based on topical inheritance between cited and citing papers .

label: Research method
text: Using scholarly publications in the field of the protein p53 as a case study , we build a citation network , filter it using citation influence values , and examine the diffusion of topics not only in the field but also in the subfields of p53 .

label: Research questions
text: Similar discussions happen on the interpretation of social scientific research data , for which information triangulation has been proposed as a useful method .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we explore a design theoryconsisting of a kernel theory , meta-requirements , and meta-designsfor software and services that triangulate Internet information .

label: Research method
text: The kernel theory identifies 5 triangulation methods based on Churchman 's inquiring systems theory and related meta-requirements .

label: Research method
text: These meta-requirements are used to search for existing software and services that contain design features for Internet information triangulation tools .

label: Research method
text: We discuss a prototyping study of the use of an information triangulator among 72 college students and how their use contributes to their opinion formation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From these Research findings/conclusions , we conclude that triangulation tools can contribute to opinion formation by information consumers , especially when the tool is not a mere fact checker but includes the search and delivery of alternative views .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we discuss other empirical propositions and design propositions for an agenda for triangulator developers and researchers .

label: Research questions
text: In particular , we propose investment in theory triangulation , that is , tools to automatically detect ethically and theoretically alternative information and views .

label: Research questions
text: However , information differs from physical objects by being intangible and easy-to-copy .

label: Research questions
text: Information as an experience good is inherently challenging to evaluate a priori ; therefore , comparing value before and after different types of experience is likely to inform theory about users ' preferences regarding information .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Prior research mostly refers to consuming information and rarely considers the experience of producing information as a factor affecting information value .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The current research compares the effect of experiencing online information through production and consumption processes on value perception .

label: Research method
text: In a set of 6 experiments with 178 participants , willingness-to-pay by consumers and willingness-to-accept payment by producers are measured before and after consumption and production of information , independently and as repeated measures .

label: Research method
text: In the experiments , we define and implement a framework for an information production process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that the value of information is dynamic .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Value perception increased after experiencing information , especially when people engaged in producing information compared to consuming it .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study offers a window toward the practical design of new digital information products .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Previous works and expert assessment recommend the adoption of an inclusive definition , with the aim of including all relevant uses of waste within this study .

label: Research method
text: An ad-hoc designed capture strategy has been used to retrieve WR-related peer-reviewed journal papers from selected databases , and the information contained in their author keyword field has been thoroughly cleaned .

label: Research method
text: Author keyword co-occurrence data have been used for building a similarity measure between keywords , plus cluster analysis for revealing the main WR research being addressed by the scientific community .

label: Research method
text: Results have been further analyzed using advanced visualization tools to determine which clusters formed strongly-linked research areas that could set the main cognitive divisions of WR science .

label: Research method
text: This process has been repeated with 2002 and 2012 data , and science maps reflecting the main research areas and clusters have been generated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that WR mainly deals with the recovery of basic , widely used raw materials like water and fertile soil .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Energy generation and waste management are other relevant fields that show an interesting evolution , revealing signs of growth in research , together with the emergence of sub-areas reflecting consolidating research specialties .

label: Research method
text: We analyze the authors ' use of graphs in this context in relation to the quality of these journals as measured by their 2-year impact factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We note a substantial variability in the use of graphs in this context : For one journal , 100 % of the papers include graphs , whereas for others only about 50 % of them include graphs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also show that higher impact agricultural journals publish more papers with graphs and that there are more graphs in these papers than in those in journals with lower impact factors ( r = +0.40 ) .

label: Research questions
text: We use rhetorical structure theory ( RST ) as the analytic framework to identify systematic differences between deceptive and truthful stories in terms of their coherence and structure .

label: Research method
text: A sample of 36 elicited personal stories , self-ranked as truthful or deceptive , is manually analyzed by assigning RST discourse relations among each story 's constituent parts .

label: Research method
text: A vector space model ( VSM ) assesses each story 's position in multidimensional RST space with respect to its distance from truthful and deceptive centers as measures of the story 's level of deception and truthfulness .

label: Research method
text: Ten human judges evaluate independently whether each story is deceptive and assign their confidence levels ( 360 evaluations total ) , producing measures of the expected human ability to recognize deception .

label: Research method
text: As a robustness check , a test sample of 18 truthful stories ( with 180 additional evaluations ) is used to determine the reliability of our RST-VSM method in determining deception .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The contribution is in demonstration of the discourse structure analysis as a significant method for automated deception detection and an effective complement to lexicosemantic analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The potential is in developing novel discourse-based tools to alert information users to potential deception in computer-mediated texts .

label: Research questions
text: However , such contests stir up controversy among scholars and practitioners about the role of transparency , or more specifically , the unrestricted access and observability of the applications submitted throughout the contest .

label: Research questions
text: In one view , transparency may reduce performance because it causes excessive replication , whereas another view argues that transparency can encourage novel forms of reuse , namely recombination .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article proposes a new perspective towards transparency as a design choice in open data contest architectures .

label: Research method
text: We introduce a 2-dimensional view towards transparency , defined as observability of information about each submitted ( a ) solution ( how it works ) and its ( b ) performance ( how high it scores ) .

label: Research method
text: We design a sociotechnical contest architecture that jointly affords both transparency dimensions , and evaluate it in the field during a 21-day contest involving 28 participants .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that the joint instantiation of both transparency dimensions increases performance by triggering different kinds of recombination .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions advance literature on sociotechnical architectures for civic design .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , they guide practitioners in implementing open data contests and balancing the tension between individual versus collective benefits .

label: Research method
text: In traditional PRF methods , top-ranked documents are all assumed to be relevant and therefore treated equally in the feedback process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the performance gain brought by each document is different as showed in our preliminary experiments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , it is more reasonable to predict the performance gain brought by each candidate feedback document in the process of PRF .

label: Research method
text: We define the quality level ( QL ) and then use this information to adjust the weights of feedback terms in these documents .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Unlike previous work , we do not make any explicit relevance assumption and we go beyond just selecting good documents for PRF .

label: Research method
text: We propose a quality-based PRF framework , in which two quality-based assumptions are introduced .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Particularly , two different strategies , relevance-based QL ( RelPRF ) and improvement-based QL ( ImpPRF ) are presented to estimate the QL of each feedback document .

label: Research method
text: Based on this , we select a set of heterogeneous document-level features and apply a learning approach to evaluate the QL of each feedback document .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Extensive experiments on standard TREC ( Text REtrieval Conference ) test collections show that our proposed model performs robustly and outperforms strong baselines significantly .

label: Research method
text: We propose a new architecture based on introducing an interlingual loss as an additional training objective .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By adding and forcing this interlingual loss , we can train multiple encoders and decoders for each language , sharing among them a common intermediate representation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Translation results on the low-resource tasks ( Turkish-English and Kazakh-English tasks ) show a BLEU improvement of up to 2.8 points .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , results on a larger dataset ( Russian-English and Kazakh-English ) show BLEU losses of a similar amount .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While our system provides improvements only for the low-resource tasks in terms of translation quality , our system is capable of quickly deploying new language pairs without the need to retrain the rest of the system , which may be a game changer in some situations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , what is most relevant regarding our architecture is that it is capable of : reducing the number of production systems , with respect to the number of languages , from quadratic to linear ; incrementally adding a new language to the system without retraining the languages already there ; and allowing for translations from the new language to all the others present in the system .

label: Research method
text: The research questions addressed are the following : ( a ) How do answer quality and answer speed vary across question types ?

label: Research questions
text: ( b ) How do the relationships between answer quality and answer speed vary across question types ?

label: Research questions
text: ( c ) How do the best quality answers and the fastest answers differ in terms of answer quality and answer speed across question types ?

label: Research method
text: ( d ) How do trends in answer quality vary over time across question types ?

label: Research method
text: From the posting of 3,000 questions in six CQAs , 5,356 answers were harvested and analyzed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There was a significant difference in answer quality and answer speed across question types , and there were generally no significant relationships between answer quality and answer speed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The best quality answers had better overall answer quality than the fastest answers but generally took longer to arrive .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , although the trend in answer quality had been mostly random across all question types , the quality of answers appeared to improve gradually when given time .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By highlighting the subtle nuances in answer quality and answer speed across question types , this study is an attempt to explore a territory of CQA research that has hitherto been relatively uncharted .

label: Research method
text: Seven reference librarians tested a set of protocols to determine whether it was possible to use the types and foci of the questions extracted from customer requests submitted to the National Library of Medicine to find authoritative answers to these questions .

label: Research method
text: Librarians tested the protocols manually to determine if the process was sufficiently robust and accurate to later automate .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results indicated that the extracted terms provide enough information to find authoritative answers for about 60 % of questions and that certain question types are more likely to result in authoritative answers than others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The question corpus and analysis performed for this project will inform automatic question answering systems , and could lead to suggestions for new content to include in MedlinePlus .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This approach can serve as an example to researchers interested in methods of evaluating question answering tools and the contents of online databases .

label: Research questions
text: These systems allow users to associate geolocation information with their images , which is essential for many interesting applications .

label: Research questions
text: However , only a small fraction of social images have geolocation information .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Thus , an automated tool for suggesting geolocation is essential to help users geotag their images .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we use a large data set consisting of 221 million Flickr images uploaded by 2.2 million users .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: For the first time , we analyze user uploading patterns , user geotagging behaviors , and the relationship between the taken-time gap and the geographical distance between two images from the same user .

label: Research method
text: Based on the Research findings/conclusions , we represent a user profile by historical tags for the user and build a multinomial model on the user profile for geotagging .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We further propose a unified framework to suggest geolocations for images , which combines the information from both image tags and the user profile .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results show that for images uploaded by users who have never done geotagging , our method outperforms the state-of-the-art method by 10.6 to 34.2 % , depending on the granularity of the prediction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For images from users who have done geotagging , a simple method is able to achieve very high accuracy .

label: Research method
text: We employ a manual human-coding approach to classify book reviews in the field of history based on reviewers ' assessments of a book author 's scholarly credibility ( SC ) and writing style ( WS ) .

label: Research method
text: In total , 100 book reviews were selected from the American Historical Review and coded for their positive/negative valence on these two dimensions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Most were coded as positive ( 68 % for SC and 47 % for WS ) , and there was also a small positive correlation between SC and WS ( r=0.2 ) .

label: Research method
text: We then constructed a classifier , combining both manual design and machine learning , to categorize sentiment-based sentences in history book reviews .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The machine classifier produced a matched accuracy ( matched to the human coding ) of approximately 75 % for SC and 64 % for WS .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: WS was found to be more difficult to classify by machine than SC because of the reviewers ' use of more subtle language .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: With further training data , a machine-learning approach could be useful for automatically classifying a large number of history book reviews at once .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Weighted megacitations can be especially valuable if they are used in conjunction with regular book/journal citations , and libcitations ( i.e. , library holding counts ) for a comprehensive assessment of a book/monograph 's scholarly impact .

label: Research method
text: This article explores the new search option by scoring 50 top economics and finance journals and comparing them with the results obtained using the original Google Scholar-based search option .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The new database delivers significantly smaller scores for all metrics , but the rank correlations across the two databases for the h-index , g-index , AWCR , and e-index are significantly correlated , especially when the time frame is restricted to more recent years .

label: Research method
text: Comparisons are also made to the Article Influence score from eigenfactor.org and to the RePEc h-index , both of which adjust for journal-level self-citations .

label: Research method
text: We present an ethnographic study involving 156 hours of observation and 28 patient interviews in outpatient hemodialysis facilities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using an extended Semiotic Framework for Information Systems Research , the Research findings/conclusions show that objects , spaces , and bodies were integral to 6 sociomaterial layers of facility information environments : the physical , empiric , syntactic , semantic , pragmatic , and social world .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Objects of importance in the information environments included dialysis machines , instruments , records , paper documents , televisions , furniture , thermostats , lighting , and personal possessions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Spatial features , including compartmentalization , displays , distance , proximity , and spatially-grounded routines , also constituted information environments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The information environments were also shaped by patient immobility , bodily discomforts , and orientation to bodily states .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Each sociomaterial layer introduced enablers and constraints to information access , flow , and acceptance ; these combined to construct patients primarily as passive recipients of information rather than active seekers and producers of information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A sociomaterial perspective and related focus on objects , spaces , and bodies offers a lens for professional information practice .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We contribute information environment design guidance to facilitate such practice and stress that the value of certain sources and types of information can be materially encoded in an environment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By conducting a thematic analysis of the 25 UN commissioned reports and policy documents , this research identifies 14 broad cultural heritage information themes that need to be practiced in order to achieve cultural sustainability , of which information platforms , information sharing , information broadcast , information quality , information usage training , information access , information collection , and contribution appear to be the significant themes .

label: Research method
text: An investigation of education on cultural heritage informatics and digital humanities at iSchools ( ) using a gap analysis framework demonstrates the core information science skills required for cultural heritage education .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The research demonstrates that : ( i ) a thematic analysis of cultural heritage policy documents can be used to explore the key themes for cultural informatics education and research that can lead to sustainable development ; and ( ii ) cultural heritage information education should cover a series of skills that can be categorized in five key areas , viz. , information , technology , leadership , application , and people and user skills .

label: Research method
text: On the basis of in-depth interviews with and on-site observations of 24 scientists and a follow-up focus group interview in the field of bioscience/nanoscience and technology in Korea , we examined scientific collaboration using the framework of the scientific research life cycle .

label: Research questions
text: We attempt to explain the major motivations , characteristics of communication and information sharing , and barriers associated with scientists ' research collaboration practices throughout the research life cycle .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions identify several notable phenomena including motivating factors , the timing of collaboration formation , partner selection , communication methods , information-sharing practices , and barriers at each phase of the life cycle .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that specific motivations were related to specific phases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The formation of collaboration was observed throughout the entire process , not only in the beginning phase of the cycle .

label: Research questions
text: For communication and information-sharing practices , scientists continue to favor traditional means of communication for security reasons .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Barriers to collaboration throughout the phases included different priorities , competitive tensions , and a hierarchical culture among collaborators , whereas credit sharing was a barrier in the research product phase .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper we propose several metrics to describe different facets of open access and open research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We discuss measures to represent the public availability of articles along with their archival location , licenses , access costs , and supporting information .

label: Research method
text: Calculations illustrating these new metrics are presented using the authors ' publications .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that explicit measurement of openness is necessary for a holistic description of research outputs .

label: Research questions
text: Common ways of presenting such information include lists , maps , and augmented reality ( AR ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Each of these interface types has its strengths and weaknesses , but few empirical evaluations have been conducted to compare them in terms of performance and perceptions of usability .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , we investigate these issues using three interface types for searching and browsing location-based information across two task types : open and closed ended .

label: Research method
text: The experimental study involved 180 participants who were issued an Android mobile phone preloaded with a specific interface and asked to perform a set of open- and closed-ended tasks using both searching and browsing approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that the list interface performed best across all tasks in terms of completion times , whereas the AR interface ranked second and the map interface performed worst .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Participants rated the list as best across most usability constructs but the map was rated better than the AR interface , even though the latter performed better .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Implications of the work are discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , for its proper functioning , it is also preferable that a team be socially cohesive .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A team recommendation system , which facilitates the search for potential team members , can be of great help both for ( a ) individuals who need to seek out collaborators and for ( b ) managers who need to build a team for some specific tasks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Such a decision support system that readily helps summarize multiple metrics indicating a team ( and its members ) quality , and possibly rank the teams in a personalized manner according to the end users ' preferences , thus serves as a tool to cope with what would otherwise be an information avalanche .

label: Research method
text: In this work , we present Social Web Application for Team Recommendation , a general-Research questions framework to compose various information retrieval and social graph mining and visualization subsystems together to build a composite team recommendation system , and instantiate it for a case study of academic teams .

label: Research questions
text: Various methods have been proposed with a focus on comparing unstructured text documents .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Several of these have been enhanced with ontology ; however , they have not been applied to ontology instances .

label: Research questions
text: With the growth in ontology instance data published online through , for example , Linked Open Data , there is an increasing need to apply semantic similarity to ontology instances .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing on ontology-supported polarity mining ( OSPM ) , we propose an algorithm that enhances the computation of semantic similarity with polarity mining techniques .

label: Research method
text: The algorithm is evaluated with online customer review data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results show that the proposed algorithm outperforms the baseline algorithm in multiple settings .

label: Research questions
text: Consumer health information behavior ( CHIB ) , which encompasses people 's healthrelated information needs as well as the ways in which they interact ( or do not interact ) with health-related information , plays an important role in people 's ability to prevent , cope with , and successfully manage a serious chronic disease across time .

label: Research method
text: In this mixed-method longitudinal study , the CHIB of 34 people with type 2 diabetes is explored with the goal of identifying the factors that motivate , demotivate , or impede their diabetes-related information seeking and use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions reveal that while these processes can be motivated by many different factors and can lead to important benefits , there are significant barriers ( such as incognizance , defined herein as having an information need that one is not aware of ) that may demotivate or impede information seeking and use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The implications of these Research findings/conclusions are discussed , focusing on how we might work toward preventing , identifying , and addressing incognizance among this population , ensuring they have the information they need when it can be of the most use to them .

label: Research method
text: A case study of the subject eugenics in the Dewey Decimal Classification is presented to illustrate this phenomenon .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Eugenics is strange because of the kinds of changes it undergoes .

label: Research method
text: The article closes with a discussion of subject ontogeny as the name for this phenomenon and describes implications for information searching and browsing .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this paper , we provide a methodological resource for social scientists looking to expand their toolkit using unstructured web-based text , and in particular , with the Wayback Machine , to access historical website data .

label: Research method
text: After providing a literature review of existing research that uses the Wayback Machine , we put forward a step-by-step description of how the analyst can design a research project using archived websites .

label: Research method
text: We draw on the example of a project that analyzes indicators of innovation activities and strategies in 300 U.S. small- and medium-sized enterprises in green goods industries .

label: Research method
text: We present six steps to access historical Wayback website data : ( a ) sampling , ( b ) organizing and defining the boundaries of the web crawl , ( c ) crawling , ( d ) website variable operationalization , ( e ) integration with other data sources , and ( f ) analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although our examples draw on specific types of firms in green goods industries , the method can be generalized to other areas of research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In discussing the limitations and benefits of using the Wayback Machine , we note that both machine and human effort are essential to developing a high-quality data set from archived web information .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article presents a novel , empirically-based model of fiction reading in a public library context , taking into account the characteristics differentiating the readers of individual fiction genres .

label: Research method
text: It begins with a literature review of factors motivating a reading choice or habit , and of the effects of reading different fiction genres , before introducing three previous studies by the first author into readers ' attitudes towards , and engagement with , fiction and selected fiction genres .

label: Research method
text: The methodologies are then summarized both for the three previous studies and the present study .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The authors present a combined analysis that integrates the Research findings/conclusions of the previous studies in order to generate a new , evidence-based model for the reading of fiction genres .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Incorporating both demographic and motivational aspects , this model illustrates how the broad themes of the fiction reader profile interrelate , giving them a new causal ordering .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , there is a discussion of the implications of this work for library and information science research and practitioner communities .

label: Research method
text: Rasch analysis was used to examine the psychometric properties of the survey .

label: Research method
text: Structural equation modeling was subsequently used to examine the validity of hypothesized relationships among the constructs measured by the survey .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , Research findings/conclusions supported validity of the existing measure for use among researchers across academic disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Recommendations for further refinement of the survey include the addition of new items to improve reliability of measurement .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additionally , implications for organizational practice are discussed , including the importance of fostering individual researchers ' perceived usefulness of secondary data , as well as providing access to data repositories and organizational resources for data reuse .

label: Research method
text: Their databases use Web of Science ( WoS ) citation data , which they match according to their own matching algorithmsin the case of CWTS for standard usage in their studies and in the case of iFQ on an experimental basis .

label: Research questions
text: Because the problem of nonmatched citations in the WoS persists due to inaccuracies in the references or inaccuracies introduced in the data extraction process , it is important to ascertain how well these inaccuracies are rectified in these citation matching algorithms .

label: Research method
text: This article evaluates the algorithms of CWTS and iFQ in comparison to the WoS in a quantitative and a qualitative analysis .

label: Research method
text: The analysis builds upon the method and the manually verified corpus of a previous study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The algorithm of CWTS performs best , closely followed by that of iFQ .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The WoS algorithm still performs quite well ( F-1 score : 96.41 % ) , but shows deficits in matching references containing inaccuracies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An additional problem is posed by incorrectly provided cited reference information in source articles by the WoS .

label: Research questions
text: These scientific communities are , however , a challenging unit of analysis to capture and compare because they overlap , have fuzzy boundaries , and evolve over time .

label: Research method
text: We describe a network analytic approach that reveals the complexities of these communities through the examination of their publication networks in combination with insights from ethnographic field studies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We suggest that the structures revealed indicate overlapping subcommunities within a research specialty , and we provide evidence that they differ in disciplinary orientation and research practices .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By mapping the community structures of scientific fields we increase confidence about the domain of validity of ethnographic observations as well as of collaborative patterns extracted from publication networks thereby enabling the systematic study of field differences .

label: Research method
text: The network analytic methods presented include methods to optimize the delineation of a bibliographic data set to adequately represent a research specialty and methods to extract community structures from this data .

label: Research method
text: We demonstrate the application of these methods in a case study of two research specialties in the physical and chemical sciences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Searching GB for citations produces approximate matches , however , and so its raw results need time-consuming human filtering .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In response , this article introduces a method to automatically remove false and irrelevant matches from GB citation searches in addition to introducing refinements to a previous GB manual citation extraction method .

label: Research method
text: The method was evaluated by manual checking of sampled GB results and comparing citations to about 14,500 monographs in the Thomson Reuters Book Citation Index ( BKCI ) against automatically extracted citations from GB across 24 subject areas .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: GB citations were 103 % to 137 % as numerous as BKCI citations in the humanities , except for tourism ( 72 % ) and linguistics ( 91 % ) , 46 % to 85 % in social sciences , but only 8 % to 53 % in the sciences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In all cases , however , GB had substantially more citing books than did BKCI , with BKCI 's results coming predominantly from journal articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moderate correlations between the GB and BKCI citation counts in social sciences and humanities , with most BKCI results coming from journal articles rather than books , suggests that they could measure the different aspects of impact , however .

label: Research questions
text: Despite such a crucial role of forenames , their effect on the performance of heuristic ( string matching ) and algorithmic disambiguation is not well understood .

label: Research method
text: This study assesses the contributions of forenames in author name disambiguation using multiple labeled data sets under varying ratios and lengths of full forenames , reflecting real-world scenarios in which an author is represented by forename variants ( synonym ) and some authors share the same forenames ( homonym ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that increasing the ratios of full forenames substantially improves both heuristic and machine-learning-based disambiguation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Performance gains by algorithmic disambiguation are pronounced when many forenames are initialized or homonyms are prevalent .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As the ratios of full forenames increase , however , they become marginal compared to those by string matching .

label: Research findings/conclusions
