text: Using a small portion of forename strings does not reduce much the performances of both heuristic and algorithmic disambiguation methods compared to using full-length strings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions provide practical suggestions , such as restoring initialized forenames into a full-string format via record linkage for improved disambiguation performances .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: At a time when scientific data were becoming exceedingly hard to manage , Brownson was instrumental in coordinating national and international efforts for more efficient , cost-effective , and universal information exchange .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Her most significant contributions to documentation/information science were during her years at the National Science Foundation 's Office of Scientific Information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From 1951 to 1966 , Brownson played a key role in identifying and subsequently distributing government funds toward projects that sought to resolve information-handling problems of the time : information access , preservation , storage , classification , and retrieval .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: She is credited for communicating the need for information systems and indexing mechanisms to have stricter criteria , standards , and evaluation methods ; laying the foundation for present-day NSF-funded computational linguistics projects ; and founding several pertinent documentation/information science publications including the Annual Review of Information Science and Technology .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study focuses on a special SNS discontinuance phenomenonuser exodus .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Compared to individual discontinuance behavior studied in prior research , the SNS user exodus possesses its own characteristics : a huge magnitude of users abandon a given SNS product in a very short time .

label: Research questions
text: Given the fatal blow of exodus to SNS providers , this exploratory research seeks to unravel why and how the SNS user exodus occurs .

label: Research method
text: Specifically , we conducted a mixed-method research combining laddering interview and network analysis .

label: Research method
text: Drawing on the means-end chain theory , laddering interviews were first used to collect data from discontinuers of a Chinese SNS , Kaixin001 , which has experienced a severe user dropout .

label: Research method
text: Then we identified various factors triggering user exodus by content analysis .

label: Research method
text: Last , network analysis was employed to establish the connections between various attributes , consequences , and values .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results showed that user exodus in SNS is strongly related to three types of value : functional , affective , and social value .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: More important , we also emphasized the dynamics process of exodus by highlighting the role of lurking .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Possible contributions and implications of our Research findings/conclusions are discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Three periods are distinguished : ( A ) construction of the interdisciplinary space in the 1980s , ( B ) development of an interdisciplinary orientation in the 1990s , and ( C ) reintegration into cognitive psychology in the 2000s .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The fluidity and fuzziness of the interdisciplinary delineations in the different visualizations can be reduced and clarified using factor analysis .

label: Research method
text: We also explore newly available routines ( CorText ) to analyze this development in terms of tubes using an alluvial map and compare the results with an animation ( using Visone ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The historical specificity of this development can be compared with the development of artificial intelligence into an integrated specialty during this same period .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Interdisciplinarity should be defined differently at the level of journals and of specialties .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Neither the cosine nor the Pearson correlation should be used for the normalization of co-occurrence matrices because the similarity is then normalized twice , and therefore overestimated ; the Ochiai coefficient can be used instead .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results are shown using a small matrix ( 5 cases , 4 variables ) for didactic reasons , and also Ahlgren etal .

label: Research method
text: 's ( 2003 ) co-occurrence matrix of 24 authors in library and information sciences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The overestimation is shown numerically and will be illustrated using multidimensional scaling and cluster dendograms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: If the occurrence matrix is not available ( such as in internet research or author cocitation analysis ) using Ochiai for the normalization is preferable to using the cosine .

label: Research questions
text: In order to increase the marketing efficiency and ad effectiveness , there is a strong demand for viewability prediction from both advertisers and publishers .

label: Research questions
text: This paper aims to predict the dwell time for a given user , page , depth triplet based on historic data collected by publishers .

label: Research questions
text: This problem is difficult because of user behavior variability and data sparsity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To solve it , we propose predictive models based on Factorization Machines and Field-aware Factorization Machines in order to overcome the data sparsity issue and provide flexibility to add auxiliary information such as the visible area of a user 's browser .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , we leverage the prior dwell time behavior of the user within the current page view , that is , time series information , to further improve the proposed models .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results using data from a large web publisher demonstrate that the proposed models outperform comparison models .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , the results show that adding time series information further improves the performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In such a patent technology map , almost all pairs of technology classes are connected , whereas most of the connections between them are extremely weak .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This observation suggests the possibility of filtering the patent network map by removing weak links .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , removing links may reduce the explanatory power of the network on inventor or organization diversification .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The network links may explain the patent portfolio diversification paths of inventors and inventing organizations .

label: Research method
text: We measure the diversification explanatory power of the patent network map , and present a method to objectively choose an optimal tradeoff between explanatory power and removing weak links .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We show that this method can remove a degree of arbitrariness compared with previous filtering methods based on arbitrary thresholds , and also identify previous filtering methods that created filters outside the optimal tradeoff .

label: Research questions
text: The filtered map aims to aid in network visualization analyses of the technological diversification of inventors , organizations , and other innovation agents , and potential foresight analysis .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Such applications to a prolific inventor ( Leonard Forbes ) and company ( Google ) are demonstrated .

label: Research questions
text: However , due to the elusive nature of the concept of context , few studies have made it a focus of examination .

label: Research method
text: To fill this gap , we studied the context of consumer health information searching by analyzing questions posted on a social question and answer site : Yahoo !

label: Research method
text: Answers .

label: Research method
text: Based on the analysis , a model of context was developed .

label: Research method
text: The model consists of 5 layers : demographic , cognitive , affective , situational , and social and environmental .

label: Research method
text: The demographic layer contains demographic factors of the person of concern ; the cognitive layer contains factors related to the current search task ( specifically , topics of interest and information goals ) and users ' cognitive ability to articulate their needs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The affective layer contains different affective motivations and intentions behind the search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The situational layer contains users ' perceptions of the current health condition and where the person is in the illness trajectory .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The social and environmental layer contains users ' social roles , social norms , and various information channels .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Several novel system functions , including faceted search and layered presentation of results , are proposed based on the model to help contextualize and improve users ' interactions with health information systems .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: IntegraL provides a lightweight approach to improve and augment search functionality by dynamically generating context-focused anchors for recognized elements of interest generated by library services .

label: Research method
text: This article includes a description of how IntegraL 's design supports users ' information-seeking behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A full user study with both objective and subjective measures of IntegraL and hypothesis testing regarding IntegraL 's effectiveness of the user 's information-seeking experience are described along with data analysis , implications arising from this kind of virtual integration , and possible future directions .

label: Research method
text: Parent-child relationships , related connections among the categories , and related connections among the subcategories in the subject directory were optimized using social network analysis .

label: Research method
text: The optimization results were assessed by both density analysis and edge strength analysis methods .

label: Research method
text: In addition , the results were evaluated by domain experts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From this study , it is recommended that four subcategories be switched from their original four categories into two different categories as a result of the parent-child relationship optimization.It is also recommended that 132 subcategories be moved to 40 subcategories and that eight categories be moved to two categories as a result of the related connection optimization .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions show that optimization boosted the densities of the optimized categories , and the recommended connections of both the related categories and subcategories were stronger than the existing connections of the related categories and subcategories .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper provides visual displays of the optimization analysis as well as suggestions to enhance the subject directory of this portal .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Researchers have identified some important stages in this pattern .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The psychological stages broadly include befriending , information exchange , grooming , and approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Similarities among the posts of a chat play an important role in differentiating as well as in identifying these stages .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this article a novel similarity measure is constructed which gives high Inter-post-similarity among the chat-posts within a particular behavioral stage and low inter-post-similarity across different behavioral stages .

label: Research method
text: A psychological stage corpus-based dictionary is constructed from mining the terms associated with each stage .

label: Research method
text: The dictionary works as a background knowledge-base to support the similarity measure .

label: Research method
text: To find the inter-post similarity a modified sentence similarity measure is used .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proposed measure gives improved recognition of inter-stage and intra-stage similarity among the chat posts compared with other types of similarity measures .

label: Research method
text: The pairwise inter-post similarity is used for clustering chat-posts into the psychological stages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results of experiments demonstrate that the new clustering method gives better results than some current clustering methods .

label: Research questions
text: When functioning well , HIT are a boon to mankind .

label: Research questions
text: However , HIT in the OR also create hazards for patients for a number of interrelated reasons .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We introduce 5 interrelated components of hazard situations for medical teams operating in the OR : complexity , overload/underload , inadequate individual training , inadequate training of medical teams , and overconfidence of surgeons .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These components of hazard situations in the OR may negatively impact patient safety .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We discuss implications , especially in terms of individuals and medical teams in the OR , as well as work substitution as a broader aspect of the potential dark side of health IT .

label: Research method
text: This article uses evidence from the book-based social website Goodreads to provide a large scale analysis of 50 major English book genres based on author genders .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show gender differences in authorship in almost all categories and gender differences the level of interest in , and ratings of , books in a minority of categories .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Perhaps surprisingly in this context , there is not a clear gender-based relationship between the success of an author and their prevalence within a genre .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The unexpected almost universal authorship gender differences should give new impetus to investigations of the importance of gender in fiction and the success of minority genders in some genres should encourage publishers and librarians to take their work seriously , except perhaps for most male-authored chick-lit .

label: Research questions
text: Given that microblogging users communicate with each other to form a social network , we hypothesize that user opinion is influenced by its neighbors in the network .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , we infer user opinion on a topic by combining two factors : the user 's historical opinion about relevant topics and opinion influence from his/her neighbors .

label: Research questions
text: We thus build a topic-level opinion influence model ( TOIM ) by integrating both topic factor and opinion influence factor into a unified probabilistic model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We evaluate our model in one of the largest microblogging sites in China , Tencent Weibo , and the experiments show that TOIM outperforms baseline methods in opinion inference accuracy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , incorporating indirect influence further improves inference recall and f1-measure .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Finally , we demonstrate some useful applications of TOIM in analyzing users ' behaviors in Tencent Weibo .

label: Research method
text: In particular , we consider those users who have both topic and geographical preferences on promotion products as targeted users .

label: Research questions
text: To efficiently solve this problem , one challenge is how to find the targeted users and compute their preferences efficiently for given requests .

label: Research method
text: To address this challenge , we devise a TR-tree index structure , where each tree node stores users ' topic and geographical preferences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By traversing the TR-tree in depth-first order , we can efficiently find the targeted users .

label: Research questions
text: Another challenge of the problem is to devise algorithms for efficient seeds selection .

label: Research method
text: We solve this challenge from two complementary directions .

label: Research method
text: In one direction , we adopt the maximum influence arborescence ( MIA ) model to approximate the influence spread , and propose two efficient approximation algorithms with 1-1/e approximation ratio , which prune some candidate seeds with small influences by precomputing users ' initial influences offline and estimating the upper bound of their marginal influences online .

label: Research method
text: In the other direction , we propose a fast heuristic algorithm to improve efficiency .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments conducted on real-world data sets demonstrate the effectiveness and efficiency of our proposed algorithms .

label: Research questions
text: In particular , digital humanities ( DH ) , the subfield that has emerged as the site of most of this work , has received growing attention in higher education in recent years .

label: Research questions
text: This study seeks to facilitate a better understanding of digital humanities by studying the motivations and practices of digital humanists as information workers in the humanities .

label: Research method
text: To this end , we observe information work through interviews with DH scholars about their work practices and through a survey of DH programs such as graduate degrees , certificates , minors , and training institutes .

label: Research questions
text: In this study we focus on how the goals behind methodology ( a link between theories and method ) surface in everyday DH work practices and in DH curricula in order to investigate if the critiques that have appeared in relation to DH information work are well founded and to suggest alternative narratives about information work in DH that will help advance the impact of the field in the humanities and beyond .

label: Research method
text: Online review data generated by authors who have experienced the submission process in 10 Chinese academic journals were collected .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of Spearman correlation analysis show that Chinese authors ' perceived responsiveness of an editorial office is positively correlated with perceived quality of the journal , and the total review time does not affect perceptions of the quality of a journal and its editorial responsiveness .

label: Research questions
text: Although reusing data might not yet be the norm in every discipline , the benefits of reusing shared data have been asserted by a number of researchers , and data reuse has been a major concern in many disciplines .

label: Research questions
text: Assessing data for trustworthiness becomes important in data reuse with the growth in data creation because of the lack of standards for ensuring data quality and potential harm from using poor-quality data .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research explores many facets of data reusers ' trust in data generated by other researchers focusing on the trust judgment process with influential factors that determine reusers ' trust .

label: Research method
text: The author took an interpretive qualitative approach by using in-depth semistructured interviews as the primary research method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study results suggest different stages of trust development associated with the process of data reuse .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Data reusers ' trust may remain the same throughout their experiences , but it can also be formed , lost , declined , and recovered during their data reuse experiences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These various stages reflect the dynamic nature of trust .

label: Research questions
text: Because of a common focus on communication , these perspectives can be combined as a set of methodologies .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Latour 's sociology of translations specifies a mechanism for generating variation in relations ( associations ) , whereas Luhmann 's systems perspective enables the specification of ( functionally different ) selection environments such as markets , professional organizations , and political control .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Selection environments can be considered as mechanisms of social coordination that can self-organizebeyond the control of human agencyinto regimes in terms of interacting codes of communication .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Unlike relatively globalized regimes , technological trajectories are organized locally in landscapes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A resulting duality of structure ( Giddens , 1979 ) between the historical organization of trajectories and evolutionary self-organization at the regime level can be expected to drive innovation cycles .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Reflexive translations add a third layer of perspectives to ( a ) the relational analysis of observable links that shape trajectories and ( b ) the positional analysis of networks in terms of latent dimensions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These three operations can be studied in a single framework , but using different methodologies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Latour 's first-order associations can then be analytically distinguished from second-order translations in terms of requiring other communicative competencies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The resulting operations remain infrareflexively nested , and can therefore be used for innovative reconstructions of previously constructed boundaries .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These corpora are untapped resources to understand social expressions on diverse subjects .

label: Research questions
text: Microblog analysis aims to unlock the value of such expressions by discovering insights and events of significance hidden among swathes of text .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Besides velocity ; diversity of content , brevity , absence of structure and time-sensitivity are key challenges in microblog analysis .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , we propose an unsupervised incremental machine learning and event detection technique to address these challenges .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The proposed technique separates a microblog discussion into topics to address the key problem of diversity .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It maintains a record of the evolution of each topic over time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Brevity , time-sensitivity and unstructured nature are addressed by these individual topic pathways which contribute to generate a temporal , topic-driven structure of a microblog discussion .

label: Research method
text: The proposed event detection method continuously monitors these topic pathways using multiple domain-independent event indicators for events of significance .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The autonomous nature of topic separation , topic pathway generation , new topic identification and event detection , appropriates the proposed technique for extensive applications in microblog analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We demonstrate these capabilities on tweets containing # microsoft and tweets containing # obama .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Despite vocal concerns , a closer look at the empirical and methodological limitations of research on bias raises questions about the existence and extent of many hypothesized forms of bias .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , the notion of bias is predicated on an implicit ideal that , once articulated , raises questions about the normative implications of research on bias in peer review .

label: Research method
text: This review provides a brief description of the function , history , and scope of peer review ; articulates and critiques the conception of bias unifying research on bias in peer review ; characterizes and examines the empirical , methodological , and normative claims of bias in peer review research ; and assesses possible alternatives to the status quo .

label: Research questions
text: We close by identifying ways to expand conceptions and studies of bias to contend with the complexity of social interactions among actors involved directly and indirectly in peer review .

label: Research method
text: Adopting a mixed-method design by conducting qualitative content analysis and statistical analysis on 1,128 posts collected from ResearchGate Q & A , we examine how scholars exchange information and resources , and how their practices vary across three distinct disciplines : library and information services , history of art , and astrophysics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that the effect of a questioner 's intention ( i.e. , seeking information or discussion ) is greater than disciplinary factors in some circumstances .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Across the three disciplines , responses to questions provide various resources , including experts ' contact details , citations , links to Wikipedia , images , and so on .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We further discuss several implications of the understanding of scholarly information exchange and the design of better academic social networking interfaces , which should stimulate scholarly interactions by minimizing confusion , improving the clarity of questions , and promoting scholarly content management .

label: Research questions
text: With its exponential growth and the public nature and transversality of its contents , more researchers are using Twitter as a source of data for multiple Research questionss .

label: Research questions
text: In this context , the ability to retrieve those messages ( tweets ) related to a certain topic becomes critical .

label: Research questions
text: In this work , we define the topic-related tweet retrieval task and propose a dynamic , graph-based method with which to address it .

label: Research method
text: We have applied our method to capture a data set containing tweets related to the participation of the Spanish team in the Euro 2012 soccer competition , measuring the precision and recall against other simple but commonly used approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results demonstrate the effectiveness of our method , which significantly increases coverage of the chosen topic and is able to capture related but unknown a priori subtopics .

label: Research questions
text: To date , the issue of customer participation in online social shopping communities has become an important but underexplored research area in the academic literature .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we examined how online social interactions affect customer information contribution behavior .

label: Research questions
text: We also explored the moderating role of customer reputation in the relationship between observational learning and reinforcement learning as well as customer information contribution behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Analyses of panel data from 6,121 customers in an online social fashion platform revealed that they are significant factors affecting customer information contribution behavior and that reinforcement learning exhibits a stronger effect than observational learning .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results also showed that customer reputation has a significant negative moderating effect on the relationship between observational learning and customer information contribution behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study not only enriched our theoretical understanding of information contribution behavior but also provided guidelines for online social shopping community administrators to better design their community features .

label: Research method
text: In order to test this hypothesis , a longitudinal analysis of the internal units of the Spanish university system was conducted over the course of 2010 .

label: Research method
text: For the 13,800 URLs identified , page count and visibility were calculated using the Yahoo !

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: API .

label: Research method
text: The internal values obtained were aggregated by university and compared with the values obtained from the analysis of the universities ' general URLs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that , although the correlations between general and internal values are high , internal performance is low in comparison to general performance , and that they give rise to different performance rankings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The conclusion is that the aggregation of unit performance is of limited use due to the low levels of internal development of the websites , and so its use is not recommended for the design of rankings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite this , the internal analysis enabled the detection of , among other things , a low correlation between page count and visibility due to the widespread use of subdirectories and problems accessing certain content .

label: Research method
text: The consensus opinion from aggregation of star ratings is used as a proxy for item quality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Online reviews are noisy and effective aggregation of star ratings to accurately reflect the true quality of products and services is challenging .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The mean-rating aggregation model is widely used and other aggregation models are also proposed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These existing aggregation models rely on a large number of reviews to tolerate noise .

label: Research questions
text: However , many products rarely have reviews .

label: Research method
text: We propose probabilistic aggregation models for review ratings based on the Dirichlet distribution to combat data sparsity in reviews .

label: Research method
text: We further propose to exploit the helpfulness social information and time to filter noisy reviews and effectively aggregate ratings to compute the consensus opinion .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our experiments on an Amazon data set show that our probabilistic aggregation models based on helpfulness achieve better performance than the statistical and heuristic baseline approaches .

text: The participants acknowledged that D-IKC brought about many benefits , including the surfacing of otherwise hidden or inaccessible cultural heritage .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Concerns around digital access , digital competency , and responsiveness to cultural values need to be thoughtfully addressed nevertheless .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Use of D-IKC had impact not only at an individual level but also at a social-community level .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We highlight several traditional cultural values related to D-IKC use that are not embodied in existing value-impact frameworks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This research also found that the intersection and interactions among individual needs , cultural expectations , and norms and affordances around the digital information environments concerned were nuanced and multifaceted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These facets must be incorporated into the stewardship of knowledge collections .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also observed digital knowledge sharing in the wild-knowledge transmission that transpired and in some cases led to creation of knowledge resources that materialized outside the bounds of the originating repositories and institutions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further studies into such self-organized knowledge transmission/sharing phenomena can lead to valuable insights to inform and shape the curation and design of D-IKC .

label: Research findings/conclusions

label: Research method
text: We open the black box of data archives by studying DANS , the Data Archiving and Networked Services institute of The Netherlands , which manages 50+ years of data from the social sciences , humanities , and other domains .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our interviews , weblogs , ethnography , and document analyses reveal that a few large contributors provide a steady flow of content , but most are academic researchers who submit data sets infrequently and often restrict access to their files .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Consumers are a diverse group that overlaps minimally with contributors .

label: Research questions
text: Archivists devote about half their time to aiding contributors with curation processes and half to assisting consumers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Given the diversity and infrequency of usage , human assistance in curation and search remains essential .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: DANS ' knowledge infrastructure encompasses public and private stakeholders who contribute , consume , harvest , and serve their data-many of whom did not exist at the time the DANS collections originated-reinforcing the need for continuous investment in digital data archives as their communities , technologies , and services evolve .

label: Research method
text: Because proverbs can be described and indexed by multiple characteristics and criteria , we built a multidimensional ontology suitable for proverb classification .

label: Research method
text: To evaluate the effectiveness of the constructed ontology for improving search and retrieval of proverbs , a large-scale user experiment was arranged with 70 users who were asked to search a proverb repository using ontology-based and free-text search interfaces .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The comparative analysis of the results shows that the use of this ontology helped to substantially improve the search recall , precision , user satisfaction , and efficiency and to minimize user effort during the search process .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A practical contribution of this work is an automated web-based proverb search and retrieval system which incorporates the proposed ontological scheme and an initial corpus of ontology-based annotated proverbs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is essential to index the images at the right level of description and ensure that the indexed levels match the user 's interest level .

label: Research method
text: This study examines 240 medical-image descriptions produced by three different groups of medical-image users ( novices , intermediates , and experts ) in the area of radiography .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article reports several important Research findings/conclusions : First , the effect of domain knowledge has a significant relationship with the use of semantic image attributes in image-users ' descriptions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that experts employ more high-level image attributes which require high-reasoning or diagnostic knowledge to search for a medical image ( Abstract Objects and Scenes ) than do novices ; novices are more likely to describe some basic objects which do not require much radiological knowledge to search for an image they need ( Generic Objects ) than are experts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Second , all image users in this study prefer to use image attributes of the semantic levels to represent the image that they desired to find , especially using those specific-level and scene-related attributes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Third , image attributes generated by medical-image users can be mapped to all levels of the pyramid model that was developed to structure visual information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Therefore , the pyramid model could be considered a robust instrument for indexing medical imagery .

label: Research method
text: As an example , we apply our methodological approach to the study of the keywords in the Library and Information Sciences ( LIS ) area .

label: Research questions
text: Our objective is to detect the new author keywords that appear in a fixed knowledge area in the period of 1 year in order to quantify the probabilities of survival for 10 years as a function of the impact of the journals where they appeared .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Many of the new keywords appearing in the LIS field are ephemeral .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Actually , more than half are never used again .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In general , the terms most commonly used in the LIS area come from other areas .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The average survival time of these keywords is approximately 3 years , being slightly higher in the case of words that were published in journals classified in the second quartile of the area .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We believe that measuring the appearance and disappearance of terms will allow understanding some relevant aspects of the evolution of a discipline , providing in this way a new bibliometric approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A portfolio analysis may aim to identify the gap between the current position of an organization and a goal that it intends to achieve or identify competencies of multiple institutions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We introduce a new visual analytic method for analyzing , comparing , and contrasting characteristics of publication portfolios .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The new method introduces a novel design of dual-map thematic overlays on global maps of science .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Each publication portfolio can be added as one layer of dual-map overlays over 2 related , but distinct , global maps of science : one for citing journals and the other for cited journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We demonstrate how the new design facilitates a portfolio analysis in terms of patterns emerging from the distributions of citation threads and the dynamics of trajectories as a function of space and time .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We first demonstrate the analysis of portfolios defined on a single source article .

label: Research method
text: Then we contrast publication portfolios of multiple comparable units of interest ; namely , colleges in universities and corporate research organizations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also include examples of overlays of scientific fields .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We expect that our method will provide new insights to portfolio analysis .

label: Research questions
text: In work , work task ( WT ) performance forms the context , which information searching should serve .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Therefore , information retrieval ( IR ) systems development/evaluation should take the WT context into account .

label: Research method
text: The present paper analyzes how WT features : task complexity and task types , affect information searching in authentic work : the types of information needs , search processes , and search media .

label: Research method
text: We collected data on 22 information professionals in authentic work situations in three organization types : city administration , universities , and companies .

label: Research method
text: The data comprise 286 WTs and 420 search tasks ( STs ) .

label: Research method
text: The data include transaction logs , video recordings , daily questionnaires , interviews .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: and observation .

label: Research method
text: The data were analyzed quantitatively .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Even if the participants used a range of search media , most STs were simple throughout the data , and up to 42 % of WTs did not include searching .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: WT 's effects on STs are not straightforward : different WT types react differently to WT complexity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Due to the simplicity of authentic searching , the WT/ST types in interactive IR experiments should be reconsidered .

label: Research questions
text: Traditional citation-based analyses treat all citations equally even though there can be various reasons and different levels of relevancy for one document to reference another .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Taking the relevancy level into consideration is intuitively advantageous because it adopts more accurate information and will thus make the results of a citation-based analysis more trustworthy .

label: Research questions
text: This is nevertheless a challenging task .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We are aware of no citation-based analysis that has taken the relevancy level into consideration .

label: Research questions
text: The difficulty lies in the fact that the existing patent or patent citation database provides no readily available relevancy level information .

label: Research method
text: We overcome this issue by obtaining citation relevancy information from a legal database that has relevancy level ranked by legal experts .

label: Research method
text: This paper selects trademark dilution , a legal concept that has been the subject of many lawsuit cases , as the target for exploration .

label: Research method
text: We apply main path analysis , taking citation relevancy into consideration , and verify the results against a set of test cases that are mentioned in an authoritative trademark book .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions show that relevancy information helps main path analysis uncover legal cases of higher importance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , in terms of the number of significant cases retrieved , relevancy information does not seem to make a noticeable difference .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Sweden can be considered a centralized and hierarchically organized system .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results accord with other statistics , but this triple helix indicator measures synergy more specifically and quantitatively .

text: Our framework stems from matrix factorization , and can explore latent relationships from the aspect of attribute and image simultaneously .
