text: Furthermore , to apply our framework in large-scale visual recognition tasks , we present both offline and online learning implementation of the proposed framework .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Extensive experiments on 3 data sets demonstrate that our framework achieves a sound accuracy of attribute recognition .

label: Research method
text: This article reports on Research findings/conclusions from research following three small teams of information professionals as they implemented emulation practices into their digital preservation programs at a technology museum , a university research library , and a university research archive and technology lab .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results suggest that the distributed teams in this cohort of preservationists have developed different emulation practices for particular kinds of emulation encounters in supporting different types of access .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: I discuss the implications of these Research findings/conclusions for digital preservation research and emulation initiatives providing access to software or software-dependent objects , showing how implications of these Research findings/conclusions have significance for those developing software preservation workflows and building emulation capacities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions suggest that different emulation practices for preservation , research access , and exhibition undertaken in libraries , archives , and museums result in different forms of access to preserved software-accessing information and experiential access .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In examining particular types of access , this research calls into question software emulation as a single , static preservation strategy for information institutions and challenges researchers to examine new forms of access and descriptive representation emerging from these digital preservation strategies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Forcing the system to predict a fixed-length list for each user may result in different confidence levels for the computed recommendations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Reporting the system 's confidence in its predictions ( the recommendation strength ) can provide valuable information to users in making their decisions .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we investigate several different displays of a system 's confidence to users and conclude that some displays are easier to understand and are favored by most users .

label: Research questions
text: We continue to investigate the effect confidence has on users in terms of their perception of the recommendation quality and the user experience with the system .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our studies show that it is not easier for users to identify relevant items when confidence is displayed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Still , users appreciate the displays and trust them when the relevance of items is difficult to establish .

label: Research method
text: For this task , the nearest-neighbor-based scheme works in two phases : first , it finds the most similar neighbors of a new image from the set of labeled images ; then , it propagates the keywords associated with the neighbors to the new image .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this article , we propose a novel approach for image annotation , which simultaneously improves both phases of the nearest-neighbor-based scheme .

label: Research questions
text: In the phase of neighbor search , different from existing work discovering the nearest neighbors with the predicted distance , we introduce a ranking-oriented neighbor search mechanism ( RNSM ) , where the ordering of labeled images is optimized directly without going through the intermediate step of distance prediction .

label: Research questions
text: In the phase of keyword propagation , different from existing work using simple heuristic rules to select the propagated keywords , we present a learning-based keyword propagation strategy ( LKPS ) , where a scoring function is learned to evaluate the relevance of keywords based on their multiple relations with the nearest neighbors .

label: Research method
text: Extensive experiments on the Corel 5K data set and the MIR Flickr data set demonstrate the effectiveness of our approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the process by which the specific field is divided into subfields is problematic , in the sense that citation information among individual patents in different subfields is lost .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: If convergence technologies are common among different subfields , this problem can result in an inappropriate main path being found .

label: Research method
text: To resolve this problem , we propose a new algorithm capable of extracting the main paths for each subfield of a technology by using the International Patent Classification ( IPC ) codes of patents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proposed algorithm is applied to the waste management field to allow core technologies in the subfields of waste disposal , waste treatment , and the reuse of waste materials to be found .

label: Research method
text: Finally , a sensitivity analysis is performed by considering the standard of the component ratio along a specific path to demonstrate the robustness of the proposed algorithm in the waste management field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Given the importance of the applications , bibliometricians are obligated to carry out empirical testing of the robustness of the indicators , in simulations of real contexts .

label: Research method
text: In this work , we compare the results of national-scale research assessments at the individual level , based on the following three different indexes : the h-index , the g-index , and fractional scientific strength ( FSS ) , an indicator previously proposed by the authors .

label: Research method
text: For each index , we construct and compare rankings lists of all Italian academic researchers working in the hard sciences during the period 2001-2005 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis quantifies the shifts in ranks that occur when researchers ' productivity rankings by simple indicators such as the h- or g-indexes are compared with those by more accurate FSS .

label: Research questions
text: Unfortunately , less-than-satisfying effectiveness in state-of-the-art information-retrieval techniques is well known , even for some of the best search engines such as Google .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this study , the authors resolve this retrieval ineffectiveness problem by developing a new framework for predicting query performance , which is the first step toward better retrieval effectiveness .

label: Research questions
text: Specifically , they examine the relationship between query performance and query context .

label: Research method
text: A query context consists of the query itself , the document collection , and the interaction between the two .

label: Research method
text: The authors first analyze the characteristics of query context and develop various features for predicting query performance .

label: Research method
text: Then , they propose a context-sensitive model for predicting query performance based on the characteristics of the query and the document collection .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Finally , they validate this model with respect to five real-world collections of documents and demonstrate its utility in routing queries to the correct repository with high accuracy .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we present a review of different author credit-assignment schemas , which are designed mainly based on author position and the total number of coauthors on the publication .

label: Research method
text: We implemented , tested , and classified 15 author credit-assignment schemas into 3 types : linear , curve , and other assignment schemas .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further investigation and analysis revealed that most of the methods provide reasonable credit-assignment results , even though the credit-assignment distribution approaches are quite different among different types .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The evaluation of each schema based on PubMed articles published in 2013 shows that there exist positive correlations among different schemas and that the similarity of credit-assignment distributions can be derived from the similar design principles that stress the number of coauthors or the author position , or consider both .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We provide a summary about the features of each credit-assignment schema to facilitate the selection of the appropriate one , depending on the different conditions required to meet diverse needs .

label: Research method
text: This article revisits the causal relationship between research articles published and economic growth in Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development ( OECD ) countries for the period 1981-2011 , using bootstrap panel causality analysis , which accounts for cross-section dependency and heterogeneity across countries .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The article , by the use of the specific method and the choice of the country group , makes a contribution to the existing literature .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our empirical results support unidirectional causality running from research output ( in terms of total number of articles published ) to economic growth for the US , Finland , Hungary , and Mexico ; the opposite causality from economic growth to research articles published for Canada , France , Italy , New Zealand , the UK , Austria , Israel , and Poland ; and no causality for the rest of the countries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions provide important policy implications for research policies and strategies for OECD countries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , we document that the growing number of physics articles in recent years is attributed to existing journals publishing more and more articles rather than more new journals coming into being as it happens in computer science .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Second , even though the references from the more recent articles generally cover a longer time span , the newer articles are cited more frequently than the older ones if the uneven article growth is not corrected for .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , despite this change in the distribution of citations , the citation behavior of scientists does not seem to have changed .

label: Research method
text: Their analysis considers the ways in which each paradigm defines the concepts of community , information , and technology .

label: Research questions
text: It also explores the insights offered by each paradigm regarding relationships between community and both information and technology .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Accordingly , the authors highlight the ways in which existing information behavior and informatics scholarship draws from similar conceptual roots .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Key insights drawn from this research , as well as remaining gaps and research questions , are examined .

label: Research questions
text: Additionally , they consider the limitations of each approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The authors conclude by arguing for the value of a vigorous research program regarding information behavior and technology use in communities , particularly that which takes the community as the central unit of analysis .

label: Research questions
text: They consider key questions that could drive such a research program , as well as potentially fruitful conceptual and methodological approaches for this endeavor .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study proposes that the social effect of an outstanding scholar , which is derived from the halo effect and the Matthew effect , is favorable for the expansion of the scholar 's personal research network and will improve that scholar 's future research accomplishments .

label: Research method
text: Data for a total of 101 outstanding information systems scholars and 36 ordinary scholars were collected .

label: Research method
text: The definition of an outstanding scholar is based on the quality and quantity of their publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that the social effect of the outstanding scholars is beneficial for the development of a research network , including 3 types of network structures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , being highly connected with colleagues leads to higher research accomplishments in terms of quantity , while being connected with colleagues from different sub-fields leads to higher research accomplishments in terms of novelty .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additionally , this study found that the social effect of outstanding scholars is a double-edged sword , with both positive and negative impacts on research accomplishments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions contribute several theoretical and practical implications for future research .

label: Research questions
text: The structure of these ontologies is typically not flat because there are hierarchical and nonhierarchical relationships among topics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As a consequence , websites classified under a certain topic may be relevant to other topics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although some of these relevance relations are explicit , most of them must be discovered by an analysis of the structure of the ontologies .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article proposes a family of models of relevance propagation in topic ontologies .

label: Research method
text: An efficient computational framework is described and used to compute nine different models for a portion of the Open Directory Project graph consisting of more than half a million nodes and approximately 1.5 million edges of different types .

label: Research method
text: After performing a quantitative analysis , a user study was carried out to compare the most promising models .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It was found that some general difficulties rule out the possibility of defining flawless models of relevance propagation that only take into account structural aspects of an ontology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , there is a clear indication that including transitive relations induced by the nonhierarchical components of the ontology results in relevance propagation models that are superior to more basic approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: At the same time , the literature demonstrates a common understanding that paradigmatic relations are the kinds of semantic relations used in thesauri and other knowledge organization systems ( including equivalence relations , hierarchical relations , and associative relations ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This understanding is problematic and harmful because it directs attention away from the empirical and contextual basis for knowledge-organizing systems .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Whether A is a kind of X is certainly not context-free and definitional in empirical sciences or in much everyday information .

label: Research questions
text: Semantic relations are theory-dependent and , in biology , for example , a scientific revolution has taken place in which many relations have changed following the new taxonomic paradigm named cladism .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This biological example is not an exception , but the norm .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Semantic relations including paradigmatic relations are not a priori but are dependent on subject knowledge , scientific Research findings/conclusions , and paradigms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As long as information scientists and knowledge organizers isolate themselves from subject knowledge , knowledge organization can not possibly progress .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Research has shown that search engine users seem to trust the search engines ' ranking uncritically and mostly select top-ranked results .

label: Research questions
text: This study further examines search engine users ' selection behavior .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing from the credibility and information research literature , we test whether the presence or absence of certain credibility cues influences the selection probability of search engine results .

label: Research method
text: In an observational study , participants ( N=247 ) completed two information research tasks on preset search engine results pages , on which three credibility cues ( source reputation , message neutrality , and social recommendations ) as well as the search result ranking were systematically varied .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of our study confirm the significance of the ranking .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Of the three credibility cues , only reputation had an additional effect on selection probabilities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Personal characteristics ( prior knowledge about the researched issues , search engine usage patterns , etc . )

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: did not influence the preference for search results linked with certain credibility cues .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions are discussed in light of situational and contextual characteristics ( e.g. , involvement , low-cost scenarios ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Its promises of free , universal , and easy access to scientific literature coupled with the perception that it covers the social sciences and the humanities better than other traditional multidisciplinary databases have contributed to the quick expansion of Google Scholar Citations and Google Scholar Metrics : 2 new bibliometric products that offer citation data at the individual level and at journal level .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we show the results of an experiment undertaken to analyze Google Scholar 's capacity to detect citation-counting manipulation .

label: Research method
text: For this , we uploaded 6 documents to an institutional web domain that were authored by a fictitious researcher and referenced all the publications of the members of the EC3 research group at the University of Granada .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The detection by Google Scholar of these papers caused an outburst in the number of citations included in the Google Scholar Citations profiles of the authors .

label: Research questions
text: We discuss the effects of such an outburst and how it could affect the future development of such products , at both the individual level and the journal level , especially if Google Scholar persists with its lack of transparency .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , motivated by a psychological theory of word meaning , we propose a graph-based approach to constructing a cross-language association dictionary ( CLAD ) from Wikipedia , which can be used in a variety of cross-language accessing and processing applications .

label: Research questions
text: In order to evaluate the quality of the mined CLAD , and to demonstrate how the mined CLAD can be used in practice , we explore two different applications of the mined CLAD to cross-language information retrieval ( CLIR ) .

label: Research method
text: First , we use the mined CLAD to conduct cross-language query expansion ; and , second , we use it to filter out translation candidates with low translation probabilities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results on a variety of standard CLIR test collections show that the CLIR retrieval performance can be substantially improved with the above two applications of CLAD , which indicates that the mined CLAD is of sound quality .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of this substudy was to examine the relationships between measures of self-reported health information behavior and neural measures of health information processing in a sample of 19 prehypertensive African Americans ( mean age = 52.5 , 52.6 % women ) .

label: Research method
text: We measured ( a ) health information seeking , sharing , and use ( surveys ) and ( b ) neural activity using functional magnetic resonance imaging ( fMRI ) to assess response to health information videos .

label: Research method
text: We hypothesized that differential activation ( comparison of analytic vs. empathic brain activity when watching a specific type of video ) would indicate better function in three , distinct cognitive domains : ( a ) Analytic Network , ( b ) Default Mode Network ( DMN ) , and ( c ) ventromedial prefrontal cortex ( vmPFC ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Scores on the information sharing measure ( but not seeking or use ) were positively associated with differential activation in the vmPFC ( rs = .53 , p = .02 ) and the DMN ( rs = .43 , p = .06 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions correspond with previous work indicating that activation of the DMN and vmPFC is associated with sharing information to persuade others and with behavior change .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although health information is commonly conveyed as detached and analytic in nature , our Research findings/conclusions suggest that neural processing of socially and emotionally salient health information is more closely associated with health information sharing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although they are an objective resource for such evaluation , they also present drawbacks : ( a ) the uncertainty about the definite position of a target journal in the corresponding annual ranking when selecting a journal , and ( b ) in spite of the nonsignificant difference in score ( for instance , impact factor ) between consecutive journals in the ranking , the journals are strictly ranked and eventually placed in different terciles/quartiles , which may have a significant influence in the subsequent evaluation .

label: Research questions
text: In this article we present several proposals to obtain an aggregated consensus ranking as an alternative/complementary tool to standardize annual rankings .

label: Research method
text: To illustrate the proposed methodology we use as a case study the Journal Citation Reports , and in particular the category of Computer Science : Artificial Intelligence ( CS : AI ) .

label: Research method
text: In the context of the consensus rankings obtained by the different methods , we discuss the convenience of using one or the other procedure according to the corresponding framework .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , our proposals allow us to obtain consensus rankings that avoid crisp frontiers between similarly ranked journals and consider the longitudinal/temporal evolution of the journals .

label: Research questions
text: Because Wikipedia is a regular topic of JASIST publications ( Lim , 2009 ; Meseguer-Artola , Aibar , Llados , Minguillon , & Lerga , ; Mesgari , Okoli , Mehdi , Nielsen , & Lanamaki , ; Okoli , Mehdi , Mesgari , Nielsen , & Lanamaki , ) , we hope to start a useful discussion with the right audience .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , deep learning models are more demanding for training data .

label: Research questions
text: Data augmentation techniques are widely used to generate new instances based on modifications to existing data or relying on external knowledge bases to address annotated data scarcity , which hinders the full potential of machine learning techniques .

label: Research questions
text: This paper presents our work using part-of-speech ( POS ) focused lexical substitution for data augmentation ( PLSDA ) to enhance the performance of machine learning algorithms in sentiment analysis .

label: Research method
text: We exploit POS information to identify words to be replaced and investigate different augmentation strategies to find semantically related substitutions when generating new instances .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The choice of POS tags as well as a variety of strategies such as semantic-based substitution methods and sampling methods are discussed in detail .

label: Research method
text: Performance evaluation focuses on the comparison between PLSDA and two previous lexical substitution-based data augmentation methods , one of which is thesaurus-based , and the other is lexicon manipulation based .

label: Research method
text: Our approach is tested on five English sentiment analysis benchmarks : SST-2 , MR , IMDB , Twitter , and AirRecord .

label: Research method
text: Hyperparameters such as the candidate similarity threshold and number of newly generated instances are optimized .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that six classifiers ( SVM , LSTM , BiLSTM-AT , bidirectional encoder representations from transformers [ BERT ] , XLNet , and RoBERTa ) trained with PLSDA achieve accuracy improvement of more than 0.6 % comparing to two previous lexical substitution methods averaged on five benchmarks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Introducing POS constraint and well-designed augmentation strategies can improve the reliability of lexical data augmentation methods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Consequently , PLSDA significantly improves the performance of sentiment analysis algorithms .

label: Research questions
text: It has been suggested that our reliance on online technologies such as search engines and social media may limit exposure to diverse points of view and make us vulnerable to manipulation by disinformation .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we mine a massive data set of web traffic to quantify two kinds of bias : ( i ) homogeneity bias , which is the tendency to consume content from a narrow set of information sources , and ( ii ) popularity bias , which is the selective exposure to content from top sites .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis reveals different bias levels across several widely used web platforms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Search exposes users to a diverse set of sources , while social media traffic tends to exhibit high popularity and homogeneity bias .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When we focus our analysis on traffic to news sites , we find higher levels of popularity bias , with smaller differences across applications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , our results quantify the extent to which our choices of online systems confine us inside social bubbles .

label: Research questions
text: The objective was to ascertain countries ' capacity to establish intra- and extraregional scientific collaboration .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that increased output and citations in medical research have heightened the region 's presence and participation in the international scientific arena .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions may be partly influenced by the inclusion of new journals in the database and regional initiatives that may have enhanced collaboration and knowledge transfer in science .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The overall rise in partnering rates is slightly greater intra- than extraregionally .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The possible effect of geographic , idiomatic , and cultural proximity is likewise identified .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The scientific dependence of small or developing countries would explain their high collaboration rates and impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The evidence shows that the most productive countries draw from knowledge generated domestically or by their neighbors , which would explain why impact is so highly concentrated in the regions with the greatest output .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The need to incentivize intraregional relationships must be stressed , although international initiatives should also be supported .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Extracting bacterial biotope entities from scientific publications is important to large scale study of the relationships between bacteria and their living environments .

label: Research method
text: To facilitate the further development of robust habitat text mining systems for biodiversity , following the BioNLP task framework , three sequence labeling techniques , CRFs ( Conditional Random Fields ) , MEMM ( Maximum Entropy Markov Model ) and SVMhmm ( Support Vector Machine ) and one classifier , SVMmulticlass , are compared on their performance in identifying three types of bacterial biotope entities : bacteria , habitats and geographical locations .

label: Research method
text: The effectiveness of a variety of basic word formation features , syntactic features , and semantic features are exploited and compared for the three sequence labeling methods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments on two publicly available BioNLP collections show that , in addition to a Word Net feature , word embedding featured clusters ( although not trained with the task-specific corpus ) consistently improve the performance for all methods on all entity types in both collections .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Other features produce various results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results also show that when trained on limited corpora .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Brown clusters resulted in better performance than word embedding clusters did .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further analysis suggests that the entity recognition performance can be greatly boosted through improving the accuracy of entity boundary identification .

label: Research method
text: The National Science Foundation ( NSF ) , which is often the source of this funding , considers proposed projects based on the criteria of Intellectual Merit and Broader Impacts .

label: Research questions
text: However , these merit review criteria have been criticized as being insufficiently specific and not appropriate for all types of scientific research .

label: Research method
text: In an effort to examine the extent to which funded projects represented Broader Impacts , the researchers performed a content analysis of the abstracts from projects in the National Science Digital Library , an NSF project that crossed many disciplines and applications , but is of particular relevance to information scientists .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When the results of these analyses are placed in the context of the controversy surrounding the Broader Impacts merit review criterion , it is clear that this criterion is interpreted broadly and that even successful proposals often include aspirational or incomplete claims of impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Because current proposed revisions to the merit review criteria that include emphases on demonstrable innovation and economic benefit will likely only complicate proposers ' abilities to describe their projects ' potentials , researchers may benefit from a greater understanding of Broader Impacts and how they can be clearly expressed to reviewers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Institutions rarely inform their students about LA practices , and there exist significant privacy concerns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Without a clear student voice in the design of LA , institutions put themselves in an ethical gray area .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To help fill this gap in practice and add to the growing literature on students ' privacy perspectives , this study reports Research findings/conclusions from over 100 interviews with undergraduate students at eight U.S. higher education institutions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions demonstrate that students lacked awareness of educational data-mining and analytic practices , as well as the data on which they rely .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Students see potential in LA , but they presented nuanced arguments about when and with whom data should be shared ; they also expressed why informed consent was valuable and necessary .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study uncovered perspectives on institutional trust that were heretofore unknown , as well as what actions might violate that trust .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Institutions must balance their desire to implement LA with their obligation to educate students about their analytic practices and treat them as partners in the design of analytic strategies reliant on student data in order to protect their intellectual privacy .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It remains unclear what their ( relative ) importance is .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Three different models have been identified : ( a ) an exclusively accessibility-driven model , ( b ) a cost-benefit model in which both accessibility and quality are significant influences , and ( c ) an exclusively quality-driven model .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Moreover , the conditions under which accessibility and quality are important are not well understood .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of our study is to shed more light on both issues by assessing the role of different dimensions of accessibility and quality and how their importance is affected by time pressure .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a policy-capturing study in which 89 financial specialists participated .

label: Research method
text: Each judged 20 scenarios in which the accessibility and quality of human information sources , as well as time pressure , were manipulated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results showed that both accessibility and quality affect the likelihood of asking a human information source for information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , although the weights attached to physical accessibility and the source 's perceived technical quality were indeed moderated by time pressure , in both conditions we find support for a cost-benefit model of information seeking , in which both accessibility and quality are significant influences .

label: Research questions
text: Although the topic has been of perennial interest to information professionals and others , since at the least the early 1980s , we believe that it is timely to revisit this question in the context of a more connected and networked environment of data , information , and knowledge .

label: Research questions
text: The principal argument is that existing models of information exchange and use do not sufficiently take account of the multiplicity of networked users as a source of value , for example , their implicit and explicit interactions with other users , and with the information system .

label: Research questions
text: We briefly review existing kinds of value that have been theorized , operationalized , and measured in the information science literature .

label: Research questions
text: Principally , these are the notions of information as embedded value ; and information and information systems as adding value .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To these notions we add the further notion of connected or cocreated value .

label: Research method
text: We conclude our opinion article with a set of questions intended to orient future research into the question of the value of information in the contemporary era .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A taxonomy needs to be comprehensive and accurate if it is to be useful for policy making , especially now that policy makers are utilizing citation-based indicators to evaluate people , institutions and laboratories .

label: Research questions
text: Determining the accuracy of a taxonomy , however , remains a challenge .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous work on the accuracy of partition solutions is sparse , and the results of those studies , although useful , have not been definitive .

label: Research method
text: In this study we compare the accuracies of topic-level taxonomies based on the clustering of documents using direct citation , bibliographic coupling , and co-citation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using a set of new gold standards-articles with at least 100 references- we find that direct citation is better at concentrating references than either bibliographic coupling or co-citation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using the assumption that higher concentrations of references denote more accurate clusters , direct citation thus provides a more accurate representation of the taxonomy of scientific and technical knowledge than either bibliographic coupling or co-citation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also find that discipline-level taxonomies based on journal schema are highly inaccurate compared to topic-level taxonomies , and recommend against their use .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Rather than the existing project-centric prediction methods , we propose a novel backer-centric prediction method .

label: Research method
text: We identify each backer 's preferences based on their pledge history and calculate the cosine similarity between backer 's preferences and the project as each backer 's persuasibility .

label: Research method
text: Finally , we aggregate all the backers ' persuasibility to predict project success .

label: Research method
text: To validate our method , we crawled data on 183,886 projects launched during or before December 2014 on Kickstarter , a crowdfunding website .

label: Research method
text: We selected 4,922 backers with a total of 442,793 pledges to identify backers ' preferences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that a backer is more likely to be persuaded by a project that is more similar to the backer 's preferences .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our Research findings/conclusions not only demonstrate the efficacy of backers ' pledge history for predicting crowdfunding project success but also verify that a backer-centric method can supplement the existing project-centric approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our model and Research findings/conclusions enable crowdfunding platform agencies , fund-seeking entrepreneurs , and investors to predict the success of a crowdfunding project .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The selection of friends or followees responds to several reasons whose importance might differ according to the characteristics and preferences of each user .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , those preferences might also change over time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Consequently , understanding how friends or followees are selected emerges as a key design factor of strategies for personalized recommendations .

label: Research questions
text: In this work , we argue that the criteria for recommending followees needs to be adapted and combined according to each user 's behavior , preferences , and characteristics .

label: Research method
text: A method is proposed for adapting such criteria to the characteristics of the previously selected followees .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , the criteria can evolve over time to adapt to changes in user behavior , and broaden the diversity of the recommendation of potential followees based on novelty .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental evaluation showed that the proposed method improved precision results regarding static criteria weighting strategies and traditional rank aggregation techniques .

label: Research questions
text: Thus , understanding people 's illness representations can be invaluable when assisting them to develop lifestyle modifications that improve their health .

label: Research questions
text: What role does information use play in this equation ?

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This is the crucial question addressed by this two-part study .

label: Research method
text: Part 1 hypothesizes a model of how information use at different timepoints may affect illness representations , and then tests this model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study found that a number of information use type and time pairings ( e.g. , information used to consult healthcare practitioners at symptom onset ) were significantly associated with present-day level of personal control .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that it is not merely type or timing of information use alone that is helpful in illness coping , but the coupling of the two ; this has several implications for the design of patient education programs .

label: Research questions
text: Part 2 examines how information use and illness representations differ based on the way an individual participates in online health forums and social media sites .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The following four different participation styles were investigated : nonuser , only reading ( lurker ) , posting occasionally but largely reading ( infrequent poster ) , and reading and posting ( poster ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Differences in both information use and illness perceptions were found , and the implications of these are discussed .

label: Research questions
text: In spite of the current widespread practice of information creation by young people , little research exists to illuminate how youth are engaged in creative information behavior or how they make participatory contributions to the changing information world .

label: Research method
text: The Research questionsfully selected sample includes teenagers who actively produce and share information projects , such as online school magazines , an information-sharing website in Wiki , and a digital media library , using Scratch-a graphical programming language developed by MIT Media Lab .

label: Research method
text: Qualitative data were collected through group and individual interviews informed by Dervin 's Sense-Making Methodology .

label: Research method
text: The data analysis technique included directed qualitative content analysis with Atlas.ti .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions reveal the process of information creation , including content development , organization , and presentation of information , as well as noticeable patterns by youth such as visualizing , remixing , tinkering , and gaining a sense of empowerment .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study extends our knowledge of the creative aspects of information behavior .

label: Research questions
text: The disparity between referees ' opinions on the same paper typically makes it difficult to judge the paper 's quality .

label: Research method
text: This article presents a comprehensive study of peer review biases with regard to 2 aspects of referees : the static profiles ( factual authority and self-reported confidence ) and the dynamic behavioral context ( the temporal ordering of reviews by a single reviewer ) , exploiting anonymized , real-world review reports of 2 different international conferences in information systems / computer science .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our work extends conventional bias research by considering multiple biases occurring simultaneously .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions show that the referees ' static profiles are more dominant in peer review bias when compared to their dynamic behavioral context .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Of the static profiles , self-reported confidence improved both conference fitness and impact-based bias reductions , while factual authority could only contribute to conference fitness-based bias reduction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results also clearly show that the reliability of referees ' judgments varies along their static profiles and is contingent on the temporal interval between 2 consecutive reviews .

label: Research method
text: The mechanism is simple to apply and adjusts for metric magnitude differentials and distributional asymmetries in the rank-score curves .

label: Research method
text: The method is demonstrated using h-index , AWCR-index , g-index , and e-index data from journals in Accounting , Economics , and Finance .

label: Research questions
text: They argue that work is actually a huge part of life .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the mind-set of these scientists , weekdays and weekends are equally appropriate for working on their research .

label: Research questions
text: Although we all have encountered such people , we may wonder how widespread this condition is with other scientists in our field .

label: Research method
text: This brief communication probes work-life balance issues among JASIST authors and editors .

label: Research method
text: We collected and examined the publication histories for 1,533 of the 2,402 articles published in JASIST between 2001 and 2012 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although there is no rush to submit , revise , or accept papers , we found that 11 % of these events happened during weekends and that this trend has been increasing since 2005 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions suggest that working during the weekend may be one of the ways that scientists cope with the highly demanding era of publish or perish .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We hope that our Research findings/conclusions will raise an awareness of the steady increases in work among scientists before it affects our work-life balance even more .

label: Research method
text: In-text author citation analysis refers to author-based citation analysis using in-text citation data from full-text articles rather than reference data from citation databases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It has the potential to help with the application of citation analysis to research fields such as the social sciences that are not covered well by citation databases and to support weighted citation and cocitation counting for improved citation analysis results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that in-text author citation analysis can work as well as traditional citation analysis using citation databases for both author ranking and mapping if author name disambiguation is performed properly .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using in-text citation data without any author name disambiguation , ranking authors by citations is useless , whereas cocitation analysis works well for identifying major specialties and their interrelationships with cautions required for the interpretation of small research areas and some authors ' memberships in specialties .

label: Research method
text: This article investigates the citation impact and Mendeley readership impact of biochemistry research from 2011 in the Web of Science according to the type of collaboration involved .

label: Research method
text: Negative binomial regression models are used that incorporate , for the first time , the inclusion of specific countries within a team .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that , holding other factors constant , larger teams robustly associate with higher impact research , but including additional departments has no effect and adding extra institutions tends to reduce the impact of research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although international collaboration is apparently not advantageous in general , collaboration with the United States , and perhaps also with some other countries , seems to increase impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In contrast , collaborations with some other nations seems to decrease impact , although both Research findings/conclusions could be due to factors such as differing national proportions of excellent researchers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As a methodological implication , simpler statistical models would find international collaboration to be generally beneficial and so it is important to take into account specific countries when examining collaboration .

text: We studied this phenomenon in the field of scholarly publishing from the perspective of a single author .

label: Research method
text: We examined 1,024 such spam e-mails received by Marcin Kozak from publishers and journals over a period of 391 days , asking him to submit an article to their journal .

label: Research method
text: We collected the following information : where the request came from ; publishing model applied ; fees charged ; inclusion or not in the Directory of Open Access Journals ( DOAJ ) ; and presence or not in Beall 's ( 2014 ) listing of dubious journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our research showed that most of the publishers that sent e-mails inviting manuscripts were ( i ) using the open access model , ( ii ) using article-processing charges to fund their journal 's operations ; ( iii ) offering very short peer-review times , ( iv ) on Beall 's list , and ( v ) misrepresenting the location of their headquarters .

label: Research questions
text: Some years ago , a letter of invitation to submit an article to a particular journal was considered a kind of distinction .

label: Research questions
text: Today , e-mails inviting submissions are generally spam , something that misleads young researchers and irritates experienced ones .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , we focus on the multichannel access in online health communities , defining social influence as the average degree of multichannel access to a physician 's colleagues .

label: Research method
text: Based on the multinomial logistic regression model , we examined the direct effects of social influence and patients ' rating to multichannel access .

label: Research questions
text: In addition , we explored the moderating effect of social influence on the relationship between patients ' rating and multichannel access in online health communities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of the experiment and robustness testing support the propositions that social influence and patients ' rating significantly and positively affect multichannel access in an online health community .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The moderating effect of social influence is negative and significantly influences the accessible channels provided by the focal physician .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research contributes to the literature concerning online health communities , social influence , and multichannel access ; it also has practical implications .

label: Research questions
text: Some authors consider that public e-mail services are unprofessional and insecure , whereas others say that , in a dynamically changing working environment , public e-mail addresses allow readers to contact authors long after they have changed their workplace .

label: Research method
text: To shed light on this issue , we analyzed how often authors of scientific papers provided e-mail addresses that were either public or institution based .

label: Research method
text: We selected from the Web of Science database 1,000 frequently cited and 1,000 infrequently cited articles ( all of the latter were noncited articles ) published in 2000 , 2005 , and 2010 , and from these we analyzed 26,937 e-mail addresses .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results showed that approximately three fourths of these addresses were institutional , but there was an increasing trend toward using public e-mail addresses over the period studied .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: No significant differences were found between frequently and infrequently cited papers in this respect .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further research is now needed to access the motivations and perceptions of scholars when it comes to their use of either public or institutional e-mail accounts .

text: The students were briefly introduced to the use of PubMed and MeSH ( medical subject headings ) before they conducted their keyword-driven subject search .

text: We assessed the search results in terms of recall and precision , and also analyzed the search process .

label: Research findings/conclusions

label: Research questions
text: To explain this phenomenon , we use the lens of the calculus of behavior within a cost-benefit framework suggesting privacy concerns as cost factors and behavior enticements as benefit factors and examine how the enticements operate against privacy concerns in users ' cost-benefit calculus regarding disclosing personal information and using SNS continuously .

label: Research questions
text: Adopting social influence process theory , we examine three enticementsthe motivation of relationship management through SNS , the perceived usefulness of SNS for self-presentation , and the subjective social norms of using SNS .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From a survey of 362 Facebook users who have disclosed personal information on Facebook , we find that the motivation of relationship management through SNS and the perceived usefulness of SNS for self-presentation lead users to disclose information but that subjective social norms do not , suggesting that the perceived benefit of behavior enticements should be assimilated into users ' own value systems to truly operate as benefit factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results regarding the positive and negative effects of suggested benefit and cost factors on information disclosure show that only the combined positive effects of all three behavior enticements exceed the negative effect of privacy concerns , suggesting that privacy concerns can be offset only by multiple benefit factors .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous international comparisons of news interests have tended to use surveys and may bypass topics not well covered in the mainstream media .

label: Research method
text: This study uses 9 months of English-language Tweets from the United Kingdom , United States , India , South Africa , New Zealand , and Australia .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based upon the top 50 trending keywords in each country from the 0.5 billion Tweets collected , festivals or religious events are the most common , followed by media events , politics , human interest , and sports .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: U.S. trending topics have the most interest in the other countries and Indian trending topics the least .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Conversely , India is the most interested in other countries trending topics and the United States the least .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This gives evidence of an international hierarchy of perceived importance or relevance with some issues , such as the international interest in U.S. Thanksgiving celebrations , apparently not being directly driven by the media .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This hierarchy echoes , and may be caused by , similar news coverage trends .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although the current imbalanced international news coverage does not seem to be out of step with public news interests , the political implication is that the Twitter-using public reflects , and hence seems to implicitly accept , international imbalances in news media agenda setting rather than combating them .

text: Extensive documents are more likely to have low cohesion among their various sections , which may lead the reader to perceive the information as being of low quality .

label: Research questions
text: This research addresses this issue by presenting a tool ( Text Matrix ) composed of procedures and algorithms coded in software , with the aim of analyzing cohesion between the text sections in extensive documents .

label: Research method
text: A design science research approach was applied to develop , test , and prove the usefulness of the Text Matrix .

label: Research method
text: A total of 127 academic advisors and advisees were trained to use the Text Matrix and apply it in the development of the extensive text of dissertations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An analysis both of those users ' perceptions and of variations in network density among 41 extensive texts that they improved through the analyses performed by the artifact proposed in the present study demonstrated the ease of operation and effectiveness of the Text Matrix to identify parts of extensive texts associated with cohesion failures that could be connected by cohesion devices or even excluded from the extensive text .

label: Research questions
text: Different from general-Research questions content-based image retrieval ( CBIR ) applications , the specific goal of product image search is to retrieve and rank relevant products from a large-scale product database to visually assist a user 's online shopping experience .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , we explore the problem of product image search through salient edge characterization and analysis , for which we propose a novel image search method coupled with an interactive user region-of-interest indication function .

label: Research method
text: Given a product image , the proposed approach first extracts an edge map , based on which contour curves are further extracted .

label: Research method
text: We then segment the extracted contours into fragments according to the detected contour corners .

label: Research method
text: After that , a set of salient edge elements is extracted from each product image .

label: Research method
text: Based on salient edge elements matching and similarity evaluation , the method derives a new pairwise image similarity estimate .

label: Research method
text: Using the new image similarity , we can then retrieve product images .

label: Research method
text: To evaluate the performance of our algorithm , we conducted 120 sessions of querying experiments on a data set comprised of around 13k product images collected from multiple , real-world e-commerce websites .

label: Research method
text: We compared the performance of the proposed method with that of a bag-of-words method ( Philbin , Chum , Isard , Sivic , & Zisserman , 2008 ) and a Pyramid Histogram of Orientated Gradients ( PHOG ) method ( Bosch , Zisserman , & Munoz , 2007 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed method improves the performance of example-based product image retrieval .

label: Research method
text: Considering the time factor , we adopt the methodology of Granger causality test and track 3,390 products on Amazon.com over a 2-month period .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results reveal that a causality loop exists between online consumer review volume and sales .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , our Research findings/conclusions indicate that the volume of negative consumer reviews drive consumers ' purchasing decisions , but the volume of positive consumers reviews only marginally affects purchasing decisions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , consumers generate more positive reviews than negative reviews after sales .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results highlight the importance of negative consumer reviews ; negative reviews not only lead to sales , but sales , in turn , lead to higher volume of negative reviews .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions suggest an alternative strategy for practitioners to address negative online consumer reviews and highlight the awareness effect of online consumer review postings that can later convert into purchase behaviors .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , I model the aspect identification problem as a text classification ( TC ) problem in which a disease aspect corresponds to a category .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The disease aspect classification problem poses two challenges to classifiers : ( a ) a medical text often contains information about multiple aspects of a disease and hence produces noise for the classifiers and ( b ) text classifiers often can not extract the textual parts ( i.e. , passages ) about the categories of interest .

label: Research questions
text: I thus develop a technique , PETC ( Passage Extractor for Text Classification ) , that extracts passages ( from medical texts ) for the underlying text classifiers to classify .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Case studies on thousands of Chinese and English medical texts show that PETC enhances a support vector machine ( SVM ) classifier in classifying disease aspect information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: PETC also performs better than three state-of-the-art classifier enhancement techniques , including two passage extraction techniques for text classifiers and a technique that employs term proximity information to enhance text classifiers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The contribution is of significance to evidence-based medicine , health education , and healthcare decision support .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: PETC can be used in those application domains in which a text to be classified may have several parts about different categories .

text: We found that patients requested access to information related to diagnosis and imaging , with more than half of the patients reporting that they did not anticipate an increase in anxiety due to access to medical record information via a portal .

label: Research findings/conclusions

text: Among the research Research findings/conclusions are that many different methods will work , including a number of methods that are superficially language-independent ( such as an analysis of the most common words or character n-grams in a document ) .

label: Research questions
text: We used this opportunity to analyze how the event affected the social-networking community of Twitter .

label: Research method
text: We analyzed whether the flyby of the asteroid elicited more tweets about the asteroid close to the asteroid 's trajectory compared to the neutral search term NASA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A spatio-temporal analysis of tweets about NASA revealed a natural movement of the geographical mean from east to west , mirroring the Sun 's path through the sky .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For the geolocation of users tweeting about the asteroid , this east-west movement changed direction , mirroring the asteroid 's trajectory ( from south-east to north-west ) as soon as the asteroid was potentially visible from Earth .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This effect appears to represent emotionally contagious flocking behavior among Twitter users influenced by the position of the asteroid itself .
