label: Research method
text: The topic relevance model uses event-related potential ( ERP ) components to describe the process of topic relevance judgment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More specifically , the topic relevance model indicates that N400 and P600 , which have been successfully applied to the mismatch process of a stimulus and the discourse-internal reorganization and integration process of a stimulus , respectively , are used for the topic mismatch process of a topic-irrelevant video shot and the topic formation process of a topic-relevant video shot .

label: Research method
text: To evaluate our proposed ERP/MMR-based method , we compared the video skims generated by the ERP/MMR-based , ERP-based , and shot boundary detection ( SBD ) methods with ground truth skims .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results showed that at a significance level of 0.05 , the ROUGE-1 scores of the ERP/MMR method are statistically higher than those of the SBD method , and the diversity scores of the ERP/MMR method are statistically higher than those of the ERP method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study suggested that the proposed method may be applied to the construction of a video skim without operational intervention , such as the insertion of a black screen between video shots .

label: Research method
text: Main path analysis is a bibliometric method capable of tracing the most significant paths in a citation network and is commonly used to trace the development trajectory of a research field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We highlight several limitations of the original main path analysis and suggest new , complementary approaches to overcome these limitations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In contrast to the original local main path , the new approaches generate the global main path , the backward local main path , multiple main paths , and key-route main paths .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Each of them is obtained via a perspective different from the original approach .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By simultaneously conducting the new , complementary approaches , one uncovers the key development of the target discipline from a broader view .

label: Research method
text: To demonstrate the value of these new approaches , we simultaneously apply them to a set of academic articles related to the Hirsch index .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that the integrated approach discovers several paths that are not captured by the original approach .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Among these new approaches , the key-route approach is especially useful and hints at a divergence-convergence-divergence structure in the development of the Hirsch index .

label: Research questions
text: To understand this possible shift from reading print media to reading digital media , we investigated reading behavior for 11 media and reading preferences between print and digital in different circumstances .

label: Research method
text: In August 2012 , an online survey was used to inquire about the reading behavior and preference of 1,755 participants , ranging in age from 18 to 69 years .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The participants contained equal numbers of men and women from five age brackets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our main finding was that approximately 70 % of total reading time was spent on digital media and that preferences favored print media .

label: Research method
text: Cluster analysis of reading time by media was used to categorize respondents into eight clusters , and a second cluster analysis on stated preference ( digital or print ) yielded six clusters .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The correspondence analysis between reading behavior clusters and preference clusters revealed that there is a mismatch between reading behavior and stated preference for either print or digital media .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study presents a framework for discovering story chains , given an input document , in a text collection .

label: Research method
text: The framework has 3 complementary parts that i ) scan the collection , ii ) measure the similarity between chain-member candidates and the chain , and iii ) measure similarity among news articles .

label: Research method
text: For scanning , we apply a novel text-mining method that uses a zigzagged search that reinvestigates past documents based on the updated chain .

label: Research method
text: We also utilize social networks of news actors to reveal connections among news articles .

label: Research method
text: We conduct 2 user studies in terms of 4 effectiveness measures-relevance , coverage , coherence , and ability to disclose relations .

label: Research method
text: The first user study compares several versions of the framework , by varying parameters , to set a guideline for use .

label: Research method
text: The second compares the framework with 3 baselines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that our method provides statistically significant improvement in effectiveness in 61 % of pairwise comparisons , with medium or large effect size ; in the remainder , none of the baselines significantly outperforms our method .

label: Research questions
text: However , prior studies focused mostly on the relationship between aggregated online reviews and sales .

label: Research questions
text: This paper investigates the impact of online review richness ( i.e. , reviews containing videos or follow-on reviews ) on sales .

label: Research questions
text: Leveraging attribute substitution theory , we conjecture that online review richness can provide heuristic cues in the online shopping environment to help consumers make better purchase decisions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using data from , we found that reviews containing either videos or follow-on reviews positively affect sales .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , different product types can also serve as heuristic cues to replace target cues , which can further affect how different forms of online review richness affect sales .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that the impact of online review richness on sales is stronger for utilitarian products than for hedonic products , and stronger for negatively commented products than for positively commented products .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , we conducted two online experiments and confirmed that the causal relationship is from online review richness to sales .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The research Research findings/conclusions offer practical implications for online retailers and constitute one of the first steps toward a better understanding of the relationship between online review richness and sales .

label: Research method
text: Fifty topics in arXiv and WoS were generated using an LDA algorithm and then regression models were used to explain 4 types of topic growth patterns .

label: Research method
text: Based on the slopes of the fitted equation curves , the paper redefines the topic trends and popularity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that arXiv and WoS share similar topics in a given domain , but differ in evolution trends .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Topics in WoS lose their popularity much earlier and their durations of popularity are shorter than those in arXiv .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This work demonstrates that open access preprints have stronger growth tendency as compared to traditional printed publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Society can reap the benefits of successful research studies only if the results are converted into marketable and consumable products ( e.g. , medicaments , diagnostic tools , machines , and devices ) or services .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A series of different names have been introduced which refer to the societal impact of research : third stream activities , societal benefits , societal quality , usefulness , public values , knowledge transfer , and societal relevance .

label: Research questions
text: What most of these names are concerned with is the assessment of social , cultural , environmental , and economic returns ( impact and effects ) from results ( research output ) or products ( research outcome ) of publicly funded research .

label: Research questions
text: This review intends to present existing research on and practices employed in the assessment of societal impact in the form of a literature survey .

label: Research questions
text: The objective is for this review to serve as a basis for the development of robust and reliable methods of societal impact measurement .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: While much research has focused on the concerns of younger generations , few studies have investigated older adults , specifically those aged 65+ years .

label: Research method
text: This study analyzes in-depth interviews with 40 older adults living in East York , Toronto , Canada , to investigate their online privacy concerns and the strategies they use to mitigate these concerns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that East York older adults are mostly concerned about security privacy concerns followed by institutional privacy concerns and only minimally concerned about social privacy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The greatest concerns included information misuse by unknown others and unauthorized access to their personal information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that , for some older adults , their high privacy concerns precluded them from taking full advantage of the potential benefits of digital media .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: East York older adults varied considerably in their use of privacy protection strategies ; some older adults used no strategies , while others were eager to protect their privacy using all strategies at their disposal .

label: Research method
text: In a field study , we examined how students ' search effort for an assigned learning task was associated with precision and relative recall , and how this was associated to the quality of learning outcome .

label: Research method
text: The study subjects were 41 medical students writing essays for a class in medicine .

label: Research method
text: Searching in Medline was part of their assignment .

label: Research method
text: The data comprised students ' search logs in Medline , their assessment of the usefulness of references retrieved , a questionnaire concerning the search process , and evaluation scores of the essays given by the teachers .

label: Research method
text: Pearson correlation was calculated for answering the research questions .

label: Research method
text: Finally , a path model for predicting task outcome was built .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that effort in the search process degraded precision but improved task outcome .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There were two major mechanisms reducing precision while enhancing task outcome .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Effort in expanding Medical Subject Heading ( MeSH ) terms within search sessions and effort in assessing and exploring documents in the result list between the sessions degraded precision , but led to better task outcome .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , human effort compensated bad retrieval results on the way to good task outcome .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions suggest that traditional effectiveness measures in information retrieval should be complemented with evaluation measures for search process and outcome .

label: Research method
text: In PRF , the top-k retrieved images are regarded as PRF .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although the PRF set contains noise , PRF has proven effective for automatically improving the overall retrieval result .

label: Research method
text: To implement PRF , the Rocchio algorithm has been considered as a reasonable and well-established baseline .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the performance of Rocchio-based PRF is subject to various representation choices ( or factors ) .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we examine these factors that affect the performance of Rocchio-based PRF , including image-feature representation , the number of top-ranked images , the weighting parameters of Rocchio , and similarity measure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We offer practical insights on how to optimize the performance of Rocchio-based PRF by choosing appropriate representation choices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our extensive experiments on NUS-WIDE-LITE and Caltech 101+Corel 5000 data sets show that the optimal feature representation is color moment+wavelet texture in terms of retrieval efficiency and effectiveness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Other representation choices are that using top-20 ranked images as pseudopositive and pseudonegative feedback sets with the equal weight ( i.e. , 0.5 ) by the correlation and cosine distance functions can produce the optimal retrieval result .

label: Research questions
text: It is argued that the notion of information quality is of great importance , and needs to be situated better within a sound philosophy of information to help frame information quality in a broader conceptual light .

label: Research questions
text: It is found that much research on information quality conceptualizes information quality as either an inherent property of the information itself , or as an individual mental construct of the users .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The notion of information quality is often not situated within a philosophy of information .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper outlines a conceptual framework in which information is regarded as a semiotic sign , and extends that notion with Paul Grice 's pragmatic philosophy of language to provide a conversational notion of information quality that is contextual and tied to the notion of meaning .

label: Research questions
text: It becomes a reality when individuals simply conform to the majority opinion and hesitate to suggest their own solutions to a problem .

label: Research questions
text: Anonymity has long been established to have an effect on conformity , but no previous research has explored the effects of different anonymity states in relation to an individual 's likelihood to conform .

label: Research method
text: Through a survey of randomly chosen participants from the English-language Wikipedia community , I explored the effects of anonymity on the likelihood of conforming to group opinion .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In addition , I differentiated between actual states of anonymity and individuals ' perceptions of anonymity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: His Research findings/conclusions indicate that although people perceive anonymity differently depending on their anonymity state , different states of anonymity do not have a strong effect on the likelihood of conforming to group opinion .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on this evidence , I make recommendations for software engineers who have a direct hand in the design of online community platforms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In many cases , statistic information ( for example , users ' profiles ) and sequentially dynamic information ( for example , logs of interaction with information systems ) are two prominent sources that can be combined to achieve optimized results .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous attempts in combining these two sources mainly exploited models designed for either static or sequential information , but not both .

label: Research questions
text: This study aims to fill the gap by proposing a novel joint neural network model that can naturally fit both static and sequential user data .

label: Research method
text: To evaluate the effectiveness of the proposed method , this study uses the problem of at-risk student prediction as an example where both static data ( personal profiles ) and sequential data ( event logs ) are involved .

label: Research method
text: A thorough evaluation was conducted on an open data set , with comparisons to a range of existing approaches including both static and sequential models .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results reveal superb performances of the proposed method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Implications of the Research findings/conclusions on further research and applications of joint models are discussed .

label: Research questions
text: One of the major limitations in today 's plagiarism checkers is their sole dependence on text-based detection , where they ignore the citation and structural information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further , the text-based detection approaches that they employ usually fail to trace out intelligent manipulations .

label: Research method
text: In the proposed work , a plagiarism detection system is presented that employs the effective coupling of various modules , namely , logical structure classifications and citation parsing , two-stage candidate document selections , syntax-semantic-based exhaustive passage level analysis with plagiarism analysis using structural and citation information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further , a new plagiarism score , namely , weighted overall similarity index is proposed , opposed to the general plagiarism scores .

label: Research method
text: The proposed approach is evaluated on the data set created by Alzahrani et al .

label: Research method
text: ( ) , which contains scientific publications imposed with various plagiarism complexities .

label: Research method
text: Comparison of the final system results is done against a potential baseline approach .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The proposed approach exhibits considerable improvement over the comparative baseline , and hence reflects the potency of syntax-semantic text-based analysis with structural and citation information .

label: Research questions
text: This article studies how badge design affects people 's contributions and behavior over time .

label: Research questions
text: Past work has shown that badges steer people 's behavior toward substantially increasing the amount of contributions before obtaining the badge , and immediately decreasing their contributions thereafter , returning to their baseline contribution levels .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In contrast , we find that the steering effect depends on the type of user , as modeled by the rate and intensity of the user 's contributions .

label: Research method
text: We use these measures to distinguish between different groups of user activity , including users who are not affected by the badge system despite being significant contributors to the site .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We provide a predictive model of how users change their activity group over the course of their lifetime in the system .

label: Research method
text: We demonstrate our approach empirically in three different Q & A sites on Stack Exchange with hundreds of thousands of users , for two types of activities ( editing and voting on posts ) .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we address more specifically the problem of accessing relevant entities , such as publications and authors within a bibliographic network , given an information need .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We propose a novel algorithm , called BibRank , that estimates a joint relevance of documents and authors within a bibliographic network .

label: Research method
text: This model ranks each type of entity using a score propagation algorithm with respect to the query topic and the structure of the underlying bi-type information entity network .

label: Research method
text: Evidence sources , namely content-based and network-based scores , are both used to estimate the topical similarity between connected entities .

label: Research method
text: For this Research questions , authorship relationships are analyzed through a language model-based score on the one hand and on the other hand , non topically related entities of the same type are detected through marginal citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The article reports the results of experiments using the Bibrank algorithm for an information retrieval task .

label: Research method
text: The CiteSeerX bibliographic data set forms the basis for the topical query automatic generation and evaluation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that a statistically significant improvement over closely related ranking models is achieved .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The use of digital traces to provide insight into human behavior remains underdeveloped .

label: Research questions
text: Recently , ontological approaches have been exploited for tagging and linking digital traces , with progress made in ontology models for well-defined domains .

label: Research questions
text: However , the process of conceptualization for ill-defined domains remains challenging , requiring interdisciplinary efforts to understand the main aspects and capture them in a computer processable form .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The primary contribution of this article is a theory-driven approach to ontology development that supports semantic augmentation of digital traces .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , we argue that ( a ) activity theory can be used to develop more insightful conceptual models of ill-defined activities , which ( b ) can be used to inform the development of an ontology , and ( c ) that this ontology can be used to guide the semantic augmentation of digital traces for making sense of phenomena .

label: Research method
text: A case study of interpersonal communication is chosen to illustrate the applicability of the proposed multidisciplinary approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The benefits of the approach are illustrated through an example application , demonstrating how it may be used to assemble and make sense of digital traces .

label: Research method
text: The individuals are classified into 3 cohorts according to their manifested professional recognition , as Price medalists ( Pm ) , members of the editorial board of Scientometrics and the Journal of Informetrics ( Rw ) , and session chairs ( Sc ) at an International Society of Scientometrics and Informetrics ( ISSI ) conference .

label: Research method
text: Several core impact indicators are calculated : h , g , pi , citation distribution score ( CDS ) , percentage rank position ( PRP ) , and weight of influence of papers ( WIP10 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The indices significantly correlate with each other .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The mean value of the indices of the cohorts decreases parallel with the decrease in professional recognition : Pm > Rw > Sc .

label: Research method
text: The 30 scientometricians studied were clustered according to the core impact indices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The members in the clusters so obtained overlap only partly with the members in the cohorts made by professional recognition .

label: Research method
text: The Total Overlap is calculated by dividing the sum of the diagonal elements in the cohorts-clusters matrix with the total number of elements , times 100 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The highest overlap ( 76.6 % ) was obtained with the g-index .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Accordingly , the g-index seems to have the greatest discriminative power in the system studied .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The cohorts-clusters method may be used for validating scientometric indicators .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We study this question empirically , as opposed to normatively .

label: Research method
text: Based on the literature that discusses whose viewpoints should be reflected , we construct a research model that includes those same three viewpoints as factors that might be influencing term assignment in actual practice .

label: Research method
text: In the unique study design that we employ , the records of term assignments made by identified indexers in academic libraries are cross-referenced with the results of a survey that those same indexers completed on political views .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results indicate that in our setting , variance in term assignment was best explained by indexers ' personal political views .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Personal communication networks as a feature do not exist in all collaborative projects .

label: Research questions
text: It is currently unclear if a designer 's decision to include a personal communication network in a collaborative project 's structure affects outcome quality .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , I investigated Wikipedia 's personal communication network and analyzed which Wikipedia editors are utilizing it and how they are connected to outcome quality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Evidence suggests that people who utilize these networks are more experienced in editing high quality articles and are more integrated in the community .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additionally , these individuals utilize the personal communication network for coordinating and perhaps mentoring editors who edit lower quality articles .

label: Research questions
text: The value of these networks is demonstrated by the characteristics of the users who use them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions indicate that designers of online collaborative projects can help improve the quality of outcomes in these projects by deciding to implement a personal communication network in their communities .

label: Research questions
text: Since then , bibliometric analysis of funding acknowledgment ( FA ) has been growing and has aroused intense interest and attention from both academia and policy makers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Examining the distribution of FA by citation index database , by language , and by acknowledgment type , we noted coverage limitations and potential biases in each analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We argue that despite its great value , bibliometric analysis of FA should be used with caution .

text: We investigate the contents of posts about the Zika virus on Yahoo !

text: Answers , identify and reveal subject patterns about the Zika virus , and analyze the temporal changes of the revealed subject topics over 4 defined periods of the Zika virus outbreak .

label: Research method
text: Multidimensional scaling analysis , temporal analysis , and inferential statistical analysis approaches were used in the study .

label: Research method
text: A resulting 2-layer Zika virus schema , and term connections and relationships are presented .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that consumers ' concerns changed over the 4 defined periods .

label: Research findings/conclusions

text: The work of Campanario and Coslado ( 2011 ) , however , shows that Benford 's law does not always fit practical data in a statistical sense .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we use a generalization of Benford 's law related to the general law of Zipf with exponent beta ? > ? 0 .

label: Research method
text: Using data from Campanario and Coslado , we apply nonlinear least squares to determine the optimal beta and show that this generalized law of Benford fits the data better than the classical law of Benford .

label: Research questions
text: In this work , we introduce two systems designed to help retrieving medical literature .

label: Research method
text: Both receive a long , discursive clinical note as input query , and return highly relevant literature that could be used in support of clinical practice .

label: Research method
text: The first system is an improved version of a method previously proposed by the authors ; it combines pseudo relevance feedback and a domain-specific term filter to reformulate the query .

label: Research method
text: The second is an approach that uses a deep neural network to reformulate a clinical note .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Both approaches were evaluated on the 2014 and 2015 TREC CDS datasets ; in our tests , they outperform the previously proposed method by up to 28 % in inferred NDCG ; furthermore , they are competitive with the state of the art , achieving up to 8 % improvement in inferred NDCG .

label: Research method
text: An aboutness coefficient is developed to estimate the strength of the aboutness relationship .

label: Research method
text: Words that are randomly distributed across subjects are assumed to lack aboutness and the degree to which their usage deviates from a random pattern indicates the strength of the aboutness .

label: Research method
text: To estimate aboutness , title words and their associated subjects are extracted from the titles of non-fiction English language books in the OCLC WorldCat database .

label: Research method
text: The usage patterns of the title words are analyzed and used to compute aboutness coefficients for each of the common title words .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Words with low aboutness coefficients ( An and In ) are commonly found in stop word lists , whereas words with high aboutness coefficients ( Carbonate , Autism ) are unambiguous and have a strong subject association .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The aboutness coefficient potentially can enhance indexing , advance authority control , and improve retrieval .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study provides a detailed comparison of use patterns between work and personal e-mail accounts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results suggest that users engage in more keeping behaviors with work e-mail than with personal e-mailrespondents reported more frequent use of keeping actions and larger inbox sizes for their work accounts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , we found correlations between individual respondents ' e-mail behaviors in the two contexts , indicating that personal preferences can play a role .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also report results pointing to e-mail as an important boundary management artifact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show evidence that the use of multiple e-mail accounts may be a work-personal boundary placement strategy , but also observe that a fair amount of boundary permeation occurs through e-mail .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To our knowledge , this study is one of the first to compare e-mail use in both work and personal contexts across the same sample .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our Research findings/conclusions extend prior research on personal information management regarding e-mail use , and help inform the role of e-mail in managing work-personal boundaries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results have implications for the design of e-mail systems , organizational e-mail policies , user training , and understanding the impacts of technology on daily life .

label: Research questions
text: The present paper attempts to redress both and proposes that navigability be conceptually examined along three dimensions , namely , logic of structure , clarity of structure , and clarity of target .

label: Research method
text: A 2x2x2 factorial between-subjects experiment ( N=128 ) was conducted to examine distinct contributions of these dimensions to perceptions of a nonprofit website .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results showed significant effects for logic of structure and clarity on perceived navigability , while logic of structure and content domain involvement affected attitudes toward the website .

label: Research method
text: Drawing from 95 structured interviews , 6 in-depth interviews , a focus group , and a series of participatory observations of computer training classes at Casa Latina , we find that information and communication technologies ( ICT ) help immigrant day laborers remain connected with their families and their employers and facilitate their navigation of , and integration into , the society in which they have precarious social and economic standing .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: ICT help immigrant day laborers maintain links with their past and their roots , offer tools to navigate their present needs , and help them build future plans and aspirations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Hispanic day laborers experience ICT mostly through mobile phones used to communicate with employers and families ; they use computers and the Internet to communicate with family and friends .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , the experience of the immigrant day laborers is strongly influenced by their English-language proficiency-which helps them navigate daily life in the United States and communicate with employers-and their use of transportation to move around the city for work and daily life .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The results of this study offer new insight into the ways in which day laborers in Seattle use ICT to help them meet personal and employment needs and realize their long-term goals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This paper shows that fuzzy retrieval has an improved retrieval performance over typical Boolean retrieval .

label: Research questions
text: Various methods of fuzzy information retrieval implementation and their use for software reuse will be examined .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A deeper explanation of the fundamentals of designing a fuzzy information retrieval system for software reuse is presented .

label: Research method
text: Eighty-eight searchers performed four web search tasks prescribed by the researchers .

label: Research method
text: Each task was linked to an existing target web page , containing a piece of text that served as the basis for the task .

label: Research method
text: A matching phrasing was a task whose wording matched the text of the target page .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A nonmatching phrasing was synonymous with the matching phrasing , but had no match with the target page .

label: Research method
text: Searchers received tasks for both types in English and in Hebrew .

label: Research method
text: The search process was logged .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions confirm that task phrasing shapes the search process and outcome , and also user satisfaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Each search stageretrieval of the target page , visiting the target page , and finding the target answerwas associated with different phenomena ; for example , target page retrieval was negatively affected by persistence in search patterns ( e.g. , use of phrases ) , user-originated keywords , shorter queries , and omitting key keywords from the queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Searchers were easily driven away from the top-ranked target pages by lower-ranked pages with title tags matching the queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Some searchers created consistently longer queries than other searchers , regardless of the task length .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Several consistent behavior patterns that characterized the Hebrew language were uncovered , including the use of keyword modifications ( replacing infinitive forms with nouns ) , omitting prefixes and articles , and preferences for the common language .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The success self-assessment also depended on whether the wording of the answer matched the task phrasing .

label: Research questions
text: In this work , we propose an anchor-based hybrid filtering approach ( AHF ) to naturally measure and capture the user 's preference stabilities for movie genres .

label: Research method
text: That is , a pairwise preference of the genre comparison process with the genre-based fuzzy inference filtering was conducted in order to achieve effective interactive recommendations .

label: Research method
text: To conduct this experiment , we recruited 30 users with different levels of preference stability for movie genres .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results show that the proposed AHFapproach can effectively capture the user 's preferences and filter out undesired movie genres .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , this approach can give a more precise recommendation than one without the anchoring process , especially for the user who has unstable preferences for movie genres .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our proposed approach achieves statistical significance and outperforms the baseline method for recommending users ' favorite movies by more than 63 % for the stable user group and 77 % for the unstable group .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that the stability of users ' preferences is a factor to be considered when developing effective recommendation strategies .

label: Research questions
text: However , the goal of many discussion communities is to produce a high-quality knowledge resource , whether to improve external task performance or to increase reputation and site traffic .

label: Research questions
text: What do moderation practices look like when the community is focused on the creation of a useable knowledge resource rather than facilitating an inclusive conversation ?

label: Research questions
text: Under what conditions is this style of moderation likely to be successful ?

label: Research method
text: We present a case study from online gamingElitist Jerksin which aggressive moderation is used to transform a conversational medium into a high-quality knowledge resource , using the strategy of open censorship .

label: Research method
text: We present a content analysis of moderator comments regarding censored messages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis revealed differences in types of contributor mistakes and the severity of moderator actions : infractions that interfered with both conversation and resource quality were punished harshly , whereas a set of infractions that supported conversation but undermined resource quality were more respectfully removed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We describe a set of conditions under which moderators should intervene in the conversion of conversation to knowledge resource rather than the conversion of lurkers to contributors .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we describe ways to identify important concepts in documents using the relationships in a thesaurus or other vocabulary structures .

label: Research method
text: We introduce a methodology for the analysis and modeling of the indexing process based on a weighted random walk algorithm .

label: Research questions
text: The primary goal of this research is the analysis of the contribution of thesaurus structure to the indexing process .

label: Research method
text: The resulting models are evaluated in the context of automatic subject indexing using four collections of documents pre-indexed with 4 different thesauri ( AGROVOC [ UN Food and Agriculture Organization ] , high-energy physics taxonomy [ HEP ] , National Agricultural Library Thesaurus [ NALT ] , and medical subject headings [ MeSH ] ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We also introduce a thesaurus-centric matching algorithm intended to improve the quality of candidate concepts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In all cases , the weighted random walk improves automatic indexing performance over matching alone with an increase in average precision ( AP ) of 9 % for HEP , 11 % for MeSH , 35 % for NALT , and 37 % for AGROVOC .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of the analysis support our hypothesis that subject indexing is in part a browsing process , and that using the vocabulary and its structure in a thesaurus contributes to the indexing process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The amount that the vocabulary structure contributes was found to differ among the 4 thesauri , possibly due to the vocabulary used in the corresponding thesauri and the structural relationships between the terms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Each of the thesauri and the manual indexing associated with it

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To date , the project has proceeded in 2 key phases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , we developed a bottom-up method for web register classification , asking end users of the web to utilize a decision-tree survey to code relevant situational characteristics of web documents , resulting in a bottom-up identification of register and subregister categories .

label: Research method
text: We present details regarding the development and testing of this method through a series of 10 pilot studies .

label: Research method
text: Then , in the second phase of our project we applied this procedure to a corpus of 53,000 web documents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An analysis of the results demonstrates the effectiveness of these methods for web register classification and provides a preliminary description of the types and distribution of registers on the web .

label: Research method
text: The first phase developed a typology of email classification patterns through a qualitative study involving 34 participants .

label: Research method
text: Inspired by the fields of pragmatics and speech act theory , this typology comprising four top level categories and 13 subcategories represents the typical email triage behaviors of managers in an organizational context .

label: Research method
text: The second study phase was conducted on a corpus of 1,703 messages using email samples of two managers .

label: Research method
text: Using the k-NN ( k-nearest neighbor ) algorithm , statistical treatments automatically classified the email according to lexical and nonlexical features representative of managers ' triage patterns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The automatic classification of email according to the lexicon of the messages was found to be substantially more efficient when k ? = ? 2 and n ? = ? 2,000 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For four categories , the average recall rate was 94.32 % , the average precision rate was 94.50 % , and the accuracy rate was 94.54 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For 13 categories , the average recall rate was 91.09 % , the average precision rate was 84.18 % , and the accuracy rate was 88.70 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It appears that a message 's nonlexical features are also deeply influenced by email pragmatics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Features related to the recipient and the sender were the most relevant for characterizing email .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , problems with navigation and retrieval represent a barrier for this cohort .

label: Research questions
text: This article addresses one aspect of page design , testing whether a horizontal or vertical contents arrangement facilitates faster access to content for people with learning disabilities .

label: Research method
text: Participants were timed as they looked for one-word dummy menu entries appearing in various locations along a horizontal or vertical grid .

label: Research method
text: The words corresponded to images shown at random in a word-search type activity .

label: Research method
text: Results were analyzed using mixed effects models .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results showed that mean search times increased as the position shifted from left to right and from top to bottom .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , participants undertook the test as if it were a reading exercise , despite the images appearing in the center of the page and the words appearing at random positions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The research also suggests that a horizontal menu may be more effective than a vertical one , with the most important links placed on the left .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The propensity to imbibe information serially ( word-for-word ) rather than to skim or look globally has important website design implications .

label: Research questions
text: This article explores the extent to which YouTube videos are cited in academic publications and whether there are significant broad disciplinary differences in this practice .

label: Research method
text: To investigate , we extracted the URL citations to YouTube videos from academic publications indexed by Scopus .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A total of 1,808 Scopus publications cited at least one YouTube video , and there was a steady upward growth in citing online videos within scholarly publications from 2006 to 2011 , with YouTube citations being most common within arts and humanities ( 0.3 % ) and the social sciences ( 0.2 % ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A content analysis of 551 YouTube videos cited by research articles indicated that in science ( 78 % ) and in medicine and health sciences ( 77 % ) , over three fourths of the cited videos had either direct scientific ( e.g. , laboratory experiments ) or scientific-related contents ( e.g. , academic lectures or education ) whereas in the arts and humanities , about 80 % of the YouTube videos had art , culture , or history themes , and in the social sciences , about 63 % of the videos were related to news , politics , advertisements , and documentaries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This shows both the disciplinary differences and the wide variety of innovative research communication uses found for videos within the different subject areas .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Some of the key problems that hamper their search experience is their limited vocabulary , their difficulty in using the right keywords , and the inappropriateness of their general-Research questions query suggestions .

label: Research questions
text: In this work , we propose a method that uses tags from social media to suggest queries related to children 's topics .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Concretely , we propose a simple yet effective approach to bias a random walk defined on a bipartite graph of web resources and tags through keywords that are more commonly used to describe resources for children .

label: Research method
text: We evaluate our method using a large query log sample of queries submitted by children .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that our method outperforms by a large margin the query suggestions of modern search engines and state-of-the art query suggestions based on random walks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We improve further the quality of the ranking by combining the score of the random walk with topical and language modeling features to emphasize even more the child-related aspects of the query suggestions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results reveal that LIS researchers most frequently cite publications in their own discipline .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , half of all co-authors of LIS articles are affiliated with LIS-related institutes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results confirm that the degree of interdisciplinarity within LIS has increased , particularly co-authorship .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the study found sources of direct citations in LIS articles are widely distributed across 30 disciplines , but co-authors of LIS articles are distributed across only 25 disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The degree of interdisciplinarity was found ranging from 0.61 to 0.82 with citation to references in all articles being the highest and that of co-authorship being the lowest .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Percentages of contribution attributable to LIS show a decreasing tendency based on the results of direct citation and co-authorship analysis , but an increasing tendency based on those of bibliographic coupling analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Such differences indicate each of the three bibliometric methods has its strength and provides insights respectively for viewing various aspects of interdisciplinarity , suggesting the use of no single bibliometric method can reveal all aspects of interdisciplinarity due to its multifaceted nature .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Up to now , research has mainly focused on the evaluation of webpages , while the evaluation of SERPs received less attention .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , task complexity is often not taken into account .

label: Research method
text: A within-subjects design was used to study the influence of task complexity on search query formulation , evaluation of search results , and task performance .

label: Research method
text: Three search tasks were used : a fact-finding , cause-effect , and a controversial topic task .

label: Research method
text: To measure perceptual search processes , we used a combination of log files , eye-tracking data , answer forms , and think-aloud protocols .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results reveal that an increase in task complexity results in more search queries and used keywords , more time to formulate search queries , and more considered search results on the SERPs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , higher ranked search results were considered more often than lower ranked results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , not all the results for the most complex task were in line with expectations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These conflicting results can be explained by a lack of prior knowledge and the possible interference of prior attitudes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While the current modeling framework successfully captures citation dynamics of typical articles , there exists a nonnegligible , and perhaps most interesting , fraction of atypical articles whose citation trajectories do not follow the normal rise-and-fall pattern .

label: Research questions
text: Here we systematically study and classify citation patterns of atypical articles , finding that they can be characterized by awakened articles , second-acts , and a combination of both .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We propose a second-act model that can accurately describe the citation dynamics of second-act articles .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The model not only provides a mechanistic framework to understand citation patterns of atypical articles , separating factors that drive impact , but it also offers new capabilities to identify the time of exogenous events that influence citations .

label: Research questions
text: The increasingly popular activity tracking technology ( ATT ) has given rise to a new type of personal information about one 's daily physical activities , which has not been scrutinized under theoretical frameworks in PIM .

label: Research method
text: This article presents an in-depth qualitative interview study supplemented by participant-driven photo elicitation with 20 long-term activity tracker users about how they manage personal information generated by ATT .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Key Research findings/conclusions include the identification of two distinctive user groups ( i.e. , consistent casual users and powers users ) among long-term activity tracker users and an in-depth portrayal of these groups ' PIM behaviors with ATT .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These behaviors include concurrent and subsequent PIM practices , 6 types of PIM activities , and the use of a spectrum of PIM tools .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research provides timely theoretical updates to PIM under the background of self-tracking technologies , outlines empirical implications to improve ATT in support of PIM , and offers recommendations for incorporating participant-driven photo elicitation as a supplementary method for qualitative interviews in information behavior research .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Evaluations of an enterprise search have predominately focused on the effectiveness and efficiency of the engine , with very little analysis of user involvement in the process , and none on the role of service providers .

label: Research questions
text: We propose and evaluate a model of costs and benefits to a service provider when investing in enhancements to the ranking of documents returned by their search engine .

label: Research method
text: We demonstrate the model through a case study to analyze the potential impact of using domain experts to provide enhanced mediated search results .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By demonstrating how to quantify the cost and benefit of an improved information retrieval system to the service provider , our case study shows that using the relevance assessments of domain experts to rerank original search results can significantly improve the accuracy of ranked lists .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , the service provider gains substantial return on investment and a higher search success rate by investing in the relevance assessments of domain experts .

label: Research method
text: Our cost and benefit analysis results are contrasted with standard modes of effectiveness analysis , including quantitative ( using measures such as precision ) and qualitative ( through user preference surveys ) approaches .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Modeling costs and benefits explicitly can provide useful insights that the other approaches do not convey .

label: Research questions
text: A key challenge in opinion retrieval is to capture the query-related opinion score of a document .

label: Research questions
text: Existing methods rely mainly on the proximity information between the opinion terms and the query terms to address the key challenge .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we propose to incorporate the syntactic and semantic information of terms into a probabilistic model to capture the query-related opinion score more accurately .

label: Research method
text: The syntactic tree structure of a sentence is used to evaluate the modifying probability between an opinion term and a noun within the sentence with a tree kernel method .

label: Research method
text: Moreover , WordNet and the probabilistic topic model are used to evaluate the semantic relatedness between any noun and the given query .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results over standard TREC baselines on the benchmark BLOG06 collection demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed method , in comparison with the proximity-based method and other baselines .

label: Research questions
text: Entity linking has been well explored for dissemination-oriented sources such as news stories , blogs , and microblog posts , but the limited work to date on conversational sources such as email or text chat has not yet attempted to determine when the referent entity is not in the knowledge base ( a task known as NIL detection ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article presents a supervised machine learning system for linking named mentions of people in email messages to a collection-specific knowledge base , and that is also capable of NIL detection .

label: Research method
text: This system learns from manually annotated training examples to leverage a rich set of features .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The entity linking accuracy for entities present in the knowledge base is substantially and significantly better than the best previously reported results on the Enron email collection , comparable accuracy is reported for the challenging NIL detection task , and these results are for the first time replicated on a second email collection from a different source with comparable results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the study , we identified 21 RIM services offered to researchers , ranging from discovering , storing , and sharing authored content to identifying expertise , recruiting faculty , and ensuring the diversity of committee assignments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , we identified 15 types of RIM service provision and adoption problems , analyzed their activity structures , and connected them to strategies for their resolution .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we report on skills that the study participants reported as being needed in their work .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions can inform the development of best practice guides for RIM on university campuses .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study also advances the state of the art of RIM research by applying the typology of contradictions from activity theory to categorize the problems of RIM service provision and connect their resolution to theories and Research findings/conclusions of prior studies in the literature .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this way , the research expands the theoretical base used to study RIM in general and RIM at research universities in particular .

label: Research method
text: An approach , BayesAD , is developed for solving this problem : apply a Bayesian segmentation algorithm , followed by a segment clustering algorithm .

label: Research method
text: Results are presented from an empirical comparison between BayesAD and AK , a modified version of an approach published by Akiva and Koppel in 2013 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: BayesAD exhibited greater accuracy than AK in all experiments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , BayesAD has a parameter that needs to be set and which had a nontrivial impact on accuracy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Developing an effective method for eliminating this need would be a fruitful direction for future work .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When controlling for topic , the accuracy levels of BayesAD and AK were , in all but one case , worse than a baseline approach wherein one author was assumed to write all sentences in the input text document .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Hence , room for improved solutions exists .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There is a close relationship between the technologies that a field utilizes and sanctions and the process of inquiry , the character and meaning of corroborative data and evidence , and the kinds of models and theories developed in a field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As the machinery changes , epistemic practices also change .

label: Research questions
text: A case in point is how the epistemic practices of historians are reconfigured by the introduction of Geographic Information Systems ( GIS ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We argue that GIS mediates historical understanding and knowledge creation in at least three ways : ( a ) by allowing historians to bring new sets of data into analysis , ( b ) by introducing novel questions , fresh insights , and new modes of analysis and reasoning , or discovering new answers to older questions ; and ( c ) by providing new tools for historians to communicate with each other and with their audiences .

label: Research questions
text: We illustrate these mediations through the study of the historiography of Budapest Ghettos during World War II .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our study shows how GIS functionalities reveal hitherto unknown aspects of social life in the ghettos , while pushing certain other aspects into the background .

label: Research method
text: This study explores the scattering patterns of patent impact based on citations in 3 distinct technological areas , the liquid crystal , semiconductor , and drug technological areas , to identify the core patents in each area .

label: Research method
text: The research follows the approach from Bradford 's law , which equally divides total citations into 3 zones .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While the result suggests that the scattering of patent citations corresponded with features of Bradford 's law , the proportion of patents in the 3 zones did not match the proportion as proposed by the law .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As a result , the study shows that the distributions of citations in all 3 areas were more concentrated than what Bradford 's law proposed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Groos ( 1967 ) droop was also presented by the scattering of patent citations , and the growth rate of cumulative citation decreased in the third zone .

label: Research questions
text: Our work was undertaken in the context of a new design concept , Privacy Trends , whose aspiration is to foster technology users ' digital literacy regarding ongoing privacy risks and elucidate how such risks fit within existing social , organizational , and political systems , leading to a longer-term privacy concern .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our study reveals 2 challenges for privacy intervention design : the need to develop technology users ' intrinsic motivations with the privacy domain and the importance of framing the concept of privacy within users ' interests .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Setting our study within a design context enables us to identify 4 design opportunities for fostering engagement with the privacy domain through technology design .

label: Research questions
text: Running specialized software , personal devices such as phones and tablets can capture and transmit users location , images , motion , and text input .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The data collected by these devices are both personal ( identifying of an individual ) and participatory ( accessible by that individual for aggregation , analysis , and sharing ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Such participatory personal data provide a new area of inquiry for the information sciences .

label: Research method
text: This article presents a review of literature from diverse fields , including information science , technology studies , surveillance studies , and participatory research traditions to explore how participatory personal data relate to existing personal data collections created by both research and surveillance .

label: Research method
text: It applies three information perspectivesinformation policy , information access and equity , and data curation and preservationto illustrate social impacts and concerns engendered by this new form of data collection .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These perspectives suggest a set of research challenges for information science posed by participatory personal data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The stability of citation rankings over time can be regarded as confirming the validity of evaluative citation analysis .

label: Research method
text: This stability over time was investigated for two sets of citation records from the Web of Science ( Thomson Reuters , Philadelphia , PA ) for articles published in journals classified in Journal Citation Reports as Mathematics .

label: Research method
text: These sets are of all such articles for the 1960s and for the 1970s .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study employs only descriptive statistics and draws no inferences to any larger population .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study found a high correlation from one decade to the next of rankings among sets of most highly cited articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the study found a low correlation for rankings among articles whose ranks were the 500 directly below those of the 500 most cited .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This perhaps expected result is discussed in terms of the Glanzel-Schubert-Schoepflin stochastic model for citation processes and also in connection with an account of the Research questionss of evaluative citation analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This interpretative context suggests why the limitations of citation analysis may be inherent to citation analysis even when it is done well .

label: Research questions
text: Consumer groups and experts have raised concerns about privacy , as smart meters can provide detailed information about activity within the home .

label: Research method
text: This study examines privacy beliefs of U.S. consumers using qualitative data from focus groups together with experimental data from a national online survey of utility customers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Exploratory analysis of focus group Research findings/conclusions suggested that consumers who felt in control of their data perceived fewer risks and more benefits from having access to the data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Participants in the online experiment saw greater risk and less benefit when advised that smart meters could be used to raise prices under time-of-use pricing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Participants also saw greater risk when the utility shared customer data with a third party .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Risks and benefits influenced perceptions of control .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These Research findings/conclusions accord with several information privacy frameworks adding new insights about consumers ' perceived control over their energy data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions can inform utility companies and policymakers with respect to giving consumers more control over their data , reducing consumers ' privacy concerns , communicating benefits of smart meter data , and providing accurate information about the risks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article presents a systematic study regarding the censorship ofbothplain text and multimedia content on the Chinese Internet .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By analyzing both censored and surviving posts on the Chinese social media platform Weibo during the 2014 Hong Kong Umbrella Movement , we find that multimedia posts suffered more intensive censorship deletion than plain text posts , with censorship programs being oriented more toward multimedia content like images than the text content of multimedia posts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis has significant implications for censorship studies , information control , and politics in the post-text era .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The main contribution of our approach is to deal with the imprecision and uncertainty of the indexing task using possibility theory .

label: Research method
text: We enhance estimation of the similarity between a document and a given concept using the two measures of possibility and necessity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Possibility estimates the extent to which a document is not similar to the concept .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The second measure can provide confirmation that the document is similar to the concept .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our contribution also reduces the limitation of partial matching .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although the latter allows extracting from the document other variants of terms than those in dictionaries , it also generates irrelevant information .

label: Research questions
text: Our objective is to filter the index using the knowledge provided by the Unified Medical Language System ( R ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments were carried out on different corpora , showing encouraging results ( the improvement rate is +26.37 % in terms of main average precision when compared with the baseline ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This overlay map technique may support competitive intelligence and policy decision making .

label: Research method
text: The global patent map is based on similarities in citing-to-cited relationships between categories of the International Patent Classification ( IPC ) of European Patent Office ( EPO ) patents from 2000 to 2006 .

label: Research method
text: This patent data set , extracted from the PATSTAT database , includes 760,000 patent records in 466 IPC-based categories .

label: Research method
text: We compare the global patent maps derived from this categorization to related efforts of other global patent maps .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The paper overlays the nanotechnology-related patenting activities of two companies and two different nanotechnology subfields on the global patent map .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The exercise shows the potential of patent overlay maps to visualize technological areas and potentially support decision making .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Furthermore , this study shows that IPC categories that are similar to one another based on citing-to-cited patterns ( and thus close in the global patent map ) are not necessarily in the same hierarchical IPC branch , thereby revealing new relationships between technologies that are classified as pertaining to different ( and sometimes distant ) subject areas in the IPC scheme .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: On closer examination , however , the term holistic is used mainly as a rhetorical device in the literature , rather than as one that embraces the epistemological tenets of a holistic paradigm , and applies these to research design .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper examines this rhetorical use , and explores what it would mean , and why it would matter , to adopt substantively holistic approaches to research .

label: Research method
text: We review relevant literature in library and information science to position past uses of holistic and compare these to the conceptual intentions of holism .

label: Research questions
text: We also outline the concept of holism , itself , with a focus on methodological and ontological holism , which can most deeply inform research design in our discipline .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Greater methodological diversity , including much wider adoption of interpretivist and critical approaches , can address the concerns underlying the use of holistic rhetoric .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We illustrate this central conceptual argument with a roadmap illustrating holistic considerations throughout the research process .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The paper demonstrates that it is possible to shift away from predominantly rhetorical use of holistic , toward paradigmatically holistic research , which will provide for richer analyses of critical phenomena in the discipline .

label: Research method
text: The core component of the model uses inferences along the paths of typed relations between the entities of a knowledge representation for enabling the determination of result sets in the context of retrieval processes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A proposal for a general , but condensed , inventory of typed relations is given .

label: Research method
text: The entities are arranged in aspect-oriented facets to ensure a consistent hierarchical structure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The possible consequences for indexing and retrieval are discussed .

label: Research questions
text: Small humanitarian organizations that help irregular migrants in the United States frequently do not have the resources or expertise to fully address the implications of collecting , storing , and using data about the vulnerable populations they serve .

label: Research questions
text: As a result , there is a risk that their work could exacerbate the vulnerabilities of the very same migrants they are trying to help .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we propose a conceptual framework for protecting privacy in the context of humanitarian information activities ( HIA ) with irregular migrants .

label: Research method
text: We draw from a review of the academic literature as well as interviews with individuals affiliated with several US-based humanitarian organizations , higher education institutions , and nonprofit organizations that provide support to undocumented migrants .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We discuss 3 primary issues : ( i ) HIA present both technological and human risks ; ( ii ) the expectation of privacy self-management by vulnerable populations is problematic ; and ( iii ) there is a need for robust , actionable , privacy-related guidelines for HIA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We suggest 5 recommendations to strengthen the privacy protection offered to undocumented migrants and other vulnerable populations .

label: Research questions
text: The review focuses on the expanded notion of videogames ( the EN ) , a concept this paper introduces to collectively refer to the cultural and social aspects of videogamesfor example , game culture , experiences , play , and community life and activity .

label: Research method
text: The study 's research aims are pursued on the basis of a critical systematic literature review of 42 publications originating from academic research and videogame-archiving projects .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study 's main finding is that the archiving literature construes the EN of videogames in three principal ways : i ) as an essential part of the videogame as an archival object ; ii ) as a useful resource in archiving videogames , able to provide documentation of game culture and social context ; and iii ) as a useful resource in inquiries focused on the current state and recent history of society and culture from a sociotechnical viewpoint .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study suggests videogame community dynamics , videogame ontology , the development of archival theory , and videogame-archive studies as rewarding directions for further research .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we introduce SemGraph , an unsupervised algorithm for extracting keyphrases from a collection of texts based on a semantic relationship graph .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The main novelty of this algorithm is its ability to identify semantic relationships between words whose presence is statistically significant .

label: Research method
text: Our method constructs a co-occurrence graph in which words appearing in the same document are linked , provided their presence in the collection is statistically significant with respect to a null model .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Furthermore , the graph obtained is enriched with information from WordNet .

label: Research method
text: We have used the most recent and standardized benchmark to evaluate the system ability to detect the keyphrases that are part of the text .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The result is a method that achieves an improvement of 5.3 % and 7.28 % in F measure over the two labeled sets of keyphrases used in the evaluation of SemEval-2010 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , both clinical information retrieval research innovation and legitimate privacy concerns can be served by the creation of intrainstitutional , fully protected resources .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we provide some principles and tools for information retrieval resource-building in the unique problem setting of patient-level information retrieval , following the tradition of the Cranfield paradigm .

label: Research method
text: We further include an analysis of parallel information retrieval resources at Oregon Health & Science University and Mayo Clinic that were built on these principles .

label: Research questions
text: The concepts of meaning-making , transitioning , and information seeking in deeply meaningful and profoundly personal contexts are used in order to understand transgender individuals ' information seeking in the contexts of gender identity formation .

label: Research method
text: Based on the literature , emotions and information seeking connected to a significant life change were divided into four phases to study how they could be identified in the 25 qualitative interviews with transgender individuals from Finland between the ages of 15 and 72 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the Research findings/conclusions of this study , in significant life changes , an individual needs reliable , sensible and identifiable information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Serendipitous encounters and embodied experiences characterize information seeking during transitional stages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Peer communities are important for minorities in order to find places where interviewees feel safe to share information and experiences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These communities can also be found online .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The concept of deeply meaningful information highlights the effect information has on information seekers .

label: Research questions
text: Deeply meaningful information can serve as a trigger for life change , helping people forward during the transitions .

label: Research method
text: This article explores this assertion via systematic analysis of studies published in journals between 1950 and 2012 .

label: Research method
text: Five time periods and four journals were sampled , including 1,391 journal articles , 915 of which were empirical studies .
