label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on these samples , the percentage of studies of information outcomes climbed from zero in the 1950s and 1960s , to 8 % in recent research reports .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The barriers to studying information outcomes and possible future research on this topic are explored .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: However , much less is known about such internationalization in the social sciences .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we analyze international and domestic coauthorship relations of all citable items in the DVD version of the Social Sciences Citation Index 2011 ( SSCI ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Network statistics indicate 4 groups of nations : ( a ) an Asian-Pacific one to which all Anglo-Saxon nations ( including the United Kingdom and Ireland ) are attributed , ( b ) a continental European one including also the Latin-American countries , ( c ) the Scandinavian nations , and ( d ) a community of African nations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Within the EU-28 , 11 of the EU-15 states have dominant positions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In many respects , the network parameters are not so different from the Science Citation Index .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In addition to these descriptive statistics , we address the question of the relative weights of the international versus domestic networks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An information-theoretical test is proposed at the level of organizational addresses within each nation ; the results are mixed , but the international dimension is more important than the national one in the aggregated sets ( as in the Science Citation Index ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In some countries ( e.g. , France ) , however , the national distribution is leading more than the international one .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Decomposition of the United States in terms of states shows a similarly mixed result ; more U.S. states are domestically oriented in the SSCI and more internationally in the SCI .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The international networks have grown during the last decades in addition to the national ones but not by replacing them .

label: Research method
text: We have surveyed 200 computer science publications , 100 journal articles , and 100 conference papers , using self-citations to identify potential and actual continuations .

label: Research questions
text: We are interested in determining the proportion of papers that do indeed continue , how and when the continuation takes place , and whether any distinctions are found between the journal and conference populations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite the implicit assumption of a research line behind each paper , manifest in the ubiquitous future research notes that close many of them , we find that more than 70 % of the papers are never continued .

label: Research questions
text: However , treating all citations with equal weight ignores the wide variety of functions that citations perform .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We want to automatically identify the subset of references in a bibliography that have a central academic influence on the citing paper .

label: Research questions
text: For this Research questions , we examine the effectiveness of a variety of features for determining the academic influence of a citation .

label: Research method
text: By asking authors to identify the key references in their own work , we created a data set in which citations were labeled according to their academic influence .

label: Research method
text: Using automatic feature selection with supervised machine learning , we found a model for predicting academic influence that achieves good performance on this data set using only four features .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The best features , among those we evaluated , were those based on the number of times a reference is mentioned in the body of a citing paper .

label: Research method
text: The performance of these features inspired us to design an influence-primed h-index ( the hip-index ) .

label: Research method
text: Unlike the conventional h-index , it weights citations by how many times a reference is mentioned .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: According to our experiments , the hip-index is a better indicator of researcher performance than the conventional h-index .

label: Research method
text: We use the same Thomson Reuters data set of about 4.4 million articles used in Crespo et al .

label: Research method
text: ( 2013a ) to analyze 22 broad fields .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main results are the following : First , when the classification system goes from 22 fields to 219 subfields the effect on citation inequality of differences in citation practices increases from similar to 14 % at the field level to 18 % at the subfield level .

label: Research method
text: Second , we estimate a set of exchange rates ( ERs ) over a wide [ 660 , 978 ] citation quantile interval to express the citation counts of articles into the equivalent counts in the all-sciences case .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the fractional case , for example , we find that in 187 of 219 subfields the ERs are reliable in the sense that the coefficient of variation is smaller than or equal to 0.10 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Third , in the fractional case the normalization of the raw data using the ERs ( or subfield mean citations ) as normalization factors reduces the importance of the differences in citation practices from 18 % to 3.8 % ( 3.4 % ) of overall citation inequality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Fourth , the results in the fractional case are essentially replicated when we adopt a multiplicative approach .

label: Research method
text: It was written by Walker Lundy of the Charlotte Observer in Charlotte , NC , USA on August 6 , 2016 .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The article was shocking , even to a non-U.S. citizen , because it revealed the sudden , and unexpected , withdrawal of Donald J. Trump from the U.S. Presidential race , which would surely have been welcome news for the Hillary Clinton camp .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Less than 24 hours later , that article could no longer be traced on Yahoo , and the original links led to a 404 error .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The original story is still published on another Charlotte Observer webpage .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: National and independent polls related to the presidential election fluctuate , but pollsters are always influenced by news events related to either candidate .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Yet , one has to wonder why Mr. Lundy would have published a false and misleading story , which was widely circulated , including by the powerful media engine Yahoo , that has serious national and international consequences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Some of the policies espoused by both presidential candidates are radically different , and thus any media story that can tilt the opinion of readers in the direction of one or other candidate needs to be carefully analyzed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Sowing doubt by using false or misleading journalism does not do the public any favors and casts a doubtful light on the practice of political journalism .

label: Research method
text: The Charlotte Observer and Mr. Lundy failed to respond to a request for comment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The result of the analysis is a conceptual framework of Information Quality ( IQ ) measures designed for validating contradictory sources of attribution on the basis of a documentary , evidence-based approach .

label: Research questions
text: The aim is to develop an ontology-based ranking model for recommending artwork attributions and support historians and catalogers ' decision-making process .

label: Research method
text: The conceptual framework was evaluated by means of a user study and the evaluation of a web application leveraging the aforementioned ranking model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of the survey demonstrate that the Research findings/conclusions satisfy users ' expectations and are potentially applicable to other types of information in the arts and humanities field .

label: Research questions
text: Although context-aware recommender systems ( CARS ) have been widely analyzed , personalized pricing or discount optimization in recommender systems to improve recommendations ' accuracy and commercial KPIs has hardly been researched .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article studies how to model user-item personalized discount sensitivity and incorporate it into a real time contextual recommender system in such a way that it can be integrated into a commercial service .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We propose a novel approach for modeling context-aware user-item personalized discount sensitivity in a sparse data scenario and present a new CARS algorithm that combines coclustering and random forest classification ( CBRF ) to incorporate the personalized discount sensitivity .

label: Research method
text: We conducted an experimental study with real consumers and mobile discount coupons to evaluate our solution .

label: Research method
text: We compared the CBRF algorithm to the widely used context-aware matrix factorization ( CAMF ) algorithm .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results suggest that incorporating personalized discount sensitivity significantly improves the consumption prediction accuracy and that the suggested CBRF algorithm provides better prediction results for this use case .

label: Research method
text: To better understand the nature of these tags , we analyzed tags assigned to a collection of 100 images of art ( provided by the steve .

label: Research method
text: museum project ) using subject matter categorization .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that the majority of tags describe the people and objects in the image and are generic in nature .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This contradicts prior subject matter analyses of queries , tags , and index terms of other image collections , suggesting that the nature of social tags largely depends on the type of collection and on user needs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This insight may help cultural heritage institutions improve their management and use of tags .

label: Research questions
text: It is not uncommon to reuse versatile decorative shape patterns across batiks .

label: Research questions
text: General-Research questions image retrieval methods often fail to pay sufficient attention to such a frequent reuse of shape patterns in the graphical compositions of batiks , leading to suboptimal retrieval results , in particular for identifying batiks that use copyrighted shape patterns without proper authorization for law-enforcement Research questionss .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To address the lack of an optimized image retrieval method suited for batiks , this study proposes a new method for retrieving salient shape patterns in batiks using a rich combination of global and local features .

label: Research method
text: The global features deployed were extracted according to the Zernike moments ( ZMs ) ; the local features adopted were extracted through curvelet transformations that characterize shape contours embedded in batiks .

label: Research method
text: The method subsequently incorporated both types of features via matching a weighted bipartite graph to measure the visual similarity between any pair of batik shape patterns through supervised distance metric learning .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The derived similarity metric can then be used to detect and retrieve similar shape patterns appearing across batiks , which in turn can be employed as a reliable similarity metric for retrieving batiks .

label: Research method
text: To explore the usefulness of the proposed method , the performance of the new retrieval method is compared against that of three peer methods as well as two variants of the proposed method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results consistently and convincingly demonstrate that the new method indeed outperforms the state-of-the-art methods in retrieving salient shape patterns in batiks .

label: Research questions
text: In theoretical models of trust in information , the concept of trustworthiness is emerging as both fundamentally important and understudied , particularly in the domain of digital repositories .

label: Research method
text: This article reports on a qualitative study designed to elicit from groups of end users components of trustworthiness and to assess their relative importance .

label: Research method
text: The study draws on interview data from 3 focus groups with experienced users of the Washington State Digital Archives .

label: Research method
text: Utilizing thematic analysis and micro-interlocutor analysis to examine a combination of interview transcripts and video recordings , the study provides a realistic picture of the strength and character of emergent themes that underpin the more general concept of trustworthiness .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study reinforces the centrality of trustworthiness at the individual document level , but calls into question the formulation of trustworthiness as a concept in Kelton , Fleischmann , and Wallace 's ( 2008 ) Integrated Model of Trust in Information .

label: Research method
text: It studies articles published in a single journal : the Journal of Informetrics ( JOI ) , in the first year the journal was published , 2007 .

label: Research method
text: The analysis classified the citations into in-and out-disciplinary content and looked at their use within the articles ' sections such as introduction , literature review , methodology , Research findings/conclusions , discussion , and conclusions .

label: Research method
text: In addition , it took into account the age of cited articles .

label: Research method
text: A thematic analysis of these citations was performed in order to identify the evolution of topics within the articles sections and the journal 's content .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A matrix describing the relationships between the citations ' use , and their in- and out-disciplinary focus within the articles ' sections is presented .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions show that an analysis of citations based on their in-and out-disciplinary orientation within the context of the articles ' sections can be an indication of the manner by which cross-disciplinary science works , and reveals the connections between the issues , methods , analysis , and conclusions coming from different research disciplines .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a study that investigated this issue by comparing Google Trends and Baidu Index .

label: Research method
text: Data from these two services are based on queries entered by users into Google and Baidu , two of the largest search engines in the world .

label: Research method
text: We first compared the features and functions of the two services based on documents and extensive testing .

label: Research method
text: We then carried out an empirical study that collected query volume data from the two sources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that data from both sources could be used to predict the quality of Chinese universities and companies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite the differences between the two services in terms of technology , such as differing methods of language processing , the search volume data from the two were highly correlated and combining the two data sources did not improve the predictive power of the data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , there was a major difference between the two in terms of data availability .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Baidu Index was able to provide more search volume data than Google Trends did .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis showed that the disadvantage of Google Trends in this regard was due to Google 's smaller user base in China .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The implication of this finding goes beyond China .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Google 's user bases in many countries are smaller than that in China , so the search volume data related to those countries could result in the same issue as that related to China .

label: Research method
text: By using information retrieval and meta-search approaches , different types of referential metadata , such as related Wikipedia pages , data sets , source code , video lectures , presentation slides , and ( online ) tutorials for scientific publications and scientific topics will be automatically retrieved , associated , and ranked .

label: Research method
text: In order to test our method of automatic cyberlearning referential metadata generation , we designed a user experiment to validate the quality of the metadata for each scientific keyword and publication and resource-ranking algorithm .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Evaluation results show that the cyberlearning referential metadata retrieved via meta-search and statistical relevance ranking can help students better understand the essence of scientific keywords and publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Theoretically these two types of articles are independent , in the sense that suffering delayed recognition depends on the number and time distribution of received citations , while being an under-cited influential article depends only partially on the number of received ( first generation ) citations , and much more on second and third citation generations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among 49 articles suffering delayed recognition we found 13 that are also under-cited influential .

label: Research method
text: Based on a thorough investigation of these special cases we found that so-called authoritative citers play an important role in uniting the two different document types into a special citation chimera .

label: Research method
text: Our investigation contributes to the classification of publications .

label: Research questions
text: The success of a website therefore depends on its ability to improve consumers ' perceptions of privacy assurance .

label: Research questions
text: Seals and assurance statements are mechanisms often used to increase this assurance ; however , the Research findings/conclusions of the extant literature regarding the effectiveness of these tools are mixed .

label: Research questions
text: We propose a model based on the elaboration likelihood model ( ELM ) that explains conditions under which privacy assurance is more or less effective , clarifying the contradictory Research findings/conclusions in previous literature .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We test our model in a free-simulation online experiment , and the results of the analysis indicate that the inclusion of assurance statements and the combination , understanding , and assurance of seals influence privacy assurance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Privacy assurance is most effective when seals and statements are accompanied by the peripheral cues of website quality and brand image and when counter-argumentation-through transaction risk-is minimized .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Importantly , we show ELM to be an appropriate theoretical lens to explain the equivocal results in the literature .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we suggest theoretical and practical implications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , the different understandings of SI in regional communities have strong impacts , and each has a different history , methodological grounding , and often a different thematic focus .

label: Research questions
text: The aim of this article is to connect three selected perspectives on SI-intellectual ( regional schools of thought ) , methodological , and thematic-and introduce a comparative framework for understanding SI that includes all known approaches .

label: Research method
text: Thus , the article draws from a thematic and methodological grounding of research across schools of thought , along with definitions that rely on the extension and intension of the notion of SI .

label: Research method
text: The article is built on a paralogy of views and pluralism typical of postmodern science .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Because SI is forced to continually reform its research focus , due to the rapid development of information and communication technology , social changes and ideologies that surround computerization and informatization , the presented perspective maintains a high degree of flexibility , without the need to constantly redefine the boundaries , as is typical in modern science .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This approach may support further developments in promoting and understanding SI worldwide .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We looked at one aspect of the interactions between reviewers and authors , the use of politeness in reviewers ' comments .

label: Research method
text: Drawing on Brown and Levinson 's ( 1987 ) politeness theory , we analyzed how politeness strategies were employed by reviewers to mitigate their criticisms in an open peer-review process of a special track of a human-computer interaction conference .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found evidence of frequent use of politeness strategies and that open peer-review processes hold unique challenges and opportunities for using politeness strategies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions revealed that less experienced researchers tended to express unmitigated criticism more often than did experienced researchers , and that reviewers tended to use more positive politeness strategies ( e.g. , compliments ) toward less experienced authors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on our Research findings/conclusions , we discuss implications for research communities and the design of peer-reviewing processes and the information systems that support them .

label: Research questions
text: Our idea consists of two main aspects : engaging wider society with usability and distributing the topic across disciplines .

label: Research questions
text: We claim that bad usability is a social justice issue .

label: Research questions
text: Primarily , we propose that usability should become the subject of widespread activism across society , enabling more people to realize that their usability problems are not due to inadequacies in themselves but in current designs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: People should be encouraged and enabled to complain about their experiences with an expectation of improvements .

label: Research questions
text: We also propose that the current restriction of this topic to certain disciplinary units is overly narrow and that instead there should be radical embedding of usability concepts across many different fields and settings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We believe that the usability of information systems is core to information science and that information scientists should resume their historic role as heralds and pioneers of human-computer interaction .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Many of these cautionary notes are alarmist and unrealistic , and while there has been some push-back on these concerns , the deep flaws in the thinking that leads to them have not been called out .

label: Research questions
text: Much of the fear and trepidation is based on misunderstanding and confusion about what AI is and can ever be .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this work we identify 3 factors that contribute to this AI anxiety : an exclusive focus on AI programs that leaves humans out of the picture , confusion about autonomy in computational entities and in humans , and an inaccurate conception of technological development .

label: Research questions
text: With this analysis we argue that there are good reasons for anxiety about AI but not for the reasons typically given by AI alarmists .

label: Research method
text: Using a questionnaire on metrics use and publication practices in Australia and Sweden , we tested the assumption that indicators play a minor role among humanities scholars .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions show that our respondents use indicators to a considerable degree , with a range of indicators and rankings being employed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The scholars use metrics as part of institutional policy , in CVs and applications , as well as for general promotion of their work .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Notable in our results is that a much larger share of researchers ( 62 % ) in Australia used metrics compared to Sweden ( 14 % ) .

label: Research questions
text: Scholar 's attitudes regarding bibliometrics are mixed ; many are critical of these measures , while at the same time feeling pressured to use them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One main tension described by our respondents is between intradisciplinary criteria of quality and formalized indicators , and negotiating these orders of worth is a challenging balancing act , especially for younger researchers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: According to the normative point of view , the behavior of scientists is regulated by norms that make the detection of citation patterns useful for the interpretation of bibliometric measures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: According to the constructivist perspective , citer behavior is influenced by other factors linked to the social and/or psychological sphere that do not allow any statistical inferences that are useful for the Research questionss of interpretation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An intermediate position supports normative theories in describing citer behavior with respect to high citation frequencies and constructivist theories with respect to low citation counts .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , this idea was tested in a case study of the Italian sociology community .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Italian sociology is characterized by an unusual organization into three political or ideological camps , and belonging to one camp can be considered a potentially strong constructivist reason to cite .

label: Research method
text: An all-author co-citation analysis was performed to map the structure of the Italian sociology community and look for evidence of three camps .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We did not expect to find evidence of this configuration in the co-citation map .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The map , in fact , included authors who obtained high citation counts that are supposedly produced by a normative-oriented behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results confirmed this hypothesis and showed that the clusters seemed to be divided according to topic and not by camp .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Relevant scientific works were cited by the members of the entire community regardless of their membership in any particular camp .

label: Research method
text: Participants were asked to draw the face of a 3D visualization after it was cut in half .

label: Research method
text: We videotaped the participants as they drew , erased , verbalized their thoughts , gestured , and moved about a two-dimensional paper presentation of the 3D visualization .

label: Research method
text: The videorecords were analyzed using a grounded theory approach to generate hypotheses related to comprehension difficulties and visualization properties .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis of the results uncovered three properties that made problem solving more difficult for participants .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These were : ( a ) cuts that were at an angle in relation to at least one plane of reference , ( b ) nonplanar properties of the features contained in the 3D visualizations including curved layers and v-shaped layers , and ( c ) mixed combinations of layers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In contrast , ( a ) cutting planes that were perpendicular or parallel to the 3D visualization diagram 's planes of reference , ( b ) internal features that were flat/planar , and ( c ) homogeneous layers were easier to comprehend .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This research has direct implications for the generation and use of 3D information visualizations in that it suggests design features to include and avoid .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Here , Tolstoy means that for a family to be happy , several key aspects must be given ( e.g. , good health of all family members , acceptable financial security , and mutual affection ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: If there is a deficiency in any one or more of these key aspects , the family will be unhappy .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we introduce the Anna Karenina principle as a way of thinking about success in science in three central areas in ( modern ) science : ( a ) peer review of research grant proposals and manuscripts ( money and journal space as scarce resources ) , ( b ) citation of publications ( reception as a scarce resource ) , and ( c ) new scientific discoveries ( recognition as a scarce resource ) .

label: Research questions
text: If resources are scarce at the highly competitive research front ( journal space , funds , reception , and recognition ) , there can be success only when several key prerequisites for the allocation of the resources are fulfilled .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: If any one of these prerequisites is not fulfilled , the grant proposal , manuscript submission , the published paper , or the discovery will not be successful .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study investigates the RCR by correlating it on the level of single publications with established field-normalized indicators and assessments of the publications by peers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that the RCR correlates highly with established field-normalized indicators , but the correlation between RCR and peer assessments is only low to medium .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From this theory , it follows that journal editors might employ biased reviewers because they shirk less .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This creates an incentive for the editor to use monitoring mechanisms ( e.g. , associate editors supervising the peer review process ) that mitigate the resulting bias in the reviewers ' recommendations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The supervision of associate editors could encourage journal editors to employ more extreme reviewers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This theory helps to explain the presence of bias in peer review .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To mitigate shirking by a reviewer , the journal editor may assign biased referees to generate information about the manuscript 's quality and subject the reviewer 's recommendations to supervision by a more aligned associate editor .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Definitions of such measures have ranged from using distance-based calculations over WordNet or other taxonomies to statistical distributional metrics over document collections such as Wikipedia or the Web .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Existing measures do not explicitly consider the domain associations of terms when calculating relatedness : This article demonstrates that domain matters .

label: Research method
text: We construct a data set of pairs of terms with associated domain information and extract pairs that are scored nearly identical by a sample of existing semantic-relatedness measures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that human judgments reliably score those pairs containing terms from the same domain as significantly more related than cross-domain pairs , even though the semantic-relatedness measures assign the pairs similar scores .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We provide further evidence for this result using a machine learning setting by demonstrating that domain is an informative feature when learning a metric .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that existing relatedness measures do not account for domain in the same way or to the same extent as do human judges .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An important component of these are policies that deal with anonymity : The rules that govern the concealment and transparency of information related to identities of the various stakeholders ( authors , reviewers , editors , and others ) involved in the peer-review process .

label: Research questions
text: Anonymity policies have been a subject of debate for several decades within scholarly communities .

label: Research questions
text: Because of widespread criticism of traditional peer-review processes , a variety of new peer-review processes have emerged that manage the trade-offs between disclosure and concealment of identities in different ways .

label: Research method
text: Based on an analysis of policies and guidelines for authors and reviewers provided by publication venues , we developed a framework for understanding how disclosure and concealment of identities is managed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We discuss the appropriate role of information technology and computer support for the peer-review process within that framework .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Inappropriate use of anomalous literature is evinced by citation of invalidated scholarly works , and though it is known that republished versions of articles are cited more often than corrected versions , the strength of the effect of invalidation , correction , and republication has not been previously quantified .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Robust analysis of 15,000+ citations to 548 articles indexed in PubMed indicates that the practice of correction and republication is a strong predictor of reduced post-republication citation relative to controls .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This bibliometric analysis shows that corrected articles are cited on average 51 % less than controls overall and that the practice of correction and republication results in a fast-acting and long-lasting reduction in citation of flawed works by downstream researchers .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we investigated how the language used in TED talks influenced popularity and viewer ratings .

label: Research method
text: We also investigated the differences in linguistic style and ratings of talks given by academics and non-academics .

label: Research method
text: The transcripts of 1866 talks were analyzed using the Linguistic Inquiry and Word Count program and eight language variables were correlated with number of views and viewer ratings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that talks with more analytic language received fewer views , while a greater use of the pronoun I , positive emotion and social words was associated with more views .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Talks with these linguistic characteristics received more emotional viewer ratings such as inspiring or courageous .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When comparing talks by academics and non-academics , there was no difference in the overall popularity but viewers rated talks by academics as more fascinating , informative , and persuasive while non-academics received higher emotional ratings .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The implications for understanding social influence processes are discussed .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article follows up on previous research from 2009 on this subject .

label: Research method
text: We reexamined tweets from the US Congress collected in early 2017 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found Congressional tweeting habits and content have changed very little in the last 8 years .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , they tended to use Twitter to pass along political information and links in addition to reporting on official and unofficial activities and meetings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We discuss future spaces for research that go beyond content analysis into issues of motivation , communication , and impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The data show the more countries there are involved in the collaboration , the greater the gain in impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Contrary to what we expected , the scientific impact of a country does not significantly influence the benefit it derives from collaboration , but does seem to positively influence the benefit obtained by the other countries collaborating with it .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although there was a weak correlation between these two classes of benefit , the countries with the highest impact were clear outliers from this correlation , tending to provide proportionally more benefit to their collaborating countries than they themselves obtained .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Two surprising Research findings/conclusions were the null benefit resulting from collaboration with Iran , and the small benefit resulting from collaboration with the United States despite its high impact .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous work on personalized search focuses on using the content of the user 's query and of the documents clicked to model the user 's preference .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper we focus on a different type of signal : We investigate the use of behavioral information for the Research questions of search personalization .

label: Research method
text: That is , we consider clicks and dwell time for reranking an initially retrieved list of documents .

label: Research method
text: In particular , we ( i ) investigate the impact of distributions of users and queries on document reranking ; ( ii ) estimate the relevance of a document for a query at 2 levels , at the query-level and at the word-level , to alleviate the problem of sparseness ; and ( iii ) perform an experimental evaluation both for users seen during the training period and for users not seen during training .

label: Research method
text: For the latter , we explore the use of information from similar users who have been seen during the training period .

label: Research method
text: We use the dwell time on clicked documents to estimate a document 's relevance to a query , and perform Bayesian probabilistic matrix factorization to generate a relevance distribution of a document over queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our experiments show that : ( i ) for personalized ranking , behavioral information helps to improve retrieval effectiveness ; and ( ii ) given a query , merging information inferred from behavior of a particular user and from behaviors of other users with a user-dependent adaptive weight outperforms any combination with a fixed weight .

label: Research questions
text: Digital platforms increasingly allow these annotations to be shared in group and public environments .

label: Research method
text: To explore scholars ' current behavior and attitudes toward shared annotations , semistructured interviews with 20 doctoral students were conducted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions suggest that sociocognitive processes are integral to scholars ' creation and use of shared annotations .

label: Research questions
text: However , although scholars clearly support creating and using shared annotations , several sociocognitive hurdles have hampered adoption of scholarly shared annotation systems .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article discusses common themes emerging from the Research findings/conclusions and relates them to research on shared annotations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In just one simple network map , we get the relevant citation environment of a specific seed journal .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It is of interest to librarians , publishers , scientists and science policy makers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These journal citation network maps are useful for these various stakeholders in and around the science system , as they provide information on the level of journal connections , unlike the more traditional structures such as the Journal Subject Categories , the classification system applied in the products of Thomson Reuters ( Journal Citation Reports , Web of Science , etc . ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These network maps show the closest relations journals can have , based on citation relations , suggesting influence relations between journals in such a way that traditional field boundaries are transcended .

label: Research questions
text: Browsing a collection through LCSH is difficult using current online tools in part because users can not explore the structure using their existing experience navigating file hierarchies on their hard drives .

label: Research questions
text: This is due to inconsistencies in the LCSH structure , which does not adhere to the specific rules defining tree structures .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article proposes a method to adapt the LCSH structure to reflect a real-world collection from the domain of science and engineering .

label: Research method
text: This structure is transformed into a valid tree structure using an automatic process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis of the resulting LCSH tree shows a large and complex structure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis of the distribution of information within the LCSH tree reveals a power law distribution where the vast majority of subjects contain few information items and a few subjects contain the vast majority of the collection .

label: Research method
text: A hypernetwork for social tagging is constructed in which a tagging action is expressed as a hyperedge and the user , resource , and tag are expressed as nodes .

label: Research method
text: Quantitative measures for the constructed hypernetwork are defined , including the hyperdegree and its distribution , the excess average hyperdegree , and the hyperdegree conditional probability distribution .

label: Research method
text: Using the data set from Delicious , an empirical study was conducted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The empirical results show that multiple individual tags and one or very few popular tags are generally employed together in one tagging action , and the usage patterns and regularities of tags with varying popularity are correlated to both user activity and resource interest .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The empirical results are further discussed and explained from the perspectives of tag functions and motivations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , suggestions regarding the usage of various popular tags for both tagging users and service providers of social tagging are given .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article contributes something new to the conversation as the first arts-informed , visual , empirical study of information utilizing the draw-and-write technique .

label: Research method
text: To approach the concept of information afresh , graduate students at a North American iSchool were asked to respond to the question What is information ?

label: Research method
text: by drawing on a 4- by 4-inch piece of paper , called an iSquare .

label: Research method
text: One hundred thirty-seven iSquares were produced and then analyzed using compositional interpretation combined with a theoretical framework of graphic representations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions indicate how students visualize information , what was drawn , and associations between the iSquares and prior renderings of information based on words .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the iSquares , information appears most often as pictures of people , artifacts , landscapes , and patterns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There are also many link diagrams , grouping diagrams , symbols , and written text , each with distinct qualities .

label: Research method
text: Methodological reflections address the relationship between visual and textual data , and the sample for the study is critiqued .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A discussion presents new directions for theory and research on information , namely , the iSquares as a thinking tool , visual stories of information , and the contradictions of information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Ideas are also provided on the use of arts-informed , visual methods and the draw-and-write technique in the classroom .

label: Research method
text: A researcher 's Nobel number for a given discipline in a given year is defined as the researcher 's average coauthorship distance to that discipline 's Nobel laureates in that year .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Plotting Nobel numbers over several decades provides a quantitative as well as visual indication of a researcher 's proximity to the intuitive center of a discipline as defined by recognized scientific achievement .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is shown that the Nobel number distributions for physics of several researchers both within and outside of physics are surprisingly flat over the five-decade span from 1951 to 2000 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A model in which Nobel laureates are typically connected by short coauthorship paths both intergenerationally and between subdisciplines reproduces such flat Nobel number distributions .

text: Most research to date has focused on value as perceived by consumers , while consumers are increasingly involved in online processes of information production .

label: Research questions

label: Research questions
text: This study places participants in the position of producing or consuming information in order to assess effects of peer group size on value perceptions .

label: Research method
text: Six hundred and fifty one participants took part in 16 information consumption and production experiments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Consumers read information and producers created the same information .

label: Research method
text: Consumers ' willingness-to-pay and producers ' willingness-to-accept payment were measured before or after peer consumption and production .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results indicate that value perception is highest when participants consume information individually , declining in small and medium-sized groups and growing in mass consumption .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Generally , post-consumption values are higher .

label: Research method
text: In production , point of measurement is cardinal .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Before production , value perceived individually is lowest , however , having experienced peer production , individuals ascribe the highest value to self-production .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Value perceptions in massive groups converge .

label: Research questions
text: However , operationalizations of disciplinarity often demarcate the boundaries of disciplines by standard classification schemes , which may be inflexible to changes in the participation profile of that discipline .

label: Research method
text: To address this limitation , a metric called venue-author-coupling ( VAC ) is proposed and illustrated using journals from the Journal Citation Report 's ( JCR ) library science and information science category .

label: Research questions
text: As JCRs are some of the most frequently used categories in bibliometric analyses , this allows for an examination of the extent to which the journals in JCR categories can be considered as proxies for disciplines .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By extending the idea of bibliographic coupling , VAC identifies similarities among journals based on the similarities of their author profiles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The employment of this method using information science and library science journals provides evidence of four distinct subfields , that is , management information systems , specialized information and library science , library science-focused , and information science-focused research .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The proposed VAC method provides a novel way to examine disciplinarity from the perspective of author communities .

label: Research method
text: The number and type of references that scientists include in their papers are analyzed , the relationship between the number of references and different impact-based indicators is studied from a multivariable perspective , and the referencing patterns of scientists are related to individual factors such as their age and scientific performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show inter-area differences in the number , type , and age of references .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Within each area , the number of references per document increases with journal impact factor and paper length .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Top-performance scientists use in their papers a higher number of references , which are more recent and more frequently covered by the Web of Science .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Veteran researchers tend to rely more on older literature and non-Web of Science sources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The longer reference lists of top scientists can be explained by their tendency to publish in high impact factor journals , with stricter reference and reviewing requirements .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Long reference lists suggest a broader knowledge on the current literature in a field , which is important to become a top scientist .

label: Research questions
text: From the perspective of the handicap principle theory , the sustained use of a high number of references in an author 's oeuvre is a costly behavior that may indicate a serious , comprehensive , and solid research capacity , but that only the best researchers can afford .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Boosting papers ' citations by artificially increasing the number of references does not seem a feasible strategy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that ( a ) at the macro level , tag growth in all the three tagging systems obeys power law distribution with exponents lower than 1 ; at the micro level , the tag growth of popular resources in all three tagging systems follows a similar power law distribution ; ( b ) the exponents of tag growth vary in different evolving stages of resources ; ( c ) the growth of number of taggers associated with different popular resources presents a feature of convergence over time ; ( d ) the active level of taggers has a positive correlation with the macro-tag growth of different tagging systems ; and ( e ) some topics evolve into several subtopics over time while others experience relatively stable stages in which their contents do not change much , and certain groups of taggers continue their interests in them .

text: This article reports the results of an international survey of authors ( n = 11,883 ) , comparing the responses of OAMJ authors with those of other OA and subscription journals , and drawing comparisons between different OAMJs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Strikingly , OAMJ authors showed a low understanding of soundness-only peer review : two-thirds believed OAMJs took into account novelty , significance , and relevance , although there were marked geographical variations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Author satisfaction with OAMJs , however , was high , with more than 80 % of OAMJ authors saying they would publish again in the same journal , although there were variations by title , and levels were slightly lower than subscription journals ( over 90 % ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Their reasons for choosing to publish in OAMJs included a wide variety of factors , not significantly different from reasons given by authors of other journals , with the most important including the quality of the journal and quality of peer review .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: About half of OAMJ articles had been submitted elsewhere before submission to the OAMJ with some evidence of a cascade of articles between journals from the same publisher .

text: All search tasks were extracted and classified under various task categories according to users ' intentions , task goals , and substances of the tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results suggest four Research findings/conclusions : ( i ) Search activity is integrally associated with the users ' creative processes .

label: Research questions
text: The content users have seen prior to searching more often triggers search , and is used as a query , within creative tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: ( ii ) Searching within intellectual and creative tasks is more time-intensive , while search activity occurring as a part of daily routine tasks is associated with more frequent searching within a search task .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: ( iii ) Searching is more often induced from utility applications in tasks demanding a degree of intellectual effort .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: ( iv ) Users ' leisure information-seeking activity is occurring inherently within social media services or comes from social communication platforms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When measured with respect to the terms used , a power-law distribution , a comparison of terms used as tags and descriptors , social network analysis ( including centrality , overall structure , and role equivalent ) and frequent-pattern tree analysis , little similarity was found between the mental models of taggers and experts .

label: Research findings/conclusions

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Title-and topic-related keyword categories were the most popular keyword categories used in path-based rules of frequent-pattern trees , and also the most popular members of 25 patterns and the starting point of the 12 identical rules .

label: Research method
text: First , we conducted a large-scale classification study ( similar to 50,000 queries ) using a crowdsourcing approach .

label: Research method
text: Next , we used clickthrough data from a search engine log and validated the judgments given by the jurors from the crowdsourcing study .

label: Research method
text: Finally , we conducted an online survey on a commercial search engine 's portal .

label: Research method
text: Because we used the same queries for all three studies , we also were able to compare the results and the effectiveness of the different approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that neither the crowdsourcing approach , using jurors who classified queries originating from other users , nor the questionnaire approach , using searchers who were asked about their own query that they just entered into a Web search engine , led to satisfying results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This leads us to conclude that there was little understanding of the classification tasks , even though both groups of jurors were given detailed instructions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although we used manual classification , our research also has important implications for automatic classification .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We must question the success of approaches using automatic classification and comparing its performance to a baseline from human jurors .

label: Research questions
text: In a knowledge-intensive environment , knowledge workers need to access task-related codified knowledge ( documents ) to perform tasks .

label: Research questions
text: A worker 's document referencing behavior can be modeled as a knowledge flow ( KF ) to represent the evolution of his or her information needs over time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Document recommendation methods can proactively support knowledge workers in the performance of tasks by recommending appropriate documents to meet their information needs .

label: Research questions
text: However , most traditional recommendation methods do not consider workers KFs or the information needs of the majority of a group of workers with similar KFs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A group 's needs may partially reflect the needs of an individual worker that can not be inferred from his or her past referencing behavior .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In other words , the group 's knowledge complements that of the individual worker .

label: Research questions
text: Thus , we leverage the group perspective to complement the personal perspective by using hybrid approaches , which combine the KF-based group recommendation method ( KFGR ) with traditional personalized-recommendation methods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proposed hybrid methods achieve a trade-off between the group-based and personalized methods by exploiting the strengths of both .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of our experiment show that the proposed methods can enhance the quality of recommendations made by traditional methods .

label: Research questions
text: Recently , boundaries between the two paradigms have narrowed and hybrid approaches are gaining interest from both academia and businesses .

label: Research questions
text: However , since hybrid approaches involve the multidisciplinary interaction of linguists , computer scientists , engineers , and information specialists , understandably a number of issues exist .

label: Research questions
text: While statistical methods currently dominate research work in MT , most commercial MT systems are technically hybrid systems .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The research community should investigate the benefits and questions surrounding the hybridization of MT systems more actively .

label: Research questions
text: This paper discusses various issues related to hybrid MT including its origins , architectures , achievements , and frustrations experienced in the community .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It can be said that both rule-based and corpus- based MT systems have benefited from hybridization when effectively integrated .

label: Research questions
text: In fact , many of the current rule/corpus-based MT approaches are already hybridized since they do include statistics/rules at some point .

label: Research questions
text: Our research objective is to understand what the main factors are that influence the teaching uses of Wikipedia among university faculty .

label: Research method
text: Based on a technology acceptance model , and using data from a survey sent to all faculty members of the Universitat Oberta de Catalunya , we analyze the relationships within the internal and external constructs of the model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that both the perception of colleagues ' opinions about Wikipedia and the perceived quality of the information in Wikipedia play a central role .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These two constructs have a significant direct impact on the perceived usefulness of Wikipedia .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This perceived usefulness affects , mediated by the behavioral intention of using Wikipedia , the effective use behavior of the encyclopedia .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The degree to which an individual considers it is important to participate in open collaborative environments and the Web 2.0 profile of the faculty members also play an important role in our model .

text: We address the research gap by modeling the factors that drive public acceptance of government surveillance , and by exploring the influence of national culture .

label: Research method
text: The research involved an online survey of 242 Australian and Sri Lankan residents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Data were analyzed using partial least squares , revealing that privacy concerns around initial collection of citizens ' data influenced levels of acceptance of surveillance in Australia but not Sri Lanka , whereas concerns about secondary use of data did not influence levels of acceptance in either country .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions suggest that respondents conflate surveillance with the collection of data and may not consider subsequent secondary use .

label: Research questions
text: We also investigate cultural differences , finding that societal collectivism and power distance significantly affect the strength of the relationships between privacy concerns and acceptance of surveillance , on the one hand , and adoption of privacy protections , on the other .

text: This study attempts to fill this gap by observing users ' behavior while using MedlinePlus to search for specific health information .

label: Research method
text: Nineteen students participated in the study , and each performed 12 specific tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: During the search process , they submitted short queries or complete questions , and they examined less than 1 result per search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Participants rarely reformulated queries ; when they did , they tended to make a query more specific or more general , or iterate in different ways .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Participants also browsed , primarily relying on the alphabetical list and the anatomical classification , to navigate to specific health topics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Participants overall had a positive experience with MedlinePlus , and the experience was significantly correlated with task difficulty and participants ' spatial abilities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that , to better support specific item search in the health domain , systems could provide a more natural interface to encourage users to ask questions ; effective conceptual hierarchies could be implemented to help users reformulate queries ; and the search results page should be reconceptualized as a place for accessing answers rather than documents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , multiple schemas should be provided to help users navigate to a health topic .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results also suggest that users ' experience with information systems in general and health-related systems in particular should be evaluated in relation to contextual factors , such as task features and individual differences .
