text: Furthermore , most data analyses produce generic outcomes without taking into account the ability of the students , including the difficulty of the test items .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The present study proposes a systematic approach for context adaptation and language translation of the preexisting IL assessment tool known as TRAILS-9 to be used in different languages and context , particularly a Malaysian public secondary school .

label: Research method
text: This study further administers a less common psychometric approach , the Rasch analysis , to validate the adapted instrument .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This technique produces a hierarchy of item difficulty within the assessment domain that enables the ability level of the students to be differentiated based on item difficulty .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The recommended scale adaptation guidelines are able to reduce the misinterpretation of scores from instruments in multiple languages as well as contribute to parallel development of IL assessment among secondary school students from different populations .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The analysis distinguishes high quality from standard quality articles and focuses on the question whether communicating acceptance rates rather than rejection rates leads to other submission decisions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that a positive framing effect might be present when authors decide on submitting a high quality article .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: No evidence of a framing effect is found when authors consider a standard quality article .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From a journal marketing perspective , this is important information for editors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Communicating acceptance rates rather than rejection rates might help to convince researchers to submit to their journal .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While the idealized IE process involves engaging with information after noticing it ( for example , by examining it , conducting follow-up seeking to determine usefulness , then using or sharing it ) , the process can be disrupted-resulting in missed opportunities for knowledge and insight creation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study provides a detailed understanding of when and why the process can be disrupted .

label: Research method
text: Think-aloud observations and Critical Incident Interviews were conducted with 15 web users , focusing on examining when they encountered information but did not engage with it .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Factors that discouraged engagement and simultaneously encouraged participants to return to active , goal-directed information seeking by disrupting the IE process were identified .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These factors individually and collectively demonstrate that IE can instigate a highly uncertain cost-benefit trade-off , sometimes resulting in encounterers being cautious by returning to less risky active seeking .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Design suggestions are made for reducing the uncertainty of deciding whether to engage with encountered information and making it easier to return to the active seeking task if disruption occurs .

label: Research questions
text: It also examines the development of LIS from 1965 to 2005 in light of comparable data sets for 1965 , 1985 , and 2005 .

label: Research method
text: In both cases , the authors report ( a ) how the research articles are distributed by topic and ( b ) what approaches , research strategies , and methods were applied in the articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In 2005 , the largest research areas in LIS by this measure were information storage and retrieval , scientific communication , library and information-service activities , and information seeking .

label: Research method
text: The same research areas constituted the quantitative core of LIS in the previous years since 1965 .

label: Research questions
text: Information retrieval has been the most popular area of research over the years .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proportion of research on library and information-service activities decreased after 1985 , but the popularity of information seeking and of scientific communication grew during the period studied .

label: Research questions
text: The viewpoint of research has shifted from library and information organizations to end users and development of systems for the latter .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proportion of empirical research strategies was high and rose over time , with the survey method being the single most important method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , attention to evaluation and experiments increased considerably after 1985 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Conceptual research strategies and system analysis , description , and design were quite popular , but declining .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The most significant changes from 1965 to 2005 are the decreasing interest in library and information-service activities and the growth of research into information seeking and scientific communication .

label: Research questions
text: The network structure of communication is considered to affect team and individual performances , but it has not been not empirically tested .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we collected a set of 1-month e-mail logs of a company and conducted an e-mail network analysis .

label: Research method
text: We calculated the network centralities of 72 managerial candidates , and investigated the relationship between positions in the network and leadership performance with partial least squares structural equation modeling .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Betweenness and in-degree network centralities of those middle managers are correlated with their leadership performance ; on the other hand , for this management group , out-degree has no correlation , and Page Rank is a negative indicator of leadership .

label: Research questions
text: Leaders with high performance are trusted in their communities as a hub of the information channel of the communication network .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Because mobile devices have relatively small screens and show fewer search results , search behavior with mobile devices may be different from that with desktops or laptops .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Therefore , examining these differences may suggest better , more efficient designs for mobile search engines .

label: Research method
text: In this experiment , we use eye tracking to explore user behavior and performance .

label: Research method
text: We analyze web searches with 2 task types on 2 differently sized screens : one for a desktop and the other for a mobile device .

label: Research questions
text: In addition , we examine the relationships between search performance and several search behaviors to allow further investigation of the differences engendered by the screens .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that users have more difficulty extracting information from search results pages on the smaller screens , although they exhibit less eye movement as a result of an infrequent use of the scroll function .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , in terms of search performance , our Research findings/conclusions suggest that there is no significant difference between the 2 screens in time spent on search results pages and the accuracy of finding answers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This suggests several possible ideas for the presentation design of search results pages on small devices .

label: Research questions
text: To navigate this landscape and drive innovations , Virginia Tech launched the strategic development of Intelligent Infrastructure for Human Centered Communities or IIHCC .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It is timely to study the integrative design process and transdisciplinary discourse for the smart future .

label: Research method
text: This study employed qualitative research methods including ethnographic participant observation , document analysis , and semistructured interviews .

label: Research method
text: The mixed-methods approach is especially useful for capturing typical scenarios , emergent issues , and practical examples surrounding the smart infrastructure endeavors and the array of challenges and creative frictions encountered .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Taking a sociotechnical perspective , this study explored how IIHCC can achieve significant program synergies and inspire new collaborations across intellectual boundaries .

label: Research questions
text: Furthermore , it investigated how libraries can work collaboratively and constructively with the community to build a stimulating culture of a transdisciplinary mechanism and collective intelligence .

label: Research questions
text: Tying all these together , the study then discusses how we can achieve a synergistic discourse by way of data as distinct unifiers for cross-domain collaborations .

label: Research questions
text: It concludes by presenting multidimensional opportunities and multispectral engagement for libraries to potentially chart a new course and become a driving force in this evolution .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study focuses on the most ubiquitous of these technologies , e-mail , and unobtrusively explores the ongoing inbox-management activities of thousands of users worldwide over a period of 8 months .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study describes the dynamics of these inboxes throughout the day and the week as users strive to handle incoming messages , read them , classify them , respond to them in a timely manner , and archive them for future reference , all while carrying out the daily tasks of knowledge workers .

label: Research method
text: It then tests several hypotheses about the influence of specific inbox-management behaviors in mitigating the causes of e-mail overload , and proposes a continuous index that quantifies one of these inbox-management behaviors .

label: Research questions
text: This inbox clearing index ( ICI ) expands on the widely cited trichotomous classification of users into frequent filers , spring cleaners , and no filers , as suggested by Whittaker and Sidner ( 1996 ) .

label: Research questions
text: We propose that the ICI allows shifting the focus , from classifying users to characterizing a diversity of user behaviors and measuring the relationships between these behaviors and desired outcomes .

label: Research questions
text: Unfortunately , many authors avoid listing sufficient keywords for their papers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As such , these applications may need to automatically associate good descriptive keywords with papers .

label: Research method
text: When the full text of the paper is available this problem has been thoroughly studied .

label: Research questions
text: In many cases , however , due to copyright limitations , research databases do not have access to the full text .

label: Research questions
text: On the other hand , such databases typically maintain metadata , such as the title and abstract and the citation network of each paper .

label: Research method
text: In this paper we study the problem of predicting which keywords are appropriate for a research paper , using different methods based on the citation network and available metadata .

label: Research questions
text: Our main goal is in providing search engines with the ability to extract keywords from the available metadata .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , our system can also be used for other applications , such as for recommending keywords for the authors of new papers .

label: Research method
text: We create a data set of research papers , and their citation network , keywords , and other metadata , containing over 470K papers with and more than 2 million keywords .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We compare our methods with predicting keywords using the title and abstract , in offline experiments and in a user study , concluding that the citation network provides much better predictions .

label: Research questions
text: Facilitated by digitization of the patent data and increasing computing power , a community of practice has grown up that has developed methods for using these data to : measure attributes of innovations such as impact and originality ; to trace flows of knowledge across individuals , institutions and regions ; and to map innovation networks .

label: Research questions
text: The objective of this article is threefold .

label: Research method
text: First , it takes stock of these main uses .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Second , it discusses 4 pitfalls associated with patent citation data , related to office , time and technology , examiner , and strategic effects .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Third , it highlights gaps in our understanding and offers directions for future research .

label: Research method
text: This article focuses on one particular group of ICT professionals , computational modelers , and explores how these ICT professionals perceive their own societal responsibilities .

label: Research method
text: Specifically , the article uses a mixed-method approach to look at the role of professional codes of ethics and explores the relationship between modelers ' experiences with , and attitudes toward , codes of ethics and their values .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Statistical analysis of survey data reveals a relationship between modelers ' values and their attitudes and experiences related to codes of ethics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thematic analysis of interviews with a subset of survey participants identifies two key themes : that modelers should be faithful to the reality and values of users and that codes of ethics should be built from the bottom up .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One important implication of the research is that those who value universalism and benevolence may have a particular duty to act on their values and advocate for , and work to develop , a code of ethics .

label: Research questions
text: With the development of new data models and computer technologies , the need for new approaches to present and interact with bibliographic data has slowly been maturing .

label: Research method
text: To investigate how this could be accomplished , a prototype system , FrbrVis 1 , was designed to present work families within a bibliographic information system using information visualization .

label: Research method
text: This paper reports on two user studies , a controlled and an observational experiment , that have been carried out to assess the Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records ( FRBR ) -based against an existing system as well as to test four different hierarchical visual layouts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results clearly show that FrbrVis offers better performance and user experience compared to the baseline system .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The differences between the four hierarchical visualizations ( Indented tree , Radial tree , Circlepack , and Sunburst ) were , on the other hand , not as pronounced , but the Indented tree and Sunburst design proved to be the most successful , both in performance as well as user perception .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The paper therefore not only evaluates the application of a visual presentation of bib-liographic work families , but also provides valuable results regarding the performance and user acceptance of individual hierarchical visualization techniques .

label: Research questions
text: A range of platforms , such as academic social networking sites ( SNS ) , are geared specifically towards the academic community .

label: Research questions
text: Proponents of the altmetrics approach have pointed out that new media allow for new avenues of scientific impact assessment .

label: Research questions
text: Traditional impact measures based on bibliographic analysis have long been criticized for overlooking the relational dynamics of scientific impact .

label: Research questions
text: We therefore propose an application of social network analysis to researchers ' interactions on an academic social networking site to generate potential new metrics of scientific impact .

label: Research method
text: Based on a case study conducted among a sample of Swiss management scholars , we analyze how centrality measures derived from the participants ' interactions on the academic SNS ResearchGate relate to traditional , offline impact indicators .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that platform engagement , seniority , and publication impact contribute to members ' indegree and eigenvector centrality on the platform , but less so to closeness or betweenness centrality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that a relational approach based on social network analyses of academic SNS , while subject to platform-specific dynamics , may add richness and differentiation to scientific impact assessment .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Expert finding has been studied extensively , with less attention going to the complementary task of expert profiling , that is , automatically identifying topics about which a person is knowledgeable .

label: Research method
text: We describe a test collection for expert profiling in which expert users have self-selected their knowledge areas .

label: Research method
text: Motivated by the sparseness of this set of knowledge areas , we report on an assessment experiment in which academic experts judge a profile that has been automatically generated by state-of-the-art expert-profiling algorithms ; optionally , experts can indicate a level of expertise for relevant areas .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experts may also give feedback on the quality of the system-generated knowledge areas .

label: Research method
text: We report on a content analysis of these comments and gain insights into what aspects of profiles matter to experts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We provide an error analysis of the system-generated profiles , identifying factors that help explain why certain experts may be harder to profile than others .

label: Research method
text: We also analyze the impact on evaluating expert-profiling systems of using self-selected versus judged system-generated knowledge areas as ground truth ; they rank systems somewhat differently but detect about the same amount of pairwise significant differences despite the fact that the judged system-generated assessments are more sparse .

label: Research method
text: Drawing on interviews with 26 participants , all of whom had moved to New York City in the past 2 years , I analyze the interrelatedness of people , city space , and technology .

label: Research questions
text: By rooting my analysis in the experiences of transnational newcomers to New York , my investigation is directed both at library and information science ( LIS ) scholarship in transnational experience and urban informatics as an area of study .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The Research findings/conclusions section first addresses participants ' practices for becoming familiar with their surroundings as embedded in everyday routines using Bergson 's ( 1911 ) construct of habits as a means of organizing stimulus .

label: Research method
text: I then develop an analysis of wandering , which emerged as an information practice used by participants to become familiar with their neighborhoods .

label: Research questions
text: Building on these themes , I suggest implications for human information behavior theory , arguing that LIS scholars should articulate more clearly and across a wider range of disciplines the concepts of mobile and ubiquitous technologies .

label: Research questions
text: Opinion mining , also known as sentiment analysis , has received a lot of attention in recent times , as it provides a number of tools to analyze public opinion on a number of different topics .

label: Research questions
text: Comparative opinion mining is a subfield of opinion mining which deals with identifying and extracting information that is expressed in a comparative form ( e.g. , paper X is better than the Y ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Comparative opinion mining plays a very important role when one tries to evaluate something because it provides a reference point for the comparison .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper provides a review of the area of comparative opinion mining .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It is the first review that cover specifically this topic as all previous reviews dealt mostly with general opinion mining .

label: Research method
text: This survey covers comparative opinion mining from two different angles .

label: Research method
text: One from the perspective of techniques and the other from the perspective of comparative opinion elements .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It also incorporates preprocessing tools as well as data set that were used by past researchers that can be useful to future researchers in the field of comparative opinion mining .

label: Research questions
text: Wittfogel 's ( 1957 ) Eastern autocracy states that 2 environmental dimensions , rainfall and sea border , influence the origin of democracy .

label: Research method
text: This study examined Wittfogel 's Eastern autocracy theory through statistical analysis of average annual precipitation , land boundaries , latitudes , and annual temperature of 196 countries and territories with their freedom levels defined by Freedom House , to find out the correlations between these geospatial factors and democracy .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In addition , this study extended its investigation to web interface design by examining democracy represented on college/university websites in correlations with these geospatial factors .

label: Research method
text: A total of 130 college/university websites selected from 65 countries were coded and examined systematically in linear and multiple regression analyses .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study concluded that democracy correlates positively with annual precipitation and latitude , but negatively with land boundaries and annual temperature .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , this study indicated that these 4 geospatial variables associate with democracy represented on web interface design , although the associations are not statistically significant .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study also suggested that it is more accurate to predict democracy if the 4 geospatial factors are considered together as dependent variables .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By examining Wittfogel 's theory of hydraulic civilization on web interface design , this study not only extended its sociological perspective to the information science arena , but also provided a better understanding of the functionality of the Internet in information dissemination and its cultural and sociological aspects .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing on the theory of impression management , we hypothesize and explain when and why consumers choose to post their comments on different platforms , and how their behavior will be affected when they choose to post on online platforms .

label: Research method
text: To test the hypotheses , we collected and text-mined online posts from product platforms such as review aggregator sites , discussion forums , and consumer rating websites , and non-product platforms such as microblogs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results showed that product platforms have more polarized opinions , and exhibit more convergence in opinion across time , compared with non-product platforms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions advise researchers and practitioners to pay attention to the characteristics of online platforms , and how users ' perceptions of the Research questions of the online platform may affect their online posting behavior .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This expansion reflects that increasingly , smart systems request input from users without having been prompted by them , which is the essence of the existing interaction types .

label: Research questions
text: Systems utilizing the Responding interaction type proactively seek input from users in situations where said input is required .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , users can not sufficiently distinguish organic results from advertisements , resulting in result selections under false assumptions .

label: Research questions
text: Following on from that , this study examines how users ' understanding of search-based advertising influences their viewing and selection behavior on desktop computer and smartphone .

label: Research method
text: To investigate this , we used a mixed methods approach ( n= 100 ) consisting of a pre-study interview , an eye-tracking experiment , and a post-study questionnaire .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that participants with a low level of knowledge on search advertising are more likely to click on ads than subjects with a high level of knowledge .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , subjects with little knowledge show less willingness to scroll down to organic results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Regarding the device , there are significant differences in viewing behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These can be attributed to the influence of the direct visibility of search results on both devices tested : Ads that were ranked on top received significantly more visual attention on the small screen than the top ranked ads on the large screen .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results call for a clearer labeling of advertisements and for the promotion of users ' information literacy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Future studies should investigate the motivations of searchers when clicking on ads .

label: Research questions
text: Molecular medicine is a relevant domain because it offers thousands of digital resources as the information environment .

label: Research method
text: Data were collected through shadowing of real work tasks .

label: Research method
text: Thirty work task sessions were analyzed and barriers in these identified .

label: Research method
text: The barriers were classified by their character ( conceptual , syntactic , and technological ) and by their context of appearance ( work task , system integration , or system ) .

label: Research method
text: Also , work task sessions were grouped into three complexity classes and the frequency of barriers of varying types across task complexity levels were analyzed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions indicate that although most of the barriers are on system level , there is a quantum of barriers in integration and work task contexts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These barriers might be overcome through attention to the integrated use of multiple systems at least for the most frequent uses .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This can be done by means of standardization and harmonization of the data and by taking the requirements of the work tasks into account in system design and development , because information access is seldom an end itself , but rather serves to reach the goals of work tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that the content-based method is appropriate to serve as a basis for the session identification in our domain .

label: Research questions
text: However , there remain some problems reported in previous research which degrade the identification performance ( such as accuracy ) of the content-based method .

label: Research questions
text: Therefore , in this article , we propose two important refinements to address these problems .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We describe the underlying rationale of our refinements and then empirically show that the content-based method equipped with our refinements is able to achieve an excellent identification performance in our domain ( such as 99.820 % accuracy and 99.707 % F-measure in our experiments ) .

label: Research method
text: Next , because the time-based method has extremely low computation costs , which makes it suitable for many real-world applications , we investigate the feasibility of the time-based method in our domain by evaluating its identification performance based on our refined content-based method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our experiments demonstrate that the performance of the time-based method is potentially acceptable to many real applications in our domain .

label: Research method
text: Finally , we analyze several features of the identified sessions in our domain and compare them with the corresponding ones in general web search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results illustrate the profession-oriented characteristics of our domain .

label: Research questions
text: This article examines the Quacquarelli Symonds ( QS ) World University Ranking methodology , pointing to a drawback of using subjective , possibly biased , weightings to build a composite indicator ( QS scores ) .

label: Research questions
text: We propose an alternative approach to creating QS scores , which is referred to as the composite I-distance indicator ( CIDI ) methodology .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The main contribution is the proposal of a composite indicator weights correction based on the CIDI methodology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It leads to the improved stability and reduced uncertainty of the QS ranking system .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The CIDI methodology is also applicable to other university rankings by proposing a specific statistical approach to creating a composite indicator .

label: Research questions
text: Long delays often cause users to abandon their searches , but how do tolerable delays affect information search behavior ?

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Intuitively , we would expect that tolerable delays should induce decreased information search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conducted two experiments and found that as delay increased , a point occurs at which time within-page information search increases ; that is , search behavior remained the same until a tipping point occurs where delay increases the depth of search .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that situation normality explains this phenomenon ; users have become accustomed to tolerable delays up to a point ( our research suggests between 7 and 11s ) , after which search behavior changes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: That is , some delay is expected , but as delay becomes noticeable but not long enough to cause the abandonment of search , an increase occurs in the stickiness of webpages such that users examine more information on each page before moving to new pages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The net impact of tolerable delays was counterintuitive : tolerable delays had no impact on the total amount of data searched in the first experiment , but induced users to examine more data points in the second experiment .

label: Research method
text: by comparing the meaning of the term information and epistemological assumptions of three theories in library and information science : the ShannonWeaver model , Brookes ' interpretation of Popper 's World 3 , and the Data-Information-Knowledge-Wisdom model .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It shows that the term information in these theories refers to empirical entities or events and is conceptualized as having causal powers upon human minds .

label: Research questions
text: It is argued that the epistemological assumptions have led to the negligence of the cultural and social aspects of the constitution of information ( i.e. , how something is considered to be and not to be information ) and the unquestioned nature of science in research methodologies .

label: Research questions
text: This study looks at users ' dwelling behavior on documents and several contextual factors : the stage of users ' work tasks , task type , and users ' knowledge of task topics , to explore whether or not taking account contextual factors could help infer document usefulness from dwell time .

label: Research method
text: A controlled laboratory experiment was conducted with 24 participants , each coming 3 times to work on 3 subtasks in a general work task .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that task stage could help interpret certain types of dwell time as reliable indicators of document usefulness in certain task types , as was topic knowledge , and the latter played a more significant role when both were available .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study contributes to a better understanding of how dwell time can be used as implicit evidence of document usefulness , as well as how contextual factors can help interpret dwell time as an indicator of usefulness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions have both theoretical and practical implications for using behaviors and contextual factors in the development of personalization systems .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous methods are not widely applied in practice because of their high computational complexity and their strong dependency on excessive attributes , such as institutional affiliation , research area , address , etc. , which are difficult to obtain in practice .

label: Research method
text: To solve this problem , we propose a novel coarse-to-fine framework for name disambiguation which sequentially employs 3 common and easily accessible attributes ( i.e. , coauthor name , article title , and publication venue ) .

label: Research method
text: Our proposed framework is based on multiple clustering and consists of 3 steps : ( a ) clustering articles by coauthorship and obtaining rough clusters , that is fragments ; ( b ) clustering fragments obtained in step 1 by title information and getting bigger fragments ; ( c ) and clustering fragments obtained in step 2 by the latent relations among venues .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results on a Digital Bibliography and Library Project ( DBLP ) data set show that our method outperforms the existing state-of-the-art methods by 2.4 % to 22.7 % on the average pairwise F1 score and is 10 to 100 times faster in terms of execution time .

label: Research method
text: In 2009 , 40,000 authors of research papers from across the globe were invited to complete an online survey .

label: Research method
text: Researchers were asked to rate a number of general statements about peer review , and then a subset of respondents , who had themselves peer reviewed , rated a series of statements concerning their experience of peer review .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study found that the peer review process is highly regarded by the vast majority of researchers and considered by most to be essential to the communication of scholarly research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nine out of 10 authors believe that peer review improved the last paper they published .

label: Research method
text: Double-blind peer review is considered the most effective form of peer review .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nearly three quarters of researchers think that technological advances are making peer review more effective .

label: Research questions
text: Most researchers believe that although peer review should identify fraud , it is very difficult for it to do so .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Reviewers are committed to conducting peer review in the future and believe that simple practical steps , such as training new reviewers would further improve peer review .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Full-text analysis offers the opportunity to significantly improve the quality of the signals upon which these co-citation models are based .

label: Research questions
text: In this work we study the effect of reference proximity on the accuracy of co-citation clusters .

label: Research method
text: Using a corpus of 270,521 full text documents from 2007 , we compare the results of traditional co-citation clustering using only the bibliographic information to results from co-citation clustering where proximity between reference pairs is factored into the pairwise relationships .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that accounting for reference proximity from full text can increase the textual coherence ( a measure of accuracy ) of a co-citation cluster solution by up to 30 % over the traditional approach based on bibliographic information .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Here , the writings of J.C. Bose are studied from this perspective .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It may be noted that the relation between Bose and Nivedita was personal in nature .

label: Research method
text: Three important style markersfunction words , punctuation marks , and usage of words are used to trace the changes in Bose 's writing style , if any .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that during the association between Bose and Nivedita , Bose 's style of writing changed considerably in comparison to the earlier period when they did not know each other .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It shows Nivedita helped Bose in preparing his journal articles and books .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results reveal a distinct change in Bose 's writing style after his meeting with Nivedita .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This is reflected in his changing pattern of usage of these three stylistic features .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Bose slowly moved back towards his original style of writing after Nivedita 's death , but his later works still carried Nivedita 's influence .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research proposes that these elicitations will depend on the type of question .

label: Research questions
text: In particular , this research explores the relationship between three constructs : question types , elicitations , and the fee that is paid for the answer .

label: Research method
text: These relationships are explored for a few different question typologies , including a new kind of question type that we call Identity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is found that the kinds of clarifications that intermediaries elicit depend on the type of question in systematic ways .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A practical implication is that interactive question-answering serviceswhether human or automatedcan be steered to focus attention on the kinds of clarification that are evidently most needed for that question type .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further , it is found that certain question types , as well as the number of elicitations , are associated with higher fees .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This means that it may be possible to define a pricing structure for question-answering services based on objective and predictable characteristics of the question , which would help to establish a rational market for this type of information service .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The newly introduced Identity question type was found to be especially reliable in predicting elicitations and fees .

label: Research method
text: Our article describes formative research conducted as part of a larger study focused on the development of an online HIV prevention platform tailored for Black female college students .

label: Research method
text: To inform the design of our platform , we conducted focus groups with 60 Black women enrolled at two predominantly White institutions ( PWIs ) .

label: Research questions
text: The Research questions of the focus groups was to understand information needs , awareness of specific information resources , and the search strategies employed for finding and evaluating HIV prevention information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We used hypervisibility as a sensitizing lens for making sense of how the intersecting gender and racial identities of Black womanhood shape informationseeking behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Four themes emerged : platform choice and privacy , relatability , respectability politics , and silence on campus .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The themes depict discursive representations specific to Black female identity to manage stigma , reduce their hypervisibility , and amplify their authentic voices in the broader HIV prevention discourse .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions contribute to human information behavior scholarship on marginalized groups .

label: Research method
text: We measured referee behavior and referees ' agreement .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that the disciplinary background and the academic status of the referee have an influence on the report time , the type of recommendation and the acceptance of the reviewing task .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Referees from the humanities tend to be more generous in their recommendations than other referees , especially economists and environmental scientists .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Second , we found that senior researchers are harsher in their judgments than junior researchers , and the latter accept requests to review more often and are faster in reporting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we found that articles that had been refereed and recommended for publication by a multidisciplinary set of referees were subsequently more likely to receive citations than those that had been reviewed by referees from the same discipline .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that common standards of evaluation can be established even in multidisciplinary communities .

label: Research questions
text: Despite its popularity , little is known about the age and discipline of the articles uploaded and viewed in the site and whether publication statistics from the site could be useful impact indicators .

label: Research method
text: In response , this article assesses samples of ResearchGate articles uploaded at specific dates , comparing their views in the site to their Mendeley readers and Scopus-indexed citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This analysis shows that ResearchGate is dominated by recent articles , which attract about three times as many views as older articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: ResearchGate has uneven coverage of scholarship , with the arts and humanities , health professions , and decision sciences poorly represented and some fields receiving twice as many views per article as others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: View counts for uploaded articles have low to moderate positive correlations with both Scopus citations and Mendeley readers , which is consistent with them tending to reflect a wider audience than Scopus-publishing scholars .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Hence , for articles uploaded to the site , view counts may give a genuinely new audience indicator .

label: Research method
text: In fact , if we make creative use of Simpson 's index of concentration ( originally devised as a measure of ecological diversity ) to measure the degree of standardization of definition in this case , we arrive at a value of 0.05 , on a scale of zero to one .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is suggested , however , that the situation is not as problematic as it might seem : that low cross-domain levels of standardization of definition should not be cause for concern .

label: Research questions

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Networks on academic sites were smaller and more highly clustered , whereas Twitter networks were larger and more diffuse .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Institutions and research interests define communities on academic sites , compared with research topics and personal interests on Twitter .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The network structures reflect differences in how academics conceptualize different sites and have implications in relation to fostering social capital and research impact .

label: Research method
text: This study measures the perception change directly as reflected in citation sentiment , with the attainment of a Nobel Prize in Chemistry or a Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine considered the status change .

label: Research method
text: The article identifies 12,393 citances to 25 Nobel articles in PubMed Central and includes a control article set of 75 articles with 30,851 citances .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show a moderate increase in citation sentiment toward Nobel articles postaward .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Dynamically , for Nobel articles there is a steady sentiment increase , and a Nobel Prize seems to co-occur with this trend .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While there is such a thing as a French conception of information science , this conception is not totally divorced from the Anglophone one .

label: Research questions
text: Unbeknownst to researchers from the two geographical and cultural regions , they share similar conceptions of the field and invoke similar theoretical foundations , in particular the socio-constructivist theory .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There is also a convergence of viewpoints on the dual nature of information science , i.e. , the fact that it is torn between two competing paradigmsobjectivist and subjectivist .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Technology is another area where a convergence of viewpoints is noticeable : Scholars from both geographic and cultural zones display the same suspicion toward the role of technology and of computer science .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It would therefore be misleading to uphold the view that Anglophone information science is essentially objectivist and technicist while the French conception is essentially social and rooted in the humanities .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper highlights converging analyses from authors based in both linguistic and geographical regions with the aim to foster a better understanding of the challenges that information science is facing worldwide and to help trace a path to how the global information science community can try to meet them .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Whereas one stream in the literature has focused on the structural responsibilities associated with roles , another has stressed the emergent nature of work .

label: Research questions
text: To date , these streams have proceeded largely in parallel .

label: Research questions
text: In seeking to enhance our understanding of the tension between structure and agency in peer-production , we investigated the interplay between structural and emergent roles .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our study explored the breadth of structural roles in Wikipedia ( English version ) and their linkage to various forms of activities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analyses show that despite the latitude in selecting their mode of participation , participants ' structural and emergent roles are tightly coupled .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our discussion highlights that : ( a ) participants often stay close to the production ground floor despite the assignment into structural roles ; and ( b ) there are typical modifications in activity patterns associated with role-assignment , namely : functional specialization , multispecialization , defunctionalization , changes in communication patterns , management of identity , and role definition .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We contribute to theory of coordination and roles , as well as provide some practical implications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , in- and out-degree node distributions display long tails , with few vital journals and many trivial ones , and they are strongly positively correlated .

label: Research method

label: Research findings/conclusions

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is important for the field to get a better understanding of the quality of this process as an approximation for determining the searcher 's actual intent .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Some studies have investigated the reliability of the query intent annotation process by measuring the interassessor agreement .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , these studies did not measure the validity of the judgments , that is , to what extent the annotations match the searcher 's actual intent .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we asked both the searchers themselves and external assessors to classify queries using the same intent classification scheme .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that of the seven dimensions in our intent classification scheme , four can reliably be used for query annotation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Of these four , only the annotations on the topic and spatial sensitivity dimension are valid when compared with the searcher 's annotations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The difference between the interassessor agreement and the assessor-searcher agreement was significant on all dimensions , showing that the agreement between external assessors is not a good estimator of the validity of the intent classifications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Therefore , we encourage the research community to consider using query intent classifications by the searchers themselves as test data .

label: Research method
text: Bibliometric indicators of important discoveries have been formulated using an empirical approach , based on the mathematical properties of the high-citation tail of the citation distribution .

label: Research method
text: To investigate the theoretical basis of such formulations this study compares the US/European research performance ratios expressed in terms of highly cited papers and Nobel Prize-winning discoveries .

label: Research method
text: The research performance ratio in terms of papers was studied from the citation distributions in the fields of chemistry , physics , and biochemistry and molecular biology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It varied as a function of the citation level .

label: Research method
text: Selecting an appropriate high citation level , the ratios in terms of highly cited papers were compared with the corresponding ratios for Nobel Prize-winning discoveries in Chemistry , Physics , and Physiology or Medicine .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research performance ratios expressed in terms of highly cited papers and Nobel Prize-winning discoveries are reasonably similar , and suggest that the research success of the United States is almost 3 times that of Europe .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A similar conclusion was obtained using articles published in Nature and Science .

label: Research questions
text: Literature draws attention to the critical success factors ( CSFs ) for implementation of BI systems .

label: Research method
text: Leveraging case studies of seven large organizations and blending them with Yeoh and Koronios 's ( 2010 ) BI CSFs framework , our empirical study gives evidence to support this notion of CSFs and provides better contextual understanding of the CSFs in BI implementation domain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Cross-case analysis suggests that organizational factors play the most crucial role in determining the success of a BI system implementation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Hence , BI stakeholders should prioritize on the organizational dimension ahead of other factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions allow BI stakeholders to holistically understand the CSFs and the associated contextual issues that impact on implementation of BI systems .

label: Research questions
text: They are complex systems , constituted by many different components interacting together , and evaluation is crucial to both tune and improve them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , in the current evaluation methodology , there is still no way to determine how much each component contributes to the overall performances and how the components interact together .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This hampers the possibility of a deep understanding of IR system behavior and , in turn , prevents us from designing ahead which components are best suited to work together for a specific search task .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this paper , we move the evaluation methodology one step forward by overcoming these barriers and beginning to devise an anatomy of IR systems and their internals .

label: Research method
text: In particular , we propose a methodology based on the General Linear Mixed Model ( GLMM ) and analysis of variance ( ANOVA ) to develop statistical models able to isolate system variance and component effects as well as their interaction , by relying on a grid of points ( GoP ) containing all the combinations of the analyzed components .

label: Research method
text: We apply the proposed methodology to the analysis of two relevant search tasksnews search and web searchby using standard TREC collections .

label: Research method
text: We analyze the basic set of components typically part of an IR system , namely , stop lists , stemmers , and n-grams , and IR models .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this way , we derive insights about English text retrieval .

label: Research method
text: The Hegelian inquiry system is used here to explain the nature of informing on the Internet as activities of information masters to influence information slaves ' opinions and as activities of information slaves to become well informed .

label: Research questions
text: The key assumption of Hegelianism regarding information is that information has no value independent from the interests and worldviews ( theses ) it supports .

label: Research questions
text: As part of the dialectic process of generating syntheses , we propose a role for information science of offering methods to critically evaluate the master 's information , and by this we develop an opinion ( thesis ) independent from the master 's power .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For this we offer multiple methods for information criticism , named triangulation , which may help users to evaluate a master 's evidence .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article presents also a prototype of a Hegelian information triangulator tool for information slaves ( i.e. , nonexperts ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The article concludes with suggestions for further research on informative triangulation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Each of us holds different values with different degrees of importance .

label: Research questions
text: Existing studies show that values of a person can be identified from their social network usage .

label: Research questions
text: However , the value priority of a person may change over time due to different factors such as time , event , influence , social structure , and technology .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this research , we are the first to investigate whether the change of value priorities can be identified from social network usage .

label: Research method
text: We propose a weighted hybrid time-series-based model to capture the change of values of a social network user .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conducted an experimental study with 726 Facebook users and showed that our model accurately captures the value priority changes from the social network usage and achieves significantly higher accuracy than our baseline hidden Markov model-based technique .

label: Research method
text: We also validated the change of a user 's value priorities in real life using a questionnaire-based technique .

label: Research questions
text: Although responses on CQA sites are obviously slower than information retrieved by a search engine , one of the most frustrating aspects of CQAs occurs when an asker 's posted question does not receive a reasonable answer or remains unanswered .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: CQA sites could improve users ' experience by identifying potential answerers and routing appropriate questions to them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this paper , we predict the potential answerers based on question content and user profiles .

label: Research method
text: Our approach builds user profiles based on past activity .

label: Research method
text: When a new question is posted , the proposed method computes scores between the question and all user profiles to find the potential answerers .

label: Research method
text: We conduct extensive experimental evaluations on two popular CQA sites - Yahoo !

label: Research method
text: Answers and Stack Overflow - to show the effectiveness of our algorithm .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that our technique is able to predict a small group of 1000 users from which at least one user will answer the question with a probability higher than 50 % in both CQA sites .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further analysis indicates that topic interest and activity level can improve the correctness of our approach .

text: The dynamic evolution of the Triple Helix can thus be compared among developed and developing nations in terms of cross-sectional coauthorship relations .

label: Research findings/conclusions

label: Research questions
text: We suggest that globalization erodes local Triple Helix relations and thus can be expected to have increased differentiation in national systems since the mid-1990s .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , the Chinese Academy of the ( Social ) Sciences is changing increasingly from a public research institute to an academic one , and this has a measurable effect on China 's position in the globalization .

label: Research questions
text: Although a substantial number of journals have practiced delayed OA since they started publishing e-versions , empirical studies concerning OA have often overlooked this body of literature .

label: Research method
text: This study provides comprehensive quantitative measurements by identifying delayed OA journals and collecting data concerning their publication volumes , embargo lengths , and citation rates .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Altogether , 492 journals were identified , publishing a combined total of 111,312 articles in 2011 ; 77.8 % of these articles were made OA within 12 months from publication , with 85.4 % becoming available within 24 months .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A journal impact factor analysis revealed that delayed OA journals have citation rates on average twice as high as those of closed subscription journals and three times as high as immediate OA journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , the results demonstrate that delayed OA journals constitute an important segment of the openly available scholarly journal literature , both by their sheer article volume and by including a substantial proportion of highimpact journals .

text: Are there particularly problematic aspects of an analytic process ?

label: Research method
text: In this article we investigate these questions through an integrative study of the use of CiteSpacea visual analytic tool for finding trends and patterns in scientific literature .

label: Research method
text: In particular , we analyze millions of interactive events in logs generated by users worldwide over a 14-month period .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The key Research findings/conclusions are : ( i ) three levels of proficiency are identified , namely , level 1 : low proficiency , level 2 : intermediate proficiency , and level 3 : high proficiency , and ( ii ) behavioral patterns at level 3 are resulted from a more engaging interaction with the system , involving a wider variety of events and being characterized by longer state transition paths , whereas behavioral patterns at levels 1 and 2 seem to focus on learning how to use the tool .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study contributes to the development and evaluation of visual analytic systems in realistic settings and provides a valuable addition to the study of interactive visual analytic processes .

text: Yet , the true nature of citations and their proper interpretation have been the center of a long , but still unresolved discussion in Bibliometrics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A comparison of 67,578 pairs of studies on the same healthcare topic , with the same publication age ( 1-15 years ) reveals that when one of the studies is being selected for citation , it has on average received about three times as many citations as the other study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the average citation-gap between selected or deselected studies narrows slightly over time , which fits poorly with the name-dropping interpretation and better with the quality and impact-interpretation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results demonstrate that authors in the field of Healthcare tend to cite highly cited documents when they have a choice .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This is more likely caused by differences related to quality than differences related to status of the publications cited .

label: Research questions
text: Following Husserl 's idea of a horizon of meanings in intersubjective communication , we propose a way in which , using Shannon 's equations , the generation and selection of meanings from a horizon of possibilities can be considered probabilistically .

label: Research questions
text: The information-theoretical dynamics we articulate considers a process of meaning generation within cultural evolution : information is imbued with meaning , and through this process , the number of options for the selection of meaning in discourse proliferates .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The redundancy of possible meanings contributes to a codification of expectations within the discourse .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Unlike hardwired DNA , the codes of nonbiological systems can coevolve with the variations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Spanning horizons of meaning , the codes structure the communications as selection environments that shape discourses .

label: Research questions
text: Discursive knowledge can be considered as meta-coded communication that enables us to translate among differently coded communications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The dynamics of discursive knowledge production can thus infuse the historical dynamics with a cultural evolution by adding options , that is , by increasing redundancy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A calculus of redundancy is presented as an indicator whereby these dynamics of discourse and meaning may be explored empirically .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Effective and efficient medical image retrieval systems are required to better manage medical image information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Text-based image retrieval ( TBIR ) was very successful in retrieving images with textual descriptions .

label: Research questions
text: Several TBIR approaches rely on models based on bag-of-words approaches , in which the image retrieval problem turns into one of standard text-based information retrieval : where the meanings and values of specific medical entities in the text and metadata are ignored in the image representation and retrieval process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , we believe that TBIR should extract specific medical entities and terms and then exploit these elements to achieve better image retrieval results .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Therefore , we propose a novel reranking method based on medical-image-dependent features .

label: Research method
text: These features are manually selected by a medical expert from imaging modalities and medical terminology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , we represent queries and images using only medical-image-dependent features such as image modality and image scale .

label: Research method
text: Second , we exploit the defined features in a new reran king method for medical image retrieval .

label: Research questions
text: Our motivation is the large influence of image modality in medical image retrieval and its impact on image-relevance scores .

label: Research method
text: To evaluate our approach , we performed a series of experiments on the medical ImageCLEF data sets from 2009 to 2013 .

label: Research method
text: The BM25 model , a language model , and an image-relevance feedback model are used as baselines to evaluate our approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results show that compared to the BM25 model , the proposed model significantly enhances image retrieval performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also compared our approach with other state-of-the-art approaches and show that our approach performs comparably to those of the top three runs in the official ImageCLEF competition .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Given the importance of interdisciplinary research , it is essential to be aware of disciplinary differences in aspects of scholarship , such as the significance of recent changes in a field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This paper identifies potential changes in 25 subject categories through a term comparison of words in article titles , keywords and abstracts in 1 year compared to the previous 4 years .

label: Research method
text: The scholarly influence of new research issues is indirectly assessed with a citation analysis of articles matching each trending term .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While topic-related words dominate the top terms , style , national focus , and language changes are also evident .

label: Research questions
text: Thus , as reflected in Scopus , fields evolve along multiple dimensions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , while articles exploiting new issues are usually more cited in some fields , such as Organic Chemistry , they are usually less cited in others , including History .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The possible causes of new issues being less cited include externally driven temporary factors , such as disease outbreaks , and internally driven temporary decisions , such as a deliberate emphasis on a single topic ( e.g. , through a journal special issue ) .

label: Research questions
text: With print publications , the responsibility rested primarily with librarians , but the shift toward digital publishing and , in particular , the introduction of open access ( OA ) have caused ambiguity and complexity .

label: Research questions
text: Consequently , the long-term accessibility of journals is not always guaranteed , and they can even disappear from the web completely .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The focus of this exploratory study is on the phenomenon of vanished journals , something that has not been carried out before .

label: Research method
text: For the analysis , we consulted several major bibliographic indexes , such as Scopus , Ulrichsweb , and the Directory of Open Access Journals , and traced the journals through the Internet Archive 's Wayback Machine .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found 174 OA journals that , through lack of comprehensive and open archives , vanished from the web between 2000 and 2019 , spanning all major research disciplines and geographic regions of the world .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results raise vital concern for the integrity of the scholarly record and highlight the urgency to take collaborative action to ensure continued access and prevent the loss of more scholarly knowledge .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We encourage those interested in the phenomenon of vanished journals to use the public dataset for their own research .

label: Research method
text: In this article a theoretical model , encompassing both normative and constructivist approaches , is suggested .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The conceptualization of scientific communities as autopoietic systems , the components of which are communicative events , allows us to observe the reproductive function of citations conceived as codes and media of scientific communication .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Citations , thanks to their constraining and enabling properties , constitute the engine of the structuration process ensuring the reproduction of scientific communities .

label: Research method
text: By referring to Giddens ' structuration theory , Luhmann 's theory about social systems as communicative networks , Merton 's sociology of science and his conceptualizations about the functions of citations , as well as Small 's proposal about citations as concept-symbols , a sociologically integrated approach to scientometrics is proposed .

text: A grounded theory approach was employed to code and analyze the data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions about tradition , cost , teaching innovations , and the historical research process provide the background for designing learning opportunities for the professional development of historians and the academic librarians who work with them .

text: While historians are open to experimenting with e-books , they are also concerned about the loss of serendipity in digital environments , the lack of availability of key resources , and the need for technological transparency .

text: Gender difference was statistically significant for conflicting information , which was more problematic for women .

text: The multiway analysis of variance ( ANOVA ) indicated notable problem-solving style differences , especially on the Personal Control subscale .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This highlights the importance of affective factors .

text: By drawing from the structural , relational , and cognitive elements of social capital theory to inform antecedents to information quality and source accessibility , a research model is developed and tested .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For interpersonal information sources , information quality is the key determinant of source use .

label: Research findings/conclusions

label: Research questions
text: The goal of this article is to examine , among all the available online sources , which online sources laypeople select to address their health-related information needs , and whether or how much the severity of a health condition influences their selection .

label: Research method
text: Twenty-four participants were recruited individually , and each was asked ( using a retrieval system called HIS ) to search for information regarding a severe health condition and a mild health condition , respectively .

label: Research method
text: The selected online health information sources were automatically captured by the HIS system and classified at both the website and webpage levels .

label: Research method
text: Participants ' selection behavior patterns were then plotted across the whole information-seeking process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results demonstrate that laypeople 's source selection fluctuates during the health information-seeking process , and also varies by the severity of health conditions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study reveals laypeople 's real usage of different types of online health information sources , and engenders implications to the design of search engines , as well as the development of health literacy programs .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: How to label the classes in these classifications is a problem that has not been thoroughly addressed in the literature .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we evaluate different approaches to label the classes in algorithmically constructed classifications of research publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We focus on two important choices : the choice of ( a ) different bibliographic fields and ( b ) different approaches to weight the relevance of terms .

label: Research method
text: To evaluate the different choices , we created two baselines : one based on the Medical Subject Headings in MEDLINE and another based on the Science-Metrix journal classification .

label: Research method
text: We tested to what extent different approaches yield the desired labels for the classes in the two baselines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on our results , we recommend extracting terms from titles and keywords to label classes at high levels of granularity ( e.g. , topics ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: At low levels of granularity ( e.g. , disciplines ) we recommend extracting terms from journal names and author addresses .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We recommend the use of a new approach , term frequency to specificity ratio , to calculate the relevance of terms .

label: Research questions
text: A major shortcoming of current automated plagiarism detection approaches is their dependence on high character-based similarity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As a result , heavily disguised plagiarism forms , such as paraphrases , translated plagiarism , or structural and idea plagiarism , remain undetected .

label: Research questions
text: A recently proposed language-independent approach to plagiarism detection , Citation-based Plagiarism Detection ( CbPD ) , allows the detection of semantic similarity even in the absence of text overlap by analyzing the citation placement in a document 's full text to determine similarity .

label: Research method
text: This article evaluates the performance of CbPD in detecting plagiarism with various degrees of disguise in a collection of 185,000 biomedical articles .

label: Research method
text: We benchmark CbPD against two character-based detection approaches using a ground truth approximated in a user study .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our evaluation shows that the citation-based approach achieves superior ranking performance for heavily disguised plagiarism forms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additionally , we demonstrate CbPD to be computationally more efficient than character-based approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , upon combining the citation-based with the traditional character-based document similarity visualization methods in a hybrid detection prototype , we observe a reduction in the required user effort for document verification .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although there are various conceptualizations of the IField , to date , in-depth studies based on empirical evidence are scarce .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article reports a study that fills this gap .

label: Research method
text: We focus on the first five ISchools in the ICaucus as a proxy to represent the IField .

label: Research method
text: The intellectual characteristics are depicted by two independent sets of data on tenure track faculty as knowledge contributors : their intellectual heritages and the intellectual substance in their journal publications .

label: Research method
text: We use a critical analysis method to examine doctoral training areas and 3 years of journal publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results indicate that ( a ) the IField can be better conceptualized with empirical support by a four-component model that includes People , Information , Technology , and Management , as predicted by the I-Model ( Zhang & Benjamin , 2007 ) ; ( b ) the ISchools ' faculty members are diverse , interdisciplinary , and multidisciplinary as shown by their intellectual heritages , by their research foci , by journals in which they publish , by the contexts within which they conduct research , and by the levels of analysis in research investigations ; ( c ) the five ISchools share similarities while evincing differences in both faculty heritages and intellectual substances ; ( d ) ISchool tenure track faculty members do not collaborate much with each other within or across schools although there is great potential ; and ( e ) intellectual heritages are not good predictors of scholars ' intellectual substance .

label: Research questions
text: We conclude by discussing the implications of the Research findings/conclusions on IField identity , IField development , new ISchool formation and existing ISchool evolution , faculty career development , and collaboration within the IField .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: On one side , the user-centered paradigm asks researchers to focus on the individual ; on the other , emerging context-centered approaches move the position of context into the foreground of information studies .

label: Research questions
