text: Although there have been attempts to create in between approaches to achieve a compromise between these two positions , they have merely generated more positions between the two poles in a continuum between approaches focusing on the individual and those focusing on context .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Such positioning not only creates an endless debate about the research focus of information studies but also limits such studies to a set of factors , a priori defined by the researcher .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article argues that IB research could benefit from actor-network theory , which could give the actors a space to perform their own positioning .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: CCSAV tools require users to contribute to the creation of a joint artifact ( argument map ) instead of contributing to a conversation .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper we assess empirically the effects of this fundamental design choice and show that the absence of conversational affordances and socially salient information in representation-centric tools is detrimental to the users ' collaboration experience .

label: Research method
text: We report empirical Research findings/conclusions from a study in which subjects using different collaborative platforms ( a forum , an argumentation platform , and a socially augmented argumentation tool ) were asked to discuss and predict the price of a commodity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By comparing users ' experience across several metrics we found evidence that the collaborative performance decreases gradually when we remove conversational interaction and other types of socially salient information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We interpret these Research findings/conclusions through theories developed in conversational analysis ( common ground theory ) and communities of practice and discuss design implications .

label: Research questions
text: In particular , we propose balancing the trade-off between knowledge reification and participation in representation-centric tools with the provision of social feedback and functionalities supporting meaning negotiation .

label: Research questions
text: However , with the rapid development of network technologies such as cloud computing , the server-side of a digital library is becoming more and more untrusted ; thus , how to prevent the disclosure of users ' book query privacy is causing people 's increasingly extensive concern .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we propose to construct a group of plausible fake queries for each user book query to cover up the sensitive subjects behind users ' queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , we propose a basic framework for the privacy protection in book search , which requires no change to the book search algorithm running on the server-side , and no compromise to the accuracy of book search .

label: Research method
text: Second , we present a privacy protection model for book search to formulate the constraints that ideal fake queries should satisfy , that is , ( i ) the feature similarity , which measures the confusion effect of fake queries on users ' queries , and ( ii ) the privacy exposure , which measures the cover-up effect of fake queries on users ' sensitive subjects .

label: Research method
text: Third , we discuss the algorithm implementation for the privacy model .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Finally , the effectiveness of our approach is demonstrated by theoretical analysis and experimental evaluation .

label: Research method
text: For fine-grained analysis , census agencies publish census microdata that consist of a sample of individual records of the census containing detailed anonymous individual information .

label: Research questions
text: Working with microdata from different censuses and doing comparative studies are currently difficult tasks due to the diversity of formats and granularities .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this article , we show that novel data processing techniques can be applied to make census microdata interoperable and easy to access and combine .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In fact , we demonstrate how Linked Open Data principles , a set of techniques to publish and make connections of ( semi- ) structured data on the web , can be fruitfully applied to census microdata .

label: Research method
text: We present a step-by-step process to achieve this goal and we study , in theory and practice , two real case studies : the 2001 Spanish census and a general framework for Integrated Public Use Microdata Series ( IPUMS-I ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Five categories are identified : use of loose analogies and metaphors between concepts in quantum physics and library/information science ; use of quantum concepts and formalisms in information retrieval ; use of quantum concepts and formalisms in studying meaning and concepts ; quantum social science , in areas adjacent to information science ; and the qualitative application of quantum concepts in the information disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Quantum issues have led to demonstrable progress in information retrieval and semantic modelling , with less clear-cut progress elsewhere .

label: Research questions
text: Whether there may be a future quantum turn in the information sciences is debated , the implications of such a turn are considered , and a research agenda outlined .

label: Research method
text: Tag is represented inked red or green according to users ' personal experiences and judgments about purchased items : red for positive comments , green for negative ones .

label: Research questions
text: The valence of users ' emotion induced by red or green is controversial .

label: Research method
text: This study firstly discovers that colored tags inked in red incite users ' positive emotion ( evaluations ) and colored tags inked in green incite negative emotion ( evaluations ) using an ERP experiment , which is manifested in ERP components ( e.g. , N170 , N2c , and LPC ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There are two main features of Tag : the text of Tag ( abbr .

label: Research method
text: Text ) and the color of Tag ( abbr.Color ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our study then proves that Color ( red or green ) is the dominant factor in users ' decision behavior compared with Text under the high cognitive load condition , while users ' decision behavior is influenced by Text ( positive tags or negative tags ) predominately rather than by Color under the low cognitive load condition with the help of Eye tracking instrument .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Those Research findings/conclusions can help to design colored tags for recommendation systems on e-commerce websites and other online platforms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For generators , stature can influence attractiveness of alternative dissemination routes and deliberations of those who assess generator performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For knowledge consumers , channel stature may influence knowledge content to which they are exposed .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study introduces a novel approach to conceptualizing and measuring stature of knowledge-dissemination channels : the power-impact ( PI ) technique .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is a flexible technique having 3 complementary variants , giving holistic insights about channel stature by accounting for both attraction of knowledge generators to a distribution channel and degree to which knowledge consumers choose to use a channel 's knowledge content .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Each PI variant is expressed in terms of multiple parameters , permitting customization of stature evaluation to suit its user 's preferences .

label: Research method
text: In the spirit of analytics , each PI variant is driven by objective evidence of actual behaviors .

label: Research method
text: The PI technique is based on 2 building blocks : ( a ) power that channels have for attracting results of generators ' knowledge work , and ( b ) impact that channel contents ' exhibit on prospective recipients .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Feasibility and functionality of the PI-technique design are demonstrated by applying it to solve a problem of journal stature evaluation for the information-systems discipline .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These two indicators raised doubts about the reliability of this ranking method because they are difficult to cope with .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Recently , a newsletter was published featuring a reduced ARWU ranking list , leaving out Nobel Prize and Fields Medal indicators : the Alternative Ranking ( Excluding Award Factor ) .

label: Research method
text: We used uncertainty and sensitivity analyses to examine and compare the stability and confidence of the official ARWU ranking and the Alternative Ranking .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that if the ARWU ranking is reduced to the 4-indicator Alternative Ranking , it shows greater certainty and stability in ranking universities .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: HIB has not been examined in detail at the broader contextual level of intellectual Research questions ( that is , the higher-order conceptual tasks the information was acquired to support ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Examination at this level can enhance holistic understanding of HIB as a means to an intellectual end and inform the design of digital information environments that support information interaction for specific intellectual Research questionss .

label: Research method
text: We investigate information-based ideation ( IBI ) as a specific intellectual information acquisition and use context by conducting Critical Incident-style interviews with 10 game designers , focusing on how they interact with information to generate and develop creative design ideas .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions give rise to a framework of their ideation-focused HIB , which systems designers can leverage to reason about how best to support certain behaviors to drive design ideation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions emphasize the importance of intellectual Research questions as a driver for acquisition and desired outcome of use .

label: Research questions
text: This article reviews current efforts to connect music data through the Semantic Web , with an emphasis on the Music Ontology ( MO ) and ontology alignment approaches ; it also presents a framework for understanding the life cycle of a musical work , focusing on the central activities of composition , performance , and use .

label: Research method
text: The project studied metadata structures and properties of 11 music-related LD data sets and mapped them to the descriptions commonly used in the library cataloging records for sound recordings and musical scores ( including MARC records and their extended schema.org markup ) , and records from 20 collections of digitized music recordings and scores ( featuring a variety of metadata structures ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis resulted in a set of crosswalks and a unified crosswalk that aligns these properties .

label: Research method
text: The paper reports on detailed methodologies used and discusses research Research findings/conclusions and issues .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Topics of particular concern include ( a ) the challenges of mapping between the overgeneralized descriptions found in library data and the specialized , music-oriented properties present in the LD data sets ; ( b ) the hidden information and access points in library data ; and ( c ) the potential benefits of enriching library data through the mapping of properties found in library catalogs to similar properties used by LD data sets .

label: Research method
text: They rely on a large number of features to compute the rank of search results for each given query .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The estimated reputation of pages is among the effective features available for search engine designers , probably being adopted by most current commercial search engines .

label: Research method
text: Page reputation is estimated by analyzing the linkage relationships between pages .

label: Research method
text: This information is used by link analysis algorithms as a query-independent feature , to be taken into account when computing the rank of the results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Unfortunately , several types of links found on the web may damage the estimated page reputation and thus cause a negative effect on the quality of search results .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This work studies alternatives to reduce the negative impact of such noisy links .

label: Research questions
text: More specifically , the authors propose and evaluate new methods that deal with noisy links , considering scenarios where the reputation of pages is computed using the PageRank algorithm .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: They show , through experiments with real web content , that their methods achieve significant improvements when compared to previous solutions proposed in the literature .

label: Research method
text: Answers , a major question and answer ( Q & A ) site .

label: Research method
text: Mainly drawing on the ideas of Toulmin ( ) , argument pattern is conceptualized as a set of 5 major elements : claim , counterclaim , rebuttal , support , and grounds .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The combinations of these elements result in diverse argument patterns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Failed opening consists of an initial claim only , whereas nonoppositional argument pattern also includes indications of support .

label: Research method
text: Oppositional argument pattern contains the elements of counterclaim and rebuttal .

label: Research method
text: Mixed argument pattern entails all 5 elements .

label: Research method
text: The empirical data were gathered by downloading from Yahoo !

label: Research questions
text: Answers 100 discussion threads discussing global warminga controversial topic providing a fertile ground for arguments for and against .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Of the argument patterns , failed openings were most frequent , followed by oppositional , nonoppositional , and mixed patterns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In most cases , the participants grounded their arguments by drawing on personal beliefs and facts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions suggest that oppositional and mixed argument patterns provide more opportunities for the assessment of the quality and credibility of answers , as compared to failed openings and nonoppositional argument patterns .

label: Research questions
text: For this study , the term social technologies refers to the fast-evolving suite of tools such as traditional applications like e-mail , phone , and instant messenger ; emerging social networking platforms ( often known as social media ) such as blogs and wikis ; public social networking sites ( i.e. , Facebook , Twitter , and LinkedIn ) ; and enterprise social networking technologies that are specifically hosted within one organization 's computing environment ( i.e. , Socialtext ) .

label: Research method
text: Building from structuration theory , the analysis presented focuses on the knowledge practices of consultants related to their uses of social technologies and the ways in which organizational norms and policies influence these practices .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A primary contribution of this research is a detailed contextualization of social technology uses by knowledge workers .

label: Research questions
text: As many organizations are allowing social media-enabled knowledge sharing to develop organically , most corporate policy toward these platforms remains defensive , not strategic , limiting opportunities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Implications for uses and expectations of social technologies arising from this research will help organizations craft relevant policies and rules to best support technology-enabled informal knowledge practices .

label: Research method
text: Using archival and publication data , we examine pairwise research collaborations among 1,138 faculty members over a 12-year period at a medical school in the United States .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Modeling at the dyadic level , we find that faculty members with more shared institutional affiliations are positively associated with knowledge creation and knowledge impact , and that this association is moderated by the physical proximity of collaborators .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We further find that the positive influence of disciplinary diversity ( e.g. , collaborators from different fields ) on knowledge impact is stronger among pairs that share more affiliations and is significantly reduced as the physical distance among collaborators increases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These results support the idea that shared institutional affiliations and physical proximity can increase interpersonal contact , providing more opportunities to develop trust and mutual understanding , and thus alleviating some of the coordination issues that can arise with higher disciplinary diversity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We discuss the implications for future research on scientific collaborations , managerial practice regarding office space allocation , and strategic planning of initiatives aimed at promoting interdisciplinary collaboration .

label: Research questions
text: Some choices and process events are captured automatically , but their interactions are not currently well understood or documented .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study examined the decision space of web archives and its role in shaping what is and what is not captured in the web archiving process .

label: Research questions
text: By comparing how three different web archives collections were created and documented , we investigate how curatorial decisions interact with technical and external factors and we compare commonalities and differences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions reveal the need to understand both the social and technical context that shapes those decisions and the ways in which these individual decisions interact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the study , we propose a framework for documenting key dimensions of a collection that addresses the situated nature of the organizational context , technical specificities , and unique characteristics of web materials that are the focus of a collection .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The framework enables future researchers to undertake empirical work studying the process of creating web archives collections in different contexts .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Despite a plethora of research Research findings/conclusions suggesting that a significant group of users look for information within a specific geographical scope , existing reformulation studies lack a focused analysis of how users reformulate geographic queries .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study comprehensively investigates the ways in which users reformulate such needs in an attempt to fill this gap in the literature .

label: Research method
text: Reformulated sessions were sampled from a query log of a major search engine to extract 2,400 entries that were manually inspected to filter geo sessions .

label: Research method
text: This filter identified 471 search sessions that included geographical intent , and these sessions were analyzed quantitatively and qualitatively .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results revealed that one in five of the users who reformulated their queries were looking for geographically related information .

label: Research method
text: They reformulated their queries by changing the content of the query rather than the structure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Users were not following a unified sequence of modifications and instead performed a single reformulation action .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , in some cases it was possible to anticipate their next move .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A number of tasks in geo modifications were identified , including standard , multi-needs , multi-places , and hybrid approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The research concludes that it is important to specialize query reformulation studies to focus on particular query types rather than generically analyzing them , as it is apparent that geographic queries have their special reformulation characteristics .

label: Research method
text: Based on a survey of members of the condensed matter physics ( CMP ) community gathered around the National High Magnetic Field Laboratory , a large national laboratory , this article defines a model of CMP research project tasks consisting of 10 task constructs .

label: Research method
text: In addition , the study develops a model of data quality perceptions by CMP scientists consisting of four data quality constructs .

label: Research questions
text: The paper also discusses relationships among the data quality perceptions , project roles , and demographic characteristics of CMP scientists .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions of the study can inform the design of a CMP data curation model that is aligned and harmonized with the community 's research work structure and data practices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: OA publishing is now actively stimulated by Dutch science policy , similar to the United Kingdom .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a bibliometric baseline measurement to assess the current situation , to be able to measure developments over time .

label: Research method
text: We collected data from various sources , and for three different smaller European countries ( the Netherlands , Denmark , and Switzerland ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Not all of the analyses for this baseline measurement are included here .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis presented in this article focuses on the various ways OA can be defined using the Web of Science , limiting the analysis mainly to Gold OA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From the data we collected we can conclude that the way OA is currently registered in various electronic bibliographic databases is quite unclear , and various methods applied deliver results that are different , although the impact scores derived from the data point in the same direction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on publicly available archival data from 178 countries , our results provide support for the hypothesized model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , whereas political stability , government effectiveness , and rule of law moderated the relationship of information infrastructure with e-government development in a positive direction , voice and accountability and control of corruption moderated the relationship negatively .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further , the relationship between information infrastructure and e-government development was not contingent on regulatory quality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions contribute to the theoretical discourse on e-government development by highlighting the complementary role of governance and provide suggestions for practice in managing e-government development by enhancing governance , thereby leveraging the effect of information infrastructure on e-government development .

label: Research method
text: The 2D distribution of these institutions is then utilized ( 1 ) to categorize the institutions into a number of qualitative groups revealing the nature of their performance , and ( 2 ) to determine the position of a specific institution among the set of institutions .

label: Research method
text: The method is compared with some major h-type indices and tested with empirical data using clinical medicine as an illustrative case .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The method is extensible to the research performance evaluation at other aggregation levels such as researchers , journals , departments , and nations .

label: Research method
text: To address this , I analyze data from a social networking site that started charging its users for an app that populates their e-mail address books with updated contact information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: I find that purchase rates of the app were higher for users with large , structurally diverse networks - which contain several distinct social groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , personal ties ( i.e. , family members and friends ) increased purchase rates more than professional ties .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: I attribute the first effect to the difficulty of obtaining information about a large , diverse social network , which the app reduces , and the second effect to the regularity with which people use information about their personal ties .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we present a framework to classify these web robots from two orthogonal perspectives , namely , their functionality and the types of resources they consume .

label: Research method
text: Applying the classification framework to a year-long access log from the UConn SoE web server , we present trends that point to significant differences in their crawling behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For scientists to leverage the value of existing government data sets , critical data sets must be identified and made as widely available as possible .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , government data sets can only be leveraged when policy makers first assess the value of data , in much the same way they decide the value of grants for research outside government .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We argue that legislators should also remove structural barriers to interoperability by funding technical infrastructure according to issue clusters rather than administrative programs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As developers attempt to make government data more accessible through portals , they should consider a range of other nontechnical constraints attached to the data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that agencies react to the large number of constraints by mostly posting their data on their own websites only rather than in data portals that can facilitate sharing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite the nontechnical constraints , we find that scientists working in government agencies exercise some autonomy in data decisions , such as data documentation , which determine whether or not the data can be widely shared .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Fortunately , scientists indicate a willingness to share the data they collect or maintain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , we argue further that a complete measure of access should also consider the normative decisions to collect ( or not ) particular data .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This work quantifies how much of the technologically-mediated information and communication explosion during the period of digitization ( 1986-2007 ) was driven by the deployment of additional technological devices , and how much by technological progress in hardware and software .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that technological progress has contributed between two to six times more than additional technological infrastructure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While infrastructure seems to reach a certain level of saturation at roughly 20 storage devices per capita and 2 to 3 telecommunication subscriptions per capita , informational capacities are still expanding greatly .

label: Research questions
text: Besides progress in better hardware , software for information compression turns out to be an important and often neglected driver of the global growth of technologically-mediated information and communication capacities .

label: Research questions
text: With the increased generative capacity of corpus-based conversational agents comes the need to classify and filter out malevolent responses that are inappropriate in terms of content and dialogue acts .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous studies on the topic of detecting and classifying inappropriate content are mostly focused on a specific category of malevolence or on single sentences instead of an entire dialogue .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We make three contributions to advance research on the malevolent dialogue response detection and classification ( MDRDC ) task .

label: Research method
text: First , we define the task and present a hierarchical malevolent dialogue taxonomy .

label: Research method
text: Second , we create a labeled multiturn dialogue data set and formulate the MDRDC task as a hierarchical classification task .

label: Research method
text: Last , we apply state-of-the-art text classification methods to the MDRDC task , and report on experiments aimed at assessing the performance of these approaches .

label: Research questions
text: Behavioral intention ( BI ) to use an IT is considered the sole proximal determinant of IT adoption and use .

label: Research questions
text: Recently , researchers have discussed the limitations of BI and argued that behavioral expectation ( BE ) would be a better predictor of IT use .

label: Research questions
text: However , without a theoretical and empirical understanding of the determinants of BE , we remain limited in our comprehension of what factors promote greater IT use in organizations .

label: Research method
text: Using the unified theory of acceptance and use of technology as the theoretical framework , we develop a model that posits 2 determinants ( i.e. , social influence and facilitating conditions ) of BE and 4 moderators ( i.e. , gender , age , experience , and voluntariness of use ) of the relationship between BE and its determinants .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that the cognitions underlying the formation of BI and BE differ .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found strong support for the proposed model in a longitudinal field study of 321 users of a new IT .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We offer theoretical and practical IT implications of our Research findings/conclusions .

label: Research method
text: The paper sets out to correct this through an analysis of the logs of a major cultural website , Europeana .

label: Research method
text: The behavior of nearly 70,000 mobile users was examined over a period of more than a year and compared with that for PC users of the same site and for the same period .

label: Research method
text: The analyses conducted include : size and growth of use , time patterns of use ; geographical location of users , digital collections used ; comparative information-seeking behavior using dashboard metrics , clustering of users according to their information seeking , and user satisfaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main Research findings/conclusions were that mobile users were the fastest-growing group and will rise rapidly to a million by December 2012 and that their visits were very different in the aggregate from those arising from fixed platforms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Mobile visits could be described as being information lite : typically shorter , less interactive , and less content viewed per visit .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Use took a social rather than office pattern , with mobile use peaking at nights and weekends .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The variation between different mobile devices was large , with information seeking on the iPad similar to that for PCs and laptops and that for smartphones very different indeed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The research further confirms that informationseeking behavior is platform-specific and the latest platforms are changing it all again .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Websites will have to adapt .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A variety of studies conducted in organizational settings have provided us with key insights about the collaborative aspects of seeking , retrieving , and using information .

label: Research questions
text: Researchers have used a range of terms , including collaborative information seeking ( CIS ) , collaborative information retrieval ( CIR ) , collaborative search , collaborative sensemaking , and others to describe various pertinent activities .

label: Research questions
text: Consequently , we lack conceptual clarity concerning these activities , leading to a tendency to use terms interchangeably when in fact they may be referring to different issues .

label: Research questions
text: Here , we offer collaborative information behavior ( CIB ) as an umbrella term to connote the collaborative aspects of information seeking , retrieval , and use .

label: Research method
text: We provide the contours of a model of CIB synthesized from Research findings/conclusions of past studies conducted by our research team as well as other researchers .

label: Research method
text: By reanalyzing and synthesizing the data from those studies , we conceptualize CIB as comprised of a set of constitutive activities , organized into three broad phasesproblem formulation , collaborative information seeking , and information use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Some of the activities are specific to a particular phase , whereas others are common to all phases .

label: Research questions
text: We explain how those constitutive activities are related to one another .

label: Research questions
text: Finally , we discuss the limitations of our model as well as its potential usefulness in advancing CIB research .

label: Research method
text: Such articles were defined as sleeping beauties by van Raan , who quantitatively studied the phenomenon of delayed recognition .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the criteria adopted by van Raan at times are not applicable and may confer recognition prematurely .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To revise such deficiencies , this paper proposes two new criteria , which are applicable ( but not limited ) to exponential citation curves .

label: Research method
text: We searched for genius work among articles of Nobel Prize laureates during the period of 1901-2012 on the Web of Science , finding 25 articles of genius work out of 21,438 papers including 10 ( by van Raan 's criteria ) sleeping beauties and 15 nonsleeping-beauties .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By our new criteria , two Research findings/conclusions were obtained through empirical analysis : ( a ) the awakening periods for genius work depend on the increase rate b in the exponential function , and ( b ) lower b leads to a longer sleeping period .

label: Research questions
text: Knowledge embodiment in robotic systems with artificial intelligence ( Al robotic systems ) actualizes the value of knowledge much more powerfully than other entities , potentially altering the connections among people or even displacing professionals .

label: Research questions
text: To understand the effects of knowledge embodiment in Al robotic systems on connections among people and technology , this study addresses 2 cumulative research questions : ( i ) What is the nature of knowledge embodiment , that is , how are knowledge and Al robots assembled for knowledge work ?

label: Research questions
text: ( ii ) How does knowledge embodiment affect connections among people and technology ( that is , social informatics ) ?

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A case study of a large hospital that has employed different Al robotic systems in many parts of its healthcare service provision process indicates 4 forms of knowledge embodiment , each with a distinct focus .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further , a social informatics analysis suggests four ways knowledge embodiment affects connections among people and technology and reveals related social and institutional issues that go beyond technological determinism .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Implications of these Research findings/conclusions for research on social informatics and information science are discussed .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study synthesizes research throughout different , yet complementary , areas , each capable of contributing Research findings/conclusions and understanding to visual information seeking .

label: Research method
text: Methods previously applied for examining the visual information seeking process are reviewed , including interactive experiments , surveys , and various qualitative approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The methods and resulting Research findings/conclusions are presented and structured according to generalized phases of existing information seeking models , which include the needs , actions , and assessments of users .

label: Research method
text: A review of visual information needs focuses on need and thus query formulation ; user actions , as reviewed , centers on search and browse behaviors and the observed trends , concluded by a survey of users ' assessments of visual information as part of the interactive process .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This separate examination , specific to a visual context , is significant ; visual information can influence outcomes in an interactive process and presents variations in the types of needs , tasks , considerations , and decisions of users , as compared to information seeking in other contexts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Electronic data in the form of semantic predications have a potential role in literature-based discovery , which can be guided by serendipitous knowledge discovery research Research findings/conclusions .

label: Research questions
text: We sought to model information-seeking behavior within the context of serendipitous knowledge discovery by leveraging existing research .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These efforts were done with an eye for a potential literature-based discovery application that utilizes semantic predications .

label: Research method
text: We performed a literature search , reviewed the results , and applied the Research findings/conclusions in developing a model for serendipitous knowledge discovery as an information-seeking behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The literature review indicated four important themes in serendipitous knowledge discovery : iteration , change or clarification , a seeker 's prior knowledge , and the role of information organization and presentation .

label: Research questions
text: The Interaction Flow in Serendipitous Knowledge Discovery ( IF-SKD ) model includes these themes , and accommodates iterative , evolving search interests .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Output can be presented in a manner to enhance short-term memory conceptualization and connections with prior knowledge .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although the IF-SKD model is currently a theoretical structure , its utility is demonstrated through replicating a literature-based discovery event , using a documented search method within the model 's steps .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The IF-SKD model can potentially serve as the foundation for future literature-based discovery applications .

label: Research questions
text: With the increasing availability of K-12 science , technology , engineering , and mathematics ( STEM ) digital library content , alignment of that content with educational standards is a significant and continuous challenge .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Whereas direct , one-to-one alignment of standards is preferable but currently unsustainable in its resource demands , less resource-intensive intermediary-based alignment offers an interesting alternative .

label: Research questions
text: But will it work ?

label: Research method
text: We present the results from an experiment in which the machine-based Standard Alignment Tool ( SAT ) incorporated in the National Science Digital Library ( NSDL ) was used to collect over half a million direct alignments between standards from different standard-authoring bodies .

label: Research method
text: These were then used to compute intermediary-based alignments derived from the well-known AAAS Project 2061 Benchmarks and NSES standards .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show strong variation among authoring bodies in their success at crosswalking , with the best results for those who modeled their standards on the intermediaries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results furthermore show a strong inverse relationship between recall and precision when both intermediates were involved in the crosswalking .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our research uncovers the best core set of relevant indices for predicting other bibliometric indices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An added difficulty is to select the role of each variable , that is , which bibliometric indices are predictive variables and which are response variables .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This results in a novel multioutput regression problem where the role of each variable ( predictor or response ) is unknown beforehand .

label: Research method
text: We use Gaussian Bayesian networks to solve the this problem and discover multivariate relationships among bibliometric indices .

label: Research method
text: These networks are learnt by a genetic algorithm that looks for the optimal models that best predict bibliometric data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that the optimal induced Gaussian Bayesian networks corroborate previous relationships between several indices , but also suggest new , previously unreported interactions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An extended analysis of the best model illustrates that a set of 12 bibliometric indices can be accurately predicted using only a smaller predictive core subset composed of citations , g-index , q ( 2 ) -index , and h ( r ) -index .

label: Research method
text: This research is performed using bibliometric data on Spanish full professors associated with the computer science area .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It has been applied to many applications in many different research and industrial areas .

label: Research method
text: Term-weighting schemes assign an appropriate weight to each term to obtain a high TC performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although term weighting is one of the important modules for TC and TC has different peculiarities from those in information retrieval , many term-weighting schemes used in information retrieval , such as term frequency-inverse document frequency ( tf-idf ) , have been used in TC in the same manner .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The peculiarity of TC that differs most from information retrieval is the existence of class information .

label: Research method
text: This article proposes a new term-weighting scheme that uses class information using positive and negative class distributions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As a result , the proposed scheme , log tf-TRR , consistently performs better than do other schemes using class information as well as traditional schemes such as tf-idf .

label: Research method
text: Typically , a researcher browses through a list of publications and traces additional relevant publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When relevant publications are identified , the list may be expanded by the citation links of the relevant publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The information needs of researchers may change as they go through such iterative processes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The exploration process quickly becomes cumbersome as the list expands .

label: Research questions
text: Most existing academic search systems tend to be limited in terms of the extent to which searchers can adapt their search as they proceed .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we introduce an adaptive visual exploration system named PaperPoles to support exploration of scientific publications in a context-aware environment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Searchers can express their information needs by intuitively formulating positive and negative queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The search results are grouped and displayed in a cluster view , which shows aspects and relevance patterns of the results to support navigation and exploration .

label: Research method
text: We conducted an experiment to compare PaperPoles with a list-based interface in performing two academic search tasks with different complexity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that PaperPoles can improve the accuracy of searching for the simple and complex tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It can also reduce the completion time of searching and improve exploration effectiveness in the complex task .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: PaperPoles demonstrates a potentially effective workflow for adaptive visual search of complex information .

label: Research questions
text: CNI posits the existence of nonvolitional mechanisms that force information behaviors beyond the control of the individual .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The CNI model consists of six primary CNI types : intrinsic somatic barriers , socio-environmental barriers , authoritarian barriers , threshold knowledge shortfall barriers , attention shortfall barriers , and filtering barriers .

label: Research questions
text: This typology of information interaction limitations functions across a full range of socio-economic contexts and thus lends itself to analysis of intractable power-based inequities such as intimate partner violence ( IPV ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: IPV includes physical , mental , financial , and social attacks that , if known , generate socially sanctioned responses of both formal ( e.g. , law enforcement ) and informal ( e.g. , pastoral ) approaches .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Using the CNI framework to analyze information factors in distinct facets of the IPV experience , as identified in the cross disciplinary research on this phenomenon , this article provides a practical application of CNI to a complicated , high-risk phenomenon .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study examined how researchers stay up to date , using the information journey model as a framework for analysis and investigating which dimensions influence information behaviors .

label: Research method
text: We designed a 2-round study involving semistructured interviews and prototype testing with 61 researchers with 3 levels of seniority ( PhD student to professor ) .

label: Research method
text: Data were analyzed following a semistructured qualitative approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Five key dimensions that influence information behaviors were identified : level of seniority , information sources , state of the project , level of familiarity , and how well defined the relevant community is .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These dimensions are interrelated and their values determine the flow of the information journey .

label: Research method
text: Across all levels of professional expertise , researchers used similar hard ( formal ) sources to access content , while soft ( interpersonal ) sources were used to filter information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An important pain point that future information tools should address is helping researchers filter information at the point of need .

label: Research questions
text: An interdisciplinary line of research has been established that empirically assesses the phenomenon of scientific misconduct using information on retractions , and thus aims to shed light on aspects of misconduct that previously were hidden .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , comparability and interpretability of studies are to a certain extent impeded by an absence of standards in corpus delineation and by the fact that the validity of this empirical data basis has never been systematically scrutinized .

label: Research method
text: This article assesses the conceptual and empirical delineation of retractions against related publication types through a comparative analysis of the coverage and consistency of retraction annotation in the databases PubMed and the Web of Science ( WoS ) , which are both commonly used for empicial studies on retractions .

label: Research method
text: The searching and linking approaches of the WoS were subsequently evaluated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that a considerable number of PubMed retracted publications and retractions are not labeled as such in the WoS or are indistinguishable from corrections , which is highly relevant for corpus and sample strategies in the WoS .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: With this method one can determine the historical roots of research fields and quantify their impact on current research .

label: Research method
text: RPYS is based on the analysis of the frequency with which references are cited in the publications of a specific research field in terms of the publication years of these cited references .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The origins show up in the form of more or less pronounced peaks mostly caused by individual publications that are cited particularly frequently .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we use research on graphene and on solar cells to illustrate how RPYS functions , and what results it can deliver .

label: Research questions
text: This new type of document will evolve from the combination of contemporary participatory , transmedia storytelling with pervasive computing technologies and multisensory interfaces .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is argued that a research program within library and information science is needed , to investigate new information behaviors associated with such documents , the new digital literacies needed to make effective use of them , and their place in the information communication chain .

label: Research questions
text: This study seeks to understand the differences between these two interfaces and how they affect the search experience of the novice user .

label: Research method
text: In this study , 40 participants were asked to search for resources using both interfaces .

label: Research method
text: Their search times and accuracy were measured across three types of search tasks ( known , partially known , and exploratory ) .

label: Research method
text: After completing the searches , they were asked a series of questions about their experiences .

label: Research method
text: The data were analyzed in order to identify strengths and weaknesses in both search interfaces .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thirty-six out of 40 participants preferred the TextFacet interface to the TextOnly interface .

label: Research method
text: Using three dependent variables-time , accuracy , and rating-the two interfaces were compared and interactions were tested with the three task types .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Search times for the TextFacet were shorter and participants preferred the TextFacet search interface over the TextOnly search interface .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Performances across the three task types were different in terms of search time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The partially known and exploratory task types showed similar distributions for rating and accuracy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These distributions were distinctly different from the known task type .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of this study may assist libraries in developing improved library catalog search interfaces that utilize facets as well as text searching .

label: Research method
text: To explore whether autocomplete functions reduce the impact of dyslexia on information searching , 20 participants with dyslexia and 20 controls solved 10 predefined tasks in the search engine Google .

label: Research method
text: Eye-tracking and screen-capture documented the searches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There were no significant differences between the dyslexic students and the controls in time usage , number of queries , query lengths , or the use of the autocomplete function .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , participants with dyslexia made more misspellings and looked less at the screen and the autocomplete suggestions lists while entering the queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that although the autocomplete function supported the participants in the search process , a more extensive use of the autocomplete function would have reduced misspellings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further , the high tolerance for spelling errors considerably reduced the effect of dyslexia , and may be as important as the autocomplete function .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is found that the GO deviates in some respects from its principles of ontological realism , and it is suggested the two forms of vocabulary could benefit from adopting good practice from the other .

label: Research questions
text: We examine how social informatics researchers have studied knowledge , computerization , and the workplace , and how all of those have evolved over time .

label: Research method
text: We describe the process by which articles were included , how they help us understand the field of social informatics scholarship today , and reflect briefly on what the future of the field holds .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Egghe argued that a good impact measure should reward nonconsistency ; that is , the more citations over papers are unequally distributed , the higher the impact should be .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Here , a quantitative proxy for consistency is offered , and it is shown that as consistency increases , the ideal performance measure , which is sensitive to changes in consistency , should increase , reflecting this virtue .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study uses the lens of human information interaction to investigate finding aid use .

label: Research method
text: Data were collected through a lab-based study of 32 experienced archives ' users who completed two tasks with each of two finding aids .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Participants were able to carry out the tasks , but they were somewhat challenged by the structure of the finding aid and employed various techniques to cope .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Their patterns of interaction differed by task type and they reported higher rates of satisfaction , ease of use , and clarity for the assessment task than the known-item task .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Four common patterns of interaction were identified : top-down , bottom-up , interrogative , and opportunistic .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show how users interact with Research findings/conclusions aids and identify features that support and hinder use .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research examines process and performance in addition to outcomes .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Results contribute to the archival science literature and also suggest ways to extend models of human information interaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Just as with data , the visibility of software in publications is related to incentives to share software in reusable ways , and so promote efficient science .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we examine software in publications through content analysis of a random sample of 90 biology articles .

label: Research method
text: We develop a coding scheme to identify software mentions and classify them according to their characteristics and ability to realize the functions of citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , we find diverse and problematic practices : Only between 31 % and 43 % of mentions involve formal citations ; informal mentions are very common , even in high impact factor journals and across different kinds of software .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Software is frequently inaccessible ( 15 % -29 % of packages in any form ; between 90 % and 98 % of specific versions ; only between 24 % -40 % provide source code ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Cites to publications are particularly poor at providing version information , whereas informal mentions are particularly poor at providing crediting information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We provide recommendations to improve the practice of software citation , highlighting recent nascent efforts .

label: Research questions
text: Software plays an increasingly great role in scientific practice ; it deserves a clear and useful place in scholarly communication .

label: Research questions
text: To optimize the utilization of knowledge in organizations , it is crucial to identify factors that influence knowledge popularity .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: From a network perspective , this study proposes a model to evaluate knowledge popularity by investigating 2 attributes of contextual information ( i.e. , authors and tags ) that are embedded in a heterogeneous knowledge network , and how they interact to impact knowledge popularity .

label: Research method
text: Objective data obtained through the interaction history of a KMS in a global telecommunication company was applied to test the hypotheses .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper contributes to the extant literature on knowledge popularity by identifying contextual attributions of knowledge , and empirically tests the impact of their interactions on knowledge popularity .

label: Research method
text: The conceptual framework for the study is Kuhlthau 's 6-stage information-search process ( ISP ) model .

label: Research questions
text: The objective of the study is to test and extend ISP model concepts .

label: Research method
text: As per other ISP model studies , our study measured the evolution of the feelings , thoughts , and actions of the study participants over the 3-month period of their class project .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The unique feature of this study is the unlimited access the researchers had to a real-life history class , resulting in 12 separate measuring periods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We report 2 important Research findings/conclusions of the study .

label: Research method
text: First , through factor analysis , we determined 5 factors that define the temporality of completing an inquiry-based project for these grade 8 students .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The second main finding is the importance of the students ' consultations with their classmates , siblings , parents , and teachers in the construction of the knowledge necessary to complete their project .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Not only did female candidates tweet more often , but they also spent more time attacking their opponents and discussing important issues in American politics .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we examine whether the female winners of those races acted differently than the male winners in the 2012 election , and whether they differed in their tweeting-style during two months in the summer of 2013 .

label: Research method
text: Using a hand-coded content analysis of every tweet from each member in the U.S. House of Representatives in June and July of 2013 , we show that women differ from their male colleagues in their frequency and type of tweeting , and note some key differences between the period during the election and the period after .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article suggests that context greatly affects representatives ' Twitter-style .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Information is illustrated by some new facts concerning The BKCI 's use in bibliometrics , coverage analysis , and a series of idiosyncrasies worthy of further discussion .

label: Research questions
text: The BKCI was launched primarily to assist researchers identify useful and relevant research that was previously invisible to them , owing to the lack of significant book content in citation indexes such as the Web of Science .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: So far , the content of 33,000 books has been added to the desktops of the global research community , the majority in the arts , humanities , and social sciences fields .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Initial analyses of the data from The BKCI have indicated that The BKCI , in its current version , should not be used for bibliometric or evaluative Research questionss .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The most significant limitations to this potential application are the high share of publications without address information , the inflation of publication counts , the lack of cumulative citation counts from different hierarchical levels , and inconsistency in citation counts between the cited reference search and the book citation index .

label: Research questions
text: However , The BKCI is a first step toward creating a reliable and necessary citation data source for monographs- a very challenging issue , because , unlike journals and conference proceedings , books have specific requirements , and several problems emerge not only in the context of subject classification , but also in their role as cited publications and in citing publications .

label: Research method
text: Scholarly publications are analyzed to track and trace breakthrough processes as well as their impact on world science .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The focus in this study is on the incremental discovery of the ubiquitin-mediated proteolytic system in the late 1970s by a small international team of collaborating researchers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Analysis of their groundbreaking research articles , all produced within a relatively short period of time , and the network of citing articles shows the cumulative effects of the intense collaboration within a small group of researchers working on the same subject .

label: Research method
text: Using bibliographic data from the Web of Science database and the PATSTAT patents database in combination with expert opinions shows that these discoveries accumulated into a new technology .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These first Research findings/conclusions suggest that potential breakthrough discoveries can be identified at a relatively early stage by careful analysis of publication and citation patterns .

label: Research method
text: There are three representative smoothing methods : Jelinek-Mercer ( JM ) method ; Bayesian smoothing using Dirichlet priors ( Dir ) method ; and absolute discounting ( Dis ) method , whose parameters are usually estimated empirically .

label: Research questions
text: Previous research in information retrieval ( IR ) on smoothing parameter estimation tends to select a single value from optional values for the collection , but it may not be appropriate for all the queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The effectiveness of all the optional values should be considered to improve the ranking performance .

label: Research questions
text: Recently , learning to rank has become an effective approach to optimize the ranking accuracy by merging the existing retrieval methods .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , the smoothing methods for language modeling in information retrieval ( LMIR ) with different parameters are treated as different retrieval methods , then a learning to rank approach to learn a ranking model based on the features extracted by smoothing methods is presented .

label: Research method
text: In the process of learning , the effectiveness of all the optional smoothing parameters is taken into account for all queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results on the Learning to Rank for Information Retrieval ( LETOR ) LETOR3.0 and LETOR4.0 data sets show that our approach is effective in improving the performance of LMIR .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , when presented with many evidence documents , users do not necessarily read and trust them uniformly .

label: Research questions
text: Psychologists and other researchers have shown that users tend to follow and agree with articles and sources that hold viewpoints similar to their own , a phenomenon known as confirmation bias .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This suggests that when learning about a controversial topic , human biases and viewpoints about the topic may affect what is considered trustworthy or credible .

label: Research questions
text: It is an interesting challenge to build systems that can help users overcome this bias and help them decide the truthfulness of claims .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we study various factors that enable humans to acquire additional information about controversial claims in an unbiased fashion .

label: Research questions
text: Specifically , we designed a user study to understand how presenting evidence with contrasting viewpoints and source expertise ratings affect how users learn from the evidence documents .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that users do not seek contrasting viewpoints by themselves , but explicitly presenting contrasting evidence helps them get a well-rounded understanding of the topic .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , explicit knowledge of the credibility of the sources and the context in which the source provides the evidence document not only affects what users read but also whether they perceive the document to be credible .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although some previous studies focused on assisting professionals in the retrieval of related legal documents , they did not take into account the general public and their difficulty in describing legal problems in professional legal terms .

label: Research questions
text: Because this problem has not been addressed by previous research , this study aims to design a text-mining-based method that allows the general public to use everyday vocabulary to search for and retrieve criminal judgments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results indicate that our method can help the general public , who are not familiar with professional legal terms , to acquire relevant criminal judgments more accurately and effectively .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Does the fact that the author of an article knows the author whose work he or she cites have an impact on the context of the citation ?

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Because citations are commonly used as criteria for research evaluation , it is important to question their social background to better understand how it impacts textual features .

label: Research method
text: We studied a collection of science articles ( N = 123 ) from 5 disciplines and interviewed their authors ( N = 84 ) to : ( a ) identify the social relations between citing and cited authors ; and ( b ) measure the correlation between a set of features related to in-text citations ( N = 6,956 ) and the identified social relations .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our pioneering work , mixing sociological and linguistic results , shows that social relations between authors can partly explain the variations of citations in terms of frequency , position and textual context .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In drawing data from the popular review platform Amazon , results indicate that review helpfulness is positively related to reviewer profile and review depth but is negatively related to review rating .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Users seem to have a proclivity for reviews contributed by reviewers with a positive track record .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: They also appreciate reviews with lambasting comments and those with adequate depth .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By highlighting its implications for theory and practice , the article concludes with limitations and areas for further research .

label: Research questions
text: Mediated search provides an opportunity to elaborate on this idea , as an intermediary 's elicitations reveal what aspects of the user model they think are worth inquiring about .

label: Research questions
text: However , empirical evidence is divided over whether intermediaries actually work to develop a broadly conceived user model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our research revisits the issue in a web research services setting , whose characteristics are expected to result in more thorough user modeling on the part of intermediaries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our empirical study confirms that intermediaries engage in rich user modeling .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While intermediaries behave differently across settings , our interpretation is that the underlying user model characteristics that intermediaries inquire about in our setting are applicable to other settings as well .

label: Research method
text: Forty-eight ELL students from three classes at a high school participated in the study while they conducted a research project in English .

label: Research method
text: Data were collected through demographic questionnaire and process surveys .

label: Research method
text: Students ' demographic information , knowledge about their research topic , labeling of knowledge , estimate of interest and knowledge , and learning outcomes were collected and analyzed with content analysis and statistical techniques .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions indicate that ELL students , as a whole group , showed significant increases in their topical knowledge and estimate of interest and knowledge as they progressed in the research project , which are consistent with what other ISP-based studies found .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When three different English proficiency-level groups were compared , only the intermediate group showed significant increases in topical knowledge and estimate of knowledge throughout the process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , different research tasks impacted the amount and substance of knowledge students built and their estimated knowledge during the research project .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions led to suggestions for instructional strategies such as learning goals reflecting various kinds of learning , differentiated instructions in mixed-ability classrooms , structured interventions , personalized research topics , and teacher-school librarian collaborations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The automation of textual entailment recognition supports a wide variety of text-based tasks , including information retrieval , information extraction , question answering , text summarization , and machine translation .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Much ingenuity has been devoted to developing algorithms for identifying textual entailments , but relatively little to saying what textual entailment actually is .

label: Research questions
text: This article is a review of the logical and philosophical issues involved in providing an adequate definition of textual entailment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that many natural definitions of textual entailment are refuted by counterexamples , including the most widely cited definition of Dagan et al .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We then articulate and defend the following revised definition : T textually entails H = ( df ) typically , a human reading T would be justified in inferring the proposition expressed by H from the proposition expressed by T. We also show that textual entailment is context-sensitive , nontransitive , and nonmonotonic .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study proposes a research model from a knowledge power perspective , that is , Internet search affects patients ' perception of their knowledge level .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our empirical study of more than 400 subjects suggests that for patients who searched online for disease information , the inconsistency between their self-diagnosis expectations and their physician 's diagnosis reduces their trust in their physician .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The effect is stronger for those who spent more time on Internet search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Patients with chronic conditions are less affected by the inconsistency , as are patients of physicians with a higher professional status .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study also found that physicians ' interaction quality in the diagnosis processhow well they communicate with their patientstill plays a dominant role in gaining patient 's trust .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This finding suggests that even in the high-tech age , high-touch remains an important factor to physician-patient trust .

label: Research questions
text: When selecting expansion terms , most traditional models do not simultaneously consider term frequency and the co-occurrence relationships between candidate terms and query terms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Intuitively , however , a term that has a higher co-occurrence with a query term is more likely to be related to the query topic .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose a kernel co-occurrence-based framework to enhance retrieval performance by integrating term co-occurrence information into the Rocchio model and a relevance language model ( RM3 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Specifically , a kernel co-occurrence-based Rocchio method ( KRoc ) and a kernel co-occurrence-based RM3 method ( KRM3 ) are proposed .

label: Research method
text: In our framework , co-occurrence information is incorporated into both the factor of the term discrimination power and the factor of the within-document term weight to boost retrieval performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of a series of experiments show that our proposed methods significantly outperform the corresponding strong baselines over all data sets in terms of the mean average precision and over most data sets in terms of P @ 10 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A direct comparison of standard Text Retrieval Conference data sets indicates that our proposed methods are at least comparable to state-of-the-art approaches .

label: Research method
text: This article describes the design and development of a novel ontology-based framework to illustrate how ontologies can interface with distributed data sources .

label: Research method
text: The framework is then tested using a survey instrument and an integrated research model of user satisfaction and technology acceptance .

label: Research questions
text: A description is provided of extensions to an industry standard ontology , specifically the Financial Industry Business Ontology ( FIBO ) , towards enabling greater data interchange .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results reveal a significant reduction in manual processes , increase in data quality , and improved data aggregation by employing the framework .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The research model reveals the range of factors that drive acceptance of the framework .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additional interview evidence reveals that the ontological framework also allows organizations to react to regulatory changes with much-improved timeframes and provides opportunities to test for data quality .

label: Research method
text: I first unpack the mainstream , autonomy-centric discourse of privacy , and then present a research model that illustrates a possible new theorization of the relationship between self-identity and information privacy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An empirical study with Facebook users confirms the main hypotheses .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , the data show that the need for self-identity is positively related to privacy management behaviors , which in turn result in increased self-disclosure in online social networks .

label: Research questions
text: I subsequently argue that the so-called privacy paradox is not a paradox per se in the context of online social networking ; rather , privacy concerns reflect the ideology of an autonomous self , whereas social construction of self-identity explains voluntary self-disclosure .
