label: Research questions
text: This paper focuses on offering insight to the curators of digital image libraries who face this dilemma by examining ( i ) how descriptions influence the user in his/her tagging behavior and ( ii ) how this relates to the ( a ) nature of the tags , ( b ) the emergent folksonomy , and ( c ) the findability of the images in the tagging system .

label: Research method
text: We compared two different methods for collecting image tags from Amazon 's Mechanical Turk 's crowdworkerswith and without image descriptions .

label: Research questions
text: Several properties of generated tags were examined from different perspectives : diversity , specificity , reusability , quality , similarity , descriptiveness , and so on .

label: Research method
text: In addition , the study was carried out to examine the impact of image description on supporting users ' information seeking with a tag cloud interface .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results showed that the properties of tags are affected by the crowdsourcing approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Tags from the with description condition are more diverse and more specific than tags from the without description condition , while the latter has a higher tag reuse rate .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A user study also revealed that different tag sets provided different support for search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Tags produced with description shortened the path to the target results , whereas tags produced without description increased user success in the search task .

label: Research findings/conclusions

label: Research method
text: In this part of a multipart study , we investigate the social support types , in particular information support types , across multiple computer-mediated communication formats ( forum , journal , and notes ) within an alcoholism community using descriptive content analysis on 3 months of data from a MedHelp online peer support community .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We present the results of identified informational support types including advice , referral , fact , personal experiences , and opinions , either offered or requested .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Fact type was exchanged most often among the messages ; however , there were some different patterns between notes and journal posts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Notes were used for maintaining relationships rather than as a main source for seeking information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Notes were similar to comments made to journal posts , which may indicate the friendship between journal readers and the author .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions suggest that users may have initially joined the MedHelpAlcoholism Community for information-seeking Research questionss but continue participation even after they have completed with information gathering because of the relationships they formed with community members through social media features .

label: Research method
text: Two theoretical perspectives , institutional theory , and theory of planned behavior , were employed in developing a research model that showed the complementary nature of the institutional and individual factors influencing scientists ' data-sharing behaviors .

label: Research method
text: This research used a survey method to examine to what extent those institutional and individual factors influence scientists ' data-sharing behaviors in a range of scientific disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A national survey ( with 1,317 scientists in 43 disciplines ) showed that regulative pressure by journals , normative pressure at a discipline level , and perceived career benefit and scholarly altruism at an individual level had significant positive relationships with data-sharing behaviors , and that perceived effort had a significant negative relationship .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Regulative pressure by funding agencies and the availability of data repositories at a discipline level and perceived career risk at an individual level were not found to have any significant relationships with data-sharing behaviors .

label: Research questions
text: Recent literature has reported the development of efficient local-pattern-based descriptors , including the local vector pattern ( LVP ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article extends the LVP formulation by making it more computationally efficient and informative .

label: Research method
text: In the extended LVP-based extraction process , the global index angles are determined using the mutual information between the patterns , which are obtained from a pair of indexed angles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , the Proposed LVP ( PLVP ) no longer requires a step to identify patterns in every indexed angle found in the querying phase of the CBIR system .

label: Research method
text: A CBIR system with the PLVP is developed in this article , and the system and its associated methods are tested using data from a benchmark texture database and a natural image database .

label: Research method
text: A performance comparison of the PLVP and traditional patterns , such as the local binary pattern ( LBP ) , completely modeled local binary pattern ( CLBP ) and local tetra pattern ( LTrP ) , is conducted using the CBIR system .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results reveal the superiority of the PLVP in terms of precision , recall , F-score and computational efficiency .

label: Research questions
text: However , such research typically operationalizes health information acquisition with knowledge tests .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Information scientists who investigate socially embedded information behaviors could help improve understanding of potential associations between information behavior-as opposed to knowledge-and health behavior formation , thus providing new opportunities to investigate the effects of health information .

label: Research questions
text: We examine the associations between information behavior and HIV testing intentions among young men who have sex with men ( YMSM ) , a group with high rates of unrecognized HIV infection .

label: Research method
text: We used the theory of planned behavior ( TPB ) to predict intentions to seek HIV testing in an online sample of 163 YMSM .

label: Research method
text: Multiple regression and recursive path analysis were used to test two models : ( a ) the basic TPB model and ( b ) an adapted model that added the direct effects of three information behaviors ( information exposure , use of information to make HIV-testing decisions , prior experience obtaining an HIV test ) plus self-rated HIV knowledge .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As hypothesized , our adapted model improved predictions , explaining more than twice as much variance as the original TPB model .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that information behaviors may be more important predictors of health behavior intentions than previously acknowledged .

text: It examines in detail the variable rate of knowledge production in the field , shifts in subject coverage , the dominance of particular publication genres at different times , prevailing modes of production , interactions with other disciplines , and , more generally , observes how the field has evolved .

label: Research findings/conclusions

label: Research value/outlook/limitations

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The idea of boundary crossing was also examined : in 2010 , nearly 60 % of authors who published in LIS also published in another discipline .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This high degree of permeability in LIS was also demonstrated through reference and citation practices : LIS scholars now cite and receive citations from other fields more than from LIS itself .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Two major structural shifts are revealed in the data : in 1960 , LIS changed from a professional field focused on librarianship to an academic field focused on information and use ; and in 1990 , LIS began to receive a growing number of citations from outside the field , notably from Computer Science and Management , and saw a dramatic increase in the number of authors contributing to the literature of the field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This gap can be filled by Mendeley reader counts , which are valuable early impact indicators for academic articles because they appear before citations and correlate strongly with them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , it is not known how Mendeley readership counts accumulate within the year of publication , and so it is unclear how soon they can be used .

label: Research method
text: In response , this paper reports a longitudinal weekly study of the Mendeley readers of articles in 6 library and information science journals from 2016 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that Mendeley readers accrue from when articles are first available online and continue to steadily build .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For journals with large publication delays , articles can already have substantial numbers of readers by their publication date .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , Mendeley reader counts may even be useful as early impact indicators for articles before they have been officially published in a journal issue .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: If field normalized indicators are needed , then these can be generated when journal issues are published using the online first date .

text: However , they rarely make use of the interrelationship among documents on readability , which can help increase the accuracy of readability assessment .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we adopt a graph-based classification method to model and utilize the relationship among documents using the coupled bag-of-words model .

label: Research method
text: We propose a word coupling method to build the coupled bag-of-words model by estimating the correlation between words on reading difficulty .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , we propose a two-view graph propagation method to make use of both the coupled bag-of-words model and the linguistic features .

label: Research method
text: Our method employs a graph merging operation to combine graphs built according to different views , and improves the label propagation by incorporating the ordinal relation among reading levels .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments were conducted on both English and Chinese data sets , and the results demonstrate both effectiveness and potential of the method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: From submissions and subscriptions to grants and hirings , researchers , policy makers , and funding agencies make important decisions influenced by journal rankings such as the ISI journal impact factor .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Typically , the rankings are derived from the citation network between a selection of journals and unavoidably depend on this selection .

label: Research questions
text: However , little is known about how robust rankings are to the selection of included journals .

label: Research method
text: We compare the robustness of three journal rankings based on network flows induced on citation networks .

label: Research method
text: They model pathways of researchers navigating the scholarly literature , stepping between journals and remembering their previous steps to different degrees : zero-step memory as impact factor , one-step memory as Eigenfactor , and two-step memory , corresponding to zero- , first- , and second-order Markov models of citation flow between journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that higher-order Markov models perform better and are more robust to the selection of journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Whereas our analysis indicates that higher-order models perform better , the performance gain for higher-order Markov models comes at the cost of requiring more citation data over a longer time period .

text: However , Leiden University leads the ranking if fractional counting is used .

text: Twenty-three of the 798 authors were also listed as most highly cited authors by Thomson Reuters in June 2014 ( ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Analysis of coauthorship relations among the 798 highly cited scientists shows that coauthorships are based on common interests in a specific topic .

label: Research method
text: In this research , using 712,643 query keywords from a popular Spanish music website relying on contextual advertising as its business model , we use a k-means clustering algorithm to categorize the referral keywords with similar characteristics of onsite customer behavior , including attributes such as clickthrough rate and revenue .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We identified 6 clusters of consumer keywords .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Clusters range from a large number of users who are low impact to a small number of high impact users .

text: Implications are that businesses can effectively segment customers to develop better business models to increase advertising conversion rates .

label: Research method
text: The inquiry is grounded by data from a study of 2 ecovillages , intentional communities striving to ground their daily activities in a set of core values related to sustainability .

label: Research method
text: Ethnographic methods employed for over 2 years resulted in data from hundreds of hours of participant observation , semistructured interviews with 22 community members , and a diverse collection of community images and texts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Analysis of the data highlights the tensions that arose and remained as community members experienced breakdowns between community values related to sustainability and their daily information practices .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Contributions to the field of information science include the development of the concept of sustainable information practice , an analysis of why community members felt unable to adapt their information practices to better match community concepts of sustainability , and an assessment of the methodological challenges of information practice inquiry within a communal , nonwork environment .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Most broadly , this work contributes to our larger understanding of the challenges faced by those attempting to identify and develop more sustainable information practices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , Research findings/conclusions from this investigation call into question previous claims that groups of individuals with strong value commitments can adapt their use of information tools to better support their values .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In contrast , this work suggests that information practices can be particularly resilient to local , value-based adaptation .

label: Research method
text: It comprises several excellent scholarly research articles previously published in JASIST with important implications for the design of digital information environments .

label: Research method
text: It covers articles that motivate the need for Information Science research to inform design and those that have empirically examined information-related concepts such as information behavior , practices , interaction , and experience and , based on their Research findings/conclusions , proposed recommendations or posed questions for design .

label: Research questions
text: This article argues that as JASIST exists at the intersection between information , systems , and users , it is natural to want to understand how people engage with information to inform design and , by doing so , Information Science research can build bridges between Information Science and computing disciplines and make contributions that transcend its discipline boundaries .

label: Research questions
text: It argues that Information Science research not only has the potential but also the duty to inform the design of future digital information environments .

label: Research questions
text: In particular , we examine the contributions of authors outside the United States , the United Kingdom , and Canada ; faculty in departments other than LIS ; and practicing librarians .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Worldwide , faculty in LIS departments account for 31 % of the journal literature ; librarians , 23 % ; computer science faculty , 10 % ; and management faculty , 10 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The top contributing nations are the United States , the United Kingdom , Spain , China , Canada , and Taiwan .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Within the United States and the United Kingdom , the current productivity of LIS departments is correlated with past productivity and with other measures of reputation and performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More generally , the distribution of contributions is highly skewed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the United States , five departments account for 27 % of the articles contributed by LIS faculty ; in the United Kingdom , four departments account for nearly two-thirds of the articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This skewed distribution reinforces the possibility that high-status departments may gain a permanent advantage in the competition for students , faculty , journal space , and research funding .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: At the same time , concentrations of research-active faculty in particular departments may generate beneficial spillover effects .

text: To revitalize the use of this crowd-sourced information , we propose using social tags to link and cluster artworks based on an experimental study using an online collection at the Gyeonggi Museum of Modern Art ( GMoMA ) .

label: Research questions
text: We view social tagging as a folksonomy , where artworks are classified by keywords of the crowd 's various interpretations and one artwork can belong to several different categories simultaneously .

label: Research method
text: To leverage this strength of social tags , we used a clustering method called link communities to detect overlapping communities in a network of artworks constructed by computing similarities between all artwork pairs .

label: Research method
text: We used this framework to identify semantic relationships and clusters of similar artworks .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By comparing the clustering results with curators ' manual classification results , we demonstrated the potential of social tagging data for automatically clustering artworks in a way that reflects the dynamic perspectives of crowds .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article describes the first implementation of a holistic user-experience evaluation in MIR , the MIREX Grand Challenge , where complete MIR systems are evaluated , with user experience being the single overarching goal .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It is the first time that complete MIR systems have been evaluated with end users in a realistic scenario .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose a novel approach to identify complementary QAs ( CQAs ) of a target QA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We define two types of complementarity : partial complementarity and extended complementarity .

label: Research method
text: First , we utilize a classification-based approach to predict complementary relationships between QAs based on three measures : question similarity , answer novelty , and answer correlation .

label: Research method
text: Then we construct a CQA network based on the derived complementary relationships .

text: In addition , we introduce a CQA network analysis technique that searches the QA network to find direct and indirect CQAs of the target QA .

text: The results of experiments conducted on the data collected from Yahoo !

text: Answers Taiwan show that the proposed approach can more effectively identify CQAs than can the conventional similarity-based method .

text: Case and user study results also validate the helpfulness and the effectiveness of our approach .

label: Research questions
text: However , attachment is still a largely unexplored concept in both IS research and practice .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing from the literature on attachment in consumer behavior research and auxiliary theories in IS use and community participation research , this study theoretically identifies and empirically explores the concept of attachment and its antecedents ( i.e. , relative visual aesthetics , personalization , relative performance ) and outcome ( i.e. , community participation intention ) in the IS context .

label: Research method
text: Using web browsers as the target IS , an online survey was conducted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that relative expressive visual aesthetics is the strongest antecedent of IS attachment , and that personalization is the second strongest antecedent of IS attachment , followed by relative performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , this study reveals that IS attachment has a strong positive impact on community participation intention .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study contributes theoretically and empirically to the body of IS use research and has managerial implications , suggesting that although superior performance is a necessary condition for attachment formation , improving users ' experience through expressive visual aesthetics and personalization is critical to build strong attachment relationships with users .

text: The governments of these countries have been boosting their investments in research and development to become part of the group of nations doing research at a world-class level .

label: Research method
text: This study investigates the development of the BRICS countries in the domain of top-cited papers ( top 10 % and 1 % most frequently cited papers ) between 1990 and 2010 .

label: Research method
text: To assess the extent to which these countries have become important players at the top level , we compare the BRICS countries with the top-performing countries worldwide .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As the analyses of the ( annual ) growth rates show , with the exception of Russia , the BRICS countries have increased their output in terms of most frequently cited papers at a higher rate than the top-cited countries worldwide .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Therefore , it can be questioned whether these indices describe scientific achievements accurately .

text: In this article we shed insight into the problem of negative citations , analyzing data from Stack Exchange and , to draw more universal conclusions , we derive an approximation of citations scores .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The cataloging community is grappling with practical issues in navigating the transition from AACR2 to RDA ; there is a definite need to evaluate major subject areas and broader themes in information organization under the new RDA paradigm .

label: Research questions
text: This article aims to accomplish this task through a thorough and critical review of the emerging RDA literature published from 2005 to 2011 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The review mostly concerns key areas of difference between RDA and AACR2 , the relationship of the new cataloging code to metadata standards , the impact on encoding standards such as Machine-Readable Cataloging ( MARC ) , end user considerations , and practitioners ' views on RDA implementation and training .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Future research will require more in-depth studies of RDA 's expected benefits and the manner in which the new cataloging code will improve resource retrieval and bibliographic control for users and catalogers alike over AACR2 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The question as to how the cataloging community can best move forward to the post-AACR2/MARC environment must be addressed carefully so as to chart the future of bibliographic control in the evolving environment of information production , management , and use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The traditional cluster hypothesis also does not consider the dependency between related queries .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of this paper is to leverage similar search intents to perform ranking consistency so that the search performance can be improved accordingly .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Different from the previous supervised approach , which learns relevance by click-through data , we propose a novel cocluster hypothesis to bridge the gap between relevance ranking and ranking consistency .

label: Research method
text: A nearest-neighbors test is also designed to measure the extent to which the cocluster hypothesis holds .

label: Research method
text: Based on the hypothesis , we further propose a two-stage unsupervised approach , in which two ranking heuristics and a cost function are developed to optimize the combination of consistency and uniqueness ( or inconsistency ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Extensive experiments have been conducted on a real and large-scale search engine log .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results not only verify the applicability of the proposed cocluster hypothesis but also show that our approach is effective in boosting the retrieval performance of the commercial search engine and reaches a comparable performance to the supervised approach .

label: Research method
text: Based on a diary study of 2 assigned tasks to search on Google and Google Scholar , factor analysis identified the core constructs of content , relevance , scope , and style , as well as informational and system ease of use as influencing the judgment that useful information had been found .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Differences were found in the participants ' evaluation of information across the search tasks on Google and on Google Scholar when identified by the factors related to both content and ease of use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions from this study suggest how searchers might critically evaluate information , and the study identifies a relation between the user 's involvement in the information interaction and the influences of the perceived system ease of use and information design .

label: Research questions
text: It is costly and time-consuming to manually label drug-disease pairs datasets .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: There are many drug-disease pairs buried in free text .

label: Research method
text: In this work , we first leverage a pattern-based method to automatically extract drug-disease pairs with treatment and inducement relationships from free text .

label: Research method
text: Then , to reflect a drug-disease relation , a network embedding algorithm is proposed to calculate the degree of correlation of a drug-disease pair .

label: Research method
text: In the experiments , we use the method to extract treatment and inducement drug-disease pairs from 27 million medical abstracts and titles available on PubMed .

label: Research method
text: We extract 138,318 unique treatment pairs and 75,396 unique inducement pairs .

label: Research method
text: Our algorithm achieves a precision of 0.912 and a recall of 0.898 in extracting the frequent treatment drug-disease pairs , and a precision of 0.923 and a recall of 0.833 in extracting the frequent inducement drug-disease pairs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Besides , our proposed information network embedding algorithm can efficiently reflect the degree of correlation of drug-disease pairs .

label: Research method
text: Our algorithm can achieve a precision of 0.802 , a recall of 0.783 in the fine-grained evaluation of extracting frequent pairs .

label: Research questions
text: Because of online accessibility , academic researchers tend to read more , and reading has become more superficial ( Olle & Borrego , ) , such that information overload has become an important issue .

label: Research questions
text: Given this circumstance , how the Internet affects knowledge transfer , or , more specifically , the citation behavior of researchers , has become a recent focus of interest .

label: Research method
text: This study assesses the effects of the Internet on citation patterns in terms of 4 characteristics of cited documents : topic relevance , author status , journal prestige , and age of references .

label: Research method
text: This work hypothesizes that academic scholars cite more topically relevant articles , more articles written by lower status authors , articles published in less prestigious journals , and older articles with online accessibility .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The current study also hypothesizes that researcher knowledge level moderates such Internet effects .

label: Research method
text: We chose the IT and Group subject area and collected 241 documents published in the pre-web period ( 1991-1995 ) and 867 documents published in the web-prevalent period ( 2006-2010 ) in the Web of Science database .

label: Research method
text: The references of these documents were analyzed to test the proposed hypotheses , which are significantly supported by the empirical results .

label: Research questions
text: These changes have yielded a variety of new economic and academic niches , including journals with questionable peer-review systems and business models , commonly dubbed predatory publishing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Empirical analysis of Cabell & apos ; s Journal Blacklist reveals substantial diversity in types and degrees of predatory publishing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While some blacklisted publishers produce journals with many severe violations of academic norms , gray journals and publishers occupy borderline or ambiguous niches between predation and legitimacy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Predation in academic publishing is not a simple binary phenomenon and should instead be perceived as a spectrum with varying types and degrees of illegitimacy .

label: Research questions
text: Conceptions of predation are based on overlapping evaluations of academic and economic legitimacy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: High institutional status benefits publishers by reducing conflicts between-if not aligning-professional and market institutional logics , which are more likely to conflict and create illegitimacy concerns in downmarket niches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: High rejection rates imbue high-status journals with value and pricing power , while low-status OA journals face predatory incentives to optimize revenue via low selectivity .

label: Research questions
text: Status influences the social acceptability of profit-seeking in academic publishing , rendering lower-status publishers vulnerable to being perceived and stigmatized as illegitimate .

label: Research questions
text: We , instead , investigate online community defections , their cause , and their impact through an empirical investigation of defections from Wikipedia .

label: Research method
text: Our research uses justice theory to determine the effects of injustice perceptions on contributor defections and draws on fairness heuristic theory to distinguish the relative effects of distributive injustice and procedural injustice .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that perceptions of injustice concerning collaboration outcomes ( distributive injustice ) raise contributor dissatisfaction , which in turn leads to defection .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Perceptions of injustice concerning the process ( procedural injustice ) , by comparison , have a direct impact on defections and exert a stronger influence on dissatisfaction than distributive injustice .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Justice emerges as a hygiene factor adding to the level of dissatisfaction among dissatisfied contributors but not among satisfied contributors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions contribute to our understanding of collaborative knowledge creation by drawing attention to contributors ' post hoc passive emotions and behaviors instead of predominantly investigating their initial prosharing behaviors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The work also has practical implications for community governance because it suggests how to sustain communities in the long term .

label: Research method
text: Using as an example the coronavirus disease 2019 ( COVID-19 ) epidemic , we ( a ) examine challenges associated with what we term globalinformationcrises ; ( b ) recommend changes needed for the field of information science to play a leading role in such crises ; and ( c ) propose actionable items for short- and long-term research , education , and practice in information science .

label: Research method
text: Our study uses a conversation analytic framework to investigate the types of potential or actual problems in communication that occur between librarians and patrons in chat reference interactions at a university library .

label: Research method
text: Conversation analysis methodology , as developed by Harvey Sacks , Emanuel Schegloff , and Gain Jefferson , provides an empirical basis for claims about problems with communication by investigating what the participants themselves display as problematic or potentially problematic .

label: Research method
text: Based on a corpus of archived chat reference transcripts , we show what types of problems in communication are displayed in the interaction , primarily through repair initiations , whether the problems are resolved , and , if so , how .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Sources of problems that were targeted by both librarians and patrons included mistyping , typing in the wrong window , ambiguous terminology , differences in expertise between patrons and librarians , and the difficulty of giving and following instructions while not copresent .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude with implications for the training of future librarians in performing chat reference interactions .

label: Research method
text: We explore information practices and collaboration between local law enforcement and federal immigration enforcement in Grant County , Washington , based on records from November 2017 to May 2019 obtained by the University of Washington Center for Human Rights through Public Records Act ( PRA ) requests .

label: Research method
text: Qualitative analysis of over 8,000 pages reveals a baseline of passive and active information sharing and collaboration between local law enforcement and federal immigration agencies before Washington sanctuary laws went into effect in May 2019 , a practice that needs to stop if agencies are to comply with the laws .

label: Research method
text: We employ a systematic methodology to obtain ( through PRA and other Access to Information requests ) and analyze official records through qualitative content analysis , to monitor and hold local law enforcement accountable in their compliance with sanctuary laws .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This method can be used to examine law enforcement information behaviors in other counties in Washington , and in other states that offer sanctuary protections , as a way to monitor compliance with sanctuary laws and strengthen the protection of immigrants ' rights .

label: Research method
text: It uses visits to the Expert Protein Analysis System ( ExPASy ) server-a virtual research infrastructure for bioinformatics-as a proxy for measuring bioinformatic research activity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study finds that in the United Kingdom ( UK ) , Germany , and Spain the number of visits to the ExPASy Web server made by research organizations is significantly positively correlated with research output in the field of biochemistry , molecular biology , and genetics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Only in the UK do we find a significant positive correlation between ExPASy visits per publication and the normalized impact of an organization 's publications .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The type of indicator developed in this study can be used to measure research activity in fields in which e-research has become important .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , it can be used for the evaluation of e-research infrastructures .

label: Research method

label: Research method
text: Based on a survey of 1,173 German Internet users , we conduct structural equation modeling and multigroup analyses to differentiate the antecedents and effects of serendipity across three distinct contexts : online shopping , information services , and social networking sites .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions confirm that antecedents and outcomes of digital serendipity vary by context , with serendipity only being associated with user satisfaction in the context of social network sites .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we present patient-centered and experience-aware mining framework for effective ADR discovery using online health forum data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our experimental evaluation with both an official ADR knowledge base and human-annotated ground truth verifies the effectiveness of the proposed method for ADR discovery .

text: These decisions are greatly influenced by contextual characteristics of the request .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the contextual influence may not be uniform among users with different levels of privacy concerns .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we hypothesize that users with higher privacy concerns may consider contextual factors differently from those with lower privacy concerns .

label: Research method
text: By conducting a scenario-based survey study and structural equation modeling , we verify the interaction effects between privacy concerns and contextual factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We additionally find that users ' perceived risk towards the requester mediates the effect of context and privacy concerns .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These results extend our understanding about the cognitive process behind privacy decision making in SNSs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The interaction effects suggest strategies for SNS providers to predict user 's friend request acceptance and to customize context-aware privacy decision support based on users ' different privacy attitudes .

label: Research questions
text: Content curation communities are large-scale crowdsourcing endeavors that aim to curate existing content into a single repository , making these communities different from content creation communities such as Wikipedia .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we define content curation communities and provide examples of this increasingly important genre .

label: Research method
text: We then follow by presenting EOL , a compelling example of a content curation community , and describe a case study of EOL based on analysis of interviews , online discussions , and survey data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions are characterized into two broad categories : information integration and social integration .

label: Research questions
text: Information integration challenges at EOL include the need to ( a ) accommodate and validate multiple sources and ( b ) integrate traditional peer reviewed sources with user-generated , nonpeer-reviewed content .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Social integration challenges at EOL include the need to ( a ) establish the credibility of open-access resources within the scientific community and ( b ) facilitate collaboration between experts and novices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: After identifying the challenges , we discuss the potential strategies EOL and other content curation communities can use to address them , and provide technical , content , and social design recommendations for overcoming them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Government funding and spending in the higher education sector encourage publications as a long-term research benefit .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Conversely , other components such as industrial funding and spending in the business sector encourage patenting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results help explain why the United States trails the European Union in publications : The focus in the United States is on industrial funding some 70 % of its total R & D investment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Likewise , our results also help explain why the European Union trails the United States in patenting , since its focus on government funding is less effective than industrial funding in predicting triadic patenting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Government funding contributes negatively to patenting in a multiple regression , and this relationship is significant in the case of triadic patenting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We provide new forecasts about the relationships of the United States , the European Union , and China for publishing ; these results suggest much later dates for changes than previous forecasts because Chinese growth has been slowing down since 2003 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Models for individual countries might be more successful than regression models whose parameters are averaged over a set of countries because nations can be expected to differ historically in terms of the institutional arrangements and funding schemes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study suggests a significant contribution of citizen science to various disciplines as well as overall science education , literacy , and development .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A solid theoretical grounding of citizen science research , coupled with application of pertinent emergent theories to various processes associated with scientific inquiry and discovery , suggests the disciplinary traits and unique contributions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study proposes that the current pace of citizen science research , empowered by ordinary citizens as well as technological affordances , provides solid evidence to warrant further development of citizen science as a unique discipline that can strengthen and democratize scientific inquiry .

text: It concludes that individual factors are more central and fundamental , although they may certainly be qualified by social and cultural factors and even though there are good reasons for studying and analyzing information behavior in terms of social groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More studies of interesting emergent factors and behaviors in social settings would be valuable .

text: Moreover , based on a simple rule we can define when there is enough evidence to propose an answer or when the attribution scheme is unable to make a decision with a high degree of certainty .

label: Research method
text: This article reports on an analysis of information sharing and use in three investment discussion forums .

label: Research method
text: Threads containing 1,787 posts were coded using previously developed typologies for Internet-based discussion .

label: Research method
text: Citations were studied in their context and sources were categorized into types .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A high degree of collaborative information behavior was identified , but the study also reveals some areas of information use that may compromise investors ' decision making , including heavy reliance on personal sources of information and other sources that vary greatly in trustworthiness , including commercially sponsored information , blogs , and investor guru sites .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These challenges are discussed and recommendations are made for improving services to investors .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Questions for additional research are also identified .

label: Research questions
text: Current online MT services are available and affordable , but are not always effective for creating multilingual metadata records .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we implemented 3 different MT strategies and evaluated their performance when translating English metadata records to Chinese and Spanish .

label: Research method
text: These strategies included combining MT results from 3 online MT systems ( Google , Bing , and Yahoo ! )

label: Research method
text: with and without additional linguistic resources , such as manually-generated parallel corpora , and metadata records in the two target languages obtained from international partners .

label: Research method
text: The open-source statistical MT platform Moses was applied to design and implement the three translation strategies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Human evaluation of the MT results using adequacy and fluency demonstrated that two of the strategies produced higher quality translations than individual online MT systems for both languages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Especially , adding small , manually-generated parallel corpora of metadata records significantly improved translation performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our study suggested an effective and efficient MT approach for providing multilingual services for digital collections .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although English tends to be the dominant language of science , SSH researchers often produce culturally and societally relevant work in their local languages .

label: Research method
text: We collected and analyzed a set of 164,218 peer-reviewed journal articles ( produced by 51,063 researchers from 2013 to 2015 ) and found that multilingualism is prevalent despite geographical location and field .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among the researchers who published at least three journal articles during this time period , over one-third from the various countries had written their work in at least two languages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The highest share of researchers who published in only one language were from Flanders ( 80.9 % ) , whereas the lowest shares were from Slovenia ( 57.2 % ) and Poland ( 59.3 % ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions show that multilingual publishing is an ongoing practice in many SSH research fields regardless of geographical location , political situation , and/or historical heritage .

label: Research questions
text: Here we argue that research is international , but multilingual publishing keeps locally relevant research alive with the added potential for creating impact .

label: Research questions
text: First we present a conceptual framework for analyzing image topicality , explicating the layers , the perspectives , and the topical relevance relationships involved in modeling the topicality of art images .

label: Research method
text: We adapt a generic relevance typology to image analysis by extending it with definitions and relationships specific to the visual art domain and integrating it with schemes of image-text relationships that are important for image subject indexing .

label: Research method
text: We then apply the adapted typology to analyze the topical relevance relationships between 11 art images and 768 image tags assigned by art historians and librarians .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The original contribution of our work is the topical structure analysis of image tags that allows the viewer to more easily grasp the content , context , and meaning of an image and quickly tune into aspects of interest ; it could also guide both the indexer and the searcher to specify image tags/descriptors in a more systematic and precise manner and thus improve the match between the two parties .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: An additional contribution is systematically examining and integrating the variety of image-text relationships from a relevance perspective .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The paper concludes with implications for relational indexing and social tagging .

label: Research method

label: Research method

label: Research method
text: The model represents psychological , behavioral , and benefit outcomes as second-order molecular constructs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results from a partial least squares ( PLS ) analysis reveal that expectation disconfirmation influences perceived quality and student satisfaction .

text: Further , psychological outcomes influence student behaviors , which in turn affect benefit outcomes .

label: Research questions
text: It is already known that various user characteristics influence the way credibility evaluation is performed .

label: Research questions
text: Domain experts on the topic at hand primarily focus on semantic features of information ( e.g. , factual accuracy ) , whereas novices focus more on surface features ( e.g. , length of a text ) .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we further explore two key influences on credibility evaluation : topic familiarity and information skills .

label: Research method
text: Participants with varying expected levels of information skills ( i.e. , high school students , undergraduates , and postgraduates ) evaluated Wikipedia articles of varying quality on familiar and unfamiliar topics while thinking aloud .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When familiar with the topic , participants indeed focused primarily on semantic features of the information , whereas participants unfamiliar with the topic paid more attention to surface features .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The utilization of surface features increased with information skills .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , participants with better information skills calibrated their trust against the quality of the information , whereas trust of participants with poorer information skills did not .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study confirms the enabling character of domain expertise and information skills in credibility evaluation as predicted by the updated 3S-model of credibility evaluation .

text: These methods are all limited by an inability to perform open-set classification and account for text and corpus size .

label: Research method
text: We propose a customized Bayesian logit-normal-beta-binomial classification model for supervised authorship attribution .

label: Research method
text: The model is based on the beta-binomial distribution with an explicit inverse relationship between extra-binomial variation and text size .

label: Research method
text: The model internally estimates the relationship of extra-binomial variation to text size , and uses Markov Chain Monte Carlo ( MCMC ) to produce distributions of posterior authorship probabilities instead of point estimates .

label: Research method
text: We illustrate the method by training the machine-learning methods as well as the open-set Bayesian classifier on undisputed papers of The Federalist , and testing the method on documents historically attributed to Alexander Hamilton , John Jay , and James Madison .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Bayesian classifier was the best classifier of these texts .

label: Research questions
text: We study whether Mendeley readership scores ( RS ) can identify highly cited publications more effectively than journal citation scores ( JCS ) .

label: Research method
text: Web of Science ( WoS ) publications with digital object identifiers ( DOIs ) published during the period 2004-2013 and across five major scientific fields were analyzed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main result of this study shows that RS are more effective ( in terms of precision/recall values ) than JCS to identify highly cited publications across all fields of science and publication years .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions also show that 86.5 % of all the publications are covered by Mendeley and have at least one reader .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , the share of publications with Mendeley RS is increasing from 84 % in 2004 to 89 % in 2009 , and decreasing from 88 % in 2010 to 82 % in 2013 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , it is noted that publications from 2010 onwards exhibit on average a higher density of readership versus citation scores .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This indicates that compared to citation scores , RS are more prevalent for recent publications and hence they could work as an early indicator of research impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions highlight the potential and value of Mendeley as a tool for scientometric Research questionss and particularly as a relevant tool to identify highly cited publications .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Several studies have recently discussed the stability of word embeddings in general domain and suggested factors influencing the stability .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this work , we conduct a detailed analysis on the stability of concept embeddings in medical domain , particularly in relations with concept frequency .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis reveals the surprising high stability of low-frequency concepts : low-frequency ( < 100 ) concepts have the same high stability as high-frequency ( > 1,000 ) concepts .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To develop a deeper understanding of this finding , we propose a new factor , the noisiness of context words , which influences the stability of medical concept embeddings regardless of high or low frequency .

label: Research method
text: We evaluate the proposed factor by showing the linear correlation with the stability of medical concept embeddings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The correlations are clear and consistent with various groups of medical concepts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the linear relations , we make suggestions on ways to adjust the noisiness of context words for the improvement of stability .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Finally , we demonstrate that the linear relation of the proposed factor extends to the word embedding stability in general domain .

label: Research method
text: Cosine distance is chosen to measure the similarities among the six networks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The authors found that topical networks and coauthorship networks have the lowest similarity ; cocitation networks and citation networks have high similarity ; bibliographic coupling networks and cocitation networks have high similarity ; and coword networks and topical networks have high similarity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , through multidimensional scaling , two dimensions can be identified among the six networks : Dimension 1 can be interpreted as citation-based versus noncitation-based , and Dimension 2 can be interpreted as social versus cognitive .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The authors recommend the use of hybrid or heterogeneous networks to study research interaction and scholarly communications .

label: Research questions
text: This paper examines some of the key challenges facing mHealth with a focus on privacy and security issues .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the first part of the paper , the security engineering process is described , which can assist healthcare organizations in developing an architecture-level protection strategy that is compliant with privacy and security legislation and industry initiatives .

label: Research method
text: In the second part of the paper , use cases are selected to illustrate the diverse security architecture contexts in which the protection strategy will be deployed , and to emphasize the importance of integrating security across these contexts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the third part of the paper , industry and government security best practices are discussed , which can assist healthcare organizations in implementing security architectures to meet their specific privacy and security requirements .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Use of the Internet can assist these volunteers by facilitating improved information access , communication , and efficiency .

label: Research questions
text: Little is known about how local sporting clubs use this important information systems ' function .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study extends Burgess ' ( 2016 ) web presence pyramid model to examine factors leading to differences in Internet use by athletics and cricket clubs in the United Kingdom and Australia .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions suggest that higher adoption levels of websites set up by clubs and social media and more sophisticated Internet usage are apparent in upper level ( or well-resourced ) local clubs than in lower level clubs , but with some important variations ( such as interventions by sport governing bodies ) that may assist smaller clubs to adopt online platforms .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Guidance on using the extended model in other contexts is offered , as is advice for clubs and sporting associations looking to improve their use of Internet platforms .

text: We believe it is necessary to use different answering strategies based on the type of questions to accommodate the different information needs .

label: Research questions
text: In this research , we propose the ASK taxonomy that categorizes questions posted on social networking sites into three types according to the nature of the questioner 's inquiry of accuracy , social , or knowledge .

label: Research method
text: To automatically decide which answering strategy to use , we develop a predictive model based on ASK question types using question features from the perspectives of lexical , topical , contextual , and syntactic as well as answer features .

label: Research method
text: By applying the classifier on an annotated data set , we present a comprehensive analysis to compare questions in terms of their word usage , topical interests , temporal and spatial restrictions , syntactic structure , and response characteristics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our research results show that the three types of questions exhibited different characteristics in the way they are asked .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our automatic classification algorithm achieves an 83 % correct labeling result , showing the value of the ASK taxonomy for the design of social question and answering systems .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our best results on the RepLab dataset ( which improves the state of the art ) uses language models to learn the domain-specific vocabulary used by influencers and combines domain and authority models using a Learning to Rank algorithm .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our experiments show that ( a ) both authority and domain evidence can be trained from the vocabulary of influencers ; ( b ) once the language of influencers is modeled as a likelihood signal , further supervised learning and additional network-based signals only provide marginal improvements ; and ( c ) the availability of training data sets is crucial to obtain competitive results in the task .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our most remarkable finding is that influencers do use a distinctive vocabulary , which is a more reliable signal than nontextual network indicators such as the number of followers , retweets , and so on .

label: Research method
text: By linking recommendations for 28,254 publications in F1000 with citations in Scopus , we investigated the effect of research level ( basic , clinical , mixed ) and article type on the internal consistency of assessments based on citations and FFa scores .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The research level has little impact on the differences between the 2 evaluation tools , while article type has a big effect .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These 2 measures differ significantly for 2 groups : ( a ) nonprimary research or evidence-based research are more highly cited but not highly recommended , while ( b ) translational research or transformative research are more highly recommended but have fewer citations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This can be expected , since citation activity is usually practiced by academic authors while the potential for scientific revolutions and the suitability for clinical practice of an article should be investigated from a practitioners ' perspective .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude with a recommendation that the application of bibliometric approaches in research evaluation should consider the proportion of 3 types of publications : evidence-based research , transformative research , and translational research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The latter 2 types are more suitable for assessment through peer review .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research analyzes funding acknowledgment presence in scientific publications and introduces a novel approach for discovering text patterns by discipline in the acknowledgment section of papers .

label: Research method
text: First , the presence of acknowledgments in 38,257 English-language papers published by Spanish researchers in 2010 is studied by subject area on the basis of the funding acknowledgment information available in the Web of Science database .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Funding acknowledgments are present in two thirds of Spanish articles , with significant differences by subject area , number of authors , impact factor of journals , and , in one specific area , basic/applied nature of research .

label: Research method
text: Second , the existence of specific acknowledgment patterns in English-language papers of Spanish researchers in 4 selected subject categories ( cardiac and cardiovascular systems , economics , evolutionary biology , and statistics and probability ) is explored through a combination of text mining and multivariate analyses .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Peer interactive communication predominates in the more theoretical or social-oriented fields ( statistics and probability , economics ) , whereas the recognition of technical assistance is more common in experimental research ( evolutionary biology ) , and the mention of potential conflicts of interest emerges forcefully in the clinical field ( cardiac and cardiovascular systems ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The systematic inclusion of structured data about acknowledgments in journal articles and bibliographic databases would have a positive impact on the study of collaboration practices in science .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It has also been recognized that geography is an important criterion of relevance , leading to the research area of geographic information retrieval .

label: Research questions
text: As users increasingly retrieve information in mobile situations , relevance is often related to geographic features in the real world as well as their representation in web documents .

label: Research method
text: We present 2 methods for assessing geographic relevance ( GR ) of geographic entities in a mobile use context that include the 5 criteria topicality , spatiotem-poral proximity , directionality , cluster , and colocation .

label: Research method
text: To determine the effectiveness and validity of these methods , we evaluate them through a user study conducted on the Amazon Mechanical Turk crowdsourcing platform .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An analysis of relevance ranks for geographic entities in 3 scenarios produced by two GR methods , 2 baseline methods , and human judgments collected in the experiment reveal that one of the GR methods produces similar ranks as human assessors .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis shows that claiming citation distributions to be universal for all fields of science is not warranted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although many fields indeed seem to have fairly similar citation distributions , there are exceptions as well .

label: Research questions
text: The focus of this work is on the basic structural nature of a thesaurus itself , not on how people develop a thesaurus or how a thesaurus effects retrieval performance .

label: Research method
text: Thesauri in this research are automatically developed in a simulation from sets of randomly or exhaustively generated documents .

label: Research method
text: Each thesaurus is generated by the Thesaurus Generator software from a set of several hundred documents , and thousands of different document sets are used as input to the Thesaurus Generator , producing thousands of thesauri .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , thousands of thesauri are generated for each data point in accompanying graphs .

label: Research method
text: The characteristics of this large number of thesauri are studied so that the relationships between thesaurus parameters can be determined .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Some rules governing these relationships are suggested , addressing factors such as tree height and width , number of tree roots in thesauri , and number of terms available for the vocabulary .

label: Research questions

label: Research method
text: Specifically , we empirically evaluate the following in classifying questions into CQA categories : ( a ) the usefulness of n-gram features and bag-of-word features ; ( b ) the performance of three standard classification algorithms ( naive Bayes , maximum entropy , and support vector machines ) ; ( c ) the performance of the state-of-the-art hierarchical classification algorithms ; ( d ) the effect of training data size on performance ; and ( e ) the effectiveness of the different components of CQA data , including subject , content , asker , and the best answer .

label: Research findings/conclusions

label: Research questions
text: Although researchers have attempted to explain the effect of SNS use on users ' psychological well-being , previous studies have produced inconsistent results .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In addition , most previous studies relied on healthy students as participants ; other cohorts of SNSs users , in particular people living with serious health conditions , have been neglected .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we carried out semistructured interviews with users of the Ovarian Cancer Australia ( OCA ) Facebook to assess how and in what ways SNS use impacts their psychological well-being .

label: Research method
text: A theoretical model was proposed to develop a better understanding of the relationships between SNS use and the psychological well-being of cancer patients .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Analysis of data collected through a subsequent quantitative survey confirmed the theoretical model and empirically revealed the extent to which SNS use impacts the psychological well-being of cancer patients .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions showed the use of OCA Facebook enhances social support , enriches the experience of social connectedness , develops social presence and learning and ultimately improves the psychological well-being of cancer patients .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Public health data have the characteristic of being capturable while still not infringing upon privacy , as the full detailed data of individuals are not needed but rather only anonymized , aggregate , de-identified , and non-unique data for an individual .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For example , rather than details of physical activity including specific route , just total caloric burn over a week or month could be submitted , thereby strongly assisting non-re-identification .

label: Research questions

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For peer-reviewed journal articles , there are two main routes to OA : publishing in OA journals ( gold OA ) or archiving of article copies or manuscripts at other web locations ( green OA ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study focuses on summarizing and extending current knowledge about green OA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A synthesis of previous studies indicates that green OA coverage of all published journal articles is approximately 12 % , with substantial disciplinary variation .

label: Research questions
text: Typically , green OA copies become available after considerable time delays , partly caused by publisher-imposed embargo periods , and partly by author tendencies to archive manuscripts only periodically .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although green OA copies should ideally be archived in proper repositories , a large share is stored on home pages and similar locations , with no assurance of long-term preservation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Often such locations contain exact copies of published articles , which may infringe on the publisher 's exclusive rights .

label: Research questions
text: The technical foundation for green OA uploading is becoming increasingly solid largely due to the rapid increase in the number of institutional repositories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The number of articles within the scope of OA mandates , which strongly influence the self-archival rate of articles , is nevertheless still low .

label: Research method
text: The researchers gathered interview data from 24 mothers .
