text: Resulting data were inductively analyzed using Chatman 's ( 1996 ) theory of information poverty .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We propose information marginalization as a complimentary concept to describe the contextual conditions that contribute to a range of defensive information behaviors and suggest that assessment of these contextual conditions be a part of the system design process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This study has implications for the development and design of systems and service models intended to provide access to information and services for individuals with disability and contributes to a critical literature on information poverty .

label: Research questions
text: Owned by LinkedIn since 2012 , it targets a professional audience but may give value to scholarship through creating a long-term record of the content of talks .

label: Research method
text: This article tests this hypothesis by analyzing sets of general and scholarly related SlideShare documents using content and citation analysis and popularity statistics reported on the site .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that academics , students , and teachers are a minority of SlideShare uploaders , especially since 2010 , with most documents not being directly related to scholarship or teaching .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: About two thirds of uploaded SlideShare documents are presentation slides , with the remainder often being files associated with presentations or video recordings of talks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: SlideShare is therefore a presentation-centered site with a predominantly professional user base .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although a minority of the uploaded SlideShare documents are cited by , or cite , academic publications , probably too few articles are cited by SlideShare to consider extracting SlideShare citations for research evaluation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Nevertheless , scholars should consider SlideShare to be a potential source of academic and nonacademic information , particularly in library and information science , education , and business .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Research and scholarship in this area has accelerated since the coining and subsequent advocacy for altmetrics-that is , research indicators based on social media activity .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This review provides an extensive account of the state-of-the art in both scholarly use of social media and altmetrics .

label: Research method
text: The review consists of 2 main parts : the first examines the use of social media in academia , reviewing the various functions these platforms have in the scholarly communication process and the factors that affect this use .

label: Research method
text: The second part reviews empirical studies of altmetrics , discussing the various interpretations of altmetrics , data collection and methodological limitations , and differences according to platform .

label: Research questions
text: The review ends with a critical discussion of the implications of this transformation in the scholarly communication system .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Files can be shared either using Group Information Management ( GIM ) , where collaborators exploit a common repository ( e.g. , the cloud ) , or Personal Information Management ( PIM ) , where files are sent via email attachments , and collaborators store files individually in personal collections .

label: Research questions
text: Given the recent prevalence of GIM , we compare the effects on retrieval for PIM versus GIM collections .

label: Research questions
text: We examine the effects of various theoretically motivated factors relating to collection size , properties of the target file , and user workload .

label: Research method
text: In our study , 289 participants accessed 1,557 of their own shared files in a naturalistic setting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results indicate that factors relating to collection size , file versions , and user workload negatively affect the retrieval of GIM more than PIM files , indicating that PIM is morescalablethan GIM .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Testing a very different population , we confirm previous Research findings/conclusions that failure percentages of GIM are approximately double those of PIM .

label: Research questions
text: We discuss possible theoretical explanations , specifically how factors that hinder retrieval exacerbate the general GIM problem of retrieving files organized by other people .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , PIM 's greater scalability has practical implications for fast-growing organizations such as startups when choosing their sharing policies .

label: Research questions
text: Most recently , Ke , Ferrara , Radicchi , and Flammini ( 2015 , Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the USA , 112 ( 24 ) , 7426-7431 ) proposed the so called beauty coefficient ( denoted as B ) to quantify how much a given paper can be considered as a paper with delayed recognition .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this study , the new term smart girl ( SG ) is suggested to differentiate instant credit or flashes in the pan from SBs .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Although SG and SB are qualitatively defined , the dynamic citation angle beta is introduced in this study as a simple way for identifying SGs and SBs quantitatively - complementing the beauty coefficient B .

label: Research method
text: The citation angles for all articles from 1980 ( n=166,870 ) in natural sciences are calculated for identifying SGs and SBs and their extent .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We reveal that about 3 % of the articles are typical SGs and about 0.1 % typical SBs .

label: Research method
text: The potential advantages of the citation angle approach are explained .

label: Research method
text: For research on the value of information , Saracevic and Kantor ( 1997 ) proposed a framework from a value perspective in philosophy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this report , we substantiate the framework with an updated review of the literature and demonstrate its applicability to understanding the value of user feedback as one type of information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our field study , in the setting of a health information provider whose information products serve thousands of Canadian healthcare professionals , provides an example of how this value-of-information framework can be operationalized for an organization .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In addition to the theoretical and methodological contributions , this research adds to the literature by documenting the way that textual feedback data were used to optimize the content of an information resource .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This contrasts with published studies that only dealt with the use of quantitative feedback by information providers not involved in content production .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Reading occurs before citing , however , and so it makes sense to count readers rather than citations for recent publications .

label: Research method
text: To assess this , Mendeley readers and citations were obtained for articles from 2004 to late 2014 in five broad categories ( agriculture , business , decision science , pharmacy , and the social sciences ) and 50 subcategories .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In these areas , citation counts tended to increase with every extra year since publication , and readership counts tended to increase faster initially but then stabilize after about 5 years .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The correlation between citations and readers was also higher for longer time periods , stabilizing after about 5 years .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although there were substantial differences between broad fields and smaller differences between subfields , the results confirm the value of Mendeley reader counts as early scientific impact indicators .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study takes a rhetorical history approach to better understand the development of information studies as a discipline .

label: Research questions
text: Information studies historians have identified that the Cold War period was critical for the development of information science and consequently of its modern-day incarnations .

label: Research questions
text: Due to post-World War II prosperity , the 1960s saw a surge in interest in scientific and technical information .

label: Research questions
text: Many from government , education , and private sectors took interest in developing new ways to compete with Soviet science .

label: Research method
text: This interest led to the National Science Foundation ( NSF ) -funded Georgia Tech conferences of 1961 and 1962 , which are analyzed here .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: I find that concerns about the science information problem provided language that was critical for transforming some of the information studies ' central concepts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , I find that the idea of an information scientist was made possible by national funding for science information .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: I suggest that attending to the discursive traffic between public and disciplinary discourse of information studies can better attune the field to its intellectual commitments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is evident that KMS technologies and activities are indiscriminately deployed in most organizations with little regard to the actual context of their adoption .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Moreover , it is apparent that the extant literature pertaining to knowledge management projects is frequently deficient in identifying the variety of factors indicative for successful KMS .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This presents an obvious business practice and research gap that requires a critical analysis of the necessary intervention that will actually improve how workers can leverage and form organization-wide knowledge .

label: Research method
text: This research involved an extensive review of the literature , a grounded theory methodological approach and rigorous data collection and synthesis through an empirical case analysis ( Parsons Brinckerhoff and Samsung ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The contribution of this study is the formulation of a model for designing KMS based upon the design science paradigm , which aspires to create artifacts that are interdependent of people and organizations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The essential proposition is that KMS design and implementation must be contextualized in relation to knowledge needs and that these will differ for various organizational settings .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions present valuable insights and further understanding of the way in which KMS design efforts should be focused .

label: Research questions
text: In information retrieval ( IR ) , some studies have examined the validity and suitability of such tests for comparing search systems .

label: Research questions
text: We argue here that current methods for assessing the reliability of statistical tests suffer from some methodological weaknesses , and we propose a novel way to study significance tests for retrieval evaluation .

label: Research method
text: Using Score Distributions , we model the output of multiple search systems , produce simulated search results from such models , and compare them using various significance tests .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A key strength of this approach is that we assess statistical tests under perfect knowledge about the truth or falseness of the null hypothesis .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This new method for studying the power of significance tests in IR evaluation is formal and innovative .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Following this type of analysis , we found that both the sign test and Wilcoxon signed test have more power than the permutation test and the t-test .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The sign test and Wilcoxon signed test also have good behavior in terms of type I errors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The bootstrap test shows few type I errors , but it has less power than the other methods tested .

label: Research questions
text: In this case study , we examine how different generations of information and communication technologies ( ICTs ) , ranging from e-mail to micro-blogging , can help address these challenges .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Twenty-one interviews with employees from a multinational company revealed that although people think social media can better address these challenges than older tools , the full potential of social media for supporting knowledge sharing has yet to be achieved .

label: Research questions
text: When examining the interconnections among different ICTs , we found that employees choice of a combination of ICTs , as affected by their functional backgrounds , could create technological divides among them and separate resources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This finding indicates that having more ICTs is not necessarily better .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: ICT integration , as well as support for easy navigation , is crucial for effective knowledge search and sharing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Adaptation to local culture is also needed to ensure worldwide participation in knowledge sharing .

label: Research method
text: We used a theoretical conception of metaphor from cognitive linguistics to design an interactive system for viewing the citation network of the corpora of literature in the JSTOR database , a highly connected compound graph of 2 million papers linked by 8 million citations .

label: Research method
text: We created 4 variants of this system , manipulating 2 distinct properties of metaphor .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a between-subjects experimental study with 80 participants to compare understanding and engagement when working with each version .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that building on known image schemas improved response time on look-up tasks , while contextual detail predicted increases in persistence and the number of inferences drawn from the data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Schema-congruency combined with contextual detail produced the highest gains in comprehension .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions provide concrete mechanisms by which designers presenting large data sets through metaphorical interfaces may improve their effectiveness and appeal with users .

label: Research questions
text: Even though in recent years online Q & A has considerably grown in popularity and impacted information-seeking behaviors , we still lack knowledge about what motivates people to ask a question in online Q & A environments .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Yahoo !

label: Research method
text: Answers and WikiAnswers were selected as the test beds in the study , and a sequential mixed method employing an Internet-based survey , a diary method , and interviews was used to investigate user motivations for asking a question in online Q & A services .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Cognitive needs were found as the most significant motivation , driving people to ask a question .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Yet , it was found that other motivational factors ( e.g. , tension free needs ) also played an important role in user motivations for asking a question , depending on asker 's contexts and situations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Understanding motivations for asking a question could provide a general framework of conceptualizing different contexts and situations of information needs in online Q & A .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions have several implications not only for developing better question-answering processes in online Q & A environments , but also for gaining insights into the broader understanding of online information-seeking behaviors .

label: Research questions
text: Applying topic models to short text documents to extract meaningful topics is challenging .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The problem becomes even more complicated when dealing with short and noisy micro-posts in Twitter that are about one general topic .

label: Research questions
text: In such a case , the goal of applying topic models is to extract subtopics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This results in topics represented by similar sets of keywords , which in turn makes the process of topic interpretation more confusing .

label: Research method
text: In this paper we propose a new method that incorporates Twitter-LDA , WordNet , and hashtags to enhance the keyword labels that represent each topic .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We emphasize the importance of different keywords to different topics based on the semantic relationships and the co-occurrences of keywords in hashtags .

label: Research questions
text: We also propose a method to find the best number of topics to represent the text document collection .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments on two real-life Twitter datasets on fashion suggest that our method performs better than the original Twitter-LDA in terms of perplexity , topic coherence , and the quality of keywords for topic labeling .

label: Research questions
text: In the past two decades or so , PIR has received extensive attention in both academia and industry .

label: Research questions
text: This article surveys the literature of personalization in text retrieval , following a framework for aspects or factors that can be used for personalization .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The framework consists of additional information about users that can be explicitly obtained by asking users for their preferences , or implicitly inferred from users ' search behaviors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Users ' characteristics and contextual factors such as tasks , time , location , etc. , can be helpful for personalization .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article also addresses various issues including when to personalize , the evaluation of PIR , privacy , usability , etc .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the extensive review , challenges are discussed and directions for future effort are suggested .

label: Research questions
text: What might poetic features , such as syllabic stress and mood , contribute ?

label: Research method
text: We address this question in the context of two different attribution problems : ( a ) kindred : differentiate Langston Hughes early poems from those of kindred poets and ( b ) diachronic : differentiate Hughes early from his later poems .

label: Research method
text: Using a diverse set of 535 generic text features , each categorized as poetic or nonpoetic , correlation-based greedy forward search ranked the features and a support vector machine classified the poems .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A small subset of features ( similar to 10 ) achieved cross-validated precision and recall as high as 87 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Poetic features ( rhyme patterns particularly ) were nearly as effective as nonpoetic in kindred discrimination , but less effective diachronically .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In other words , Hughes used both poetic and nonpoetic features in distinctive ways and his use of nonpoetic features evolved systematically while he continued to experiment with poetic features .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions affirm qualitative studies attesting to structural elements from Black oral tradition and Black folk music ( blues ) and to the internal consistency of Hughes early poetry .

label: Research method
text: The impact of user , task , and environmental factors on user satisfaction and task performance was investigated through a mixed methods study with 26 experienced information professionals using enterprise search in an oil and gas enterprise .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Some participants found 75 % of high-value items , others found none , with an average of 27 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: No association was found between self-reported search expertise and task performance , with a tendency for many participants to overestimate their search expertise .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Successful searchers may have more accurate mental models of both search systems and the information space .

text: Organizations may not have effective exploratory search task performance feedback loops , a lack of learning .

text: This may be caused by management bias towards technology , not capability , a lack of systems thinking .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , organizations may not know they do n't know their true level of search expertise , a lack of knowing .

label: Research method
text: A metamodel is presented identifying the causal factors for workplace exploratory search task performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Semistructured qualitative interviews with search staff from the defense , pharmaceutical , and aerospace sectors indicates the potential transferability of the finding that organizations may not know their search expertise levels .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Work on interactive information behaviors has also focused on organizations and on collaboration rather than conflict .

label: Research questions
text: Therefore , in families managing chronic illness , we investigated information behaviors in the context of health-related social control and the impact of control on patient health behavior .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a qualitative analysis of interviews with 38 family groups and 97 individuals over 2 years .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions revealed conflictual information behavior , which led to competitions for control and influence between family members and patients .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In response to perceived patient health behavior-related problems , family members sought , shared , and used information for social control of patients by enforcing norms , leveraging expertise , performing surveillance , and structuring the environment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These behaviors clashed with patients ' interests and perspectives drawn from their own information acquisition .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Patients responded by assessing family-presented information and using information to resist or appease norm enforcement , refute or agree with expertise , and permit or block surveillance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Over time , some patient behaviors changed ; alternatively , patients blocked family access to information about themselves , or family members retreated .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The results challenge presumptions of benefit and harmony that have characterized much prior information behavior research .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Many other compounds that involve information seem , however , not to have a known origin yet .

text: In this article , further information about the phrase information storage and retrieval is provided .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Knowing the history of terms and their associated concepts is an important prescription against poor terminological phrasing and theoretical confusion .

label: Research questions
text: EIM describes the ways that individuals , based on their beliefs , attitudes , and expectations , orient themselves to information as a resource of everyday action .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The key features of EIM were identified by conceptual analysis focusing on three EIM frameworks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Four modes of EIM-Proactive , Social , Reactive , and Passive-and their 12 constituents were identified .

label: Research method
text: A survey of 39 items was developed in two pilot studies to operationalize the identified modes as measurable EIM constituents .

label: Research method
text: The respondents in the main study were upper secondary school students ( n =412 ) .

label: Research method
text: Exploratory factor analysis ( EFA ) was applied to validate subscales for each EIM constituent .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Seven subscales emerged : Inquiring and Scanning in the Proactive mode , Social media-centered , and Experiential in the Social mode , and Information poor , Overwhelmed , and Blunting in the Passive mode .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Two constituents , Serendipitous and Intuitive , were not supported in the EFA .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions highlight that the core constituents of an individual 's everyday information mastering can be operationalized as psychometric scales .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The instrument contributes to the systematic empirical study of EIM constituents and their relationships .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study further sheds light on key modes of EIM .

label: Research method
text: In this article we propose an approach based on a beam search algorithm and a language model working at the byte/character level , the latter component implemented either as an n-gram model or a recurrent neural network .

label: Research method
text: The resulting system analyzes the text input with no word boundaries one token at a time , which can be a character or a byte , and uses the information gathered by the language model to determine if a boundary must be placed in the current position or not .

label: Research questions
text: Our aim is to use this system in a preprocessing step for a microtext normalization system .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This means that it needs to effectively cope with the data sparsity present on this kind of texts .

label: Research questions
text: We also strove to surpass the performance of two readily available word segmentation systems : The well-known and accessible Word Breaker by Microsoft , and the Python module WordSegment by Grant Jenks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that we have met our objectives , and we hope to continue to improve both the precision and the efficiency of our system in the future .

label: Research questions
text: User-generated content ( UGC ) in social media can provide an invaluable source of culturally diverse viewpoints for supporting the understanding of cultural variations .

label: Research questions
text: However , discovering and organizing UGC is notoriously challenging and laborious for humans , especially in ill-defined domains such as culture .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This calls for computational approaches to automate the UGC sensemaking process by using tagging , linking , and exploring .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Semantic technologies allow automated structuring and qualitative analysis of UGC , but are dependent on the availability of an ontology representing the main concepts in a specific domain .

label: Research questions
text: For the domain of cultural variations in interpersonal communication , no ontological model exists .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper presents the first such ontological model , called AMOn+ , which defines cultural variations and enables tagging culture-related mentions in textual content .

label: Research method
text: AMOn+ is designed based on a novel interdisciplinary approach that combines theoretical models of culture with crowdsourced knowledge ( DBpedia ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An evaluation of AMOn+ demonstrated its fitness-for-Research questions regarding domain coverage for annotating culture-related concepts mentioned in text corpora .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This ontology can underpin computational models for making sense of UGC .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , although some of the most widespread uses of these networks nowadays are for professional , academic , and business Research questionss , a thorough investigation of professional information disclosure is still needed .

label: Research questions
text: This study 's primary aim , therefore , is to conduct a systematic and comprehensive investigation into patterns of professional information disclosure and various factors involved on different types of social networks .

label: Research method
text: To this end , a user survey was conducted .

label: Research method
text: We focused specifically on Facebook and LinkedIn , the 2 diverse networks most widely used in Israel .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Significant differences were found between these networks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For example , we found that on Facebook professional pride is a factor in professional information disclosure , whereas on LinkedIn , work seniority and income have a significant effect .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , our Research findings/conclusions shed light on the attitudes and professional behavior of network members , leading to recommendations regarding advertising strategies and network-appropriate self-presentation , as well as approaches that companies might adopt according to the type of manpower required .

label: Research questions
text: This prompts two questions : What precisely is the data reuse process ?

label: Research method
text: What is the connection between each participating element ?

label: Research method
text: To address these issues , 42 studies were reviewed to identify the stages and primary data reuse elements .

label: Research method
text: A meta-synthesis was used to locate and analyze the studies , and inductive coding was used to organize the analytical process .

label: Research method
text: We identified three stages of data reuse-initiation , exploration and collection , and repurposing-and explored how they interact and form iterative characteristics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results illuminated the data reuse at each stage , including issues of data trust , data sources , scaffolds , and barriers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicated that multisource data and human scaffolds promote reuse behavior effectively .

label: Research method
text: Further , two data and information search patterns were extracted : reticular centripetal patterns and decentralized centripetal patterns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Three paths with elements cooperating through flexible functions and motivated by different action items were identified : data centers , human scaffolds , and publications .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study supports improvements for data infrastructure construction , data reuse , and data reuse research by providing a new perspective on the effect of information behavior and clarifying the stages and contextual relationships between various elements .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In disciplinary literatures , authors indicate motivations to use the methods include needs to ( a ) translate research-based knowledge to inform practice and policy decisions , and ( b ) integrate relatively large and diverse knowledge bases to increase the generality of results and yield novel insights or explanations .

label: Research method
text: This review presents two histories of the diffusion of research synthesis methods : a narrative history based primarily in the health and social sciences ; and a bibliometric overview across science broadly .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Engagement with research synthesis was strongly correlated with evidence-based practice ( EBP ) , and moderately with review prevalence .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The social sciences were most diverse in terms of when research synthesis was adopted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Technology , physical sciences , and math appear to be relatively resistant though fields such as physics may be considered to have used similar methods long ago .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additional research is needed to assess the consequences of adoption within fields , including changes in how researchers engage with knowledge resources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This review demonstrates that particularistic histories of science and technology may be fruitfully augmented with informetrics to examine how disciplinary diffusion narratives coincide with patterns across science more broadly , thereby opening up disciplinary knowledge to inform future research .

label: Research questions
text: We postulate that individual users of social Q & A constantly adjust their kindness in the direction of the observed benefit and effort of others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Collective reciprocity emerges from this pattern of conditional strategy of reciprocation and helps form a structure that guides the very interactions that give birth to the structure .

label: Research method
text: Based on a large sample of data from Yahoo !

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Answers , our empirical analysis supports the collective reciprocity premise , showing that the more effort ( relative to benefit ) an asker contributes to the community , the more likely the community will return the favor .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: On the other hand , the more benefit ( relative to effort ) the asker takes from the community , the less likely the community will cooperate in terms of providing answers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that a structuration view of reciprocity sheds light on the duality of social norms in online communities .

label: Research method
text: The research included all major national media and political parties in Spain .

label: Research method
text: Inlink and co-link data about these organizations were collected and analyzed using multidimensional scaling ( MDS ) and other statistical methods .

label: Research method
text: In the MDS map , media are clustered based on their political orientation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There are significantly more co-links between media and parties with the same political orientation than there are between those with different political orientations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions from the study suggest the potential of using link analysis to gain new insights into the interactions among media and political parties .

label: Research questions
text: IA is acknowledged as an important meta-discipline concerned with the design , implementation , and maintenance of digital information spaces .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Despite the relevance of IA , there is little research about the subject within LIS , and still less if one considers initiatives for creating a theory for IA .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we provide a theory for IA and describe the resources needed to create it through ontological models .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We also choose the document as the key entity for such theory , contemplating kinds of documents that not only serve to register information , but also create claims and obligations in society .

label: Research method
text: To achieve our goals , we provide a background for subtheories from LIS and from Applied Ontology .

label: Research questions
text: As a result , we present some basic theory for IA in the form of a formal framework to represent corporations in which IA activities take place , acknowledging that our approach is de facto a subset of IA we call the enterprise information architecture ( EAI ) approach .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By doing this , we highlight the effects that documents cause within corporations in the scope of EIA .

label: Research method
text: Many Twitter topics are annotated by hashtags .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose methods to predict the popularity of new hashtags on Twitter by formulating the problem as a classification task .

label: Research method
text: We use five standard classification models ( i. e. , Naive bayes , k-nearest neighbors , decision trees , support vector machines , and logistic regression ) for prediction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The main challenge is the identification of effective features for describing new hashtags .

label: Research method
text: We extract 7 content features from a hashtag string and the collection of tweets containing the hashtag and 11 contextual features from the social graph formed by users who have adopted the hashtag .

label: Research method
text: We conducted experiments on a Twitter data set consisting of 31 million tweets from 2 million Singapore-based users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results show that the standard classifiers using the extracted features significantly outperform the baseline methods that do not use these features .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among the five classifiers , the logistic regression model performs the best in terms of the Micro-F1 measure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also observe that contextual features are more effective than content features .

label: Research method
text: First , global and overlay maps were developed for the 2 sets separately .

label: Research method
text: Using fuzzy-string matching and ISSN numbers , we were able to match 10,524 journal names between the 2 sets : 96.4 % of the 10,936 journals contained in JCR , or 51.2 % of the 20,554 journals covered by Scopus .

label: Research method
text: Network analysis was pursued on the set of journals shared between the 2 databases and the 2 sets of unique journals .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Citations among the shared journals are more comprehensively covered in JCR than in Scopus , so the network in JCR is denser and more connected than in Scopus .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The ranking of shared journals in terms of indegree ( i.e. , numbers of citing journals ) or total citations is similar in both databases overall ( Spearman rank correlation > 0.97 ) , but some individual journals rank very differently .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Journals that are unique to Scopus seem to be less importantthey are citing shared journals rather than being cited by thembut the humanities are covered better in Scopus than in JCR .

label: Research questions
text: However , several institutional challenges inhibit the required implementation of innovative and information-centric tools to transform records management in response to the challenges of digitization and to capitalize on new opportunities in the digital economy .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we make recommendations to overcome institutional and legislative barriers to transform records management in the public sector .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Among existing studies for document decomposition , some were limited by specific languages , according to topics or restricted to a document of two authors , and their accuracies have big room for improvement .

label: Research questions
text: In this paper , we consider the contextual correlation hidden among sentences and propose an algorithm for Sequential and Unsupervised Decomposition of a Multi-Author Document ( SUDMAD ) written in any language , disregarding topics , through the construction of a Hidden Markov Model ( HMM ) reflecting the authors ' writing styles .

label: Research method
text: To build and learn such a model , an unsupervised , statistical approach is first proposed to estimate the initial values of HMM parameters of a preliminary model , which does not require the availability of any information of author 's or document 's context other than how many authors contributed to writing the document .

label: Research method
text: To further boost the performance of this approach , a boosted HMM learning procedure is proposed next , where the initial classification results are used to create labeled training data to learn a more accurate HMM .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Moreover , the contextual relationship among sentences is further utilized to refine the classification results .

label: Research method
text: Our proposed approach is empirically evaluated on three benchmark datasets that are widely used for authorship analysis of documents .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Comparisons with recent state-of-the-art approaches are also presented to demonstrate the significance of our new ideas and the superior performance of our approach .

label: Research method
text: This study used a constructivist grounded theory approach to examine humanities scholars ' research practices , including their use of a wide range of resources and digital technologies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using in-depth study , several themes emerged from the research relating to the role of technology in shaping humanities scholars ' research practices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The themes include : ( a ) humanities scholars ' research approaches and technology tools ; ( b ) the humanities scholar as tool developer ; ( c ) the role of data preparation as a meta-level research practice ; ( d ) data visualization versus numeric outputs-one size does not fit all ; ( e ) the importance of flexibility and agency ; ( f ) technology tools in support of the researcher as writer ; and ( g ) working alone/working together-technology tools and collaborative practice .

label: Research questions
text: The heterogeneous nature of humanities scholars ' research practices are explored and the resulting implications for digital tool design .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Two new research practices-tool development and data preparation-are proposed .

label: Research questions
text: The diverse digital technologies humanities scholars use support the traditional ways of working within their discipline , as well as creating potential for new scholarly practices .

label: Research questions
text: Given the exponential growth of new web applications and services , and the intense competition among them , attaining and retaining popularity are difficult .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: One possible approach to this problem is to enhance the competitiveness of a web presence by using appropriate web design mechanisms .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Research in this area has mainly focused on technological issues and usability studies .

label: Research questions
text: Few studies have paid attention to the socially constructed meaning ( cognition ) that is embedded in the context of media .

label: Research questions
text: Drawing on the heuristic model from the social cognition perspective , the author posits that source credibility and content freshness are two important media-embedded heuristics potentially influential to the readership popularity of online interactive media sites .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The content analysis results of 100 leading web-logs strongly supported this hypotheses .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Key quantitative Research findings/conclusions were also consistent with the qualitative evidence provided by 28 expert practitioners .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study expands our understanding of the related constructs from a social cognition perspective and calls for design attention to influential media-embedded traits when developing online interactive media and related websites .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research shows that people conduct collaborative information searches while planning their travel activities online .

label: Research questions
text: However , little is known in depth about tourists ' online collaborative search .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study examines tourists ' collaborative information search behavior in detail , including their search stages , online search strategies , and information flow breakdowns .

label: Research method
text: The data for analysis included pre- and postsearch questionnaires , web search and chat logs , and postsearch interviews .

label: Research method
text: A model of tourist collaborative information retrieval was developed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The model identified collaborative planning , collaborative information searching , sharing of information , and collaborative decision making as four stages of tourists ' collaborative search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that tourists collaborated by planning their search strategies , dividing search tasks into subtasks and allocating workload , using search queries and URL links recommended by teammates , and discussing search results together .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Related personal knowledge and experiences appeared important in trip planning and collaborative information search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: During the collaborative search , tourists also encountered various information flow breakdowns in different search stages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These were classified and their effects on collaborative information search were reported .

label: Research questions
text: Implications for system design in support of collaborative information retrieval in travel contexts are also discussed .

label: Research method
text: Focusing on three main branches-diseases , drugs and chemicals , and techniques and equipment-we use base maps and overlay techniques to investigate the translations and interactions and thus to gain a bibliometric perspective on the dynamics of medical innovations .

label: Research method
text: To this end , we first analyze the MEDLINE database , the MeSH index tree , and the various options for a static mapping from different perspectives and at different levels of aggregation .

label: Research method
text: Following a specific innovation ( RNA interference ) over time , the notion of a trajectory which leaves a signature in the database is elaborated .

label: Research method
text: Can the detailed index terms describing the dynamics of research be used to predict the diffusion dynamics of research results ?

label: Research method
text: Possibilities are specified for further integration between the MEDLINE database on one hand , and the Science Citation Index and Scopus ( containing citation information ) on the other .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research investigated what happens if researchers de facto allow distractions to occur in a test situation .

label: Research questions
text: It examined the type and magnitude of occurred distractions , the effects distractions have on completion scores , and whether different distractions affect different test activities differently .

label: Research method
text: In the research design , participants were randomly assigned to either a controlled environment or their natural environment .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results showed that whereas participants in the natural environment needed more time to complete the post task questionnaire than their laboratory counterparts , they spent a similar amount of time on the tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Participants were capable of , and indeed willing to , limit the less-urgent distractions in the interests of getting the tasks done .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: If they were interrupted by a human contact , however , the completion time for tasks increased significantly .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous studies showed that distractions change information behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Yet , the present results provide evidence that these changes do not always occur , and thus there needs to be a better demarcation of the limits within which distraction can be expected to change how people interact with information .

label: Research method
text: For this Research questions , from 6 selected subject fields ( condensed matter physics , inorganic and nuclear chemistry , electric and electronic engineering , biochemistry and molecular biology , physiology , and gastroenterology ) , original articles published in the same year were sampled ( n=230-240 for each field ) .

label: Research method
text: Then , the citation counts received by the articles in relatively long citation windows ( 6 and 11 years after publication ) were predicted by negative binomial multiple regression ( NBMR ) analysis for each field .

label: Research method
text: Various article features about author collaboration , cited references , visibility , authors ' achievements ( measured by past publications and citedness ) , and publishing journals were considered as the explanatory variables of NBMR .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Some generality across the fields was found with regard to the selected predicting factors and the degree of significance of these predictors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Price index was the strongest predictor of citations , and number of references was the next .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The effects of number of authors and authors ' achievement measures were rather weak .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is shown that the corresponding function , h ( T ) , is concavely increasing .

label: Research method
text: Next , we construct an implicit relation between the h-index and the impact factor IF ( an average number of items per source ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The corresponding function h ( IF ) is increasing and we show that if the parameter C in the numerator of the shifted Lotka function is high , then the relation between the h-index and the impact factor is almost linear .

label: Research questions
text: The tensions caused by this multiplicity of interests and singularity of output frame most collaborative research practice .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of present study is to identify areas of tension in such collaborative and heterogeneous efforts .

label: Research questions
text: To this end , the present study investigates the coconstruction of archeological narrative at one of the largest multinational archeological campaigns in the world , the catalhoyuk project in Turkey .

label: Research questions
text: This study conceptualizes archeological narratives as epistemic assemblages .

label: Research questions
text: Following Actor Network theorists , the archeological process is conceptualized as a series of translation processes ( of heterogeneous engineering ) that inscribe the found material remains of archeological investigation into a narrative .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This complex process takes place within a heterogeneous sociotechnical network .

label: Research method
text: This study decomposes this heterogeneous network to identify the areas of tension and struggle .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Two sources of such tensions are identified as fragmentation and fault lines .

label: Research questions
text: Overcoming fragmentation and fault lines is key for the success of heterogeneous scientific work and maintaining productive scientific collaboration .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions of this study have applications beyond archeology and can inform the design of cyberin-frastructure for heterogeneous collaborations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Current guidelines on publishing recommend making images accessible to all readers .

label: Research questions
text: However , academic publishers do not always follow these guidelines and therefore fail to guarantee access by all readers to the visual content of academic articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: People with severe visual impairments can not access the visual content of images unless a text alternative describing the images is provided .

label: Research questions
text: This study investigates the current use of texts commonly related to images in academic articles , such as captions and mentions , in order to assess their suitability as potential text alternatives to the images for readers who are blind or have severe low vision .

label: Research method
text: A sample of 30 academic articles in the fields of biomedicine , computer science , and mathematics was analyzed and quantitative and qualitative data were collected about images and their related texts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We suggest a practical and sustainable solution that can foster the adoption of good accessibility practices by authors and publishers and facilitate their inclusion in regular publishing workflows .

label: Research questions
text: Does topic modeling provide an alternative for co-word mapping in research practices using moderately sized document collections ?

label: Research method
text: We return to the word/document matrix using first a single text with a strong argument ( The Leiden Manifesto ) and then upscale to a sample of moderate size ( n = 5687 ) to study the pros and cons of the two approaches in terms of the resulting possibilities for making semantic maps that can serve an argument .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results from co-wordmapping ( using two different routines ) versus topic modeling are significantly uncorrelated .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Whereas components in the co-word maps can easily be designated , the topic models provide sets of words that are very differently organized .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In these samples , the topic models seem to reveal similarities other than semantic ones ( e.g. , linguistic ones ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In other words , topic modeling does not replace co-word mapping in small and medium-sized sets ; but the paper leaves open the possibility that topic modeling would work well for the semantic mapping of large sets .

label: Research method
text: In all , 15,000 random queries were formulated to GSC to obtain a list of 26,682 registered users .

label: Research method
text: From this list a network graph of 6,660 labels was built and classified according to the Scopus Subject Area classes .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results display a detailed label map of the most used ( > 15 times ) tags .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The structural analysis shows that the core of the network is occupied by computer sciencerelated disciplines that account for the most used and shared labels .

label: Research method
text: This core is surrounded by clusters of disciplines related or close to computing such as Information Sciences , Mathematics , or Bioinformatics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Classical areas such as Chemistry and Physics are marginalized in the graph .

label: Research questions
text: It is suggested that GSC would in the future be an accurate source to map Science because it is based on the labels that scientists themselves use to describe their own research activity .

label: Research questions
text: However , the popularity of Twitter has attracted not only legitimate users but also spammers who exploit social graphs , popular keywords , and hashtags for malicious Research questionss .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , we present a detailed analysis of the HSpam14 dataset , which contains 14 million tweets with spam and ham ( i.e. , nonspam ) labels , to understand spamming activities on Twitter .

label: Research questions
text: The primary focus of this paper is to analyze various aspects of spam on Twitter based on hashtags , tweet contents , and user profiles , which are useful for both tweet-level and user-level spam detection .

label: Research method
text: First , we compare the usage of hashtags in spam and ham tweets based on frequency , position , orthography , and co-occurrence .

label: Research method
text: Second , for content-based analysis , we analyze the variations in word usage , metadata , and near-duplicate tweets .

label: Research method
text: Third , for user-based analysis , we investigate user profile information .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In our study , we validate that spammers use popular hashtags to promote their tweets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We also observe differences in the usage of words in spam and ham tweets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Spam tweets are more likely to be emphasized using exclamation points and capitalized words .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , we observe that spammers use multiple accounts to post near-duplicate tweets to promote their services and products .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Unlike spammers , legitimate users are likely to provide more information such as their locations and personal descriptions in their profiles .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In summary , this study presents a comprehensive analysis of hashtags , tweet contents , and user profiles in Twitter spamming .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By specifying the functional role of a given piece of relevant information in the overall structure of a topic , the proposed typology provides a generic framework for integrating different pieces of clinical evidence and a multifaceted view of a clinical problem .

label: Research questions
text: In medical problem solving structured knowledge plays a key role .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The typology provides the conceptual basis for integrating and structuring knowledge ; it incorporates and goes beyond existing clinical schemes ( such as PICO and illness script ) and offers extra assistance for physicians as well as lay users ( such as patients and caregivers ) to manage the vast amount of diversified evidence , to maintain a structured view of the patient problem at hand , and ultimately to make well-grounded clinical choices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Developed as a generic topical framework across topics and domains , the typology proved useful for clinical medicine once extended with domainspecific definitions and relationships .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article reports the Research findings/conclusions of using the adapted and extended typology in the analysis of 26 clinical questions and their evidence-based answers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The article concludes with potential applications of the typology to improve clinical information seeking , organizing , and processing .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: It also introduces the degree of internationality of journals and references as new metrics for this Research questions .

label: Research method
text: The journal impact factor ; the impact of references ; the internationality of authors , journals , and references ; and the number of authors , institutions , and references were all calculated for papers published in nanoscience and nanotechnology journals in the Web of Science from 2007 to 2009 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using a zero-inflated negative binomial regression model on the data set , the impact factor of the publishing journal and the citation impact of the cited references were found to be the most effective determinants of citation counts in all four time periods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the entire 2007 to 2009 period , apart from journal internationality and author numbers and internationality , all other predictor variables had significant effects on citation counts .

label: Research questions
text: This article considers the connections between scientific and bibliographic classifications for music , taking general discourse about scientific classification and domain analysis as its starting point .

label: Research method
text: Three relationship characteristics are posited : similarity , causation , and time .

label: Research method
text: In discussions about similarity , accords and discords are analyzed .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Further , the idea of a scale of accord is introduced , and issues with assuming a univocal scientific or bibliographic classification of music are discussed .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Causation and the idea of influence between scientific and bibliographic classifications for music are unpicked .

label: Research questions
text: The connections between accordance and influence are explored , and the concept of differing Research questionss for different classification approaches is analyzed .

label: Research method
text: A temporal dimension is considered , and the dynamic nature of connections between music scientific and bibliographic classifications is established .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The idea of bifurcation is introduceda change of accordance over timewhich is prominent for musical instrument classification .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The concluding model visualizes similarity , causation and temporal aspects as three dimensions , showing how scientific and bibliographic classifications for music are connected through a set of interconnected and complex relationships .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we examine whether this diversification has also affected the handful of elite journals that are traditionally considered to be the best .

label: Research method
text: We examine citation patterns during the past 40 years of seven long-standing traditionally elite journals and six journals that have been increasing in importance during the past 20 years .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To be among the top 5 % or 1 % cited papers , papers now need about twice as many citations as they did 40 years ago .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Since the late 1980s and early 1990s , elite journals have been publishing a decreasing proportion of these top-cited papers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This also applies to the two journals that are typically considered as the top venues and often used as bibliometric indicators of excellence : Science and Nature .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: On the other hand , several new and established journals are publishing an increasing proportion of the most-cited papers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These changes bring new challenges and opportunities for all parties .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Journals can enact policies to increase or maintain their relative position in the journal hierarchy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Researchers now have the option to publish in more diverse venues knowing that their work can still reach the same audiences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , evaluators and administrators need to know that although there will always be a certain prestige associated with publishing in elite journals , journal hierarchies are in constant flux .

label: Research method
text: A set of 862 academic documents relating to social tagging and published from 2005 to 2011 was thus examined using bibliometric analysis as well as the social network analysis technique .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that social tagging , as a research area , develops rapidly and attracts an increasing number of new entrants .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There are no key authors , publication sources , or research groups that dominate the research domain of social tagging .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research on social tagging appears to focus mainly on the following three aspects : ( a ) components and functions of social tagging ( e.g. , tags , tagging objects , and tagging network ) , ( b ) taggers ' behaviors and interface design , and ( c ) tags ' organization and usage in social tagging .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The trend suggest that more researchers turn to the latter two integrated with human computer interface and information retrieval , although the first aspect is the fundamental one in social tagging .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , more studies relating to social tagging pay attention to multimedia tagging objects and not only text tagging .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Previous research on social tagging was limited to a few subject domains such as information science and computer science .

label: Research questions
text: As an interdisciplinary research area , social tagging is anticipated to attract more researchers from different disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More practical applications , especially in high-tech companies , is an encouraging research trend in social tagging .

label: Research method
text: This study explored whether a search interface based on the Bing API and enabled by Scatter/Gather , a well-known document-clustering technique , can improve health information searches .

label: Research method
text: Forty participants without medical backgrounds were randomly assigned to two interfaces : a baseline interface that resembles typical web search engines and a Scatter/Gather interface .

label: Research method
text: Both groups performed two lookup and two exploratory health-related tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It was found that the baseline group was more likely to rephrase queries and less likely to access general-Research questions sites than the Scatter/Gather group when completing exploratory tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Otherwise , the two groups did not differ in behavior and task performance , with participants in the Scatter/Gather group largely overlooking the features ( key words , clusters , and the recluster function ) designed to facilitate the exploration of semantic relationships between information objects , a potentially useful means for users in the rather unfamiliar domain of health .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest a strong effect of users ' mental models of search on their use of search interfaces and a high cognitive cost associated with using the Scatter/Gather features .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It follows that novel features of a search interface should not only be compatible with users ' mental models but also provide sufficient affordance to inform users of how they can be used .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Compared with the interface , tasks showed more significant impacts on search behavior .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In future studies , more effort should be devoted to identify salient features of health-related information needs .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper explores the actual privacy practices of popular disaster apps , highlighting location information flows .

label: Research method
text: Our empirical study compares content analysis of privacy policies and government agency policies , structured by the contextual integrity framework , with static and dynamic app analysis documenting the personal data sent by 15 apps .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We identify substantive gaps between regulation and guidance , privacy policies , and information flows , resulting from ambiguities and exploitation of exemptions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results also indicate gaps between governance and practice , including the following : ( a ) Many apps ignore self-defined policies ; ( b ) while some policies state they might access location data under certain conditions , those conditions are not met as 12 apps included in our study capture location immediately upon initial launch under default settings ; and ( c ) not all third-party data recipients are identified in policy , including instances that violate expectations of trusted third parties .

label: Research questions
text: We focus on some topics of particular interest to the information science community : data infrastructures for scholarly communication and research , the politicization of data curation and visualization for public-facing dashboards , and human subjects research and policies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude with some areas of opportunity and need , including broader and richer data curation education in the information schools , the establishment of better data management policy implementations by research funders , the award of formal academic credit for data curation activities and data sharing , and engagement in cooperative action around data ethics and security .

label: Research questions
text: One approach to extracting biomedical knowledge involves using citation relations to discover entity relations .

label: Research method
text: The assumption is that citation relations between any two articles connect knowledge entities across the articles , enabling the detection of implicit relationships among biomedical entities .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of this article is to examine the characteristics of biomedical entities connected via intermediate entities using citation relations aided by text mining .

label: Research method
text: Based on the importance of symptoms as biomedical entities , we created triples connected via citation relations to identify drug-disease pairs with shared symptoms as intermediate entities .

label: Research method
text: Drug-disease interactions built via citation relations were compared with co-occurrence-based interactions .

label: Research method
text: Several types of analyses were adopted to examine the properties of the extracted entity pairs by comparing them with drug-disease interaction databases .

label: Research questions
text: We attempted to identify the characteristics of drug-disease pairs through citation relations in association with biomedical entities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results showed that the citation relation-based approach resulted in diverse types of biomedical entities and preserved topical consistency .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , drug-disease pairs identified only via citation relations are interesting for clinical trials when they are examined using BITOLA .

label: Research questions
text: However , current studies have overly focused on source attributes as indicators for 2 criteria , source quality and accessibility , and overlooked the role of other factors and criteria that help determine source selection .

label: Research method
text: To fill this gap , guided by decision-making theories and the cognitive perspective to information search , we interviewed 30 participants about their reasons for using a wide range of sources for health information .

label: Research method
text: Additionally , we asked each of them to report a critical incident in which sources were selected to fulfill a specific information need .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the analysis of the transcripts , 5 categories of factors were identified as influential to source selection : source-related factors , user-related factors , user-source relationships , characteristics of the problematic situation , and social influences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , about a dozen criteria that mediate the influence of the factors on source-selection decisions were identified , including accessibility , quality , usability , interactivity , relevance , usefulness , familiarity , affection , anonymity , and appropriateness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These results significantly expanded the current understanding of the nature of costs and benefits involved in source-selection decisions , and strongly indicated that a personalized approach is needed for information services and information systems to provide effective access to health information sources for consumers .

label: Research questions
text: Because nonprofit organizations differ from commercial , educational , or governmental sectors , it is important to understand the ways they utilize the web .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: To the best of our knowledge , the linking structure of nonprofit organizations has not been previously studied .

label: Research method
text: We surveyed websites of 54 nonprofit organizations in Israel ; most of these sites have at least 100 volunteers .

label: Research method
text: We compared their orientation and contents and we built their linking map .

label: Research method
text: We divided the organizations into four main groups : economic aid and citizen rights organizations , health aid organizations , organizations supporting families and individuals with special needs , and organizations for women and children .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that the number of links inside the special needs group is much higher than in the other groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We tried to explain this behavior by considering the data obtained from the site-linking graph .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The value of our results is in defining and testing a method to investigate a group of nonprofit organizations , using a case study of Israeli organizations .

label: Research method
text: The basis for the analysis is the Flemish Academic Bibliographic Database for the Social Sciences and Humanities ( VABB-SHW ) , a comprehensive bibliographic database of peer-reviewed publications in the SSH by researchers affiliated with Flemish universities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Combining data on journal articles and book chapters , our Research findings/conclusions indicate that collaborative publishing in the SSH is increasing , though considerable differences between disciplines remain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Conversely , we did observe a sharp decline in single-author publishing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We further demonstrate that coauthored SSH articles in journals indexed in the Web of Science ( WoS ) generally have a higher ( and growing ) number of coauthors than do either those in non-WoS journals or book chapters .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This illustrates the need to include non-WoS data and book chapters when studying coauthorship in the SSH .

label: Research questions
text: Nevertheless , despite some research into specific images , such as selfies , and a few news stories about specific tweeted photographs , little is known about the types of images that are routinely shared .

label: Research method
text: In response , this article reports a content analysis of random samples of 800 images tweeted from the UK or USA during a week at the end of 2014 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Although most images were photographs , a substantial minority were hybrid or layered image forms : phone screenshots , collages , captioned pictures , and pictures of text messages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: About half were primarily of one or more people , including 10 % that were selfies , but a wide variety of other things were also pictured .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Some of the images were for advertising or to share a joke but in most cases the Research questions of the tweet seemed to be to share the minutiae of daily lives , performing the function of chat or gossip , sometimes in innovative ways .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a systematic literature review to lay the groundwork for understanding the relationship between SNS use and users ' psychological well-being and for devising strategies for taking advantage of this relationship .

label: Research method
text: The review included articles published between 2003 and 2016 , extracted from major academic databases .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions revealed that the use of SNSs is both positively and negatively related to users ' psychological well-being .

label: Research questions
text: We discuss the factors that moderate this relationship and their implications on users ' psychological well-being .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Many of the studies we reviewed lacked a sound theoretical justification for their Research findings/conclusions and most involved young and healthy students , leaving other cohorts of SNS users neglected .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The paper concludes with the presentation of a platform for future investigation .

label: Research method
text: To determine the most important words of a given text , the term frequencies ( tf ) or the tfidf weighting scheme can be applied .

label: Research questions
text: Recently , latent Dirichlet allocation ( LDA ) has been proposed to define the topics included in a corpus .

label: Research questions
text: As another strategy , this study proposes to apply a vocabulary specificity measure ( Zscore ) to determine the most significantly overused word-types or short sequences of them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our experiments show that the simple term frequency measure is not able to discriminate between specific terms associated with a document or a set of texts .

label: Research method
text: Using the tf idf or LDA approach , the selection requires some arbitrary decisions .

label: Research method
text: Based on the term-specific measure ( Zscore ) , the term selection has a clear theoretical basis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , the most significant sentences for each presidency can be determined .
