label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: As another facet , we can visualize the dynamic evolution of usage of some terms associated with their specificity measures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , this technique can be employed to define the most important lexical leaders introducing terms overused by the k following presidencies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By using the Arpanet Host-Host Protocol and its sockets as an entry point for studying the generation of metadata , we show that the development and function of key Arpanet infrastructure can be studied by examining the creation and stabilization of metadata .

label: Research questions
text: More specifically , we use the Host-Host Protocol 's sockets as an example of something that , at the level of the network , functions as both network infrastructure and metadata simultaneously .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By presenting the function of sockets in tandem with an overview of the Host-Host Protocol , we argue for the further integrated study of infrastructure and metadata .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Finally , we reintroduce the concept of infradata to refer specifically to data that locate data throughout an infrastructure and are required by the infrastructure to function , separating them from established and stabilized standards .

label: Research questions
text: We argue for the future application of infradata as a concept for the study of histories and political economies of networks , bridging the largely library and information science ( LIS ) study of metadata with the largely science and technology studies ( STS ) domain of infrastructure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article reports the Research findings/conclusions of a case study that investigated the use of image and multimedia resources in an undergraduate classroom .

label: Research method
text: The study assumed a contextual approach and focused on different class contexts and students ' literacy practices .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The class , which took place in a resource-rich , multimodal environment , was perceived by students as a positive learning experience .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The distribution of resources and their role in teaching and learning varied and depended on the context of use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions indicate that images fulfilled important descriptive and mnemonic functions when students were introduced to new concepts , but their role was limited in practices that required students to analyze and synthesize knowledge .

label: Research method
text: Searches using each term are conducted in JSTOR and in selected additional full-text journal sources from over the years 1987-2011 .

label: Research method
text: Two measures of OBI are used , one simply tallying the presence or absence of references to Simon 's oeuvre ( strict OBI ) linked to the catch phrase and one counting only papers lacking any embedded reference as evidence of obliteration ( lenient OBI ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By either measure , OBI existed but varied across subject area , time period , and catch phrase .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Economics had the highest strict OBI ( 82 % ) and lenient OBI ( 43 % ) for bounded rationality and the highest strict OBI ( 64 % ) for satisficing ; all 3 subject areas were essentially tied for lenient OBI at about 30 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Sixty-two percent of the articles for bounded rationalitypsychology were retrieved only because the catch phrase occurred in a title in the article bibliography .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: OBI research can benefit from full-text searching ; the main tradeoff is more detailed and nuanced evidence concerning OBI existence and trends versus increased noise in the retrieval .

label: Research questions
text: State-of-the-art approaches view it as an expert search or resource selection problem .

label: Research questions
text: We investigate the effect of content-based similarity between posts on the performance of the retrieval system .

label: Research method
text: We test two different approaches for smoothing ( regularizing ) relevance scores of posts based on their dependencies .

label: Research method
text: In the first approach , we smooth term distributions describing posts by performing a random walk over a document-term graph in which similar posts are highly connected .

label: Research method
text: In the second , we directly smooth scores for posts using a regularization framework that aims to minimize the discrepancy between scores for similar documents .

label: Research method
text: We then extend these approaches to consider the time interval between the posts in smoothing the scores .

label: Research questions
text: The idea is that if two posts are temporally close , then they are good sources for smoothing each other 's relevance scores .

label: Research method
text: We compare these methods with the state-of-the-art approaches in blog search that employ Language Modeling-based resource selection algorithms and fusion-based methods for aggregating post relevance scores .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show performance gains over the baseline techniques which do not take advantage of the relation between posts for smoothing relevance estimates .

label: Research method
text: Based on an extensive interdisciplinary review , I provide a novel framework that presents resonance as a spectrum of experience with a multitude of outcomes ranging from a sense of harmony and coherence to life transformation .

label: Research questions
text: I argue that resonance has different properties to the more traditional interpretation of relevance and provides a better system of explanation of what it means to experience relevance .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: I show how traditional approaches to relevance and resonance work in a complementary fashion and outline how resonance may present distinct new lines of research into relevance theory .

label: Research method
text: As part of this project , the authors explored informal learning methods that the groups could benefit from and practiced them with the community representatives who played key roles in the daily life of the organizations .

label: Research method
text: In the present article , the authors reflect on the developmental trajectories observed for two individuals , each from a different nonprofit organization , with respect to information technology efficacy and ability .

label: Research method
text: The authors analyze these trajectories as a sequence of the following four technology-related roles-technology consumers , technology planners , technology doers , and technology sustainers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The authors describe these roles , the methods used to promote informal learning , and implications for other researchers studying informal learning in communities .

label: Research questions
text: Such knowledge provides a basis for designing systems for providing complementary health information .

label: Research questions
text: This article discusses how patients ' conceptualizations of their health-information-related preferences , motivations , and needs are linked to the perceived role of medical records as an informational artifact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We identified seven subject positions : ( P1 ) Hypothetically positive to e-health services generally , ( P2 ) Positive to reading medical records due to implications , ( P3 ) Positive to all Internet use including medical records online , ( P4 ) Distrustful and wants to be in control of health treatment , ( P5 ) Worried about health , ( P6 ) Wants communication with health care professionals , and ( P7 ) Do not understand their medical record .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These subject positions can explain the worry and enthusiasm documented in earlier literature .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The diversity of subject positions implies that health care information services should be planned with different subject positions in mind rather than a simple demographic group .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Special attention needs to be given to finding flexible solutions that address the opportunities and worries of the identified subject positions .

label: Research questions
text: Institutions that are spread across multiple geographic locations face additional challenges .

label: Research method
text: To better understand the nature of cross-campus collaboration within a single institution and the effects of institutional efforts to spark collaboration , we conducted a case study of collaboration at Cornell University using scientometric and network analyses .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results suggest that crosscampus collaboration is increasingly common , but is accounted for primarily by a relatively small number of departments and individual researchers .

label: Research method
text: Specific researchers involved in many collaborative projects are identified , and their unique characteristics are described .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Institutional efforts , such as seed grants and topical retreats , have some effect for researchers who are central in the collaboration network , but were less clearly effective for others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This article shows that one way to do this is through the concept of understanding .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Visual art is identified as an illuminating domain for an initial foray into such research .

label: Research method
text: This article presents Research findings/conclusions from a phenomenology-of-practice study of the information behavior of visual artists .

label: Research method
text: Seven local artists documented their experiences creating self-portraits , and semistructured follow-up interviews were conducted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions show how these participants built understanding with information in their work of creating individual self-portraits .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These understandings fall into two categories : of the self and of the artistic process .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Many forms of information , traditional and novel , contribute to these understandings ; examples of the latter include memories , the lived environment , profound experiences , and online browsing .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These Research findings/conclusions extend the literature on artists ' information behavior , connect everyday information behavior to information experience , and illustrate a method for studying understanding empirically in information science .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The article closes by discussing the meaning of these Research findings/conclusions for the future of information science , suggesting that the kinds of information employed by artists might be recognized and appreciated more widely throughout society .

label: Research method
text: A seed set of 901 articles published between 1973 and 2015 was evaluated and in total 65 studies were considered for further analyses .

label: Research method
text: Data extraction and synthesis was performed through content analysis using the PRISMA method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Three thematic categories were identified in regard to music information needs : ( a ) those related to scholarly activities , ( b ) musically motivated , as well as ( c ) those which are related to socializing and communication .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , 3 categories of music information sources were connected to musical creativity : ( i ) those that are related to Internet and media technologies , ( ii ) those that are related to music libraries , organizations , and music stores , and ( iii ) those that are related to the subjects ' social settings .

label: Research questions
text: The paper provides a systematic review , with the aim of showcasing the effect of modern information retrieval techniques in a creative and intensive area of information-dependent activity such as music making and consumption .

label: Research questions
text: However , most current methods focus on increasing the performance , leaving the semantic gap problem , which refers to the learned ranking models are hard to be understood , remaining intact .

label: Research questions
text: Therefore , in this article , we aim at learning an interpretable ranking model to tackle the semantic gap in fine-grained image ranking .

label: Research questions
text: We propose to combine attribute-based representation and online passive-aggressive ( PA ) learning based ranking models to achieve this goal .

label: Research method
text: Besides , considering the highly localized instances in fine-grained image ranking , we introduce a supervised constrained clustering method to gather class-balanced training instances for local PA-based models , and incorporate the learned local models into a unified probabilistic framework .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Extensive experiments on the benchmark demonstrate that the proposed framework outperforms state-of-the-art methods in terms of accuracy and speed .

label: Research method
text: It presents the results of a survey covering higher education libraries in Australia , Canada , Germany , Ireland , the Netherlands , New Zealand , and the UK .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results indicate that libraries have provided leadership in RDM , particularly in advocacy and policy development .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Service development is still limited , focused especially on advisory and consultancy services ( such as data management planning support and data-related training ) , rather than technical services ( such as provision of a data catalog , and curation of active data ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Data curation skills development is underway in libraries , but skills and capabilities are not consistently in place and remain a concern .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Other major challenges include resourcing , working with other support services , and achieving buy in from researchers and senior managers .

label: Research method
text: Results are compared with previous studies in order to assess trends and relative maturity levels .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The range of RDM activities explored in this study are positioned on a landscape maturity model , which reflects current and planned research data services and practice in academic libraries , representing a snapshot of current developments and a baseline for future research .

label: Research questions
text: This is a problem because the discourse of the weak discipline creates conceptual confusion in relation to interdisciplinarity .

label: Research questions
text: Considering the growth of the iSchools and what is assumed to be a major institutional redrawing of boundaries , there is a pressing need to conceptualize interdisciplinary practices and boundary work .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper explores the weak discipline through a discourse analytical lens and identifies a myth .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Perceiving the discipline as weak is part of a myth , fueled by the ideal of a unitary discipline ; the ideal discipline has strong boundaries , and as long as the discourse continues to focus on a need for boundaries , the only available discourse is one that articulates the discipline as weak .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , the myth is a vicious circle that can be broken if weakness is no longer ascribed to the discipline by tradition .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The paper offers an explanation of the workings of the myth so that its particular way of interpreting the world does not mislead us when theorizing interdisciplinarity .

label: Research method
text: This is a conceptual paper , and the examples serve as an empirical backdrop to the conceptual argument .

label: Research questions
text: A key element of collaborative tagging is the concept of collective intelligence ( CI ) , which is a shared intelligence among all participants .

label: Research questions
text: This research investigates the phenomenon of social tagging in the context of CI with the aim to serve as a stepping-stone towards the mining of truly valuable social tags for web resources .

label: Research method
text: This study focuses on assessing and evaluating the degree of CI embedded in social tagging over time in terms of two-parameter values , number of participants , and top frequency ranking window .

label: Research method
text: Five different metrics were adopted and utilized for assessing the similarity between ranking lists : overlapList , overlapRank , Footrule , Fagin 's measure , and the Inverse Rank measure .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The result of this study demonstrates that a substantial degree of CI is most likely to be achieved when somewhere between the first 200 and 400 people have participated in tagging , and that a target degree of CI can be projected by controlling the two factors along with the selection of a similarity metric .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The study also tests some experimental conditions for detecting social tags with high CI degree .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of this study can be applicable to the study of filtering social tags based on CI ; filtered social tags may be utilized for the metadata creation of tagged resources and possibly for the retrieval of tagged resources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We present the search trends adolescents display and develop a framework of search roles that these trends help define .

label: Research method
text: We compare these trends and roles to similar trends and roles found in prior work with children ages 7 , 9 , and 11 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We use these comparisons to make recommendations to adult stakeholders such as researchers , designers , and information literacy educators about the best ways to design search tools for children and adolescents , as well as how to use the framework of searching roles to find better methods of educating youth searchers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Major Research findings/conclusions include the seven roles of adolescent searchers , and evidence that adolescents are social in their computer use , have a greater knowledge of sources than younger children , and that adolescents are less frustrated by searching tasks than younger children .

label: Research method
text: Drawing on the extant literature on innovation adoption and opinion leadership , we propose two dimensions of crowdfunders that capture the heterogeneity in crowdfunders & apos ; behavior : opinion leadership and interest specialization of crowdfunders .

label: Research method
text: Using a set of variables representing these two dimensions , our analysis revealed five distinct archetypes of crowdfunders : the Vocal Actives , the Silent Actives , the Focused Enthusiasts , the Trend Followers , and the Star Seekers , who each adopted distinct crowdfunding strategies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We established external and criterion-related validity of the cluster solutions in multiple ways .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results suggest that the composition of crowdfunders is complex , even within a single platform .

label: Research method
text: Keywords Plus and Author Keywords are commonly selected as units of analysis , despite the limited research evidence demonstrating the effectiveness of Keywords Plus .

label: Research questions
text: This study was conceived to evaluate the efficacy of Keywords Plus as a parameter for capturing the content and scientific concepts presented in articles .

label: Research method
text: Using scientific papers about patient adherence that were retrieved from WOS , a comparative assessment of Keywords Plus and Author Keywords was performed at the scientific field level and the document level , respectively .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our search yielded more Keywords Plus terms than Author Keywords , and the Keywords Plus terms were more broadly descriptive .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Keywords Plus is as effective as Author Keywords in terms of bibliometric analysis investigating the knowledge structure of scientific fields , but it is less comprehensive in representing an article 's content .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: While previous research has analyzed trending topics over the long term , we look at the earliest tweets that produce a trend , with the aim of categorizing trends early on .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This allows us to provide a filtered subset of trends to end users .

label: Research method
text: We experiment with a set of straightforward language-independent features based on the social spread of trends and categorize them using the typology .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our method provides an efficient way to accurately categorize trending topics without need of external data , enabling news organizations to discover breaking news in real-time , or to quickly identify viral memes that might inform marketing decisions , among others .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The analysis of social features also reveals patterns associated with each type of trend , such as tweets about ongoing events being shorter as many were likely sent from mobile devices , or memes having more retweets originating from a few trend-setters .

label: Research method
text: This study investigates the impact of TED Talks videos on YouKu , a Chinese video portal , and YouTube using 6 measures of impact : number of views ; likes ; dislikes ; comments ; bookmarks ; and shares .

label: Research questions
text: In particular , we study the relationship between the topicality and impact of these videos .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions demonstrate that topics vary greatly in terms of their impact : Topics on entertainment and psychology/philosophy receive more views and likes , whereas design/art and astronomy/biology/oceanography attract fewer comments and bookmarks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , we identify several topical differences between YouKu and YouTube users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Topics on global issues and technology are more popular on YouKu , whereas topics on entertainment and psychology/philosophy are more popular on YouTube .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: By analyzing the popularity distribution of videos and the audience characteristics of YouKu , we find that women are more interested in topics on education and psychology/philosophy , whereas men favor topics on technology and astronomy/biology/oceanography .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A central idea is to gradually increase the user 's knowledge about the contents , structures , and semantics of the data sources in the dataspace .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Without this knowledge , the user is not able to make sophisticated queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The dataspace systems proposed so far are usually application specific .

label: Research questions
text: In contrast , our idea in this paper is to develop an application-independent extensible markup language ( XML ) dataspace system with versatile facilities .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Unlike the other proposed dataspace systems , we show that it is possible to build an interface based on conventional visual tools in terms of which the user can satisfy his or her sophisticated information needs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In our system , the user does not need to master programming techniques nor the XML syntax , which provides a good starting point for its declarative use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , the selection of results by users can be interpreted as a confirmation of the relevance of those results , and used to reorder or prioritize subsequent search results .

label: Research questions
text: This collection of search/result pairings is called clickthrough data , and many uses for it have been proposed .

label: Research questions
text: However , the reliability of clickthrough data has been challenged and it has been suggested that clickthrough data are not a completely accurate measure of relevance between search term and results .

label: Research method
text: This paper reports on an experiment evaluating the reliability of clickthrough data as a measure of the mutual relevance of search term and result .

label: Research method
text: The experiment comprised a user study involving over 67 participants and determines the reliability of image search clickthrough data , using factors identified in previous similar studies .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A major difference in this work to previous work is that the source of clickthrough data comes from image searches , rather than the traditional text page searches .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Image search clickthrough data were rarely examined in prior works but has differences that impact the accuracy of clickthrough data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These differences include a more complete representation of the results in image search , allowing users to scrutinize the results more closely before selecting them , as well as presenting the results in a less obviously ordered way .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The experiment reported here demonstrates that image clickthrough data can be more reliable as a relevance feedback measure than has been the case with traditional text-based search .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There is also evidence that the precision of the search system influences the accuracy of click data when users make searches in an information-seeking capacity .

label: Research questions
text: In this study , we reexamine the question of the growth of science .

label: Research method
text: To do this we ( a ) use current data up to publication year 2012 and ( b ) analyze the data across all disciplines and also separately for the natural sciences and for the medical and health sciences .

label: Research method
text: Furthermore , the data were analyzed with an advanced statistical techniquesegmented regression analysiswhich can identify specific segments with similar growth rates in the history of science .

label: Research method
text: The study is based on two different sets of bibliometric data : ( a ) the number of publications held as source items in the Web of Science ( WoS , Thomson Reuters ) per publication year and ( b ) the number of cited references in the publications of the source items per cited reference year .

label: Research method
text: We looked at the rate at which science has grown since the mid-1600s .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In our analysis of cited references we identified three essential growth phases in the development of science , which each led to growth rates tripling in comparison with the previous phase : from less than 1 % up to the middle of the 18th century , to 2 to 3 % up to the period between the two world wars , and 8 to 9 % to 2010 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show the existence of a problem that advanced statistical methods are provably incapable of solving due to the presence of initial and inevitable model uncertainties arising from a qualitative set of base quantities and the number of variables which are considered , even before verifying the different sources of the uncertainties and executing any experimental measurements or computer calculations .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The information contained in the model can be used theoretically and practically to test the solutions to a wide range of problems .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Revealing the measurement accuracy limit ( in addition to the Heisenberg inequality ) with the help of the information transmitted from the studied phenomenon to the observer , which is then stored in the model , helps to perform two additional tasks : choosing the preferred method for measuring a particular physical constant , in physics ; and calculating the exact value of the threshold discrepancy between the model and the measured object , in measurement theory .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further research indicates the possibility of allying these methods in biological and medical sciences .

label: Research method
text: The readersourcing.org system is then presented as an independent , third-party , nonprofit , and academic/scientific endeavor aimed at quality rating of scholarly literature and scholars , and some possible criticisms are discussed .

label: Research questions
text: Such image retrieval is complicated by the fact that figures in the scientific literature often combine multiple individual subfigures ( panels ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Multipanel figures are in fact the predominant pattern in certain types of scientific publications .

label: Research questions
text: The goal of this work is to automatically segment multipanel figuresa necessary step for automatic semantic indexing and in the development of image retrieval systems targeting the scientific literature .

label: Research method
text: We have developed a method that uses the image content as well as the associated figure caption to : ( 1 ) automatically detect panel boundaries ; ( 2 ) detect panel labels in the images and convert them to text ; and ( 3 ) detect the labels and textual descriptions of each panel within the captions .

label: Research method
text: Our approach combines the output of image-content and text-based processing steps to split the multipanel figures into individual subfigures and assign to each subfigure its corresponding section of the caption .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The developed system achieved precision of 81 % and recall of 73 % on the task of automatic segmentation of multipanel figures .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Attention is paid to the grounds by which the participants bolster the informational support .

label: Research method
text: The Research findings/conclusions draw on the analysis of 200 threads of a Finnish online discussion group and a Yahoo !

label: Research method
text: Answers Q & A ( question and answer ) forum .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Three main types of informational support were identified : providing factual information , providing advice , and providing personal opinion .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The grounds used in the answers varied across the types of informational support .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While providing factual information , the most popular ground was description of the attributes of an entity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the context of providing advice , reference to external sources of information was employed most frequently .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , although providing personal opinions , the participants most often bolstered their views by articulating positive or negative evaluations of an entity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , regarding the grounds , there were more similarities than differences between the discussion group and the Q & A site .

label: Research method
text: This study focused on describing how U.S. teens from a highly technological suburban high school select ICT 's for personal communication Research questionss .

label: Research method
text: Two research questions guided the study : ( a ) What factors influence high school seniors selection of online social networks and other ICT 's for everyday communication ?

label: Research questions
text: ( b ) How can social network theory ( SNT ) help to explain how teens select online social networks and other ICT 's for everyday communication Research questionss ?

label: Research method
text: Using focus groups , a purposive sample of 45 teens were asked to discuss ( a ) their preferred methods for communicating with friends and family and why , ( b ) the reasons why they chose to engage ( or not to engage ) in online social networking , ( c ) how they selected ICT 's for social networking and other communication Research questionss , and ( d ) how they decided whom to accept as online friends .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions indicated that many factors influenced participants ICT selection practices including six major categories of selection factors : relationship factors , information/communication factors , social factors , systems factors , self-protection factors , and recipient factors .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: SNT was also helpful in explaining how friendship was a major determining factor in their communication media and platform choices .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These models have been previously empirically tested assuming a mathematical model and predetermining the models ' parameter values at some fixed constant .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The present study , from a statistical modeling viewpoint , investigates alternative distributions commonly used for this type of point data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study shows that the typical assumptions for the parameters of the h-index mathematical models in such representations are not always realistic , with more suitable specifications being favorable .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Prediction of the h-index is also demonstrated .

label: Research questions
text: A major hurdle for current state-of-the-art automatic methods for sentiment analysis is the fact that human communication often involves the use of sarcasm or irony , where the author means the opposite of what she/he says .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Sarcasm transforms the polarity of an apparently positive or negative utterance into its opposite .

label: Research questions
text: Lack of naturally occurring utterances labeled for sarcasm is one of the key problems for the development of machine-learning methods for sarcasm detection .

label: Research method
text: We report on a method for constructing a corpus of sarcastic Twitter messages in which determination of the sarcasm of each message has been made by its author .

label: Research method
text: We use this reliable corpus to compare sarcastic utterances in Twitter to utterances that express positive or negative attitudes without sarcasm .

label: Research questions
text: We investigate the impact of lexical and pragmatic factors on machine-learning effectiveness for identifying sarcastic utterances and we compare the performance of machine-learning techniques and human judges on this task .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This approach bears the risk of incorrectly merging or splitting author identities .

label: Research method
text: The use of initial-based disambiguation has been justified by the assumption that such errors would not affect research Research findings/conclusions too much .

label: Research method
text: This paper tests that assumption by analyzing coauthorship networks from five academic fields-biology , computer science , nanoscience , neuroscience , and physics-and an interdisciplinary journal , PNAS .

label: Research method
text: Name instances in data sets of this study were disambiguated based on heuristics gained from previous algorithmic disambiguation solutions .

label: Research method
text: We use disambiguated data as a proxy of ground-truth to test the performance of three types of initial-based disambiguation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that initial-based disambiguation can misrepresent statistical properties of coauthorship networks : It deflates the number of unique authors , number of components , average shortest paths , clustering coefficient , and assortativity , while it inflates average productivity , density , average coauthor number per author , and largest component size .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , on average , more than half of top 10 productive or collaborative authors drop off the lists .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Asian names were found to account for the majority of misidentification by initial-based disambiguation due to their common surname and given name initials .

label: Research method
text: This study describes and examines a set of tags using quantitative and qualitative methods and assesses relationships among categories of image tags , tag assignment order , and users ' perceptions of usefulness of index terms and user-contributed tags .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study found that tags provide much descriptive information about an image but that users also value and trust controlled vocabulary terms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study found no correlation between tag length and assignment order , and tag length and its perceived usefulness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions of this study can contribute to the design of controlled vocabularies , indexing processes , and retrieval systems for images .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , the Research findings/conclusions of the study can advance the understanding of image tagging practices , tag facet/category distributions , relative usefulness and importance of these categories to the user , and potential mechanisms for identifying useful terms .

label: Research questions
text: This study aims to examine the information journey experienced by marketing professionals , including task-driven information seeking , information judgments , information use , and information sharing , from a more contextualized and holistic viewpoint .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The information journey presents a more comprehensive picture of user-information interaction than is usually offered in the literature .

label: Research method
text: Using a diary method and post-diary in-depth interviews , data consisting of 1,198 diary entries relating to 101 real work tasks were collected over a period of 5 work days .

label: Research method
text: The data were used to ascertain characteristics of the stages of marketing professionals ' information journeys as well as the relationships between them .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Five stages of the information journey , including determining the need for work task-generated information , seeking such information , judging and evaluating the information found , making sense of and using the obtained information , and sharing the obtained or assembled information , were identified .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The information journey also encompassed types of gaps and gap-bridge techniques that occurred during information seeking and use .

label: Research method
text: Based on the empirical Research findings/conclusions , an information journey model was developed .

label: Research questions
text: The implications for information systems design solutions that enable different stages of the information journey to be linked together are also discussed .

label: Research method
text: This paper presents a machine-learning approach to automatically detect this kind of information in the review domain .

label: Research method
text: The resulting system works in two steps : in the first pass , negation/speculation cues are identified , and in the second phase the full scope of these cues is determined .

label: Research method
text: The system is trained and evaluated on the Simon Fraser University Review corpus , which is extensively used in opinion mining .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show how the proposed method outstrips the baseline by as much as roughly 20 % in the negation cue detection and around 13 % in the scope recognition , both in terms of F-1 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In speculation , the performance obtained in the cue prediction phase is close to that obtained by a human rater carrying out the same task .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In the scope detection , the results are also promising and represent a substantial improvement on the baseline ( up by roughly 10 % ) .

label: Research method
text: A detailed error analysis is also provided .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The extrinsic evaluation shows that the correct identification of cues and scopes is vital for the task of sentiment analysis .

label: Research questions
text: In particular , to answer geographic and temporal user queries , the IR task becomes a nonstraightforward process where the available geographic and temporal information is often unstructured .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose a geotemporal search approach that consists of modeling and exploiting geographic and temporal query context evidence that refers to implicit multivarying geographic and temporal intents behind the query .

label: Research method
text: Modeling geographic and temporal query contexts is based on extracting and ranking geographic and temporal keywords found in pseudo-relevant feedback ( PRF ) documents for a given query .

label: Research method
text: Our geotemporal search approach is based on exploiting the geographic and temporal query contexts separately into a probabilistic ranking model and jointly into a proximity ranking model .

label: Research method
text: Our hypothesis is based on the concept that geographic and temporal expressions tend to co-occur within the document where the closer they are in the document , the more relevant the document is .

label: Research method
text: Finally , geographic , temporal , and proximity scores are combined according to a linear combination formula .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An extensive experimental evaluation conducted on a portion of the New York Times news collection and the TREC 2004 robust retrieval track collection shows that our geotemporal approach outperforms significantly a well-known baseline search and the best known geotemporal search approaches in the domain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , an in-depth analysis shows a positive correlation between the geographic and temporal query sensitivity and the retrieval performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , we find that geotemporal distance has a positive impact on retrieval performance generally .

label: Research questions
text: Among these applications , the task of identifying the word sense based on Wikipedia is a crucial component because the output of this component is often used in subsequent tasks .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we present a two-stage framework ( called TSDW ) for word sense disambiguation using knowledge latent in Wikipedia .

label: Research method
text: The disambiguation of a given phrase is applied through a two-stage disambiguation process : ( a ) The first-stage disambiguation explores the contextual semantic information , where the noisy information is pruned for better effectiveness and efficiency ; and ( b ) the second-stage disambiguation explores the disambiguated phrases of high confidence from the first stage to achieve better redisambiguation decisions for the phrases that are difficult to disambiguate in the first stage .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Moreover , existing studies have addressed the disambiguation problem for English text only .

label: Research questions
text: Considering the popular usage of Wikipedia in different languages , we study the performance of TSDW and the existing state-of-the-art approaches over both English and Traditional Chinese articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results show that TSDW generalizes well to different semantic relatedness measures and text in different languages .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: More important , TSDW significantly outperforms the state-of-the-art approaches with both better effectiveness and efficiency .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Behavioral research describes 3 conflict types : task-related , affective , and process .

label: Research questions
text: Affective and process conflicts have been consistently found to impede group performance ; however , the effect of task conflict is inconsistent .

label: Research questions
text: We propose that these inconclusive results are due to underspecification of the task conflict construct , and focus on the transition phase where task-related disagreements escalate into affective and process conflict .

label: Research method
text: We define these transitional phases as distinct constructstask-affective and task-process conflictand develop a theoretical model that explains how the various task-related conflict constructs , together with the composition of the wiki editor group , determine the quality of the collaboratively authored wiki article .

label: Research method
text: Our empirical study of 96 Wikipedia articles involved multiple data-collection methods , including analysis of Wikipedia system logs , manual content analysis of articles ' discussion pages , and a comprehensive assessment of articles ' quality using the Delphi method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results show that when group members ' disagreementsoriginally task relatedescalate into personal attacks or hinge on procedure , these disagreements impede group performance .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Implications for research and practice are discussed .

label: Research questions
text: We focus on influence tasks because , although they appear to be unfamiliar , they arise in much academic discourse , at least tacitly .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We report the processes of academics at different levels of seniority when completing exploratory search tasks that involved identifying influential members of their academic community and rising stars , and similarly for an unfamiliar academic community .

label: Research method
text: 11 think-aloud sessions followed by semi-structured interviews were conducted to investigate the roles of specific and general domain expertise in shaping information seeking and knowledge construction .

label: Research method
text: Academics defined and completed the tasks through an iterative and interactive process of seeking and sensemaking , during which they constructed an understanding of their communities and determined qualities of being influential .

label: Research method
text: The Data/Frame Theory of Sensemaking was used to provide sensitising theoretical constructs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study shows that both external and internal knowledge resources are essential to define a starting point or frame , make and support decisions , and experience satisfaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Ill-defined or non-existent initial frames may cause unsubstantial or arbitrary decisions , and feelings of uncertainty and lack of confidence .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Such file management has been the focus of many studies across various fields , but has not been explicitly acknowledged nor made the focus of dedicated review .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this article we present the first dedicated review of this topic and its research , synthesizing more than 230 publications from various research domains to establish what is known and what remains to be investigated , particularly by examining the common motivations , methods , and Research findings/conclusions evinced by the previously furcate body of work .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find three typical research motivations in the literature reviewed : understanding how and why users store , organize , retrieve , and share files and folders , understanding factors that determine their behavior , and attempting to improve the user experience through novel interfaces and information services .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Relevant conceptual frameworks and approaches to designing and testing systems are described , and open research challenges and the significance for other research areas are discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We conclude that file management is a ubiquitous , challenging , and relatively unsupported activity that invites and has received attention from several disciplines and has broad importance for topics across information science .

label: Research method
text: Accordingly , we quantitatively represent the proportion of contributions from each author and reference to a paper .

label: Research method
text: A paper 's credit can be allocated among its authors and references based on their contributions .

label: Research method
text: All papers carry innate credit because of publication .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: If cited , they also carry external credit from the citing papers .

label: Research method
text: The proportion of a paper 's credit allocated to references can be regarded as a credit output and serves as an input for these references .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In this scenario , only the credit assigned to a paper 's authors remains as the paper 's deserved credit .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The credit of papers can be transferred in a direction opposite that of knowledge diffusion .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Via this method , the estimate of an individual reference 's contribution incorporates content-based citation analysis , a promising method to differentiate different citations .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A paper 's deserved credit represents the contribution of the paper 's authors to the scientific community via the new knowledge they provide in the paper .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Therefore , it is rational to evaluate papers according to their deserved credit , not the credit they carry .

label: Research questions
text: Most solutions to this problem are typically based on increases or spikes in frequency of terms in social media .

label: Research questions
text: In our case , we explore whether sudden changes in the positivity or negativity that keywords are typically associated with can be exploited for this Research questions .

label: Research method
text: A data set that contains several million Twitter messages over a 1-month time span is presented and experimental results demonstrate that sentiment analysis can be successfully utilized for this Research questions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further experiments study the sensitivity of both frequency- or sentiment-based solutions to a number of parameters .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Concretely , we show that the number of tweets that are used for event detection is an important factor , while the number of days used to extract token frequency or sentiment averages is not .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Lastly , we present results focusing on detecting local events and conclude that all approaches are dependant on the level of coverage that such events receive in social media .

label: Research method
text: It involves 2 studies .

label: Research method
text: In the first , a user-centered sound design method is used , based on one originally applied for visually impaired users .

label: Research method
text: Three panels of end users are employed to collaboratively and iteratively design the required nonspeech sounds .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The method ensures that the sounds designed are not based on designers ' personal or ad hoc choices and instead exploits the creativity of a user group as an application of participatory sound design .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the results of this study , recommendations are made for extending the sound design method to novel interfaces and sighted users .

label: Research method
text: A second study involves a formative evaluation of the information system integrated with the designed auditory feedback .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This evaluation confirms that the user-centered sound design method leads to the creation of auditory feedback which conveys meaningful information to users .

label: Research method
text: In order to better understand and support the language preferences and behaviors of such multilingual users , this paper presents a series of five large-scale studies that specifically elicit language choices regarding search queries and result lists .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , the results from the studies indicate that users frequently make use of different languages ( i.e. , not just their primary language ) , especially when they are provided with choices ( e.g. , when provided with a secondary language query or result list choice ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , when presented with a mixed-language list choice , participants choose this option to an almost equal extent compared to primary-language-only lists .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Important factors leading to language choices are user- , task- and system-related , including proficiency , task topic , and result layout .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , participants ' subjective reasons for making particular choices indicate that their primary language is considered more comfortable , that the secondary language often has more relevant and trustworthy results , and that mixed-language lists provide a better overview .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: These results provide crucial insights into multilingual user preferences and behaviors , and may help in the design of systems that can better support the querying and result exploration of multilingual users .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study argues that collaboration networks can look more or less scale-free depending on the methods for resolving author name ambiguity in bibliographic data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Analyzing networks constructed from multiple datasets containing 3.4 M similar to 9.6 M publication records , this study shows that collaboration networks in which author names are disambiguated by the commonly used heuristic , i.e. , forename-initial-based name matching , tend to produce degree distributions better fitted to power-law slopes with the typical scaling parameter ( 2 < alpha < 3 ) than networks disambiguated by more accurate algorithm-based methods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Such tendency is observed across collaboration networks generated under various conditions such as cumulative years , 5- and 1-year sliding windows , and random sampling , and through simulation , found to arise due mainly to artefactual entities created by inaccurate disambiguation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This cautionary study calls for special attention from scholars analyzing network data in which entities such as people , organization , and gene can be merged or split by improper disambiguation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using primary research analysis of the number of images , references , internal links , external links , words , and characters , as well as their proportions in Good and Featured articles on the eight largest Wikipedias , we discover a high diversity of approaches and format preferences , correlating with culture .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We demonstrate that high-quality standards in information presentation are not globally shared and that in many aspects , the language culture 's influence determines what is perceived to be proper , desirable , and exemplary for encyclopedic entries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As a result , we demonstrate that standards for encyclopedic knowledge are not globally agreed-upon and objective but local and very subjective .

label: Research method
text: In this article , the authors investigate the usage of structural information of scientific publications in both problems , and the consideration of citation evidence in the second problem .

label: Research method
text: Three statistical measures namely Inverse Generic Class Frequency , Spread , and Depth are introduced to assign a degree of importance ( i.e. , weight ) to structural components in scientific articles .

label: Research method
text: A term-weighting scheme is adjusted to incorporate component-weight factors , which is used to improve the retrieval of potential sources of plagiarism .

label: Research method
text: A plagiarism screening process is applied based on a measure of resemblance , in which component-weight factors are exploited to ignore less or nonsignificant plagiarism cases .

label: Research method
text: Using the notion of citation evidence , parts with proper citation evidence are excluded , and remaining cases are suspected and used to calculate the similarity index .

label: Research method
text: The authors compare their approach to two flat-based baselines , TF-IDF weighting with a Cosine coefficient , and shingling with a Jaccard coefficient .

label: Research method
text: In both baselines , they use different comparison units with overlapping measures for plagiarism screening .

label: Research method
text: They conducted extensive experiments using a dataset of 15,412 documents divided into 8,657 source publications and 6,755 suspicious queries , which included 18,147 plagiarism cases inserted automatically .

label: Research method
text: Component-weight factors are assessed using precision , recall , and F-measure averaged over a 10-fold cross-validation and compared using the ANOVA statistical test .

label: Research method
text: Results from structural-based candidate retrieval and plagiarism detection are evaluated statistically against the flat baselines using paired-t tests on 10-fold cross-validation runs , which demonstrate the efficacy achieved by the proposed framework .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An empirical study on the system 's response shows that structural information , unlike existing plagiarism detectors , helps to flag significant plagiarism cases , improve the similarity index , and provide human-like plagiarism screening results .

label: Research questions
text: Researchers using ASNSs come from very divergent scientific backgrounds and academic levels , prompting one to ask the question , What kind of communication and self-presentation behaviors occur within these structures ?

label: Research method
text: The qualitative study presented in this article analyzed the communication behavior of a selected sample on ResearchGate ( RG ) .

label: Research questions
text: It investigates how researchers present themselves on their personal-profile sites and how they interact with other researchers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Overall , the results show that mostly young male academics without previous connections to each other ( for example , faculty colleges ) use RG for their scholarly exchanges .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In general , communication behavior is characterized by an objective , professional , unemotional choice of words and seldom the use of polite salutations or words of farewell .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , there seems to be a correlation between long discussion and an increased use of colloquial and emotional language .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on our Research findings/conclusions , we derived preliminary practical recommendations for communications on ASNSs to improve the relationships in online academic interactions , to foster inclusiveness of gender and culture , and to reduce insecurity in matters of communication , presentation , and the exchange of scientific data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the click metrics of over 1.1 million Bitly short links referring to Web of Science ( WoS ) publications , our results show that around 49.5 % of them were not clicked by Twitter users .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For those Bitly short links with clicks from Twitter , the majority of their Twitter clicks accumulated within a short period of time after they were first tweeted .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Bitly short links to the publications in the field of Social Sciences and Humanities tend to attract more clicks from Twitter over other subject fields .

label: Research questions
text: This article also assesses the extent to which Twitter clicks are correlated with some other impact indicators .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Twitter clicks are weakly correlated with scholarly impact indicators ( WoS citations and Mendeley readers ) , but moderately correlated to other Twitter engagement indicators ( total retweets and total likes ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In light of these results , we highlight the importance of paying more attention to the click metrics of URLs in scholarly Twitter mentions , to improve our understanding about the more effective dissemination and reception of science information on Twitter .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Public health professionals require good information about successful health promotion policies and programs that might be considered for application within their own communities .

label: Research questions
text: Our effort seeks to improve access to relevant information for the public health profession , to help those in the field remain an information-savvy workforce .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Natural language processing and semantic techniques hold promise to help public health professionals navigate the growing ocean of information by organizing and structuring this knowledge into a focused public health framework paired with a user-friendly visualization application as a way to summarize results of PubMed ( R ) searches in this field of knowledge .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The VQR performance evaluation followed a pattern also seen in other nations , as it was based on a selected subset of products .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this work , we identify the exercise 's methodological weaknesses and measure the distortions that result from them in the university performance rankings .

label: Research method
text: First , we create a scenario in which we assume the efficient selection of the products to be submitted by the universities and , from this , simulate a set of rankings applying the precise VQR rating criteria .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Next , we compare these VQR rankings with those that would derive from the application of more-appropriate bibliometrics .

label: Research method
text: Finally , we extend the comparison to university rankings based on the entire scientific production for the period , as indexed in the Web of Science .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Such analyses have mainly been based upon hyperlink counts , the number of hyperlinks between a pair of websites , although some have used title mentions or URL citations instead .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The ability to automatically gather hyperlink counts from Yahoo !

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: ceased in April 2011 and the ability to manually gather such counts was due to cease by early 2012 , creating a need for alternatives .

label: Research method
text: This article assesses URL citations and title mentions as possible replacements for hyperlinks in both binary and weighted direct link and co-inlink network diagrams .

label: Research method
text: It also assesses three different types of data for the network connections : hit count estimates , counts of matching URLs , and filtered counts of matching URLs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results from analyses of U. S. library and information science departments and U. K. universities give evidence that metrics based upon URLs or titles can be appropriate replacements for metrics based upon hyperlinks for both binary and weighted networks , although filtered counts of matching URLs are necessary to give the best results for co-title mention and co-URL citation network diagrams .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Data indicate that the smartphone adoption rates are beyond the early majority and are now approaching the late majority .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions of analysis of variance tests revealed that all variables of TAM , VAM , and SI varied across the adopter groups : The current adopter 's mean values of the variables were the highest , followed by those of potential and nonadoption groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Multinomial logistic regression ( MLR ) analyses revealed that perceived value and affiliation mainly determine the different perceptions of adoption groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Smartphone adoption , however , was relatively unaffected by perceived ease of use and perceived usefulness .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Perceived popularity , perceived price , and ethnicity played a role in distinctive determinants between current adopters and nonadopters .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results imply that adopters perceive smartphones as not only a worthwhile device in which to invest money but also a symbolic device to signal their affiliation and timely technology adoption .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Another intriguing finding is the differences of interest in contents between current adopters and nonadopters .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Social interactions via social networking services , acquisition for lifestyle , information seeking , and entertainment via gaming were the main applications of interest .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our analysis reveals three main categories of need : needs around how to create a positive environment for a child , needs around a mother 's relationships and well-being and needs around child development and health .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We demonstrate the similarities of this scheme to needs uncovered in other studies and how our classification of needs is more comprehensive than those in previous studies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: A critical distinction in our results is between two types of need presentation , distinguishing between situational and informational needs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Situational needs are narrative descriptions of a problematic situations whereas informational needs are need statements with a clear request .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Distinguishing between these two types of needs sheds new light on how information needs develop .

label: Research questions
text: We conclude with a discussion on the implication of our results for young mothers and information providers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Here , however , we show that it is not so much a national bias , but that papers have a greater impact on their immediate environments , an impact that is diluted as that environment grows .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For this reason , the greatest biases are observed in countries with a limited production .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Papers that involve international collaboration have a greater impact in general , on the one hand , because they have multiple immediate environments , and on the other because of their greater quality or prestige .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In short , one can say that science knows no frontiers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Certainly there is a greater impact on the authors ' immediate environment , but this does not necessarily have to coincide with their national environments , which fade in importance as the collaborative environment expands .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The ORM experts try to minimize the negative impact of the information about an entity while maximizing the positive material for being more trustworthy to the customers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Due to the huge amount of information that is published on the Internet every day , there is a need to summarize the entire flow of information to obtain only those data that are relevant to the entities .

label: Research questions
text: Traditionally the automatic summarization task in the ORM scenario takes some in-domain signals into account such as popularity , polarity for reputation and novelty but exists other feature to be considered , the authority of the people .

label: Research questions
text: This authority depends on the ability to convince others and therefore to influence opinions .

label: Research questions
text: In this work , we propose the use of authority signals that measures the influence of a user jointly with ( a ) priority signals related to the ORM domain and ( b ) information regarding the different topics that influential people is talking about .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results indicate that the use of authority signals may significantly improve the quality of the summaries that are automatically generated .

label: Research method
text: Using the Hierarchical Linear Modeling software package and the 2-wave data from 166 individuals in 51 wiki-based teams , we found cross-level interaction effects between individual epistemic motivation and team task reflexivity on different knowledge contribution behaviors on wikis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Epistemic motivation exerted a positive effect on adding , which was strengthened by team task reflexivity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The effect of epistemic motivation on deleting was positive only when task reflexivity was high .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In addition , epistemic motivation was strongly positively related to revising , regardless of the level of task reflexivity involved .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results indicate that textual similarity , intellectual overlap ( shared references ) , author overlap ( shared authors ) , proximity in publication time all rise monotonically as the cocitation level gets lower ( from journal to bracket ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While the main gain in similarity happens when moving from journal to article cocitation , all level changes entail an increase in similarity , especially section to paragraph and paragraph to sentence/bracket levels .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We compared the results from four journals over the years 2010-2015 : Cell , the European Journal of Operational Research , Physics Letters B , and Research Policy , with consistent general outcomes and some interesting differences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions motivate the use of granular cocitation information as defined by meaningful units of text , with implications for , among others , the elaboration of maps of science and the retrieval of scholarly literature .

label: Research method
text: This allows an analysis of how genre labels are applied , how genres are composed and how these ingredients change , and how genres compare .

label: Research method
text: We apply unsupervised topic modeling to a large collection of textual movie summaries and then use the model 's topic proportions to investigate key questions in genre , including recognizability , mapping , canonicity , and change over time .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that many genres can be quite easily predicted by their lexical signatures and this defines their position on the genre landscape .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find significant genre composition changes between periods for westerns , science fiction and road movies , reflecting changes in production and consumption values .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We show that in terms of canonicity , canonical examples are often at the high end of the topic distribution profile for the genre rather than central as might be predicted by categorization theory .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , author name ambiguity may lead to irrelevant retrieval results .

label: Research method
text: To improve the PubMed user experience with author name queries , we designed an author name disambiguation system consisting of similarity estimation and agglomerative clustering .

label: Research method
text: A machine-learning method was employed to score the features for disambiguating a pair of papers with ambiguous names .

label: Research method
text: These features enable the computation of pairwise similarity scores to estimate the probability of a pair of papers belonging to the same author , which drives an agglomerative clustering algorithm regulated by 2 factors : name compatibility and probability level .

label: Research method
text: With transitivity violation correction , high precision author clustering is achieved by focusing on minimizing false-positive pairing .

label: Research method
text: Disambiguation performance is evaluated with manual verification of random samples of pairs from clustering results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When compared with a state-of-the-art system , our evaluation shows that among all the pairs the lumping error rate drops from 10.1 % to 2.2 % for our system , while the splitting error rises from 1.8 % to 7.7 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This results in an overall error rate of 9.9 % , compared with 11.9 % for the state-of-the-art method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Other evaluations based on gold standard data also show the increase in accuracy of our clustering .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We attribute the performance improvement to the machine-learning method driven by a large-scale training set and the clustering algorithm regulated by a name compatibility scheme preferring precision .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: With integration of the author name disambiguation system into the PubMed search engine , the overall click-through-rate of PubMed users on author name query results improved from 34.9 % to 36.9 % .

label: Research questions
text: However , in such environments , news variety and quantity can have an overwhelming effect .

label: Research questions
text: New-event detection and topic-tracking studies address this problem .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: They examine news streams and organize stories according to their events ; however , several tracking stories of an event/topic may contain no new information ( i.e. , no novelty ) .

label: Research questions
text: We study the novelty detection ( ND ) problem on the tracking news of a particular topic .

label: Research method
text: For this Research questions , we build a Turkish ND test collection called BilNov-2005 and propose the usage of three ND methods : a cosine-similarity ( CS ) -based method , a language-model ( LM ) -based method , and a cover-coefficient ( CC ) -based method .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: For the LM-based ND method , we show that a simpler smoothing approach , Dirichlet smoothing , can have similar performance to a more complex smoothing approach , Shrinkage smoothing .

label: Research method
text: We introduce a baseline that shows the performance of a system with random novelty decisions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In addition , a category-based threshold learning method is used for the first time in ND literature .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The experimental results show that the LM-based ND method significantly outperforms the CS- and CC-based methods , and category-based threshold learning achieves promising results when compared to general threshold learning .

label: Research questions
text: We report on a study of the relationship between information searchers ' topic knowledge and their search behaviors , and on an attempt to predict searchers ' topic knowledge from their behaviors during the search .

label: Research method
text: Data were collected in a controlled laboratory experiment with 32 undergraduate journalism student participants , each searching on 4 tasks of different types .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In general , behavioral variables were not found to have significant differences between users with high and low levels of topic knowledge , except the mean first dwell time on search result pages .

label: Research method
text: Several models were built to predict topic knowledge using behavioral variables calculated at 3 different stages of search episodes : the first-query-round , the middle point of the search , and the end point .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It was found that a model using some search behaviors observed in the first query round led to satisfactory prediction results .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results suggest that early-session search behaviors can be used to predict users ' topic knowledge levels , allowing personalization of search for users with different levels of topic knowledge , especially in order to assist users with low topic knowledge .

label: Research method
text: Two related studies were conducted using hotel reviews as the test case for investigation .

label: Research method
text: The first study analyzed 1,800 authentic and fictitious reviews based on the linguistic cues of comprehensibility , specificity , exaggeration , and negligence .

label: Research method
text: The analysis involved classification algorithms followed by feature selection and statistical tests .

label: Research method
