text: A filtered set of variables that helped discern review authenticity was identified .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The second study incorporated these variables to develop a guideline that aimed to inform humans how to distinguish between authentic and fictitious reviews .

label: Research method
text: The guideline was used as an intervention in an experimental setup that involved 240 participants .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The intervention improved human ability to identify fictitious reviews amid authentic ones .

label: Research method
text: An ethnographic approach incorporating both semistructured interviews and in the garage ethnographic observation was employed .

label: Research method
text: Analysis was undertaken using an inductive , thematic approach .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions demonstrate that participants ' information environments are rich and complex .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Participants ' accounts emphasized the corporeal and embodied nature of the restoration process , and this may account for why they privileged the social networks they had developed , often over many decades , over online resources and communities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions indicate that participants are engaged in much more than applied problem solving .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: What is also evident is that engagement in the social world of car restoration , and the networks of social knowledge sharing it affords , is significant for the emotional support it provides for older men who often lose these networks later in life .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In a sense , the participants are not only rebuilding their cars but also their own sense of self .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We examine several relationships potentially associated with funding , including first citation , total citations , and the chances of becoming highly cited .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Furthermore , we explore the links between citations and types of funding by organization and also with combined measures of funding .

label: Research questions
text: In particular , we examine the relationship between funding intensity and funding variety and citation .

label: Research method
text: Our empirical work focuses on six small advanced European economies , applying a zero inflated negative binomial model to a set of more than 240,000 papers authored by researchers from these countries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that funding is not related to the first citation but is significantly related to the number of citations and top percentile citation impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additionally , we find that citation impact is positively related to funding variety and negatively related with funding intensity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally there is an inverse relationship between the relative frequency of funding and citation impact .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results presented in the paper provide insights for the design of research programs and the structure of research funding and for the behavior and strategies of research and sponsoring organizations .

label: Research questions
text: Yet , contrary to initial expectations , cost of access to published scientific knowledge increased following the advent of the Internet and electronic processing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An analysis of the ethicality of current arrangements in academic publishing shows that monetization and the sequestering of scientific knowledge behind paywalls breach the principle of fairness and damage public interest .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Following decades of failed effort to redress the situation , there are ethical grounds for consumers of scientific knowledge to invoke the right of collective civil disobedience , including support for pirate open access .

label: Research questions
text: Could this be the best option available to consumers of scientific knowledge for removing paywalls to knowledge that rightly belongs in the public domain ?

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: A model that attempts to solve this has previously been presented .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: This model contained various baseline features , including contextual relationship features , statistical features , and language-specific features .

label: Research method
text: The domain of Jewish law documents written in Hebrew and Aramaic is known to be rich in ambiguous abbreviations and therefore this model was implemented and applied over 2 separate corpuses within this domain .

label: Research method
text: Several common machine-learning ( ML ) methods were tested with the intent of finding a successful integration of the baseline feature variants .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When the features were evaluated individually , the best averaged results were achieved by a library for support vector machines ( LIBSVM ) ; 98.07 % of the ambiguous abbreviations , which were researched in the domain , were disambiguated correctly .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When all the features were evaluated together , the J48 ML method achieved the best result , with 96.95 % accuracy .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , we examine the system 's degree of success and the degree of its professionalism by conducting a comparison between this system 's results and the results achieved by 39 participants , highly fluent in the research domain .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Despite the fact that all the participants had backgrounds in religious scriptures and continue to study these texts , the system 's accuracy rate , 98.07 % , was significantly higher than the average accuracy result of the participants , 91.65 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Further analysis of the results for each corpus implies that participants overcomplicate the required task , as well as exclude vital information needed to properly examine the context of a given initialism .

label: Research method
text: The anonymized data set gathered from an opt-in system provides users ' approximate physical location as well as web browsing and some search history .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Such data provide a unique opportunity to analyze the interaction between people 's behavior in physical retail spaces and their web behavior , serving as a proxy to their information needs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that ( a ) there is a weekly periodicity in users ' visits to the mall ; ( b ) people tend to visit similar mall locations and web content during their repeated visits to the mall ; ( c ) around 60 % of registered Wi-Fi users actively browse the web , and around 10 % of them use Wi-Fi for accessing web search engines ; ( d ) people are likely to spend a relatively constant amount of time browsing the web while the duration of their visit may vary ; ( e ) the physical spatial context has a small , but significant , influence on the web content that indoor users browse ; and ( f ) accompanying users tend to access resources from the same web domains .

label: Research questions
text: Discapnet is a website mainly aimed at visually disabled people , and navigation is a challenging task for its users .

label: Research questions
text: In this context , system evaluation and problem detection become crucial aspects for enhancing user experience and may contribute greatly to diminishing the existing technological gap .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This study proposes a system based on web-mining techniques that collects in-use information while the user is accessing the web ( thus , being a noninvasive system ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proposed system models users in the wild and discovers navigation problems appearing in Discapnet and can also be used for problem detection when new users are navigating the site .

label: Research method
text: The system was tested and its efficiency demonstrated in an experiment involving navigation under supervision , in which 82.6 % of a set of disabled people were automatically labeled as having problems with the website .

label: Research questions
text: Author cocitation analysis using mapping techniques has been most frequently used to study how closely two authors are thought to be in intellectual space based on how members of the research community co-cite their works .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Other approaches exist to study author relatedness based more directly on the text of their published works .

label: Research method
text: In this study we present static and dynamic word-based approaches using vector space modeling , as well as a topic-based approach based on latent Dirichlet allocation for mapping author research relatedness .

label: Research method
text: Vector space modeling is used to define an author space consisting of works by a given author .

label: Research method
text: Outcomes for the two word-based approaches and a topic-based approach for 50 prolific authors in library and information science are compared with more traditional author cocitation analysis using multidimensional scaling and hierarchical cluster analysis .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The two word-based approaches produced similar outcomes except where two authors were frequent co-authors for the majority of their articles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The topic-based approach produced the most distinctive map .

label: Research method
text: He derived this relationship from two assumptions : that words follow Zipf 's law for word frequencies ( a power law dependency between frequency and rank ) and Zipf 's law of meaning distribution ( a power law dependency between number of meanings and rank ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Here we show that a single assumption on the joint probability of a word and a meaning suffices to infer Zipf 's meaning-frequency law or relaxed versions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Interestingly , this assumption can be justified as the outcome of a biased random walk in the process of mental exploration .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This research dissects the concept of orthogonality , in particular regard to music classification .

label: Research questions
text: Orthogonality ( antonym : dependency ) means that one facet acts independently from another facet .

label: Research questions
text: Although orthogonality is an assumed quality of facets , it has attracted relatively little attention in knowledge organization discourse .

label: Research method
text: This research utilizes bibliographic classification schemes , musicological writings , and musical works to analyze orthogonality in music classification .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The relationships between the medium , form/genre , and function facets are unpicked and a strong dependency is found between these facets .

label: Research questions
text: Whether this orthogonality exists as a construct of faceted classification or stems from the domain knowledge is explored .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Furthermore , the analysis initiates new thinking about the general concept of orthogonality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The idea of a spectrum of dependency is proposed .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In addition , novel , orthogonality-derived phenomena are discussed-dynamic facets and meta-dependency-where the boundary between what is and is not a facet is blurred .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The concluding model visualizes the chain of dependencies between music facets , ultimately showing how the lack of orthogonality plays a key role in the complexity and issues found in music classification .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this work , we provide a detailed characterization of such queries and show that search engines try to improve such queries by showing the results of related queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Through a user study , we show that these query suggestions are usually perceived as relevant .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Also , through a query log analysis , we show that the users are dissatisfied after submitting a query that match no results at least 88.5 % of the time .

label: Research questions
text: As a first step towards solving these no-answer queries , we devised a large number of features that can be used to identify such queries and built machine-learning models .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These models can be useful for scenarios such as the mobile- or meta-search , where identifying a query that will retrieve no results at the client device ( i.e. , even before submitting it to the search engine ) may yield gains in terms of the bandwidth usage , power consumption , and/or monetary costs .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments over query logs indicate that , despite the heavy skew in class sizes , our models achieve good prediction quality , with accuracy ( in terms of area under the curve ) up to 0.95 .

label: Research method
text: Using both resources , we have created a unique relational database designed to compare citation counts to books with international library holdings or libcitations for scholarly book publishers .

label: Research method
text: First , we construct a ranking of the top 500 publishers and explore descriptive statistics at the level of publisher type ( university , commercial , other ) and country of origin .

label: Research method
text: We then identify the top 50 university presses and commercial houses based on total citations and mean citations per book ( CPB ) .

label: Research method
text: In a third analysis , we present a map of directed citation links between journals and book publishers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: American and British presses/publishing houses tend to dominate the work of library collection managers and citing scholars ; however , a number of specialist publishers from Europe are included .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Distinct clusters from the directed citation map indicate a certain degree of regionalism and subject specialization , where some journals produced in languages other than English tend to cite books published by the same parent press .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Bibliometric rankings convey only a small part of how the actual structure of the publishing field has evolved ; hence , challenges lie ahead for developers of new citation indices for books and bibliometricians interested in measuring book and publisher impacts .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Do these approaches lead to field-normalized impact measures for journals ?

label: Research method
text: In addition to the 2-year IF ( IF2 ) , we consider the 5-year IF ( IF5 ) , the respective numerators of these IFs , and the number of Total Cites , counted both as integers and fractionally .

label: Research method
text: These various indicators are tested against the hypothesis that the classification of journals into 11 broad fields by PatentBoard/NSF ( National Science Foundation ) provides statistically significant between-field effects .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using fractional counting the between-field variance is reduced by 91.7 % in the case of IF5 , and by 79.2 % in the case of IF2 .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the differences in citation counts are not significantly affected by fractional counting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These results accord with previous studies , but the longer citation window of a fractionally counted IF5 can lead to significant improvement in the normalization across fields .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Even though online book-exchange systems have been developed , their services can further be improved by reducing the workload imposed on their users .

label: Research questions
text: To accomplish this task , we propose a recommendation-based book exchange system , called EasyEx , which identifies potential exchanges for a user solely based on a list of items the user is willing to part with .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: EasyEx is a novel and unique book-exchange system because unlike existing online exchange systems , it does not require a user to create and maintain a wish list , which is a list of items the user would like to receive as part of the exchange .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Instead , EasyEx directly suggests items to users to increase serendipity and as a result expose them to items which may be unfamiliar , but appealing , to them .

label: Research method
text: In identifying books to be exchanged , EasyEx employs known recommendation strategies , that is , personalized mean and matrix factorization , to predict book ratings , which are treated as the degrees of appeal to a user on recommended books .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , EasyEx incorporates OptaPlanner , which solves constraint satisfaction problems efficiently , as part of the recommendation-based exchange process to create exchange cycles .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experimental results have verified that EasyEx offers users recommended books that satisfy the users ' interests and contributes to the item-exchange mechanism with a new design methodology .

label: Research questions
text: Earlier works identified result diversification as a useful technique to support learning-oriented search , since diversification ensures a comprehensive coverage of various aspects of the queried topic in the result list .

label: Research questions
text: Inspired by this finding , first we define a new research problem , multidimensional result diversification , in the context of educational search .

label: Research questions
text: We argue that in a search engine for the education domain , it is necessary to diversify results across multiple dimensions , that is , not only for the topical aspects covered by the retrieved documents , but also for other dimensions , such as the type of the document ( e.g. , text , video , etc . )

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: or its intellectual level ( say , for beginners/experts ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Second , we propose a framework that extends the probabilistic and supervised diversification methods to take into account the coverage of such multiple dimensions .

label: Research method
text: We demonstrate its effectiveness upon a newly developed test collection based on a real-life educational search engine .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thorough experiments based on gathered relevance annotations reveal that the proposed framework outperforms the baseline by up to 2.4 % .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: An alternative evaluation utilizing user clicks also yields improvements of up to 2 % w.r.t .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: various metrics .

label: Research questions
text: In recent years , research in this field has grown rapidly .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the performance of state-of-the-art methods is heavily affected when text of known authorship and texts under investigation differ in topic and/or genre .

label: Research questions
text: So far , it is not clear how to quantify the personal style of authors in a way that is not affected by topic shifts or genre variations .

label: Research method
text: In this paper , a set of text distortion methods are used attempting to mask topic-related information .

label: Research method
text: These methods transform the input texts into a more topic-neutral form while maintaining the structure of documents associated with the personal style of the author .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Using a controlled corpus that includes a fine-grained range of topics and genres it is demonstrated how the proposed approach can be combined with existing authorship attribution methods to enhance their performance in very challenging tasks , especially in cross-topic attribution .

label: Research questions
text: We also examine cross-genre attribution and the most challenging , yet realistic , cross-topic-and-genre attribution scenarios and show how the proposed techniques should be tuned to enhance performance in these tasks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , we demonstrate that there are important differences in attribution effectiveness when either conversational genres , nonconversational genres , or a mix of them are considered .

label: Research findings/conclusions

label: Research questions
text: The web has proved to be among the most ephemeral and changing of information vehicles .

text: The research note revisits Koehler 's original data set after about 20 years since it was first collected .

label: Research questions
text: In this context and given that university libraries have played an important role in supporting RDM at an institutional level in North America , Europe , and Australasia , the aim of this article is to explore the current status of RDM in Chinese universities , in particular how university libraries have been involved in taking the agenda forward .

label: Research method
text: This article uses a mixed-methods data collection approach and draws on a website analysis of university policies and services ; a questionnaire for university librarians ; and semi-structured interviews .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions indicate that Research Data Service at a local level in Chinese Universities are in their infancy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There is more evidence of activity in developing data repositories than support services .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There is little development of local policy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Among the explanations of this may be the existence of a national-level infrastructure for some subject disciplines , the lack of professionalization of librarianship , and the relatively weak resonance of openness as an idea in the Chinese context .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Accordingly , topic modeling in a network of documents has been attracting continuous research attention .

label: Research questions
text: Most of the existing network-based topic models assume that topics in a document are influenced by its directly linked neighbouring documents in a document network and overlook the potential influence from indirectly linked ones .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The existing work also has not carefully modeled variations of such influence among neighboring documents .

label: Research questions
text: Recognizing these modeling limitations , this paper introduces a novel Local Context-Aware LDA Model ( LC-LDA ) , which is capable of observing a local context comprising a rich collection of documents that may directly or indirectly influence the topic distributions of a target document .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The proposed model can also differentiate the respective influence of each document in the local context on the target document according to both structural and temporal relationships between the two documents .

label: Research method
text: The proposed model is extensively evaluated through multiple document clustering and classification tasks conducted over several large-scale document sets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Evaluation results clearly and consistently demonstrate the effectiveness and superiority of the new model with respect to several state-of-the-art peer models .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: However , to date very little research has taken place on information and sustainable development in general , and on the environmental impact of information services in particular .

label: Research questions
text: Based on the data collected from various research papers and reports , this review article shows that information systems and services for the higher education and research sector currently generate massive greenhouse gas ( GHG ) emissions , and it is argued that there is an urgent need for developing a green information service , or green IS in short , that should be based on minimum GHG emissions throughout its lifecycle , from content creation to distribution , access , use , and disposal .

label: Research method
text: Based on an analysis of the current research on green information technology ( IT ) , it is proposed that a green IS should be based on the model of cloud computing .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , a research agenda is proposed that will pave the way for building and managing green ISs to support education and research/scholarly activities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The frequency distribution of disciplines by citing articles provides a signature for a cited journal that permits it to be compared with other journals using similarity comparison techniques .

label: Research method
text: As an initial exploration , citing discipline data for 40 high-impact-factor journals assigned to the information science and library science category of the Web of Science were compared across 5 time periods .

label: Research method
text: Similarity relationships were determined using multidimensional scaling and hierarchical cluster analysis to compare the outcomes produced by the proposed citing discipline and established cocitation methods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The maps and clustering outcomes reveal that a number of journals in allied areas of the information science and library science category may not be very closely related to each other or may not be appropriately situated in the category studied .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The citing discipline similarity data resulted in similar outcomes with the cocitation data but with some notable differences .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Because the citing discipline method relies on a citing perspective different from cocitations , it may provide a complementary way to compare journal similarity that is less labor intensive than cocitation analysis .

label: Research method
text: Drawing on social capital theories , we develop a theoretical model to investigate how the two types of social capital ( bonding and bridging ) contribute to the individual and collective well-being of virtual communities through information exchange .

label: Research method
text: Research hypotheses were tested through survey instruments and computer archive data of 475 members of a large social network site during the Wenchuan earthquake ( 2008 ) in China .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that bonding has a positive and significant impact on bridging .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Both bonding and bridging have positive and significant impacts on information quality , but not on information quantity .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results also suggest that information quality is more critical to individuals and collective well-being than information quantity after a disaster .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: With a focus on the social sciences , this article contributes to the existing literature on indicators and metrics use in fields with diverse publication practices .

label: Research method
text: Scholars in Australia and Sweden were asked about their use and reasons for using metrics .

label: Research method
text: A total of 581 completed surveys were analyzed to generate descriptive statistics , with textual analysis performed on comments provided to open questions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: While just under half of the participant group had used metrics , the Australians reported use in twice the proportion of their Swedish peers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Institutional policies and processes were frequently associated with use , and the scholars ' comments suggest a high level of awareness of some metrics as well as strategic behavior in demonstrating research performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: There is also evidence of tensions between scholars ' research evaluation environment and their disciplinary values and publication practices .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: First , this study considers the relationship between source credibility and argument quality and the relationship between herding factors and information usefulness ( i.e. , bias effects ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Second , this study proposes the interaction effects of source credibility and argument quality and the interaction effects of herding factors and information usefulness ( i.e. , synergistic effects ) .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Third , this study explores the moderating role of an information characteristic - search versus experience information ( i.e. , information contingency effects ) .

label: Research method
text: The proposed extended information adoption model ( EIAM ) is empirically tested through a 2 by 2 by 2 experiment in the social Q & A context , and the results confirm most of the hypotheses .

label: Research method
text: Finally , theoretical contributions and practical implications are discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Odds and odds ratios can be used to measure the performance difference between a selected university and competing institutions , or the average of selected competitors , in a relatively simple but clear way .

label: Research method
text: To address this issue , the Game Metadata Research Group at the University of Washington Information School , in collaboration with the Seattle Interactive Media Museum , worked to create a standardized metadata schema .

label: Research method
text: This metadata schema was empirically evaluated using multiple approachescollaborative review , schema testing , semi-structured user interview , and a large-scale survey .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Reviewing and testing the schema revealed issues and challenges in sourcing the metadata for particular elements , determining the level of granularity for data description , and describing digitally distributed games .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions from user studies suggest that users value various subject and visual metadata , information about how games are related to each other , and data regarding game expansions/alterations such as additional content and networked features .

label: Research method
text: The metadata schema was extensively revised based on the evaluation results , and we present the new element definitions from the revised schema in this article .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This work will serve as a platform and catalyst for advances in the design and use of video game metadata .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Numerous studies reported uncovering rich information and methodological advances .

label: Research questions
text: However , very few studies thus far examined hyperlinks in the rapidly developing sphere of social media .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This paper reports a study that helps fill this gap .

label: Research method
text: The study analyzed links originating from tweets to the websites of 3 types of organizations ( government , education , and business ) .

label: Research method
text: Data were collected over an 8-month period to observe the fluctuation and reliability of the individual data set .

label: Research method
text: Hyperlink data from the general web ( not social media sites ) were also collected and compared with social media data .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study found that the 2 types of hyperlink data correlated significantly and that analyzing the 2 together can help organizations see their relative strength or weakness in the two platforms .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study also found that both types of inlink data correlated with offline measures of organizations ' performance .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Twitter data from a relatively short period were fairly reliable in estimating performance measures .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The timelier nature of social media data as well as the date/time stamps on tweets make this type of data potentially more valuable than that from the general web .

label: Research questions
text: Having an established record of the use of a unique mixture of empirical methods , the work of understanding and designing for user behavior is well situated to take advantage of the advances claimed by big data methods .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Beyond any straightforward benefit of the use of large sets of data , such an increase in the scale of empirical evidence has far-reaching implications for the work of empirically guided design .

label: Research questions
text: We develop the concept of peak empiricism to explain the new role that large-scale data comes to play in design , one in which data become more than a simple empirical tool .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In providing such an expansive empirical setting for design , big data weakens the subjective conditions necessary for empirical insight , pointing to a more performative approach to the relationship between a designer and his or her work .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: In this , the work of design is characterized as thinking with the data in a partnership that weakens not only any sense of empiricism but also the agentive foundations of a classical view of design work .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: We present a novel , entirely unsupervised , method that achieves strong results on multiple testbeds , including those for which authorial threads are topically identical .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Unlike previous work , our method requires no specialized linguistic tools and can be easily applied to any text .

label: Research questions
text: We propose a novel flexible template generation and matching scheme called the principle-based approach ( PBA ) based on sequence alignment , and employ it for reference metadata extraction ( RME ) to demonstrate its effectiveness .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: The main contributions of this research are threefold .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: First , we propose an automatic template generation that can capture prominent patterns using the dominating set algorithm .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Second , we devise an alignment-based template-matching technique that uses a logistic regression model , which makes it more general and flexible than pure rule-based approaches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Last , we apply PBA to RME on extensive cross-domain corpora and demonstrate its robustness and generality .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Experiments reveal that the same set of templates produced by the PBA framework not only deliver consistent performance on various unseen domains , but also surpass hand-crafted knowledge ( templates ) .

label: Research method
text: We use four independent journal style test sets and one conference style test set in the experiments .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: When compared to renowned machine learning methods , such as conditional random fields ( CRF ) , as well as recent deep learning methods ( i.e. , bi-directional long short-term memory with a CRF layer , Bi-LSTM-CRF ) , PBA has the best performance for all datasets .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The factors include journal impact factor , individual collaboration , international collaboration , institution prestige , country prestige , research funding , abstract readability , abstract length , title length , number of cited references , field size , and field type and will be modeled in association with citation counts , Mendeley readers , Twitter posts , Facebook posts , blog posts , and news posts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results demonstrate that eight factors are important for increased citation counts , seven different factors are important for increased Mendeley readers , eight factors are important for increased Twitter posts , three factors are important for increased Facebook posts , six factors are important for increased blog posts , and five factors are important for increased news posts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Journal impact factor and international collaboration are the two factors that significantly associate with increased citation counts and with all altmetric scores .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , it seems that the factors driving Mendeley readership are similar to those driving citation counts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , the altmetric events differ from each other in terms of a small number of factors ; for instance , institution prestige and country prestige associate with increased Mendeley readers and blog and news posts , but it is an insignificant factor for Twitter and Facebook posts .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions contribute to the continued development of theoretical models and methodological developments associated with capturing , interpreting , and understanding altmetric events .

label: Research method
text: Using a mixed-methods approach involving focus group interviews with 120 participants , an online survey with 2,918 responses , and an analysis of transaction logs of approximately 15 million sessions from , the study provides a new understanding of the context for global union catalog use .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find that is accessed by a diverse population , with the three primary user groups being librarians , students , and academics .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Use of the system is found to fall within three broad types of work-task ( professional , academic , and leisure ) , and we also present an emergent taxonomy of search tasks that encompass known-item , unknown-item , and institutional information searches .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results support the notion that union catalogs are primarily used for known-item searches , although the volume of traffic to means that unknown-item searches nonetheless represent an estimated 250,000 sessions per month .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Search engine referrals account for almost half of all traffic , but although effectively connects users referred from institutional library catalogs to other libraries holding a sought item , users arriving from a search engine are less likely to connect to a library .

text: These systems enable users to explore collections by way of latent topics .

label: Research method
text: A standard way to represent a topic is using a term list ; that is the top-n words with highest conditional probability within the topic .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Other topic representations such as textual and image labels also have been proposed .

label: Research questions
text: However , there has been no comparison of these alternative representations .

label: Research method
text: In this article , we compare 3 different topic representations in a document retrieval task .

label: Research method
text: Participants were asked to retrieve relevant documents based on predefined queries within a fixed time limit , presenting topics in one of the following modalities : ( a ) lists of terms , ( b ) textual phrase labels , and ( c ) image labels .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Results show that textual labels are easier for users to interpret than are term lists and image labels .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Moreover , the precision of retrieved documents for textual and image labels is comparable to the precision achieved by representing topics using term lists , demonstrating that labeling methods are an effective alternative topic representation .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Casual observations suggested that similar problematic papers are still published and sold , without follow-up retractions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: No systematic screening has been performed and the prevalence of such nonsensical publications in the scientific literature is unknown .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Our contribution is 2-fold .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: First , we designed a detector that combs the scientific literature for grammar-based computer-generated papers .

label: Research method
text: Applied to SCIgen , it has a 83.6 % precision .

label: Research method
text: Second , we performed a scientometric study of the 243 detected SCIgen-papers from 19 publishers .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We estimate the prevalence of SCIgen-papers to be 75 per million papers in Information and Computing Sciences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Only 19 % of the 243 problematic papers were dealt with : formal retraction ( 12 ) or silent removal ( 34 ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Publishers still serve and sometimes sell the remaining 197 papers without any caveat .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found evidence of citation manipulation via edited SCIgen bibliographies .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This work reveals metric gaming up to the point of absurdity : fraudsters publish nonsensical algorithmically generated papers featuring genuine references .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It stresses the need to screen papers for nonsense before peer-review and chase citation manipulation in published papers .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Overall , this is yet another illustration of the harmful effects of the pressure to publish or perish .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Community management has three main Research questionss : to create a positive experience for existing participants , to promote appropriate , socionormative behaviors , and to encourage potential participants to make contributions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research indicates that the quality of content a potential participant sees on a site is highly influential ; off-topic , negative comments with malicious intent are a particularly strong boundary to participation or set the tone for encouraging similar contributions .

label: Research questions
text: Aproblem for community managers , therefore , is the detection and elimination of such undesirable content .

label: Research questions
text: As a community grows , this undertaking becomes more daunting .

label: Research questions
text: Can an automated system aid community managers in this task ?

label: Research method
text: In this paper , we address this question through a machine learning approach to automatic detection of inappropriate negative user contributions .

label: Research method
text: Our training corpus is a set of comments from a news commenting site that we tasked Amazon Mechanical Turk workers with labeling .

label: Research method
text: Each comment is labeled for the presence of profanity , insults , and the object of the insults .

label: Research method
text: Support vector machines trained on these data are combined with relevance and valence analysis systems in a multistep approach to the detection of inappropriate negative user contributions .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The system shows great potential for semiautomated community management .

label: Research questions
text: Although the quantity of digitized historical documents available is increasing , historians ' ways of working with the digital documents have not been widely studied , particularly in authentic work settings .

label: Research questions
text: To better support the historians ' reasoning processes , we investigate history researchers ' work tasks as the context of information interaction and examine their cognitive access points into information .

label: Research method
text: The analysis is based on a longitudinal observational research and interviews in a task-based research setting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on these Research findings/conclusions in the historians ' cognitive space , we build bridges into the document space .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: By studying the information interactions in real task contexts , we facilitate the provision of task-specific handles into documents that can be used in designing digital research tools for historians .

text: They therefore tend not to disclose data that would be useful for personalization .

label: Research questions
text: We investigate how characteristics of the personalization provider influence users ' attitudes towards personalization and their resulting disclosure behavior .

label: Research method
text: We propose an integrative model that links these characteristics via privacy attitudes to actual disclosure behavior .

label: Research method
text: Using the Elaboration Likelihood Model , we discuss in what way the influence of the manipulated provider characteristics is different for users engaging in different levels of elaboration ( represented by the user characteristics of privacy concerns and self-efficacy ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We find particularly that ( a ) reputation management is effective when users predominantly use the peripheral route ( i.e. , a low level of elaboration ) , but much less so when they predominantly use the central route ( i.e. , a high level of elaboration ) ; ( b ) client-side personalization has a positive impact when users use either route ; and ( c ) personalization in the cloud does not work well in either route .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Managers and designers can use our results to instill more favorable privacy attitudes and increase disclosure , using different techniques that depend on each user 's levels of privacy concerns and privacy self-efficacy .

label: Research method
text: This paper describes a sociotechnical study conducted from 2008 through 2015 to identify deceptive communicative intent within group context as manifested in language-action cues .

label: Research method
text: Specifically , this study used an online team-based game that simulates real-world deceptive insider scenarios to examine several dimensions of group communication .

label: Research questions
text: First , we studied how language-action cues differ between groups with and groups without a compromised actor .

label: Research questions
text: We also examine how these cues differ within groups in terms of the group members ' individual and collective interactions with the compromised actor .

label: Research questions
text: Finally , we look at how the cues of compromised actors differ from those of noncompromised actors , and how communication behavior changes after an actor is presented with an ethical dilemma .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results of the study further our understanding of language-action cues as indicators for unmasking a potential deceptive insider .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: However , such networks can vary according to the collection of data sets relevant to the theme by querying knowledge entities .

label: Research method
text: In this study we classify three different bibliometric content networks .

label: Research method
text: The primary bibliometric network is based on knowledge entities relevant to a keyword of the theme , the secondary network is based on entities associated with the lower concepts of the keyword , and the tertiary network is based on entities influenced by the theme .

label: Research method
text: To explore the content and properties of these networks , we propose a tomographic content analysis that takes a slice-and-dice approach to analyzing the networks .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our Research findings/conclusions indicate that the primary network is best suited to understanding the current knowledge on a certain topic , whereas the secondary network is good at discovering new knowledge across fields associated with the topic , and the tertiary network is appropriate for outlining the current knowledge of the topic and relevant studies .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Additional sociotechnical challenges include items such as how to define the project goals and how to ensure the project is effectively managed .

label: Research method
text: This paper reports on a set of case studies where researchers were embedded within data science teams and where the researcher observations and analysis was focused on the attributes that can help describe data science projects and the challenges faced by the teams executing these projects , as opposed to the algorithms and technologies that were used to perform the analytics .

label: Research method
text: Based on our case studies , we identified 14 characteristics that can help describe a data science project .

label: Research method
text: We then used these characteristics to create a model that defines two key dimensions of the project .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Finally , by clustering the projects within these two dimensions , we identified four types of data science projects , and based on the type of project , we identified some of the sociotechnical challenges that project teams should expect to encounter when executing data science projects .

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we investigate adaptive data fusion methods that can change their behavior when the search environment changes .

text: Three adaptive data fusion methods are proposed and investigated .

label: Research method
text: In this study , we compare Mendeley readership counts with citations for different social sciences and humanities disciplines .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The overall correlation between Mendeley readership counts and citations for the social sciences was higher than for the humanities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Low and medium correlations between Mendeley bookmarks and citation counts in all the investigated disciplines suggest that these measures reflect different aspects of research impact .

label: Research method
text: Mendeley data were also used to discover patterns of information flow between scientific fields .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Comparing information flows based on Mendeley bookmarking data and cross-disciplinary citation analysis for the disciplines revealed substantial similarities and some differences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Thus , the evidence from this study suggests that Mendeley readership data could be used to help capture knowledge transfer across scientific disciplines , especially for people that read but do not author articles , as well as giving impact evidence at an earlier stage than is possible with citation counts .

label: Research method
text: A collection of 8,310 tags from a digital portal ( Nineteenth-Century Electronic Scholarship , NINES ) was analyzed to find out what attributes of primary historical resources users described with tags .

label: Research method
text: Tags were categorized to identify which tags describe the content of the resource , the resource itself , and subjective aspects ( e.g. , usage or emotion ) .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study 's Research findings/conclusions revealed that over half were content-related ; tags representing opinion , usage context , or self-reference , however , reflected only a small percentage .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The study further found that terms related to genre or physical format of a resource were frequently used in describing primary archival resources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It was also learned that nontextual resources had lower numbers of content-related tags and higher numbers of document-related tags than textual resources and bibliographic materials ; moreover , textual resources tended to have more user-context-related tags than other resources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: These Research findings/conclusions help explain users ' tagging behavior and resource interpretation in primary resources in the humanities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Such information provided through tags helps information professionals decide to what extent indexing archival and cultural resources should be done for resource description and discovery , and understand users ' terminology .

text: Inclusion criteria were the frequent use of computers and a web-searching activity ; the older adults performed the Mini-Mental State Examination to exclude cognitive impairment .

text: Furthermore , nonverbal IQ improved performance in terms of time among the older participants .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Age did not influence web-searching behavior in users with normal expertise and intelligence .

label: Research findings/conclusions

label: Research questions
text: The aim was to understand how fiction readers with varied reading preferences are selecting interesting novels in library catalogs .

label: Research method
text: We conducted a controlled user study with 80 participants .

label: Research method
text: Two reader groups were elicited according to similar reading preference patterns .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The readers enjoyed the entertainment , escape , and comfort that reading as a pleasurable activity offered .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The aesthetic readers valued the artistic and aesthetic pleasures , widening vocabulary , and ability to express oneself through fiction books .

label: Research method
text: We compared the search queries and search actions between the 2 reader groups .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Our results demonstrated that preference patterns were associated with readers ' search behavior , that is , the number of viewed search result pages , opened book pages , dwell time on book pages , and the type of search queries .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Based on the Research findings/conclusions , we present 3 search tactics for fiction books in library catalogs : i ) focused querying , ii ) topical browsing , and iii ) similarity-based tactic .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The most popular search tactic in each search scenario was focused querying with known author in both reader groups .

label: Research questions
text: Do abstracts tend to use conceptually broader terms than sentences in a citation context in the body of a publication ?

label: Research questions
text: In this article , we propose a method to analyze and compare latent topics in scientific publications , in particular , from abstracts of papers that cited a target reference and from sentences that cited the target reference .

label: Research method
text: We conducted an experiment and applied topical modeling techniques to full-text papers in eight biomedicine journals .

label: Research method
text: Topics derived from the two sources are compared in terms of their similarities and broad-narrow relationships defined based on information entropy .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that abstracts and citation contexts are characterized by distinct sets of topics with moderate overlaps .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Furthermore , the results confirm that topics from abstracts of citing papers have broader terms than topics from citation contexts formed by citing sentences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The method and the Research findings/conclusions could be used to enhance and extend the current methodologies for research evaluation and citation evaluation .

label: Research questions
text: It notes that information science/IR has been evolving from a case science into a fully fledged , disciplined/disciplinary science .

label: Research method
text: The article establishes correspondences between linguistics and information science/IR using the three established IR paradigms-physical , cognitive , and computational-as a frame of reference .

label: Research method
text: The current relationship between information science/IR and linguistics is elucidated through discussion of some recent information science publications dealing with linguistic topics and a novel technique , keyword collocation analysis , is introduced .

label: Research method
text: Insights from interdisciplinarity research and case theory are also discussed .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: It is demonstrated that the three stages of interdisciplinarity , namely multidisciplinarity , interdisciplinarity ( in the narrow sense ) , and transdisciplinarity , can be linked to different phases of the information science/IR-linguistics relationship and connected to different ways of using linguistic theory in information science and IR .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: Current research has primarily focused on examining the social and interactional aspects of CIS in organizational or other settings and developing technical approaches to support CIS activities .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: As we continue to develop a better understanding of the interactional aspects of CIS , we need also start to examine the cognitive aspects of CIS .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: In particular , we need to understand CIS from a team cognition perspective .

label: Research method
text: To examine how team cognition develops during CIS , we conducted a study using observations and interviews of student teams engaged in colocated CIS tasks in a laboratory setting .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: We found that a variety of awareness mechanisms play a key role in the development of team cognition during CIS .

label: Research questions
text: Specifically , we identify that search , information , and social methods of awareness are critical to developing team cognition during CIS .

label: Research questions
text: We discuss why awareness is important for team cognition , how team cognition comprises both individual and team-level cognitive activities , and the importance of examining both interaction and cognition to truly understand team cognition .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: To take full advantage of the web as a research resource that extends beyond the consideration of snapshots of the present , however , it is necessary to begin to take web archiving much more seriously as an important element of any research program involving web resources .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The ephemeral character of the web requires that researchers take proactive steps in the present to enable future analysis .

label: Research questions
text: Efforts to archive the web or portions thereof have been developed around the world , but these efforts have not yet provided reliable and scalable solutions .

label: Research value/outlook/limitations
text: This article summarizes the current state of web archiving in relation to researchers and research needs .

label: Research method
text: Interviews with researchers , archivists , and technologists identify the differences in Research questions , scope , and scale of current web archiving practice , and the professional tensions that arise given these differences .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: Research findings/conclusions outline the challenges that still face researchers who wish to engage seriously with web content as an object of research , and archivists who must strike a balance reflecting a range of user needs .

text: The first is a site where a social space was augmented by the introduction of technology with the potential to provide information with the belief that information behavior , use , and services would evolve .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The second is where intermediaries and information systems were designed and introduced into existing social spaces ( an individual 's home , community center , or street ) with the explicit intention of providing information .

text: The intention of both implementations was to reduce social exclusion .

label: Research method
text: This exploratory research used activity theory as a theoretical lens to explore end-user reaction .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The Research findings/conclusions of the research illustrate how information and service needs are now addressed through a combination of mobile information and communication technologies and human intermediary knowledge .

label: Research findings/conclusions
text: The results show that a very small number of indicators may lead to a robust prediction of about 75 % of the cases .
